verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्रे॑ बृ॒हन्नु॒षसा॑मू॒र्ध्वो अ॑स्थान्निर्जग॒न्वान्तम॑सो॒ ज्योति॒षागा॑त् अ॒ग्निर्भा॒नुना॒ रुश॑ता॒ स्वङ्ग॒ आ जा॒तो विश्वा॒ सद्मा॑न्यप्राः
verses.transliteration: ágre br̥hánn uṣásām ūrdhvó asthāt-  nirjaganvā́n támaso jyótiṣā́gāt  agnír bhānúnā rúśatā sváṅgaḥ-  ā́ jātó víśvā sádmāny aprāḥ

translation.text: HIGH hath the Mighty risen before the dawning, and come to us with light from out the darkness. Fair-shapen Agni with white-shining splendour hath filled at birth all human habitations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स जा॒तो गर्भो॑ असि॒ रोद॑स्यो॒रग्ने॒ चारु॒र्विभृ॑त॒ ओष॑धीषु चि॒त्रः शिशुः॒ परि॒ तमां॑स्य॒क्तून्प्र मा॒तृभ्यो॒ अधि॒ कनि॑क्रदद्गाः
verses.transliteration: sá jātó gárbho asi ródasyor  ágne cā́rur víbhr̥ta óṣadhīṣu  citráḥ śíśuḥ pári támāṃsy aktū́n  prá mātŕ̥bhyo ádhi kánikradat gāḥ

translation.text: Thou, being born, art Child of Earth and Heaven, parted among the plants in beauty, Agni! The glooms of night thou, Brilliant Babe, subduest, and art come forth, loud roaring, from thy Mothers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विष्णु॑रि॒त्था प॑र॒मम॑स्य वि॒द्वाञ्जा॒तो बृ॒हन्न॒भि पा॑ति तृ॒तीय॑म् आ॒सा यद॑स्य॒ पयो॒ अक्र॑त॒ स्वं सचे॑तसो अ॒भ्य॑र्च॒न्त्यत्र॑
verses.transliteration: víṣṇur itthā́ paramám asya vidvā́ñ  jātó br̥hánn abhí pāti tr̥tī́yam  āsā́ yád asya páyo ákrata sváṃ  sácetaso abhy àrcanty átra

translation.text: Here, being manifested, lofty Vishṇu, full wise, protects his own supremest station. When they have offered in his mouth their sweet milk, to him with one accord they sing forth praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत॑ उ त्वा पितु॒भृतो॒ जनि॑त्रीरन्ना॒वृधं॒ प्रति॑ चर॒न्त्यन्नैः॑ ता ईं॒ प्रत्ये॑षि॒ पुन॑र॒न्यरू॑पा॒ असि॒ त्वं वि॒क्षु मानु॑षीषु॒ होता॑
verses.transliteration: áta u tvā pitubhŕ̥to jánitrīr  annāvŕ̥dham práti caranty ánnaiḥ  tā́ īm práty eṣi púnar anyárūpāḥ-  ási tváṃ vikṣú mā́nuṣīṣu hótā

translation.text: Thence bearing food the Mothers come to meet thee, with food for thee who givest food its increase. These in their altered form again thou meetest. Thou art Invoking Priest in homes of mortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: होता॑रं चि॒त्रर॑थमध्व॒रस्य॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑यज्ञस्य के॒तुं रुश॑न्तम् प्रत्य॑र्धिं दे॒वस्य॑देवस्य म॒ह्ना श्रि॒या त्व१॒॑ग्निमति॑थिं॒ जना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: hótāraṃ citráratham adhvarásya  yajñásya-yajñasya ketúṃ rúśantam  prátyardhiṃ devásya-devasya mahnā́  śriyā́ tv àgním átithiṃ jánānām

translation.text: Priest of the holy rite, with car that glitters, refulgent Banner of each act of worship, Sharinging every God through might and glory, even Agni Guest of men I summon hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स तु वस्त्रा॒ण्यध॒ पेश॑नानि॒ वसा॑नो अ॒ग्निर्नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्याः अ॒रु॒षो जा॒तः प॒द इळा॑याः पु॒रोहि॑तो राजन्यक्षी॒ह दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: sá tú vástrāṇy ádha péśanāni  vásāno agnír nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ḥ  aruṣó jātáḥ padá íḷāyāḥ  puróhito rājan yakṣīhá devā́n

translation.text: So Agni stands on earth's most central station, invested in well-decorated garments. Born, red of hue, where men pour out libations, O King, as great High Priest bring the Gods hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ हि द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॑ग्न उ॒भे सदा॑ पु॒त्रो न मा॒तरा॑ त॒तन्थ॑ प्र या॒ह्यच्छो॑श॒तो य॑वि॒ष्ठाथा व॑ह सहस्ये॒ह दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: ā́ hí dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ agna ubhé  sádā putró ná mātárā tatántha  prá yāhy áchośató yaviṣṭha-  -áthā́ vaha sahasyehá devā́n

translation.text: Over the earth and over heaven, O Agni, thou, Son, hast ever spread above thy Parents. Come, Youthfullest! to those who long to meet thee, and hither bring the Gods, O Mighty Victor.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒प्री॒हि दे॒वाँ उ॑श॒तो य॑विष्ठ वि॒द्वाँ ऋ॒तूँर्ऋ॑तुपते यजे॒ह ये दैव्या॑ ऋ॒त्विज॒स्तेभि॑रग्ने॒ त्वं होतॄ॑णाम॒स्याय॑जिष्ठः
verses.transliteration: piprīhí devā́m̐ uśató yaviṣṭha  vidvā́m̐ r̥tū́m̐r r̥tupate yajehá  yé daívyā r̥tvíjas tébhir agne  tváṃ hótr̥̄ṇām asy ā́yajiṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: GLADDEN the yearning Gods, O thou Most Youthful: bring them, O Lord of Seasons, knowing seasons, With all the Priests Celestial, O Agni. Best worshipper art thou of all Invokers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेषि॑ हो॒त्रमु॒त पो॒त्रं जना॑नां मन्धा॒तासि॑ द्रविणो॒दा ऋ॒तावा॑ स्वाहा॑ व॒यं कृ॒णवा॑मा ह॒वींषि॑ दे॒वो दे॒वान्य॑जत्व॒ग्निरर्ह॑न्
verses.transliteration: véṣi hotrám utá potráṃ jánānām  mandhātā́si draviṇodā́ r̥tā́vā  svā́hā vayáṃ kr̥ṇávāmā havī́ṃṣi  devó devā́n yajatv agnír árhan

translation.text: Thine is the Herald's, thine the Cleanser's office, thinker art thou, wealth-giver, true to Order. Let us with Svâhâ offer up oblations, and Agni, worthy God, pay the Gods worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ दे॒वाना॒मपि॒ पन्था॑मगन्म॒ यच्छ॒क्नवा॑म॒ तदनु॒ प्रवो॑ळ्हुम् अ॒ग्निर्वि॒द्वान्त्स य॑जा॒त्सेदु॒ होता॒ सो अ॑ध्व॒रान्त्स ऋ॒तून्क॑ल्पयाति
verses.transliteration: ā́ devā́nām ápi pánthām aganma  yác chaknávāma tád ánu právoḷhum  agnír vidvā́n sá yajāt séd u hótā  só adhvarā́n sá r̥tū́n kalpayāti

translation.text: To the Gods' pathway have we travelled, ready to execute what work we may accomplish. Let Agni, for he knows, complete the worship. He is the Priest: let him fix rites and seasons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वो॑ व॒यं प्र॑मि॒नाम॑ व्र॒तानि॑ वि॒दुषां॑ देवा॒ अवि॑दुष्टरासः अ॒ग्निष्टद्विश्व॒मा पृ॑णाति वि॒द्वान्येभि॑र्दे॒वाँ ऋ॒तुभिः॑ क॒ल्पया॑ति
verses.transliteration: yád vo vayám praminā́ma vratā́ni  vidúṣāṃ devā áviduṣṭarāsaḥ  agníṣ ṭád víśvam ā́ pr̥ṇāti vidvā́n  yébhir devā́m̐ r̥túbhiḥ kalpáyāti

translation.text: When we most ignorant neglect the statutes of you, O Deities with whom is knowledge, Wise Agni shall correct our faults and failings, skilled to assign each God his fitting season.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्पा॑क॒त्रा मन॑सा दी॒नद॑क्षा॒ न य॒ज्ञस्य॑ मन्व॒ते मर्त्या॑सः अ॒ग्निष्टद्धोता॑ क्रतु॒विद्वि॑जा॒नन्यजि॑ष्ठो दे॒वाँ ऋ॑तु॒शो य॑जाति
verses.transliteration: yát pākatrā́ mánasā dīnádakṣāḥ-  ná yajñásya manvaté mártyāsaḥ  agníṣ ṭád dhótā kratuvíd vijānán  yájiṣṭho devā́m̐ r̥tuśó yajāti

translation.text: When, weak in mind, of feeble understanding, mortals bethink them not of sacrificing, Then shall the prudent and discerning Agni worship the Gods, best worshipper, in season.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑षां॒ ह्य॑ध्व॒राणा॒मनी॑कं चि॒त्रं के॒तुं जनि॑ता त्वा ज॒जान॑ स आ य॑जस्व नृ॒वती॒रनु॒ क्षाः स्पा॒र्हा इषः॑ क्षु॒मती॑र्वि॒श्वज॑न्याः
verses.transliteration: víśveṣāṃ hy àdhvarā́ṇām ánīkaṃ  citráṃ ketúṃ jánitā tvā jajā́na  sá ā́ yajasva nr̥vátīr ánu kṣā́ḥ-  spārhā́ íṣaḥ kṣumátīr viśvájanyāḥ

translation.text: Because the Father hath produced thee, Leader of all our solemn rites, their brilliant Banner: So win by worship pleasant homes abounding in heroes, and rich food to nourish all men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्वा॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी यं त्वाप॒स्त्वष्टा॒ यं त्वा॑ सु॒जनि॑मा ज॒जान॑ पन्था॒मनु॑ प्रवि॒द्वान्पि॑तृ॒याणं॑ द्यु॒मद॑ग्ने समिधा॒नो वि भा॑हि
verses.transliteration: yáṃ tvā dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ yáṃ tvā́pas  tváṣṭā yáṃ tvā sujánimā jajā́na  pánthām ánu pravidvā́n pitr̥yā́ṇaṃ  dyumád agne samidhānó ví bhāhi

translation.text: Thou whom the Heaven and Earth, thou whom the Waters, and Tvashṭar, maker of fair things, created, Well knowing, all along the Fathers' pathway, shine with resplendent light, enkindled, Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒नो रा॑जन्नर॒तिः समि॑द्धो॒ रौद्रो॒ दक्षा॑य सुषु॒माँ अ॑दर्शि चि॒किद्वि भा॑ति भा॒सा बृ॑ह॒तासि॑क्नीमेति॒ रुश॑तीम॒पाज॑न्
verses.transliteration: inó rājann aratíḥ sámiddho  raúdro dákṣāya suṣumā́m̐ adarśi  cikíd ví bhāti bhāsā́ br̥hatā́-  -ásiknīm eti rúśatīm apā́jan

translation.text: O KING, the potent and terrific envoy, kindled for strength, is manifest in beauty. He shines, all-knowing, with his lotty splendour: chasing black Night he comes with white-rayed Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒ष्णां यदेनी॑म॒भि वर्प॑सा॒ भूज्ज॒नय॒न्योषां॑ बृह॒तः पि॒तुर्जाम् ऊ॒र्ध्वं भा॒नुं सूर्य॑स्य स्तभा॒यन्दि॒वो वसु॑भिरर॒तिर्वि भा॑ति
verses.transliteration: kr̥ṣṇā́ṃ yád énīm abhí várpasā bhū́j  janáyan yóṣām br̥hatáḥ pitúr jā́m  ūrdhvám bhānúṃ sū́ryasya stabhāyán  divó vásubhir aratír ví bhāti

translation.text: Having o'ercome the glimmering Black with beauty, and bringing forth the dame the Great Sire's Daughter, Holding aloft the radiant light of Sûrya, as messenger of heaven he shines with treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रो भ॒द्रया॒ सच॑मान॒ आगा॒त्स्वसा॑रं जा॒रो अ॒भ्ये॑ति प॒श्चात् सु॒प्र॒के॒तैर्द्युभि॑र॒ग्निर्वि॒तिष्ठ॒न्रुश॑द्भि॒र्वर्णै॑र॒भि रा॒मम॑स्थात्
verses.transliteration: bhadró bhadráyā sácamāna ā́gāt  svásāraṃ jāró abhy èti paścā́t  supraketaír dyúbhir agnír vitíṣṭhan  rúśadbhir várṇair abhí rāmám asthāt

translation.text: Attendant on the Blessed Dame the Blessed hath come: the Lover followeth his Sister. Agni, far-spreading with conspicuous lustre, hath compassed Night with whitelyshining garments.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य यामा॑सो बृह॒तो न व॒ग्नूनिन्धा॑ना अ॒ग्नेः सख्युः॑ शि॒वस्य॑ ईड्य॑स्य॒ वृष्णो॑ बृह॒तः स्वासो॒ भामा॑सो॒ याम॑न्न॒क्तव॑श्चिकित्रे
verses.transliteration: asyá yā́māso br̥ható ná vagnū́n  índhānā agnéḥ sákhyuḥ śivásya  ī́ḍyasya vŕ̥ṣṇo br̥hatáḥ svā́so  bhā́māso yā́mann aktávaś cikitre

translation.text: His goings-forth kindle as 'twere high voices the goings of the auspicious Friend of Agni. The rays, the bright beams of the strong-jawed, mighty, adorable Steer are visible as he cometh.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒ना न यस्य॒ भामा॑सः॒ पव॑न्ते॒ रोच॑मानस्य बृह॒तः सु॒दिवः॑ ज्येष्ठे॑भि॒र्यस्तेजि॑ष्ठैः क्रीळु॒मद्भि॒र्वर्षि॑ष्ठेभिर्भा॒नुभि॒र्नक्ष॑ति॒ द्याम्
verses.transliteration: svanā́ ná yásya bhā́māsaḥ pávante  rócamānasya br̥hatáḥ sudívaḥ  jyéṣṭhebhir yás téjiṣṭhaiḥ krīḷumádbhir  várṣiṣṭhebhir bhānúbhir nákṣati dyā́m

translation.text: Whose radiant splendours flow, like sounds, about us, his who is lofty, brilliant, and effulgent, Who reaches heaven with best and brightest lustres, sportive and piercing even to the summit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य शुष्मा॑सो ददृशा॒नप॑वे॒र्जेह॑मानस्य स्वनयन्नि॒युद्भिः॑ प्र॒त्नेभि॒र्यो रुश॑द्भिर्दे॒वत॑मो॒ वि रेभ॑द्भिरर॒तिर्भाति॒ विभ्वा॑
verses.transliteration: asyá śúṣmāso dadr̥śānápaver  jéhamānasya svanayan niyúdbhiḥ  pratnébhir yó rúśadbhir devátamo  ví rébhadbhir aratír bhā́ti víbhvā

translation.text: His powers, whose chariot fellies gleam and glitter have loudly roared while, as with teams, he hasted. He, the most Godlike, far-extending envoy, shines with flames ancient, resonant, whitely-shining.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स आ व॑क्षि॒ महि॑ न॒ आ च॑ सत्सि दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्योर॑र॒तिर्यु॑व॒त्योः अ॒ग्निः सु॒तुकः॑ सु॒तुके॑भि॒रश्वै॒ रभ॑स्वद्भी॒ रभ॑स्वाँ॒ एह ग॑म्याः
verses.transliteration: sá ā́ vakṣi máhi na ā́ ca satsi  diváspr̥thivyór aratír yuvatyóḥ  agníḥ sutúkaḥ sutúkebhir áśvaiḥ-  rábhasvadbhī rábhasvām̐ éhá gamyāḥ

translation.text: So bring us ample wealth: seat thee as envoy of the two youthful Matrons, Earth and Heaven. Let Agni rapid with his rapid, horses, impetuous with impetuous Steeds, come hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॑ यक्षि॒ प्र त॑ इयर्मि॒ मन्म॒ भुवो॒ यथा॒ वन्द्यो॑ नो॒ हवे॑षु धन्व॑न्निव प्र॒पा अ॑सि॒ त्वम॑ग्न इय॒क्षवे॑ पू॒रवे॑ प्रत्न राजन्
verses.transliteration: prá te yakṣi prá ta iyarmi mánma  bhúvo yáthā vándyo no háveṣu  dhánvann iva prapā́ asi tvám agne-  iyakṣáve pūráve pratna rājan

translation.text: To thee will send praise and bring oblation, as thou hast merited lauds when we invoked thee. A fountain in the desert art thou, Agni, O Ancient King, to man who fain would worship,

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्वा॒ जना॑सो अ॒भि सं॒चर॑न्ति॒ गाव॑ उ॒ष्णमि॑व व्र॒जं य॑विष्ठ दू॒तो दे॒वाना॑मसि॒ मर्त्या॑नाम॒न्तर्म॒हाँश्च॑रसि रोच॒नेन॑
verses.transliteration: yáṃ tvā jánāso abhí saṃcáranti  gā́va uṣṇám iva vrajáṃ yaviṣṭha  dūtó devā́nām asi mártyānām  antár mahā́ṃś carasi rocanéna

translation.text: Thou unto whom resort the gathered people, as the kine seek the warm stall, O Most Youthful. Thou art the messenger of Gods and mortals, and goest glorious with thy light between them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शिशुं॒ न त्वा॒ जेन्यं॑ व॒र्धय॑न्ती मा॒ता बि॑भर्ति सचन॒स्यमा॑ना धनो॒रधि॑ प्र॒वता॑ यासि॒ हर्य॒ञ्जिगी॑षसे प॒शुरि॒वाव॑सृष्टः
verses.transliteration: śíśuṃ ná tvā jényaṃ vardháyantī  mātā́ bibharti sacanasyámānā  dhánor ádhi pravátā yāsi háryañ  jígīṣase paśúr ivā́vasr̥ṣṭaḥ

translation.text: Making thee grow as 'twere some noble infant, thy Mother nurtures thee with sweet affection. Over the desert slopes thou passest longing, and seekest, like some beast set free, thy fodder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मू॒रा अ॑मूर॒ न व॒यं चि॑कित्वो महि॒त्वम॑ग्ने॒ त्वम॒ङ्ग वि॑त्से शये॑ व॒व्रिश्चर॑ति जि॒ह्वया॒दन्रे॑रि॒ह्यते॑ युव॒तिं वि॒श्पतिः॒ सन्
verses.transliteration: mūrā́ amūra ná vayáṃ cikitvo  mahitvám agne tvám aṅgá vitse  śáye vavríś cárati jihváyādán  rerihyáte yuvatíṃ viśpátiḥ sán

translation.text: Foolish are we, O Wise and free from error: verily, Agni, thou dost know thy grandeur. There lies the form: he moves and licks, and swallows, and, as House-Lord, kisses the Youthful Maiden.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कूचि॑ज्जायते॒ सन॑यासु॒ नव्यो॒ वने॑ तस्थौ पलि॒तो धू॒मके॑तुः अ॒स्ना॒तापो॑ वृष॒भो न प्र वे॑ति॒ सचे॑तसो॒ यं प्र॒णय॑न्त॒ मर्ताः॑
verses.transliteration: kū́cij jāyate sánayāsu návyo  váne tasthau palitó dhūmáketuḥ  asnātā́po vr̥ṣabhó ná prá veti  sácetaso yám praṇáyanta mártāḥ

translation.text: He rises ever fresh in ancient fuel: smoke-bannered, gray, he makes the wood his dwelling. No swimmer, Steer, he presses through the waters, and to his place accordant mortals bear him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त॒नू॒त्यजे॑व॒ तस्क॑रा वन॒र्गू र॑श॒नाभि॑र्द॒शभि॑र॒भ्य॑धीताम् इ॒यं ते॑ अग्ने॒ नव्य॑सी मनी॒षा यु॒क्ष्वा रथं॒ न शु॒चय॑द्भि॒रङ्गैः॑
verses.transliteration: tanūtyájeva táskarā vanargū́  raśanā́bhir daśábhir abhy àdhītām  iyáṃ te agne návyasī manīṣā́  yukṣvā́ ráthaṃ ná śucáyadbhir áṅgaiḥ

translation.text: Like thieves who risk their lives and haunt the forest, the twain with their ten girdles have secured him. This is a new hymn meant for thee, O Agni: yoke as it were thy car with parts that glitter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्म॑ च ते जातवेदो॒ नम॑श्चे॒यं च॒ गीः सद॒मिद्वर्ध॑नी भूत् रक्षा॑ णो अग्ने॒ तन॑यानि तो॒का रक्षो॒त न॑स्त॒न्वो॒३॒॑ अप्र॑युच्छन्
verses.transliteration: bráhma ca te jātavedo námaś ca-  -iyáṃ ca gī́ḥ sádam íd várdhanī bhūt  rákṣā ṇo agne tánayāni tokā́  rákṣotá nas tanvò áprayuchan

translation.text: Homage and prayer are thine, O Jâtavedas, and this my song shall evermore exalt thee. Agni, protect our children and descendants, and guard with ever-watcliful care our bodies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एकः॑ समु॒द्रो ध॒रुणो॑ रयी॒णाम॒स्मद्धृ॒दो भूरि॑जन्मा॒ वि च॑ष्टे सिष॒क्त्यूध॑र्नि॒ण्योरु॒पस्थ॒ उत्स॑स्य॒ मध्ये॒ निहि॑तं प॒दं वेः
verses.transliteration: ékaḥ samudró dharúṇo rayīṇā́m  asmád dhr̥dó bhū́rijanmā ví caṣṭe  síṣakty ū́dhar niṇyór upásthe-  útsasya mádhye níhitam padáṃ véḥ

translation.text: HE only is the Sea, holder of treasures: born many a time he views the hearts within us. He hides him in the secret couple's bosom. The Bird dwells in the middle of the fountain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नं नी॒ळं वृष॑णो॒ वसा॑नाः॒ सं ज॑ग्मिरे महि॒षा अर्व॑तीभिः ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒दं क॒वयो॒ नि पा॑न्ति॒ गुहा॒ नामा॑नि दधिरे॒ परा॑णि
verses.transliteration: samānáṃ nīḷáṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇo vásānāḥ  sáṃ jagmire mahiṣā́ árvatībhiḥ  r̥tásya padáṃ kaváyo ní pānti  gúhā nā́māni dadhire párāṇi

translation.text: Inhabiting one dwelling-place in common, strong Stallions and the Mares have come together. The sages guard the seat of Holy Order, and keep the highest names concealed within them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒ता॒यिनी॑ मा॒यिनी॒ सं द॑धाते मि॒त्वा शिशुं॑ जज्ञतुर्व॒र्धय॑न्ती विश्व॑स्य॒ नाभिं॒ चर॑तो ध्रु॒वस्य॑ क॒वेश्चि॒त्तन्तुं॒ मन॑सा वि॒यन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: r̥tāyínī māyínī sáṃ dadhāte  mitvā́ śíśuṃ jajñatur vardháyantī  víśvasya nā́bhiṃ cárato dhruvásya  kavéś cit tántum mánasā viyántaḥ

translation.text: The Holy Pair, of wondrous power, have coupled: they formed the Infant, they who bred produced him. The central point of all that moves and moves not, the while they wove the Sage's thread with insight

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॒ हि व॑र्त॒नयः॒ सुजा॑त॒मिषो॒ वाजा॑य प्र॒दिवः॒ सच॑न्ते अ॒धी॒वा॒सं रोद॑सी वावसा॒ने घृ॒तैरन्नै॑र्वावृधाते॒ मधू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya hí vartanáyaḥ sújātam  íṣo vā́jāya pradívaḥ sácante  adhīvāsáṃ ródasī vāvasāné  ghr̥taír ánnair vāvr̥dhāte mádhūnām

translation.text: For tracks of Order and refreshing viands attend from ancient times the goodly Infant. Wearing him as a mantle, Earth and Heaven grow strong by food of pleasant drink and fatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त स्वसॄ॒ररु॑षीर्वावशा॒नो वि॒द्वान्मध्व॒ उज्ज॑भारा दृ॒शे कम् अ॒न्तर्ये॑मे अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे पुरा॒जा इ॒च्छन्व॒व्रिम॑विदत्पूष॒णस्य॑
verses.transliteration: saptá svásr̥̄r áruṣīr vāvaśānó  vidvā́n mádhva új jabhārā dr̥śé kám  antár yeme antárikṣe purājā́ḥ-  ichán vavrím avidat pūṣaṇásya

translation.text: He, calling loudly to the Seven red Sisters, hath, skilled in sweet drink, brought them to be looked on. He, born of old, in middle air hath halted, and sought and found the covering robe of Pûshan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त म॒र्यादाः॑ क॒वय॑स्ततक्षु॒स्तासा॒मेका॒मिद॒भ्यं॑हु॒रो गा॑त् आ॒योर्ह॑ स्क॒म्भ उ॑प॒मस्य॑ नी॒ळे प॒थां वि॑स॒र्गे ध॒रुणे॑षु तस्थौ
verses.transliteration: saptá maryā́dāḥ kaváyas tatakṣus  tā́sām ékām íd abhy àṃhuró gāt  āyór ha skambhá upamásya nīḷé  pathā́ṃ visargé dharúṇeṣu tasthau

translation.text: Seven are the pathways which the wise have fashioned; to one of these may come the troubled mortal. He standeth in the dwelling of the Highest, a Pillar, on sure ground where paths are parted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॑च्च॒ सच्च॑ पर॒मे व्यो॑म॒न्दक्ष॑स्य॒ जन्म॒न्नदि॑तेरु॒पस्थे॑ अ॒ग्निर्ह॑ नः प्रथम॒जा ऋ॒तस्य॒ पूर्व॒ आयु॑नि वृष॒भश्च॑ धे॒नुः
verses.transliteration: ásac ca sác ca paramé vyòman  dákṣasya jánmann áditer upásthe  agnír ha naḥ prathamajā́ r̥tásya  pū́rva ā́yuni vr̥ṣabháś ca dhenúḥ

translation.text: Not Being, Being in the highest heaven, in Aditi's bosom and in Daksha's birthplace, Is Agni, our first-born of Holy Order, the Milch-cow and the Bull in life's beginning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं स यस्य॒ शर्म॒न्नवो॑भिर॒ग्नेरेध॑ते जरि॒ताभिष्टौ॑ ज्येष्ठे॑भि॒र्यो भा॒नुभि॑र्ऋषू॒णां प॒र्येति॒ परि॑वीतो वि॒भावा॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sá yásya śármann ávobhir  agnér édhate jaritā́bhíṣṭau  jyéṣṭhebhir yó bhānúbhir r̥ṣūṇā́m  paryéti párivīto vibhā́vā

translation.text: THIS is that Agni, he by whose protection, favour, and help. the singer is successful; Who with the noblest flames of glowing fuel comes forth encompassed with far-spreading lustre.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो भा॒नुभि॑र्वि॒भावा॑ वि॒भात्य॒ग्निर्दे॒वेभि॑र्ऋ॒तावाज॑स्रः आ यो वि॒वाय॑ स॒ख्या सखि॒भ्योऽप॑रिह्वृतो॒ अत्यो॒ न सप्तिः॑
verses.transliteration: yó bhānúbhir vibhā́vā vibhā́ti-  agnír devébhir r̥tā́vā́jasraḥ  ā́ yó vivā́ya sakhyā́ sákhibhyaḥ-  -áparihvr̥to átyo ná sáptiḥ

translation.text: Agni, the Holy One, the everlasting, who shines far beaming with celestial splendours; He who hath come unto his friends with friendship, like a fleet steed who never trips or stumbles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईशे॒ यो विश्व॑स्या दे॒ववी॑ते॒रीशे॑ वि॒श्वायु॑रु॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ आ यस्मि॑न्म॒ना ह॒वींष्य॒ग्नावरि॑ष्टरथः स्क॒भ्नाति॑ शू॒षैः
verses.transliteration: ī́śe yó víśvasyā devávīter  ī́śe viśvā́yur uṣáso vyùṣṭau  ā́ yásmin manā́ havī́ṃṣy agnā́v  áriṣṭaratha skabhnā́ti śūṣaíḥ

translation.text: He who is Lord of all divine oblation, shared by all living men at break of morning, Agni to whom our offerings are devoted, in whom rests he whose car, through might, is scatheless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शू॒षेभि॑र्वृ॒धो जु॑षा॒णो अ॒र्कैर्दे॒वाँ अच्छा॑ रघु॒पत्वा॑ जिगाति म॒न्द्रो होता॒ स जु॒ह्वा॒३॒॑ यजि॑ष्ठः॒ सम्मि॑श्लो अ॒ग्निरा जि॑घर्ति दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: śūṣébhir vr̥dhó juṣāṇó arkaír  devā́m̐ áchā raghupátvā jigāti  mandró hótā sá juhvā̀ yájiṣṭhaḥ  sámmiślo agnír ā́ jigharti devā́n

translation.text: Increasing by his strength. while lauds content him, with easy flight unto the Gods he travels. Agni the cheerful Priest, best Sacrificer, balms with his tongue the Gods with whom he mingles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॒स्रामिन्द्रं॒ न रेज॑मानम॒ग्निं गी॒र्भिर्नमो॑भि॒रा कृ॑णुध्वम् आ यं विप्रा॑सो म॒तिभि॑र्गृ॒णन्ति॑ जा॒तवे॑दसं जु॒ह्वं॑ स॒हाना॑म्
verses.transliteration: tám usrā́m índraṃ ná réjamānam  agníṃ gīrbhír námobhir ā́ kr̥ṇudhvam  ā́ yáṃ víprāso matíbhir gr̥ṇánti  jātávedasaṃ juhvàṃ sahā́nām

translation.text: With songs and adorations bring ye hither Agni who stirs himself at dawn like Indra, Whom sages laud with hymns as Jâtavedas of those who wield the sacrificial ladle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं यस्मि॒न्विश्वा॒ वसू॑नि ज॒ग्मुर्वाजे॒ नाश्वाः॒ सप्ती॑वन्त॒ एवैः॑ अ॒स्मे ऊ॒तीरिन्द्र॑वाततमा अर्वाची॒ना अ॑ग्न॒ आ कृ॑णुष्व
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yásmin víśvā vásūni jagmúr  vā́je nā́śvāḥ sáptīvanta évaiḥ  asmé ūtī́r índravātatamāḥ-  arvācīnā́ agna ā́ kr̥ṇuṣva

translation.text: In whom all goodly treasures meet together, even as steeds and riders for the booty. Inclining hither bring us help, O Agni, even assistance most desired by Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॒ ह्य॑ग्ने म॒ह्ना नि॒षद्या॑ स॒द्यो ज॑ज्ञा॒नो हव्यो॑ ब॒भूथ॑ तं ते॑ दे॒वासो॒ अनु॒ केत॑माय॒न्नधा॑वर्धन्त प्रथ॒मास॒ ऊमाः॑
verses.transliteration: ádhā hy àgne mahnā́ niṣádyā  sadyó jajñānó hávyo babhū́tha  táṃ te devā́so ánu kétam āyann  ádhāvardhanta prathamā́sa ū́māḥ

translation.text: Yea, at thy birth, when thou hadst sat in glory, thou, Agni, wast the aim of invocations. The Gods came near, obedient to thy sunimons, and thus attained their rank as chief Protectors.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्ति नो॑ दि॒वो अ॑ग्ने पृथि॒व्या वि॒श्वायु॑र्धेहि य॒जथा॑य देव सचे॑महि॒ तव॑ दस्म प्रके॒तैरु॑रु॒ष्या ण॑ उ॒रुभि॑र्देव॒ शंसैः॑
verses.transliteration: svastí no divó agne pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  viśvā́yur dhehi yajáthāya deva  sácemahi táva dasma praketaír  uruṣyā́ ṇa urúbhir deva śáṃsaiḥ

translation.text: O AGNI, shared by all men living bring us good luck for sacrifice from earth and heaven. With us be thine intelligence, WonderWorker! Protect us, God, with thy far-reaching blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा अ॑ग्ने म॒तय॒स्तुभ्यं॑ जा॒ता गोभि॒रश्वै॑र॒भि गृ॑णन्ति॒ राधः॑ य॒दा ते॒ मर्तो॒ अनु॒ भोग॒मान॒ड्वसो॒ दधा॑नो म॒तिभिः॑ सुजात
verses.transliteration: imā́ agne matáyas túbhyaṃ jātā́ḥ-  góbhir áśvair abhí gr̥ṇanti rā́dhaḥ  yadā́ te márto ánu bhógam ā́naḷ  váso dádhāno matíbhiḥ sujāta

translation.text: These hymns brought forth for thee, O Agni, laud thee for bounteous gifts, with cattle and with horses. Good Lord, when man from thee hath gained enjoyment, by hymns, O noblyborn, hath he obtained it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं म॑न्ये पि॒तर॑म॒ग्निमा॒पिम॒ग्निं भ्रात॑रं॒ सद॒मित्सखा॑यम् अ॒ग्नेरनी॑कं बृह॒तः स॑पर्यं दि॒वि शु॒क्रं य॑ज॒तं सूर्य॑स्य
verses.transliteration: agním manye pitáram agním āpím  agním bhrā́taraṃ sádam ít sákhāyam  agnér ánīkam br̥hatáḥ saparyaṃ  diví śukráṃ yajatáṃ sū́ryasya

translation.text: Agni I deem my Kinsman and my Father, count him my Brother and my Friend for ever. I honour as the face of lofty Agni in heaven the bright and holy light of Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सि॒ध्रा अ॑ग्ने॒ धियो॑ अ॒स्मे सनु॑त्री॒र्यं त्राय॑से॒ दम॒ आ नित्य॑होता ऋ॒तावा॒ स रो॒हिद॑श्वः पुरु॒क्षुर्द्युभि॑रस्मा॒ अह॑भिर्वा॒मम॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: sidhrā́ agne dhíyo asmé sánutrīr  yáṃ trā́yase dáma ā́ nítyahotā  r̥tā́vā sá rohídaśvaḥ purukṣúr  dyúbhir asmā áhabhir vāmám astu

translation.text: Effectual, Agni, are our prayers for profit. He whom, at home thou, Priest for ever, guardest Is rich in food, drawn by red steeds, and holy: by day and night to him shall all be pleasant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्युभि॑र्हि॒तं मि॒त्रमि॑व प्र॒योगं॑ प्र॒त्नमृ॒त्विज॑मध्व॒रस्य॑ जा॒रम् बा॒हुभ्या॑म॒ग्निमा॒यवो॑ऽजनन्त वि॒क्षु होता॑रं॒ न्य॑सादयन्त
verses.transliteration: dyúbhir hitám mitrám iva prayógam  pratnám r̥tvíjam adhvarásya jārám  bāhúbhyām agním āyávo 'jananta  vikṣú hótāraṃ ny àsādayanta

translation.text: Men with their arms have generated Agni, helpful as some kind friend, adorned with splendours, And stablished as Invoker mid the people the ancient Priest the sacrifice's lover.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒यं य॑जस्व दि॒वि दे॑व दे॒वान्किं ते॒ पाकः॑ कृणव॒दप्र॑चेताः यथाय॑ज ऋ॒तुभि॑र्देव दे॒वाने॒वा य॑जस्व त॒न्वं॑ सुजात
verses.transliteration: svayáṃ yajasva diví deva devā́n  kíṃ te pā́kaḥ kr̥ṇavad ápracetāḥ  yáthā́yaja r̥túbhir deva devā́n  evā́ yajasva tanvàṃ sujāta

translation.text: Worship, thyself, O God, the Gods in heaven: what, void of knowledge, shall the fool avail thee? As thou, O God, hast worshipped Gods by seasons, so, nobly-born! to thine own self pay worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भवा॑ नो अग्नेऽवि॒तोत गो॒पा भवा॑ वय॒स्कृदु॒त नो॑ वयो॒धाः रास्वा॑ च नः सुमहो ह॒व्यदा॑तिं॒ त्रास्वो॒त न॑स्त॒न्वो॒३॒॑ अप्र॑युच्छन्
verses.transliteration: bhávā no agne 'vitótá gopā́ḥ-  bhávā vayaskŕ̥d utá no vayodhā́ḥ  rā́svā ca naḥ sumaho havyádātiṃ  trā́svotá nas tanvò áprayuchan

translation.text: Agni, be thou our Guardian and Protector bestow upon us life and vital vigour. Accept, O Mighty One, the gifts we offer, and with unceasing care protect our bodies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र के॒तुना॑ बृह॒ता या॑त्य॒ग्निरा रोद॑सी वृष॒भो रो॑रवीति दि॒वश्चि॒दन्ताँ॑ उप॒माँ उदा॑नळ॒पामु॒पस्थे॑ महि॒षो व॑वर्ध
verses.transliteration: prá ketúnā br̥hatā́ yāty agnír  ā́ ródasī vr̥ṣabhó roravīti  diváś cid ántām̐ upamā́m̐ úd ānaḷ  apā́m upásthe mahiṣó vavardha

translation.text: AGNI advances with his lofty banner: the Bull is bellowing to the earth and heavens. He hath attained the sky's supremest limits. the Steer hath waxen in the lap of waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मु॒मोद॒ गर्भो॑ वृष॒भः क॒कुद्मा॑नस्रे॒मा व॒त्सः शिमी॑वाँ अरावीत् स दे॒वता॒त्युद्य॑तानि कृ॒ण्वन्त्स्वेषु॒ क्षये॑षु प्रथ॒मो जि॑गाति
verses.transliteration: mumóda gárbho vr̥ṣabháḥ kakúdmān  asremā́ vatsáḥ śímīvām̐ arāvīt  sá devátāty údyatāni kr̥ṇván  svéṣu kṣáyeṣu prathamó jigāti

translation.text: The Bull, the youngling with the hump, hath frolicked, the strong and never-ceasing Calf hath bellowed. Bringing our offerings to the God's assembly, he moves as Chief in his own dwelling-places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यो मू॒र्धानं॑ पि॒त्रोरर॑ब्ध॒ न्य॑ध्व॒रे द॑धिरे॒ सूरो॒ अर्णः॑ अस्य॒ पत्म॒न्नरु॑षी॒रश्व॑बुध्ना ऋ॒तस्य॒ योनौ॑ त॒न्वो॑ जुषन्त
verses.transliteration: ā́ yó mūrdhā́nam pitrór árabdha  ny àdhvaré dadhire sū́ro árṇaḥ  ásya pátmann áruṣīr áśvabudhnāḥ-  r̥tásya yónau tanvò juṣanta

translation.text: Him who hath grasped his Parents' head, they stablished at sacrifice a wave of heavenly lustre. In his swift flight the red Dawns borne by horses refresh their bodies in the home of Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒षउ॑षो॒ हि व॑सो॒ अग्र॒मेषि॒ त्वं य॒मयो॑रभवो वि॒भावा॑ ऋ॒ताय॑ स॒प्त द॑धिषे प॒दानि॑ ज॒नय॑न्मि॒त्रं त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ स्वायै॑
verses.transliteration: uṣá-uṣo hí vaso ágram éṣi  tváṃ yamáyor abhavo vibhā́vā  r̥tā́ya saptá dadhiṣe padā́ni  janáyan mitráṃ tanvè svā́yai

translation.text: For, Vasu thou precedest every Morning, and still hast been the Twins' illuminator. For sacrifice, seven places thou retainest while for thine own self thou engenderest Mitra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भुव॒श्चक्षु॑र्म॒ह ऋ॒तस्य॑ गो॒पा भुवो॒ वरु॑णो॒ यदृ॒ताय॒ वेषि॑ भुवो॑ अ॒पां नपा॑ज्जातवेदो॒ भुवो॑ दू॒तो यस्य॑ ह॒व्यं जुजो॑षः
verses.transliteration: bhúvaś cákṣur mahá r̥tásya gopā́ḥ-  bhúvo váruṇo yád r̥tā́ya véṣi  bhúvo apā́ṃ nápāj jātavedo  bhúvo dūtó yásya havyáṃ jújoṣaḥ

translation.text: Thou art the Eye and Guard of mighty Order, and Varuṇa when to sacrifice thou comest. Thou art the Waters' Child O Jâtavedas, envoy of him whose offering thou acceptest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भुवो॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॒ रज॑सश्च ने॒ता यत्रा॑ नि॒युद्भिः॒ सच॑से शि॒वाभिः॑ दि॒वि मू॒र्धानं॑ दधिषे स्व॒र्षां जि॒ह्वाम॑ग्ने चकृषे हव्य॒वाह॑म्
verses.transliteration: bhúvo yajñásya rájasaś ca netā́  yátrā niyúdbhiḥ sácase śivā́bhiḥ  diví mūrdhā́naṃ dadhiṣe svarṣā́ṃ  jihvā́m agne cakr̥ṣe havyavā́ham

translation.text: Thou art the Leader of the rite and region, to which with thine auspicious teams thou teadest, Thy light-bestowing head to heaven thou liftest, making thy tongue the oblationbearer, Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य त्रि॒तः क्रतु॑ना व॒व्रे अ॒न्तरि॒च्छन्धी॒तिं पि॒तुरेवैः॒ पर॑स्य स॒च॒स्यमा॑नः पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थे॑ जा॒मि ब्रु॑वा॒ण आयु॑धानि वेति
verses.transliteration: asyá tritáḥ krátunā vavré antár  ichán dhītím pitúr évaiḥ párasya  sacasyámānaḥ pitrór upásthe  jāmí bruvāṇá ā́yudhāni veti

translation.text: Through his wise insight Trita in the cavern, seeking as ever the Chief Sire's intention, Carefully tended in his Parents' bosom, calling the weapons kin, goes forth to combat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स पित्र्या॒ण्यायु॑धानि वि॒द्वानिन्द्रे॑षित आ॒प्त्यो अ॒भ्य॑युध्यत् त्रि॒शी॒र्षाणं॑ स॒प्तर॑श्मिं जघ॒न्वान्त्वा॒ष्ट्रस्य॑ चि॒न्निः स॑सृजे त्रि॒तो गाः
verses.transliteration: sá pítryāṇy ā́yudhāni vidvā́n  índreṣita āptyó abhy àyudhyat  triśīrṣā́ṇaṃ saptáraśmiṃ jaghanvā́n  tvāṣṭrásya cin níḥ sasr̥je tritó gā́ḥ

translation.text: Well-skilled to use the weapons of his Father, Âptya, urged on by Indra, fought the battle. Then Trita slew the foe seven-rayed, three-headed, and freed the cattle of the Son of Tvashṭar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरीदिन्द्र॑ उ॒दिन॑क्षन्त॒मोजोऽवा॑भिन॒त्सत्प॑ति॒र्मन्य॑मानम् त्वा॒ष्ट्रस्य॑ चिद्वि॒श्वरू॑पस्य॒ गोना॑माचक्रा॒णस्त्रीणि॑ शी॒र्षा परा॑ वर्क्
verses.transliteration: bhū́rī́d índra udínakṣantam ójaḥ-  -ávābhinat sátpatir mányamānam  tvāṣṭrásya cid viśvárūpasya gónām  ācakrāṇás trī́ṇi śīrṣā́ párā vark

translation.text: Lord of the brave, Indra cleft him in pieces who sought to gain much strength and deemed him mighty. He smote his three heads from his body, seizing the cattle of the oniniform Son of Tvashṭar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपो॒ हि ष्ठा म॑यो॒भुव॒स्ता न॑ ऊ॒र्जे द॑धातन म॒हे रणा॑य॒ चक्ष॑से
verses.transliteration: ā́po hí ṣṭhā́ mayobhúvas  tā́ na ūrjé dadhātana  mahé ráṇāya cákṣase

translation.text: YE, Waters, are beneficent: so help ye us to energy That we may look on great delight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वः॑ शि॒वत॑मो॒ रस॒स्तस्य॑ भाजयते॒ह नः॑ उ॒श॒तीरि॑व मा॒तरः॑
verses.transliteration: yó vaḥ śivátamo rásas  tásya bhājayatehá naḥ  uśatī́r iva mātáraḥ

translation.text: Give us a portion of the sap, the most auspicious that ye have, Like mothers in their longing love.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्मा॒ अरं॑ गमाम वो॒ यस्य॒ क्षया॑य॒ जिन्व॑थ आपो॑ ज॒नय॑था च नः
verses.transliteration: tásmā áraṃ gamāma vo  yásya kṣáyāya jínvatha  ā́po janáyathā ca naḥ

translation.text: To you we gladly come for him to whose abode ye send us on; And, Waters, give us procreant strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॑ दे॒वीर॒भिष्ट॑य॒ आपो॑ भवन्तु पी॒तये॑ शं योर॒भि स्र॑वन्तु नः
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no devī́r abhíṣṭaye-  ā́po bhavantu pītáye  śáṃ yór abhí sravantu naḥ

translation.text: The Waters. be to us for drink, Goddesses for our aid and bliss: Let them stream to us health and strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईशा॑ना॒ वार्या॑णां॒ क्षय॑न्तीश्चर्षणी॒नाम् अ॒पो या॑चामि भेष॒जम्
verses.transliteration: ī́śānā vā́ryāṇāṃ  kṣáyantīś carṣaṇīnā́m  apó yācāmi bheṣajám

translation.text: I beg the Floods to give us balm, these Queens who rule o'er precious things, And have supreme control of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒प्सु मे॒ सोमो॑ अब्रवीद॒न्तर्विश्वा॑नि भेष॒जा अ॒ग्निं च॑ वि॒श्वश॑म्भुवम्
verses.transliteration: apsú me sómo abravīd  antár víśvāni bheṣajā́  agníṃ ca viśváśambhuvam

translation.text: Within the Waters-Soma thus hath told me-dwell all balms that heal, And Agni, he who blesseth all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपः॑ पृणी॒त भे॑ष॒जं वरू॑थं त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ मम॑ ज्योक्च॒ सूर्यं॑ दृ॒शे
verses.transliteration: ā́paḥ pr̥ṇītá bheṣajáṃ  várūthaṃ tanvè máma  jyók ca sū́ryaṃ dr̥śé

translation.text: O Waters, teem with medicine to keep my body safe from harm, So that I long may see the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दमा॑पः॒ प्र व॑हत॒ यत्किं च॑ दुरि॒तं मयि॑ यद्वा॒हम॑भिदु॒द्रोह॒ यद्वा॑ शे॒प उ॒तानृ॑तम्
verses.transliteration: idám āpaḥ prá vahata  yát kíṃ ca duritám máyi  yád vāhám abhidudróha  yád vā śepá utā́nr̥tam

translation.text: Whatever sin is found in me, whatever evil I have wrought, If I have lied or falsely sworn, Waters, remove it far from me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपो॑ अ॒द्यान्व॑चारिषं॒ रसे॑न॒ सम॑गस्महि पय॑स्वानग्न॒ आ ग॑हि॒ तं मा॒ सं सृ॑ज॒ वर्च॑सा
verses.transliteration: ā́po adyā́nv acāriṣaṃ  rásena sám agasmahi  páyasvān agna ā́ gahi  tám mā sáṃ sr̥ja várcasā

translation.text: The Waters I this day have sought, and to their moisture have we come: O Agni, rich in milk, come thou, and with thy splendour cover me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ चि॒त्सखा॑यं स॒ख्या व॑वृत्यां ति॒रः पु॒रू चि॑दर्ण॒वं ज॑ग॒न्वान् पि॒तुर्नपा॑त॒मा द॑धीत वे॒धा अधि॒ क्षमि॑ प्रत॒रं दीध्या॑नः
verses.transliteration: ó cit sákhāyaṃ sakhyā́ vavr̥tyāṃ  tiráḥ purū́ cid arṇaváṃ jaganvā́n  pitúr nápātam ā́ dadhīta vedhā́ḥ-  ádhi kṣámi prataráṃ dī́dhyānaḥ

translation.text: FAIN would I win my friend to kindly friendship. So may the Sage, come through the air's wide ocean, Remembering the earth and days to follow, obtain a son, the issue of his father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ते॒ सखा॑ स॒ख्यं व॑ष्ट्ये॒तत्सल॑क्ष्मा॒ यद्विषु॑रूपा॒ भवा॑ति म॒हस्पु॒त्रासो॒ असु॑रस्य वी॒रा दि॒वो ध॒र्तार॑ उर्वि॒या परि॑ ख्यन्
verses.transliteration: ná te sákhā sakhyáṃ vaṣṭy etát  sálakṣmā yád víṣurūpā bhávāti  mahás putrā́so ásurasya vīrā́ḥ-  divó dhartā́ra urviyā́ pári khyan

translation.text: Thy friend loves not the friendship which considers her who is near in kindred as stranger. Sons of the mighty Asura, the Heroes, supporters of the heavens, see far around them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒शन्ति॑ घा॒ ते अ॒मृता॑स ए॒तदेक॑स्य चित्त्य॒जसं॒ मर्त्य॑स्य नि ते॒ मनो॒ मन॑सि धाय्य॒स्मे जन्युः॒ पति॑स्त॒न्व१॒॑मा वि॑विश्याः
verses.transliteration: uśánti ghā té amŕ̥tāsa etád  ékasya cit tyajásam mártyasya  ní te máno mánasi dhāyy asmé  jányuḥ pátis tanvàm ā́ viviśyāḥ

translation.text: Yea, this the Immortals seek of thee with longing, progeny of the sole existing mortal. Then let thy soul and mine be knit together, and as a loving husband take thy consort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यत्पु॒रा च॑कृ॒मा कद्ध॑ नू॒नमृ॒ता वद॑न्तो॒ अनृ॑तं रपेम ग॒न्ध॒र्वो अ॒प्स्वप्या॑ च॒ योषा॒ सा नो॒ नाभिः॑ पर॒मं जा॒मि तन्नौ॑
verses.transliteration: ná yát purā́ cakr̥mā́ kád dha nūnám  r̥tā́ vádanto ánr̥taṃ rapema  gandharvó apsv ápyā ca yóṣā  sā́ no nā́bhiḥ paramáṃ jāmí tán nau

translation.text: Shall we do now what we ne'er did aforetime? we who spake righteously now talk impurely? Gandharva in the floods, the Dame of Waters-such is our bond, such our most lofty kinship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गर्भे॒ नु नौ॑ जनि॒ता दम्प॑ती कर्दे॒वस्त्वष्टा॑ सवि॒ता वि॒श्वरू॑पः नकि॑रस्य॒ प्र मि॑नन्ति व्र॒तानि॒ वेद॑ नाव॒स्य पृ॑थि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: gárbhe nú nau janitā́ dámpatī kar  devás tváṣṭā savitā́ viśvárūpaḥ  nákir asya prá minanti vratā́ni  véda nāv asyá pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Even in the womb God Tvashṭar, Vivifier, shaping all forms, Creator, made us consorts. None violates his holy ordinances: that we are his the heavens and earth acknowledge.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को अ॒स्य वे॑द प्रथ॒मस्याह्नः॒ क ईं॑ ददर्श॒ क इ॒ह प्र वो॑चत् बृ॒हन्मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धाम॒ कदु॑ ब्रव आहनो॒ वीच्या॒ नॄन्
verses.transliteration: kó asyá veda prathamásyā́hnaḥ  ká īṃ dadarśa ká ihá prá vocat  br̥hán mitrásya váruṇasya dhā́ma  kád u brava āhano vī́cyā nr̥̄́n

translation.text: Who knows that earliest day whereof thou speakest? Who hath beheld it? Who can here declare it? Great is the Law of Varuṇa and Mitra. What, wanton! wilt thou say to men to tempt them?

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒मस्य॑ मा य॒म्यं१॒॑ काम॒ आग॑न्त्समा॒ने योनौ॑ सह॒शेय्या॑य जा॒येव॒ पत्ये॑ त॒न्वं॑ रिरिच्यां॒ वि चि॑द्वृहेव॒ रथ्ये॑व च॒क्रा
verses.transliteration: yamásya mā yamyàṃ kā́ma ā́gan  samāné yónau sahaśéyyāya  jāyéva pátye tanvàṃ riricyāṃ  ví cid vr̥heva ráthyeva cakrā́

translation.text: I, Yamî, am possessed by love of Yama, that I may rest on the same couch beside him. I as a wife would yield me to my husband. Like car-wheels let us speed to meet each other.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ति॑ष्ठन्ति॒ न नि मि॑षन्त्ये॒ते दे॒वानां॒ स्पश॑ इ॒ह ये चर॑न्ति अ॒न्येन॒ मदा॑हनो याहि॒ तूयं॒ तेन॒ वि वृ॑ह॒ रथ्ये॑व च॒क्रा
verses.transliteration: ná tiṣṭhanti ná ní miṣanty eté  devā́nāṃ spáśa ihá yé cáranti  anyéna mád āhano yāhi tū́yaṃ  téna ví vr̥ha ráthyeva cakrā́

translation.text: They stand not still, they never close their eyelids, those sentinels of Gods who wander round us. Not me-go quickly, wanton, with another, and hasten like a chariot wheel to meet him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रात्री॑भिरस्मा॒ अह॑भिर्दशस्ये॒त्सूर्य॑स्य॒ चक्षु॒र्मुहु॒रुन्मि॑मीयात् दि॒वा पृ॑थि॒व्या मि॑थु॒ना सब॑न्धू य॒मीर्य॒मस्य॑ बिभृया॒दजा॑मि
verses.transliteration: rā́trībhir asmā áhabhir daśasyet  sū́ryasya cákṣur múhur ún mimīyāt  divā́ pr̥thivyā́ mithunā́ sábandhū  yamī́r yamásya bibhr̥yād ájāmi

translation.text: May Sûrya's eye with days and nights endow him, and ever may his light spread out before him. In heaven and earth the kindred Pair commingle. On Yam! be the unbrotherly act of Yama.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ घा॒ ता ग॑च्छा॒नुत्त॑रा यु॒गानि॒ यत्र॑ जा॒मयः॑ कृ॒णव॒न्नजा॑मि उप॑ बर्बृहि वृष॒भाय॑ बा॒हुम॒न्यमि॑च्छस्व सुभगे॒ पतिं॒ मत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ ghā tā́ gachān úttarā yugā́ni  yátra jāmáyaḥ kr̥ṇávann ájāmi  úpa barbr̥hi vr̥ṣabhā́ya bāhúm  anyám ichasva subhage pátim mát

translation.text: Sure there will come succeeding times when brothers and sisters will do acts unmeet for kinsfolk. Not me, O fair one,– seek another husband, and make thine arm a pillow for thy consort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं भ्राता॑स॒द्यद॑ना॒थं भवा॑ति॒ किमु॒ स्वसा॒ यन्निर्ऋ॑तिर्नि॒गच्छा॑त् काम॑मूता ब॒ह्वे॒३॒॑तद्र॑पामि त॒न्वा॑ मे त॒न्वं१॒॑ सं पि॑पृग्धि
verses.transliteration: kím bhrā́tāsad yád anāthám bhávāti  kím u svásā yán nírr̥tir nigáchāt  kā́mamūtā bahv ètád rapāmi  tanvā̀ me tanvàṃ sám pipr̥gdhi

translation.text: Is he a brother when no lord is left her? Is she a sister when Destruction cometh? Forced by my love these many words I utter. Come near, and hold me in thy close embraces.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वा उ॑ ते त॒न्वा॑ त॒न्वं१॒॑ सं प॑पृच्यां पा॒पमा॑हु॒र्यः स्वसा॑रं नि॒गच्छा॑त् अ॒न्येन॒ मत्प्र॒मुदः॑ कल्पयस्व॒ न ते॒ भ्राता॑ सुभगे वष्ट्ये॒तत्
verses.transliteration: ná vā́ u te tanvā̀ tanvàṃ sám papr̥cyām  pāpám āhur yáḥ svásāraṃ nigáchāt  anyéna mát pramúdaḥ kalpayasva  ná te bhrā́tā subhage vaṣṭy etát

translation.text: I will not fold mine arms about thy body: they call it sin when one comes near his sister. Not me,– prepare thy pleasures with another: thy brother seeks not this from thee, O fair one.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब॒तो ब॑तासि यम॒ नैव ते॒ मनो॒ हृद॑यं चाविदाम अ॒न्या किल॒ त्वां क॒क्ष्ये॑व यु॒क्तं परि॑ ष्वजाते॒ लिबु॑जेव वृ॒क्षम्
verses.transliteration: bató batāsi yama  naívá te máno hŕ̥dayaṃ cāvidāma  anyā́ kíla tvā́ṃ kakṣyèva yuktám  pári ṣvajāte líbujeva vr̥kṣám

translation.text: Alas! thou art indeed a weakling, Yama we find in thee no trace of heart or spirit. As round the tree the woodbine clings, another will cling albout thee girt as with a girdle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्यमू॒ षु त्वं य॑म्य॒न्य उ॒ त्वां परि॑ ष्वजाते॒ लिबु॑जेव वृ॒क्षम् तस्य॑ वा॒ त्वं मन॑ इ॒च्छा स वा॒ तवाधा॑ कृणुष्व सं॒विदं॒ सुभ॑द्राम्
verses.transliteration: anyám ū ṣú tváṃ yamy anyá u tvā́m  pári ṣvajāte líbujeva vr̥kṣám  tásya vā tvám mána ichā́ sá vā táva-  -ádhā kr̥ṇuṣva saṃvídaṃ súbhadrām

translation.text: Embrace another, Yamî; let another, even as the woodbine rings the tree, enfold thee. Win thou his heart and let him win thy fancy, and he shall form with thee a blest alliance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॒ वृष्णे॑ दुदुहे॒ दोह॑सा दि॒वः पयां॑सि य॒ह्वो अदि॑ते॒रदा॑भ्यः विश्वं॒ स वे॑द॒ वरु॑णो॒ यथा॑ धि॒या स य॒ज्ञियो॑ यजतु य॒ज्ञियाँ॑ ऋ॒तून्
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā vŕ̥ṣṇe duduhe dóhasā diváḥ  páyāṃsi yahvó áditer ádābhyaḥ  víśvaṃ sá veda váruṇo yáthā dhiyā́  sá yajñíyo yajatu yajñíyām̐ r̥tū́n

translation.text: THE Bull hath yielded for the Bull the milk of heaven: the Son of Aditi can never be deceived. According to his wisdom Varuṇa knoweth all: may he, the Holy, hallow times for sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रप॑द्गन्ध॒र्वीरप्या॑ च॒ योष॑णा न॒दस्य॑ ना॒दे परि॑ पातु मे॒ मनः॑ इ॒ष्टस्य॒ मध्ये॒ अदि॑ति॒र्नि धा॑तु नो॒ भ्राता॑ नो ज्ये॒ष्ठः प्र॑थ॒मो वि वो॑चति
verses.transliteration: rápad gandharvī́r ápyā ca yóṣaṇā  nadásya nādé pári pātu me mánaḥ  iṣṭásya mádhye áditir ní dhātu no  bhrā́tā no jyeṣṭháḥ prathamó ví vocati

translation.text: Gandharvi spake: may she, the Lady of the flood, amid the river's roaring leave my heart untouched. May Aditi accomplish all that we desire, and may our eldest Brother tell us this as Chief.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो चि॒न्नु भ॒द्रा क्षु॒मती॒ यश॑स्वत्यु॒षा उ॑वास॒ मन॑वे॒ स्व॑र्वती यदी॑मु॒शन्त॑मुश॒तामनु॒ क्रतु॑म॒ग्निं होता॑रं वि॒दथा॑य॒ जीज॑नन्
verses.transliteration: só cin nú bhadrā́ kṣumátī yáśasvatī-  uṣā́ uvāsa mánave svàrvatī  yád īm uśántam uśatā́m ánu krátum  agníṃ hótāraṃ vidáthāya jī́janan

translation.text: Yea, even this blessed Morning, rich in store of food, splendid, with heavenly lustre, hath shone out for man, Since they, as was the wish of yearning Gods, brought forth that yearning Agni for the assembly as the Priest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ त्यं द्र॒प्सं वि॒भ्वं॑ विचक्ष॒णं विराभ॑रदिषि॒तः श्ये॒नो अ॑ध्व॒रे यदी॒ विशो॑ वृ॒णते॑ द॒स्ममार्या॑ अ॒ग्निं होता॑र॒मध॒ धीर॑जायत
verses.transliteration: ádha tyáṃ drapsáṃ vibhvàṃ vicakṣaṇáṃ  vír ā́bharad iṣitáḥ śyenó adhvaré  yádī víśo vr̥ṇáte dasmám ā́ryāḥ-  agníṃ hótāram ádha dhī́r ajāyata

translation.text: And the fleet Falcon brought for sacrifice from afar this flowing Drop most excellent and keen of sight, Then when the Aryan tribes chose as Invoking Priest Agni the Wonder-Worker, and the hymn rose up.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सदा॑सि र॒ण्वो यव॑सेव॒ पुष्य॑ते॒ होत्रा॑भिरग्ने॒ मनु॑षः स्वध्व॒रः विप्र॑स्य वा॒ यच्छ॑शमा॒न उ॒क्थ्यं१॒॑ वाजं॑ सस॒वाँ उ॑प॒यासि॒ भूरि॑भिः
verses.transliteration: sádāsi raṇvó yávaseva púṣyate  hótrābhir agne mánuṣaḥ svadhvaráḥ  víprasya vā yác chaśamāná ukthyàṃ  vā́jaṃ sasavā́m̐ upayā́si bhū́ribhiḥ

translation.text: Still art thou kind to him who feeds thee as with grass, and, skilled in sacrifice, offers thee holy gifts. When thou, having received the sage's strengthening food with lauds, after long toil, cornest with many more.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदी॑रय पि॒तरा॑ जा॒र आ भग॒मिय॑क्षति हर्य॒तो हृ॒त्त इ॑ष्यति विव॑क्ति॒ वह्निः॑ स्वप॒स्यते॑ म॒खस्त॑वि॒ष्यते॒ असु॑रो॒ वेप॑ते म॒ती
verses.transliteration: úd īraya pitárā jārá ā́ bhágam  íyakṣati haryató hr̥ttá iṣyati  vívakti váhniḥ svapasyáte makhás  taviṣyáte ásuro vépate matī́

translation.text: Urge thou thy Parents, as a lover ' to delight: the Lovely One desires and craves it from his heart. The priest calls out, the sacrificer shows his skill, the Asura tries his strength, and with the hymn is stirred.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॑ अग्ने सुम॒तिं मर्तो॒ अक्ष॒त्सह॑सः सूनो॒ अति॒ स प्र शृ॑ण्वे इषं॒ दधा॑नो॒ वह॑मानो॒ अश्वै॒रा स द्यु॒माँ अम॑वान्भूषति॒ द्यून्
verses.transliteration: yás te agne sumatím márto ákṣat  sáhasaḥ sūno áti sá prá śr̥ṇve  íṣaṃ dádhāno váhamāno áśvair  ā́ sá dyumā́m̐ ámavān bhūṣati dyū́n

translation.text: Far-famed is he, the mortal man, O Agni, thou Son of Strength, who hath obtained thy favour. He, gathering power, borne onward by his horses, makes his days lovely in his might and splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॑ग्न ए॒षा समि॑ति॒र्भवा॑ति दे॒वी दे॒वेषु॑ यज॒ता य॑जत्र रत्ना॑ च॒ यद्वि॒भजा॑सि स्वधावो भा॒गं नो॒ अत्र॒ वसु॑मन्तं वीतात्
verses.transliteration: yád agna eṣā́ sámitir bhávāti  devī́ devéṣu yajatā́ yajatra  rátnā ca yád vibhájāsi svadhāvo  bhāgáṃ no átra vásumantaṃ vītāt

translation.text: When, Holy Agni, the divine assembly, the sacred synod mid the Gods, is gathered, And when thou, Godlike One, dealest forth treasures, vouchsafe us, too, our portion of the riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒धी नो॑ अग्ने॒ सद॑ने स॒धस्थे॑ यु॒क्ष्वा रथ॑म॒मृत॑स्य द्रवि॒त्नुम् आ नो॑ वह॒ रोद॑सी दे॒वपु॑त्रे॒ माकि॑र्दे॒वाना॒मप॑ भूरि॒ह स्याः॑
verses.transliteration: śrudhī́ no agne sádane sadhásthe  yukṣvā́ rátham amŕ̥tasya dravitnúm  ā́ no vaha ródasī deváputre  mā́kir devā́nām ápa bhūr ihá syāḥ

translation.text: Hear us, O Agni, in your common dwelling: harness thy rapid car of Amrit. Bring Heaven and Earth, the Deities' Parents, hither: stay with us here, nor from the Gods be distant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यावा॑ ह॒ क्षामा॑ प्रथ॒मे ऋ॒तेना॑भिश्रा॒वे भ॑वतः सत्य॒वाचा॑ दे॒वो यन्मर्ता॑न्य॒जथा॑य कृ॒ण्वन्त्सीद॒द्धोता॑ प्र॒त्यङ्स्वमसुं॒ यन्
verses.transliteration: dyā́vā ha kṣā́mā prathamé r̥téna-  -abhiśrāvé bhavataḥ satyavā́cā  devó yán mártān yajáthāya kr̥ṇván  sī́dad dhótā pratyáṅ svám ásuṃ yán

translation.text: HEAVEN and Earth, first by everlasting Order, speakers of truth, are near enough to hear us, When the God, urging men to worship. sitteth as Priest, assuming all his vital vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वो दे॒वान्प॑रि॒भूर्ऋ॒तेन॒ वहा॑ नो ह॒व्यं प्र॑थ॒मश्चि॑कि॒त्वान् धू॒मके॑तुः स॒मिधा॒ भाऋ॑जीको म॒न्द्रो होता॒ नित्यो॑ वा॒चा यजी॑यान्
verses.transliteration: devó devā́n paribhū́r r̥téna  váhā no havyám prathamáś cikitvā́n  dhūmáketuḥ samídhā bhā́r̥jīko  mandró hótā nítyo vācā́ yájīyān

translation.text: As God comprising Gods by Law Eternal, bear, as the Chief who knoweth, our oblation, Smoke-bannered with the fuel, radiant, joyous, better to praise and worship, Priest for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वावृ॑ग्दे॒वस्या॒मृतं॒ यदी॒ गोरतो॑ जा॒तासो॑ धारयन्त उ॒र्वी विश्वे॑ दे॒वा अनु॒ तत्ते॒ यजु॑र्गुर्दु॒हे यदेनी॑ दि॒व्यं घृ॒तं वाः
verses.transliteration: svā́vr̥g devásyāmŕ̥taṃ yádī gór  áto jātā́so dhārayanta urvī́  víśve devā́ ánu tát te yájur gur  duhé yád énī divyáṃ ghr̥táṃ vā́ḥ

translation.text: When the cow's nectar wins the God completely, men here below are heaven's sustainers. All the Gods came to this thy heavenly Yajus which from the motley Pair milked oil and water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्चा॑मि वां॒ वर्धा॒यापो॑ घृतस्नू॒ द्यावा॑भूमी शृणु॒तं रो॑दसी मे अहा॒ यद्द्यावोऽसु॑नीति॒मय॒न्मध्वा॑ नो॒ अत्र॑ पि॒तरा॑ शिशीताम्
verses.transliteration: árcāmi vāṃ várdhāyā́po ghr̥tasnū  dyā́vābhūmī śr̥ṇutáṃ rodasī me  áhā yád dyā́vó 'sunītim áyan  mádhvā no átra pitárā śiśītām

translation.text: I praise your work that ye may make me prosper: hear, Heaven and Earth, Twain Worlds that drop with fatness. While days and nights go to the world of spirits, here let the Parents with sweet meath refresh us

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं स्वि॑न्नो॒ राजा॑ जगृहे॒ कद॒स्याति॑ व्र॒तं च॑कृमा॒ को वि वे॑द मि॒त्रश्चि॒द्धि ष्मा॑ जुहुरा॒णो दे॒वाञ्छ्लोको॒ न या॒तामपि॒ वाजो॒ अस्ति॑
verses.transliteration: kíṃ svin no rā́jā jagr̥he kád asya-  -áti vratáṃ cakr̥mā kó ví veda  mitráś cid dhí ṣmā juhurāṇó devā́ñ  -ślóko ná yātā́m ápi vā́jo ásti

translation.text: Hath the King siezed us? How have we offended against his holy ordinance? Who knoweth? For even Mitra mid the Gods is angry there are both song and strength for those who come not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दु॒र्मन्त्वत्रा॒मृत॑स्य॒ नाम॒ सल॑क्ष्मा॒ यद्विषु॑रूपा॒ भवा॑ति य॒मस्य॒ यो म॒नव॑ते सु॒मन्त्वग्ने॒ तमृ॑ष्व पा॒ह्यप्र॑युच्छन्
verses.transliteration: durmántv átrāmŕ̥tasya nā́ma  sálakṣmā yád víṣurūpā bhávāti  yamásya yó manávate sumántu-  ágne tám r̥ṣva pāhy áprayuchan

translation.text: 'Tis hard to understand the Immortal's nature, where she who is akin becomes astranger. Guard ceaselessly, great Agni, him who ponders Yama's name, easy to be comprehended.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मि॑न्दे॒वा वि॒दथे॑ मा॒दय॑न्ते वि॒वस्व॑तः॒ सद॑ने धा॒रय॑न्ते सूर्ये॒ ज्योति॒रद॑धुर्मा॒स्य१॒॑क्तून्परि॑ द्योत॒निं च॑रतो॒ अज॑स्रा
verses.transliteration: yásmin devā́ vidáthe mādáyante  vivásvataḥ sádane dhāráyante  sū́rye jyótir ádadhur māsy àktū́n  pári dyotaníṃ carato ájasrā

translation.text: They in the synod where the Gods rejoice them, where they are seated in Vivasvan's dwelling, Have given the Moon his beams, the Sun his splendour-the Two unweariedly maintain their brightness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मि॑न्दे॒वा मन्म॑नि सं॒चर॑न्त्यपी॒च्ये॒३॒॑ न व॒यम॑स्य विद्म मि॒त्रो नो॒ अत्रादि॑ति॒रना॑गान्त्सवि॒ता दे॒वो वरु॑णाय वोचत्
verses.transliteration: yásmin devā́ mánmani saṃcáranti-  apīcyè ná vayám asya vidma  mitró no átrā́ditir ánāgān  savitā́ devó váruṇāya vocat

translation.text: The counsel which the Gods meet to consider, their secret plan,– of that we have no knowledge. There let God Savitar, Aditi, and Mitra proclaim to Varuṇa that we are sinless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒धी नो॑ अग्ने॒ सद॑ने स॒धस्थे॑ यु॒क्ष्वा रथ॑म॒मृत॑स्य द्रवि॒त्नुम् आ नो॑ वह॒ रोद॑सी दे॒वपु॑त्रे॒ माकि॑र्दे॒वाना॒मप॑ भूरि॒ह स्याः॑
verses.transliteration: śrudhī́ no agne sádane sadhásthe  yukṣvā́ rátham amŕ̥tasya dravitnúm  ā́ no vaha ródasī deváputre  mā́kir devā́nām ápa bhūr ihá syāḥ

translation.text: Hear us, O Agni, in your comninn dwell ing: harness thy rapid car, the car of Amrit. Bring Heaven and Earth, the Deities' Parents, hither: stay with us here, nor from the Gods be distant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒जे वां॒ ब्रह्म॑ पू॒र्व्यं नमो॑भि॒र्वि श्लोक॑ एतु प॒थ्ये॑व सू॒रेः शृ॒ण्वन्तु॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒मृत॑स्य पु॒त्रा आ ये धामा॑नि दि॒व्यानि॑ त॒स्थुः
verses.transliteration: yujé vām bráhma pūrvyáṃ námobhir  ví ślóka etu pathyèva sūréḥ  śr̥ṇvántu víśve amŕ̥tasya putrā́ḥ-  ā́ yé dhā́māni divyā́ni tasthúḥ

translation.text: I YOKE with prayer your ancient inspiration: may the laud rise as on the prince's pathway. All Sons of Immortality shall hear it, all the possessors of celestial natures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒मे इ॑व॒ यत॑माने॒ यदैतं॒ प्र वां॑ भर॒न्मानु॑षा देव॒यन्तः॑ आ सी॑दतं॒ स्वमु॑ लो॒कं विदा॑ने स्वास॒स्थे भ॑वत॒मिन्द॑वे नः
verses.transliteration: yamé iva yátamāne yád aítam  prá vām bharan mā́nuṣā devayántaḥ  ā́ sīdataṃ svám ulokáṃ vídāne  svāsasthé bhavatam índave naḥ

translation.text: When speeding ye came nigh us like twin sisters, religious-hearted votaries brought you forward. Take your place, ye who know your proper station: be near, be very near unto our Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पञ्च॑ प॒दानि॑ रु॒पो अन्व॑रोहं॒ चतु॑ष्पदी॒मन्वे॑मि व्र॒तेन॑ अ॒क्षरे॑ण॒ प्रति॑ मिम ए॒तामृ॒तस्य॒ नाभा॒वधि॒ सं पु॑नामि
verses.transliteration: páñca padā́ni rupó ánv arohaṃ  cátuṣpadīm ánv emi vraténa  akṣáreṇa práti mima etā́m  r̥tásya nā́bhāv ádhi sám punāmi

translation.text: Five paces have I risen from Earth. I follow her who hath four feet with devout observance. This by the Sacred Syllable have I measured: I purify in the central place of Order,

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वेभ्यः॒ कम॑वृणीत मृ॒त्युं प्र॒जायै॒ कम॒मृतं॒ नावृ॑णीत बृह॒स्पतिं॑ य॒ज्ञम॑कृण्वत॒ ऋषिं॑ प्रि॒यां य॒मस्त॒न्वं१॒॑ प्रारि॑रेचीत्
verses.transliteration: devébhyaḥ kám avr̥ṇīta mr̥tyúm  prajā́yai kám amŕ̥taṃ nā́vr̥ṇīta  bŕ̥haspátiṃ yajñám akr̥ṇvata ŕ̥ṣim  priyā́ṃ yamás tanvàm prā́rirecīt

translation.text: He, for God's sake, chose death to be his portion. He chose not, for men's good, a life eternal They sacrificed Br̥ihaspati the R̥ishi. Yama delivered up his own dear body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त क्ष॑रन्ति॒ शिश॑वे म॒रुत्व॑ते पि॒त्रे पु॒त्रासो॒ अप्य॑वीवतन्नृ॒तम् उ॒भे इद॑स्यो॒भय॑स्य राजत उ॒भे य॑तेते उ॒भय॑स्य पुष्यतः
verses.transliteration: saptá kṣaranti śíśave marútvate  pitré putrā́so ápy avīvatann r̥tám  ubhé íd asyobháyasya rājataḥ-  ubhé yatete ubháyasya puṣyataḥ

translation.text: The Seven flow to the Youth on whom the Maruts wait: the Sons unto the Father brought the sacrifice. Both these are his, as his they are the Lords of both: both toil; belonging unto both they prosper well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रे॒यि॒वांसं॑ प्र॒वतो॑ म॒हीरनु॑ ब॒हुभ्यः॒ पन्था॑मनुपस्पशा॒नम् वै॒व॒स्व॒तं सं॒गम॑नं॒ जना॑नां य॒मं राजा॑नं ह॒विषा॑ दुवस्य
verses.transliteration: pareyivā́ṃsam praváto mahī́r ánu  bahúbhyaḥ pánthām anupaspaśānám  vaivasvatáṃ saṃgámanaṃ jánānāṃ  yamáṃ rā́jānaṃ havíṣā duvasya

translation.text: HONOUR the King with thine oblations, Yama, Vivasvan's Son, who gathers men together, Who travelled to the lofty heights above us, who searcbes out and shows the path to many.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒मो नो॑ गा॒तुं प्र॑थ॒मो वि॑वेद॒ नैषा गव्यू॑ति॒रप॑भर्त॒वा उ॑ यत्रा॑ नः॒ पूर्वे॑ पि॒तरः॑ परे॒युरे॒ना ज॑ज्ञा॒नाः प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ अनु॒ स्वाः
verses.transliteration: yamó no gātúm prathamó viveda  naíṣā́ gávyūtir ápabhartavā́ u  yátrā naḥ pū́rve pitáraḥ pareyúr  enā́ jajñānā́ḥ pathyā̀ ánu svā́ḥ

translation.text: Yama first found for us a place to dwell in: this pasture never can be taken from Us. Men born on earth tread their own paths that lead them whither our ancient Fathers have departed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मात॑ली क॒व्यैर्य॒मो अङ्गि॑रोभि॒र्बृह॒स्पति॒र्ऋक्व॑भिर्वावृधा॒नः याँश्च॑ दे॒वा वा॑वृ॒धुर्ये च॑ दे॒वान्त्स्वाहा॒न्ये स्व॒धया॒न्ये म॑दन्ति
verses.transliteration: mā́talī kavyaír yamó áṅgirobhir  bŕ̥haspátir ŕ̥kvabhir vāvr̥dhānáḥ  yā́ṃś ca devā́ vāvr̥dhúr yé ca devā́n  svā́hānyé svadháyānyé madanti

translation.text: Mitali prospers there with Kâvyas, Yama with Angiras' sons, Br̥ihaspati with Rkvans: Exalters of the Gods, by Gods exalted, some joy in praise and some in our oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं य॑म प्रस्त॒रमा हि सीदाङ्गि॑रोभिः पि॒तृभिः॑ संविदा॒नः आ त्वा॒ मन्त्राः॑ कविश॒स्ता व॑हन्त्वे॒ना रा॑जन्ह॒विषा॑ मादयस्व
verses.transliteration: imáṃ yama prastarám ā́ hí sī́da-  -áṅgirobhiḥ pitŕ̥bhiḥ saṃvidānáḥ  ā́ tvā mántrāḥ kaviśastā́ vahantu-  enā́ rājan havíṣā mādayasva

translation.text: Come, seat thee on this bed of grass, O Yama, in company with Angirases and Fathers. Let texts recited by the sages bring thee O King, let this oblation make thee joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अङ्गि॑रोभि॒रा ग॑हि य॒ज्ञिये॑भि॒र्यम॑ वैरू॒पैरि॒ह मा॑दयस्व विव॑स्वन्तं हुवे॒ यः पि॒ता ते॒ऽस्मिन्य॒ज्ञे ब॒र्हिष्या नि॒षद्य॑
verses.transliteration: áṅgirobhir ā́ gahi yajñíyebhir  yáma vairūpaír ihá mādayasva  vívasvantaṃ huve yáḥ pitā́ te  -asmín yajñé barhíṣy ā́ niṣádya

translation.text: Come, Yama, with the Angirases the Holy, rejoice thee here with children of Virûpa. To sit on sacred grass at this our worship, I call Vivasvan, too, thy Father hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अङ्गि॑रसो नः पि॒तरो॒ नव॑ग्वा॒ अथ॑र्वाणो॒ भृग॑वः सो॒म्यासः॑ तेषां॑ व॒यं सु॑म॒तौ य॒ज्ञिया॑ना॒मपि॑ भ॒द्रे सौ॑मन॒से स्या॑म
verses.transliteration: áṅgiraso naḥ pitáro návagvāḥ-  átharvāṇo bhŕ̥gavaḥ somyā́saḥ  téṣāṃ vayáṃ sumataú yajñíyānām  -ápi bhadré saumanasé syāma

translation.text: Our Fathers are Angirases, Navagvas, Atharvans, Bhr̥igus who deserve the Soma. May these, the Holy, look on us with favour, may we enjoy their gracious loving-kindness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेहि॒ प्रेहि॑ प॒थिभिः॑ पू॒र्व्येभि॒र्यत्रा॑ नः॒ पूर्वे॑ पि॒तरः॑ परे॒युः उ॒भा राजा॑ना स्व॒धया॒ मद॑न्ता य॒मं प॑श्यासि॒ वरु॑णं च दे॒वम्
verses.transliteration: préhi préhi pathíbhiḥ pūrvyébhir  yátrā naḥ pū́rve pitáraḥ pareyúr  ubhā́ rā́jānā svadháyā mádantā  yamám paśyāsi váruṇaṃ ca devám

translation.text: Go forth, go forth upon the ancient pathways whereon our sires of old have gone before us. 'Mere shalt thou look on both the Kings enjoying their sacred food, God Varuṇa and Yama.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं ग॑च्छस्व पि॒तृभिः॒ सं य॒मेने॑ष्टापू॒र्तेन॑ पर॒मे व्यो॑मन् हि॒त्वाया॑व॒द्यं पुन॒रस्त॒मेहि॒ सं ग॑च्छस्व त॒न्वा॑ सु॒वर्चाः॑
verses.transliteration: sáṃ gachasva pitŕ̥bhiḥ sáṃ yaména-  -iṣṭāpūrténa paramé vyòman  hitvā́yāvadyám púnar ástam éhi  sáṃ gachasva tanvā̀ suvárcāḥ

translation.text: Meet Yama, meet the Fathers, meet the merit of free or ordered acts, in highest heaven. Leave sin and evil, seek anew thy dwelling, and bright with glory wear another body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपे॑त॒ वी॑त॒ वि च॑ सर्प॒तातो॒ऽस्मा ए॒तं पि॒तरो॑ लो॒कम॑क्रन् अहो॑भिर॒द्भिर॒क्तुभि॒र्व्य॑क्तं य॒मो द॑दात्यव॒सान॑मस्मै
verses.transliteration: ápeta vī̀ta ví ca sarpatā́to  -asmā́ etám pitáro lokám akran  áhobhir adbhír aktúbhir vyàktaṃ  yamó dadāty avasā́nam asmai

translation.text: Go hence, depart ye, fly in all directions: this place for him the Fathers have provided. Yama bestows on him a place to rest in adorned with days and beams of light and waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अति॑ द्रव सारमे॒यौ श्वानौ॑ चतुर॒क्षौ श॒बलौ॑ सा॒धुना॑ प॒था अथा॑ पि॒तॄन्त्सु॑वि॒दत्राँ॒ उपे॑हि य॒मेन॒ ये स॑ध॒मादं॒ मद॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: áti drava sārameyaú śvā́nau  caturakṣaú śabálau sādhúnā pathā́  áthā pitr̥̄́n suvidátrām̐ úpehi  yaména yé sadhamā́dam mádanti

translation.text: Run and outspeed the two dogs, Saramâ's offspring, brindled, four-eyed, upon thy happy pathway. Draw nigh then to the gracious-minded Fathers where they rejoice in company with Yama.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यौ ते॒ श्वानौ॑ यम रक्षि॒तारौ॑ चतुर॒क्षौ प॑थि॒रक्षी॑ नृ॒चक्ष॑सौ ताभ्या॑मेनं॒ परि॑ देहि राजन्त्स्व॒स्ति चा॑स्मा अनमी॒वं च॑ धेहि
verses.transliteration: yaú te śvā́nau yama rakṣitā́rau  caturakṣaú pathirákṣī nr̥cákṣasau  tā́bhyām enam pári dehi rājan  svastí cāsmā anamīváṃ ca dhehi

translation.text: And those two dogs of thine, Yama, the watchers, four-eyed, who look on men and guard the pathway,– Entrust this man, O King, to their protection, and with prosperity and health endow him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रू॒ण॒साव॑सु॒तृपा॑ उदुम्ब॒लौ य॒मस्य॑ दू॒तौ च॑रतो॒ जनाँ॒ अनु॑ ताव॒स्मभ्यं॑ दृ॒शये॒ सूर्या॑य॒ पुन॑र्दाता॒मसु॑म॒द्येह भ॒द्रम्
verses.transliteration: urūṇasā́v asutŕ̥pā udumbalaú  yamásya dūtaú carato jánām̐ ánu  tā́v asmábhyaṃ dr̥śáye sū́ryāya  púnar dātām ásum adyéhá bhadrám

translation.text: Dark-hued, insatiate, with distended nostrils, Yama's two envoys roam among the People; May they restore to us a fair existence here and to-day, that we may see the sunlight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒माय॒ सोमं॑ सुनुत य॒माय॑ जुहुता ह॒विः य॒मं ह॑ य॒ज्ञो ग॑च्छत्य॒ग्निदू॑तो॒ अरं॑कृतः
verses.transliteration: yamā́ya sómaṃ sunuta  yamā́ya juhutā havíḥ  yamáṃ ha yajñó gachati-  agnídūto áraṃkr̥taḥ

translation.text: To Yama pour the Soma, bring to Yama consecrated gifts: To Yama sacrifice prepared and heralded by Agni goes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒माय॑ घृ॒तव॑द्ध॒विर्जु॒होत॒ प्र च॑ तिष्ठत स नो॑ दे॒वेष्वा य॑मद्दी॒र्घमायुः॒ प्र जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yamā́ya ghr̥távad dhavír  juhóta prá ca tiṣṭhata  sá no devéṣv ā́ yamad  dīrghám ā́yuḥ prá jīváse

translation.text: Offer to Yama holy gifts enriched with butter, and draw near: So may he grant that we may live long days of life among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒माय॒ मधु॑मत्तमं॒ राज्ञे॑ ह॒व्यं जु॑होतन इ॒दं नम॒ ऋषि॑भ्यः पूर्व॒जेभ्यः॒ पूर्वे॑भ्यः पथि॒कृद्भ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: yamā́ya mádhumattamaṃ  rā́jñe havyáṃ juhotana  idáṃ náma ŕ̥ṣibhyaḥ pūrvajébhyaḥ  pū́rvebhyaḥ pathikŕ̥dbhyaḥ

translation.text: Offer to Yama, to the King, oblation very rich in meath: Bow down before the R̥ishis of the ancient times, who made this path in days of old.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिक॑द्रुकेभिः पतति॒ षळु॒र्वीरेक॒मिद्बृ॒हत् त्रि॒ष्टुब्गा॑य॒त्री छन्दां॑सि॒ सर्वा॒ ता य॒म आहि॑ता
verses.transliteration: tríkadrukebhiḥ patati  ṣáḷ urvī́r ékam íd br̥hát  triṣṭúb gāyatrī́ chándāṃsi  sárvā tā́ yamá ā́hitā

translation.text: Into the six Expanses flies the Great One in Trkadrukas. The Gâyatrî, the Trishṭup, all metres in Yama are contained.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदी॑रता॒मव॑र॒ उत्परा॑स॒ उन्म॑ध्य॒माः पि॒तरः॑ सो॒म्यासः॑ असुं॒ य ई॒युर॑वृ॒का ऋ॑त॒ज्ञास्ते नो॑ऽवन्तु पि॒तरो॒ हवे॑षु
verses.transliteration: úd īratām ávara út párāsaḥ-  ún madhyamā́ḥ pitáraḥ somyā́saḥ  ásuṃ yá īyúr avr̥kā́ r̥tajñā́s  té no 'vantu pitáro háveṣu

translation.text: MAY they ascend, the lowest, highest, midmost, the Fathers who deserve a share of Soma- May they who have attained the life of spirits, gentle and righteous, aid us when we call them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं पि॒तृभ्यो॒ नमो॑ अस्त्व॒द्य ये पूर्वा॑सो॒ य उप॑रास ई॒युः ये पार्थि॑वे॒ रज॒स्या निष॑त्ता॒ ये वा॑ नू॒नं सु॑वृ॒जना॑सु वि॒क्षु
verses.transliteration: idám pitŕ̥bhyo námo astv adyá  yé pū́rvāso yá úparāsa īyúḥ  yé pā́rthive rájasy ā́ níṣattāḥ-  yé vā nūnáṃ suvr̥jánāsu vikṣú

translation.text: Now let us pay this homage to the Fathers, to those who passed of old and those who followed, Those who have rested in the earthly region, and those who dwell among the Mighty Races.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आहं पि॒तॄन्त्सु॑वि॒दत्राँ॑ अवित्सि॒ नपा॑तं च वि॒क्रम॑णं च॒ विष्णोः॑ ब॒र्हि॒षदो॒ ये स्व॒धया॑ सु॒तस्य॒ भज॑न्त पि॒त्वस्त इ॒हाग॑मिष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: ā́hám pitr̥̄́n suvidátrām̐ avitsi  nápātaṃ ca vikrámaṇaṃ ca víṣṇoḥ  barhiṣádo yé svadháyā sutásya  bhájanta pitvás tá ihā́gamiṣṭhāḥ

translation.text: I have attained the gracious-minded Fathers, I have gained son and progeny from Vishṇu. They who enjoy pressed juices with oblation seated on sacred grass, come oftenest hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बर्हि॑षदः पितर ऊ॒त्य१॒॑र्वागि॒मा वो॑ ह॒व्या च॑कृमा जु॒षध्व॑म् त आ ग॒ताव॑सा॒ शंत॑मे॒नाथा॑ नः॒ शं योर॑र॒पो द॑धात
verses.transliteration: bárhiṣadaḥ pitara ūty àrvā́g  imā́ vo havyā́ cakr̥mā juṣádhvam  tá ā́ gatā́vasā śáṃtamena-  -áthā naḥ śáṃ yór arapó dadhāta

translation.text: Fathers who sit on sacred grass, come, help us: these offerings have we made for you; accept them. So come to us with most auspicious favour, and give us health and strength without a trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑हूताः पि॒तरः॑ सो॒म्यासो॑ बर्हि॒ष्ये॑षु नि॒धिषु॑ प्रि॒येषु॑ त आ ग॑मन्तु॒ त इ॒ह श्रु॑व॒न्त्वधि॑ ब्रुवन्तु॒ ते॑ऽवन्त्व॒स्मान्
verses.transliteration: úpahūtāḥ pitáraḥ somyā́so  barhiṣyèṣu nidhíṣu priyéṣu  tá ā́ gamantu tá ihá śruvantu  ádhi bruvantu tè 'vantv asmā́n

translation.text: May they, the Fathers, worthy of the Soma, invited to their favourite oblations. Laid on the sacred grass, come nigh and listen: may they be gracious unto us and bless us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आच्या॒ जानु॑ दक्षिण॒तो नि॒षद्ये॒मं य॒ज्ञम॒भि गृ॑णीत॒ विश्वे॑ मा हिं॑सिष्ट पितरः॒ केन॑ चिन्नो॒ यद्व॒ आगः॑ पुरु॒षता॒ करा॑म
verses.transliteration: ā́cyā jā́nu dakṣiṇató niṣádyā-  -imáṃ yajñám abhí gr̥ṇīta víśve  mā́ hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kéna cin no  yád va ā́gaḥ puruṣátā kárāma

translation.text: Bowing your bended knees and seated southward, accept this sacrifice of ours with favour. Punish us not for any sin, O Fathers, which we through human frailty have committed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आसी॑नासो अरु॒णीना॑मु॒पस्थे॑ र॒यिं ध॑त्त दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य पु॒त्रेभ्यः॑ पितर॒स्तस्य॒ वस्वः॒ प्र य॑च्छत॒ त इ॒होर्जं॑ दधात
verses.transliteration: ā́sīnāso aruṇī́nām upásthe  rayíṃ dhatta dāśúṣe mártyāya  putrébhyaḥ pitaras tásya vásvaḥ  prá yachata tá ihórjaṃ dadhāta

translation.text: Lapped in the bosom of the purple Mornings, give riches to the man who brings oblations. Grant to your sons a portion of that treasure, and, present, give them energy, ye Fathers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये नः॒ पूर्वे॑ पि॒तरः॑ सो॒म्यासो॑ऽनूहि॒रे सो॑मपी॒थं वसि॑ष्ठाः तेभि॑र्य॒मः सं॑ररा॒णो ह॒वींष्यु॒शन्नु॒शद्भिः॑ प्रतिका॒मम॑त्तु
verses.transliteration: yé naḥ pū́rve pitáraḥ somyā́so  -anūhiré somapītháṃ vásiṣṭhāḥ  tébhir yamáḥ saṃrarāṇó havī́ṃṣi-  uśánn uśádbhiḥ pratikāmám attu

translation.text: Our ancient Fathers who deserve the Soma, who came, most noble, to our Soma banquet,– With these let Yama, yearning with the yearning, rejoicing eat our offerings at his pleasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ता॑तृ॒षुर्दे॑व॒त्रा जेह॑माना होत्रा॒विदः॒ स्तोम॑तष्टासो अ॒र्कैः आग्ने॑ याहि सुवि॒दत्रे॑भिर॒र्वाङ्स॒त्यैः क॒व्यैः पि॒तृभि॑र्घर्म॒सद्भिः॑
verses.transliteration: yé tātr̥ṣúr devatrā́ jéhamānāḥ-  hotrāvída stómataṣṭāso arkaíḥ  ā́gne yāhi suvidátrebhir arvā́ṅ  satyaíḥ kavyaíḥ pitŕ̥bhir gharmasádbhiḥ

translation.text: Come to us, Agni, with the gracioug Fathers who dwell in glowing light, the very Kâvyas, Who thirsted mid the Gods, who hasten hither, oblation winners, theme of singers' praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये स॒त्यासो॑ हवि॒रदो॑ हवि॒ष्पा इन्द्रे॑ण दे॒वैः स॒रथं॒ दधा॑नाः आग्ने॑ याहि स॒हस्रं॑ देवव॒न्दैः परैः॒ पूर्वैः॑ पि॒तृभि॑र्घर्म॒सद्भिः॑
verses.transliteration: yé satyā́so havirádo haviṣpā́ḥ-  índreṇa devaíḥ saráthaṃ dádhānāḥ  ā́gne yāhi sahásraṃ devavandaíḥ  páraiḥ pū́rvaiḥ pitŕ̥bhir gharmasádbhiḥ

translation.text: Come, Agni, come with countless ancient Fathers, dwellers in light, primeval, God-adorers, Eaters and drinkers of oblations, truthful, who travel with the Deities and Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नि॑ष्वात्ताः पितर॒ एह ग॑च्छत॒ सदः॑सदः सदत सुप्रणीतयः अ॒त्ता ह॒वींषि॒ प्रय॑तानि ब॒र्हिष्यथा॑ र॒यिं सर्व॑वीरं दधातन
verses.transliteration: ágniṣvāttāḥ pitara éhá gachata  sádaḥ-sadaḥ sadata supraṇītayaḥ  attā́ havī́ṃṣi práyatāni barhíṣi-  áthā rayíṃ sárvavīraṃ dadhātana

translation.text: Fathers whom Agni's flames have tasted, come ye nigh: ye kindly leaders, take ye each your proper place. Eat sacrificial food presented on the grass: grant riches with a multitude of hero sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्न ईळि॒तो जा॑तवे॒दोऽवा॑ड्ढ॒व्यानि॑ सुर॒भीणि॑ कृ॒त्वी प्रादाः॑ पि॒तृभ्यः॑ स्व॒धया॒ ते अ॑क्षन्न॒द्धि त्वं दे॑व॒ प्रय॑ता ह॒वींषि॑
verses.transliteration: tvám agna īḷitó jātavedaḥ-  -ávāḍ ḍhavyā́ni surabhī́ṇi kr̥tvī́  prā́dāḥ pitŕ̥bhyaḥ svadháyā té akṣann  addhí tváṃ deva práyatā havī́ṃṣi

translation.text: Thou, Agni Jâtavedas, when entreated, didst bear the offerings which thou madest fragrant, And give them to the Fathers who did cat them with Svadha. Eat, thou God, the gifts we bring thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये चे॒ह पि॒तरो॒ ये च॒ नेह याँश्च॑ वि॒द्म याँ उ॑ च॒ न प्र॑वि॒द्म त्वं वे॑त्थ॒ यति॒ ते जा॑तवेदः स्व॒धाभि॑र्य॒ज्ञं सुकृ॑तं जुषस्व
verses.transliteration: yé cehá pitáro yé ca néhá  yā́ṃś ca vidmá yā́m̐ u ca ná pravidmá  tváṃ vettha yáti té jātavedaḥ  svadhā́bhir yajñáṃ súkr̥taṃ juṣasva

translation.text: Thou, Jâtavedas, knowest well the number of Fathers who are here and who are absent, Of Fathers whom we know and whom we know not: accept the sacrifice wellprepared with portions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये अ॑ग्निद॒ग्धा ये अन॑ग्निदग्धा॒ मध्ये॑ दि॒वः स्व॒धया॑ मा॒दय॑न्ते तेभिः॑ स्व॒राळसु॑नीतिमे॒तां य॑थाव॒शं त॒न्वं॑ कल्पयस्व
verses.transliteration: yé agnidagdhā́ yé ánagnidagdhāḥ-  mádhye diváḥ svadháyā mādáyante  tébhiḥ svarā́ḷ ásunītim etā́ṃ  yathāvaśáṃ tanvàṃ kalpayasva

translation.text: They who, consumed by fire or not cremated, joy in their offering in the midst of heaven,– Grant them, O Sovran Lord, the world of spirits and their own body, as thy pleasure wills it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मैन॑मग्ने॒ वि द॑हो॒ माभि शो॑चो॒ मास्य॒ त्वचं॑ चिक्षिपो॒ मा शरी॑रम् य॒दा शृ॒तं कृ॒णवो॑ जातवे॒दोऽथे॑मेनं॒ प्र हि॑णुतात्पि॒तृभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: maínam agne ví daho mā́bhí śoco  mā́sya tvácaṃ cikṣipo mā́ śárīram  yadā́ śr̥táṃ kr̥ṇávo jātavedaḥ-  -áthem enam prá hiṇutāt pitŕ̥bhyaḥ

translation.text: Burn him not up, nor quite consume him, Agni: let not his body or his skin be scattered. O Jâtavedas, when thou hast matured him, then send him on his way unto the Fathers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शृ॒तं य॒दा कर॑सि जातवे॒दोऽथे॑मेनं॒ परि॑ दत्तात्पि॒तृभ्यः॑ य॒दा गच्छा॒त्यसु॑नीतिमे॒तामथा॑ दे॒वानां॑ वश॒नीर्भ॑वाति
verses.transliteration: śr̥táṃ yadā́ kárasi jātavedaḥ-  -áthem enam pári dattāt pitŕ̥bhyaḥ  yadā́ gáchāty ásunītim etā́m  áthā devā́nāṃ vaśanī́r bhavāti

translation.text: When thou hast made him ready, Jâtavedas, then do thou give him over to the Fathers. When he attains unto the life that waits him, he shall become the Deities' controller.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सूर्यं॒ चक्षु॑र्गच्छतु॒ वात॑मा॒त्मा द्यां च॑ गच्छ पृथि॒वीं च॒ धर्म॑णा अ॒पो वा॑ गच्छ॒ यदि॒ तत्र॑ ते हि॒तमोष॑धीषु॒ प्रति॑ तिष्ठा॒ शरी॑रैः
verses.transliteration: sū́ryaṃ cákṣur gachatu vā́tam ātmā́  dyā́ṃ ca gacha pr̥thivī́ṃ ca dhármaṇā  apó vā gacha yádi tátra te hitám  óṣadhīṣu práti tiṣṭhā śárīraiḥ

translation.text: The Sun receive thine eye, tne Wind thy spirit; go, as thy merit is, to earth or heaven. Go, if it be thy lot, unto the waters; go, make thine home in plants with all thy members.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒जो भा॒गस्तप॑सा॒ तं त॑पस्व॒ तं ते॑ शो॒चिस्त॑पतु॒ तं ते॑ अ॒र्चिः यास्ते॑ शि॒वास्त॒न्वो॑ जातवेद॒स्ताभि॑र्वहैनं सु॒कृता॑मु लो॒कम्
verses.transliteration: ajó bhāgás tápasā táṃ tapasva  táṃ te śocís tapatu táṃ te arcíḥ  yā́s te śivā́s tanvò jātavedas  tā́bhir vahainaṃ sukŕ̥tām ulokám

translation.text: Thy portion is the goat: with heat consume him: let thy fierce flame, thy glowing splendour, burn him With thine auspicious forms, o Jâtavedas, bear this man to the region of the pious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ सृज॒ पुन॑रग्ने पि॒तृभ्यो॒ यस्त॒ आहु॑त॒श्चर॑ति स्व॒धाभिः॑ आयु॒र्वसा॑न॒ उप॑ वेतु॒ शेषः॒ सं ग॑च्छतां त॒न्वा॑ जातवेदः
verses.transliteration: áva sr̥ja púnar agne pitŕ̥bhyo  yás ta ā́hutaś cárati svadhā́bhiḥ  ā́yur vásāna úpa vetu śéṣaḥ  sáṃ gachatāṃ tanvā̀ jātavedaḥ

translation.text: Again, O Agni, to the Fathers send him who, offered in thee, goes with our oblations. Wearing new life let him increase his offspring: let him rejoin a body, Jâtavedas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ कृ॒ष्णः श॑कु॒न आ॑तु॒तोद॑ पिपी॒लः स॒र्प उ॒त वा॒ श्वाप॑दः अ॒ग्निष्टद्वि॒श्वाद॑ग॒दं कृ॑णोतु॒ सोम॑श्च॒ यो ब्रा॑ह्म॒णाँ आ॑वि॒वेश॑
verses.transliteration: yát te kr̥ṣṇáḥ śakuná ātutóda  pipīláḥ sarpá utá vā śvā́padaḥ  agníṣ ṭád viśvā́d agadáṃ kr̥ṇotu  sómaś ca yó brāhmaṇā́m̐ āvivéśa

translation.text: What wound soe'er the dark bird hath inflicted, the emmet, or the serpent, or the jackal, May Agni who devoureth all things heal it and Soma who hath passed into the Brahmans.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्नेर्वर्म॒ परि॒ गोभि॑र्व्ययस्व॒ सं प्रोर्णु॑ष्व॒ पीव॑सा॒ मेद॑सा च नेत्त्वा॑ धृ॒ष्णुर्हर॑सा॒ जर्हृ॑षाणो द॒धृग्वि॑ध॒क्ष्यन्प॑र्य॒ङ्खया॑ते
verses.transliteration: agnér várma pári góbhir vyayasva  sám prórṇuṣva pī́vasā médasā ca  nét tvā dhr̥ṣṇúr hárasā járhr̥ṣāṇo  dadhŕ̥g vidhakṣyán paryaṅkháyāte

translation.text: Shield thee with flesh against the flames of Agni, encompass thee about with fat and marrow, So will the Bold One, eager to attack thee with fierce glow fail to girdle and consume thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मम॑ग्ने चम॒सं मा वि जि॑ह्वरः प्रि॒यो दे॒वाना॑मु॒त सो॒म्याना॑म् ए॒ष यश्च॑म॒सो दे॑व॒पान॒स्तस्मि॑न्दे॒वा अ॒मृता॑ मादयन्ते
verses.transliteration: imám agne camasám mā́ ví jihvaraḥ  priyó devā́nām utá somyā́nām  eṣá yáś camasó devapā́nas  tásmin devā́ amŕ̥tā mādayante

translation.text: Forbear, O Agni, to upset this ladle: the Gods and they who merit Soma love it. This ladle, this which serves the Gods to drink from, in this the Immortal Deities rejoice them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्र॒व्याद॑म॒ग्निं प्र हि॑णोमि दू॒रं य॒मरा॑ज्ञो गच्छतु रिप्रवा॒हः इ॒हैवायमित॑रो जा॒तवे॑दा दे॒वेभ्यो॑ ह॒व्यं व॑हतु प्रजा॒नन्
verses.transliteration: kravyā́dam agním prá hiṇomi dūráṃ  yamárājño gachatu ripravāháḥ  ihaívā́yám ítaro jātávedāḥ-  devébhyo havyáṃ vahatu prajānán

translation.text: I send afar flesh eating Agni, bearing off stains may he depart to Yama's subjects. But let this other Jâtavedas carry oblation to the Gods, for he is skilful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॒ग्निः क्र॒व्यात्प्र॑वि॒वेश॑ वो गृ॒हमि॒मं पश्य॒न्नित॑रं जा॒तवे॑दसम् तं ह॑रामि पितृय॒ज्ञाय॑ दे॒वं स घ॒र्ममि॑न्वात्पर॒मे स॒धस्थे॑
verses.transliteration: yó agníḥ kravyā́t pravivéśa vo gr̥hám  imám páśyann ítaraṃ jātávedasam  táṃ harāmi pitr̥yajñā́ya deváṃ  sá gharmám invāt paramé sadhásthe

translation.text: I choose as God for Father-worship Agni, flesh-eater, who hath past within your dwelling, While looking on this other Jâtavedas. Let him light flames in the supreme assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॒ग्निः क्र॑व्य॒वाह॑नः पि॒तॄन्यक्ष॑दृता॒वृधः॑ प्रेदु॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ वोचति दे॒वेभ्य॑श्च पि॒तृभ्य॒ आ
verses.transliteration: yó agníḥ kravyavā́hanaḥ  pitr̥̄́n yákṣad r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ  préd u havyā́ni vocati  devébhyaś ca pitŕ̥bhya ā́

translation.text: With offerings meet let Agni bring the Fathers who support the Law. Let him announce oblations paid to Fathers and to Deities.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒शन्त॑स्त्वा॒ नि धी॑मह्यु॒शन्तः॒ समि॑धीमहि उ॒शन्नु॑श॒त आ व॑ह पि॒तॄन्ह॒विषे॒ अत्त॑वे
verses.transliteration: uśántas tvā ní dhīmahi-  uśántaḥ sám idhīmahi  uśánn uśatá ā́ vaha  pitr̥̄́n havíṣe áttave

translation.text: Right gladly would we set thee down, right gladly make thee burn and glow. Gladly bring yearning Fathers nigh to cat the food of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्वम॑ग्ने स॒मद॑ह॒स्तमु॒ निर्वा॑पया॒ पुनः॑ कि॒याम्ब्वत्र॑ रोहतु पाकदू॒र्वा व्य॑ल्कशा
verses.transliteration: yáṃ tvám agne samádahas  tám u nír vāpayā púnaḥ  kiyā́mbv átra rohatu  pākadūrvā́ vyàlkaśā

translation.text: Cool, Agni, and again refresh the spot which thou hast scorched and burnt. Here let the water-lily grow, and tender grass and leafy herb.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शीति॑के॒ शीति॑कावति॒ ह्लादि॑के॒ ह्लादि॑कावति म॒ण्डू॒क्या॒३॒॑ सु सं ग॑म इ॒मं स्व१॒॑ग्निं ह॑र्षय
verses.transliteration: śī́tike śī́tikāvati  hlā́dike hlā́dikāvati  maṇḍūkyā̀ sú sáṃ gamaḥ-  imáṃ sv àgníṃ harṣaya

translation.text: O full of coolness, thou cool Plant, full of fresh moisture, freshening Herb, Come hither with the female frog: fill with delight this Agni here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वष्टा॑ दुहि॒त्रे व॑ह॒तुं कृ॑णो॒तीती॒दं विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं॒ समे॑ति य॒मस्य॑ मा॒ता प॑र्यु॒ह्यमा॑ना म॒हो जा॒या विव॑स्वतो ननाश
verses.transliteration: tváṣṭā duhitré vahatúṃ kr̥ṇoti-  -ítīdáṃ víśvam bhúvanaṃ sám eti  yamásya mātā́ paryuhyámānā  mahó jāyā́ vívasvato nanāśa

translation.text: Tvashṭar prepares the bridal of his Daughter: all the world hears the tidings and assembles. But Yama's Mother, Spouse of great Vivasvan, vanished as she was carried to her dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपा॑गूहन्न॒मृतां॒ मर्त्ये॑भ्यः कृ॒त्वी सव॑र्णामददु॒र्विव॑स्वते उ॒ताश्विना॑वभर॒द्यत्तदासी॒दज॑हादु॒ द्वा मि॑थु॒ना स॑र॒ण्यूः
verses.transliteration: ápāgūhann amŕ̥tām mártyebhyaḥ  kr̥tvī́ sávarṇām adadur vívasvate  utā́śvínāv abharad yát tád ā́sīd  ájahād u dvā́ mithunā́ saraṇyū́ḥ

translation.text: From mortal men they hid the Immortal Lady, made one like her and gave her to Vivasvan. Saraṇyû brought to him the Aṣvin brothers, and then deserted both twinned pairs of children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒षा त्वे॒तश्च्या॑वयतु॒ प्र वि॒द्वानन॑ष्टपशु॒र्भुव॑नस्य गो॒पाः स त्वै॒तेभ्यः॒ परि॑ ददत्पि॒तृभ्यो॒ऽग्निर्दे॒वेभ्यः॑ सुविद॒त्रिये॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: pūṣā́ tvetáś cyāvayatu prá vidvā́n  ánaṣṭapaśur bhúvanasya gopā́ḥ  sá tvaitébhyaḥ pári dadat pitŕ̥bhyo  -agnír devébhyaḥ suvidatríyebhyaḥ

translation.text: Guard of the world, whose cattle ne'er are injured, may Pûshan bear thee hence, for he hath knowledge. May he consign thee to these Fathers' keeping, and to the gracious Gods let Agni give thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आयु॑र्वि॒श्वायुः॒ परि॑ पासति त्वा पू॒षा त्वा॑ पातु॒ प्रप॑थे पु॒रस्ता॑त् यत्रास॑ते सु॒कृतो॒ यत्र॒ ते य॒युस्तत्र॑ त्वा दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता द॑धातु
verses.transliteration: ā́yur viśvā́yuḥ pári pāsati tvā  pūṣā́ tvā pātu prápathe purástāt  yátrā́sate sukŕ̥to yátra té yayús  tátra tvā deváḥ savitā́ dadhātu

translation.text: May Âyu, giver of all life, protect thee, and bear thee forward on the distant pathway. Thither let Savitar the God transport thee, where dwell the pious who have passed-before thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒षेमा आशा॒ अनु॑ वेद॒ सर्वाः॒ सो अ॒स्माँ अभ॑यतमेन नेषत् स्व॒स्ति॒दा आघृ॑णिः॒ सर्व॑वी॒रोऽप्र॑युच्छन्पु॒र ए॑तु प्रजा॒नन्
verses.transliteration: pūṣémā́ ā́śā ánu veda sárvāḥ  só asmā́m̐ ábhayatamena neṣat  svastidā́ ā́ghr̥ṇiḥ sárvavīraḥ-  -áprayuchan purá etu prajānán

translation.text: Pûshan knows all these realms: may he conduct us by ways that are most free from fear and danger. Giver of blessings, glowing, all-heroic, may he, thewise and watchful, go before us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रप॑थे प॒थाम॑जनिष्ट पू॒षा प्रप॑थे दि॒वः प्रप॑थे पृथि॒व्याः उ॒भे अ॒भि प्रि॒यत॑मे स॒धस्थे॒ आ च॒ परा॑ च चरति प्रजा॒नन्
verses.transliteration: prápathe pathā́m ajaniṣṭa pūṣā́  prápathe diváḥ prápathe pr̥thivyā́ḥ  ubhé abhí priyátame sadhásthe  ā́ ca párā ca carati prajānán

translation.text: Pûshan was born to move on distant pathways, on the road far from earth and far from heaven. To both most wonted places of assembly he travels and returns with perfect knowledge.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर॑स्वतीं देव॒यन्तो॑ हवन्ते॒ सर॑स्वतीमध्व॒रे ता॒यमा॑ने सर॑स्वतीं सु॒कृतो॑ अह्वयन्त॒ सर॑स्वती दा॒शुषे॒ वार्यं॑ दात्
verses.transliteration: sárasvatīṃ devayánto havante  sárasvatīm adhvaré tāyámāne  sárasvatīṃ sukŕ̥to ahvayanta  sárasvatī dāśúṣe vā́ryaṃ dāt

translation.text: The pious call Sarasvatî, they worship Sarasvatî while sacrifice proceedeth. The pious called Sarasvatî aforetime. Sarasvatî send bliss to him who giveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर॑स्वति॒ या स॒रथं॑ य॒याथ॑ स्व॒धाभि॑र्देवि पि॒तृभि॒र्मद॑न्ती आ॒सद्या॒स्मिन्ब॒र्हिषि॑ मादयस्वानमी॒वा इष॒ आ धे॑ह्य॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: sárasvati yā́ saráthaṃ yayā́tha  svadhā́bhir devi pitŕ̥bhir mádantī  āsádyāsmín barhíṣi mādayasva-  -anamīvā́ íṣa ā́ dhehy asmé

translation.text: Sarasvatî, who camest with the Fathers, with them rejoicing thee in our oblations, Seated upon this sacred grass be joyful, and give us strengthening food that brings no sickness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर॑स्वतीं॒ यां पि॒तरो॒ हव॑न्ते दक्षि॒णा य॒ज्ञम॑भि॒नक्ष॑माणाः स॒ह॒स्रा॒र्घमि॒ळो अत्र॑ भा॒गं रा॒यस्पोषं॒ यज॑मानेषु धेहि
verses.transliteration: sárasvatīṃ yā́m pitáro hávante  dakṣiṇā́ yajñám abhinákṣamāṇāḥ  sahasrārghám iḷó átra bhāgáṃ  rāyás póṣaṃ yájamāneṣu dhehi

translation.text: Thou, called on as Sarasvatî by Fathers who come right forward to our solemn service, Give food and wealth to present sacrificers, a portion, worth a thousand, of refreshment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपो॑ अ॒स्मान्मा॒तरः॑ शुन्धयन्तु घृ॒तेन॑ नो घृत॒प्वः॑ पुनन्तु विश्वं॒ हि रि॒प्रं प्र॒वह॑न्ति दे॒वीरुदिदा॑भ्यः॒ शुचि॒रा पू॒त ए॑मि
verses.transliteration: ā́po asmā́n mātáraḥ śundhayantu  ghr̥téna no ghr̥tapvàḥ punantu  víśvaṃ hí riprám praváhanti devī́r  úd íd ābhyaḥ śúcir ā́ pūtá emi

translation.text: The Mother Floods shall make us bright and shining, cleansers of holy oil, with oil shall cleanse us: For, Goddesses, they bear off all defilement: I, rise up from them purified and brightened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्र॒प्सश्च॑स्कन्द प्रथ॒माँ अनु॒ द्यूनि॒मं च॒ योनि॒मनु॒ यश्च॒ पूर्वः॑ स॒मा॒नं योनि॒मनु॑ सं॒चर॑न्तं द्र॒प्सं जु॑हो॒म्यनु॑ स॒प्त होत्राः॑
verses.transliteration: drapsáś caskanda prathamā́m̐ ánu dyū́n  imáṃ ca yónim ánu yáś ca pū́rvaḥ  samānáṃ yónim ánu saṃcárantaṃ  drapsáṃ juhomy ánu saptá hótrāḥ

translation.text: Through days of earliest date the Drop descended on this place and on that which was before it. I offer up, throughout the seven oblations, the Drop which still to one same place is moving.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॑ द्र॒प्सः स्कन्द॑ति॒ यस्ते॑ अं॒शुर्बा॒हुच्यु॑तो धि॒षणा॑या उ॒पस्था॑त् अ॒ध्व॒र्योर्वा॒ परि॑ वा॒ यः प॒वित्रा॒त्तं ते॑ जुहोमि॒ मन॑सा॒ वष॑ट्कृतम्
verses.transliteration: yás te drapsá skándati yás te aṃśúr  bāhúcyuto dhiṣáṇāyā upásthāt  adhvaryór vā pári vā yáḥ pavítrāt  táṃ te juhomi mánasā váṣaṭkr̥tam

translation.text: The Drop that falls, thy stalk which arms have shaken, which from the bosom of the press hath fallen, Or from the Adhvaryu's purifying filter, I offer thee with heart and cry of Vashaṭ!

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॑ द्र॒प्सः स्क॒न्नो यस्ते॑ अं॒शुर॒वश्च॒ यः प॒रः स्रु॒चा अ॒यं दे॒वो बृह॒स्पतिः॒ सं तं सि॑ञ्चतु॒ राध॑से
verses.transliteration: yás te drapsá skannó yás te aṃśúr  aváś ca yáḥ paráḥ srucā́  ayáṃ devó bŕ̥haspátiḥ  sáṃ táṃ siñcatu rā́dhase

translation.text: That fallen Drop of thine, the stalk which from the ladle fell away, This present God Br̥ihaspati shall pour it forth to make us rich.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पय॑स्वती॒रोष॑धयः॒ पय॑स्वन्माम॒कं वचः॑ अ॒पां पय॑स्व॒दित्पय॒स्तेन॑ मा स॒ह शु॑न्धत
verses.transliteration: páyasvatīr óṣadhayaḥ  páyasvan māmakáṃ vácaḥ  apā́m páyasvad ít páyas  téna mā sahá śundhata

translation.text: The plants of earth are rich in milk, and rich in milk is this my speech; And rich in milk the essence of the Waters: make me pure therewith.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परं॑ मृत्यो॒ अनु॒ परे॑हि॒ पन्थां॒ यस्ते॒ स्व इत॑रो देव॒याना॑त् चक्षु॑ष्मते शृण्व॒ते ते॑ ब्रवीमि॒ मा नः॑ प्र॒जां री॑रिषो॒ मोत वी॒रान्
verses.transliteration: páram mr̥tyo ánu párehi pánthāṃ  yás te svá ítaro devayā́nāt  cákṣuṣmate śr̥ṇvaté te bravīmi  mā́ naḥ prajā́ṃ rīriṣo mótá vīrā́n

translation.text: Go hence, O Death, pursue thy special pathway apart from that which Gods are wont to travel. To thee I say it who hast eyes and hearest: Touch not our offspring, injure not our heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मृ॒त्योः प॒दं यो॒पय॑न्तो॒ यदैत॒ द्राघी॑य॒ आयुः॑ प्रत॒रं दधा॑नाः आ॒प्याय॑मानाः प्र॒जया॒ धने॑न शु॒द्धाः पू॒ता भ॑वत यज्ञियासः
verses.transliteration: mr̥tyóḥ padáṃ yopáyanto yád aíta  drā́ghīya ā́yuḥ prataráṃ dádhānāḥ  āpyā́yamānāḥ prajáyā dhánena  śuddhā́ḥ pūtā́ bhavata yajñiyāsaḥ

translation.text: As ye have come effacing Mrtyu's footstep, to further times prolonging your existence, May ye be rich in children and possessions. cleansed, purified, and meet for sacrificing.
