verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे जी॒वा वि मृ॒तैराव॑वृत्र॒न्नभू॑द्भ॒द्रा दे॒वहू॑तिर्नो अ॒द्य प्राञ्चो॑ अगाम नृ॒तये॒ हसा॑य॒ द्राघी॑य॒ आयुः॑ प्रत॒रं दधा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: imé jīvā́ ví mr̥taír ā́vavr̥trann  ábhūd bhadrā́ deváhūtir no adyá  prā́ñco agāma nr̥táye hásāya  drā́ghīya ā́yuḥ prataráṃ dádhānāḥ

translation.text: Divided from the dead are these, the living: now be our calling on the Gods successful. We have gone forth for dancing and for laughter, tofurther times prolonging our existence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं जी॒वेभ्यः॑ परि॒धिं द॑धामि॒ मैषां॒ नु गा॒दप॑रो॒ अर्थ॑मे॒तम् श॒तं जी॑वन्तु श॒रदः॑ पुरू॒चीर॒न्तर्मृ॒त्युं द॑धतां॒ पर्व॑तेन
verses.transliteration: imáṃ jīvébhyaḥ paridhíṃ dadhāmi  maíṣāṃ nú gād áparo ártham etám  śatáṃ jīvantu śarádaḥ purūcī́r  antár mr̥tyúṃ dadhatām párvatena

translation.text: Here I erect this rampart for the living; let none of these, none other, reach this limit. May they survive a hundred lengthened autumns, and may they bury Death beneath this mountain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथाहा॑न्यनुपू॒र्वं भव॑न्ति॒ यथ॑ ऋ॒तव॑ ऋ॒तुभि॒र्यन्ति॑ सा॒धु यथा॒ न पूर्व॒मप॑रो॒ जहा॑त्ये॒वा धा॑त॒रायूं॑षि कल्पयैषाम्
verses.transliteration: yáthā́hāny anupūrvám bhávanti  yátha r̥táva r̥túbhir yánti sādhú  yáthā ná pū́rvam áparo jáhāti-  evā́ dhātar ā́yūṃṣi kalpayaiṣām

translation.text: As the days follow days in close succession, as with the seasons duly come the seasons, As each successor fails not his foregoer, so form the lives of these, O great Ordainer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रो॑ह॒तायु॑र्ज॒रसं॑ वृणा॒ना अ॑नुपू॒र्वं यत॑माना॒ यति॒ ष्ठ इ॒ह त्वष्टा॑ सु॒जनि॑मा स॒जोषा॑ दी॒र्घमायुः॑ करति जी॒वसे॑ वः
verses.transliteration: ā́ rohatā́yur jarásaṃ vr̥ṇānā́ḥ-  anupūrváṃ yátamānā yáti ṣṭhá  ihá tváṣṭā sujánimā sajóṣāḥ-  dīrghám ā́yuḥ karati jīváse vaḥ

translation.text: Live your full lives ap! find old age delightful, all of you striving one behind the other. May Tvashṭar, maker of fair things, be gracious and lengthen out the days of your existence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा नारी॑रविध॒वाः सु॒पत्नी॒राञ्ज॑नेन स॒र्पिषा॒ सं वि॑शन्तु अ॒न॒श्रवो॑ऽनमी॒वाः सु॒रत्ना॒ आ रो॑हन्तु॒ जन॑यो॒ योनि॒मग्रे॑
verses.transliteration: imā́ nā́rīr avidhavā́ḥ supátnīr  ā́ñjanena sarpíṣā sáṃ viśantu  anaśrávo 'namīvā́ḥ surátnāḥ-  ā́ rohantu jánayo yónim ágre

translation.text: Let these unwidowed dames with noble husbands adorn themselves with fragrant balm and unguent. Decked with fair jewels, tearless, free from sorrow, first let the dames go up to where he lieth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदी॑र्ष्व नार्य॒भि जी॑वलो॒कं ग॒तासु॑मे॒तमुप॑ शेष॒ एहि॑ ह॒स्त॒ग्रा॒भस्य॑ दिधि॒षोस्तवे॒दं पत्यु॑र्जनि॒त्वम॒भि सं ब॑भूथ
verses.transliteration: úd īrṣva nāry abhí jīvalokáṃ  gatā́sum etám úpa śeṣa éhi  hastagrābhásya didhiṣós távedám  pátyur janitvám abhí sám babhūtha

translation.text: Rise, come unto the world of life, O woman: come, he is lifeless by whose side thou liest. Wifehood with this thy husband was thy portion, who took thy hand and wooed thee as a lover.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धनु॒र्हस्ता॑दा॒ददा॑नो मृ॒तस्या॒स्मे क्ष॒त्राय॒ वर्च॑से॒ बला॑य अत्रै॒व त्वमि॒ह व॒यं सु॒वीरा॒ विश्वाः॒ स्पृधो॑ अ॒भिमा॑तीर्जयेम
verses.transliteration: dhánur hástād ādádāno mr̥tásya-  -asmé kṣatrā́ya várcase bálāya  átraivá tvám ihá vayáṃ suvī́rāḥ-  víśvā spŕ̥dho abhímātīr jayema

translation.text: From his dead hand I take the bow be carried, that it may be our power and might and glory. There art thou, there; and here with noble heroes may we o'ercome all hosts that fight against us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ सर्प मा॒तरं॒ भूमि॑मे॒तामु॑रु॒व्यच॑सं पृथि॒वीं सु॒शेवा॑म् ऊर्ण॑म्रदा युव॒तिर्दक्षि॑णावत ए॒षा त्वा॑ पातु॒ निर्ऋ॑तेरु॒पस्था॑त्
verses.transliteration: úpa sarpa mātáram bhū́mim etā́m  uruvyácasam pr̥thivī́ṃ suśévām  ū́rṇamradā yuvatír dákṣiṇāvate-  eṣā́ tvā pātu nírr̥ter upásthāt

translation.text: Betake thee to the Iap of Earth the Mother, of Earth far-spreading, very kind and gracious. Young Dame, wool-soft unto the guerdongiver, may she preserve thee from Destruction's bosom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उच्छ्व॑ञ्चस्व पृथिवि॒ मा नि बा॑धथाः सूपाय॒नास्मै॑ भव सूपवञ्च॒ना मा॒ता पु॒त्रं यथा॑ सि॒चाभ्ये॑नं भूम ऊर्णुहि
verses.transliteration: úc chvañcasva pr̥thivi mā́ ní bādhathāḥ  sūpāyanā́smai bhava sūpavañcanā́  mātā́ putráṃ yáthā sicā́-  -abhy ènam bhūma ūrṇuhi

translation.text: Heave thyself, Earth, nor press thee downward heavily: afford him easy access, gently tending him. Cover him, as a mother wraps her skirt about her child, O Earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒च्छ्वञ्च॑माना पृथि॒वी सु ति॑ष्ठतु स॒हस्रं॒ मित॒ उप॒ हि श्रय॑न्ताम् ते गृ॒हासो॑ घृत॒श्चुतो॑ भवन्तु वि॒श्वाहा॑स्मै शर॒णाः स॒न्त्वत्र॑
verses.transliteration: ucchváñcamānā pr̥thivī́ sú tiṣṭhatu  sahásram míta úpa hí śráyantām  té gr̥hā́so ghr̥taścúto bhavantu  viśvā́hāsmai śaraṇā́ḥ santv átra

translation.text: Now let the heaving earth be free from motion: yea,– let a thousand clods remain above him. Be they to him a home distilling fatness, here let them ever be his place of refuge.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ते॑ स्तभ्नामि पृथि॒वीं त्वत्परी॒मं लो॒गं नि॒दध॒न्मो अ॒हं रि॑षम् ए॒तां स्थूणां॑ पि॒तरो॑ धारयन्तु॒ तेऽत्रा॑ य॒मः साद॑ना ते मिनोतु
verses.transliteration: út te stabhnāmi pr̥thivī́ṃ tvát pári-  -imáṃ logáṃ nidádhan mó aháṃ riṣam  etā́ṃ sthū́ṇām pitáro dhārayantu te-  -átrā yamáḥ sā́danā te minotu

translation.text: I stay the earth from thee, while over thee I place this piece of earth. May I be free from injury. Here let the Fathers keep this pillar firm for thee, and there let Yama make thee an abiding-place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒ती॒चीने॒ मामह॒नीष्वाः॑ प॒र्णमि॒वा द॑धुः प्र॒तीचीं॑ जग्रभा॒ वाच॒मश्वं॑ रश॒नया॑ यथा
verses.transliteration: pratīcī́ne mā́m áhani-  -íṣvāḥ parṇám ivā́ dadhuḥ  pratī́cīṃ jagrabhā vā́cam  áśvaṃ raśanáyā yathā

translation.text: Even as an arrow's feathers, they have set me on a fitting day. The fit word have I caught and held as 'twere a courser with the rein.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि व॑र्तध्वं॒ मानु॑ गाता॒स्मान्त्सि॑षक्त रेवतीः अग्नी॑षोमा पुनर्वसू अ॒स्मे धा॑रयतं र॒यिम्
verses.transliteration: ní vartadhvam mā́nu gāta-  -asmā́n siṣakta revatīḥ  ágnīṣomā punarvasū  asmé dhārayataṃ rayím

translation.text: TURN, go not farther on your way: visit us, O ye Wealthy Ones. Agni and Soma, ye who bring riches again, secure us wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुन॑रेना॒ नि व॑र्तय॒ पुन॑रेना॒ न्या कु॑रु इन्द्र॑ एणा॒ नि य॑च्छत्व॒ग्निरे॑ना उ॒पाज॑तु
verses.transliteration: púnar enā ní vartaya  púnar enā ny ā́ kuru  índra eṇā ní yachatu-  agnír enā upā́jatu

translation.text: Make these return to us again, bring them beside us once again. May. Indra give them back to us, and Agni drive them hither-ward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुन॑रे॒ता नि व॑र्तन्ताम॒स्मिन्पु॑ष्यन्तु॒ गोप॑तौ इ॒हैवाग्ने॒ नि धा॑रये॒ह ति॑ष्ठतु॒ या र॒यिः
verses.transliteration: púnar etā́ ní vartantām  asmín puṣyantu gópatau  ihaívā́gne ní dhāraya-  -ihá tiṣṭhatu yā́ rayíḥ

translation.text: Let them return to us again: under this herdsman let them feed. Do thou, O Agni, keep them here, and let the wealth we have remain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यन्नि॒यानं॒ न्यय॑नं सं॒ज्ञानं॒ यत्प॒राय॑णम् आ॒वर्त॑नं नि॒वर्त॑नं॒ यो गो॒पा अपि॒ तं हु॑वे
verses.transliteration: yán niyā́naṃ nyáyanaṃ  saṃjñā́naṃ yát parā́yaṇam  āvártanaṃ nivártanaṃ  yó gopā́ ápi táṃ huve

translation.text: I call upon their herdsman, him who knoweth well their coming nigh, Their parting and their home-return, and watcheth their approach and rest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य उ॒दान॒ड्व्यय॑नं॒ य उ॒दान॑ट् प॒राय॑णम् आ॒वर्त॑नं नि॒वर्त॑न॒मपि॑ गो॒पा नि व॑र्तताम्
verses.transliteration: yá udā́naḍ vyáyanaṃ  yá udā́naṭ parā́yaṇam  āvártanaṃ nivártanaṃ  ápi gopā́ ní vartatām

translation.text: Yea, let the herdsman, too, return, who marketh well their driving-forth; Marketh their wandering away, their turning back and coming home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नि॑वर्त॒ नि व॑र्तय॒ पुन॑र्न इन्द्र॒ गा दे॑हि जी॒वाभि॑र्भुनजामहै
verses.transliteration: ā́ nivarta ní vartaya  púnar na indra gā́ dehi  jīvā́bhir bhunajāmahai

translation.text: Home-leader, lead them home to us; Indra, restore to us our kine: We will rejoice in them alive.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ वो वि॒श्वतो॑ दध ऊ॒र्जा घृ॒तेन॒ पय॑सा ये दे॒वाः के च॑ य॒ज्ञिया॒स्ते र॒य्या सं सृ॑जन्तु नः
verses.transliteration: pári vo viśváto dadhe-  ūrjā́ ghr̥téna páyasā  yé devā́ḥ ké ca yajñíyās  té rayyā́ sáṃ sr̥jantu naḥ

translation.text: I offer you on every side butter and milk and strengthening food. May all the Holy Deities pour down on us a flood of wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नि॑वर्तन वर्तय॒ नि नि॑वर्तन वर्तय भूम्या॒श्चत॑स्रः प्र॒दिश॒स्ताभ्य॑ एना॒ नि व॑र्तय
verses.transliteration: ā́ nivartana vartaya  ní nivartana vartaya  bhū́myāś cátasraḥ pradíśas  tā́bhya enā ní vartaya

translation.text: O thou Home-leader, lead them home, restore them thou who bringest home. Four are the quarters of the earth; from these bring back to us our kine,

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रं नो॒ अपि॑ वातय॒ मनः॑
verses.transliteration: bhadráṃ no ápi vātaya mánaḥ

translation.text: SEND unto us a good and happy mind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निमी॑ळे भु॒जां यवि॑ष्ठं शा॒सा मि॒त्रं दु॒र्धरी॑तुम् यस्य॒ धर्म॒न्त्स्व१॒॑रेनीः॑ सप॒र्यन्ति॑ मा॒तुरूधः॑
verses.transliteration: agním īḷe bhujā́ṃ yáviṣṭhaṃ  śāsā́ mitráṃ durdhárītum  yásya dhárman svàr énīḥ  saparyánti mātúr ū́dhaḥ

translation.text: I worship Agni, Youthfullest of Gods, resistless, Friend of laws; Under whose guard and heavenly light the Spotted seek the Mother's breast:

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमा॒सा कृ॒पनी॑ळं भा॒साके॑तुं व॒र्धय॑न्ति भ्राज॑ते॒ श्रेणि॑दन्
verses.transliteration: yám āsā́ kr̥pánīḷam  bhāsā́ketuṃ vardháyanti  bhrā́jate śréṇidan

translation.text: Whom with their mouth they magnify, bannered with flame and homed in light. He glitters with his row of teeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्यो वि॒शां गा॒तुरे॑ति॒ प्र यदान॑ड्दि॒वो अन्ता॑न् क॒विर॒भ्रं दीद्या॑नः
verses.transliteration: aryó viśā́ṃ gātúr eti  prá yád ā́naḍ divó ántān  kavír abhráṃ dī́dyānaḥ

translation.text: Kind, Furtherer of men, he comes, when he hath reached the ends of heaven, Sage, giving splendour to the clouds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जु॒षद्ध॒व्या मानु॑षस्यो॒र्ध्वस्त॑स्था॒वृभ्वा॑ य॒ज्ञे मि॒न्वन्त्सद्म॑ पु॒र ए॑ति
verses.transliteration: juṣád dhavyā́ mā́nuṣasya-  -ūrdhvás tasthāv ŕ̥bhvā yajñé  minván sádma purá eti

translation.text: To taste man's offerings, he, the Strong, hath risen erect at sacrifice: Fixing his dwelling he proceeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि क्षेमो॑ ह॒विर्य॒ज्ञः श्रु॒ष्टीद॑स्य गा॒तुरे॑ति अ॒ग्निं दे॒वा वाशी॑मन्तम्
verses.transliteration: sá hí kṣémo havír yajñáḥ  śruṣṭī́d asya gātúr eti  agníṃ devā́ vā́śīmantam

translation.text: Here are oblation, worship, rest: rapidly comes his furtherance. To sword-armed Agni come the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञा॒साहं॒ दुव॑ इषे॒ऽग्निं पूर्व॑स्य॒ शेव॑स्य अद्रेः॑ सू॒नुमा॒युमा॑हुः
verses.transliteration: yajñāsā́haṃ dúva iṣe  -agním pū́rvasya śévasya  ádreḥ sūnúm āyúm āhuḥ

translation.text: With service for chief bliss I seek the Lord of Sacrifice, Agni, whom They call the Living, Son of Cloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नरो॒ ये के चा॒स्मदा विश्वेत्ते वा॒म आ स्युः॑ अ॒ग्निं ह॒विषा॒ वर्ध॑न्तः
verses.transliteration: náro yé ké cāsmád~ā́  víśvét té vāmá ā́ syuḥ  agníṃ havíṣā várdhantaḥ

translation.text: Blest evermore be all the men who come from us, who magnify Agni with sacrificial gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒ष्णः श्वे॒तो॑ऽरु॒षो यामो॑ अस्य ब्र॒ध्न ऋ॒ज्र उ॒त शोणो॒ यश॑स्वान् हिर॑ण्यरूपं॒ जनि॑ता जजान
verses.transliteration: kr̥ṣṇáḥ śvetò 'ruṣó yā́mo asya  bradhná r̥jrá utá śóṇo yáśasvān  híraṇyarūpaṃ jánitā jajāna

translation.text: The path he treads is black and white and red, and striped, and brown, crimson, and glorious. His sire begat him bright with hues of gold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा ते॑ अग्ने विम॒दो म॑नी॒षामूर्जो॑ नपाद॒मृते॑भिः स॒जोषाः॑ गिर॒ आ व॑क्षत्सुम॒तीरि॑या॒न इष॒मूर्जं॑ सुक्षि॒तिं विश्व॒माभाः॑
verses.transliteration: evā́ te agne vimadó manīṣā́m  ū́rjo napād amŕ̥tebhiḥ sajóṣāḥ  gíra ā́ vakṣat sumatī́r iyānáḥ-  íṣam ū́rjaṃ sukṣitíṃ víśvam ā́bhāḥ

translation.text: Thus with his thoughts, O Son of Strength, O Agni, hath Vimada, accordant with the Immortals, Offered thee hymns, soliciting thy favour. Thou hast brought all food, strength, a prosperous dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आग्निं न स्ववृ॑क्तिभि॒र्होता॑रं त्वा वृणीमहे य॒ज्ञाय॑ स्ती॒र्णब॑र्हिषे॒ वि वो॒ मदे॑ शी॒रं पा॑व॒कशो॑चिषं॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: ā́gníṃ ná svávr̥ktibhir  hótāraṃ tvā vr̥ṇīmahe-  yajñā́ya stīrṇábarhiṣe  ví vo máde  śīrám pāvakáśociṣam  vívakṣase

translation.text: WITH offerings of our own we choose thee, Agni, as Invoking Priest, For sacrifice with trimmed grass,– at your glad carouse-piercing and brightly shining. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामु॒ ते स्वा॒भुवः॑ शु॒म्भन्त्यश्व॑राधसः वेति॒ त्वामु॑प॒सेच॑नी॒ वि वो॒ मद॒ ऋजी॑तिरग्न॒ आहु॑ति॒र्विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: tvā́m u té svābhúvaḥ  śumbhánty áśvarādhasaḥ  véti tvā́m upasécanī  ví vo máde  ŕ̥jītir agna ā́hutir  vívakṣase

translation.text: The wealthy ones adorn thee, they who bring us horses as their gift: The sprinkling ladle, Agni,– at your glad carouse -and glowing offering taste thee. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे ध॒र्माण॑ आसते जु॒हूभिः॑ सिञ्च॒तीरि॑व कृ॒ष्णा रू॒पाण्यर्जु॑ना॒ वि वो॒ मदे॒ विश्वा॒ अधि॒ श्रियो॑ धिषे॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: tvé dharmā́ṇa āsate  juhū́bhiḥ siñcatī́r iva  kr̥ṣṇā́ rūpā́ṇy árjunā  ví vo máde  víśvā ádhi śríyo dhiṣe  vívakṣase

translation.text: The holy statutes rest by thee, as 'twere with ladles that o'erflow. Black and white-gleaming colours,– at your glad carouse-all glories thou assurnest. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यम॑ग्ने॒ मन्य॑से र॒यिं सह॑सावन्नमर्त्य तमा नो॒ वाज॑सातये॒ वि वो॒ मदे॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॑ चि॒त्रमा भ॑रा॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: yám agne mányase rayíṃ  sáhasāvann amartya  tám ā́ no vā́jasātaye  ví vo máde  yajñéṣu citrám ā́ bharā  vívakṣase

translation.text: O Agni, what thou deemest wealth, Victorious and Immortal One! Bring thou to give us vigour,– at your glad carouse -splendid at sacrifices. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्जा॒तो अथ॑र्वणा वि॒दद्विश्वा॑नि॒ काव्या॑ भुव॑द्दू॒तो वि॒वस्व॑तो॒ वि वो॒ मदे॑ प्रि॒यो य॒मस्य॒ काम्यो॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: agnír jātó átharvaṇā  vidád víśvāni kā́vyā  bhúvad dūtó vivásvato  ví vo máde  priyó yamásya kā́myo  vívakṣase

translation.text: Skilled in all lore is Agni, he whom erst Atharvan brought to life. He was Vivasvan's envoy, at your glad carouse-the weIl-loved friend of Yama, Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां य॒ज्ञेष्वी॑ळ॒तेऽग्ने॑ प्रय॒त्य॑ध्व॒रे त्वं वसू॑नि॒ काम्या॒ वि वो॒ मदे॒ विश्वा॑ दधासि दा॒शुषे॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ yajñéṣv īḷate-  -ágne prayaty àdhvaré  tváṃ vásūni kā́myā  ví vo máde  víśvā dadhāsi dāśúṣe  vívakṣase

translation.text: At sacrifices they adore thee, Agni, when the rite proceeds. All fair and lovely treasures-at your glad carouse-thou givest him who offers. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां य॒ज्ञेष्वृ॒त्विजं॒ चारु॑मग्ने॒ नि षे॑दिरे घृ॒तप्र॑तीकं॒ मनु॑षो॒ वि वो॒ मदे॑ शु॒क्रं चेति॑ष्ठम॒क्षभि॒र्विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ yajñéṣv r̥tvíjam  cā́rum agne ní ṣedire  ghr̥tápratīkam mánuṣo  ví vo máde  śukráṃ cétiṣṭham akṣábhir  vívakṣase

translation.text: Men, Agni, have established thee as welcome Priest at holy rites, Thee whose face shines with butter,– at your glad carouse-bright, with eyes most observant. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ शु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषो॒रु प्र॑थयसे बृ॒हत् अ॒भि॒क्रन्द॑न्वृषायसे॒ वि वो॒ मदे॒ गर्भं॑ दधासि जा॒मिषु॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: ágne śukréṇa śocíṣā  -urú prathayase br̥hát  abhikrándan vr̥ṣāyase  ví vo máde  gárbhaṃ dadhāsi jāmíṣu  vívakṣase

translation.text: Wide and aloft thou spreadest thee, O Agni, with thy brilliant flame. A Bull art thou when bellowing,– at your glad carouse-thou dost impregn the Sisters. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कुह॑ श्रु॒त इन्द्रः॒ कस्मि॑न्न॒द्य जने॑ मि॒त्रो न श्रू॑यते ऋषी॑णां वा॒ यः क्षये॒ गुहा॑ वा॒ चर्कृ॑षे गि॒रा
verses.transliteration: kúha śrutá índraḥ kásminn adyá  jáne mitró ná śrūyate  ŕ̥ṣīṇāṃ vā yáḥ kṣáye  gúhā vā cárkr̥ṣe girā́

translation.text: WHERE is famed Indra heard of? With what folk is he renowned to-day as Mitra is,– Who in the home of R̥ishis and in secret is extolled with song?

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह श्रु॒त इन्द्रो॑ अ॒स्मे अ॒द्य स्तवे॑ व॒ज्र्यृची॑षमः मि॒त्रो न यो जने॒ष्वा यश॑श्च॒क्रे असा॒म्या
verses.transliteration: ihá śrutá índro asmé  stáve vajry ŕ̥cīṣamaḥ  mitró ná yó jáneṣv~ā́  yáśaś cakré ásāmy ā́

translation.text: Even here is Indra famed, and among us this day the glorious Thunderer is praised, He who like Mitra mid the folk hath won complete and full renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हो यस्पतिः॒ शव॑सो॒ असा॒म्या म॒हो नृ॒म्णस्य॑ तूतु॒जिः भ॒र्ता वज्र॑स्य धृ॒ष्णोः पि॒ता पु॒त्रमि॑व प्रि॒यम्
verses.transliteration: mahó yás pátiḥ śávaso ásāmy~ā́  mahó nr̥mṇásya tūtujíḥ  bhartā́ vájrasya dhr̥ṣṇóḥ  pitā́ putrám iva priyám

translation.text: He who is Sovran Lord of great and perfect strength, exerter of heroic might, Who bears the fearless thunder as a father bears his darling son.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒जा॒नो अश्वा॒ वात॑स्य॒ धुनी॑ दे॒वो दे॒वस्य॑ वज्रिवः स्यन्ता॑ प॒था वि॒रुक्म॑ता सृजा॒नः स्तो॒ष्यध्व॑नः
verses.transliteration: yujānó áśvā vā́tasya dhúnī  devó devásya vajrivaḥ  syántā pathā́ virúkmatā  sr̥jāná stoṣy ádhvanaḥ

translation.text: Harnessing to thy car, as God, two blustering Steeds Of the Wind-God, O Thunderer, That speed along the shining path, thou making ways art glorified.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं त्या चि॒द्वात॒स्याश्वागा॑ ऋ॒ज्रा त्मना॒ वह॑ध्यै ययो॑र्दे॒वो न मर्त्यो॑ य॒न्ता नकि॑र्वि॒दाय्यः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tyā́ cid vā́tasyā́śvā́gāḥ-  r̥jrā́ tmánā váhadhyai  yáyor devó ná mártyo  yantā́ nákir vidā́yyaḥ

translation.text: Even to these dark Steeds of Wind thou of thyself hast come to ride, Of which no driver may be found, none, be he God or mortal man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ ग्मन्तो॒शना॑ पृच्छते वां॒ कद॑र्था न॒ आ गृ॒हम् आ ज॑ग्मथुः परा॒काद्दि॒वश्च॒ ग्मश्च॒ मर्त्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ádha gmántośánā pr̥chate vāṃ  kádarthā na ā́ gr̥hám  ā́ jagmathuḥ parākā́d  diváś ca gmáś ca mártyam

translation.text: When ye approach, men ask you, thee and Uṣanâ: Why come ye to our dwelling-place? Why are ye come to mortal man from distant realms of eapth and heaven?

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॑ इन्द्र पृक्षसे॒ऽस्माकं॒ ब्रह्मोद्य॑तम् तत्त्वा॑ याचाम॒हेऽवः॒ शुष्णं॒ यद्धन्नमा॑नुषम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ na indra pr̥kṣase  -asmā́kam bráhmódyatam  tát tvā yācāmahé 'vaḥ  śúṣṇaṃ yád dhánn ámānuṣam

translation.text: O Indra, thou shalt speak us fair: our holy prayer is offered up. We pray to thee for help as thou didst strike the monster Ṣushṇa dead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒क॒र्मा दस्यु॑र॒भि नो॑ अम॒न्तुर॒न्यव्र॑तो॒ अमा॑नुषः त्वं तस्या॑मित्रह॒न्वध॑र्दा॒सस्य॑ दम्भय
verses.transliteration: akarmā́ dásyur abhí no amantúr  anyávrato ámānuṣaḥ  tváṃ tásyāmitrahan  vádhar dāsásya dambhaya

translation.text: Around us is the Dasyu, riteless, void of sense, inhuman, keeping alien laws. Baffle, thou Slayer of the foe, the weapon which this Dâsa wields.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं न॑ इन्द्र शूर॒ शूरै॑रु॒त त्वोता॑सो ब॒र्हणा॑ पु॒रु॒त्रा ते॒ वि पू॒र्तयो॒ नव॑न्त क्षो॒णयो॑ यथा
verses.transliteration: tváṃ na indra śūra śū́rair  utá tvótāso barháṇā  purutrā́ te ví pūrtáyo  návanta kṣoṇáyo yathā

translation.text: Hero with Heroes, thou art ours: yea, strong are they whom thou dost help. In many a place are thy full gifts, and men, like vassals, sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं तान्वृ॑त्र॒हत्ये॑ चोदयो॒ नॄन्का॑र्पा॒णे शू॑र वज्रिवः गुहा॒ यदी॑ कवी॒नां वि॒शां नक्ष॑त्रशवसाम्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tā́n vr̥trahátye codayo nr̥̄́n  kārpāṇé śūra vajrivaḥ  gúhā yádī kavīnā́ṃ  viśā́ṃ nákṣatraśavasām

translation.text: Urge thou these heroes on to slay the enemy, brave Thunderer! in the fight with swords. Even when hid among the tribes of Sages numerous as stars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒क्षू ता त॑ इन्द्र दा॒नाप्न॑स आक्षा॒णे शू॑र वज्रिवः यद्ध॒ शुष्ण॑स्य द॒म्भयो॑ जा॒तं विश्वं॑ स॒याव॑भिः
verses.transliteration: makṣū́ tā́ ta indra dānā́pnasaḥ-  ākṣāṇé śūra vajrivaḥ  yád dha śúṣṇasya dambháyo  jātáṃ víśvaṃ sayā́vabhiḥ

translation.text: Swift come those gifts of thine whose hand is prompt to rend and burn, O Hero Thunder-armed: As thou with thy Companions didst destroy the whole of SuSnia's brood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: माकु॒ध्र्य॑गिन्द्र शूर॒ वस्वी॑र॒स्मे भू॑वन्न॒भिष्ट॑यः व॒यंव॑यं त आसां सु॒म्ने स्या॑म वज्रिवः
verses.transliteration: mā́kudhryàg indra śūra vásvīr  asmé bhūvann abhíṣṭayaḥ  vayáṃ-vayaṃ ta āsāṃ  sumné syāma vajrivaḥ

translation.text: Let not thine excellent assistance come to us, O Hero Indra, profitless. May we, may we enjoy the bliss of these thy favours, Thunderer!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे ता त॑ इन्द्र सन्तु स॒त्याहिं॑सन्तीरुप॒स्पृशः॑ वि॒द्याम॒ यासां॒ भुजो॑ धेनू॒नां न व॑ज्रिवः
verses.transliteration: asmé tā́ ta indra santu satyā́-  -áhiṃsantīr upaspŕ̥śaḥ  vidyā́ma yā́sām bhújo  dhenūnā́ṃ ná vajrivaḥ

translation.text: May those soft impulses of thine, O Indra, be fruitful and innocent to us. May we know these whose treasures are like those of milch-kine, Thunderer!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ह॒स्ता यद॒पदी॒ वर्ध॑त॒ क्षाः शची॑भिर्वे॒द्याना॑म् शुष्णं॒ परि॑ प्रदक्षि॒णिद्वि॒श्वाय॑वे॒ नि शि॑श्नथः
verses.transliteration: ahastā́ yád apádī várdhata kṣā́ḥ  śácībhir vedyā́nām  śúṣṇam pári pradakṣiṇíd  viśvā́yave ní śiśnathaḥ

translation.text: That Earth, through power of knowing things that may be known, handless and footless yet might thrive, Thou slewest, turning to the right, gu;na for every living man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिबा॑पि॒बेदि॑न्द्र शूर॒ सोमं॒ मा रि॑षण्यो वसवान॒ वसुः॒ सन् उ॒त त्रा॑यस्व गृण॒तो म॒घोनो॑ म॒हश्च॑ रा॒यो रे॒वत॑स्कृधी नः
verses.transliteration: píbā-pibéd indra śūra sómam  mā́ riṣaṇyo vasavāna vásuḥ sán  utá trāyasva gr̥ṇató maghóno  maháś ca rāyó revátas kr̥dhī naḥ

translation.text: Drink, drink the Soma, Hero Indra; be not withheld as thou art good, O Treasure-giver. Preserve the singers and our liberal princes, and make us wealthy with abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यजा॑मह॒ इन्द्रं॒ वज्र॑दक्षिणं॒ हरी॑णां र॒थ्यं१॒॑ विव्र॑तानाम् प्र श्मश्रु॒ दोधु॑वदू॒र्ध्वथा॑ भू॒द्वि सेना॑भि॒र्दय॑मानो॒ वि राध॑सा
verses.transliteration: yájāmaha índraṃ vájradakṣiṇaṃ  hárīṇāṃ rathyàṃ vívratānām  prá śmáśru dódhuvad ūrdhváthā bhūd  ví sénābhir dáyamāno ví rā́dhasā

translation.text: INDRA, whose right hand wields the bolt, we worship, driver of Bay Steeds seeking sundered courses. Shaking his beard with might he hath arisen, casting his weapons forth and dealing bounties.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हरी॒ न्व॑स्य॒ या वने॑ वि॒दे वस्विन्द्रो॑ म॒घैर्म॒घवा॑ वृत्र॒हा भु॑वत् ऋ॒भुर्वाज॑ ऋभु॒क्षाः प॑त्यते॒ शवोऽव॑ क्ष्णौमि॒ दास॑स्य॒ नाम॑ चित्
verses.transliteration: hárī nv àsya yā́ váne vidé vásu-  índro maghaír maghávā vr̥trahā́ bhuvat  r̥bhúr vā́ja r̥bhukṣā́ḥ patyate śávaḥ-  -áva kṣṇaumi dā́sasya nā́ma cit

translation.text: The treasure which his Bay Steeds found at sacrifice,– this wealth made opulent Indra slayer of the foe. R̥ibhu, R̥ibhukshan, Vâja-he is Lord of Might. The Dâsa's very name I utterly destroy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒दा वज्रं॒ हिर॑ण्य॒मिदथा॒ रथं॒ हरी॒ यम॑स्य॒ वह॑तो॒ वि सू॒रिभिः॑ आ ति॑ष्ठति म॒घवा॒ सन॑श्रुत॒ इन्द्रो॒ वाज॑स्य दी॒र्घश्र॑वस॒स्पतिः॑
verses.transliteration: yadā́ vájraṃ híraṇyam íd áthā ráthaṃ  hárī yám asya váhato ví sūríbhiḥ  ā́ tiṣṭhati maghávā sánaśrutaḥ-  índro vā́jasya dīrgháśravasas pátiḥ

translation.text: When, with the Princes, Maghavari, famed of old, comes nigh the thunderbolt of gold, and the Controller's car Which his two Tawny Coursers draw, then Indra is the Sovran Lord of power whose glory spreads afar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो चि॒न्नु वृ॒ष्टिर्यू॒थ्या॒३॒॑ स्वा सचाँ॒ इन्द्रः॒ श्मश्रू॑णि॒ हरि॑ता॒भि प्रु॑ष्णुते अव॑ वेति सु॒क्षयं॑ सु॒ते मधूदिद्धू॑नोति॒ वातो॒ यथा॒ वन॑म्
verses.transliteration: só cin nú vr̥ṣṭír yūthyā̀ svā́ sácām̐  índraḥ śmáśrūṇi háritābhí pruṣṇute  áva veti sukṣáyaṃ suté mádhu-  -úd íd dhūnoti vā́to yáthā vánam

translation.text: With him too is this rain of his that comes like herds: Indra throws drops of moisture on his yellow beard. When the sweet juice is shed he seeks the pleasant place, and stirs the worshipper as wind disturbs the wood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वा॒चा विवा॑चो मृ॒ध्रवा॑चः पु॒रू स॒हस्राशि॑वा ज॒घान॑ तत्त॒दिद॑स्य॒ पौंस्यं॑ गृणीमसि पि॒तेव॒ यस्तवि॑षीं वावृ॒धे शवः॑
verses.transliteration: yó vācā́ vívāco mr̥dhrávācaḥ  purū́ sahásrā́śivā jaghā́na  tát-tad íd asya paúṃsyaṃ gr̥ṇīmasi-  pitéva yás táviṣīṃ vāvr̥dhé śávaḥ

translation.text: We laud and praise his several deeds of valour who, fatherlike, with power hath made us stronger; Who with his voice slew many thousand wicked ones who spake in varied manners with contemptuous cries.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तोमं॑ त इन्द्र विम॒दा अ॑जीजन॒न्नपू॑र्व्यं पुरु॒तमं॑ सु॒दान॑वे वि॒द्मा ह्य॑स्य॒ भोज॑नमि॒नस्य॒ यदा प॒शुं न गो॒पाः क॑रामहे
verses.transliteration: stómaṃ ta indra vimadā́ ajījanann  ápūrvyam purutámaṃ sudā́nave  vidmā́ hy àsya bhójanam inásya  yád ā́ paśúṃ ná gopā́ḥ karāmahe

translation.text: Indra, the Vimadas have formed for thee a laud, copious, unparalleled, for thee Most Bountiful. We know the good we gain from him the Mighty One when we attract him as a herdsman calls the kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: माकि॑र्न ए॒ना स॒ख्या वि यौ॑षु॒स्तव॑ चेन्द्र विम॒दस्य॑ च॒ ऋषेः॑ वि॒द्मा हि ते॒ प्रम॑तिं देव जामि॒वद॒स्मे ते॑ सन्तु स॒ख्या शि॒वानि॑
verses.transliteration: mā́kir na enā́ sakhyā́ ví yauṣus  táva cendra vimadásya ca ŕ̥ṣeḥ  vidmā́ hí te prámatiṃ deva jāmivád  asmé te santu sakhyā́ śivā́ni

translation.text: Ne'er may this bond of friendship be dissevered, the R̥ishi Vimada's and thine, O Indra. We know thou carest for us as a brother with us, O God, be thine auspicious friendship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ सोम॑मि॒मं पि॑ब॒ मधु॑मन्तं च॒मू सु॒तम् अ॒स्मे र॒यिं नि धा॑रय॒ वि वो॒ मदे॑ सह॒स्रिणं॑ पुरूवसो॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: índra sómam imám piba  mádhumantaṃ camū́ sutám  asmé rayíṃ ní dhāraya  ví vo máde  sahasríṇam purūvaso  vívakṣase

translation.text: O INDRA, drink this Soma, pressed out in the mortar, full of sweets. Send down to us great riches,– at your glad carouse-in thousands, O Most healthy. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां य॒ज्ञेभि॑रु॒क्थैरुप॑ ह॒व्येभि॑रीमहे शची॑पते शचीनां॒ वि वो॒ मदे॒ श्रेष्ठं॑ नो धेहि॒ वार्यं॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ yajñébhir ukthaír  úpa havyébhir īmahe  śácīpate śacīnāṃ  ví vo máde  śréṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vā́ryam  vívakṣase

translation.text: To thee with sacrifices, with oblations, and with lauds we come. Lord of all strength and power, grant-at your glad carouse-the best choiceworthy treasure. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्पति॒र्वार्या॑णा॒मसि॑ र॒ध्रस्य॑ चोदि॒ता इन्द्र॑ स्तोतॄ॒णाम॑वि॒ता वि वो॒ मदे॑ द्वि॒षो नः॑ पा॒ह्यंह॑सो॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: yás pátir vā́ryāṇām  ási radhrásya coditā́  índra stotr̥̄ṇā́m avitā́  ví vo máde  dviṣó naḥ pāhy áṃhaso  vívakṣase

translation.text: Thou who art Lord of precious boons, inciter even of the churl. Guardian of singers, Indra,– at your glad carouse-save us from woe and hatred. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं श॑क्रा माया॒विना॑ समी॒ची निर॑मन्थतम् वि॒म॒देन॒ यदी॑ळि॒ता नास॑त्या नि॒रम॑न्थतम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ śakrā māyāvínā  samīcī́ nír amanthatam  vimadéna yád īḷitā́  nā́satyā nirámanthatam

translation.text: Strong, Lords of Magic power, ye Twain churned the united worlds apart, When ye, implored by Vimada, Nâsatyas, forced apart the pair.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ दे॒वा अ॑कृपन्त समी॒च्योर्नि॒ष्पत॑न्त्योः नास॑त्यावब्रुवन्दे॒वाः पुन॒रा व॑हता॒दिति॑
verses.transliteration: víśve devā́ akr̥panta  samīcyór niṣpátantyoḥ  nā́satyāv abruvan devā́ḥ  púnar ā́ vahatād íti

translation.text: When the united pair were rent asunder all the Gods complained. The Gods to the Nâsatyas cried, Bring these together once again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मधु॑मन्मे प॒राय॑णं॒ मधु॑म॒त्पुन॒राय॑नम् ता नो॑ देवा दे॒वत॑या यु॒वं मधु॑मतस्कृतम्
verses.transliteration: mádhuman me parā́yaṇam  mádhumat púnar ā́yanam  tā́ no devā devátayā  yuvám mádhumatas kr̥tam

translation.text: Sweet be my going forth, and rich in sweets be my approach to home. So, through your Deity, both Gods, enrich us with all pleasantness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रं नो॒ अपि॑ वातय॒ मनो॒ दक्ष॑मु॒त क्रतु॑म् अधा॑ ते स॒ख्ये अन्ध॑सो॒ वि वो॒ मदे॒ रण॒न्गावो॒ न यव॑से॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: bhadráṃ no ápi vātaya  máno dákṣam utá krátum  ádhā te sakhyé ándhaso  ví vo máde  ráṇan gā́vo ná yávase  vívakṣase

translation.text: SEND us a good and happy mind, send energy and mental power. Then-at your glad carouse-let men joy in thy love, Sweet juice! as kine in pasture. Thou. art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हृ॒दि॒स्पृश॑स्त आसते॒ विश्वे॑षु सोम॒ धाम॑सु अधा॒ कामा॑ इ॒मे मम॒ वि वो॒ मदे॒ वि ति॑ष्ठन्ते वसू॒यवो॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: hr̥dispŕ̥śas ta āsate  víśveṣu soma dhā́masu  ádhā kā́mā imé máma  ví vo máde  ví tiṣṭhante vasūyávo  vívakṣase

translation.text: rn all thy forms, O Soma, rest thy powers that influence the heart. So also these my longings-at your glad carouse-spread themselves seeking riches. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त व्र॒तानि॑ सोम ते॒ प्राहं मि॑नामि पा॒क्या॑ अधा॑ पि॒तेव॑ सू॒नवे॒ वि वो॒ मदे॑ मृ॒ळा नो॑ अ॒भि चि॑द्व॒धाद्विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: utá vratā́ni soma te  prā́hám mināmi pākyā̀  ádhā pitéva sūnáve  ví vo máde  mr̥ḷā́ no abhí cid vadhā́d  vívakṣase

translation.text: Even if, O Soma, I neglect thy laws through my simplicity, Be gracious-at your glad carouse-as sire to son. Preserve us even from slaughter. T'hou. art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समु॒ प्र य॑न्ति धी॒तयः॒ सर्गा॑सोऽव॒ताँ इ॑व क्रतुं॑ नः सोम जी॒वसे॒ वि वो॒ मदे॑ धा॒रया॑ चम॒साँ इ॑व॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: sám u prá yanti dhītáyaḥ  sárgāso 'vatā́m̐ iva  krátuṃ naḥ soma jīváse  ví vo máde  dhāráyā camasā́m̐ iva  vívakṣase

translation.text: Our songs in concert go to thee as streams of water to the wells. Soma, that we may live, grant-at your glad carouse-full powers of mind, like beakers. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ त्ये सो॑म॒ शक्ति॑भि॒र्निका॑मासो॒ व्यृ॑ण्विरे गृत्स॑स्य॒ धीरा॑स्त॒वसो॒ वि वो॒ मदे॑ व्र॒जं गोम॑न्तम॒श्विनं॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: táva tyé soma śáktibhir  níkāmāso vy r̥̀ṇvire  gŕ̥tsasya dhī́rās taváso  ví vo máde  vrajáṃ gómantam aśvínaṃ  vívakṣase

translation.text: O Soma, through thy might who art skilful and strong, these longing men, These sages, have thrown open-at your glad carouse-the stall of kine and horses. Thou art waxing great

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒शुं नः॑ सोम रक्षसि पुरु॒त्रा विष्ठि॑तं॒ जग॑त् स॒माकृ॑णोषि जी॒वसे॒ वि वो॒ मदे॒ विश्वा॑ स॒म्पश्य॒न्भुव॑ना॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: paśúṃ naḥ soma rakṣasi  purutrā́ víṣṭhitaṃ jágat  samā́kr̥ṇoṣi jīváse  ví vo máde  víśvā sampáśyan bhúvanā  vívakṣase

translation.text: Our herds thou guardest, Soma, and the moving world spread far and wide. Thou fittest them for living,– at your glad carouse-looking upon all beings. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नः॑ सोम वि॒श्वतो॑ गो॒पा अदा॑भ्यो भव सेध॑ राज॒न्नप॒ स्रिधो॒ वि वो॒ मदे॒ मा नो॑ दुः॒शंस॑ ईशता॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: tváṃ naḥ soma viśváto  gopā́ ádābhyo bhava  sédha rājann ápa srídho  ví vo máde  mā́ no duḥśáṃsa īśatā  vívakṣase

translation.text: On all sides, Soma, be to us a Guardian ne'er to be deceived. King, drive away our foemen-at your glad carouse:-let not the wicked rule us. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नः॑ सोम सु॒क्रतु॑र्वयो॒धेया॑य जागृहि क्षे॒त्र॒वित्त॑रो॒ मनु॑षो॒ वि वो॒ मदे॑ द्रु॒हो नः॑ पा॒ह्यंह॑सो॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: tváṃ naḥ soma sukrátur  vayodhéyāya jāgr̥hi  kṣetravíttaro mánuṣo  ví vo máde  druhó naḥ pāhy áṃhaso  vívakṣase

translation.text: Be watchful, Soma, passing wise, to give us store of vital strength. More skilled than man to guide us,– at your glad carouse-save us from harm and sorrow. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ वृत्रहन्त॒मेन्द्र॑स्येन्दो शि॒वः सखा॑ यत्सीं॒ हव॑न्ते समि॒थे वि वो॒ मदे॒ युध्य॑मानास्तो॒कसा॑तौ॒ विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no vr̥trahantama-  -índrasyendo śiváḥ sákhā  yát sīṃ hávante samithé  ví vo máde  yúdhyamānās tokásātau  vívakṣase

translation.text: Chief slayer of our foemen, thou, Indu, art Indra's gracious Friend, When warriors invoke him-at your glad carouse -in fight, to win them offspring. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं घ॒ स तु॒रो मद॒ इन्द्र॑स्य वर्धत प्रि॒यः अ॒यं क॒क्षीव॑तो म॒हो वि वो॒ मदे॑ म॒तिं विप्र॑स्य वर्धय॒द्विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ gha sá turó mádaḥ-  índrasya vardhata priyáḥ  ayáṃ kakṣī́vato mahó  ví vo máde  matíṃ víprasya vardhayad  vívakṣase

translation.text: Victorious is this gladdening drink: to Indra dear it grows in strength. This-at your glad carouse -enhanced the mighty hymn of the great sage Kakshîvân. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं विप्रा॑य दा॒शुषे॒ वाजाँ॑ इयर्ति॒ गोम॑तः अ॒यं स॒प्तभ्य॒ आ वरं॒ वि वो॒ मदे॒ प्रान्धं श्रो॒णं च॑ तारिष॒द्विव॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ víprāya dāśúṣe  vā́jām̐ iyarti gómataḥ  ayáṃ saptábhya ā́ váraṃ  ví vo máde  prā́ndháṃ śroṇáṃ ca tāriṣad  vívakṣase

translation.text: This to the sage who offers gifts brings power that comes from wealth in kine. This, better than the seven, hath-at your glad carouse-furthered the blind, the cripple. Thou art waxing great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ह्यच्छा॑ मनी॒षाः स्पा॒र्हा यन्ति॑ नि॒युतः॑ प्र द॒स्रा नि॒युद्र॑थः पू॒षा अ॑विष्टु॒ माहि॑नः
verses.transliteration: prá hy áchā manīṣā́ḥ-  spārhā́ yánti niyútaḥ  prá dasrā́ niyúdrathaḥ  pūṣā́ aviṣṭu mā́hinaḥ

translation.text: FORWARD upon their way proceed the ready teams, the lovely songs. Further them glorious Pûshan with yoked chariot, and the Mighty Twain!

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ त्यन्म॑हि॒त्वं वा॒ताप्य॑म॒यं जनः॑ विप्र॒ आ वं॑सद्धी॒तिभि॒श्चिके॑त सुष्टुती॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: yásya tyán mahitváṃ  vātā́pyam ayáṃ jánaḥ  vípra ā́ vaṃsad dhītíbhiś  cíketa suṣṭutīnā́m

translation.text: With sacred hymns let this man here, this singer, win the God to whom Belong this majesty and might. He hath observed our eulogies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वे॑द सुष्टुती॒नामिन्दु॒र्न पू॒षा वृषा॑ अ॒भि प्सुरः॑ प्रुषायति व्र॒जं न॒ आ प्रु॑षायति
verses.transliteration: sá veda suṣṭutīnā́m  índur ná pūṣā́ vŕ̥ṣā  abhí psúraḥ pruṣāyati  vrajáṃ na ā́ pruṣāyati

translation.text: Pûshan the Strong hath knowledge of sweet praises even as Indu hath. He dews our corn with moisture, he bedews the pasture of our kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मं॒सी॒महि॑ त्वा व॒यम॒स्माकं॑ देव पूषन् म॒ती॒नां च॒ साध॑नं॒ विप्रा॑णां चाध॒वम्
verses.transliteration: maṃsīmáhi tvā vayám  asmā́kaṃ deva pūṣan  matīnā́ṃ ca sā́dhanaṃ  víprāṇāṃ cādhavám

translation.text: We will bethink ourselves of thee, O Pûshan, O thou God, as One. Who brings fulfilment of our hymns, and stirs the singer and the sage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्य॑र्धिर्य॒ज्ञाना॑मश्वह॒यो रथा॑नाम् ऋषिः॒ स यो मनु॑र्हितो॒ विप्र॑स्य यावयत्स॒खः
verses.transliteration: prátyardhir yajñā́nām  aśvahayó ráthānām  ŕ̥ṣiḥ sá yó mánurhito  víprasya yāvayatsakháḥ

translation.text: joint-sharer of each sacrifice, the driver of the chariot steeds; The R̥ishi who is good to man, the singer's Friend and faithful Guard.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒धीष॑माणायाः॒ पतिः॑ शु॒चाया॑श्च शु॒चस्य॑ च वा॒सो॒वा॒योऽवी॑ना॒मा वासां॑सि॒ मर्मृ॑जत्
verses.transliteration: ādhī́ṣamāṇāyāḥ pátiḥ  śucā́yāś ca śucásya ca  vāsovāyó 'vīnām  ā́ vā́sāṃsi mármr̥jat

translation.text: One who is Lord of Suca, Lord of Suca caring for herself: Weaving the raiment of the sheep and making raiment beautiful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒नो वाजा॑नां॒ पति॑रि॒नः पु॑ष्टी॒नां सखा॑ प्र श्मश्रु॑ हर्य॒तो दू॑धो॒द्वि वृथा॒ यो अदा॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: inó vā́jānām pátir  ináḥ puṣṭīnā́ṃ sákhā  prá śmáśru haryató dūdhod  ví vŕ̥thā yó ádābhyaḥ

translation.text: The mighty Lord of spoil and wealth, Strong Friend of all prosperity; He with light movement shakes his beard, lovely and ne'er to be deceived.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॒ रथ॑स्य पूषन्न॒जा धुरं॑ ववृत्युः विश्व॑स्या॒र्थिनः॒ सखा॑ सनो॒जा अन॑पच्युतः
verses.transliteration: ā́ te ráthasya pūṣann  ajā́ dhúraṃ vavr̥tyuḥ  víśvasyārthínaḥ sákhā  sanojā́ ánapacyutaḥ

translation.text: O Pûshan, may those goats of thine turn hitherward thy chariot-pole. Friend of all suppliants; art thou, born in old time, and arm and sure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॑मू॒र्जा रथं॑ पू॒षा अ॑विष्टु॒ माहि॑नः भुव॒द्वाजा॑नां वृ॒ध इ॒मं नः॑ शृणव॒द्धव॑म्
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam ūrjā́ rátham  pūṣā́ aviṣṭu mā́hinaḥ  bhúvad vā́jānāṃ vr̥dháḥ-  imáṃ naḥ śr̥ṇavad dhávam

translation.text: May the majestic Pûshan speed our chariot with his power and might. May he increase our store of wealth and listen to this call of ours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॒त्सु मे॑ जरितः॒ साभि॑वे॒गो यत्सु॑न्व॒ते यज॑मानाय॒ शिक्ष॑म् अना॑शीर्दाम॒हम॑स्मि प्रह॒न्ता स॑त्य॒ध्वृतं॑ वृजिना॒यन्त॑मा॒भुम्
verses.transliteration: ásat sú me jaritaḥ sā́bhivegó  yát sunvaté yájamānāya śíkṣam  ánāśīrdām ahám asmi prahantā́  satyadhvŕ̥taṃ vr̥jināyántam ābhúm

translation.text: THIS, singer, is my firm determination, to aid the worshipper who pours the Soma. I slay the man who brings no milkoblation, unrighteous, powerful, the truth's perverter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदीद॒हं यु॒धये॑ सं॒नया॒न्यदे॑वयून्त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ शूशु॑जानान् अ॒मा ते॒ तुम्रं॑ वृष॒भं प॑चानि ती॒व्रं सु॒तं प॑ञ्चद॒शं नि षि॑ञ्चम्
verses.transliteration: yádī́d aháṃ yudháye saṃnáyāni-  ádevayūn tanvā̀ śū́śujānān  amā́ te túmraṃ vr̥ṣabhám pacāni  tīvráṃ sutám pañcadaśáṃ ní ṣiñcam

translation.text: Then Will I, when I lead my friends to battle against the radiant persons of the godless, Prepare for thee at home a vigorous bullock, and pour for thee the fifteen-fold strong juices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाहं तं वे॑द॒ य इति॒ ब्रवी॒त्यदे॑वयून्त्स॒मर॑णे जघ॒न्वान् य॒दावाख्य॑त्स॒मर॑ण॒मृघा॑व॒दादिद्ध॑ मे वृष॒भा प्र ब्रु॑वन्ति
verses.transliteration: nā́háṃ táṃ veda yá íti brávīti-  ádevayūn samáraṇe jaghanvā́n  yadā́vā́khyat samáraṇam ŕ̥ghāvad  ā́d íd dha me vr̥ṣabhā́ prá bruvanti

translation.text: I know not him who sayeth and declareth that he hath slain the godless in the battle. Soon as they see the furious combat raging, men speak forth praises of my vigorous horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदज्ञा॑तेषु वृ॒जने॒ष्वासं॒ विश्वे॑ स॒तो म॒घवा॑नो म आसन् जि॒नामि॒ वेत्क्षेम॒ आ सन्त॑मा॒भुं प्र तं क्षि॑णां॒ पर्व॑ते पाद॒गृह्य॑
verses.transliteration: yád ájñāteṣu vr̥jáneṣv ā́saṃ  víśve sató maghávāno ma āsan  jinā́mi vét kṣéma ā́ sántam ābhúm  prá táṃ kṣiṇām párvate pādagŕ̥hya

translation.text: While yet my deeds of might were unrecorded, all passed for Maghavans though I existed. The potent one who dwelt in peace I conquered, grasped by the foot and slew him on the mountain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वा उ॒ मां वृ॒जने॑ वारयन्ते॒ न पर्व॑तासो॒ यद॒हं म॑न॒स्ये मम॑ स्व॒नात्कृ॑धु॒कर्णो॑ भयात ए॒वेदनु॒ द्यून्कि॒रणः॒ समे॑जात्
verses.transliteration: ná vā́ u mā́ṃ vr̥jáne vārayante  ná párvatāso yád ahám manasyé  máma svanā́t kr̥dhukárṇo bhayāte-  evéd ánu dyū́n kiráṇaḥ sám ejāt

translation.text: None hinder me in mine heroic exploits, no, not the mountains when I will and purpose. Even the deaf will tremble at my roaring, and every day will dust be agitated.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दर्श॒न्न्वत्र॑ शृत॒पाँ अ॑नि॒न्द्रान्बा॑हु॒क्षदः॒ शर॑वे॒ पत्य॑मानान् घृषुं॑ वा॒ ये नि॑नि॒दुः सखा॑य॒मध्यू॒ न्वे॑षु प॒वयो॑ ववृत्युः
verses.transliteration: dárśan nv átra śr̥tapā́m̐ anindrā́n  bāhukṣádaḥ śárave pátyamānān  ghŕ̥ṣuṃ vā yé ninidúḥ sákhāyam  ádhy ū nv èṣu paváyo vavr̥tyuḥ

translation.text: To see the Indraless oblation-drinkers, mean offerers, o'ertaken by destruction! Then shall the fellies of my car pass over those who have blamed my joyous Friend and scorned him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॒र्वौक्षी॒र्व्यु१॒॑ आयु॑रान॒ड्दर्ष॒न्नु पूर्वो॒ अप॑रो॒ नु द॑र्षत् द्वे प॒वस्ते॒ परि॒ तं न भू॑तो॒ यो अ॒स्य पा॒रे रज॑सो वि॒वेष॑
verses.transliteration: ábhūr v aúkṣīr vy ù ā́yur ānaḍ  dárṣan nú pū́rvo áparo nú darṣat  dvé paváste pári táṃ ná bhūto  yó asyá pāré rájaso vivéṣa

translation.text: Thou wast, thou grewest to full vital vigour: an earlier saw, a later one shall see thee. Two canopies, as 'twere, are round about him who reacheth to the limit of this region.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गावो॒ यवं॒ प्रयु॑ता अ॒र्यो अ॑क्ष॒न्ता अ॑पश्यं स॒हगो॑पा॒श्चर॑न्तीः हवा॒ इद॒र्यो अ॒भितः॒ समा॑य॒न्किय॑दासु॒ स्वप॑तिश्छन्दयाते
verses.transliteration: gā́vo yávam práyutā aryó akṣan  tā́ apaśyaṃ sahágopāś cárantīḥ  hávā íd aryó abhítaḥ sám āyan  kíyad āsu svápatiś chandayāte

translation.text: The freed kine eat the barley of the pious. I saw them as they wandered with the herdsman. The calling of the pious rang around them. What portion will these kine afford their owner?

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं यद्वयं॑ यव॒सादो॒ जना॑नाम॒हं य॒वाद॑ उ॒र्वज्रे॑ अ॒न्तः अत्रा॑ यु॒क्तो॑ऽवसा॒तार॑मिच्छा॒दथो॒ अयु॑क्तं युनजद्वव॒न्वान्
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yád váyaṃ yavasā́do jánānām  aháṃ yavā́da urvájre antáḥ  átrā yuktò 'vasātā́ram ichād  átho áyuktaṃ yunajad vavanvā́n

translation.text: When we who cat the grass of men are gathered I am with barley-eaters in the corn-land. There shall the captor yoke the yokeless bullock, and he who hath been yoked seek one to loose him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्रेदु॑ मे मंससे स॒त्यमु॒क्तं द्वि॒पाच्च॒ यच्चतु॑ष्पात्संसृ॒जानि॑ स्त्री॒भिर्यो अत्र॒ वृष॑णं पृत॒न्यादयु॑द्धो अस्य॒ वि भ॑जानि॒ वेदः॑
verses.transliteration: átréd u me maṃsase satyám uktáṃ  dvipā́c ca yác cátuṣpāt saṃsr̥jā́ni  strībhír yó átra vŕ̥ṣaṇam pr̥tanyā́d  áyuddho asya ví bhajāni védaḥ

translation.text: There wilt thou hold as true my spoken purpose, to bring together quadrupeds. and bipeds. I will divide, without a fight, his riches who warreth here, against the Bull, with women.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्या॑न॒क्षा दु॑हि॒ता जात्वास॒ कस्तां वि॒द्वाँ अ॒भि म॑न्याते अ॒न्धाम् क॒त॒रो मे॒निं प्रति॒ तं मु॑चाते॒ य ईं॒ वहा॑ते॒ य ईं॑ वा वरे॒यात्
verses.transliteration: yásyānakṣā́ duhitā́ jā́tv ā́sa  kás tā́ṃ vidvā́m̐ abhí manyāte andhā́m  kataró mením práti tám mucāte  yá īṃ váhāte yá īṃ vā vareyā́t

translation.text: When a man's daughter hath been ever eyeless, who, knowing, will be wroth with her for blindness? Which of the two will loose on him his anger-the man who leads her home or he who woos her?

verses.sanskrit_deva: किय॑ती॒ योषा॑ मर्य॒तो व॑धू॒योः परि॑प्रीता॒ पन्य॑सा॒ वार्ये॑ण भ॒द्रा व॒धूर्भ॑वति॒ यत्सु॒पेशाः॑ स्व॒यं सा मि॒त्रं व॑नुते॒ जने॑ चित्
verses.transliteration: kíyatī yóṣā maryató vadhūyóḥ  páriprītā pányasā vā́ryeṇa  bhadrā́ vadhū́r bhavati yát supéśāḥ  svayáṃ sā́ mitráṃ vanute jáne cit

translation.text: How many a maid is pleasing to the suitor who fain would marry for her splendid riches? If the girl be both good and fair of feature, she finds, herself, a friend among the people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒त्तो ज॑गार प्र॒त्यञ्च॑मत्ति शी॒र्ष्णा शिरः॒ प्रति॑ दधौ॒ वरू॑थम् आसी॑न ऊ॒र्ध्वामु॒पसि॑ क्षिणाति॒ न्य॑ङ्ङुत्ता॒नामन्वे॑ति॒ भूमि॑म्
verses.transliteration: pattó jagāra pratyáñcam atti  śīrṣṇā́ śíraḥ práti dadhau várūtham  ā́sīna ūrdhvā́m upási kṣiṇāti  nyàṅṅ uttānā́m ánv eti bhū́mim

translation.text: His feet have grasped: he eats the man who meets him. Around his head he sets the head for shelter. Sitting anear and right above he smites us, and follows earth that lies spread out beneath him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हन्न॑च्छा॒यो अ॑पला॒शो अर्वा॑ त॒स्थौ मा॒ता विषि॑तो अत्ति॒ गर्भः॑ अ॒न्यस्या॑ व॒त्सं रि॑ह॒ती मि॑माय॒ कया॑ भु॒वा नि द॑धे धे॒नुरूधः॑
verses.transliteration: br̥hánn achāyó apalāśó árvā  tasthaú mātā́ víṣito atti gárbhaḥ  anyásyā vatsáṃ rihatī́ mimāya  káyā bhuvā́ ní dadhe dhenúr ū́dhaḥ

translation.text: High, leafless, shadowless, and swift is Heaven: the Mother stands, the Youngling, loosed, is feeding. Loud hath she lowed, licking Another's offspring. In what world hath the Cow laid down her udder?

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त वी॒रासो॑ अध॒रादुदा॑यन्न॒ष्टोत्त॒रात्ता॒त्सम॑जग्मिर॒न्ते नव॑ प॒श्चाता॑त्स्थिवि॒मन्त॑ आय॒न्दश॒ प्राक्सानु॒ वि ति॑र॒न्त्यश्नः॑
verses.transliteration: saptá vīrā́so adharā́d úd āyann  aṣṭóttarā́ttāt sám ajagmiran té  náva paścā́tāt sthivimánta āyan  dáśa prā́k sā́nu ví tiranty áśnaḥ

translation.text: Seven heroes from the nether part ascended, and from the upper part came eight together. Nine from behind came armed with winnowing-baskets: ten from the front pressed o'er the rock's high ridges.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒शा॒नामेकं॑ कपि॒लं स॑मा॒नं तं हि॑न्वन्ति॒ क्रत॑वे॒ पार्या॑य गर्भं॑ मा॒ता सुधि॑तं व॒क्षणा॒स्ववे॑नन्तं तु॒षय॑न्ती बिभर्ति
verses.transliteration: daśānā́m ékaṃ kapiláṃ samānáṃ  táṃ hinvanti krátave pā́ryāya  gárbham mātā́ súdhitaṃ vakṣáṇāsu-  ávenantaṃ tuṣáyantī bibharti

translation.text: One of the ten, the tawny, shared in common, they send to execute their final purpose. The Mother carries on her breast the Infant of noble form and soothes it while it knows not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पीवा॑नं मे॒षम॑पचन्त वी॒रा न्यु॑प्ता अ॒क्षा अनु॑ दी॒व आ॑सन् द्वा धनुं॑ बृह॒तीम॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तः प॒वित्र॑वन्ता चरतः पु॒नन्ता॑
verses.transliteration: pī́vānam meṣám apacanta vīrā́ḥ-  nyùptā akṣā́ ánu dīvá āsan  dvā́ dhánum br̥hatī́m apsv àntáḥ  pavítravantā carataḥ punántā

translation.text: The Heroes dressed with fire the fatted wether: the dice were thrown by way of sport and gaming. Two reach the plain amid the heavenly waters, hallowing and with means of purifying.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि क्रो॑श॒नासो॒ विष्व॑ञ्च आय॒न्पचा॑ति॒ नेमो॑ न॒हि पक्ष॑द॒र्धः अ॒यं मे॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता तदा॑ह॒ द्र्व॑न्न॒ इद्व॑नवत्स॒र्पिर॑न्नः
verses.transliteration: ví krośanā́so víṣvañca āyan  pácāti némo nahí pákṣad ardháḥ  ayám me deváḥ savitā́ tád āha  drvànna íd vanavat sarpírannaḥ

translation.text: Crying aloud they ran in all directions: One half of them will cook, and not the other. To me hath Savitar, this God, declared it: He will perform, whose food is wood and butter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॑श्यं॒ ग्रामं॒ वह॑मानमा॒राद॑च॒क्रया॑ स्व॒धया॒ वर्त॑मानम् सिष॑क्त्य॒र्यः प्र यु॒गा जना॑नां स॒द्यः शि॒श्ना प्र॑मिना॒नो नवी॑यान्
verses.transliteration: ápaśyaṃ grā́maṃ váhamānam ārā́d  acakráyā svadháyā vártamānam  síṣakty aryáḥ prá yugā́ jánānāṃ  sadyáḥ śiśnā́ praminānó návīyān

translation.text: I saw a troop advancing from the distance moved, not by wheels but their own God-like nature. The Friendly One seeks human generations, destroying, still new bands of evil beings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तौ मे॒ गावौ॑ प्रम॒रस्य॑ यु॒क्तौ मो षु प्र से॑धी॒र्मुहु॒रिन्म॑मन्धि आप॑श्चिदस्य॒ वि न॑श॒न्त्यर्थं॒ सूर॑श्च म॒र्क उप॑रो बभू॒वान्
verses.transliteration: etaú me gā́vau pramarásya yuktaú  mó ṣú prá sedhīr múhur ín mamandhi  ā́paś cid asya ví naśanty árthaṃ  sū́raś ca marká úparo babhūvā́n

translation.text: These my two Bulls, even Pramara's, are harnessed: drive them not far; here let them often linger. The waters even shall aid him to his object, and the all-cleansing Sun who is above us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं यो वज्रः॑ पुरु॒धा विवृ॑त्तो॒ऽवः सूर्य॑स्य बृह॒तः पुरी॑षात् श्रव॒ इदे॒ना प॒रो अ॒न्यद॑स्ति॒ तद॑व्य॒थी ज॑रि॒माण॑स्तरन्ति
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ yó vájraḥ purudhā́ vívr̥tto  -aváḥ sū́ryasya br̥hatáḥ púrīṣāt  śráva íd enā́ paró anyád asti  tád avyathī́ jarimā́ṇas taranti

translation.text: This is the thunderbolt which often whirleth down from the lofty misty realm of Sûrya. Beyond this realm there is another glory so through old age they pass and feel no sorrow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒क्षेवृ॑क्षे॒ निय॑ता मीमय॒द्गौस्ततो॒ वयः॒ प्र प॑तान्पूरु॒षादः॑ अथे॒दं विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं भयात॒ इन्द्रा॑य सु॒न्वदृष॑ये च॒ शिक्ष॑त्
verses.transliteration: vr̥kṣé-vr̥kṣe níyatā mīmayad gaús  táto váyaḥ prá patān pūruṣā́daḥ  áthedáṃ víśvam bhúvanam bhayāte-  índrāya sunvád ŕ̥ṣaye ca śíkṣat

translation.text: Bound fast to,every tree the cow is lowing, and thence the man-consuming birds are flying, Then all this world, though pressing juice for Indra and strengthening the R̥ishi, is affrighted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वानां॒ माने॑ प्रथ॒मा अ॑तिष्ठन्कृ॒न्तत्रा॑देषा॒मुप॑रा॒ उदा॑यन् त्रय॑स्तपन्ति पृथि॒वीम॑नू॒पा द्वा बृबू॑कं वहतः॒ पुरी॑षम्
verses.transliteration: devā́nām mā́ne prathamā́ atiṣṭhan  kr̥ntátrād eṣām úparā úd āyan  tráyas tapanti pr̥thivī́m anūpā́ḥ-  dvā́ bŕ̥būkaṃ vahataḥ púrīṣam

translation.text: In the Gods' mansion stood the first-created, and from their separation came the later. Three warm the Earth while holding stores of water, and Two of these convey the murmuring moisture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा ते॑ जी॒वातु॑रु॒त तस्य॑ विद्धि॒ मा स्मै॑ता॒दृगप॑ गूहः सम॒र्ये आ॒विः स्वः॑ कृणु॒ते गूह॑ते बु॒सं स पा॒दुर॑स्य नि॒र्णिजो॒ न मु॑च्यते
verses.transliteration: sā́ te jīvā́tur utá tásya viddhi  mā́ smaitādŕ̥g ápa gūhaḥ samaryé  āvíḥ svàḥ kr̥ṇuté gū́hate busáṃ  sá pādúr asya nirṇíjo ná mucyate

translation.text: This is thy life: and do thou mark and know it. As such, hide not thyself in time of battle. He manifests the light and hides the vapour: his foot is never free from robes that veil it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वो॒ ह्य१॒॑न्यो अ॒रिरा॑ज॒गाम॒ ममेदह॒ श्वशु॑रो॒ ना ज॑गाम ज॒क्षी॒याद्धा॒ना उ॒त सोमं॑ पपीया॒त्स्वा॑शितः॒ पुन॒रस्तं॑ जगायात्
verses.transliteration: víśvo hy ànyó arír ājagā́ma  máméd áha śváśuro nā́ jagāma  jakṣīyā́d dhānā́ utá sómam papīyāt  svā̀śitaḥ púnar ástaṃ jagāyāt

translation.text: Now all my other friends are here assembled: my Sire-in-law alone hath not come hither. So might he eat the grain and drink the Soma, and, satisfied, return unto; his dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रोरु॑वद्वृष॒भस्ति॒ग्मशृ॑ङ्गो॒ वर्ष्म॑न्तस्थौ॒ वरि॑म॒न्ना पृ॑थि॒व्याः विश्वे॑ष्वेनं वृ॒जने॑षु पामि॒ यो मे॑ कु॒क्षी सु॒तसो॑मः पृ॒णाति॑
verses.transliteration: sá róruvad vr̥ṣabhás tigmáśr̥ṅgo  várṣman tasthau várimann ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  víśveṣv enaṃ vr̥jáneṣu pāmi  yó me kukṣī́ sutásomaḥ pr̥ṇā́ti

translation.text: Loud belloweth the Bull whose horns are sharpened: upon the height above earth's breadth he standeth. That man I guard and save in all his troubles who fills my flanks when he hath shed the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद्रि॑णा ते म॒न्दिन॑ इन्द्र॒ तूया॑न्त्सु॒न्वन्ति॒ सोमा॒न्पिब॑सि॒ त्वमे॑षाम् पच॑न्ति ते वृष॒भाँ अत्सि॒ तेषां॑ पृ॒क्षेण॒ यन्म॑घवन्हू॒यमा॑नः
verses.transliteration: ádriṇā te mandína indra tū́yān  sunvánti sómān píbasi tvám eṣām  pácanti te vr̥ṣabhā́m̐ átsi téṣām  pr̥kṣéṇa yán maghavan hūyámānaḥ

translation.text: Men with the stone press out for thee, O Indra, strong, gladdening Soma, and thereof thou drinkest. Bulls they dress for thee, and of these thou eatest when, Maghavan, with food thou art invited.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं सु मे॑ जरित॒रा चि॑किद्धि प्रती॒पं शापं॑ न॒द्यो॑ वहन्ति लो॒पा॒शः सिं॒हं प्र॒त्यञ्च॑मत्साः क्रो॒ष्टा व॑रा॒हं निर॑तक्त॒ कक्षा॑त्
verses.transliteration: idáṃ sú me jaritar ā́ cikiddhi  pratīpáṃ śā́paṃ nadyò vahanti  lopāśáḥ siṃhám pratyáñcam atsāḥ  kroṣṭā́ varāháṃ nír atakta kákṣāt

translation.text: Resolve for me, O singer, this my riddle: The rivers send their swelling water backward: The fox steals up to the approaching lion: the jackal drives the wild-boar from the brushwood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒था त॑ ए॒तद॒हमा चि॑केतं॒ गृत्स॑स्य॒ पाक॑स्त॒वसो॑ मनी॒षाम् त्वं नो॑ वि॒द्वाँ ऋ॑तु॒था वि वो॑चो॒ यमर्धं॑ ते मघवन्क्षे॒म्या धूः
verses.transliteration: kathā́ ta etád ahám ā́ ciketaṃ  gŕ̥tsasya pā́kas taváso manīṣā́m  tváṃ no vidvā́m̐ r̥tuthā́ ví voco  yám árdhaṃ te maghavan kṣemyā́ dhū́ḥ

translation.text: How shall I solve this riddle, I, the simple, declare the thought of thee the Wise and Mighty? Tell us, well knowing, as befits the season: Whitherward is thy prosperous car advancing?

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा हि मां त॒वसं॑ व॒र्धय॑न्ति दि॒वश्चि॑न्मे बृह॒त उत्त॑रा॒ धूः पु॒रू स॒हस्रा॒ नि शि॑शामि सा॒कम॑श॒त्रुं हि मा॒ जनि॑ता ज॒जान॑
verses.transliteration: evā́ hí mā́ṃ tavásaṃ vardháyanti  diváś cin me br̥hatá úttarā dhū́ḥ  purū́ sahásrā ní śiśāmi sākám  aśatrúṃ hí mā jánitā jajā́na

translation.text: Thus do they magnify me, me the mighty higher than even high heaven is my car-pole. I all at once demolish many thousands: my Sire begot me with no foe to match me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा हि मां त॒वसं॑ ज॒ज्ञुरु॒ग्रं कर्म॑न्कर्म॒न्वृष॑णमिन्द्र दे॒वाः वधीं॑ वृ॒त्रं वज्रे॑ण मन्दसा॒नोऽप॑ व्र॒जं म॑हि॒ना दा॒शुषे॑ वम्
verses.transliteration: evā́ hí mā́ṃ tavásaṃ jajñúr ugráṃ  kárman-karman vŕ̥ṣaṇam indra devā́ḥ  vádhīṃ vr̥tráṃ vájreṇa mandasānó  -ápa vrajám mahinā́ dāśúṣe vam

translation.text: Yea, and the Gods have known me also, Indra, as mighty, fierce and strong in every exploit. Exulting with the bolt I slaughtered Vr̥itra, and for the offerer oped with might the cow-stall.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वास॑ आयन्पर॒शूँर॑बिभ्र॒न्वना॑ वृ॒श्चन्तो॑ अ॒भि वि॒ड्भिरा॑यन् नि सु॒द्र्वं१॒॑ दध॑तो व॒क्षणा॑सु॒ यत्रा॒ कृपी॑ट॒मनु॒ तद्द॑हन्ति
verses.transliteration: devā́sa āyan paraśū́m̐r abibhran  vánā vr̥ścánto abhí viḍbhír āyan  ní sudrvàṃ dádhato vakṣáṇāsu  yátrā kŕ̥pīṭam ánu tád dahanti

translation.text: The Deities approached, they carried axes; splitting the wood they came with their attendants. They laid good timber in the fire-receivers, and burnt the grass up where they found it growing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒शः क्षु॒रं प्र॒त्यञ्चं॑ जगा॒राद्रिं॑ लो॒गेन॒ व्य॑भेदमा॒रात् बृ॒हन्तं॑ चिदृह॒ते र॑न्धयानि॒ वय॑द्व॒त्सो वृ॑ष॒भं शूशु॑वानः
verses.transliteration: śaśáḥ kṣurám pratyáñcaṃ jagāra-  -ádriṃ logéna vy àbhedam ārā́t  br̥hántaṃ cid r̥haté randhayāni  váyad vatsó vr̥ṣabháṃ śū́śuvānaḥ

translation.text: The hare hath swallowed up the opposing razor: I sundered with a clod the distant mountain. The great will I make subject to the little: the calf shall wax in strength and cat the bullock.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒प॒र्ण इ॒त्था न॒खमा सि॑षा॒याव॑रुद्धः परि॒पदं॒ न सिं॒हः नि॒रु॒द्धश्चि॑न्महि॒षस्त॒र्ष्यावा॑न्गो॒धा तस्मा॑ अ॒यथं॑ कर्षदे॒तत्
verses.transliteration: suparṇá itthā́ nakhám ā́ siṣāya-  -ávaruddhaḥ paripádaṃ ná siṃháḥ  niruddháś cin mahiṣás tarṣyā́vān  godhā́ tásmā ayáthaṃ karṣad etát

translation.text: There hath the strong-winged eagle left his talon, as a snared lion leaves the trap that caught him. Even the wild steer in his thirst is captured: the leather strap still holds his foot entangled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तेभ्यो॑ गो॒धा अ॒यथं॑ कर्षदे॒तद्ये ब्र॒ह्मणः॑ प्रति॒पीय॒न्त्यन्नैः॑ सि॒म उ॒क्ष्णो॑ऽवसृ॒ष्टाँ अ॑दन्ति स्व॒यं बला॑नि त॒न्वः॑ शृणा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: tébhyo godhā́ ayáthaṃ karṣad etád  yé brahmáṇaḥ pratipī́yanty ánnaiḥ  simá ukṣṇò 'vasr̥ṣṭā́m̐ adanti  svayám bálāni tanvàḥ śr̥ṇānā́ḥ

translation.text: So may the leather strap their foot entangle who fatten on the viands of the Brahman. They all devour the bulls set free to wander, while they themselves destroy their bodies' vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते शमी॑भिः सु॒शमी॑ अभूव॒न्ये हि॑न्वि॒रे त॒न्व१॒॑ः सोम॑ उ॒क्थैः नृ॒वद्वद॒न्नुप॑ नो माहि॒ वाजा॑न्दि॒वि श्रवो॑ दधिषे॒ नाम॑ वी॒रः
verses.transliteration: eté śámībhiḥ suśámī abhūvan  yé hinviré tanvàḥ sóma ukthaíḥ  nr̥vád vádann úpa no māhi vā́jān  diví śrávo dadhiṣe nā́ma vīráḥ

translation.text: They were well occupied with holy duties who sped in person with their lauds to Soma. Speaking like man, mete to us wealth and booty: in heaven thou hast the name and fame of Hero.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वने॒ न वा॒ यो न्य॑धायि चा॒कञ्छुचि॑र्वां॒ स्तोमो॑ भुरणावजीगः यस्येदिन्द्रः॑ पुरु॒दिने॑षु॒ होता॑ नृ॒णां नर्यो॒ नृत॑मः क्ष॒पावा॑न्
verses.transliteration: váne ná vā yó ny àdhāyi cākáñ  -śúcir vāṃ stómo bhuraṇāv ajīgaḥ  yásyéd índraḥ purudíneṣu hótā  nr̥ṇā́ṃ náryo nŕ̥tamaḥ kṣapā́vān

translation.text: As sits the young bird on the tree rejoicing, ye, swift Pair, have been roused by clear laudation, Whose Herald-Priest through many days is Indra, earth's Guardian, Friend of men, the best of Heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॑ अ॒स्या उ॒षसः॒ प्राप॑रस्या नृ॒तौ स्या॑म॒ नृत॑मस्य नृ॒णाम् अनु॑ त्रि॒शोकः॑ श॒तमाव॑ह॒न्नॄन्कुत्से॑न॒ रथो॒ यो अस॑त्सस॒वान्
verses.transliteration: prá te asyā́ uṣásaḥ prā́parasyāḥ-  nr̥taú syāma nŕ̥tamasya nr̥ṇā́m  ánu triśókaḥ śatám ā́vahan nr̥̄́n  kútsena rátho yó ásat sasavā́n

translation.text: May we, when this Dawn and the next dance hither, be thy best servants, most heroic Hero! Let the victorious car with triple splendour bring hitherward the hundred chiefs with Kutsa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कस्ते॒ मद॑ इन्द्र॒ रन्त्यो॑ भू॒द्दुरो॒ गिरो॑ अ॒भ्यु१॒॑ग्रो वि धा॑व कद्वाहो॑ अ॒र्वागुप॑ मा मनी॒षा आ त्वा॑ शक्यामुप॒मं राधो॒ अन्नैः॑
verses.transliteration: kás te máda indra rántyo bhūd  dúro gíro abhy ùgró ví dhāva  kád vā́ho arvā́g úpa mā manīṣā́  ā́ tvā śakyām upamáṃ rā́dho ánnaiḥ

translation.text: What was the gladdening draught that pleased thee, Indra? Speed through our doors to songs, for thou art mighty. Why comest thou to me, what gift attracts thee? Fain would I bring thee food most meet to offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कदु॑ द्यु॒म्नमि॑न्द्र॒ त्वाव॑तो॒ नॄन्कया॑ धि॒या क॑रसे॒ कन्न॒ आग॑न् मि॒त्रो न स॒त्य उ॑रुगाय भृ॒त्या अन्ने॑ समस्य॒ यदस॑न्मनी॒षाः
verses.transliteration: kád u dyumnám indra tvā́vato nr̥̄́n  káyā dhiyā́ karase kán na ā́gan  mitró ná satyá urugāya bhr̥tyaí-  ánne samasya yád ásan manīṣā́ḥ

translation.text: Indra, what fame hath one like thee mid heroes? With what plan wilt thou act? Why hast thou sought us? As a true Friend, Wide-Strider! to sustain us, since food absorbs the thought of each among us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेर॑य॒ सूरो॒ अर्थं॒ न पा॒रं ये अ॑स्य॒ कामं॑ जनि॒धा इ॑व॒ ग्मन् गिर॑श्च॒ ये ते॑ तुविजात पू॒र्वीर्नर॑ इन्द्र प्रति॒शिक्ष॒न्त्यन्नैः॑
verses.transliteration: préraya sū́ro árthaṃ ná pāráṃ  yé asya kā́maṃ janidhā́ iva gmán  gíraś ca yé te tuvijāta pūrvī́r  nára indra pratiśíkṣanty ánnaiḥ

translation.text: Speed happily those, as Sûrya ends his journey, who meet his wish as bridegrooms meet their spouses; Men who present, O Indra strong by nature, with food the many songs that tell thy praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मात्रे॒ नु ते॒ सुमि॑ते इन्द्र पू॒र्वी द्यौर्म॒ज्मना॑ पृथि॒वी काव्ये॑न वरा॑य ते घृ॒तव॑न्तः सु॒तासः॒ स्वाद्म॑न्भवन्तु पी॒तये॒ मधू॑नि
verses.transliteration: mā́tre nú te súmite indra pūrvī́  dyaúr majmánā pr̥thivī́ kā́vyena  várācya te ghr̥távantaḥ sutā́saḥ  svā́dman bhavantu pītáye mádhūni

translation.text: Thine are two measures, Indra, wide-wellmeted, heaven for thy majesty, earth for thy wisdom. Here for thy choice are Somas mixed with butter: may the sweet meath be pleasant for thy drinking.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ मध्वो॑ अस्मा असिच॒न्नम॑त्र॒मिन्द्रा॑य पू॒र्णं स हि स॒त्यरा॑धाः स वा॑वृधे॒ वरि॑म॒न्ना पृ॑थि॒व्या अ॒भि क्रत्वा॒ नर्यः॒ पौंस्यै॑श्च
verses.transliteration: ā́ mádhvo asmā asicann ámatram  índrāya pūrṇáṃ sá hí satyárādhāḥ  sá vāvr̥dhe várimann ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  abhí krátvā náryaḥ paúṃsyaiś ca

translation.text: They have poured out a bowl to him, to Indra, full of sweet juice, for faithful is his bounty. O'er earth's expanse hath he grown great by wisdom, the Friend of man, and by heroic exploits.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्या॑न॒ळिन्द्रः॒ पृत॑नाः॒ स्वोजा॒ आस्मै॑ यतन्ते स॒ख्याय॑ पू॒र्वीः आ स्मा॒ रथं॒ न पृत॑नासु तिष्ठ॒ यं भ॒द्रया॑ सुम॒त्या चो॒दया॑से
verses.transliteration: vy ā̀naḷ índraḥ pŕ̥tanāḥ svójāḥ-  ā́smai yatante sakhyā́ya pūrvī́ḥ  ā́ smā ráthaṃ ná pŕ̥tanāsu tiṣṭha  yám bhadráyā sumatyā́ codáyāse

translation.text: Indra hath conquered in his wars, the Mighty: men strive in multitudes to win his friendship. Ascend thy chariot as it were in battle, which thou shalt drive to us with gracious favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र दे॑व॒त्रा ब्रह्म॑णे गा॒तुरे॑त्व॒पो अच्छा॒ मन॑सो॒ न प्रयु॑क्ति म॒हीं मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य धा॒सिं पृ॑थु॒ज्रय॑से रीरधा सुवृ॒क्तिम्
verses.transliteration: prá devatrā́ bráhmaṇe gātúr etu-  apó áchā mánaso ná práyukti  mahī́m mitrásya váruṇasya dhāsím  pr̥thujráyase rīradhā suvr̥ktím

translation.text: As 'twere with swift exertion of the spirit, let the priest speed to the celestial Waters, The glorious food of Varuṇa and Mitra. To him who spreadeth far this laud I offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो ह॒विष्म॑न्तो॒ हि भू॒ताच्छा॒प इ॑तोश॒तीरु॑शन्तः अव॒ याश्चष्टे॑ अरु॒णः सु॑प॒र्णस्तमास्य॑ध्वमू॒र्मिम॒द्या सु॑हस्ताः
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo havíṣmanto hí bhūtá-  -áchāpá itośatī́r uśantaḥ  áva yā́ś cáṣṭe aruṇáḥ suparṇás  tám ā́syadhvam ūrmím adyā́ suhastāḥ

translation.text: Adhvaryus, he ye ready with oblations,, and come with longing to the longing Waters, Down on which looks the. purple-tinted Eagle. Pour ye that flowing wave this day, deft-handed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ऽप इ॑ता समु॒द्रम॒पां नपा॑तं ह॒विषा॑ यजध्वम् स वो॑ दददू॒र्मिम॒द्या सुपू॑तं॒ तस्मै॒ सोमं॒ मधु॑मन्तं सुनोत
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo 'pá itā samudrám  apā́ṃ nápātaṃ havíṣā yajadhvam  sá vo dadad ūrmím adyā́ súpūtaṃ  tásmai sómam mádhumantaṃ sunota

translation.text: Go to the reservoir, O ye Adhvaryus worship the Waters' Child with your oblations. A consecrated wave he now will give you, so press for him the Soma rich in sweetness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॑नि॒ध्मो दीद॑यद॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तर्यं विप्रा॑स॒ ईळ॑ते अध्व॒रेषु॑ अपां॑ नपा॒न्मधु॑मतीर॒पो दा॒ याभि॒रिन्द्रो॑ वावृ॒धे वी॒र्या॑य
verses.transliteration: yó anidhmó dī́dayad apsv àntár  yáṃ víprāsa ī́ḷate adhvaréṣu  ápāṃ napān mádhumatīr apó dāḥ-  yā́bhir índro vāvr̥dhé vīryā̀ya

translation.text: He who shines bright in floods, unfed with fuel, whom sages worship at their sacrifices: Give waters rich in sweets, Child of the Waters, even those which gave heroic might to Indra:

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ सोमो॒ मोद॑ते॒ हर्ष॑ते च कल्या॒णीभि॑र्युव॒तिभि॒र्न मर्यः॑ ता अ॑ध्वर्यो अ॒पो अच्छा॒ परे॑हि॒ यदा॑सि॒ञ्चा ओष॑धीभिः पुनीतात्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ sómo módate hárṣate ca  kalyāṇī́bhir yuvatíbhir ná máryaḥ  tā́ adhvaryo apó áchā párehi  yád āsiñcā́ óṣadhībhiḥ punītāt

translation.text: Those in which Soma joys and is delighted, as a young man with fair and pleasant damsels. Go thou unto those Waters, O Adhvaryu, and purify with herbs what thou infusest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेद्यूने॑ युव॒तयो॑ नमन्त॒ यदी॑मु॒शन्नु॑श॒तीरेत्यच्छ॑ सं जा॑नते॒ मन॑सा॒ सं चि॑कित्रेऽध्व॒र्यवो॑ धि॒षणाप॑श्च दे॒वीः
verses.transliteration: evéd yū́ne yuvatáyo namanta  yád īm uśánn uśatī́r éty ácha  sáṃ jānate mánasā sáṃ cikitre  -adhvaryávo dhiṣáṇā́paś ca devī́ḥ

translation.text: So maidens bow before the youthful gallant who comes with love to them who yearn to meet him. In heart accordant and in wish one-minded are the Adhvaryus and the heavenly Waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वो॑ वृ॒ताभ्यो॒ अकृ॑णोदु लो॒कं यो वो॑ म॒ह्या अ॒भिश॑स्ते॒रमु॑ञ्चत् तस्मा॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ मधु॑मन्तमू॒र्मिं दे॑व॒माद॑नं॒ प्र हि॑णोतनापः
verses.transliteration: yó vo vr̥tā́bhyo ákr̥ṇod ulokáṃ  yó vo mahyā́ abhíśaster ámuñcat  tásmā índrāya mádhumantam ūrmíṃ  devamā́danam prá hiṇotanāpaḥ

translation.text: He who made room for you when fast imprisoned, who freed you from the mighty imprecation,– Even to that Indra send the meath-rich current, the wave that gratifies the Gods, O Waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रास्मै॑ हिनोत॒ मधु॑मन्तमू॒र्मिं गर्भो॒ यो वः॑ सिन्धवो॒ मध्व॒ उत्सः॑ घृ॒तपृ॑ष्ठ॒मीड्य॑मध्व॒रेष्वापो॑ रेवतीः शृणु॒ता हवं॑ मे
verses.transliteration: prā́smai hinota mádhumantam ūrmíṃ  gárbho yó vaḥ sindhavo mádhva útsaḥ  ghr̥tápr̥ṣṭham ī́ḍyam adhvaréṣu-  ā́po revatīḥ śr̥ṇutā́ hávam me

translation.text: Send forth to him the meath-rich wave, O Rivers, which is your offspring and a well of sweetness, Oil-balmed, to be implored at sacrifices. Ye wealthy Waters, hear mine invocation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं सि॑न्धवो मत्स॒रमि॑न्द्र॒पान॑मू॒र्मिं प्र हे॑त॒ य उ॒भे इय॑र्ति म॒द॒च्युत॑मौशा॒नं न॑भो॒जां परि॑ त्रि॒तन्तुं॑ वि॒चर॑न्त॒मुत्स॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ sindhavo matsarám indrapā́nam  ūrmím prá heta yá ubhé íyarti  madacyútam auśānáṃ nabhojā́m  pári tritántuṃ vicárantam útsam

translation.text: Send forth the rapture-giving wave, O Rivers, which Indra drinks, which sets the Twain in motion; The well that springeth from the clouds, desirous, that wandereth triple-formed, distilling transport.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒वर्वृ॑तती॒रध॒ नु द्वि॒धारा॑ गोषु॒युधो॒ न नि॑य॒वं चर॑न्तीः ऋषे॒ जनि॑त्री॒र्भुव॑नस्य॒ पत्नी॑र॒पो व॑न्दस्व स॒वृधः॒ सयो॑नीः
verses.transliteration: āvárvr̥tatīr ádha nú dvidhā́rāḥ-  goṣuyúdho ná niyaváṃ cárantīḥ  ŕ̥ṣe jánitrīr bhúvanasya pátnīr  apó vandasva savŕ̥dhaḥ sáyonīḥ

translation.text: These winding Streams which with their double current, like cattle-raiders, seek the lower pastures,– Waters which dwell together, thrive together, Queens, Mothers of the world, these, R̥ishi, honour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒नोता॑ नो अध्व॒रं दे॑वय॒ज्या हि॒नोत॒ ब्रह्म॑ स॒नये॒ धना॑नाम् ऋ॒तस्य॒ योगे॒ वि ष्य॑ध्व॒मूधः॑ श्रुष्टी॒वरी॑र्भूतना॒स्मभ्य॑मापः
verses.transliteration: hinótā no adhvaráṃ devayajyā́  hinóta bráhma sanáye dhánānām  r̥tásya yóge ví ṣyadhvam ū́dhaḥ  śruṣṭīvárīr bhūtanāsmábhyam āpaḥ

translation.text: Send forth our sacrifice with holy worship send forth the hymn and prayer for gain of riches. For need of sacrifice disclose the udder. Give gracious hearing to our call, O Waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपो॑ रेवतीः॒ क्षय॑था॒ हि वस्वः॒ क्रतुं॑ च भ॒द्रं बि॑भृ॒थामृतं॑ च रा॒यश्च॒ स्थ स्व॑प॒त्यस्य॒ पत्नीः॒ सर॑स्वती॒ तद्गृ॑ण॒ते वयो॑ धात्
verses.transliteration: ā́po revatīḥ kṣáyathā hí vásvaḥ  krátuṃ ca bhadrám bibhr̥thā́mŕ̥taṃ ca  rāyáś ca sthá svapatyásya pátnīḥ  sárasvatī tád gr̥ṇaté váyo dhāt

translation.text: For, wealthy Waters, ye control all treasures: ye bring auspicious intellect and Amrit. Ye are the Queens of independent riches Sarasvatî give full life to the singer!

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॒ यदापो॒ अदृ॑श्रमाय॒तीर्घृ॒तं पयां॑सि॒ बिभ्र॑ती॒र्मधू॑नि अ॒ध्व॒र्युभि॒र्मन॑सा संविदा॒ना इन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमं॒ सुषु॑तं॒ भर॑न्तीः
verses.transliteration: práti yád ā́po ádr̥śram āyatī́r  ghr̥tám páyāṃsi bíbhratīr mádhūni  adhvaryúbhir mánasā saṃvidānā́ḥ-  índrāya sómaṃ súṣutam bhárantīḥ

translation.text: When I behold the Waters coming hither, carrying with them milk and mcath and butter, Bearing the well-pressed Soma juice to Indra, they harmonize in spirit with Adhvaryus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एमा अ॑ग्मन्रे॒वती॑र्जी॒वध॑न्या॒ अध्व॑र्यवः सा॒दय॑ता सखायः नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ धत्तन सोम्यासो॒ऽपां नप्त्रा॑ संविदा॒नास॑ एनाः
verses.transliteration: émā́ agman revátīr jīvádhanyāḥ-  ádhvaryavaḥ sādáyatā sakhāyaḥ  ní barhíṣi dhattana somyāso  -apā́ṃ náptrā saṃvidānā́sa enāḥ

translation.text: Rich, they are come with wealth for living beings, O friends, Adhvaryus, seat them in their places. Seat them on holy grass, ye Soma-bringers in harmony with the Offspring of the Waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आग्म॒न्नाप॑ उश॒तीर्ब॒र्हिरेदं न्य॑ध्व॒रे अ॑सदन्देव॒यन्तीः॑ अध्व॑र्यवः सुनु॒तेन्द्रा॑य॒ सोम॒मभू॑दु वः सु॒शका॑ देवय॒ज्या
verses.transliteration: ā́gmann ā́pa uśatī́r barhír édáṃ  ny àdhvaré asadan devayántīḥ  ádhvaryavaḥ sunuténdrāya sómam  ábhūd u vaḥ suśákā devayajyā́

translation.text: Now to this grass are come the longing Waters: the Pious Ones are seated at our worship. Adbvaryus, press the Soma juice for Indra so will the service of the Gods be easy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ दे॒वाना॒मुप॑ वेतु॒ शंसो॒ विश्वे॑भिस्तु॒रैरव॑से॒ यज॑त्रः तेभि॑र्व॒यं सु॑ष॒खायो॑ भवेम॒ तर॑न्तो॒ विश्वा॑ दुरि॒ता स्या॑म
verses.transliteration: ā́ no devā́nām úpa vetu śáṃso  víśvebhis turaír ávase yájatraḥ  tébhir vayáṃ suṣakhā́yo bhavema  táranto víśvā duritā́ syāma

translation.text: MAY benediction of the Gods approach us, holy, to aid us with all rapid succours. Therewith may we be happily befriended, and pass triumphant over all our troubles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ चि॒न्मर्तो॒ द्रवि॑णं ममन्यादृ॒तस्य॑ प॒था नम॒सा वि॑वासेत् उ॒त स्वेन॒ क्रतु॑ना॒ सं व॑देत॒ श्रेयां॑सं॒ दक्षं॒ मन॑सा जगृभ्यात्
verses.transliteration: pári cin márto dráviṇam mamanyād  r̥tásya pathā́ námasā́ vivāset  utá svéna krátunā sáṃ vadeta  śréyāṃsaṃ dákṣam mánasā jagr̥bhyāt

translation.text: A man should think on wealth and strive to win it by adoration on the path of Order, Counsel himself with his own mental insight, and grasp still nobler vigour with his spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑यि धी॒तिरस॑सृग्र॒मंशा॑स्ती॒र्थे न द॒स्ममुप॑ य॒न्त्यूमाः॑ अ॒भ्या॑नश्म सुवि॒तस्य॑ शू॒षं नवे॑दसो अ॒मृता॑नामभूम
verses.transliteration: ádhāyi dhītír ásasr̥gram áṃśās  tīrthé ná dasmám úpa yanty ū́māḥ  abhy ā̀naśma suvitásya śūṣáṃ  návedaso amŕ̥tānām abhūma

translation.text: The hymn is formed, poured are the allotted portions: as to a ford friends come unto the Wondrous. We have obtained the power of case and comfort, we haVe become acquainted, with Immortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नित्य॑श्चाकन्या॒त्स्वप॑ति॒र्दमू॑ना॒ यस्मा॑ उ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता ज॒जान॑ भगो॑ वा॒ गोभि॑रर्य॒मेम॑नज्या॒त्सो अ॑स्मै॒ चारु॑श्छदयदु॒त स्या॑त्
verses.transliteration: nítyaś cākanyāt svápatir dámūnāḥ-  yásmā u deváḥ savitā́ jajā́na  bhágo vā góbhir aryamém anajyāt  só asmai cā́ruś chadayad utá syāt

translation.text: Pleased be the Eternal Lord who loves the household with this man whom God Savitar created. May Bhaga Aryaman grace him with cattle: may he appear to him, and be, delightful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं सा भू॑या उ॒षसा॑मिव॒ क्षा यद्ध॑ क्षु॒मन्तः॒ शव॑सा स॒माय॑न् अ॒स्य स्तु॒तिं ज॑रि॒तुर्भिक्ष॑माणा॒ आ नः॑ श॒ग्मास॒ उप॑ यन्तु॒ वाजाः॑
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ sā́ bhūyā uṣásām iva kṣā́ḥ-  yád dha kṣumántaḥ śávasā samā́yan  asyá stutíṃ jaritúr bhíkṣamāṇāḥ-  ā́ naḥ śagmā́sa úpa yantu vā́jāḥ

translation.text: Like the Dawns' dwelling-place be this assembly, where in their might men rich in food have gathered. Striving to share the praises of this singer. To us come strengthening and effectual riches!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्येदे॒षा सु॑म॒तिः प॑प्रथा॒नाभ॑वत्पू॒र्व्या भूम॑ना॒ गौः अ॒स्य सनी॑ळा॒ असु॑रस्य॒ योनौ॑ समा॒न आ भर॑णे॒ बिभ्र॑माणाः
verses.transliteration: asyéd eṣā́ sumatíḥ paprathānā́-  -ábhavat pūrvyā́ bhū́manā gaúḥ  asyá sánīḷā ásurasya yónau  samāná ā́ bháraṇe bíbhramāṇāḥ

translation.text: This Bull's most gracious far-extended favour existed first of all in full abundance. By his support they are maintained in common who in the Asura's mansion dwell together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं स्वि॒द्वनं॒ क उ॒ स वृ॒क्ष आ॑स॒ यतो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी नि॑ष्टत॒क्षुः सं॒त॒स्था॒ने अ॒जरे॑ इ॒तऊ॑ती॒ अहा॑नि पू॒र्वीरु॒षसो॑ जरन्त
verses.transliteration: kíṃ svid vánaṃ ká u sá vr̥kṣá āsa  yáto dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ niṣṭatakṣúḥ  saṃtasthāné ajáre itáūtī  áhāni pūrvī́r uṣáso jaranta

translation.text: What was the tree, what wood, in sooth, produced it, from which they fashioned forth the Earth and Heaven? These Twain stand fast and wax not old for ever: these have sung praise to many a day and morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नैताव॑दे॒ना प॒रो अ॒न्यद॑स्त्यु॒क्षा स द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी बि॑भर्ति त्वचं॑ प॒वित्रं॑ कृणुत स्व॒धावा॒न्यदीं॒ सूर्यं॒ न ह॒रितो॒ वह॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: naítā́vad enā́ paró anyád asti-  ukṣā́ sá dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ bibharti  tvácam pavítraṃ kr̥ṇuta svadhā́vān  yád īṃ sū́ryaṃ ná haríto váhanti

translation.text: Not only here is this: more is beyond us. He is the Bull, the Heaven's and Earth's supporter. With power divine he makes his skin a filter, when the Bay Coursers bear him on as Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्ते॒गो न क्षामत्ये॑ति पृ॒थ्वीं मिहं॒ न वातो॒ वि ह॑ वाति॒ भूम॑ मि॒त्रो यत्र॒ वरु॑णो अ॒ज्यमा॑नो॒ऽग्निर्वने॒ न व्यसृ॑ष्ट॒ शोक॑म्
verses.transliteration: stegó ná kṣā́m áty eti pr̥thvī́m  míhaṃ ná vā́to ví ha vāti bhū́ma  mitró yátra váruṇo ajyámāno  -agnír váne ná vy ásr̥ṣṭa śókam

translation.text: He passes o'er the broad earth like a Stega: he penetrates the world as Wind the mist-cloud. He, balmed with oil, near Varuṇa and Mitra, like Agni in the wood, hath shot forth splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्त॒रीर्यत्सूत॑ स॒द्यो अ॒ज्यमा॑ना॒ व्यथि॑रव्य॒थीः कृ॑णुत॒ स्वगो॑पा पु॒त्रो यत्पूर्वः॑ पि॒त्रोर्जनि॑ष्ट श॒म्यां गौर्ज॑गार॒ यद्ध॑ पृ॒च्छान्
verses.transliteration: starī́r yát sū́ta sadyó ajyámānā  vyáthir avyathī́ḥ kr̥ṇuta svágopā  putró yát pū́rvaḥ pitrór jániṣṭa  śamyā́ṃ gaúr jagāra yád dha pr̥chā́n

translation.text: When suddenly called the cow that erst was barren, she, self-protected, ended all her troubles. Earth, when the first son sprang from sire and mother, cast up the gami, that which men were seeking.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त कण्वं॑ नृ॒षदः॑ पु॒त्रमा॑हुरु॒त श्या॒वो धन॒माद॑त्त वा॒जी प्र कृ॒ष्णाय॒ रुश॑दपिन्व॒तोध॑र्ऋ॒तमत्र॒ नकि॑रस्मा अपीपेत्
verses.transliteration: utá káṇvaṃ nr̥ṣádaḥ putrám āhur  utá śyāvó dhánam ā́datta vājī́  prá kr̥ṣṇā́ya rúśad apinvatódhar  r̥tám átra nákir asmā apīpet

translation.text: To Nr̥ishad's son they gave the name of Kainva, and he the brown-hued courser won the treasure. For him dark-coloured streamed the shining udder: none made it swell for him. Thus Order willed it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सु ग्मन्ता॑ धियसा॒नस्य॑ स॒क्षणि॑ व॒रेभि॑र्व॒राँ अ॒भि षु प्र॒सीद॑तः अ॒स्माक॒मिन्द्र॑ उ॒भयं॑ जुजोषति॒ यत्सो॒म्यस्यान्ध॑सो॒ बुबो॑धति
verses.transliteration: prá sú gmántā dhiyasānásya sakṣáṇi  varébhir varā́m̐ abhí ṣú prasī́dataḥ  asmā́kam índra ubháyaṃ jujoṣati  yát somyásyā́ndhaso búbodhati

translation.text: FORTH speed the Pair to bring the meditating God, benevolent with boons sent in return for boons. May Indra graciously accept both gifts from us, when he hath knowledge of the flowing Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वी॑न्द्र यासि दि॒व्यानि॑ रोच॒ना वि पार्थि॑वानि॒ रज॑सा पुरुष्टुत ये त्वा॒ वह॑न्ति॒ मुहु॑रध्व॒राँ उप॒ ते सु व॑न्वन्तु वग्व॒नाँ अ॑रा॒धसः॑
verses.transliteration: vī̀ndra yāsi divyā́ni rocanā́  ví pā́rthivāni rájasā puruṣṭuta  yé tvā váhanti múhur adhvarā́m̐ úpa  té sú vanvantu vagvanā́m̐ arādhásaḥ

translation.text: Thou wanderest far, O Indra, through the spheres of light and realms of earth, the region, thou whom many praise! Let those who often bring their solemn rites conquer the noisy babblers who present no gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदिन्मे॑ छन्त्स॒द्वपु॑षो॒ वपु॑ष्टरं पु॒त्रो यज्जानं॑ पि॒त्रोर॒धीय॑ति जा॒या पतिं॑ वहति व॒ग्नुना॑ सु॒मत्पुं॒स इद्भ॒द्रो व॑ह॒तुः परि॑ष्कृतः
verses.transliteration: tád ín me chantsad vápuṣo vápuṣṭaram  putró yáj jā́nam pitrór adhī́yati  jāyā́ pátiṃ vahati vagnúnā sumát  puṃsá íd bhadró vahatúḥ páriṣkr̥taḥ

translation.text: More beautiful than beauty must this seem to me, when the son duly careth for his parents' line. The wife attracts the husband: with a shout of joy the man's auspicious marriage is performed aright.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदित्स॒धस्थ॑म॒भि चारु॑ दीधय॒ गावो॒ यच्छास॑न्वह॒तुं न धे॒नवः॑ मा॒ता यन्मन्तु॑र्यू॒थस्य॑ पू॒र्व्याभि वा॒णस्य॑ स॒प्तधा॑तु॒रिज्जनः॑
verses.transliteration: tád ít sadhástham abhí cā́ru dīdhaya  gā́vo yác chā́san vahatúṃ ná dhenávaḥ  mātā́ yán mántur yūthásya pūrvyā́-  -abhí vāṇásya saptádhātur íj jánaḥ

translation.text: This beauteous place of meeting have I looked upon, where, like milch-cows, the kine order the marriage train; Where the Herd's Mother counts as first and best of all, and round her are the seven-toned people of the choir.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वोऽच्छा॑ रिरिचे देव॒युष्प॒दमेको॑ रु॒द्रेभि॑र्याति तु॒र्वणिः॑ ज॒रा वा॒ येष्व॒मृते॑षु दा॒वने॒ परि॑ व॒ ऊमे॑भ्यः सिञ्चता॒ मधु॑
verses.transliteration: prá vó 'chā ririce devayúṣ padám  éko rudrébhir yāti turváṇiḥ  jarā́ vā yéṣv amŕ̥teṣu dāváne  pári va ū́mebhyaḥ siñcatā mádhu

translation.text: The Pious One hath reached your place before the rest: One only moves victorious with the Rudras' band. To these your helpers pour our meath, Immortal Gods, with whom your song of praise hath power to win their gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि॒धी॒यमा॑न॒मप॑गूळ्हम॒प्सु प्र मे॑ दे॒वानां॑ व्रत॒पा उ॑वाच इन्द्रो॑ वि॒द्वाँ अनु॒ हि त्वा॑ च॒चक्ष॒ तेना॒हम॑ग्ने॒ अनु॑शिष्ट॒ आगा॑म्
verses.transliteration: nidhīyámānam ápagūḷham apsú  prá me devā́nāṃ vratapā́ uvāca  índro vidvā́m̐ ánu hí tvā cacákṣa  ténāhám agne ánuśiṣṭa ā́gām

translation.text: He who maintains the Laws of God informed me that thou wast lying hidden in the waters. Indra, who knoweth well, beheld and showed thee. By him instructed am I come, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अक्षे॑त्रवित्क्षेत्र॒विदं॒ ह्यप्रा॒ट् स प्रैति॑ क्षेत्र॒विदानु॑शिष्टः ए॒तद्वै भ॒द्रम॑नु॒शास॑नस्यो॒त स्रु॒तिं वि॑न्दत्यञ्ज॒सीना॑म्
verses.transliteration: ákṣetravit kṣetravídaṃ hy áprāṭ  sá praíti kṣetravídā́nuśiṣṭaḥ  etád vaí bhadrám anuśā́sanasya-  -utá srutíṃ vindaty añjasī́nām

translation.text: The stranger asks the way of him who knows it: taught by the skilful guide he travels onward. This is, in truth, the blessing of instruction: he finds the path that leads directly forward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्येदु॒ प्राणी॒दम॑मन्नि॒माहापी॑वृतो अधयन्मा॒तुरूधः॑ एमे॑नमाप जरि॒मा युवा॑न॒महे॑ळ॒न्वसुः॑ सु॒मना॑ बभूव
verses.transliteration: adyéd u prā́ṇīd ámamann imā́hā-  -ápīvr̥to adhayan mātúr ū́dhaḥ  ém enam āpa jarimā́ yúvānam  áheḷan vásuḥ sumánā babhūva

translation.text: Even now he breathed: these days hath he remembered. Concealed, he sucked the bosom of his Mother. Yet in his youth old age hath come upon him: he hath grown gracious, good, and free from anger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तानि॑ भ॒द्रा क॑लश क्रियाम॒ कुरु॑श्रवण॒ दद॑तो म॒घानि॑ दा॒न इद्वो॑ मघवानः॒ सो अ॑स्त्व॒यं च॒ सोमो॑ हृ॒दि यं बिभ॑र्मि
verses.transliteration: etā́ni bhadrā́ kalaśa kriyāma  kúruśravaṇa dádato maghā́ni  dāná íd vo maghavānaḥ só astu-  ayáṃ ca sómo hr̥dí yám bíbharmi

translation.text: O Kalasa, all these blessings will we bring them, O Kuruṣravaṇa, who give rich presents. May he, O wealthy princes, and this Soma which I am bearing in my heart, reward you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र मा॑ युयुज्रे प्र॒युजो॒ जना॑नां॒ वहा॑मि स्म पू॒षण॒मन्त॑रेण विश्वे॑ दे॒वासो॒ अध॒ माम॑रक्षन्दुः॒शासु॒रागा॒दिति॒ घोष॑ आसीत्
verses.transliteration: prá mā yuyujre prayújo jánānāṃ  váhāmi sma pūṣáṇam ántareṇa  víśve devā́so ádha mā́m arakṣan  duḥśā́sur ā́gād íti ghóṣa āsīt

translation.text: THE urgings of the people have impelled me, and by,the nearest way I bring you Pûshan. The Universal Gods have brought me safely. The cry was heard, Behold, Dubsasu cometh!

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं मा॑ तपन्त्य॒भितः॑ स॒पत्नी॑रिव॒ पर्श॑वः नि बा॑धते॒ अम॑तिर्न॒ग्नता॒ जसु॒र्वेर्न वे॑वीयते म॒तिः
verses.transliteration: sám mā tapanty abhítaḥ  sapátnīr iva párśavaḥ  ní bādhate ámatir nagnátā jásur  vér ná vevīyate matíḥ

translation.text: The ribs that compass me give pain and trouble me like rival wives. Indigence, nakedness, exhaustion press me sore: my mind is fluttering like a bird's.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मूषो॒ न शि॒श्ना व्य॑दन्ति मा॒ध्यः॑ स्तो॒तारं॑ ते शतक्रतो स॒कृत्सु नो॑ मघवन्निन्द्र मृळ॒याधा॑ पि॒तेव॑ नो भव
verses.transliteration: mū́ṣo ná śiśnā́ vy àdanti mādhyàḥ-  stotā́raṃ te śatakrato  sakŕ̥t sú no maghavann indra mr̥ḷaya-  -ádhā pitéva no bhava

translation.text: As rats eat weavers' threads, cares are consuming me, thy singer, gatakratu, me. Have mercy on us once, O Indra, Bounteous Lord: be thou a Father unto us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒रु॒श्रव॑णमावृणि॒ राजा॑नं॒ त्रास॑दस्यवम् मंहि॑ष्ठं वा॒घता॒मृषिः॑
verses.transliteration: kuruśrávaṇam āvr̥ṇi  rā́jānaṃ trā́sadasyavam  máṃhiṣṭhaṃ vāghátām ŕ̥ṣiḥ

translation.text: I the priests' R̥ishi chose as prince most liberal Kuruṣravaṇa, The son of Trasadasyu's son,

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ मा ह॒रितो॒ रथे॑ ति॒स्रो वह॑न्ति साधु॒या स्तवै॑ स॒हस्र॑दक्षिणे
verses.transliteration: yásya mā haríto ráthe  tisró váhanti sādhuyā́  stávai sahásradakṣiṇe

translation.text: Whose three bays harnessed to the car bear me straight onward: I will laud The giver of a thousand meeds,

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ प्रस्वा॑दसो॒ गिर॑ उप॒मश्र॑वसः पि॒तुः क्षेत्रं॒ न र॒ण्वमू॒चुषे॑
verses.transliteration: yásya prásvādaso gíraḥ-  upamáśravasaḥ pitúḥ  kṣétraṃ ná raṇvám ūcúṣe

translation.text: The sire of Upamaṣravas, even him whose words were passing sweet, As a fair field is to its lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॑ पुत्रोपमश्रवो॒ नपा॑न्मित्रातिथेरिहि पि॒तुष्टे॑ अस्मि वन्दि॒ता
verses.transliteration: ádhi putropamaśravo  nápān mitrātither ihi  pitúṣ ṭe asmi vanditā́

translation.text: Mark, Upamaṣravas, his son, mark, grandson of Mitrâtithi: I am thy father's eulogist.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदीशी॑या॒मृता॑नामु॒त वा॒ मर्त्या॑नाम् जीवे॒दिन्म॒घवा॒ मम॑
verses.transliteration: yád ī́śīyāmŕ̥tānām  utá vā mártyānām  jī́ved ín maghávā máma
