translation.text: If I controlled Immortal Gods, yea, even were I Lord of men, My liberal prince were living still.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न दे॒वाना॒मति॑ व्र॒तं श॒तात्मा॑ च॒न जी॑वति तथा॑ यु॒जा वि वा॑वृते
verses.transliteration: ná devā́nām áti vratáṃ  śatā́tmā caná jīvati  táthā yujā́ ví vāvr̥te

translation.text: None lives, even had he hundred lives, beyond the statute of the Gods So am I parted from my friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒वे॒पा मा॑ बृह॒तो मा॑दयन्ति प्रवाते॒जा इरि॑णे॒ वर्वृ॑तानाः सोम॑स्येव मौजव॒तस्य॑ भ॒क्षो वि॒भीद॑को॒ जागृ॑वि॒र्मह्य॑मच्छान्
verses.transliteration: prāvepā́ mā br̥ható mādayanti  pravātejā́ íriṇe várvr̥tānāḥ  sómasyeva maujavatásya bhakṣó  vibhī́dako jā́gr̥vir máhyam achān

translation.text: SPRUNG from tall trees on windy heights, these rollers transport me as they turn upon the table. Dearer to me the die that never slumbers than the deep draught of Mujavan's own Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न मा॑ मिमेथ॒ न जि॑हीळ ए॒षा शि॒वा सखि॑भ्य उ॒त मह्य॑मासीत् अ॒क्षस्या॒हमे॑कप॒रस्य॑ हे॒तोरनु॑व्रता॒मप॑ जा॒याम॑रोधम्
verses.transliteration: ná mā mimetha ná jihīḷa eṣā́  śivā́ sákhibhya utá máhyam āsīt  akṣásyāhám ekaparásya hetór  ánuvratām ápa jāyā́m arodham

translation.text: She never vexed me nor was angry with me, but to my friends and me was ever gracious. For the die's sake, whose single point is final, mine own devoted wife I alienated.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वेष्टि॑ श्व॒श्रूरप॑ जा॒या रु॑णद्धि॒ न ना॑थि॒तो वि॑न्दते मर्डि॒तार॑म् अश्व॑स्येव॒ जर॑तो॒ वस्न्य॑स्य॒ नाहं वि॑न्दामि कित॒वस्य॒ भोग॑म्
verses.transliteration: dvéṣṭi śvaśrū́r ápa jāyā́ ruṇaddhi  ná nāthitó vindate marḍitā́ram  áśvasyeva járato vásnyasya  nā́háṃ vindāmi kitavásya bhógam

translation.text: My wife holds me aloof, her mother hates me: the wretched man finds none to give him comfort. As of a costly horse grown old and feeble, I find not any profit of the gamester.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्ये जा॒यां परि॑ मृशन्त्यस्य॒ यस्यागृ॑ध॒द्वेद॑ने वा॒ज्य१॒॑क्षः पि॒ता मा॒ता भ्रात॑र एनमाहु॒र्न जा॑नीमो॒ नय॑ता ब॒द्धमे॒तम्
verses.transliteration: anyé jāyā́m pári mr̥śanty asya  yásyā́gr̥dhad védane vājy àkṣáḥ  pitā́ mātā́ bhrā́tara enam āhur  ná jānīmo náyatā baddhám etám

translation.text: Others caress the wife of him whose riches the die hath coveted, that rapid courser: Of him speak father, mother, brothers saying, We know him not: bind him and take him with you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदा॒दीध्ये॒ न द॑विषाण्येभिः परा॒यद्भ्योऽव॑ हीये॒ सखि॑भ्यः न्यु॑प्ताश्च ब॒भ्रवो॒ वाच॒मक्र॑तँ॒ एमीदे॑षां निष्कृ॒तं जा॒रिणी॑व
verses.transliteration: yád ādī́dhye ná daviṣāṇy ebhiḥ  parāyádbhyó 'va hīye sákhibhyaḥ  nyùptāś ca babhrávo vā́cam ákratam̐  émī́d eṣāṃ niṣkr̥táṃ jāríṇīva

translation.text: When I resolve to play with these no longer, my friends depart from me and leave me lonely. When the brown dice, thrown on the board, have rattled, like a fond girl I seek the place of meeting.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒भामे॑ति कित॒वः पृ॒च्छमा॑नो जे॒ष्यामीति॑ त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ शूशु॑जानः अ॒क्षासो॑ अस्य॒ वि ति॑रन्ति॒ कामं॑ प्रति॒दीव्ने॒ दध॑त॒ आ कृ॒तानि॑
verses.transliteration: sabhā́m eti kitaváḥ pr̥chámāno  jeṣyā́mī́ti tanvā̀ śū́śujānaḥ  akṣā́so asya ví tiranti kā́mam  pratidī́vne dádhata ā́ kr̥tā́ni

translation.text: The gamester seeks the gambling-house, and wonders, his body all afire, Shall I be lucky? Still do the dice extend his eager longing, staking his gains against his adversary.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒क्षास॒ इद॑ङ्कु॒शिनो॑ नितो॒दिनो॑ नि॒कृत्वा॑न॒स्तप॑नास्तापयि॒ष्णवः॑ कु॒मा॒रदे॑ष्णा॒ जय॑तः पुन॒र्हणो॒ मध्वा॒ सम्पृ॑क्ताः कित॒वस्य॑ ब॒र्हणा॑
verses.transliteration: akṣā́sa íd aṅkuśíno nitodíno  nikŕ̥tvānas tápanās tāpayiṣṇávaḥ  kumārádeṣṇā jáyataḥ punarháṇo  mádhvā sámpr̥ktāḥ kitavásya barháṇā

translation.text: Dice, verily, are armed with goads and driving-hooks, deceiving and tormenting, causing grievous woe. They give frail gifts and then destroy the man who wins, thickly anointed with the player's fairest good.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒प॒ञ्चा॒शः क्री॑ळति॒ व्रात॑ एषां दे॒व इ॑व सवि॒ता स॒त्यध॑र्मा उ॒ग्रस्य॑ चिन्म॒न्यवे॒ ना न॑मन्ते॒ राजा॑ चिदेभ्यो॒ नम॒ इत्कृ॑णोति
verses.transliteration: tripañcāśáḥ krīḷati vrā́ta eṣāṃ  devá iva savitā́ satyádharmā  ugrásya cin manyáve nā́ namante  rā́jā cid ebhyo náma ít kr̥ṇoti

translation.text: Merrily sports their troop, the three-and-fifty, like Savitar the God whose ways are faithful. They bend not even to the mighty's anger: the King himself pays homage and reveres them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नी॒चा व॑र्तन्त उ॒परि॑ स्फुरन्त्यह॒स्तासो॒ हस्त॑वन्तं सहन्ते दि॒व्या अङ्गा॑रा॒ इरि॑णे॒ न्यु॑प्ताः शी॒ताः सन्तो॒ हृद॑यं॒ निर्द॑हन्ति
verses.transliteration: nīcā́ vartanta upári sphuranti-  ahastā́so hástavantaṃ sahante  divyā́ áṅgārā íriṇe nyùptāḥ  śītā́ḥ sánto hŕ̥dayaṃ nír dahanti

translation.text: Downward they roll, and then spring quickly upward, and, handless, force the man with hands to serve them. Cast on the board, like lumps of magic charcoal, though cold themselves they bum the heart to ashes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒या त॑प्यते कित॒वस्य॑ ही॒ना मा॒ता पु॒त्रस्य॒ चर॑तः॒ क्व॑ स्वित् ऋ॒णा॒वा बिभ्य॒द्धन॑मि॒च्छमा॑नो॒ऽन्येषा॒मस्त॒मुप॒ नक्त॑मेति
verses.transliteration: jāyā́ tapyate kitavásya hīnā́  mātā́ putrásya cárataḥ kvà svit  r̥ṇāvā́ bíbhyad dhánam ichámāno  -anyéṣām ástam úpa náktam eti

translation.text: The gambler's wife is left forlorn and wretched: the mother mourns the son who wanders homeless. In constant fear, in debt, and seeking riches, he goes by night unto the home of others.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्त्रियं॑ दृ॒ष्ट्वाय॑ कित॒वं त॑तापा॒न्येषां॑ जा॒यां सुकृ॑तं च॒ योनि॑म् पू॒र्वा॒ह्णे अश्वा॑न्युयु॒जे हि ब॒भ्रून्त्सो अ॒ग्नेरन्ते॑ वृष॒लः प॑पाद
verses.transliteration: stríyaṃ dr̥ṣṭvā́ya kitaváṃ tatāpa-  -anyéṣāṃ jāyā́ṃ súkr̥taṃ ca yónim  pūrvāhṇé áśvān yuyujé hí babhrū́n  só agnér ánte vr̥ṣaláḥ papāda

translation.text: Sad is the gambler when he sees a matron, another's wife, and his well-ordered dwelling. He yokes the brown steeds in the early morning, and when the fire is cold sinks down an outcast.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वः॑ सेना॒नीर्म॑ह॒तो ग॒णस्य॒ राजा॒ व्रात॑स्य प्रथ॒मो ब॒भूव॑ तस्मै॑ कृणोमि॒ न धना॑ रुणध्मि॒ दशा॒हं प्राची॒स्तदृ॒तं व॑दामि
verses.transliteration: yó vaḥ senānī́r maható gaṇásya  rā́jā vrā́tasya prathamó babhū́va  tásmai kr̥ṇomi ná dhánā ruṇadhmi  dáśāhám prā́cīs tád r̥táṃ vadāmi

translation.text: To the great captain of your mighty army, who hath become the host's imperial leader, To him I show my ten extended fingers: I speak the truth. No wealth am I withholding.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒क्षैर्मा दी॑व्यः कृ॒षिमित्कृ॑षस्व वि॒त्ते र॑मस्व ब॒हु मन्य॑मानः तत्र॒ गावः॑ कितव॒ तत्र॑ जा॒या तन्मे॒ वि च॑ष्टे सवि॒तायम॒र्यः
verses.transliteration: akṣaír mā́ dīvyaḥ kr̥ṣím ít kr̥ṣasva  vitté ramasva bahú mányamānaḥ  tátra gā́vaḥ kitava tátra jāyā́  tán me ví caṣṭe savitā́yám aryáḥ

translation.text: Play not with dice: no, cultivate thy corn-land. Enjoy the gain, and deem that wealth sufficient. There are thy cattle there thy wife, O gambler. So this good Savitar himself hath told me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रं कृ॑णुध्वं॒ खलु॑ मृ॒ळता॑ नो॒ मा नो॑ घो॒रेण॑ चरता॒भि धृ॒ष्णु नि वो॒ नु म॒न्युर्वि॑शता॒मरा॑तिर॒न्यो ब॑भ्रू॒णां प्रसि॑तौ॒ न्व॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: mitráṃ kr̥ṇudhvaṃ khálu mr̥ḷátā no  mā́ no ghoréṇa caratābhí dhr̥ṣṇú  ní vo nú manyúr viśatām árātir  anyó babhrūṇā́m prásitau nv àstu

translation.text: Make me your friend: show us some little mercy. Assail us not with your terrific fierceness. Appeased be your malignity and anger, and let the brown dice snare some other captive.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अबु॑ध्रमु॒ त्य इन्द्र॑वन्तो अ॒ग्नयो॒ ज्योति॒र्भर॑न्त उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु म॒ही द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी चे॑तता॒मपो॒ऽद्या दे॒वाना॒मव॒ आ वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: ábudhram u tyá índravanto agnáyo  jyótir bháranta uṣáso vyùṣṭiṣu  mahī́ dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ cetatām ápo  -adyā́ devā́nām áva ā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: THESE fires associate with Indra are awake, bringing their light when first the Dawn begins to shine. May Heaven and Earth, great Pair, observe our holy work. We claim for us this day the favour of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्योरव॒ आ वृ॑णीमहे मा॒तॄन्त्सिन्धू॒न्पर्व॑ताञ्छर्य॒णाव॑तः अ॒ना॒गा॒स्त्वं सूर्य॑मु॒षास॑मीमहे भ॒द्रं सोमः॑ सुवा॒नो अ॒द्या कृ॑णोतु नः
verses.transliteration: diváspr̥thivyór áva ā́ vr̥ṇīmahe  mātr̥̄́n síndhūn párvatāñ charyaṇā́vataḥ  anāgāstváṃ sū́ryam uṣā́sam īmahe  bhadráṃ sómaḥ suvānó adyā́ kr̥ṇotu naḥ

translation.text: Yea, for ourselves we claim the grace of Heaven and Earth, of Ṣaryaṇâvân, of the Hills and Mother Streams. For innocence we pray to Sûrya and to Dawn. So may the flowing Soma bring us bliss to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यावा॑ नो अ॒द्य पृ॑थि॒वी अना॑गसो म॒ही त्रा॑येतां सुवि॒ताय॑ मा॒तरा॑ उ॒षा उ॒च्छन्त्यप॑ बाधताम॒घं स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: dyā́vā no adyá pr̥thivī́ ánāgaso  mahī́ trāyetāṃ suvitā́ya mātárā  uṣā́ uchánty ápa bādhatām agháṃ  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: May the great Twain, the Mothers, Heaven and Earth, this day preserve us free from sin for peace and happiness. May Morning sending forth her light drive sin afar. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं न॑ उ॒स्रा प्र॑थ॒मा सु॑दे॒व्यं॑ रे॒वत्स॒निभ्यो॑ रे॒वती॒ व्यु॑च्छतु आ॒रे म॒न्युं दु॑र्वि॒दत्र॑स्य धीमहि स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ na usrā́ prathamā́ sudevyàṃ  revát saníbhyo revátī vy ùchatu  āré manyúṃ durvidátrasya dhīmahi  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: May this first Dawn bring us the host of gracious Gods: rich, may it richly shine for us who strive for wealth. The wrath of the malignant may we keep afar. We pray to kindled Agni for feilicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र याः सिस्र॑ते॒ सूर्य॑स्य र॒श्मिभि॒र्ज्योति॒र्भर॑न्तीरु॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु भ॒द्रा नो॑ अ॒द्य श्रव॑से॒ व्यु॑च्छत स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: prá yā́ḥ sísrate sū́ryasya raśmíbhir  jyótir bhárantīr uṣáso vyùṣṭiṣu  bhadrā́ no adyá śrávase vy ùchata  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: Dawns, who come forward with the bright beams of the Sun, and at your earliest flushing bring to us the light, Shine ye on us to-day auspicious, for renown. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न॒मी॒वा उ॒षस॒ आ च॑रन्तु न॒ उद॒ग्नयो॑ जिहतां॒ ज्योति॑षा बृ॒हत् आयु॑क्षाताम॒श्विना॒ तूतु॑जिं॒ रथं॑ स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: anamīvā́ uṣása ā́ carantu naḥ-  úd agnáyo jihatāṃ jyótiṣā br̥hát  ā́yukṣātām aśvínā tū́tujiṃ ráthaṃ  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: Free from all sickness may the Mornings come to us, and let our fires mount upward with a lofty blaze. The Aṣvin Pair have harnessed their swift-moving car. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रेष्ठं॑ नो अ॒द्य स॑वित॒र्वरे॑ण्यं भा॒गमा सु॑व॒ स हि र॑त्न॒धा असि॑ रा॒यो जनि॑त्रीं धि॒षणा॒मुप॑ ब्रुवे स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: śréṣṭhaṃ no adyá savitar váreṇyam  bhāgám ā́ suva sá hí ratnadhā́ ási  rāyó jánitrīṃ dhiṣáṇām úpa bruve  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: Send us to-day a portion choice and excellent, O Savitar, for thou art he who dealeth wealth. I cry to Dhishaṇâ, Mother of opulence. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिप॑र्तु मा॒ तदृ॒तस्य॑ प्र॒वाच॑नं दे॒वानां॒ यन्म॑नु॒ष्या॒३॒॑ अम॑न्महि विश्वा॒ इदु॒स्राः स्पळुदे॑ति॒ सूर्यः॑ स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: pípartu mā tád r̥tásya pravā́canaṃ  devā́nāṃ yán manuṣyā̀ ámanmahi  víśvā íd usrā́ spáḷ úd eti sū́ryaḥ  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: Further me this declaring of Eternal Law, the Law of Gods, as we mortals acknowledge it! The Sun goes up beholding all the rays of morn. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्वे॒षो अ॒द्य ब॒र्हिषः॒ स्तरी॑मणि॒ ग्राव्णां॒ योगे॒ मन्म॑नः॒ साध॑ ईमहे आ॒दि॒त्यानां॒ शर्म॑णि॒ स्था भु॑रण्यसि स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: adveṣó adyá barhíṣa stárīmaṇi  grā́vṇāṃ yóge mánmanaḥ sā́dha īmahe  ādityā́nāṃ śármaṇi sthā́ bhuraṇyasi  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: This day we pray with innocence in strewing grass, adjusting pressing-stones, and perfecting the hymn. Thou in the Âdityas' keeping movest restlessly. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ ब॒र्हिः स॑ध॒मादे॑ बृ॒हद्दि॒वि दे॒वाँ ई॑ळे सा॒दया॑ स॒प्त होतॄ॑न् इन्द्रं॑ मि॒त्रं वरु॑णं सा॒तये॒ भगं॑ स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: ā́ no barhíḥ sadhamā́de br̥hád diví  devā́m̐ īḷe sādáyā saptá hótr̥̄n  índram mitráṃ váruṇaṃ sātáye bhágaṃ  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: To our great holy grass I bid the Gods at morn to banquet, and will seat them as the seven priests,– Varuṇa, Indra, Mitra, Bhaga for our gain. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त आ॑दित्या॒ आ ग॑ता स॒र्वता॑तये वृ॒धे नो॑ य॒ज्ञम॑वता सजोषसः बृह॒स्पतिं॑ पू॒षण॑म॒श्विना॒ भगं॑ स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: tá ādityā ā́ gatā sarvátātaye  vr̥dhé no yajñám avatā sajoṣasaḥ  bŕ̥haspátim pūṣáṇam aśvínā bhágaṃ  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: Come hither, O Âdityas, for our perfect weal: accordant help our sacrifice that we may thrive. Pûshan, Br̥ihaspati, Bhaga, both Aṣvins, and enkindled Agni we implore for happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्नो॑ देवा यच्छत सुप्रवाच॒नं छ॒र्दिरा॑दित्याः सु॒भरं॑ नृ॒पाय्य॑म् पश्वे॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय जी॒वसे॑ स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑ग्निं स॑मिधा॒नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: tán no devā yachata supravācanáṃ  chardír ādityāḥ subháraṃ nr̥pā́yyam  páśve tokā́ya tánayāya jīváse  svasty àgníṃ samidhānám īmahe

translation.text: Âdityas, Gods, vouchsafe that this our home may be praise-worthy, prosperous, our heroes' sure defence, For cattle, for our sons, for progeny, for life. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ अ॒द्य म॒रुतो॒ विश्व॑ ऊ॒ती विश्वे॑ भवन्त्व॒ग्नयः॒ समि॑द्धाः विश्वे॑ नो दे॒वा अव॒सा ग॑मन्तु॒ विश्व॑मस्तु॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ वाजो॑ अ॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: víśve adyá marúto víśva ūtī́  víśve bhavantv agnáyaḥ sámiddhāḥ  víśve no devā́ ávasā́ gamantu  víśvam astu dráviṇaṃ vā́jo asmé

translation.text: This day may all the Maruts, all he near us with aid: may all our fires be well enkindled. May all Gods come to us with gracious favour. May spoil and wealth he ours, and all possessions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं दे॑वा॒सोऽव॑थ॒ वाज॑सातौ॒ यं त्राय॑ध्वे॒ यं पि॑पृ॒थात्यंहः॑ यो वो॑ गोपी॒थे न भ॒यस्य॒ वेद॒ ते स्या॑म दे॒ववी॑तये तुरासः
verses.transliteration: yáṃ devāsó 'vatha vā́jasātau  yáṃ trā́yadhve yám pipr̥thā́ty áṃhaḥ  yó vo gopīthé ná bhayásya véda  té syāma devávītaye turāsaḥ

translation.text: He whom ye aid, O Deities, in battle, whom ye protect and rescue from affliction, Who fears no danger at your milk-libation, -such may we be to feast the Gods, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ बृह॒ती सु॒पेश॑सा॒ द्यावा॒क्षामा॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा इन्द्रं॑ हुवे म॒रुतः॒ पर्व॑ताँ अ॒प आ॑दि॒त्यान्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒पः स्वः॑
verses.transliteration: uṣā́sānáktā br̥hatī́ supéśasā  dyā́vākṣā́mā váruṇo mitró aryamā́  índraṃ huve marútaḥ párvatām̐ apáḥ-  ādityā́n dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ apáḥ svàḥ

translation.text: THERE are the Dawn and Night, the grand and beauteous Pair, Earth, Heaven, and Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman. Indra I call, the Maruts, Mountains, and the Floods, Âdityas, Heaven and Earth, the Waters, and the Sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यौश्च॑ नः पृथि॒वी च॒ प्रचे॑तस ऋ॒ताव॑री रक्षता॒मंह॑सो रि॒षः मा दु॑र्वि॒दत्रा॒ निर्ऋ॑तिर्न ईशत॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: dyaúś ca naḥ pr̥thivī́ ca prácetasa  r̥tā́varī rakṣatām áṃhaso riṣáḥ  mā́ durvidátrā nírr̥tir na īśata  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: May Dyaus and Pr̥ithivî, wise, true to Holy Law, keep us in safety from distress and injury. Let not malignant Nirr̥iti rule over us. We crave to-day this gracious favour of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑स्मान्नो॒ अदि॑तिः पा॒त्वंह॑सो मा॒ता मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य रे॒वतः॑ स्व॑र्व॒ज्ज्योति॑रवृ॒कं न॑शीमहि॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: víśvasmān no áditiḥ pātv áṃhaso  mātā́ mitrásya váruṇasya revátaḥ  svàrvaj jyótir avr̥káṃ naśīmahi  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Mother of Mitra and of opulent Varuṇa, may Aditi preserve us safe from all distress. May we obtain the light of heaven without a foe. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्रावा॒ वद॒न्नप॒ रक्षां॑सि सेधतु दु॒ष्ष्वप्न्यं॒ निर्ऋ॑तिं॒ विश्व॑म॒त्रिण॑म् आ॒दि॒त्यं शर्म॑ म॒रुता॑मशीमहि॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: grā́vā vádann ápa rákṣāṃsi sedhatu  duṣvápnyaṃ nírr̥tiṃ víśvam atríṇam  ādityáṃ śárma marútām aśīmahi  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: May ringing press-stones keep the Raksasas afar, ill dream, and Nirr̥iti, and each voracious fiend. May the Âdityas and the Maruts shelter us. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एन्द्रो॑ ब॒र्हिः सीद॑तु॒ पिन्व॑ता॒मिळा॒ बृह॒स्पतिः॒ साम॑भिर्ऋ॒क्वो अ॑र्चतु सु॒प्र॒के॒तं जी॒वसे॒ मन्म॑ धीमहि॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: éndro barhíḥ sī́datu pínvatām íḷā  bŕ̥haspátiḥ sā́mabhir r̥kvó arcatu  supraketáṃ jīváse mánma dhīmahi  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Full flow libations; on our grass let Indra sit; Br̥ihaspati the singer laud with Sâma hymns! Wise be our hearts' imaginings that we may live. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वि॒स्पृशं॑ य॒ज्ञम॒स्माक॑मश्विना जी॒राध्व॑रं कृणुतं सु॒म्नमि॒ष्टये॑ प्रा॒चीन॑रश्मि॒माहु॑तं घृ॒तेन॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: divispŕ̥śaṃ yajñám asmā́kam aśvinā  jīrā́dhvaraṃ kr̥ṇutaṃ sumnám iṣṭáye  prācī́naraśmim ā́hutaṃ ghr̥téna  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Ye Aṣvins, make our sacrifice ascend to heaven, and animate the rite that it may send us bliss, Offered with holy oil, with forward-speeding rein. We crave the gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ ह्वये सु॒हवं॒ मारु॑तं ग॒णं पा॑व॒कमृ॒ष्वं स॒ख्याय॑ श॒म्भुव॑म् रा॒यस्पोषं॑ सौश्रव॒साय॑ धीमहि॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: úpa hvaye suhávam mā́rutaṃ gaṇám  pāvakám r̥ṣváṃ sakhyā́ya śambhúvam  rāyás póṣaṃ sauśravasā́ya dhīmahi  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Hither I call the band of Maruts, swift to hear, great, purifying, bringing bliss, to he our Friends. May we increase our wealth to glorify our name. We crave this graciousfavour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पां पेरुं॑ जी॒वध॑न्यं भरामहे देवा॒व्यं॑ सु॒हव॑मध्वर॒श्रिय॑म् सु॒र॒श्मिं सोम॑मिन्द्रि॒यं य॑मीमहि॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: apā́m péruṃ jīvádhanyam bharāmahe  devāvyàṃ suhávam adhvaraśríyam  suraśmíṃ sómam indriyáṃ yamīmahi  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: We bring the Stay of Life, who makes the waters swell, swift-hearing, Friend of Gods, who waits on sacrifice. May we control that Power, Soma whose rays are bright. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒नेम॒ तत्सु॑स॒निता॑ स॒नित्व॑भिर्व॒यं जी॒वा जी॒वपु॑त्रा॒ अना॑गसः ब्र॒ह्म॒द्विषो॒ विष्व॒गेनो॑ भरेरत॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: sanéma tát susanítā sanítvabhir  vayáṃ jīvā́ jīváputrā ánāgasaḥ  brahmadvíṣo víṣvag éno bharerata  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Alive ourselves, with living sons, devoid of guilt, may we win this with winners by fair means to win. Let the prayer-haters bear our sin to every side. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये स्था मनो॑र्य॒ज्ञिया॒स्ते शृ॑णोतन॒ यद्वो॑ देवा॒ ईम॑हे॒ तद्द॑दातन जैत्रं॒ क्रतुं॑ रयि॒मद्वी॒रव॒द्यश॒स्तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: yé sthā́ mánor yajñíyās té śr̥ṇotana  yád vo devā ī́mahe tád dadātana  jaítraṃ krátuṃ rayimád vīrávad yáśas  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Hear us, O ye who claim the worship of mankind, and give us, O ye Gods, the gift for which we pray, Victorious wisdom, fame with heroes and with wealth. We crave to-day this gracious favour of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हद॒द्य म॑ह॒तामा वृ॑णीम॒हेऽवो॑ दे॒वानां॑ बृह॒ताम॑न॒र्वणा॑म् यथा॒ वसु॑ वी॒रजा॑तं॒ नशा॑महै॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: mahád adyá mahatā́m ā́ vr̥ṇīmahe-  -ávo devā́nām br̥hatā́m anarváṇām  yáthā vásu vīrájātaṃ náśāmahai  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: We crave the gracious favour of the Gods to-day, great favour of great Gods, sublime and free from foes, That we may gain rich treasure sprung from hero sons. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods today.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हो अ॒ग्नेः स॑मिधा॒नस्य॒ शर्म॒ण्यना॑गा मि॒त्रे वरु॑णे स्व॒स्तये॑ श्रेष्ठे॑ स्याम सवि॒तुः सवी॑मनि॒ तद्दे॒वाना॒मवो॑ अ॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: mahó agnéḥ samidhānásya śármaṇi-  ánāgā mitré váruṇe svastáye  śréṣṭhe syāma savitúḥ sávīmani  tád devā́nām ávo adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: In great enkindled Agni's keeping, and, for bliss, free from all sin before Mitra and Varuṇa. May we share Savitar's best animating help. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये स॑वि॒तुः स॒त्यस॑वस्य॒ विश्वे॑ मि॒त्रस्य॑ व्र॒ते वरु॑णस्य दे॒वाः ते सौभ॑गं वी॒रव॒द्गोम॒दप्नो॒ दधा॑तन॒ द्रवि॑णं चि॒त्रम॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: yé savitúḥ satyásavasya víśve  mitrásya vraté váruṇasya devā́ḥ  té saúbhagaṃ vīrávad gómad ápno  dádhātana dráviṇaṃ citrám asmé

translation.text: All ye, the Gods whom Savitar the Father of truth, and Varuṇa and Mitra govern, Give us prosperity with hero children, and opulence in kine and various treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒वि॒ता प॒श्चाता॑त्सवि॒ता पु॒रस्ता॑त्सवि॒तोत्त॒रात्ता॑त्सवि॒ताध॒रात्ता॑त् स॒वि॒ता नः॑ सुवतु स॒र्वता॑तिं सवि॒ता नो॑ रासतां दी॒र्घमायुः॑
verses.transliteration: savitā́ paścā́tāt savitā́ purástāt  savitóttarā́ttāt savitā́dharā́ttāt  savitā́ naḥ suvatu sarvátātiṃ  savitā́ no rāsatāṃ dīrghám ā́yuḥ

translation.text: Savitar, Savitar from cast and westward, Savitar, Savitar from north and southward, Savitar send us perfect health and comfort, Savitar let our days of life be lengthened!

verses.sanskrit_deva: नमो॑ मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ चक्ष॑से म॒हो दे॒वाय॒ तदृ॒तं स॑पर्यत दू॒रे॒दृशे॑ दे॒वजा॑ताय के॒तवे॑ दि॒वस्पु॒त्राय॒ सूर्या॑य शंसत
verses.transliteration: námo mitrásya váruṇasya cákṣase  mahó devā́ya tád r̥táṃ saparyata  dūredŕ̥śe devájātāya ketáve  divás putrā́ya sū́ryāya śaṃsata

translation.text: Do homage unto Varuṇa's and Mitra's Eye: offer this solemn worship to the Mighty God, Who seeth far away, the Ensign, born of Gods. Sing praises unto Sûrya, to the Son of Dyaus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा मा॑ स॒त्योक्तिः॒ परि॑ पातु वि॒श्वतो॒ द्यावा॑ च॒ यत्र॑ त॒तन॒न्नहा॑नि च विश्व॑म॒न्यन्नि वि॑शते॒ यदेज॑ति वि॒श्वाहापो॑ वि॒श्वाहोदे॑ति॒ सूर्यः॑
verses.transliteration: sā́ mā satyóktiḥ pári pātu viśváto  dyā́vā ca yátra tatánann áhāni ca  víśvam anyán ní viśate yád éjati  viśvā́hā́po viśvā́hód eti sū́ryaḥ

translation.text: May this my truthful speech guard me on every side wherever heaven and earth and days are spread abroad. All else that is in motion finds a place of rest: the waters ever flow and ever mounts the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ते॒ अदे॑वः प्र॒दिवो॒ नि वा॑सते॒ यदे॑त॒शेभिः॑ पत॒रै र॑थ॒र्यसि॑ प्रा॒चीन॑म॒न्यदनु॑ वर्तते॒ रज॒ उद॒न्येन॒ ज्योति॑षा यासि सूर्य
verses.transliteration: ná te ádevaḥ pradívo ní vāsate  yád etaśébhiḥ pataraí ratharyási  prācī́nam anyád ánu vartate rájaḥ-  úd anyéna jyótiṣā yāsi sūrya

translation.text: No godless man from time remotest draws thee down when thou art driving forth with winged dappled Steeds. One lustre waits upon thee moving to the cast, and, Sûrya, thou arisest with a different light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येन॑ सूर्य॒ ज्योति॑षा॒ बाध॑से॒ तमो॒ जग॑च्च॒ विश्व॑मुदि॒यर्षि॑ भा॒नुना॑ तेना॒स्मद्विश्वा॒मनि॑रा॒मना॑हुति॒मपामी॑वा॒मप॑ दु॒ष्ष्वप्न्यं॑ सुव
verses.transliteration: yéna sūrya jyótiṣā bā́dhase támo  jágac ca víśvam udiyárṣi bhānúnā  ténāsmád víśvām ánirām ánāhutim  ápā́mīvām ápa duṣvápnyaṃ suva

translation.text: O Sûrya, with the light whereby thou scatterest gloom, and with thy ray impellest every moving thing, Keep far from us all feeble, worthless sacrifice, and drive away disease and every evil dream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑स्य॒ हि प्रेषि॑तो॒ रक्ष॑सि व्र॒तमहे॑ळयन्नु॒च्चर॑सि स्व॒धा अनु॑ यद॒द्य त्वा॑ सूर्योप॒ब्रवा॑महै॒ तं नो॑ दे॒वा अनु॑ मंसीरत॒ क्रतु॑म्
verses.transliteration: víśvasya hí préṣito rákṣasi vratám  áheḷayann uccárasi svadhā́ ánu  yád adyá tvā sūryopabrávāmahai  táṃ no devā́ ánu maṃsīrata krátum

translation.text: Sent forth thou guardest well the Universe's law, and in thy wonted way arisest free from wrath. When Sûrya, we address our prayers to thee to-day, may the Gods favour this our purpose and desire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं नो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी तन्न॒ आप॒ इन्द्रः॑ शृण्वन्तु म॒रुतो॒ हवं॒ वचः॑ मा शूने॑ भूम॒ सूर्य॑स्य सं॒दृशि॑ भ॒द्रं जीव॑न्तो जर॒णाम॑शीमहि
verses.transliteration: táṃ no dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ tán na ā́paḥ-  índraḥ śr̥ṇvantu marúto hávaṃ vácaḥ  mā́ śū́ne bhūma sū́ryasya saṃdŕ̥śi  bhadráṃ jī́vanto jaraṇā́m aśīmahi

translation.text: This invocation, these our words may Heaven and Earth, and Indra and the Waters and the Maruts hear. Ne'er may we suffer want in presence of the Sun, and, living happy lives, may we attain old age.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्वाहा॑ त्वा सु॒मन॑सः सु॒चक्ष॑सः प्र॒जाव॑न्तो अनमी॒वा अना॑गसः उ॒द्यन्तं॑ त्वा मित्रमहो दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ ज्योग्जी॒वाः प्रति॑ पश्येम सूर्य
verses.transliteration: viśvā́hā tvā sumánasaḥ sucákṣasaḥ  prajā́vanto anamīvā́ ánāgasaḥ  udyántaṃ tvā mitramaho divé-dive  jyóg jīvā́ḥ práti paśyema sūrya

translation.text: Cheerful in spirit, evermore, and keen of sight, with store of children, free from sickness and from sin, Long-living, may we look, O Sûrya, upon thee uprising day by day, thou great as Mitra is!

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॒ ज्योति॒र्बिभ्र॑तं त्वा विचक्षण॒ भास्व॑न्तं॒ चक्षु॑षेचक्षुषे॒ मयः॑ आ॒रोह॑न्तं बृह॒तः पाज॑स॒स्परि॑ व॒यं जी॒वाः प्रति॑ पश्येम सूर्य
verses.transliteration: máhi jyótir bíbhrataṃ tvā vicakṣaṇa  bhā́svantaṃ cákṣuṣe-cakṣuṣe máyaḥ  āróhantam br̥hatáḥ pā́jasas pári  vayáṃ jīvā́ḥ práti paśyema sūrya

translation.text: Sûrya, may we live long and look upon thee still, thee, O Far-seeing One, bringing the glorious light, The radiant God, the spring of joy to every eye, as thou art mounting up o'er the high shining flood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ ते॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि के॒तुना॒ प्र चेर॑ते॒ नि च॑ वि॒शन्ते॑ अ॒क्तुभिः॑ अ॒ना॒गा॒स्त्वेन॑ हरिकेश सू॒र्याह्ना॑ह्ना नो॒ वस्य॑सावस्य॒सोदि॑हि
verses.transliteration: yásya te víśvā bhúvanāni ketúnā  prá cérate ní ca viśánte aktúbhiḥ  anāgāstvéna harikeśa sūrya-  -áhnāhnā no vásyasā-vasyasód ihi

translation.text: Thou by whose lustre all the world of life comes forth, and by thy beams again returns unto its rest, O Sûrya with the golden hair, ascend for us day after day, still bringing purer innocence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॑ भव॒ चक्ष॑सा॒ शं नो॒ अह्ना॒ शं भा॒नुना॒ शं हि॒मा शं घृ॒णेन॑ यथा॒ शमध्व॒ञ्छमस॑द्दुरो॒णे तत्सू॑र्य॒ द्रवि॑णं धेहि चि॒त्रम्
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no bhava cákṣasā śáṃ no áhnā  śám bhānúnā śáṃ himā́ śáṃ ghr̥ṇéna  yáthā śám ádhvañ chám ásad duroṇé  tát sūrya dráviṇaṃ dhehi citrám

translation.text: Bless us with shine, bless us with perfect daylight, bless us with cold, with fervent heat and lustre. Bestow on us, O Sûrya, varied riches, to bless us in our home and when we travel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माकं॑ देवा उ॒भया॑य॒ जन्म॑ने॒ शर्म॑ यच्छत द्वि॒पदे॒ चतु॑ष्पदे अ॒दत्पिब॑दू॒र्जय॑मान॒माशि॑तं॒ तद॒स्मे शं योर॑र॒पो द॑धातन
verses.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ devā ubháyāya jánmane  śárma yachata dvipáde cátuṣpade  adát píbad ūrjáyamānam ā́śitaṃ  tád asmé śáṃ yór arapó dadhātana

translation.text: Gods, to our living creatures of both kinds vouchsafe protection, both to bipeds and to quadrupeds, That they may drink and eat invigorating food. So grant us health and strength and perfect innocence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वो॑ देवाश्चकृ॒म जि॒ह्वया॑ गु॒रु मन॑सो वा॒ प्रयु॑ती देव॒हेळ॑नम् अरा॑वा॒ यो नो॑ अ॒भि दु॑च्छुना॒यते॒ तस्मि॒न्तदेनो॑ वसवो॒ नि धे॑तन
verses.transliteration: yád vo devāś cakr̥má jihváyā gurú  mánaso vā práyutī devahéḷanam  árāvā yó no abhí duchunāyáte  tásmin tád éno vasavo ní dhetana

translation.text: If by some grievous sin we have provoked the Gods, O Deities, with the tongue or thoughtlessness of heart, That guilt, O Vasus, lay upon the Evil One, on him who ever leads us into deep distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मिन्न॑ इन्द्र पृत्सु॒तौ यश॑स्वति॒ शिमी॑वति॒ क्रन्द॑सि॒ प्राव॑ सा॒तये॑ यत्र॒ गोषा॑ता धृषि॒तेषु॑ खा॒दिषु॒ विष्व॒क्पत॑न्ति दि॒द्यवो॑ नृ॒षाह्ये॑
verses.transliteration: asmín na indra pr̥tsutaú yáśasvati  śímīvati krándasi prā́va sātáye  yátra góṣātā dhr̥ṣitéṣu khādíṣu  víṣvak pátanti didyávo nr̥ṣā́hye

translation.text: O INDRA, in this battle great and glorious, in this loud din of war help us to victory, Where in the strife for kine among bold ring-decked men arrows fly all around and heroes are subdued.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नः॑ क्षु॒मन्तं॒ सद॑ने॒ व्यू॑र्णुहि॒ गोअ॑र्णसं र॒यिमि॑न्द्र श्र॒वाय्य॑म् स्याम॑ ते॒ जय॑तः शक्र मे॒दिनो॒ यथा॑ व॒यमु॒श्मसि॒ तद्व॑सो कृधि
verses.transliteration: sá naḥ kṣumántaṃ sádane vy ū̀rṇuhi  góarṇasaṃ rayím indra śravā́yyam  syā́ma te jáyataḥ śakra medíno  yáthā vayám uśmási tád vaso kr̥dhi

translation.text: At home disclose to us opulence rich in food, streaming with milk, O Indra, meet to be renowned. Ṣakra, may we be thine, the friendly Conqueror's: even as we desire, O Vasu, so do thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो नो॒ दास॒ आर्यो॑ वा पुरुष्टु॒तादे॑व इन्द्र यु॒धये॒ चिके॑तति अ॒स्माभि॑ष्टे सु॒षहाः॑ सन्तु॒ शत्र॑व॒स्त्वया॑ व॒यं तान्व॑नुयाम संग॒मे
verses.transliteration: yó no dā́sa ā́ryo vā puruṣṭuta-  -ádeva indra yudháye cíketati  asmā́bhiṣ ṭe suṣáhāḥ santu śátravas  tváyā vayáṃ tā́n vanuyāma saṃgamé

translation.text: The godless man, much-lauded Indra, whether he be Dâsa or be Ârya, who would war with us,– Easy to conquer he for thee, with us, these foes: with thee may we subdue them in the clash of fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो द॒भ्रेभि॒र्हव्यो॒ यश्च॒ भूरि॑भि॒र्यो अ॒भीके॑ वरिवो॒विन्नृ॒षाह्ये॑ तं वि॑खा॒दे सस्नि॑म॒द्य श्रु॒तं नर॑म॒र्वाञ्च॒मिन्द्र॒मव॑से करामहे
verses.transliteration: yó dabhrébhir hávyo yáś ca bhū́ribhir  yó abhī́ke varivovín nr̥ṣā́hye  táṃ vikhādé sásnim adyá śrutáṃ náram  arvā́ñcam índram ávase karāmahe

translation.text: Him who must be invoked by many and by few, who standeth nigh with comfort in the war of men, Indra, famed Hero, winner in the deadly strife, let us bring hitherward to-day to favour us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒वृजं॒ हि त्वाम॒हमि॑न्द्र शु॒श्रवा॑नानु॒दं वृ॑षभ रध्र॒चोद॑नम् प्र मु॑ञ्चस्व॒ परि॒ कुत्सा॑दि॒हा ग॑हि॒ किमु॒ त्वावा॑न्मु॒ष्कयो॑र्ब॒द्ध आ॑सते
verses.transliteration: svavŕ̥jaṃ hí tvā́m ahám indra śuśráva-  -anānudáṃ vr̥ṣabha radhracódanam  prá muñcasva pári kútsād ihā́ gahi  kím u tvā́vān muṣkáyor baddhá āsate

translation.text: For, Indra, I have heard thee called Self. capturer, One, Steer! who never yields, who urges even the churl. Release thyself from Kutsa and come hither. How shall one like thee sit still bound that he may not move?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वां॒ परि॑ज्मा सु॒वृद॑श्विना॒ रथो॑ दो॒षामु॒षासो॒ हव्यो॑ ह॒विष्म॑ता श॒श्व॒त्त॒मास॒स्तमु॑ वामि॒दं व॒यं पि॒तुर्न नाम॑ सु॒हवं॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: yó vām párijmā suvŕ̥d aśvinā rátho  doṣā́m uṣā́so hávyo havíṣmatā  śaśvattamā́sas tám u vām idáṃ vayám  pitúr ná nā́ma suhávaṃ havāmahe

translation.text: As 'twere the name of father, easy to invoke, we all assembled here invoke this Car of yours, Aṣvins, your swiftly-rolling circumambient Car which he who worships must invoke at eve and dawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चो॒दय॑तं सू॒नृताः॒ पिन्व॑तं॒ धिय॒ उत्पुरं॑धीरीरयतं॒ तदु॑श्मसि य॒शसं॑ भा॒गं कृ॑णुतं नो अश्विना॒ सोमं॒ न चारुं॑ म॒घव॑त्सु नस्कृतम्
verses.transliteration: codáyataṃ sūnŕ̥tāḥ pínvataṃ dhíyaḥ-  út púraṃdhīr īrayataṃ tád uśmasi  yaśásam bhāgáṃ kr̥ṇutaṃ no aśvinā  sómaṃ ná cā́rum maghávatsu nas kr̥tam

translation.text: Awake all pleasant strains and let the hymns flow forth: raise up abundant fulness: this is our desire. Aṣvins, bestow on us a glorious heritage, and give our princes treasure fair as Soma is.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒मा॒जुर॑श्चिद्भवथो यु॒वं भगो॑ऽना॒शोश्चि॑दवि॒तारा॑प॒मस्य॑ चित् अ॒न्धस्य॑ चिन्नासत्या कृ॒शस्य॑ चिद्यु॒वामिदा॑हुर्भि॒षजा॑ रु॒तस्य॑ चित्
verses.transliteration: amājúraś cid bhavatho yuvám bhágo  -anāśóś cid avitā́rāpamásya cit  andhásya cin nāsatyā kr̥śásya cid  yuvā́m íd āhur bhiṣájā rutásya cit

translation.text: Ye are the bliss of her who groweth old at home, and helpers of the slow although he linger last. Men call you too, Nâsatyas, healers of the blind, the thin and feeble, and the man with broken bones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं च्यवा॑नं स॒नयं॒ यथा॒ रथं॒ पुन॒र्युवा॑नं च॒रथा॑य तक्षथुः निष्टौ॒ग्र्यमू॑हथुर॒द्भ्यस्परि॒ विश्वेत्ता वां॒ सव॑नेषु प्र॒वाच्या॑
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ cyávānaṃ sanáyaṃ yáthā rátham  púnar yúvānaṃ caráthāya takṣathuḥ  níṣ ṭaugryám ūhathur adbhyás pári  víśvét tā́ vāṃ sávaneṣu pravā́cyā

translation.text: Ye made Chyavâna, weak and worn with length of days, young again, like a car, that he had power to move. Ye lifted up the son of Tugra from the floods. At our libations must all these your acts be praised.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रा॒णा वां॑ वी॒र्या॒३॒॑ प्र ब्र॑वा॒ जनेऽथो॑ हासथुर्भि॒षजा॑ मयो॒भुवा॑ ता वां॒ नु नव्या॒वव॑से करामहे॒ऽयं ना॑सत्या॒ श्रद॒रिर्यथा॒ दध॑त्
verses.transliteration: purāṇā́ vāṃ vīryā̀ prá bravā jáne-  -átho hāsathur bhiṣájā mayobhúvā  tā́ vāṃ nú návyāv ávase karāmahe  -ayáṃ nāsatyā śrád arír yáthā dádhat

translation.text: We will declare among the folk your ancient deeds heroic; yea, ye were Physicians bringing health. You, you who must be lauded, will we bring for aid, so that this foe of ours, O Aṣvins, may believe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं वा॑मह्वे शृणु॒तं मे॑ अश्विना पु॒त्राये॑व पि॒तरा॒ मह्यं॑ शिक्षतम् अना॑पि॒रज्ञा॑ असजा॒त्याम॑तिः पु॒रा तस्या॑ अ॒भिश॑स्ते॒रव॑ स्पृतम्
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ vām ahve śr̥ṇutám me aśvinā  putrā́yeva pitárā máhyaṃ śikṣatam  ánāpir ájñā asajātyā́matiḥ  purā́ tásyā abhíśaster áva spr̥tam

translation.text: Listen to me, O Aṣvins; I have cried to you. Give me-your aid as sire and mother aid their son. Poor, without kin or friend or ties of blood am I. Save me before it be too late, from this my curse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं रथे॑न विम॒दाय॑ शु॒न्ध्युवं॒ न्यू॑हथुः पुरुमि॒त्रस्य॒ योष॑णाम् यु॒वं हवं॑ वध्रिम॒त्या अ॑गच्छतं यु॒वं सुषु॑तिं चक्रथुः॒ पुरं॑धये
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ ráthena vimadā́ya śundhyúvaṃ  ny ū̀hathuḥ purumitrásya yóṣaṇām  yuváṃ hávaṃ vadhrimatyā́ agachataṃ  yuváṃ súṣutiṃ cakrathuḥ púraṃdhaye

translation.text: Ye, mounted on your chariot brought to Vimada the comely maid of Purumitra as a bride. Ye, came unto the calling of the weakling's dame, and granted noble offspring to the happy wife.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं विप्र॑स्य जर॒णामु॑पे॒युषः॒ पुनः॑ क॒लेर॑कृणुतं॒ युव॒द्वयः॑ यु॒वं वन्द॑नमृश्य॒दादुदू॑पथुर्यु॒वं स॒द्यो वि॒श्पला॒मेत॑वे कृथः
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ víprasya jaraṇā́m upeyúṣaḥ  púnaḥ kalér akr̥ṇutaṃ yúvad váyaḥ  yuváṃ vándanam r̥śyadā́d úd ūpathur  yuváṃ sadyó viśpálām étave kr̥thaḥ

translation.text: Ye gave a ain the vigour of his youthful life to tge sage Kali when old age was coming nigh. Ye rescued Vandana and raised him from the pit, and in a moment gave Vispala power to move.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं ह॑ रे॒भं वृ॑षणा॒ गुहा॑ हि॒तमुदै॑रयतं ममृ॒वांस॑मश्विना यु॒वमृ॒बीस॑मु॒त त॒प्तमत्र॑य॒ ओम॑न्वन्तं चक्रथुः स॒प्तव॑ध्रये
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ ha rebháṃ vr̥ṣaṇā gúhā hitám  úd airayatam mamr̥vā́ṃsam aśvinā  yuvám r̥bī́sam utá taptám átraye-  ómanvantaṃ cakrathuḥ saptávadhraye

translation.text: Ye Aṣvins Twain, endowed with manly strength, brought forth Reblia when hidden in the cave and well-nigh dead, Freed Saptavadliri, and for Atri caused the pit heated with fire to be a pleasant resting-place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं श्वे॒तं पे॒दवे॑ऽश्वि॒नाश्वं॑ न॒वभि॒र्वाजै॑र्नव॒ती च॑ वा॒जिन॑म् च॒र्कृत्यं॑ ददथुर्द्राव॒यत्स॑खं॒ भगं॒ न नृभ्यो॒ हव्यं॑ मयो॒भुव॑म्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ śvetám pedáve 'śvinā́śvaṃ  navábhir vā́jair navatī́ ca vājínam  carkŕ̥tyaṃ dadathur drāvayátsakham  bhágaṃ ná nŕ̥bhyo hávyam mayobhúvam

translation.text: On Pedu ye bestowed, Aṣvins, a courser white, mighty with nine-and-ninety varied gifts of strength, A horse to be renowned, who bore his friend at speed, joy-giving, Bhaga-like to be invoked of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न तं रा॑जानावदिते॒ कुत॑श्च॒न नांहो॑ अश्नोति दुरि॒तं नकि॑र्भ॒यम् यम॑श्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी पुरोर॒थं कृ॑णु॒थः पत्न्या॑ स॒ह
verses.transliteration: ná táṃ rājānāv adite kútaś caná  nā́ṃho aśnoti duritáṃ nákir bhayám  yám aśvinā suhavā rudravartanī  puroratháṃ kr̥ṇutháḥ pátnyā sahá

translation.text: From no side, ye Two Kings whom none may check or stay, doth grief, distress, or danger come u on the man Whom, Aṣvins swift to hear, borne on your glowing path, ye with your Consort make the foremost in the race.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तेन॑ यातं॒ मन॑सो॒ जवी॑यसा॒ रथं॒ यं वा॑मृ॒भव॑श्च॒क्रुर॑श्विना यस्य॒ योगे॑ दुहि॒ता जाय॑ते दि॒व उ॒भे अह॑नी सु॒दिने॑ वि॒वस्व॑तः
verses.transliteration: ā́ téna yātam mánaso jávīyasā  ráthaṃ yáṃ vām r̥bhávaś cakrúr aśvinā  yásya yóge duhitā́ jā́yate diváḥ-  ubhé áhanī sudíne vivásvataḥ

translation.text: Come on that Chariot which the R̥ibhus wrought for you, the Chariot, Aṣvins, that is speedier than thought, At harnessing whereof Heaven's Daughter springs to birth, and from Vivasvan come auspicious Night and Day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता व॒र्तिर्या॑तं ज॒युषा॒ वि पर्व॑त॒मपि॑न्वतं श॒यवे॑ धे॒नुम॑श्विना वृक॑स्य चि॒द्वर्ति॑काम॒न्तरा॒स्या॑द्यु॒वं शची॑भिर्ग्रसि॒ताम॑मुञ्चतम्
verses.transliteration: tā́ vartír yātaṃ jayúṣā ví párvatam  ápinvataṃ śayáve dhenúm aśvinā  vŕ̥kasya cid vártikām antár āsyā̀d  yuváṃ śácībhir grasitā́m amuñcatam

translation.text: Come, Conquerors of the sundered mountain, to our home, Aṣvins who made the cow stream milk for Ṣayu's sake, Ye who delivered even from the wolf's deep throat and set again at liberty the swallowed quail.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तं वां॒ स्तोम॑मश्विनावक॒र्मात॑क्षाम॒ भृग॑वो॒ न रथ॑म् न्य॑मृक्षाम॒ योष॑णां॒ न मर्ये॒ नित्यं॒ न सू॒नुं तन॑यं॒ दधा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: etáṃ vāṃ stómam aśvināv akarma-  -átakṣāma bhŕ̥gavo ná rátham  ny àmr̥kṣāma yóṣaṇāṃ ná márye  nítyaṃ ná sūnúṃ tánayaṃ dádhānāḥ

translation.text: We have prepared this laud for you, O Aṣvins, and, like the Bhr̥igus, as a car have framed it, Have decked it as a maid to meet the bridegroom, and brought it as a son, our stay for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथं॒ यान्तं॒ कुह॒ को ह॑ वां नरा॒ प्रति॑ द्यु॒मन्तं॑ सुवि॒ताय॑ भूषति प्रा॒त॒र्यावा॑णं वि॒भ्वं॑ वि॒शेवि॑शे॒ वस्तो॑र्वस्तो॒र्वह॑मानं धि॒या शमि॑
verses.transliteration: ráthaṃ yā́ntaṃ kúha kó ha vāṃ narā  práti dyumántaṃ suvitā́ya bhūṣati  prātaryā́vāṇaṃ vibhvàṃ viśé-viśe  vástor-vastor váhamānaṃ dhiyā́ śámi

translation.text: YOUR radiant Chariot-whither goes it on its way?-who decks it for you, Heroes, for its happy course, Starting at daybreak, visiting each morning every house, borne hitherward through prayer unto the sacrifice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कुह॑ स्विद्दो॒षा कुह॒ वस्तो॑र॒श्विना॒ कुहा॑भिपि॒त्वं क॑रतः॒ कुहो॑षतुः को वां॑ शयु॒त्रा वि॒धवे॑व दे॒वरं॒ मर्यं॒ न योषा॑ कृणुते स॒धस्थ॒ आ
verses.transliteration: kúha svid doṣā́ kúha vástor aśvínā  kúhābhipitváṃ karataḥ kúhoṣatuḥ  kó vāṃ śayutrā́ vidháveva deváram  máryaṃ ná yóṣā kr̥ṇute sadhástha ā́

translation.text: Where are ye, Aṣvins, in the evening, where at morn? Where is your haltingplace, where rest ye for the night? Who brings you homeward, as the widow bedward draws her husband's brother, as the bride attracts the groom?

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒तर्ज॑रेथे जर॒णेव॒ काप॑या॒ वस्तो॑र्वस्तोर्यज॒ता ग॑च्छथो गृ॒हम् कस्य॑ ध्व॒स्रा भ॑वथः॒ कस्य॑ वा नरा राजपु॒त्रेव॒ सव॒नाव॑ गच्छथः
verses.transliteration: prātár jarethe jaraṇéva kā́payā  vástor-vastor yajatā́ gachatho gr̥hám  kásya dhvasrā́ bhavathaḥ kásya vā narā  rājaputréva sávanā́va gachathaḥ

translation.text: Early ye sing forth praise as with a herald's voice, and, meet for worship, go each morning to the house. Whom do ye ever bring to ruin? Unto whose libations come ye, Heroes, like two Sons of Kings?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां मृ॒गेव॑ वार॒णा मृ॑ग॒ण्यवो॑ दो॒षा वस्तो॑र्ह॒विषा॒ नि ह्व॑यामहे यु॒वं होत्रा॑मृतु॒था जुह्व॑ते न॒रेषं॒ जना॑य वहथः शुभस्पती
verses.transliteration: yuvā́m mr̥géva vāraṇā́ mr̥gaṇyávo  doṣā́ vástor havíṣā ní hvayāmahe  yuváṃ hótrām r̥tuthā́ júhvate narā-  -íṣaṃ jánāya vahathaḥ śubhas patī

translation.text: Even as hunters follow two wild elephants, we with oblations call you down at morn and eve. To folk who pay you offerings at appointed times, Chiefs, Lords of splendour, ye bring food to strengthen them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां ह॒ घोषा॒ पर्य॑श्विना य॒ती राज्ञ॑ ऊचे दुहि॒ता पृ॒च्छे वां॑ नरा भू॒तं मे॒ अह्न॑ उ॒त भू॑तम॒क्तवेऽश्वा॑वते र॒थिने॑ शक्त॒मर्व॑ते
verses.transliteration: yuvā́ṃ ha ghóṣā páry aśvinā yatī́  rā́jña ūce duhitā́ pr̥ché vāṃ narā  bhūtám me áhna utá bhūtam aktáve-  -áśvāvate rathíne śaktam árvate

translation.text: To you, O Aṣvins, came the daughter of a King, Ghoshâ, and said, O Heroes, this I beg of you: Be near me in the day, he near me in the night: help me to gain a car-borne chieftain rich in steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं क॒वी ष्ठः॒ पर्य॑श्विना॒ रथं॒ विशो॒ न कुत्सो॑ जरि॒तुर्न॑शायथः यु॒वोर्ह॒ मक्षा॒ पर्य॑श्विना॒ मध्वा॒सा भ॑रत निष्कृ॒तं न योष॑णा
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ kavī́ ṣṭhaḥ páry aśvinā ráthaṃ  víśo ná kútso jaritúr naśāyathaḥ  yuvór ha mákṣā páry aśvinā mádhu-  āsā́ bharata niṣkr̥táṃ ná yóṣaṇā

translation.text: O Aṣvins, ye are wise: as Kutsa comes to men, bring your car nigh the folk of him who sings your praise. The bee, O Aṣvins, bears your honey in her mouth, as the maid carries it purified in her hand.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं ह॑ भु॒ज्युं यु॒वम॑श्विना॒ वशं॑ यु॒वं शि॒ञ्जार॑मु॒शना॒मुपा॑रथुः यु॒वो ररा॑वा॒ परि॑ स॒ख्यमा॑सते यु॒वोर॒हमव॑सा सु॒म्नमा च॑के
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ ha bhujyúṃ yuvám aśvinā váśaṃ  yuváṃ śiñjā́ram uśánām úpārathuḥ  yuvór árāvā pári sakhyám āsate  yuvór ahám ávasā sumnám ā́ cake

translation.text: To Bhujyu and to Vaṣa ye come near with help, O Aṣvins, to Ṣinjâra and to Uṣanâ. Your worshipper secures your friendship for himself. Through your protection I desire felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं ह॑ कृ॒शं यु॒वम॑श्विना श॒युं यु॒वं वि॒धन्तं॑ वि॒धवा॑मुरुष्यथः यु॒वं स॒निभ्यः॑ स्त॒नय॑न्तमश्वि॒नाप॑ व्र॒जमू॑र्णुथः स॒प्तास्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ ha kr̥śáṃ yuvám aśvinā śayúṃ  yuváṃ vidhántaṃ vidhávām uruṣyathaḥ  yuváṃ saníbhya stanáyantam aśvinā-  -ápa vrajám ūrṇuthaḥ saptā́syam

translation.text: Kr̥iṣa and Ṣayu ye protect, ye Aṣvins Twain: ye Two assist the widow and the worshipper; And ye throw open, Aṣvins, unto those who win the cattle-stall that thunders with its serenfold mouth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जनि॑ष्ट॒ योषा॑ प॒तय॑त्कनीन॒को वि चारु॑हन्वी॒रुधो॑ दं॒सना॒ अनु॑ आस्मै॑ रीयन्ते निव॒नेव॒ सिन्ध॑वो॒ऽस्मा अह्ने॑ भवति॒ तत्प॑तित्व॒नम्
verses.transliteration: jániṣṭa yóṣā patáyat kanīnakó  ví cā́ruhan vīrúdho daṃsánā ánu  ā́smai rīyante nivanéva síndhavo  -asmā́ áhne bhavati tát patitvanám

translation.text: The Woman hath brought forth, the Infant hath appeared, the plants of wondrous beauty straightway have sprung up. To him the rivers run as down a deep descent, and he this day becomes their master and their lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जी॒वं रु॑दन्ति॒ वि म॑यन्ते अध्व॒रे दी॒र्घामनु॒ प्रसि॑तिं दीधियु॒र्नरः॑ वा॒मं पि॒तृभ्यो॒ य इ॒दं स॑मेरि॒रे मयः॒ पति॑भ्यो॒ जन॑यः परि॒ष्वजे॑
verses.transliteration: jīváṃ rudanti ví mayante adhvaré  dīrghā́m ánu prásitiṃ dīdhiyur náraḥ  vāmám pitŕ̥bhyo yá idáṃ sameriré  máyaḥ pátibhyo jánayaḥ pariṣváje

translation.text: They mourn the living, cry aloud, at sacrifice: the men have set their thoughts upon a distant cast. A lovely thing for fathers who have gathered here,– a joy to husbands,– are the wives their arms shall clasp

verses.sanskrit_deva: न तस्य॑ विद्म॒ तदु॒ षु प्र वो॑चत॒ युवा॑ ह॒ यद्यु॑व॒त्याः क्षेति॒ योनि॑षु प्रि॒योस्रि॑यस्य वृष॒भस्य॑ रे॒तिनो॑ गृ॒हं ग॑मेमाश्विना॒ तदु॑श्मसि
verses.transliteration: ná tásya vidma tád u ṣú prá vocata  yúvā ha yád yuvatyā́ḥ kṣéti yóniṣu  priyósriyasya vr̥ṣabhásya retíno  gr̥háṃ gamemāśvinā tád uśmasi

translation.text: Of this we have no knowledge. Tall it forth to us, now the youth rests within the chambers of the bride. Fain would we reach the dwelling of the vigorous Steer who loves the kine, O Aṣvins: this is our desire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वा॑मगन्त्सुम॒तिर्वा॑जिनीवसू॒ न्य॑श्विना हृ॒त्सु कामा॑ अयंसत अभू॑तं गो॒पा मि॑थु॒ना शु॑भस्पती प्रि॒या अ॑र्य॒म्णो दुर्याँ॑ अशीमहि
verses.transliteration: ā́ vām agan sumatír vājinīvasū  ny àśvinā hr̥tsú kā́mā ayaṃsata  ábhūtaṃ gopā́ mithunā́ śubhas patī  priyā́ aryamṇó dúryām̐ aśīmahi

translation.text: Your favouring grace hath come, ye Lords of ample wealth: Aṣvins, our longings are stored up within your hearts. Ye, Lords of splendour, have become our twofold guard: may we as welcome friends reach Aryaman's abode.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता म॑न्दसा॒ना मनु॑षो दुरो॒ण आ ध॒त्तं र॒यिं स॒हवी॑रं वच॒स्यवे॑ कृ॒तं ती॒र्थं सु॑प्रपा॒णं शु॑भस्पती स्था॒णुं प॑थे॒ष्ठामप॑ दुर्म॒तिं ह॑तम्
verses.transliteration: tā́ mandasānā́ mánuṣo duroṇá ā́  dhattáṃ rayíṃ sahávīraṃ vacasyáve  kr̥táṃ tīrtháṃ suprapāṇáṃ śubhas patī  sthāṇúm patheṣṭhā́m ápa durmatíṃ hatam

translation.text: Even so, rejoicing in the dwelling-place of man, give hero sons and riches to the eloquent. Make a ford, Lords of splendour, where men well may drink: remove the spiteful tree-stump standing in the path.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व॑ स्विद॒द्य क॑त॒मास्व॒श्विना॑ वि॒क्षु द॒स्रा मा॑दयेते शु॒भस्पती॑ क ईं॒ नि ये॑मे कत॒मस्य॑ जग्मतु॒र्विप्र॑स्य वा॒ यज॑मानस्य वा गृ॒हम्
verses.transliteration: kvà svid adyá katamā́sv aśvínā  vikṣú dasrā́ mādayete śubhás pátī  ká īṃ ní yeme katamásya jagmatur  víprasya vā yájamānasya vā gr̥hám

translation.text: O Aṣvins, Wonder-Workers, Lords of lustre, where and with what folk do ye delight yourselves today? Who hath detained them with him? Whither are they gone? Unto what sage's or what worshipper's abode?

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नमु॒ त्यं पु॑रुहू॒तमु॒क्थ्यं१॒॑ रथं॑ त्रिच॒क्रं सव॑ना॒ गनि॑ग्मतम् परि॑ज्मानं विद॒थ्यं॑ सुवृ॒क्तिभि॑र्व॒यं व्यु॑ष्टा उ॒षसो॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: samānám u tyám puruhūtám ukthyàṃ  ráthaṃ tricakráṃ sávanā gánigmatam  párijmānaṃ vidathyàṃ suvr̥ktíbhir  vayáṃ vyùṣṭā uṣáso havāmahe

translation.text: THAT general Car of yours, invoked by many a man, that comes to our libations, three-wheeled, meet for lauds, That circumambient Car, worthy of sacrifice, we call with our pure hymns at earliest flush of dawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒त॒र्युजं॑ नास॒त्याधि॑ तिष्ठथः प्रात॒र्यावा॑णं मधु॒वाह॑नं॒ रथ॑म् विशो॒ येन॒ गच्छ॑थो॒ यज्व॑रीर्नरा की॒रेश्चि॑द्य॒ज्ञं होतृ॑मन्तमश्विना
verses.transliteration: prātaryújaṃ nāsatyā́dhi tiṣṭhathaḥ  prātaryā́vāṇam madhuvā́hanaṃ rátham  víśo yéna gáchatho yájvarīr narā  kīréś cid yajñáṃ hótr̥mantam aśvinā

translation.text: Ye, O Nâsatyas, mount that early-harnessed Car, that travels early, laden with its freight of balm, Wherewith ye, Heroes, visit clans who sacrifice, even the poor man's worship where the priest attends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ध्व॒र्युं वा॒ मधु॑पाणिं सु॒हस्त्य॑म॒ग्निधं॑ वा धृ॒तद॑क्षं॒ दमू॑नसम् विप्र॑स्य वा॒ यत्सव॑नानि॒ गच्छ॒थोऽत॒ आ या॑तं मधु॒पेय॑मश्विना
verses.transliteration: adhvaryúṃ vā mádhupāṇiṃ suhástyam  agnídhaṃ vā dhr̥tádakṣaṃ dámūnasam  víprasya vā yát sávanāni gáchathaḥ-  -áta ā́ yātam madhupéyam aśvinā

translation.text: If to the deft Adhvaryu with the meath in hand, or to the Kindler firm in strength, the household friend, Or to the sage's poured libations ye approach, come thence, O Aṣvins, now to drink the offered meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्ते॑व॒ सु प्र॑त॒रं लाय॒मस्य॒न्भूष॑न्निव॒ प्र भ॑रा॒ स्तोम॑मस्मै वा॒चा वि॑प्रास्तरत॒ वाच॑म॒र्यो नि रा॑मय जरितः॒ सोम॒ इन्द्र॑म्
verses.transliteration: ásteva sú prataráṃ lā́yam ásyan  bhū́ṣann iva prá bharā stómam asmai  vācā́ viprās tarata vā́cam aryó  ní rāmaya jaritaḥ sóma índram

translation.text: EVEN as an archer shoots afar his arrow, offer the laud to him with meet adornment. Quell with your voice the wicked's voice, O sages. Singer, make Indra rest beside the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दोहे॑न॒ गामुप॑ शिक्षा॒ सखा॑यं॒ प्र बो॑धय जरितर्जा॒रमिन्द्र॑म् कोशं॒ न पू॒र्णं वसु॑ना॒ न्यृ॑ष्ट॒मा च्या॑वय मघ॒देया॑य॒ शूर॑म्
verses.transliteration: dóhena gā́m úpa śikṣā sákhāyam  prá bodhaya jaritar jārám índram  kóśaṃ ná pūrṇáṃ vásunā nyr̥̀ṣṭam  ā́ cyāvaya maghadéyāya śū́ram

translation.text: Draw thy Friend to thee like a cow at milking: O Singer, wake up Indra as a lover. Make thou the Hero haste to give us riches even as a vessel filled brimful with treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किम॒ङ्ग त्वा॑ मघवन्भो॒जमा॑हुः शिशी॒हि मा॑ शिश॒यं त्वा॑ शृणोमि अप्न॑स्वती॒ मम॒ धीर॑स्तु शक्र वसु॒विदं॒ भग॑मि॒न्द्रा भ॑रा नः
verses.transliteration: kím aṅgá tvā maghavan bhojám āhuḥ  śiśīhí mā śiśayáṃ tvā śr̥ṇomi  ápnasvatī máma dhī́r astu śakra  vasuvídam bhágam indrā́ bharā naḥ

translation.text: Why, Maghavan, do they call thee Bounteous; Giver? Quicken me: thou, I hear, art he who quickens. Ṣakra, let my intelligence be active, and bring us luck that finds great wealth, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां जना॑ ममस॒त्येष्वि॑न्द्र संतस्था॒ना वि ह्व॑यन्ते समी॒के अत्रा॒ युजं॑ कृणुते॒ यो ह॒विष्मा॒न्नासु॑न्वता स॒ख्यं व॑ष्टि॒ शूरः॑
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ jánā mamasatyéṣv indra  saṃtasthānā́ ví hvayante samīké  átrā yújaṃ kr̥ṇute yó havíṣmān  nā́sunvatā sakhyáṃ vaṣṭi śū́raḥ

translation.text: Standing, in battle for their rights, together, the people, Indra, in the fray invoke thee. Him who brings gifts the Hero makes his comrade: with him who pours no juice he seeks not friendship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धनं॒ न स्य॒न्द्रं ब॑हु॒लं यो अ॑स्मै ती॒व्रान्त्सोमाँ॑ आसु॒नोति॒ प्रय॑स्वान् तस्मै॒ शत्रू॑न्त्सु॒तुका॑न्प्रा॒तरह्नो॒ नि स्वष्ट्रा॑न्यु॒वति॒ हन्ति॑ वृ॒त्रम्
verses.transliteration: dhánaṃ ná syandrám bahuláṃ yó asmai  tīvrā́n sómām̐ āsunóti práyasvān  tásmai śátrūn sutúkān prātár áhno  ní sváṣṭrān yuváti hánti vr̥trám

translation.text: Whoso with plenteous food for him expresses strong Somas as much quickly-coming treasure, For him he overthrows in early morning his swift well-weaponed foes, and slays the tyrant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मि॑न्व॒यं द॑धि॒मा शंस॒मिन्द्रे॒ यः शि॒श्राय॑ म॒घवा॒ काम॑म॒स्मे आ॒राच्चि॒त्सन्भ॑यतामस्य॒ शत्रु॒र्न्य॑स्मै द्यु॒म्ना जन्या॑ नमन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: yásmin vayáṃ dadhimā́ śáṃsam índre  yáḥ śiśrā́ya maghávā kā́mam asmé  ārā́c cit sán bhayatām asya śátrur  ny àsmai dyumnā́ jányā namantām

translation.text: He unto whom we offer praises, Indra, Maghavan, who hath joined to ours his wishes,– Before him even afar the foe must tremble: low before him must bow all human glories.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒राच्छत्रु॒मप॑ बाधस्व दू॒रमु॒ग्रो यः शम्बः॑ पुरुहूत॒ तेन॑ अ॒स्मे धे॑हि॒ यव॑म॒द्गोम॑दिन्द्र कृ॒धी धियं॑ जरि॒त्रे वाज॑रत्नाम्
verses.transliteration: ārā́c chátrum ápa bādhasva dūrám  ugró yáḥ śámbaḥ puruhūta téna  asmé dhehi yávamad gómad indra  kr̥dhī́ dhíyaṃ jaritré vā́jaratnām

translation.text: With thy fierce bolt, O God invoked of many, drive to a distance from afar the foeman. O Indra, give us wealth in corn and cattle, and make thy singer's prayer gain strength and riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यम॒न्तर्वृ॑षस॒वासो॒ अग्म॑न्ती॒व्राः सोमा॑ बहु॒लान्ता॑स॒ इन्द्र॑म् नाह॑ दा॒मानं॑ म॒घवा॒ नि यं॑स॒न्नि सु॑न्व॒ते व॑हति॒ भूरि॑ वा॒मम्
verses.transliteration: prá yám antár vr̥ṣasavā́so ágman  tīvrā́ḥ sómā bahulā́ntāsa índram  nā́ha dāmā́nam maghávā ní yaṃsat-  ní sunvaté vahati bhū́ri vāmám

translation.text: Indra, the swallower of strong libations rich in the boons they bring, the potent Somas, He, Maghavan, will not restrict his bounty he brings much wealth unto the Soma-presser.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त प्र॒हाम॑ति॒दीव्या॑ जयाति कृ॒तं यच्छ्व॒घ्नी वि॑चि॒नोति॑ का॒ले यो दे॒वका॑मो॒ न धना॑ रुणद्धि॒ समित्तं रा॒या सृ॑जति स्व॒धावा॑न्
verses.transliteration: utá prahā́m atidī́vyā jayāti  kr̥táṃ yác chvaghnī́ vicinóti kālé  yó devákāmo ná dhánā ruṇaddhi  sám ít táṃ rāyā́ sr̥jati svadhā́vān

translation.text: Yea, by superior play he wins advantage, when he, a gambler, piles his gains in season. Celestial-natured, he o'erwhelms with riches the devotee who keeps not back his treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोभि॑ष्टरे॒माम॑तिं दु॒रेवां॒ यवे॑न॒ क्षुधं॑ पुरुहूत॒ विश्वा॑म् व॒यं राज॑भिः प्रथ॒मा धना॑न्य॒स्माके॑न वृ॒जने॑ना जयेम
verses.transliteration: góbhiṣ ṭaremā́matiṃ durévāṃ  yávena kṣúdham puruhūta víśvām  vayáṃ rā́jabhiḥ prathamā́ dhánāni-  asmā́kena vr̥jánenā jayema

translation.text: O Much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle. May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॒स्पति॑र्नः॒ परि॑ पातु प॒श्चादु॒तोत्त॑रस्मा॒दध॑रादघा॒योः इन्द्रः॑ पु॒रस्ता॑दु॒त म॑ध्य॒तो नः॒ सखा॒ सखि॑भ्यो॒ वरि॑वः कृणोतु
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspátir naḥ pári pātu paścā́d  utóttarasmād ádharād aghāyóḥ  índraḥ purástād utá madhyató naḥ  sákhā sákhibhyo várivaḥ kr̥ṇotu

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners! May Indra from the front, and from the centre, as Friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ म॒ इन्द्रं॑ म॒तयः॑ स्व॒र्विदः॑ स॒ध्रीची॒र्विश्वा॑ उश॒तीर॑नूषत परि॑ ष्वजन्ते॒ जन॑यो॒ यथा॒ पतिं॒ मर्यं॒ न शु॒न्ध्युं म॒घवा॑नमू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: áchā ma índram matáyaḥ svarvídaḥ  sadhrī́cīr víśvā uśatī́r anūṣata  pári ṣvajante jánayo yáthā pátim  máryaṃ ná śundhyúm maghávānam ūtáye

translation.text: IN perfect unison all yearning hymns of mine that find the light of heaven have sung forth Indra's praise. As wives embrace their lord, the comely bridegroom, so they compass Maghavan about that he may help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न घा॑ त्व॒द्रिगप॑ वेति मे॒ मन॒स्त्वे इत्कामं॑ पुरुहूत शिश्रय राजे॑व दस्म॒ नि ष॒दोऽधि॑ ब॒र्हिष्य॒स्मिन्त्सु सोमे॑ऽव॒पान॑मस्तु ते
verses.transliteration: ná ghā tvadríg ápa veti me mánas  tvé ít kā́mam puruhūta śiśraya  rā́jeva dasma ní ṣadó 'dhi barhíṣi-  asmín sú sóme 'vapā́nam astu te

translation.text: Directed unto thee my spirit never strays, for I have set my hopes on thee, O Much-invoked! Sit, Wonderful! as King upon the sacred grass, and let thy drinking-place be by the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒षू॒वृदिन्द्रो॒ अम॑तेरु॒त क्षु॒धः स इद्रा॒यो म॒घवा॒ वस्व॑ ईशते तस्येदि॒मे प्र॑व॒णे स॒प्त सिन्ध॑वो॒ वयो॑ वर्धन्ति वृष॒भस्य॑ शु॒ष्मिणः॑
verses.transliteration: viṣūvŕ̥d índro ámater utá kṣudháḥ  sá íd rāyó maghávā vásva īśate  tásyéd imé pravaṇé saptá síndhavo  váyo vardhanti vr̥ṣabhásya śuṣmíṇaḥ

translation.text: From indigence and hunger Indra turns away: Maghavan hath dominion over precious wealth. These the Seven Rivers flowing on their downward path increase the vital vigour of the potent Steer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वयो॒ न वृ॒क्षं सु॑पला॒शमास॑द॒न्त्सोमा॑स॒ इन्द्रं॑ म॒न्दिन॑श्चमू॒षदः॑ प्रैषा॒मनी॑कं॒ शव॑सा॒ दवि॑द्युतद्वि॒दत्स्व१॒॑र्मन॑वे॒ ज्योति॒रार्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: váyo ná vr̥kṣáṃ supalāśám ā́sadan  sómāsa índram mandínaś camūṣádaḥ  praíṣām ánīkaṃ śávasā dávidyutad  vidát svàr mánave jyótir ā́ryam

translation.text: As on the fair-leafed tree rest birds, to Indra flow the gladdening Soma juices that the bowls contain. Their face that glows with splendour through their mighty power hath found the shine of heaven for man, the Aryas' light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒तं न श्व॒घ्नी वि चि॑नोति॒ देव॑ने सं॒वर्गं॒ यन्म॒घवा॒ सूर्यं॒ जय॑त् न तत्ते॑ अ॒न्यो अनु॑ वी॒र्यं॑ शक॒न्न पु॑रा॒णो म॑घव॒न्नोत नूत॑नः
verses.transliteration: kr̥táṃ ná śvaghnī́ ví cinoti dévane  saṃvárgaṃ yán maghávā sū́ryaṃ jáyat  ná tát te anyó ánu vīryàṃ śakat-  ná purāṇó maghavan nótá nū́tanaḥ

translation.text: As in the game a gambler piles his winnings, so Maghavan, sweeping all together, gained the Sun This mighty deed of thine none other could achieve, none, Maghavan, before thee, none in recent time.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विशं॑विशं म॒घवा॒ पर्य॑शायत॒ जना॑नां॒ धेना॑ अव॒चाक॑श॒द्वृषा॑ यस्याह॑ श॒क्रः सव॑नेषु॒ रण्य॑ति॒ स ती॒व्रैः सोमैः॑ सहते पृतन्य॒तः
verses.transliteration: víśaṃ-viśam maghávā páry aśāyata  jánānāṃ dhénā avacā́kaśad vŕ̥ṣā  yásyā́ha śakráḥ sávaneṣu ráṇyati  sá tīvraíḥ sómaiḥ sahate pr̥tanyatáḥ

translation.text: Maghavan came by turns to all the tribes of men: the Steer took notice of the people's songs of praise. The man in whose libations Ṣakra hath delight by means of potent Somas vanquisheth his foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपो॒ न सिन्धु॑म॒भि यत्स॒मक्ष॑र॒न्त्सोमा॑स॒ इन्द्रं॑ कु॒ल्या इ॑व ह्र॒दम् वर्ध॑न्ति॒ विप्रा॒ महो॑ अस्य॒ साद॑ने॒ यवं॒ न वृ॒ष्टिर्दि॒व्येन॒ दानु॑ना
verses.transliteration: ā́po ná síndhum abhí yát samákṣaran  sómāsa índraṃ kulyā́ iva hradám  várdhanti víprā máho asya sā́dane  yávaṃ ná vr̥ṣṭír divyéna dā́nunā

translation.text: When Soma streams together unto Indra flow like waters to the river, rivulets to the lake, In place of sacrifice sages exalt his might, as the rain swells the corn by moisture sent from heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॒ न क्रु॒द्धः प॑तय॒द्रजः॒स्वा यो अ॒र्यप॑त्नी॒रकृ॑णोदि॒मा अ॒पः स सु॑न्व॒ते म॒घवा॑ जी॒रदा॑न॒वेऽवि॑न्द॒ज्ज्योति॒र्मन॑वे ह॒विष्म॑ते
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā ná kruddháḥ patayad rájassv~ā́  yó aryápatnīr ákr̥ṇod imā́ apáḥ  sá sunvaté maghávā jīrádānave-  -ávindaj jyótir mánave havíṣmate

translation.text: He rushes through the region like a furious Bull, he who hath made these floods the dames of worthy lords. This Maghavan hath found light for the man who brings oblation, sheds the juice, and promptly pours his gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उज्जा॑यतां पर॒शुर्ज्योति॑षा स॒ह भू॒या ऋ॒तस्य॑ सु॒दुघा॑ पुराण॒वत् वि रो॑चतामरु॒षो भा॒नुना॒ शुचिः॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण शु॒क्रं शु॑शुचीत॒ सत्प॑तिः
verses.transliteration: új jāyatām paraśúr jyótiṣā sahá  bhūyā́ r̥tásya sudúghā purāṇavát  ví rocatām aruṣó bhānúnā śúciḥ  svàr ṇá śukráṃ śuśucīta sátpatiḥ

translation.text: Let the keen axe come forth together with the light: here be,.as erst, the teeming cow of sacrifice. Let the Red God shine bright with his refulgent ray, and let the Lord of heroes glow like heaven's clear sheen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोभि॑ष्टरे॒माम॑तिं दु॒रेवां॒ यवे॑न॒ क्षुधं॑ पुरुहूत॒ विश्वा॑म् व॒यं राज॑भिः प्रथ॒मा धना॑न्य॒स्माके॑न वृ॒जने॑ना जयेम
verses.transliteration: góbhiṣ ṭaremā́matiṃ durévāṃ  yávena kṣúdham puruhūta víśvām  vayáṃ rā́jabhiḥ prathamā́ dhánāni-  asmā́kena vr̥jánenā jayema

translation.text: O Much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle. May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॒स्पति॑र्नः॒ परि॑ पातु प॒श्चादु॒तोत्त॑रस्मा॒दध॑रादघा॒योः इन्द्रः॑ पु॒रस्ता॑दु॒त म॑ध्य॒तो नः॒ सखा॒ सखि॑भ्यो॒ वरि॑वः कृणोतु
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspátir naḥ pári pātu paścā́d  utóttarasmād ádharād aghāyóḥ  índraḥ purástād utá madhyató naḥ  sákhā sákhibhyo várivaḥ kr̥ṇotu

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners. May Indra from the front, and from the centre, as Friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॒त्विन्द्रः॒ स्वप॑ति॒र्मदा॑य॒ यो धर्म॑णा तूतुजा॒नस्तुवि॑ष्मान् प्र॒त्व॒क्षा॒णो अति॒ विश्वा॒ सहां॑स्यपा॒रेण॑ मह॒ता वृष्ण्ये॑न
verses.transliteration: ā́ yātv índraḥ svápatir mádāya  yó dhármaṇā tūtujānás túviṣmān  pratvakṣāṇó áti víśvā sáhāṃsi-  apāréṇa mahatā́ vŕ̥ṣṇyena

translation.text: MAY Sovran Indra come to the carousal, he who by Holy Law is strong and active, The overcomer of all conquering forces with his great steer-like power that hath no limit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒ष्ठामा॒ रथः॑ सु॒यमा॒ हरी॑ ते मि॒म्यक्ष॒ वज्रो॑ नृपते॒ गभ॑स्तौ शीभं॑ राजन्त्सु॒पथा या॑ह्य॒र्वाङ्वर्धा॑म ते प॒पुषो॒ वृष्ण्या॑नि
verses.transliteration: suṣṭhā́mā ráthaḥ suyámā hárī te  mimyákṣa vájro nr̥pate gábhastau  śī́bhaṃ rājan supáthā́ yāhy arvā́ṅ  várdhāma te papúṣo vŕ̥ṣṇyāni

translation.text: Firm-seated is thy car, thy Steeds are docile; thy hand, O King, holds, firmly grasped, the thunder. On thy fair path, O Lord of men, come quickly: we will increase thy powers when thou hast drunken.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एन्द्र॒वाहो॑ नृ॒पतिं॒ वज्र॑बाहुमु॒ग्रमु॒ग्रास॑स्तवि॒षास॑ एनम् प्रत्व॑क्षसं वृष॒भं स॒त्यशु॑ष्म॒मेम॑स्म॒त्रा स॑ध॒मादो॑ वहन्तु
verses.transliteration: éndravā́ho nr̥pátiṃ vájrabāhum  ugrám ugrā́sas taviṣā́sa enam  prátvakṣasaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ satyáśuṣmam  ém asmatrā́ sadhamā́do vahantu

translation.text: Let strong and mighty Steeds who bear this Mighty Indra, the Lord of men, whose arm wields thunder, Bring unto us, as sharers of our banquet, the Steer of conquering might, of real vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा पतिं॑ द्रोण॒साचं॒ सचे॑तसमू॒र्जः स्क॒म्भं ध॒रुण॒ आ वृ॑षायसे ओजः॑ कृष्व॒ सं गृ॑भाय॒ त्वे अप्यसो॒ यथा॑ केनि॒पाना॑मि॒नो वृ॒धे
verses.transliteration: evā́ pátiṃ droṇasā́caṃ sácetasam  ūrjá skambháṃ dharúṇa ā́ vr̥ṣāyase  ójaḥ kr̥ṣva sáṃ gr̥bhāya tvé ápi-  áso yáthā kenipā́nām inó vr̥dhé

translation.text: So like a Bull thou rushest to the Lord who loves the trough, the Sage, the prop of vigour, in the vat, Prepare thine energies, collect them in thyself: be for our profit as the Master of the wise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गम॑न्न॒स्मे वसू॒न्या हि शंसि॑षं स्वा॒शिषं॒ भर॒मा या॑हि सो॒मिनः॑ त्वमी॑शिषे॒ सास्मिन्ना स॑त्सि ब॒र्हिष्य॑नाधृ॒ष्या तव॒ पात्रा॑णि॒ धर्म॑णा
verses.transliteration: gámann asmé vásūny ā́ hí śáṃsiṣaṃ  svāśíṣam bháram ā́ yāhi somínaḥ  tvám īśiṣe sā́smínn ā́ satsi barhíṣi-  anādhr̥ṣyā́ táva pā́trāṇi dhármaṇā

translation.text: May precious treasures come to us-so will I pray. Come to the votary's gift offered with beauteous laud. Thou art the Lord, as such sit on this holy grass: thy vessels are inviolate as Law commands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृथ॒क्प्राय॑न्प्रथ॒मा दे॒वहू॑त॒योऽकृ॑ण्वत श्रव॒स्या॑नि दु॒ष्टरा॑ न ये शे॒कुर्य॒ज्ञियां॒ नाव॑मा॒रुह॑मी॒र्मैव ते न्य॑विशन्त॒ केप॑यः
verses.transliteration: pŕ̥thak prā́yan prathamā́ deváhūtayaḥ-  -ákr̥ṇvata śravasyā̀ni duṣṭárā  ná yé śekúr yajñíyāṃ nā́vam ārúham  īrmaívá té ny àviśanta képayaḥ

translation.text: Far went our earlist invocation of the Gods, and won us glories that can never be surpassed. They who could not ascend the ship of sacrifice, sink down in desolation, trembling with alarm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वैवापा॒गप॑रे सन्तु दू॒ढ्योऽश्वा॒ येषां॑ दु॒र्युज॑ आयुयु॒ज्रे इ॒त्था ये प्रागुप॑रे॒ सन्ति॑ दा॒वने॑ पु॒रूणि॒ यत्र॑ व॒युना॑नि॒ भोज॑ना
verses.transliteration: evaívā́pāg ápare santu dūḍhyó  -áśvā yéṣāṃ duryúja āyuyujré  itthā́ yé prā́g úpare sánti dāváne  purū́ṇi yátra vayúnāni bhójanā

translation.text: So be the others, evil-hearted, far away, whose horses, difficult to harness, have been yoked. Here in advance men stand anear to offer gifts, by whom full many a work that brings reward is done.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गि॒रीँरज्रा॒न्रेज॑मानाँ अधारय॒द्द्यौः क्र॑न्दद॒न्तरि॑क्षाणि कोपयत् स॒मी॒ची॒ने धि॒षणे॒ वि ष्क॑भायति॒ वृष्णः॑ पी॒त्वा मद॑ उ॒क्थानि॑ शंसति
verses.transliteration: girī́m̐r ájrān réjamānām̐ adhārayad  dyaúḥ krandad antárikṣāṇi kopayat  samīcīné dhiṣáṇe ví ṣkabhāyati  vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ pītvā́ máda ukthā́ni śaṃsati

translation.text: He firmly fixed the plains and mountains as they shook. Dyaus thundered forth and made the air's mid-region quake. He stays apart the two confronting bowls; he sings lauds in the potent Soma's joy when he hath drunk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं बि॑भर्मि॒ सुकृ॑तं ते अङ्कु॒शं येना॑रु॒जासि॑ मघवञ्छफा॒रुजः॑ अ॒स्मिन्त्सु ते॒ सव॑ने अस्त्वो॒क्यं॑ सु॒त इ॒ष्टौ म॑घवन्बो॒ध्याभ॑गः
verses.transliteration: imám bibharmi súkr̥taṃ te aṅkuśáṃ  yénārujā́si maghavañ chaphārújaḥ  asmín sú te sávane astv okyàṃ  sutá iṣṭaú maghavan bodhy ā́bhagaḥ

translation.text: I bear this deftly-fashioned goad of thine, wherewith thou, Maghavan, shalt break the strikers with the hoof. At this libation mayst thou be well satisfied. Partake the juice, partake the worship, Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोभि॑ष्टरे॒माम॑तिं दु॒रेवां॒ यवे॑न॒ क्षुधं॑ पुरुहूत॒ विश्वा॑म् व॒यं राज॑भिः प्रथ॒मा धना॑न्य॒स्माके॑न वृ॒जने॑ना जयेम
verses.transliteration: góbhiṣ ṭaremā́matiṃ durévāṃ  yávena kṣúdham puruhūta víśvām  vayáṃ rā́jabhiḥ prathamā́ dhánāni-  asmā́kena vr̥jánenā jayema

translation.text: O Much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle. May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॒स्पति॑र्नः॒ परि॑ पातु प॒श्चादु॒तोत्त॑रस्मा॒दध॑रादघा॒योः इन्द्रः॑ पु॒रस्ता॑दु॒त म॑ध्य॒तो नः॒ सखा॒ सखि॑भ्यो॒ वरि॑वः कृणोतु
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspátir naḥ pári pātu paścā́d  utóttarasmād ádharād aghāyóḥ  índraḥ purástād utá madhyató naḥ  sákhā sákhibhyo várivaḥ kr̥ṇotu

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners. May Indra from the front and from the centre, as Friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वस्परि॑ प्रथ॒मं ज॑ज्ञे अ॒ग्निर॒स्मद्द्वि॒तीयं॒ परि॑ जा॒तवे॑दाः तृ॒तीय॑म॒प्सु नृ॒मणा॒ अज॑स्र॒मिन्धा॑न एनं जरते स्वा॒धीः
verses.transliteration: divás pári prathamáṃ jajñe agnír  asmád dvitī́yam pári jātávedāḥ  tr̥tī́yam apsú nr̥máṇā ájasram  índhāna enaṃ jarate svādhī́ḥ

translation.text: FIRST Agni sprang to life from out of Heaven: the second time from us came Jâtavedas. Thirdly the Manly-souled was in the waters. The pious lauds and kindles him the Eternal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्मा ते॑ अग्ने त्रे॒धा त्र॒याणि॑ वि॒द्मा ते॒ धाम॒ विभृ॑ता पुरु॒त्रा वि॒द्मा ते॒ नाम॑ पर॒मं गुहा॒ यद्वि॒द्मा तमुत्सं॒ यत॑ आज॒गन्थ॑
verses.transliteration: vidmā́ te agne tredhā́ trayā́ṇi  vidmā́ te dhā́ma víbhr̥tā purutrā́  vidmā́ te nā́ma paramáṃ gúhā yád  vidmā́ tám útsaṃ yáta ājagántha

translation.text: Agni, we know thy three powers in three stations, we know thy forms in many a place divided. We know what name supreme thou hast in secret: we know the source from which thou hast proceeded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मु॒द्रे त्वा॑ नृ॒मणा॑ अ॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तर्नृ॒चक्षा॑ ईधे दि॒वो अ॑ग्न॒ ऊध॑न् तृ॒तीये॑ त्वा॒ रज॑सि तस्थि॒वांस॑म॒पामु॒पस्थे॑ महि॒षा अ॑वर्धन्
verses.transliteration: samudré tvā nr̥máṇā apsv àntár  nr̥cákṣā īdhe divó agna ū́dhan  tr̥tī́ye tvā rájasi tasthivā́ṃsam  apā́m upásthe mahiṣā́ avardhan

translation.text: The Manly-souled lit thee in sea and waters, man's Viewer lit thee in the breast of heaven, There as thou stoodest in the third high region the Steers increased thee in the water's bosom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अक्र॑न्दद॒ग्निः स्त॒नय॑न्निव॒ द्यौः क्षामा॒ रेरि॑हद्वी॒रुधः॑ सम॒ञ्जन् स॒द्यो ज॑ज्ञा॒नो वि हीमि॒द्धो अख्य॒दा रोद॑सी भा॒नुना॑ भात्य॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: ákrandad agní stanáyann iva dyaúḥ  kṣā́mā rérihad vīrúdhaḥ samañján  sadyó jajñānó ví hī́m iddhó ákhyad  ā́ ródasī bhānúnā bhāty antáḥ

translation.text: Agni roared out, like Dyaus what time he thunders: he licked the ground about the plants he flickered. At once, when born, he looked around enkindled, and lightened heaven and earth within with splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्री॒णामु॑दा॒रो ध॒रुणो॑ रयी॒णां म॑नी॒षाणां॒ प्रार्प॑णः॒ सोम॑गोपाः वसुः॑ सू॒नुः सह॑सो अ॒प्सु राजा॒ वि भा॒त्यग्र॑ उ॒षसा॑मिधा॒नः
verses.transliteration: śrīṇā́m udāró dharúṇo rayīṇā́m  manīṣā́ṇām prā́rpaṇaḥ sómagopāḥ  vásuḥ sūnúḥ sáhaso apsú rā́jā  ví bhāty ágra uṣásām idhānáḥ

translation.text: The spring of glories and support of riches, rouser of thoughts and guardian of the Soma, Good Son of Strength, a King amid the waters, in forefront of the Dawns he shines enkindled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑स्य के॒तुर्भुव॑नस्य॒ गर्भ॒ आ रोद॑सी अपृणा॒ज्जाय॑मानः वी॒ळुं चि॒दद्रि॑मभिनत्परा॒यञ्जना॒ यद॒ग्निमय॑जन्त॒ पञ्च॑
verses.transliteration: víśvasya ketúr bhúvanasya gárbhaḥ-  ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇāj jā́yamānaḥ  vīḷúṃ cid ádrim abhinat parāyáñ  jánā yád agním áyajanta páñca

translation.text: Germ of the world, ensign of all creation, be sprang to life and filled the earth and heavens. Even the firm rock he cleft when passing over, when the Five Tribes brought sacrifice to Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒शिक्पा॑व॒को अ॑र॒तिः सु॑मे॒धा मर्ते॑ष्व॒ग्निर॒मृतो॒ नि धा॑यि इय॑र्ति धू॒मम॑रु॒षं भरि॑भ्र॒दुच्छु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषा॒ द्यामिन॑क्षन्
verses.transliteration: uśík pāvakó aratíḥ sumedhā́ḥ-  márteṣv agnír amŕ̥to ní dhāyi  íyarti dhūmám aruṣám bháribhrad  úc chukréṇa śocíṣā dyā́m ínakṣan

translation.text: So among mortals was Immortal Agni stablished as holy wise and willing envoy. He waves the red smoke that he lifts above him, striving to reach the heavens with radiant lustre.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दृ॒शा॒नो रु॒क्म उ॑र्वि॒या व्य॑द्यौद्दु॒र्मर्ष॒मायुः॑ श्रि॒ये रु॑चा॒नः अ॒ग्निर॒मृतो॑ अभव॒द्वयो॑भि॒र्यदे॑नं॒ द्यौर्ज॒नय॑त्सु॒रेताः॑
verses.transliteration: dr̥śānó rukmá urviyā́ vy àdyaud  durmárṣam ā́yuḥ śriyé rucānáḥ  agnír amŕ̥to abhavad váyobhir  yád enaṃ dyaúr janáyat surétāḥ

translation.text: Like gold to look on, far he shone refulgent, beaming imperishable life for glory, Agni by vital powers became immortal when his prolific Father Dyaus begat him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॑ अ॒द्य कृ॒णव॑द्भद्रशोचेऽपू॒पं दे॑व घृ॒तव॑न्तमग्ने प्र तं न॑य प्रत॒रं वस्यो॒ अच्छा॒भि सु॒म्नं दे॒वभ॑क्तं यविष्ठ
verses.transliteration: yás te adyá kr̥ṇávad bhadraśoce  -apūpáṃ deva ghr̥távantam agne  prá táṃ naya prataráṃ vásyo ácha-  -abhí sumnáṃ devábhaktaṃ yaviṣṭha

translation.text: Whoso this day, O God whose flames are lovely, prepares a cake, O Agni, mixt with butter, Lead thou and further him to higher fortune, to bliss bestowed by Gods, O thou Most Youthful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तं भ॑ज सौश्रव॒सेष्व॑ग्न उ॒क्थउ॑क्थ॒ आ भ॑ज श॒स्यमा॑ने प्रि॒यः सूर्ये॑ प्रि॒यो अ॒ग्ना भ॑वा॒त्युज्जा॒तेन॑ भि॒नद॒दुज्जनि॑त्वैः
verses.transliteration: ā́ tám bhaja sauśravaséṣv agne-  ukthá-uktha ā́ bhaja śasyámāne  priyáḥ sū́rye priyó agnā́ bhavāti  új jāténa bhinádad új jánitvaiḥ

translation.text: Endow him, Agni, with a share of glory, at every song of praise sung forth enrich him. Dear let him be to Sûrya, dear to Agni, preeminent with son and children's children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ यज॑माना॒ अनु॒ द्यून्विश्वा॒ वसु॑ दधिरे॒ वार्या॑णि त्वया॑ स॒ह द्रवि॑णमि॒च्छमा॑ना व्र॒जं गोम॑न्तमु॒शिजो॒ वि व॑व्रुः
verses.transliteration: tvā́m agne yájamānā ánu dyū́n  víśvā vásu dadhire vā́ryāṇi  tváyā sahá dráviṇam ichámānāḥ-  vrajáṃ gómantam uśíjo ví vavruḥ

translation.text: While, Agni, day by day men pay thee worship they win themselves all treasures worth the wishing. Allied with thee, eager and craving riches, they have disclosed the stable filled with cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्ता॑व्य॒ग्निर्न॒रां सु॒शेवो॑ वैश्वान॒र ऋषि॑भिः॒ सोम॑गोपाः अ॒द्वे॒षे द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी हु॑वेम॒ देवा॑ ध॒त्त र॒यिम॒स्मे सु॒वीर॑म्
verses.transliteration: ástāvy agnír narā́ṃ suśévo  vaiśvānará ŕ̥ṣibhiḥ sómagopāḥ  adveṣé dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ huvema  dévā dhattá rayím asmé suvī́ram

translation.text: Agni, the Friend of men, the Soma's keeper, Vaiṣvânara, hath been lauded by the R̥ishis. We will invoke benignant Earth and Heaven: ye Deities, give us wealth with hero children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र होता॑ जा॒तो म॒हान्न॑भो॒विन्नृ॒षद्वा॑ सीदद॒पामु॒पस्थे॑ दधि॒र्यो धायि॒ स ते॒ वयां॑सि य॒न्ता वसू॑नि विध॒ते त॑नू॒पाः
verses.transliteration: prá hótā jātó mahā́n nabhovít-  nr̥ṣádvā sīdad apā́m upásthe  dádhir yó dhā́yi sá te váyāṃsi  yantā́ vásūni vidhaté tanūpā́ḥ

translation.text: STABLISHED for thee, to lend thee vital forces, Giver of wealth, Guard of his servant's body. The Great Priest, born, who knows the clouds, Abider with men, is seated in the lap of waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं वि॒धन्तो॑ अ॒पां स॒धस्थे॑ प॒शुं न न॒ष्टं प॒दैरनु॑ ग्मन् गुहा॒ चत॑न्तमु॒शिजो॒ नमो॑भिरि॒च्छन्तो॒ धीरा॒ भृग॑वोऽविन्दन्
verses.transliteration: imáṃ vidhánto apā́ṃ sadhásthe  paśúṃ ná naṣṭám padaír ánu gman  gúhā cátantam uśíjo námobhir  ichánto dhī́rā bhŕ̥gavo 'vindan

translation.text: Worshipping, seeking him with adoration like some lost creature followed by its footprints, Wise Bhr̥igus, yearning in their hearts, pursued him, and found him lurking where the floods are gathered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं त्रि॒तो भूर्य॑विन्ददि॒च्छन्वै॑भूव॒सो मू॒र्धन्यघ्न्या॑याः स शेवृ॑धो जा॒त आ ह॒र्म्येषु॒ नाभि॒र्युवा॑ भवति रोच॒नस्य॑
verses.transliteration: imáṃ tritó bhū́ry avindad ichán  vaibhūvasó mūrdhány ághnyāyāḥ  sá śévr̥dho jātá ā́ harmyéṣu  nā́bhir yúvā bhavati rocanásya

translation.text: On the Cow's forehead, with laborious searching, Trita, the offspring of Vibhiavas, found him. Born in our houses, Youthful, joy-bestower, he now becomes the central point of brightness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒न्द्रं होता॑रमु॒शिजो॒ नमो॑भिः॒ प्राञ्चं॑ य॒ज्ञं ने॒तार॑मध्व॒राणा॑म् वि॒शाम॑कृण्वन्नर॒तिं पा॑व॒कं ह॑व्य॒वाहं॒ दध॑तो॒ मानु॑षेषु
verses.transliteration: mandráṃ hótāram uśíjo námobhiḥ  prā́ñcaṃ yajñáṃ netā́ram adhvarā́ṇām  viśā́m akr̥ṇvann aratím pāvakáṃ  havyavā́haṃ dádhato mā́nuṣeṣu

translation.text: Yearning, with homage, they have set and made him blithe Priest among mankind, oblation-bearer, Leader of rites and Purifier, envoy of men, as sacrifice that still advances.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र भू॒र्जय॑न्तं म॒हां वि॑पो॒धां मू॒रा अमू॑रं पु॒रां द॒र्माण॑म् नय॑न्तो॒ गर्भं॑ व॒नां धियं॑ धु॒र्हिरि॑श्मश्रुं॒ नार्वा॑णं॒ धन॑र्चम्
verses.transliteration: prá bhūr jáyantam mahā́ṃ vipodhā́m  mūrā́ ámūram purā́ṃ darmā́ṇam  náyanto gárbhaṃ vanā́ṃ dhíyaṃ dhur  híriśmaśruṃ nā́rvāṇaṃ dhánarcam

translation.text: The foolish brought the ne'er-bewildered forward, great, Victor, Song-inspirer, Fort-destroyer. Leading the Youth gold-bearded, like a courser gleaming with wealth, they turned their hymn to profit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि प॒स्त्या॑सु त्रि॒तः स्त॑भू॒यन्परि॑वीतो॒ योनौ॑ सीदद॒न्तः अतः॑ सं॒गृभ्या॑ वि॒शां दमू॑ना॒ विध॑र्मणाय॒न्त्रैरी॑यते॒ नॄन्
verses.transliteration: ní pastyā̀su tritá stabhūyán  párivīto yónau sīdad antáḥ  átaḥ saṃgŕ̥bhyā viśā́ṃ dámūnāḥ-  vídharmaṇāyantraír īyate nr̥̄́n

translation.text: Holding his station firmly in the houses, Trita sat down within his home surrounded Thence, as Law bids, departs the Tribes' Companion having collected men with no compulsion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्याजरा॑सो द॒माम॒रित्रा॑ अ॒र्चद्धू॑मासो अ॒ग्नयः॑ पाव॒काः श्वि॒ती॒चयः॑ श्वा॒त्रासो॑ भुर॒ण्यवो॑ वन॒र्षदो॑ वा॒यवो॒ न सोमाः॑
verses.transliteration: asyā́járāso damā́m arítrāḥ-  arcáddhūmāso agnáyaḥ pāvakā́ḥ  śvitīcáyaḥ śvātrā́so bhuraṇyávo  vanarṣádo vāyávo ná sómāḥ

translation.text: His are the fires, eternal, purifying, that make the houses move, whose smoke is shining, White, waxing in their strength, for ever stirring, and sitting in the wood; like winds are Somas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र जि॒ह्वया॑ भरते॒ वेपो॑ अ॒ग्निः प्र व॒युना॑नि॒ चेत॑सा पृथि॒व्याः तमा॒यवः॑ शु॒चय॑न्तं पाव॒कं म॒न्द्रं होता॑रं दधिरे॒ यजि॑ष्ठम्
verses.transliteration: prá jihváyā bharate vépo agníḥ  prá vayúnāni cétasā pr̥thivyā́ḥ  tám āyávaḥ śucáyantam pāvakám  mandráṃ hótāraṃ dadhire yájiṣṭham

translation.text: The tongue of Agni bears away the praisesong, and, through his care for Earth, her operations. Him, bright and radiant, living men have stablished as their blithe Priest, the Chief of Sacrificers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यावा॒ यम॒ग्निं पृ॑थि॒वी जनि॑ष्टा॒माप॒स्त्वष्टा॒ भृग॑वो॒ यं सहो॑भिः ई॒ळेन्यं॑ प्रथ॒मं मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑ दे॒वास्त॑तक्षु॒र्मन॑वे॒ यज॑त्रम्
verses.transliteration: dyā́vā yám agním pr̥thivī́ jániṣṭām  ā́pas tváṣṭā bhŕ̥gavo yáṃ sáhobhiḥ  īḷényam prathamám mātaríśvā  devā́s tatakṣur mánave yájatram

translation.text: That Agni, him whom Heaven and Earth engendered, the Waters. Tvashṭar, and with might, the Bhr̥igus, Him Mâtariṣvan and the Gods have fashioned holy for man and first to be entreated.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्वा॑ दे॒वा द॑धि॒रे ह॑व्य॒वाहं॑ पुरु॒स्पृहो॒ मानु॑षासो॒ यज॑त्रम् स याम॑न्नग्ने स्तुव॒ते वयो॑ धाः॒ प्र दे॑व॒यन्य॒शसः॒ सं हि पू॒र्वीः
verses.transliteration: yáṃ tvā devā́ dadhiré havyavā́ham  puruspŕ̥ho mā́nuṣāso yájatram  sá yā́mann agne stuvaté váyo dhāḥ  prá devayán yaśásaḥ sáṃ hí pūrvī́ḥ

translation.text: Agni, whom Gods have made oblationbearer, and much-desiring men regard as holy, Give life to him who lauds thee when he worships, and then shall glorious men in troops adore thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒गृ॒भ्मा ते॒ दक्षि॑णमिन्द्र॒ हस्तं॑ वसू॒यवो॑ वसुपते॒ वसू॑नाम् वि॒द्मा हि त्वा॒ गोप॑तिं शूर॒ गोना॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ चि॒त्रं वृष॑णं र॒यिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: jagr̥bhmā́ te dákṣiṇam indra hástaṃ  vasūyávo vasupate vásūnām  vidmā́ hí tvā gópatiṃ śūra gónām  asmábhyaṃ citráṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ rayíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: THY right hand have we grasped in ours, O Indra, longing for treasure, Treasure-Lord of treasures! Because we know thee, Hero, Lord of cattle: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒यु॒धं स्वव॑सं सुनी॒थं चतुः॑समुद्रं ध॒रुणं॑ रयी॒णाम् च॒र्कृत्यं॒ शंस्यं॒ भूरि॑वारम॒स्मभ्यं॑ चि॒त्रं वृष॑णं र॒यिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: svāyudháṃ svávasaṃ sunītháṃ  cátuḥsamudraṃ dharúṇaṃ rayīṇā́m  carkŕ̥tyaṃ śáṃsyam bhū́rivāram  asmábhyaṃ citráṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ rayíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: Wealth, fully armed, good guard and kind protector, sprung from four seas, the prop and stay of treasures, Fraught with great bounties, meet for praise and glory; vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒ब्रह्मा॑णं दे॒वव॑न्तं बृ॒हन्त॑मु॒रुं ग॑भी॒रं पृ॒थुबु॑ध्नमिन्द्र श्रु॒तऋ॑षिमु॒ग्रम॑भिमाति॒षाह॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ चि॒त्रं वृष॑णं र॒यिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: subráhmāṇaṃ devávantam br̥hántam  urúṃ gabhīrám pr̥thúbudhnam indra  śrutár̥ṣim ugrám abhimātiṣā́ham  asmábhyaṃ citráṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ rayíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: Wealth, with good Brahmans, Indra! God-attended, high, wide, and deep, arid based on broad foundations, Strong, with famed R̥ishis, conquering our foemen: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒नद्वा॑जं॒ विप्र॑वीरं॒ तरु॑त्रं धन॒स्पृतं॑ शूशु॒वांसं॑ सु॒दक्ष॑म् द॒स्यु॒हनं॑ पू॒र्भिद॑मिन्द्र स॒त्यम॒स्मभ्यं॑ चि॒त्रं वृष॑णं र॒यिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: sanádvājaṃ vípravīraṃ tárutraṃ  dhanaspŕ̥taṃ śūśuvā́ṃsaṃ sudákṣam  dasyuhánam pūrbhídam indra satyám  asmábhyaṃ citráṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ rayíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: Victorious, winning strength, with hero sages, confirmed in power, most useful, wealth-attracting, True, Indra! crushing forts and slaying Dasyus: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑वन्तं र॒थिनं॑ वी॒रव॑न्तं सह॒स्रिणं॑ श॒तिनं॒ वाज॑मिन्द्र भ॒द्रव्रा॑तं॒ विप्र॑वीरं स्व॒र्षाम॒स्मभ्यं॑ चि॒त्रं वृष॑णं र॒यिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: áśvāvantaṃ rathínaṃ vīrávantaṃ  sahasríṇaṃ śatínaṃ vā́jam indra  bhadrávrātaṃ vípravīraṃ svarṣā́m  asmábhyaṃ citráṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ rayíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: Wealthy in heroes and in cars and horses, strength hundredfold and thousandfold, O Indra, With manly sages, happy troops, Iight-winning: vouchsafe us mighty and resplentdent riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र स॒प्तगु॑मृ॒तधी॑तिं सुमे॒धां बृह॒स्पतिं॑ म॒तिरच्छा॑ जिगाति य आ॑ङ्गिर॒सो नम॑सोप॒सद्यो॒ऽस्मभ्यं॑ चि॒त्रं वृष॑णं र॒यिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: prá saptágum r̥tádhītiṃ sumedhā́m  bŕ̥haspátim matír áchā jigāti  yá āṅgirasó námasopasádyo  asmábhyaṃ citráṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ rayíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: To Saptagu the sage, the holy-minded, to him, Br̥ihaspati, the song approaches, Angiras' Son who must be met with homage: vouchsafe us mighty and reslendent riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वनी॑वानो॒ मम॑ दू॒तास॒ इन्द्रं॒ स्तोमा॑श्चरन्ति सुम॒तीरि॑या॒नाः हृ॒दि॒स्पृशो॒ मन॑सा व॒च्यमा॑ना अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ चि॒त्रं वृष॑णं र॒यिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: vánīvāno máma dūtā́sa índraṃ  stómāś caranti sumatī́r iyānā́ḥ  hr̥dispŕ̥śo mánasā vacyámānāḥ-  asmábhyaṃ citráṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ rayíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: My lauds, like envoys, craving loving-kindness, go forth to Indra with their strong entreaty, Moving his heart and uttered by my spirit: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.
