verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्त्वा॒ यामि॑ द॒द्धि तन्न॑ इन्द्र बृ॒हन्तं॒ क्षय॒मस॑मं॒ जना॑नाम् अ॒भि तद्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी गृ॑णीताम॒स्मभ्यं॑ चि॒त्रं वृष॑णं र॒यिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: yát tvā yā́mi daddhí tán na indra  br̥hántaṃ kṣáyam ásamaṃ jánānām  abhí tád dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ gr̥ṇītām  asmábhyaṃ citráṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ rayíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: Grant us the boon for which I pray, O Indra, a spacious home unmatched among the people. To this may Heaven and Earth accord approval: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं भु॑वं॒ वसु॑नः पू॒र्व्यस्पति॑र॒हं धना॑नि॒ सं ज॑यामि॒ शश्व॑तः मां ह॑वन्ते पि॒तरं॒ न ज॒न्तवो॒ऽहं दा॒शुषे॒ वि भ॑जामि॒ भोज॑नम्
verses.transliteration: ahám bhuvaṃ vásunaḥ pūrvyás pátir  aháṃ dhánāni sáṃ jayāmi śáśvataḥ  mā́ṃ havante pitáraṃ ná jantávo  -aháṃ dāśúṣe ví bhajāmi bhójanam

translation.text: I WAS the first possessor of all precious gear: the wealth of every man I win and gather up. On me as on a Father living creatures call; I deal enjoyment to tho. man who offers gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हमिन्द्रो॒ रोधो॒ वक्षो॒ अथ॑र्वणस्त्रि॒ताय॒ गा अ॑जनय॒महे॒रधि॑ अ॒हं दस्यु॑भ्यः॒ परि॑ नृ॒म्णमा द॑दे गो॒त्रा शिक्ष॑न्दधी॒चे मा॑त॒रिश्व॑ने
verses.transliteration: ahám índro ródho vákṣo átharvaṇas  tritā́ya gā́ ajanayam áher ádhi  aháṃ dásyubhyaḥ pári nr̥mṇám ā́ dade  gotrā́ śíkṣan dadhīcé mātaríśvane

translation.text: I, Indra, am Atharvan's stay and firm support: I brought forth kine to Trita from the Dragon's grasp. I stripped the Dasyus of their manly might, and gave the cattle-stalls to Matarigvan and Dadhyach.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मह्यं॒ त्वष्टा॒ वज्र॑मतक्षदाय॒सं मयि॑ दे॒वासो॑ऽवृज॒न्नपि॒ क्रतु॑म् ममानी॑कं॒ सूर्य॑स्येव दु॒ष्टरं॒ मामार्य॑न्ति कृ॒तेन॒ कर्त्वे॑न च
verses.transliteration: máhyaṃ tváṣṭā vájram atakṣad āyasám  máyi devā́so 'vr̥jann ápi krátum  mámā́nīkaṃ sū́ryasyeva duṣṭáram  mā́m ā́ryanti kr̥téna kártvena ca

translation.text: For me hath Tvashṭar forged the iron thunderbolt: in me the Gods have centred intellectual power. My sheen is like the Sun's insufferably bright: men honour me as Lord for past and future deeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हमे॒तं ग॒व्यय॒मश्व्यं॑ प॒शुं पु॑री॒षिणं॒ साय॑केना हिर॒ण्यय॑म् पु॒रू स॒हस्रा॒ नि शि॑शामि दा॒शुषे॒ यन्मा॒ सोमा॑स उ॒क्थिनो॒ अम॑न्दिषुः
verses.transliteration: ahám etáṃ gavyáyam áśvyam paśúm  purīṣíṇaṃ sā́yakenā hiraṇyáyam  purū́ sahásrā ní śiśāmi dāśúṣe  yán mā sómāsa ukthíno ámandiṣuḥ

translation.text: I won myself these herdi of cattle, steeds and kine, and gold in ample store, with my destructive bolt. I give full many a thousand to the worshipper, what time the Somas and the lauds have made me glad.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हमिन्द्रो॒ न परा॑ जिग्य॒ इद्धनं॒ न मृ॒त्यवेऽव॑ तस्थे॒ कदा॑ च॒न सोम॒मिन्मा॑ सु॒न्वन्तो॑ याचता॒ वसु॒ न मे॑ पूरवः स॒ख्ये रि॑षाथन
verses.transliteration: ahám índro ná párā jigya íd dhánaṃ  ná mr̥tyávé 'va tasthe kádā caná  sómam ín mā sunvánto yācatā vásu  ná me pūravaḥ sakhyé riṣāthana

translation.text: Indra am I none ever wins my wealth from me never at any time am I a thrall to death. Pressing the Soma, ask riches from me alone: ye, Pûrus, in my friendship shall not suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हमे॒ताञ्छाश्व॑सतो॒ द्वाद्वेन्द्रं॒ ये वज्रं॑ यु॒धयेऽकृ॑ण्वत आ॒ह्वय॑मानाँ॒ अव॒ हन्म॑नाहनं दृ॒ळ्हा वद॒न्नन॑मस्युर्नम॒स्विनः॑
verses.transliteration: ahám etā́ñ chā́śvasato dvā́-dvā-  -índraṃ yé vájraṃ yudháyé 'kr̥ṇvata  āhváyamānām̐ áva hánmanāhanaṃ  dr̥ḷhā́ vádann ánamasyur namasvínaḥ

translation.text: These, breathing loud in fury, two and two, who caused Indra to bring his bolt of thunder to the fray, The challengers, I struck with deadly weapon down: firm stand what words the God speaks to his worshippers. This One by stronger might I conquered singly; yea, also two: shall three prevail against me? Like many sheaves upon the floor I thrash them. How can my foes, the Indraless, revile me?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी॒३॒॑दमेक॒मेको॑ अस्मि नि॒ष्षाळ॒भी द्वा किमु॒ त्रयः॑ करन्ति खले॒ न प॒र्षान्प्रति॑ हन्मि॒ भूरि॒ किं मा॑ निन्दन्ति॒ शत्र॑वोऽनि॒न्द्राः
verses.transliteration: abhī̀dám ékam éko asmi niṣṣā́ḷ  abhī́ dvā́ kím u tráyaḥ karanti  khále ná parṣā́n práti hanmi bhū́ri  kím mā nindanti śátravo 'nindrā́ḥ

translation.text: This One by stronger might I conquered singly; yea, also two: shall three prevail against me? Like many sheaves upon the floor I thrash them. How can my foes, the Indraless, revile me?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं गु॒ङ्गुभ्यो॑ अतिथि॒ग्वमिष्क॑र॒मिषं॒ न वृ॑त्र॒तुरं॑ वि॒क्षु धा॑रयम् यत्प॑र्णय॒घ्न उ॒त वा॑ करञ्ज॒हे प्राहं म॒हे वृ॑त्र॒हत्ये॒ अशु॑श्रवि
verses.transliteration: aháṃ guṅgúbhyo atithigvám íṣkaram  íṣaṃ ná vr̥tratúraṃ vikṣú dhārayam  yát parṇayaghná utá vā karañjahé  prā́hám mahé vr̥trahátye áśuśravi

translation.text: Against the Gungus I made Âtithigva strong, and kept him mid the folk like Vr̥itra-conquering strength, When I won glory in the great foe-slaying fight, in battle where Karanja fell, and Parṇaya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र मे॒ नमी॑ सा॒प्य इ॒षे भु॒जे भू॒द्गवा॒मेषे॑ स॒ख्या कृ॑णुत द्वि॒ता दि॒द्युं यद॑स्य समि॒थेषु॑ मं॒हय॒मादिदे॑नं॒ शंस्य॑मु॒क्थ्यं॑ करम्
verses.transliteration: prá me námī sāpyá iṣé bhujé bhūd  gávām éṣe sakhyā́ kr̥ṇuta dvitā́  didyúṃ yád asya samithéṣu maṃháyam  ā́d íd enaṃ śáṃsyam ukthyàṃ karam

translation.text: With food for mine enjoyment Sâpya Namî came: he joined me as a friend of old in search of kine. As I bestowed on him an arrow for the fight I made him worthy of the song apd hymn of praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नेम॑स्मिन्ददृशे॒ सोमो॑ अ॒न्तर्गो॒पा नेम॑मा॒विर॒स्था कृ॑णोति स ति॒ग्मशृ॑ङ्गं वृष॒भं युयु॑त्सन्द्रु॒हस्त॑स्थौ बहु॒ले ब॒द्धो अ॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: prá némasmin dadr̥śe sómo antár  gopā́ némam āvír asthā́ kr̥ṇoti  sá tigmáśr̥ṅgaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ yúyutsan  druhás tasthau bahulé baddhó antáḥ

translation.text: One of the two hath Soma, seen within it; the Herdsman with the bone shows forth the other. He, fain to fight the Bull whose horns were sharpened, stood fettered in the demon's ample region.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दि॒त्यानां॒ वसू॑नां रु॒द्रिया॑णां दे॒वो दे॒वानां॒ न मि॑नामि॒ धाम॑ ते मा॑ भ॒द्राय॒ शव॑से ततक्षु॒रप॑राजित॒मस्तृ॑त॒मषा॑ळ्हम्
verses.transliteration: ādityā́nāṃ vásūnāṃ rudríyāṇāṃ  devó devā́nāṃ ná mināmi dhā́ma  té mā bhadrā́ya śávase tatakṣur  áparājitam ástr̥tam áṣāḷham

translation.text: I, as a God, ne'er violate the statutes of Gods, of Vasus, Rudriyas, Âdityas. These Gods have formed me for auspicious vigour, unconquered and invincible for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं दां॑ गृण॒ते पूर्व्यं॒ वस्व॒हं ब्रह्म॑ कृणवं॒ मह्यं॒ वर्ध॑नम् अ॒हं भु॑वं॒ यज॑मानस्य चोदि॒ताय॑ज्वनः साक्षि॒ विश्व॑स्मि॒न्भरे॑
verses.transliteration: aháṃ dāṃ gr̥ṇaté pū́rvyaṃ vásu-  ahám bráhma kr̥ṇavam máhyaṃ várdhanam  ahám bhuvaṃ yájamānasya coditā́-  -áyajvanaḥ sākṣi víśvasmin bháre

translation.text: I HAVE enriched the singer with surpassing wealth; I have allowed the holy hymn to strengthen me. I, furtherer of him who offers sacrifice, have conquered in each fight the men who worship not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मां धु॒रिन्द्रं॒ नाम॑ दे॒वता॑ दि॒वश्च॒ ग्मश्चा॒पां च॑ ज॒न्तवः॑ अ॒हं हरी॒ वृष॑णा॒ विव्र॑ता र॒घू अ॒हं वज्रं॒ शव॑से धृ॒ष्ण्वा द॑दे
verses.transliteration: mā́ṃ dhur índraṃ nā́ma devátā  diváś ca gmáś cāpā́ṃ ca jantávaḥ  aháṃ hárī vŕ̥ṣaṇā vívratā raghū́  aháṃ vájraṃ śávase dhr̥ṣṇv ā́ dade

translation.text: The People of the heavens, the waters, and the earth have stablished me among the Gods with Indra's name. I took unto myself the two swift vigorous Bays that speed on divers paths, and the fierce bolt for strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हमत्कं॑ क॒वये॑ शिश्नथं॒ हथै॑र॒हं कुत्स॑मावमा॒भिरू॒तिभिः॑ अ॒हं शुष्ण॑स्य॒ श्नथि॑ता॒ वध॑र्यमं॒ न यो र॒र आर्यं॒ नाम॒ दस्य॑वे
verses.transliteration: ahám átkaṃ kaváye śiśnathaṃ háthair  aháṃ kútsam āvam ābhír ūtíbhiḥ  aháṃ śúṣṇasya śnáthitā vádhar yamaṃ  ná yó rará ā́ryaṃ nā́ma dásyave

translation.text: With deadly blows I smote Atka for Kavi's sake; I guarded Kutsa well with these saving helps. As Ṣushṇa's slayer I brandished the dart of death: I gave not up the Aryan name to Dasyu foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं पि॒तेव॑ वेत॒सूँर॒भिष्ट॑ये॒ तुग्रं॒ कुत्सा॑य॒ स्मदि॑भं च रन्धयम् अ॒हं भु॑वं॒ यज॑मानस्य रा॒जनि॒ प्र यद्भरे॒ तुज॑ये॒ न प्रि॒याधृषे॑
verses.transliteration: ahám pitéva vetasū́m̐r abhíṣṭaye  túgraṃ kútsāya smádibhaṃ ca randhayam  ahám bhuvaṃ yájamānasya rājáni  prá yád bháre tújaye ná priyā́dhŕ̥ṣe

translation.text: Smadibha, Tugra, and the Vetasus I gave as prey to Kutsa, father-like, to succour him. I was a worthy King to rule the worshipper, when I gave Tuji dear inviolable gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं र॑न्धयं॒ मृग॑यं श्रु॒तर्व॑णे॒ यन्माजि॑हीत व॒युना॑ च॒नानु॒षक् अ॒हं वे॒शं न॒म्रमा॒यवे॑ऽकरम॒हं सव्या॑य॒ पड्गृ॑भिमरन्धयम्
verses.transliteration: aháṃ randhayam mŕ̥gayaṃ śrutárvaṇe  yán mā́jihīta vayúnā canā́nuṣák  aháṃ veśáṃ namrám āyáve 'karam  aháṃ sávyāya páḍgr̥bhim arandhayam

translation.text: I gave up Mr̥igaya to Ṣrutarvan as his prey because he ever followed me and kept my laws. For Âyu's sake I caused Veta to bend and bow, and into Savya's hand delivered Paḍgr̥ibhi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं स यो नव॑वास्त्वं बृ॒हद्र॑थं॒ सं वृ॒त्रेव॒ दासं॑ वृत्र॒हारु॑जम् यद्व॒र्धय॑न्तं प्र॒थय॑न्तमानु॒षग्दू॒रे पा॒रे रज॑सो रोच॒नाक॑रम्
verses.transliteration: aháṃ sá yó návavāstvam br̥hádrathaṃ  sáṃ vr̥tréva dā́saṃ vr̥trahā́rujam  yád vardháyantam pratháyantam ānuṣág  dūré pāré rájaso rocanā́karam

translation.text: I, I crushed Navavâstva of the lofty car, the Dâsa, as the Vr̥itra-slayer kills the fiends; When straightway on the region's farthest edge I brought the God who makes the lights to broaden and increase.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं सूर्य॑स्य॒ परि॑ याम्या॒शुभिः॒ प्रैत॒शेभि॒र्वह॑मान॒ ओज॑सा यन्मा॑ सा॒वो मनु॑ष॒ आह॑ नि॒र्णिज॒ ऋध॑क्कृषे॒ दासं॒ कृत्व्यं॒ हथैः॑
verses.transliteration: aháṃ sū́ryasya pári yāmy āśúbhiḥ  praítaśébhir váhamāna ójasā  yán mā sāvó mánuṣa ā́ha nirṇíje-  ŕ̥dhak kr̥ṣe dā́saṃ kŕ̥tvyaṃ háthaiḥ

translation.text: I travel round about borne onward in my might by the fleet-footed dappled Horses of the Sun. When man's libation calls me to the robe of state I soon repel the powerful Dasyu with my blows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं स॑प्त॒हा नहु॑षो॒ नहु॑ष्टरः॒ प्राश्रा॑वयं॒ शव॑सा तु॒र्वशं॒ यदु॑म् अ॒हं न्य१॒॑न्यं सह॑सा॒ सह॑स्करं॒ नव॒ व्राध॑तो नव॒तिं च॑ वक्षयम्
verses.transliteration: aháṃ saptahā́ náhuṣo náhuṣṭaraḥ  prā́śrāvayaṃ śávasā turváśaṃ yádum  aháṃ ny ànyáṃ sáhasā sáhas karaṃ  náva vrā́dhato navatíṃ ca vakṣayam

translation.text: Stronger am I than Nabus, I who slew the seven: I glorified with might Yadu and Turvaga. I brought another low, with strength I bent his strength: I let the mighty nine-and-ninety wax in power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं स॒प्त स्र॒वतो॑ धारयं॒ वृषा॑ द्रवि॒त्न्वः॑ पृथि॒व्यां सी॒रा अधि॑ अ॒हमर्णां॑सि॒ वि ति॑रामि सु॒क्रतु॑र्यु॒धा वि॑दं॒ मन॑वे गा॒तुमि॒ष्टये॑
verses.transliteration: aháṃ saptá sraváto dhārayaṃ vŕ̥ṣā  dravitnvàḥ pr̥thivyā́ṃ sīrā́ ádhi  ahám árṇāṃsi ví tirāmi sukrátur  yudhā́ vidam mánave gātúm iṣṭáye

translation.text: Bull over all the streams that flow along the earth, I took the Seven Rivers as mine own domain. I, gifted with great wisdom, spread the floods abroad: by war I found for man the way to high success.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं तदा॑सु धारयं॒ यदा॑सु॒ न दे॒वश्च॒न त्वष्टाधा॑रय॒द्रुश॑त् स्पा॒र्हं गवा॒मूधः॑सु व॒क्षणा॒स्वा मधो॒र्मधु॒ श्वात्र्यं॒ सोम॑मा॒शिर॑म्
verses.transliteration: aháṃ tád āsu dhārayaṃ yád āsu ná  deváś caná tváṣṭā́dhārayad rúśat  spārháṃ gávām ū́dhassu vakṣáṇāsv~ā́  mádhor mádhu śvā́tryaṃ sómam āśíram

translation.text: I set within these cows the white milk which no God, not even Tvashṭar's self, had there deposited,– Much-longed-for, in the breasts, the udders of the kine, the savoury sweets of meath, the milk and Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा दे॒वाँ इन्द्रो॑ विव्ये॒ नॄन्प्र च्यौ॒त्नेन॑ म॒घवा॑ स॒त्यरा॑धाः विश्वेत्ता ते॑ हरिवः शचीवो॒ऽभि तु॒रासः॑ स्वयशो गृणन्ति
verses.transliteration: evā́ devā́m̐ índro vivye nr̥̄́n  prá cyautnéna maghávā satyárādhāḥ  víśvét tā́ te harivaḥ śacīvo  -abhí turā́saḥ svayaśo gr̥ṇanti

translation.text: Even thus hath Indra Maghavan, truly bounteous, sped Gods and men with mighty operation. The pious glorify all these thine exploits, Lord of Bay Coursers, Strong, and Selfresplendent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ म॒हे मन्द॑माना॒यान्ध॒सोऽर्चा॑ वि॒श्वान॑राय विश्वा॒भुवे॑ इन्द्र॑स्य॒ यस्य॒ सुम॑खं॒ सहो॒ महि॒ श्रवो॑ नृ॒म्णं च॒ रोद॑सी सप॒र्यतः॑
verses.transliteration: prá vo mahé mándamānāyā́ndhasaḥ-  -árcā viśvā́narāya viśvābhúve  índrasya yásya súmakhaṃ sáho máhi  śrávo nr̥mṇáṃ ca ródasī saparyátaḥ

translation.text: I LAUD your Mighty One who joyeth in the juice, him who is shared by all men, who created all; Indra, whose conquering strength is powerful in war, whose fame and manly vigour Heaven and Earth revere.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो चि॒न्नु सख्या॒ नर्य॑ इ॒नः स्तु॒तश्च॒र्कृत्य॒ इन्द्रो॒ माव॑ते॒ नरे॑ विश्वा॑सु धू॒र्षु वा॑ज॒कृत्ये॑षु सत्पते वृ॒त्रे वा॒प्स्व१॒॑भि शू॑र मन्दसे
verses.transliteration: só cin nú sákhyā nárya iná stutáś  carkŕ̥tya índro mā́vate náre  víśvāsu dhūrṣú vājakŕ̥tyeṣu satpate  vr̥tré vāpsv àbhí śūra mandase

translation.text: He with his friend is active, lauded, good to man, Indra who must be glorified by one like me. Hero, Lord of the brave, all cars are thy delight, warring with Vr̥itra, or for waters, or for spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: के ते नर॑ इन्द्र॒ ये त॑ इ॒षे ये ते॑ सु॒म्नं स॑ध॒न्य१॒॑मिय॑क्षान् के ते॒ वाजा॑यासु॒र्या॑य हिन्विरे॒ के अ॒प्सु स्वासू॒र्वरा॑सु॒ पौंस्ये॑
verses.transliteration: ké té nára indra yé ta iṣé  yé te sumnáṃ sadhanyàm íyakṣān  ké te vā́jāyāsuryā̀ya hinvire  ké apsú svā́sūrvárāsu paúṃsye

translation.text: Who are the men whom thou wilt further, Indra, who strive to win thy bliss allied with riches? Who urged thee forward to exert thy power divine, to valour, in the war for waters on their fields?

verses.sanskrit_deva: भुव॒स्त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ ब्रह्म॑णा म॒हान्भुवो॒ विश्वे॑षु॒ सव॑नेषु य॒ज्ञियः॑ भुवो॒ नॄँश्च्यौ॒त्नो विश्व॑स्मि॒न्भरे॒ ज्येष्ठ॑श्च॒ मन्त्रो॑ विश्वचर्षणे
verses.transliteration: bhúvas tvám indra bráhmaṇā mahā́n  bhúvo víśveṣu sávaneṣu yajñíyaḥ  bhúvo nr̥̄́ṃś cyautnó víśvasmin bháre  jyéṣṭhaś ca mántro viśvacarṣaṇe

translation.text: Thou, Indra, through the holy prayer art mighty, worthy of sacrifice at all libations. In every fight thou castest heroes on the ground: thou art the noblest song, O Lord of all the folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवा॒ नु कं॒ ज्याया॑न्य॒ज्ञव॑नसो म॒हीं त॒ ओमा॑त्रां कृ॒ष्टयो॑ विदुः असो॒ नु क॑म॒जरो॒ वर्धा॑श्च॒ विश्वेदे॒ता सव॑ना तूतु॒मा कृ॑षे
verses.transliteration: ávā nú kaṃ jyā́yān yajñávanaso  mahī́ṃ ta ómātrāṃ kr̥ṣṭáyo viduḥ  áso nú kam ajáro várdhāś ca  víśvéd etā́ sávanā tūtumā́ kr̥ṣe

translation.text: Help now, as Highest, those who toil at sacrifice: well do the people know thy great protecting might. Thou shalt be Everlasing, Giver of success yea, on all these libations thou bestowest strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता विश्वा॒ सव॑ना तूतु॒मा कृ॑षे स्व॒यं सू॑नो सहसो॒ यानि॑ दधि॒षे वरा॑य ते॒ पात्रं॒ धर्म॑णे॒ तना॑ य॒ज्ञो मन्त्रो॒ ब्रह्मोद्य॑तं॒ वचः॑
verses.transliteration: etā́ víśvā sávanā tūtumā́ kr̥ṣe  svayáṃ sūno sahaso yā́ni dadhiṣé  várāya te pā́traṃ dhármaṇe tánā  yajñó mántro bráhmódyataṃ vácaḥ

translation.text: All these libations thou makest effectual, of which thou art thyself supporter, Son of Power. Therefore thy vessel is to be esteemed the best, sacrifice, holy text, prayer, and exalted speech.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ते॑ विप्र ब्रह्म॒कृतः॑ सु॒ते सचा॒ वसू॑नां च॒ वसु॑नश्च दा॒वने॑ प्र ते सु॒म्नस्य॒ मन॑सा प॒था भु॑व॒न्मदे॑ सु॒तस्य॑ सो॒म्यस्यान्ध॑सः
verses.transliteration: yé te vipra brahmakŕ̥taḥ suté sácā  vásūnāṃ ca vásunaś ca dāváne  prá té sumnásya mánasā pathā́ bhuvan  máde sutásya somyásyā́ndhasaḥ

translation.text: They who with flowing Soma pray to thee, O Sage, to pour on them thy gifts of opulence and wealth, May they come forward, through their spirit, on the path of bliss, in the wild joy of Soma juice effused.

suktas.deity: Dialogue Between the Gods and Agni

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हत्तदुल्बं॒ स्थवि॑रं॒ तदा॑सी॒द्येनावि॑ष्टितः प्रवि॒वेशि॑था॒पः विश्वा॑ अपश्यद्बहु॒धा ते॑ अग्ने॒ जात॑वेदस्त॒न्वो॑ दे॒व एकः॑
verses.transliteration: mahát tád úlbaṃ stháviraṃ tád āsīd  yénā́viṣṭitaḥ pravivéśithāpáḥ  víśvā apaśyad bahudhā́ te agne  jā́tavedas tanvò devá ékaḥ

translation.text: LARGE was that covering, and firm of texture, folded wherein thou enteredst the waters. One Deity alone, O Jâtavedas Agni, saw all thy forms in sundry places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को मा॑ ददर्श कत॒मः स दे॒वो यो मे॑ त॒न्वो॑ बहु॒धा प॒र्यप॑श्यत् क्वाह॑ मित्रावरुणा क्षियन्त्य॒ग्नेर्विश्वाः॑ स॒मिधो॑ देव॒यानीः॑
verses.transliteration: kó mā dadarśa katamáḥ sá devó  yó me tanvò bahudhā́ paryápaśyat  kvā́ha mitrāvaruṇā kṣiyanti-  agnér víśvāḥ samídho devayā́nīḥ

translation.text: What God hath seen me? Who of all their number clearly beheld my forms in many places? Where lie, then, all the sacred logs of Agni that lead him God-ward, Varuṇa and Mitra?

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऐच्छा॑म त्वा बहु॒धा जा॑तवेदः॒ प्रवि॑ष्टमग्ने अ॒प्स्वोष॑धीषु तं त्वा॑ य॒मो अ॑चिकेच्चित्रभानो दशान्तरु॒ष्याद॑ति॒रोच॑मानम्
verses.transliteration: aíchāma tvā bahudhā́ jātavedaḥ  práviṣṭam agne apsv óṣadhīṣu  táṃ tvā yamó acikec citrabhāno  daśāntaruṣyā́d atirócamānam

translation.text: In many places, Agni Jâtavedas, we sought thee hidden in the plants and waters. Then Yama marked thee, God of wondrous splendour! effulgent from thy tenfold secret dwelling,

verses.sanskrit_deva: हो॒त्राद॒हं व॑रुण॒ बिभ्य॑दायं॒ नेदे॒व मा॑ यु॒नज॒न्नत्र॑ दे॒वाः तस्य॑ मे त॒न्वो॑ बहु॒धा निवि॑ष्टा ए॒तमर्थं॒ न चि॑केता॒हम॒ग्निः
verses.transliteration: hotrā́d aháṃ varuṇa bíbhyad āyaṃ  néd evá mā yunájann átra devā́ḥ  tásya me tanvò bahudhā́ níviṣṭāḥ-  etám árthaṃ ná ciketāhám agníḥ

translation.text: I fled in fear from sacrificial worship, Varuṇa, lest the Gods should thus engage me. Thus were my forms laid down in many places. This, as my goal, I Agni saw before me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एहि॒ मनु॑र्देव॒युर्य॒ज्ञका॑मोऽरं॒कृत्या॒ तम॑सि क्षेष्यग्ने सु॒गान्प॒थः कृ॑णुहि देव॒याना॒न्वह॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ सुमन॒स्यमा॑नः
verses.transliteration: éhi mánur devayúr yajñákāmo  -araṃkŕ̥tyā támasi kṣeṣy agne  sugā́n patháḥ kr̥ṇuhi devayā́nān  váha havyā́ni sumanasyámānaḥ

translation.text: Come; man is pious and would fain do worship, he waits prepared: in gloom thou, Agni, dwellest. Make pathways leading God-ward clear and easy, and bear oblations with a kindly spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्नेः पूर्वे॒ भ्रात॑रो॒ अर्थ॑मे॒तं र॒थीवाध्वा॑न॒मन्वाव॑रीवुः तस्मा॑द्भि॒या व॑रुण दू॒रमा॑यं गौ॒रो न क्षे॒प्नोर॑विजे॒ ज्यायाः॑
verses.transliteration: agnéḥ pū́rve bhrā́taro ártham etáṃ  rathī́vā́dhvānam ánv ā́varīvuḥ  tásmād bhiyā́ varuṇa dūrám āyaṃ  gauró ná kṣepnór avije jyā́yāḥ

translation.text: This goal mine elder brothers erst selected, as he who drives a car the way to travel. So,Varuṇa, I fled afar through terror, as flies the wild-bull from an archer's bowstring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒र्मस्त॒ आयु॑र॒जरं॒ यद॑ग्ने॒ यथा॑ यु॒क्तो जा॑तवेदो॒ न रिष्याः॑ अथा॑ वहासि सुमन॒स्यमा॑नो भा॒गं दे॒वेभ्यो॑ ह॒विषः॑ सुजात
verses.transliteration: kurmás ta ā́yur ajáraṃ yád agne  yáthā yuktó jātavedo ná ríṣyāḥ  áthā vahāsi sumanasyámāno  bhāgáṃ devébhyo havíṣaḥ sujāta

translation.text: We give thee life unwasting, Jâtavedas, so that, employed, thou never shalt be injured. So, nobly born! shalt thou with kindly spirit bear to the Gods their share of men's oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒या॒जान्मे॑ अनुया॒जाँश्च॒ केव॑ला॒नूर्ज॑स्वन्तं ह॒विषो॑ दत्त भा॒गम् घृ॒तं चा॒पां पुरु॑षं॒ चौष॑धीनाम॒ग्नेश्च॑ दी॒र्घमायु॑रस्तु देवाः
verses.transliteration: prayājā́n me anuyājā́ṃś ca kévalān  ū́rjasvantaṃ havíṣo datta bhāgám  ghr̥táṃ cāpā́m púruṣaṃ caúṣadhīnām  agnéś ca dīrghám ā́yur astu devāḥ

translation.text: Grant me the first oblations and the latter, entire, my forceful shares of holy presents, The soul of plants, the fatness of the waters, and let there be long life, ye Gods, to Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॑ प्रया॒जा अ॑नुया॒जाश्च॒ केव॑ल॒ ऊर्ज॑स्वन्तो ह॒विषः॑ सन्तु भा॒गाः तवा॑ग्ने य॒ज्ञो॒३॒॑ऽयम॑स्तु॒ सर्व॒स्तुभ्यं॑ नमन्तां प्र॒दिश॒श्चत॑स्रः
verses.transliteration: táva prayājā́ anuyājā́ś ca kévale-  ū́rjasvanto havíṣaḥ santu bhāgā́ḥ  távāgne yajñò 'yám astu sárvas  túbhyaṃ namantām pradíśaś cátasraḥ

translation.text: Thine be the first oblations and the latter, entire, thy forceful shares of holy presents. Let all this sacrifice be thine, O Agni, and let the world's four regions how before thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ देवाः शा॒स्तन॑ मा॒ यथे॒ह होता॑ वृ॒तो म॒नवै॒ यन्नि॒षद्य॑ प्र मे॑ ब्रूत भाग॒धेयं॒ यथा॑ वो॒ येन॑ प॒था ह॒व्यमा वो॒ वहा॑नि
verses.transliteration: víśve devāḥ śāstána mā yáthehá  hótā vr̥tó manávai yán niṣádya  prá me brūta bhāgadhéyaṃ yáthā vo  yéna pathā́ havyám ā́ vo váhāni

translation.text: INSTRUCT me, all ye Gods, how I, elected your Priest, must seat me here, and how address you. Instruct me how to deal to each his portion, and by what ' path to bring you man's oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं होता॒ न्य॑सीदं॒ यजी॑या॒न्विश्वे॑ दे॒वा म॒रुतो॑ मा जुनन्ति अह॑रहरश्वि॒नाध्व॑र्यवं वां ब्र॒ह्मा स॒मिद्भ॑वति॒ साहु॑तिर्वाम्
verses.transliteration: aháṃ hótā ny àsīdaṃ yájīyān  víśve devā́ marúto mā junanti  áhar-ahar aśvinā́dhvaryavaṃ vām  brahmā́ samíd bhavati sā́hutir vām

translation.text: I sit as Priest most skilled in sacrificing: the Maruts and all Deities impel me. Aṣvins, each day yours is the Adhvaryu's duty: Brahman and wood are here: 'tis yours to offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं यो होता॒ किरु॒ स य॒मस्य॒ कमप्यू॑हे॒ यत्स॑म॒ञ्जन्ति॑ दे॒वाः अह॑रहर्जायते मा॒सिमा॒स्यथा॑ दे॒वा द॑धिरे हव्य॒वाह॑म्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ yó hótā kír u sá yamásya  kám ápy ūhe yát samañjánti devā́ḥ  áhar-ahar jāyate māsí-māsi-  -áthā devā́ dadhire havyavā́ham

translation.text: Who is the Priest? Is he the Priest of Yama? On whom is thrust this God-appointed honour? He springs to life each month, each day that passes; so Gods have made him their oblation-bearer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मां दे॒वा द॑धिरे हव्य॒वाह॒मप॑म्लुक्तं ब॒हु कृ॒च्छ्रा चर॑न्तम् अ॒ग्निर्वि॒द्वान्य॒ज्ञं नः॑ कल्पयाति॒ पञ्च॑यामं त्रि॒वृतं॑ स॒प्तत॑न्तुम्
verses.transliteration: mā́ṃ devā́ dadhire havyavā́ham  ápamluktam bahú kr̥chrā́ cárantam  agnír vidvā́n yajñáṃ naḥ kalpayāti  páñcayāmaṃ trivŕ̥taṃ saptátantum

translation.text: The Gods have made me bearer of oblations, who slipped away and passed through many troubles. Wise Agni shall ordain for us the worship, whether five-wayed, threefold, or seven-threaded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वो॑ यक्ष्यमृत॒त्वं सु॒वीरं॒ यथा॑ वो देवा॒ वरि॑वः॒ करा॑णि आ बा॒ह्वोर्वज्र॒मिन्द्र॑स्य धेया॒मथे॒मा विश्वाः॒ पृत॑ना जयाति
verses.transliteration: ā́ vo yakṣy amr̥tatváṃ suvī́raṃ  yáthā vo devā várivaḥ kárāṇi  ā́ bāhvór vájram índrasya dheyām  áthemā́ víśvāḥ pŕ̥tanā jayāti

translation.text: So will I win you strength and life for ever. O Gods, that I may give you room and freedom. To Indra's arms would I consign the thunder; in all these battles shall he then be victor.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रीणि॑ श॒ता त्री स॒हस्रा॑ण्य॒ग्निं त्रिं॒शच्च॑ दे॒वा नव॑ चासपर्यन् औक्ष॑न्घृ॒तैरस्तृ॑णन्ब॒र्हिर॑स्मा॒ आदिद्धोता॑रं॒ न्य॑सादयन्त
verses.transliteration: trī́ṇi śatā́ trī́ sahásrāṇy agníṃ  triṃśác ca devā́ náva cāsaparyan  aúkṣan ghr̥taír ástr̥ṇan barhír asmai-  ā́d íd dhótāraṃ ny àsādayanta

translation.text: The Deities three hundred and thirty-nine, have served and honoured Agni, Strewn sacred grass, anointed him with butter, and seated him as Priest, the Gods' Invoker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमैच्छा॑म॒ मन॑सा॒ सो॒३॒॑ऽयमागा॑द्य॒ज्ञस्य॑ वि॒द्वान्परु॑षश्चिकि॒त्वान् स नो॑ यक्षद्दे॒वता॑ता॒ यजी॑या॒न्नि हि षत्स॒दन्त॑रः॒ पूर्वो॑ अ॒स्मत्
verses.transliteration: yám aíchāma mánasā sò 'yám ā́gād  yajñásya vidvā́n páruṣaś cikitvā́n  sá no yakṣad devátātā yájīyān  ní hí ṣátsad ántaraḥ pū́rvo asmát

translation.text: HE hath arrived, he whom we sought with longing, who skilled in sacrifice well knows its courses. Let him discharge his sacrificial duties: let him sit down as Friend who was before Us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरा॑धि॒ होता॑ नि॒षदा॒ यजी॑यान॒भि प्रयां॑सि॒ सुधि॑तानि॒ हि ख्यत् यजा॑महै य॒ज्ञिया॒न्हन्त॑ दे॒वाँ ईळा॑महा॒ ईड्याँ॒ आज्ये॑न
verses.transliteration: árādhi hótā niṣádā yájīyān  abhí práyāṃsi súdhitāni hí khyát  yájāmahai yajñíyān hánta devā́m̐  ī́ḷāmahā ī́ḍyām̐ ā́jyena

translation.text: Best Priest, he hath been won by being seated, for he hath looked on the well-ordered viands. Come, let usworship Gods who must be worshipped, and pouring oil, laud those who should be lauded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒ध्वीम॑कर्दे॒ववी॑तिं नो अ॒द्य य॒ज्ञस्य॑ जि॒ह्वाम॑विदाम॒ गुह्या॑म् स आयु॒रागा॑त्सुर॒भिर्वसा॑नो भ॒द्राम॑कर्दे॒वहू॑तिं नो अ॒द्य
verses.transliteration: sādhvī́m akar devávītiṃ no adyá  yajñásya jihvā́m avidāma gúhyām  sá ā́yur ā́gāt surabhír vásāno  bhadrā́m akar deváhūtiṃ no adyá

translation.text: Now hath he made the feast of Gods effective: now have we found the secret tongue of worship. Now hath he come, sweet, robed in vital vigour, and made our calling on the Gods effective.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद॒द्य वा॒चः प्र॑थ॒मं म॑सीय॒ येनासु॑राँ अ॒भि दे॒वा असा॑म ऊर्जा॑द उ॒त य॑ज्ञियासः॒ पञ्च॑ जना॒ मम॑ हो॒त्रं जु॑षध्वम्
verses.transliteration: tád adyá vācáḥ prathamám masīya  yénā́surām̐ abhí devā́ ásāma  ū́rjāda utá yajñiyāsaḥ  páñca janā máma hotráṃ juṣadhvam

translation.text: This prelude of my speech I now will utter, whereby we Gods may quell our Asura foemen. Eaters of strengthening food who merit worship, O ye Five Tribes, be pleased with mine oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पञ्च॒ जना॒ मम॑ हो॒त्रं जु॑षन्तां॒ गोजा॑ता उ॒त ये य॒ज्ञिया॑सः पृ॒थि॒वी नः॒ पार्थि॑वात्पा॒त्वंह॑सो॒ऽन्तरि॑क्षं दि॒व्यात्पा॑त्व॒स्मान्
verses.transliteration: páñca jánā máma hotráṃ juṣantāṃ  gójātā utá yé yajñíyāsaḥ  pr̥thivī́ naḥ pā́rthivāt pātv áṃhaso  -antárikṣaṃ divyā́t pātv asmā́n

translation.text: May the Five Tribes be pleased with mine oblation, and the Cow's Sons and all who merit worship. From earthly trouble may the earth protect us, and air's mid realm from woe that comes from heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्तुं॑ त॒न्वन्रज॑सो भा॒नुमन्वि॑हि॒ ज्योति॑ष्मतः प॒थो र॑क्ष धि॒या कृ॒तान् अ॒नु॒ल्ब॒णं व॑यत॒ जोगु॑वा॒मपो॒ मनु॑र्भव ज॒नया॒ दैव्यं॒ जन॑म्
verses.transliteration: tántuṃ tanván rájaso bhānúm ánv ihi  jyótiṣmataḥ pathó rakṣa dhiyā́ kr̥tā́n  anulbaṇáṃ vayata jóguvām ápo  mánur bhava janáyā daívyaṃ jánam

translation.text: Spinning the thread, follow the region's splendid light: guard thou the path ways well which wisdom hath prepared. Weave ye the knotless labour of the bards who sing: be Manu thou, and bring the Heavenly People forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒क्षा॒नहो॑ नह्यतनो॒त सो॑म्या॒ इष्कृ॑णुध्वं रश॒ना ओत पिं॑शत अ॒ष्टाव॑न्धुरं वहता॒भितो॒ रथं॒ येन॑ दे॒वासो॒ अन॑यन्न॒भि प्रि॒यम्
verses.transliteration: akṣānáho nahyatanotá somyāḥ-  íṣkr̥ṇudhvaṃ raśanā́ ótá piṃśata  aṣṭā́vandhuraṃ vahatābhíto ráthaṃ  yéna devā́so ánayann abhí priyám

translation.text: Lovers of Soma, bind the chariot traces fast: set ye the reins in order and embellish them. Bring hitherward the car with seats where eight may sit, whereon the Gods have brought the treasure that we love.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्म॑न्वती रीयते॒ सं र॑भध्व॒मुत्ति॑ष्ठत॒ प्र त॑रता सखायः अत्रा॑ जहाम॒ ये अस॒न्नशे॑वाः शि॒वान्व॒यमुत्त॑रेमा॒भि वाजा॑न्
verses.transliteration: áśmanvatī rīyate sáṃ rabhadhvam  út tiṣṭhata prá taratā sakhāyaḥ  átrā jahāma yé ásann áśevāḥ  śivā́n vayám út taremābhí vā́jān

translation.text: Here flows Asmanvati: hold fast each other, keep yourselves up, and pass, my friends, the river. There let us leave the Powers that brought no profit, and cross the flood to Powers that are auspicious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वष्टा॑ मा॒या वे॑द॒पसा॑म॒पस्त॑मो॒ बिभ्र॒त्पात्रा॑ देव॒पाना॑नि॒ शंत॑मा शिशी॑ते नू॒नं प॑र॒शुं स्वा॑य॒सं येन॑ वृ॒श्चादेत॑शो॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṣṭā māyā́ ved apásām apástamo  bíbhrat pā́trā devapā́nāni śáṃtamā  śíśīte nūnám paraśúṃ svāyasáṃ  yéna vr̥ścā́d étaśo bráhmaṇas pátiḥ

translation.text: Tvashṭar, most deft of workmen, knew each magic art, bringing most blessed bowls that hold the drink of Gods. His axe, wrought of good metal, he is sharpening now, wherewith the radiant Brahmaṇaspati will cut.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒तो नू॒नं क॑वयः॒ सं शि॑शीत॒ वाशी॑भि॒र्याभि॑र॒मृता॑य॒ तक्ष॑थ वि॒द्वांसः॑ प॒दा गुह्या॑नि कर्तन॒ येन॑ दे॒वासो॑ अमृत॒त्वमा॑न॒शुः
verses.transliteration: sató nūnáṃ kavayaḥ sáṃ śiśīta  vā́śībhir yā́bhir amŕ̥tāya tákṣatha  vidvā́ṃsaḥ padā́ gúhyāni kartana  yéna devā́so amr̥tatvám ānaśúḥ

translation.text: Now, O ye Sapient Ones, make ye the axes sharp wherewith ye fashion bowls to hold the Amrit. Knowing the secret places make ye ready that whereby the Gods have gotten immortality.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गर्भे॒ योषा॒मद॑धुर्व॒त्समा॒सन्य॑पी॒च्ये॑न॒ मन॑सो॒त जि॒ह्वया॑ स वि॒श्वाहा॑ सु॒मना॑ यो॒ग्या अ॒भि सि॑षा॒सनि॑र्वनते का॒र इज्जिति॑म्
verses.transliteration: gárbhe yóṣām ádadhur vatsám āsáni-  apīcyèna mánasotá jihváyā  sá viśvā́hā sumánā yogyā́ abhí  siṣāsánir vanate kārá íj jítim

translation.text: Ye with a secret tongue and dark intention laid the maiden deep within, the calf within the mouth. They evermore are near us with their gracious help: successful is the song that strives for victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तां सु ते॑ की॒र्तिं म॑घवन्महि॒त्वा यत्त्वा॑ भी॒ते रोद॑सी॒ अह्व॑येताम् प्रावो॑ दे॒वाँ आति॑रो॒ दास॒मोजः॑ प्र॒जायै॑ त्वस्यै॒ यदशि॑क्ष इन्द्र
verses.transliteration: tā́ṃ sú te kīrtím maghavan mahitvā́  yát tvā bhīté ródasī áhvayetām  prā́vo devā́m̐ ā́tiro dā́sam ójaḥ  prajā́yai tvasyai yád áśikṣa indra

translation.text: I SING thy fame that, Maghavan, through thy Greatness the heavens and earth invoked thee in their terror, Thou, aiding Gods, didst quell the power of Dâsas, what time thou holpest many a race, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदच॑रस्त॒न्वा॑ वावृधा॒नो बला॑नीन्द्र प्रब्रुवा॒णो जने॑षु मा॒येत्सा ते॒ यानि॑ यु॒द्धान्या॒हुर्नाद्य शत्रुं॑ न॒नु पु॒रा वि॑वित्से
verses.transliteration: yád ácaras tanvā̀ vāvr̥dhānó  bálānīndra prabruvāṇó jáneṣu  māyét sā́ te yā́ni yuddhā́ny āhúr  nā́dyá śátruṃ nanú purā́ vivitse

translation.text: When thou wast roaming, waxen strong in body, telling thy might, Indra, among the people, All that men called thy battles was illusion: no foe hast thou to-day, nor erst hast found one.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क उ॒ नु ते॑ महि॒मनः॑ समस्या॒स्मत्पूर्व॒ ऋष॒योऽन्त॑मापुः यन्मा॒तरं॑ च पि॒तरं॑ च सा॒कमज॑नयथास्त॒न्व१॒॑ः स्वायाः॑
verses.transliteration: ká u nú te mahimánaḥ samasya-  -asmát pū́rva ŕ̥ṣayó 'ntam āpuḥ  yán mātáraṃ ca pitáraṃ ca sākám  ájanayathās tanvàḥ svā́yāḥ

translation.text: Who are the R̥ishis, then, who comprehended before our time the bounds of all thy greatness? For from thy body thou hast generated at the same time the Mother and the Father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒त्वारि॑ ते असु॒र्या॑णि॒ नामादा॑भ्यानि महि॒षस्य॑ सन्ति त्वम॒ङ्ग तानि॒ विश्वा॑नि वित्से॒ येभिः॒ कर्मा॑णि मघवञ्च॒कर्थ॑
verses.transliteration: catvā́ri te asuryā̀ṇi nā́ma-  -ádābhyāni mahiṣásya santi  tvám aṅgá tā́ni víśvāni vitse  yébhiḥ kármāṇi maghavañ cakártha

translation.text: Thou, Mighty Steer, hast four supremest natures, Asura natures that may ne'er be injured. All these, O Maghavan, thou surely knowest, wherewith thou hast performed thy great achievements.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं विश्वा॑ दधिषे॒ केव॑लानि॒ यान्या॒विर्या च॒ गुहा॒ वसू॑नि काम॒मिन्मे॑ मघव॒न्मा वि ता॑री॒स्त्वमा॑ज्ञा॒ता त्वमि॑न्द्रासि दा॒ता
verses.transliteration: tváṃ víśvā dadhiṣe kévalāni  yā́ny āvír yā́ ca gúhā vásūni  kā́mam ín me maghavan mā́ ví tārīs  tvám ājñātā́ tvám indrāsi dātā́

translation.text: Thou hast all treasures in thy sole possession, treasures made manifest and treasures hidden. Defer not thou, O Maghavan, my longing: thou, art Director, Indra, thou art Giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अद॑धा॒ज्ज्योति॑षि॒ ज्योति॑र॒न्तर्यो असृ॑ज॒न्मधु॑ना॒ सं मधू॑नि अध॑ प्रि॒यं शू॒षमिन्द्रा॑य॒ मन्म॑ ब्रह्म॒कृतो॑ बृ॒हदु॑क्थादवाचि
verses.transliteration: yó ádadhāj jyótiṣi jyótir antár  yó ásr̥jan mádhunā sám mádhūni  ádha priyáṃ śūṣám índrāya mánma  brahmakŕ̥to br̥hádukthād avāci

translation.text: To him who set the light in things of splendour, and with all sweetness blent essential sweetness, To Indra hath this welcome hymn that strengthens been uttered by the votary Br̥ihaduktha.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दू॒रे तन्नाम॒ गुह्यं॑ परा॒चैर्यत्त्वा॑ भी॒ते अह्व॑येतां वयो॒धै उद॑स्तभ्नाः पृथि॒वीं द्याम॒भीके॒ भ्रातुः॑ पु॒त्रान्म॑घवन्तित्विषा॒णः
verses.transliteration: dūré tán nā́ma gúhyam parācaír  yát tvā bhīté áhvayetāṃ vayodhaí  úd astabhnāḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m abhī́ke  bhrā́tuḥ putrā́n maghavan titviṣāṇáḥ

translation.text: FAR is that secret name by which, in terror, the worlds invoked thee and thou gavest vigour The earth and heaven thou settest near each other, and Maghavan, madest bright thy Brother's Children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हत्तन्नाम॒ गुह्यं॑ पुरु॒स्पृग्येन॑ भू॒तं ज॒नयो॒ येन॒ भव्य॑म् प्र॒त्नं जा॒तं ज्योति॒र्यद॑स्य प्रि॒यं प्रि॒याः सम॑विशन्त॒ पञ्च॑
verses.transliteration: mahát tán nā́ma gúhyam puruspŕ̥g  yéna bhūtáṃ janáyo yéna bhávyam  pratnáṃ jātáṃ jyótir yád asya  priyám priyā́ḥ sám aviśanta páñca

translation.text: Great is that secret name and far-extending, whereby thou madest all that is and shall be. The Five Tribes whom he loveth well have entered the light he loveth that was made aforetime.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रोद॑सी अपृणा॒दोत मध्यं॒ पञ्च॑ दे॒वाँ ऋ॑तु॒शः स॒प्तस॑प्त चतु॑स्त्रिंशता पुरु॒धा वि च॑ष्टे॒ सरू॑पेण॒ ज्योति॑षा॒ विव्र॑तेन
verses.transliteration: ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇād ótá mádhyam  páñca devā́m̐ r̥tuśáḥ saptá-sapta  cátustriṃśatā purudhā́ ví caṣṭe  sárūpeṇa jyótiṣā vívratena

translation.text: He filled the heaven and earth and all between them, Gods five times sevenfold in their proper seasons. With four-and-thirty lights he looks around him, lights of one colour though their ways are divers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदु॑ष॒ औच्छः॑ प्रथ॒मा वि॒भाना॒मज॑नयो॒ येन॑ पु॒ष्टस्य॑ पु॒ष्टम् यत्ते॑ जामि॒त्वमव॑रं॒ पर॑स्या म॒हन्म॑ह॒त्या अ॑सुर॒त्वमेक॑म्
verses.transliteration: yád uṣa aúchaḥ prathamā́ vibhā́nām  ájanayo yéna puṣṭásya puṣṭám  yát te jāmitvám ávaram párasyāḥ-  mahán mahatyā́ asuratvám ékam

translation.text: As first among the lights, O Dawn, thou shonest, whereby thou broughtest forth the Stay of Increase, Great art thou, matchless is thine Asura nature, who, high above, art kin to those beneath thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒धुं द॑द्रा॒णं सम॑ने बहू॒नां युवा॑नं॒ सन्तं॑ पलि॒तो ज॑गार दे॒वस्य॑ पश्य॒ काव्यं॑ महि॒त्वाद्या म॒मार॒ स ह्यः समा॑न
verses.transliteration: vidhúṃ dadrāṇáṃ sámane bahūnā́ṃ  yúvānaṃ sántam palitó jagāra  devásya paśya kā́vyam mahitvā́-  -adyā́ mamā́ra sá hyáḥ sám āna

translation.text: The old hath waked the young Moon from his slumber who runs his circling course with many round him. Behold the Gods' high wisdom in its greatness: he who died yesterday to-day is living.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शाक्म॑ना शा॒को अ॑रु॒णः सु॑प॒र्ण आ यो म॒हः शूरः॑ स॒नादनी॑ळः यच्चि॒केत॑ स॒त्यमित्तन्न मोघं॒ वसु॑ स्पा॒र्हमु॒त जेतो॒त दाता॑
verses.transliteration: śā́kmanā śākó aruṇáḥ suparṇáḥ-  ā́ yó maháḥ śū́raḥ sanā́d ánīḷaḥ  yác cikéta satyám ít tán ná móghaṃ  vásu spārhám utá jétotá dā́tā

translation.text: Strong is the Red Bird in his strength, great Hero, who from of old hath had no nest to dwell in. That which he knows is truth and never idle: he wins and gives the wealth desired of many.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऐभि॑र्ददे॒ वृष्ण्या॒ पौंस्या॑नि॒ येभि॒रौक्ष॑द्वृत्र॒हत्या॑य व॒ज्री ये कर्म॑णः क्रि॒यमा॑णस्य म॒ह्न ऋ॑तेक॒र्ममु॒दजा॑यन्त दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: aíbhir dade vŕ̥ṣṇyā paúṃsyāni  yébhir aúkṣad vr̥trahátyāya vajrī́  yé kármaṇaḥ kriyámāṇasya mahnā́-  r̥tekarmám udájāyanta devā́ḥ

translation.text: Through these the Thunderer gained strong manly vigour, through whom he waxed in power to smite down Vr̥itra,– Who through the might of Indra's operation came forth as Gods in course of Law and Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒जा कर्मा॑णि ज॒नय॑न्वि॒श्वौजा॑ अशस्ति॒हा वि॒श्वम॑नास्तुरा॒षाट् पी॒त्वी सोम॑स्य दि॒व आ वृ॑धा॒नः शूरो॒ निर्यु॒धाध॑म॒द्दस्यू॑न्
verses.transliteration: yujā́ kármāṇi janáyan viśvaújāḥ-  aśastihā́ viśvámanās turāṣā́ṭ  pītvī́ sómasya divá ā́ vr̥dhānáḥ  śū́ro nír yudhā́dhamad dásyūn

translation.text: All-strong, performing works with his companion, All-marking, rapid Victor, Curse-averter, The Hero, waxing, after draughts of Soma, blew far from heaven the Dasyus with his weapon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं त॒ एकं॑ प॒र ऊ॑ त॒ एकं॑ तृ॒तीये॑न॒ ज्योति॑षा॒ सं वि॑शस्व सं॒वेश॑ने त॒न्व१॒॑श्चारु॑रेधि प्रि॒यो दे॒वानां॑ पर॒मे ज॒नित्रे॑
verses.transliteration: idáṃ ta ékam pará ū ta ékaṃ  tr̥tī́yena jyótiṣā sáṃ viśasva  saṃvéśane tanvàś cā́rur edhi  priyó devā́nām paramé janítre

translation.text: HERE is one light for thee, another yonder: enter the third and he therewith united. Uniting with a body be thou welcome, dear to the Gods in their sublimest birthplace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त॒नूष्टे॑ वाजिन्त॒न्वं१॒॑ नय॑न्ती वा॒मम॒स्मभ्यं॒ धातु॒ शर्म॒ तुभ्य॑म् अह्रु॑तो म॒हो ध॒रुणा॑य दे॒वान्दि॒वी॑व॒ ज्योतिः॒ स्वमा मि॑मीयाः
verses.transliteration: tanū́ṣ ṭe vājin tanvàṃ náyantī  vāmám asmábhyaṃ dhā́tu śárma túbhyam  áhruto mahó dharúṇāya devā́n  divī̀va jyótiḥ svám ā́ mimīyāḥ

translation.text: Bearing thy body, Vajin, may thy body afford us blessing and thyself protection. Unswerving, stablish as it were in heaven thine own light as the mighty God's supporter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒ज्य॑सि॒ वाजि॑नेना सुवे॒नीः सु॑वि॒तः स्तोमं॑ सुवि॒तो दिवं॑ गाः सु॒वि॒तो धर्म॑ प्रथ॒मानु॑ स॒त्या सु॑वि॒तो दे॒वान्त्सु॑वि॒तोऽनु॒ पत्म॑
verses.transliteration: vājy àsi vā́jinenā suvenī́ḥ  suvitá stómaṃ suvitó dívaṃ gāḥ  suvitó dhárma prathamā́nu satyā́  suvitó devā́n suvitó 'nu pátma

translation.text: Strong Steed art thou: go to the yearning Maidens with vigour, happily go to heaven and praises: Fly happily to the Gods with easy passage, according to the first and faithful statutes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हि॒म्न ए॑षां पि॒तर॑श्च॒नेशि॑रे दे॒वा दे॒वेष्व॑दधु॒रपि॒ क्रतु॑म् सम॑विव्यचुरु॒त यान्यत्वि॑षु॒रैषां॑ त॒नूषु॒ नि वि॑विशुः॒ पुनः॑
verses.transliteration: mahimná eṣām pitáraś canéśire  devā́ devéṣv adadhur ápi krátum  sám avivyacur utá yā́ny átviṣur  aíṣāṃ tanū́ṣu ní viviśuḥ púnaḥ

translation.text: Part of their grandeur have the Fathers also gained: the Gods have seated mental power in them as Gods. They have embraced within themselves all energies, which, issuing forth, again into their bodies pass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सहो॑भि॒र्विश्वं॒ परि॑ चक्रमू॒ रजः॒ पूर्वा॒ धामा॒न्यमि॑ता॒ मिमा॑नाः त॒नूषु॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒ नि ये॑मिरे॒ प्रासा॑रयन्त पुरु॒ध प्र॒जा अनु॑
verses.transliteration: sáhobhir víśvam pári cakramū rájaḥ  pū́rvā dhā́māny ámitā mímānāḥ  tanū́ṣu víśvā bhúvanā ní yemire  prā́sārayanta purudhá prajā́ ánu

translation.text: They strode through all the region with victorious might, establishing the old immeasurable laws. They compassed in their bodies all existing things, and streamed forth offspring in many successive forms.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्विधा॑ सू॒नवोऽसु॑रं स्व॒र्विद॒मास्था॑पयन्त तृ॒तीये॑न॒ कर्म॑णा स्वां प्र॒जां पि॒तरः॒ पित्र्यं॒ सह॒ आव॑रेष्वदधु॒स्तन्तु॒मात॑तम्
verses.transliteration: dvídhā sūnávó 'suraṃ svarvídam  ā́sthāpayanta tr̥tī́yena kármaṇā  svā́m prajā́m pitáraḥ pítryaṃ sáhaḥ-  ā́vareṣv adadhus tántum ā́tatam

translation.text: In two ways have the sons established in his place the Asura who finds the light, by the third act, As fathers, they have set their heritage on earth, their offspring, as a thread continuously spun out.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ना॒वा न क्षोदः॑ प्र॒दिशः॑ पृथि॒व्याः स्व॒स्तिभि॒रति॑ दु॒र्गाणि॒ विश्वा॑ स्वां प्र॒जां बृ॒हदु॑क्थो महि॒त्वाव॑रेष्वदधा॒दा परे॑षु
verses.transliteration: nāvā́ ná kṣódaḥ pradíśaḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  svastíbhir áti durgā́ṇi víśvā  svā́m prajā́m br̥háduktho mahitvā́-  -ā́vareṣv adadhād ā́ páreṣu

translation.text: As in a ship through billows, so through regions of air, with blessings, through toils and troubles Hath Br̥ihaduktha brought his seed with glory, and placed it here and in the realms beyond us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा प्र गा॑म प॒थो व॒यं मा य॒ज्ञादि॑न्द्र सो॒मिनः॑ मान्तः स्थु॑र्नो॒ अरा॑तयः
verses.transliteration: mā́ prá gāma pathó vayám  mā́ yajñā́d indra somínaḥ  mā́ntá sthur no árātayaḥ

translation.text: LET us not, Indra, leave the path, the Soma-presser's sacrifice: Let no malignity dwell with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो य॒ज्ञस्य॑ प्र॒साध॑न॒स्तन्तु॑र्दे॒वेष्वात॑तः तमाहु॑तं नशीमहि
verses.transliteration: yó yajñásya prasā́dhanas  tántur devéṣv ā́tataḥ  tám ā́hutaṃ naśīmahi

translation.text: May we obtain, completely wrought, the thread spun out to reach the Gods, That perfecteth the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मनो॒ न्वा हु॑वामहे नाराशं॒सेन॒ सोमे॑न पि॒तॄ॒णां च॒ मन्म॑भिः
verses.transliteration: máno nv ā́ huvāmahe  nārāśaṃséna sómena  pitr̥̄ṇā́ṃ ca mánmabhiḥ

translation.text: We call the spirit hither with the Soma of our parted sires, Yea, with the Fathers' holy hymns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त॑ एतु॒ मनः॒ पुनः॒ क्रत्वे॒ दक्षा॑य जी॒वसे॑ ज्योक्च॒ सूर्यं॑ दृ॒शे
verses.transliteration: ā́ ta etu mánaḥ púnaḥ  krátve dákṣāya jīváse  jyók ca sū́ryaṃ dr̥śé

translation.text: Thy spirit come to thee again for wisdom, energy, and lire, That thou mayst long behold the sun!

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुन॑र्नः पितरो॒ मनो॒ ददा॑तु॒ दैव्यो॒ जनः॑ जी॒वं व्रातं॑ सचेमहि
verses.transliteration: púnar naḥ pitaro máno  dádātu daívyo jánaḥ  jīváṃ vrā́taṃ sacemahi

translation.text: O Fathers, may the Heavenly Folk give us our spirit once again, That we may be with those who live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं सो॑म व्र॒ते तव॒ मन॑स्त॒नूषु॒ बिभ्र॑तः प्र॒जाव॑न्तः सचेमहि
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ soma vraté táva  mánas tanū́ṣu bíbhrataḥ  prajā́vantaḥ sacemahi

translation.text: O Soma with the spirit still within us, blest with progeny, May we be busied in the law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ य॒मं वै॑वस्व॒तं मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te yamáṃ vaivasvatám  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: THY spirit, that went far away to Yama to Vivasvan's Son, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ दिवं॒ यत्पृ॑थि॒वीं मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te dívaṃ yát pr̥thivī́m  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away, that passed away to earth and heaven, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ भूमिं॒ चतु॑र्भृष्टिं॒ मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te bhū́miṃ cáturbhr̥ṣṭim  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away, away to the four-cornered earth, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ चत॑स्रः प्र॒दिशो॒ मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te cátasraḥ pradíśo  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away to the four quarters of the world, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ समु॒द्रम॑र्ण॒वं मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te samudrám arṇavám  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away, away unto the billowy sea, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ मरी॑चीः प्र॒वतो॒ मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te márīcīḥ praváto  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away to beams of light that flash and flow, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ अ॒पो यदोष॑धी॒र्मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te apó yád óṣadhīr  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away, went to the waters and the plants, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ सूर्यं॒ यदु॒षसं॒ मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te sū́ryaṃ yád uṣásam  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away, that visited the Sun and Dawn. We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ पर्व॑तान्बृह॒तो मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te párvatān br̥ható  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away, away to lofty mountain heights, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ विश्व॑मि॒दं जग॒न्मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te víśvam idáṃ jágat-  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away into this All, that lives and moves, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ पराः॑ परा॒वतो॒ मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te párāḥ parāváto  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away to distant realms beyond our ken, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ भू॒तं च॒ भव्यं॑ च॒ मनो॑ ज॒गाम॑ दूर॒कम् तत्त॒ आ व॑र्तयामसी॒ह क्षया॑य जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yát te bhūtáṃ ca bhávyaṃ ca  máno jagā́ma dūrakám  tát ta ā́ vartayāmasi-  -ihá kṣáyāya jīváse

translation.text: Thy spirit, that went far away to all that is and is to be, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn heie.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ता॒र्यायुः॑ प्रत॒रं नवी॑यः॒ स्थाता॑रेव॒ क्रतु॑मता॒ रथ॑स्य अध॒ च्यवा॑न॒ उत्त॑वी॒त्यर्थं॑ परात॒रं सु निर्ऋ॑तिर्जिहीताम्
verses.transliteration: prá tāry ā́yuḥ prataráṃ návīyaḥ-  sthā́tāreva krátumatā ráthasya  ádha cyávāna út tavīty ártham  parātaráṃ sú nírr̥tir jihītām

translation.text: His life hath been renewed and carried forward as two men, car-borne, by the skilful driver. One falls, then seeks the goal with quickened vigour. Let Nirr̥iti depart to distant places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: साम॒न्नु रा॒ये नि॑धि॒मन्न्वन्नं॒ करा॑महे॒ सु पु॑रु॒ध श्रवां॑सि ता नो॒ विश्वा॑नि जरि॒ता म॑मत्तु परात॒रं सु निर्ऋ॑तिर्जिहीताम्
verses.transliteration: sā́man nú rāyé nidhimán nv ánnaṃ  kárāmahe sú purudhá śrávāṃsi  tā́ no víśvāni jaritā́ mamattu  parātaráṃ sú nírr̥tir jihītām

translation.text: Here is the psalm for wealth, and food, in plenty: let us do many deeds to bring us glory. All these our doings shall delight the singer. Let Nirr̥iti depart to distant places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी ष्व१॒॑र्यः पौंस्यै॑र्भवेम॒ द्यौर्न भूमिं॑ गि॒रयो॒ नाज्रा॑न् ता नो॒ विश्वा॑नि जरि॒ता चि॑केत परात॒रं सु निर्ऋ॑तिर्जिहीताम्
verses.transliteration: abhī́ ṣv àryáḥ paúṃsyair bhavema  dyaúr ná bhū́miṃ giráyo nā́jrān  tā́ no víśvāni jaritā́ ciketa  parātaráṃ sú nírr̥tir jihītām

translation.text: May we o'ercome our foes with acts of valour, as heaven is over earth, hills over lowlands. All these our deeds the singer hath considered. Let Nirr̥iti depart to distant places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मो षु णः॑ सोम मृ॒त्यवे॒ परा॑ दाः॒ पश्ये॑म॒ नु सूर्य॑मु॒च्चर॑न्तम् द्युभि॑र्हि॒तो ज॑रि॒मा सू नो॑ अस्तु परात॒रं सु निर्ऋ॑तिर्जिहीताम्
verses.transliteration: mó ṣú ṇaḥ soma mr̥tyáve párā dāḥ  páśyema nú sū́ryam uccárantam  dyúbhir hitó jarimā́ sū́ no astu  parātaráṃ sú nírr̥tir jihītām

translation.text: Give us not up as prey to death, O Sorna still let us look upon the Sun arising. Let our old age with passing days be kindly. Let Nirr̥iti depart to distant places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असु॑नीते॒ मनो॑ अ॒स्मासु॑ धारय जी॒वात॑वे॒ सु प्र ति॑रा न॒ आयुः॑ रा॒र॒न्धि नः॒ सूर्य॑स्य सं॒दृशि॑ घृ॒तेन॒ त्वं त॒न्वं॑ वर्धयस्व
verses.transliteration: ásunīte máno asmā́su dhāraya  jīvā́tave sú prá tirā na ā́yuḥ  rārandhí naḥ sū́ryasya saṃdŕ̥śi  ghr̥téna tváṃ tanvàṃ vardhayasva

translation.text: O Asuniti, keep the soul within us, and make the days we have to live yet longer. Grant that we still may look upon the sunlight: strengthen thy body with the oil we bring thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असु॑नीते॒ पुन॑र॒स्मासु॒ चक्षुः॒ पुनः॑ प्रा॒णमि॒ह नो॑ धेहि॒ भोग॑म् ज्योक्प॑श्येम॒ सूर्य॑मु॒च्चर॑न्त॒मनु॑मते मृ॒ळया॑ नः स्व॒स्ति
verses.transliteration: ásunīte púnar asmā́su cákṣuḥ  púnaḥ prāṇám ihá no dhehi bhógam  jyók paśyema sū́ryam uccárantam  ánumate mr̥ḷáyā naḥ svastí

translation.text: Give us our sight again, O Asuniti, give us again our breath and our enjoyment. Long may we look upon the Sun uprising; O Anumati, favour thou and bless us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुन॑र्नो॒ असुं॑ पृथि॒वी द॑दातु॒ पुन॒र्द्यौर्दे॒वी पुन॑र॒न्तरि॑क्षम् पुन॑र्नः॒ सोम॑स्त॒न्वं॑ ददातु॒ पुनः॑ पू॒षा प॒थ्यां॒३॒॑ या स्व॒स्तिः
verses.transliteration: púnar no ásum pr̥thivī́ dadātu  púnar dyaúr devī́ púnar antárikṣam  púnar naḥ sómas tanvàṃ dadātu  púnaḥ pūṣā́ pathyā̀ṃ yā́ svastíḥ

translation.text: May Earth restore to us our vital spirit, may Heaven the Goddess and mid-air restore it. May Soma give us once again our body, and Pûshan show the Path of peace and comfort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं रोद॑सी सु॒बन्ध॑वे य॒ह्वी ऋ॒तस्य॑ मा॒तरा॑ भर॑ता॒मप॒ यद्रपो॒ द्यौः पृ॑थिवि क्ष॒मा रपो॒ मो षु ते॒ किं च॒नाम॑मत्
verses.transliteration: śáṃ ródasī subándhave  yahvī́ r̥tásya mātárā  bháratām ápa yád rápo  dyaúḥ pr̥thivi kṣamā́ rápo  mó ṣú te kíṃ canā́mamat

translation.text: May both Worlds bless Subandhu, young Mothers of everlasting Law. May Heaven and Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ द्व॒के अव॑ त्रि॒का दि॒वश्च॑रन्ति भेष॒जा क्ष॒मा च॑रि॒ष्ण्वे॑क॒कं भर॑ता॒मप॒ यद्रपो॒ द्यौः पृ॑थिवि क्ष॒मा रपो॒ मो षु ते॒ किं च॒नाम॑मत्
verses.transliteration: áva dvaké áva trikā́  diváś caranti bheṣajā́  kṣamā́ cariṣṇv èkakám  bháratām ápa yád rápo  dyaúḥ pr̥thivi kṣamā́ rápo  mó ṣú te kíṃ canā́mamat

translation.text: Health-giving medicines descend sent down from heaven in twos and threes, Or wandering singly on the earth. May Heaven and Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑न्द्रेरय॒ गाम॑न॒ड्वाहं॒ य आव॑हदुशी॒नरा॑ण्या॒ अनः॑ भर॑ता॒मप॒ यद्रपो॒ द्यौः पृ॑थिवि क्ष॒मा रपो॒ मो षु ते॒ किं च॒नाम॑मत्
verses.transliteration: sám indreraya gā́m  anaḍvā́haṃ yá ā́vahad  uśīnárāṇyā ánaḥ  bháratām ápa yád rápo  dyaúḥ pr̥thivi kṣamā́ rápo  mó ṣú te kíṃ canā́mamat

translation.text: Drive forward thou the wagon-ox, O Indra, which brought Uṣînarâṇî's wagon hither. May Heaven and Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ जनं॑ त्वे॒षसं॑दृशं॒ माही॑नाना॒मुप॑स्तुतम् अग॑न्म॒ बिभ्र॑तो॒ नमः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ jánaṃ tveṣásaṃdr̥śam  mā́hīnānām úpastutam  áganma bíbhrato námaḥ

translation.text: BRINGING our homage we have come to one magnificent in look. Glorified of the mighty Gods

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॑मातिं नि॒तोश॑नं त्वे॒षं नि॑य॒यिनं॒ रथ॑म् भ॒जेर॑थस्य॒ सत्प॑तिम्
verses.transliteration: ásamātiṃ nitóśanaṃ  tveṣáṃ niyayínaṃ rátham  bhajérathasya sátpatim

translation.text: To Asâmati, spring of gifts, lord of the brave, a radiant car, The conqueror of Bhajeratha

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो जना॑न्महि॒षाँ इ॑वातित॒स्थौ पवी॑रवान् उ॒ताप॑वीरवान्यु॒धा
verses.transliteration: yó jánān mahiṣā́m̐ iva-  -atitasthaú pávīravān  utā́pavīravān yudhā́

translation.text: Who, when the spear hath armed his hand, or even weaponless o'erthrows Men strong as buffaloes in fight;

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ये॑क्ष्वा॒कुरुप॑ व्र॒ते रे॒वान्म॑रा॒य्येध॑ते दि॒वी॑व॒ पञ्च॑ कृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: yásyekṣvākúr úpa vraté  revā́n marāyy édhate  divī̀va páñca kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: Him in whose service flourishes Ikshvâku, rich and dazzling-bright. As the Five Tribes that are in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ क्ष॒त्रास॑मातिषु॒ रथ॑प्रोष्ठेषु धारय दि॒वी॑व॒ सूर्यं॑ दृ॒शे
verses.transliteration: índra kṣatrā́samātiṣu  ráthaproṣṭheṣu dhāraya  divī̀va sū́ryaṃ dr̥śé

translation.text: Indra, support the princely power of Rathaproshṭhas matched by none, Even as the Sun for all to see.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒गस्त्य॑स्य॒ नद्भ्यः॒ सप्ती॑ युनक्षि॒ रोहि॑ता प॒णीन्न्य॑क्रमीर॒भि विश्वा॑न्राजन्नरा॒धसः॑
verses.transliteration: agástyasya nádbhyaḥ  sáptī yunakṣi róhitā  paṇī́n ny àkramīr abhí  víśvān rājann arādhásaḥ

translation.text: Thou for Agastya's sister's sons yokest thy pair of ruddy steeds. Thou troddest niggards under foot, all those, O King, who brought no gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं मा॒तायं पि॒तायं जी॒वातु॒राग॑मत् इ॒दं तव॑ प्र॒सर्प॑णं॒ सुब॑न्ध॒वेहि॒ निरि॑हि
verses.transliteration: ayám mātā́yám pitā́-  -ayáṃ jīvā́tur ā́gamat  idáṃ táva prasárpaṇaṃ  súbandhav éhi nír ihi

translation.text: This is the mother, this the sire, this one hath come to be thy life. What brings thee forth is even this. Now come, Subandhu, get thee forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ यु॒गं व॑र॒त्रया॒ नह्य॑न्ति ध॒रुणा॑य॒ कम् ए॒वा दा॑धार ते॒ मनो॑ जी॒वात॑वे॒ न मृ॒त्यवेऽथो॑ अरि॒ष्टता॑तये
verses.transliteration: yáthā yugáṃ varatráyā  náhyanti dharúṇāya kám  evā́ dādhāra te máno  jīvā́tave ná mr̥tyáve-  -átho ariṣṭátātaye

translation.text: As with the leather thong they bind the chariot yoke to hold it fast, So have I held thy spirit fast, held it for life and not for death, held it for thy security.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथे॒यं पृ॑थि॒वी म॒ही दा॒धारे॒मान्वन॒स्पती॑न् ए॒वा दा॑धार ते॒ मनो॑ जी॒वात॑वे॒ न मृ॒त्यवेऽथो॑ अरि॒ष्टता॑तये
verses.transliteration: yátheyám pr̥thivī́ mahī́  dādhā́remā́n vánaspátīn  evā́ dādhāra te máno  jīvā́tave ná mr̥tyáve-  -átho ariṣṭátātaye

translation.text: Even as this earth, the mighty earth, holds fast the monarchs of the wood. So have I held thy spirit fast, held it for life and not for death, held it for thy security.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒माद॒हं वै॑वस्व॒तात्सु॒बन्धो॒र्मन॒ आभ॑रम् जी॒वात॑वे॒ न मृ॒त्यवेऽथो॑ अरि॒ष्टता॑तये
verses.transliteration: yamā́d aháṃ vaivasvatā́t  subándhor mána ā́bharam  jīvā́tave ná mr̥tyáve-  -átho ariṣṭátātaye

translation.text: Subandlin's spirit I have brought from Yarna, from Vivasvan's Son, Brought it for life and not for death, yea, brought it for security.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न्य१॒॑ग्वातोऽव॑ वाति॒ न्य॑क्तपति॒ सूर्यः॑ नी॒चीन॑म॒घ्न्या दु॑हे॒ न्य॑ग्भवतु ते॒ रपः॑
verses.transliteration: nyàg vā́tó 'va vāti  nyàk tapati sū́ryaḥ  nīcī́nam aghnyā́ duhe  nyàg bhavatu te rápaḥ

translation.text: The wind blows downward from on high, downward the Sun-God sends his heat, Downward the milch-cow pours her milk: so downward go thy pain and grief.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं मे॒ हस्तो॒ भग॑वान॒यं मे॒ भग॑वत्तरः अ॒यं मे॑ वि॒श्वभे॑षजो॒ऽयं शि॒वाभि॑मर्शनः
verses.transliteration: ayám me hásto bhágavān  ayám me bhágavattaraḥ  ayám me viśvábheṣajo  -ayáṃ śivā́bhimarśanaḥ

translation.text: Felicitous is this mine hand, yet more felicitous is this. This hand contains all healing balms, and this makes whole with gentle touch.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दमि॒त्था रौद्रं॑ गू॒र्तव॑चा॒ ब्रह्म॒ क्रत्वा॒ शच्या॑म॒न्तरा॒जौ क्रा॒णा यद॑स्य पि॒तरा॑ मंहने॒ष्ठाः पर्ष॑त्प॒क्थे अह॒न्ना स॒प्त होतॄ॑न्
verses.transliteration: idám itthā́ raúdraṃ gūrtávacāḥ-  bráhma krátvā śácyām antár ājaú  krāṇā́ yád asya pitárā maṃhaneṣṭhā́ḥ  párṣat pakthé áhann ā́ saptá hótr̥̄n

translation.text: THE welcome speaker in the storm of battle uttered with might this prayer to win the Aṣvins, When the most liberal God, for Paktha, rescued his parents, and assailed the seven Hotrâs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इद्दा॒नाय॒ दभ्या॑य व॒न्वञ्च्यवा॑नः॒ सूदै॑रमिमीत॒ वेदि॑म् तूर्व॑याणो गू॒र्तव॑चस्तमः॒ क्षोदो॒ न रेत॑ इ॒तऊ॑ति सिञ्चत्
verses.transliteration: sá íd dānā́ya dábhyāya vanváñ  cyávānaḥ sū́dair amimīta védim  tū́rvayāṇo gūrtávacastamaḥ  kṣódo ná réta itáūti siñcat

translation.text: Chyavâna, purposing deceptive presents, with all ingredients, made the altar ready. Most sweet-voiced Tûrvayâṇa poured oblations like floods of widely fertilizing water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मनो॒ न येषु॒ हव॑नेषु ति॒ग्मं विपः॒ शच्या॑ वनु॒थो द्रव॑न्ता आ यः शर्या॑भिस्तुविनृ॒म्णो अ॒स्याश्री॑णीता॒दिशं॒ गभ॑स्तौ
verses.transliteration: máno ná yéṣu hávaneṣu tigmáṃ  vípaḥ śácyā vanuthó drávantā  ā́ yáḥ śáryābhis tuvinr̥mṇó asya-  -áśrīṇītādíśaṃ gábhastau

translation.text: To his oblations, swift as thought, ye hurried, and welcomed eagerly the prayers he offered. With arrows in his hand the Very Mighty forced from him all obedience of a servant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒ष्णा यद्गोष्व॑रु॒णीषु॒ सीद॑द्दि॒वो नपा॑ताश्विना हुवे वाम् वी॒तं मे॑ य॒ज्ञमा ग॑तं मे॒ अन्नं॑ वव॒न्वांसा॒ नेष॒मस्मृ॑तध्रू
verses.transliteration: kr̥ṣṇā́ yád góṣv aruṇī́ṣu sī́dad  divó nápātāśvinā huve vām  vītám me yajñám ā́ gatam me ánnaṃ  vavanvā́ṃsā néṣam ásmr̥tadhrū

translation.text: I call on you the Sons of Dyaus, the Aṣvins, that a dark cow to my red kine be added. Enjoy my sacrifice, come to my viands contented, not deceiving expectation. '

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रथि॑ष्ट॒ यस्य॑ वी॒रक॑र्ममि॒ष्णदनु॑ष्ठितं॒ नु नर्यो॒ अपौ॑हत् पुन॒स्तदा वृ॑हति॒ यत्क॒नाया॑ दुहि॒तुरा अनु॑भृतमन॒र्वा
verses.transliteration: práthiṣṭa yásya vīrákarmam iṣṇád  ánuṣṭhitaṃ nú náryo ápauhat  púnas tád ā́ vr̥hati yát kanā́yāḥ-  duhitúr ā́ ánubhr̥tam anarvā́

translation.text: Membrum suum virile, quod protentum fuerat, mas ille retraxit. Rursus illud quod in juvenem filiam sublatum fuerat, non aggressurus, ad se retrahit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒ध्या यत्कर्त्व॒मभ॑वद॒भीके॒ कामं॑ कृण्वा॒ने पि॒तरि॑ युव॒त्याम् म॒ना॒नग्रेतो॑ जहतुर्वि॒यन्ता॒ सानौ॒ निषि॑क्तं सुकृ॒तस्य॒ योनौ॑
verses.transliteration: madhyā́ yát kártvam ábhavad abhī́ke  kā́maṃ kr̥ṇvāné pitári yuvatyā́m  manānág réto jahatur viyántā  sā́nau níṣiktaṃ sukr̥tásya yónau

translation.text: Quum jam in medio congressu, semiperfecto opere, amorem in puellam pater impleverat, ambo discedentes seminis paulum in terrae superficie in sacrorum sede effusum emiserunt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒ता यत्स्वां दु॑हि॒तर॑मधि॒ष्कन्क्ष्म॒या रेतः॑ संजग्मा॒नो नि षि॑ञ्चत् स्वा॒ध्यो॑ऽजनय॒न्ब्रह्म॑ दे॒वा वास्तो॒ष्पतिं॑ व्रत॒पां निर॑तक्षन्
verses.transliteration: pitā́ yát svā́ṃ duhitáram adhiṣkán  kṣmayā́ rétaḥ saṃjagmānó ní ṣiñcat  svādhyò 'janayan bráhma devā́ḥ-  vā́stoṣ pátiṃ vratapā́ṃ nír atakṣan

translation.text: Quum pater suam filiam adiverat, cum eâ congressus suum semen supra terram effudit. Tum Dii benigni precem (brahma) progenuerunt, et Vastoshpatim, legum sacrarum custodem, formaverunt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ईं॒ वृषा॒ न फेन॑मस्यदा॒जौ स्मदा परै॒दप॑ द॒भ्रचे॑ताः सर॑त्प॒दा न दक्षि॑णा परा॒वृङ्न ता नु मे॑ पृश॒न्यो॑ जगृभ्रे
verses.transliteration: sá īṃ vŕ̥ṣā ná phénam asyad ājaú  smád ā́ páraid ápa dabhrácetāḥ  sárat padā́ ná dákṣiṇā parāvŕ̥k-  ná tā́ nú me pr̥śanyò jagr̥bhre

translation.text: "Ille tauro similis spumam in certamine jactavit; tunc discedens pusillanimis huc profectus est. Quasi dextro pede claudus processit, "inutiles fuerunt illi mei complexus," ita locutus."

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒क्षू न वह्निः॑ प्र॒जाया॑ उप॒ब्दिर॒ग्निं न न॒ग्न उप॑ सीद॒दूधः॑ सनि॑ते॒ध्मं सनि॑तो॒त वाजं॒ स ध॒र्ता ज॑ज्ञे॒ सह॑सा यवी॒युत्
verses.transliteration: makṣū́ ná váhniḥ prajā́yā upabdír  agníṃ ná nagná úpa sīdad ū́dhaḥ  sánitedhmáṃ sánitotá vā́jaṃ  sá dhartā́ jajñe sáhasā yavīyút

translation.text: The fire, burning the people, does not approach quickly (by day): the naked (Rákshasas approach) not Agni by night; the giver of fuel, and the giver of food, he, the upholder (of the rite), is born, overcoming enemies by his might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒क्षू क॒नायाः॑ स॒ख्यं नव॑ग्वा ऋ॒तं वद॑न्त ऋ॒तयु॑क्तिमग्मन् द्वि॒बर्ह॑सो॒ य उप॑ गो॒पमागु॑रदक्षि॒णासो॒ अच्यु॑ता दुदुक्षन्
verses.transliteration: makṣū́ kanā́yāḥ sakhyáṃ návagvāḥ-  r̥táṃ vádanta r̥táyuktim agman  dvibárhaso yá úpa gopám ā́gur  adakṣiṇā́so ácyutā dudukṣan

translation.text: Uttering praise to suit the rite Navagvas came speedily to win the damsel's friendship. They who approached the twice-strong stable's keeper, meedless would milk the rocks that naught had shaken.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒क्षू क॒नायाः॑ स॒ख्यं नवी॑यो॒ राधो॒ न रेत॑ ऋ॒तमित्तु॑रण्यन् शुचि॒ यत्ते॒ रेक्ण॒ आय॑जन्त सब॒र्दुघा॑याः॒ पय॑ उ॒स्रिया॑याः
verses.transliteration: makṣū́ kanā́yāḥ sakhyáṃ návīyo  rā́dho ná réta r̥tám ít turaṇyan  śúci yát te rékṇa ā́yajanta  sabardúghāyāḥ páya usríyāyāḥ

translation.text: Swift was new friendship with the maid they quickly accepted it as genuine seed and bounty. Milk which the cow Sabardugha had yielded was the bright heritage which to thee they offered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒श्वा यत्प॒श्चा वियु॑ता बु॒धन्तेति॑ ब्रवीति व॒क्तरी॒ ररा॑णः वसो॑र्वसु॒त्वा का॒रवो॑ऽने॒हा विश्वं॑ विवेष्टि॒ द्रवि॑ण॒मुप॒ क्षु
verses.transliteration: paśvā́ yát paścā́ víyutā budhánta-  -íti bravīti vaktárī rárāṇaḥ  vásor vasutvā́ kārávo 'nehā́ḥ-  víśvaṃ viveṣṭi dráviṇam úpa kṣú

translation.text: When afterwards they woke- and missed the cattle, the speaker thus in joyful mood addressed them: Matchless are singers throulgh the Vasu's nature; he bringeth them all food and all possessions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदिन्न्व॑स्य परि॒षद्वा॑नो अग्मन्पु॒रू सद॑न्तो नार्ष॒दं बि॑भित्सन् वि शुष्ण॑स्य॒ संग्र॑थितमन॒र्वा वि॒दत्पु॑रुप्रजा॒तस्य॒ गुहा॒ यत्
verses.transliteration: tád ín nv àsya pariṣádvāno agman  purū́ sádanto nārṣadám bibhitsan  ví śúṣṇasya sáṃgrathitam anarvā́  vidát puruprajātásya gúhā yát

translation.text: His followers then who dwelt in sundry places came and desired too slay the son of Nr̥ishad. Resistless foe, be found the hidden treasure of Ṣushṇa multiplied in numerous offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भर्गो॑ ह॒ नामो॒त यस्य॑ दे॒वाः स्व१॒॑र्ण ये त्रि॑षध॒स्थे नि॑षे॒दुः अ॒ग्निर्ह॒ नामो॒त जा॒तवे॑दाः श्रु॒धी नो॑ होतर्ऋ॒तस्य॒ होता॒ध्रुक्
verses.transliteration: bhárgo ha nā́motá yásya devā́ḥ  svàr ṇá yé triṣadhasthé niṣedúḥ  agnír ha nā́motá jātávedāḥ  śrudhī́ no hotar r̥tásya hótādhrúk

translation.text: Thou, called Effulgence, in whose threefold dwelling, as in the light of heaven, the Gods are sitting, Thou who art called Agni or Jâtavedas, Priest, hear us, guileless Priest of holy worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्या मे॒ रौद्रा॑वर्चि॒मन्ता॒ नास॑त्याविन्द्र गू॒र्तये॒ यज॑ध्यै म॒नु॒ष्वद्वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषे॒ ररा॑णा म॒न्दू हि॒तप्र॑यसा वि॒क्षु यज्यू॑
verses.transliteration: utá tyā́ me raúdrāv arcimántā  nā́satyāv indra gūrtáye yájadhyai  manuṣvád vr̥ktábarhiṣe rárāṇā  mandū́ hitáprayasā vikṣú yájyū

translation.text: And, Indra, bring, that I may laud and serve them, those Two resplendent glorious Nâsatyas, Blithe, bounteous, man-like, to the sacrificer, honoured among our men with offered viands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं स्तु॒तो राजा॑ वन्दि वे॒धा अ॒पश्च॒ विप्र॑स्तरति॒ स्वसे॑तुः स क॒क्षीव॑न्तं रेजय॒त्सो अ॒ग्निं ने॒मिं न च॒क्रमर्व॑तो रघु॒द्रु
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ stutó rā́jā vandi vedhā́ḥ-  apáś ca vípras tarati svásetuḥ  sá kakṣī́vantaṃ rejayat só agníṃ  nemíṃ ná cakrám árvato raghudrú

translation.text: This King is praised and honoured as Ordainer: himself the bridge, the Sage speeds o'er the waters. He hath stirred up Kakshîvân, stirred up Agni, as the steed's swift wheel drives the felly onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स द्वि॒बन्धु॑र्वैतर॒णो यष्टा॑ सब॒र्धुं धे॒नुम॒स्वं॑ दु॒हध्यै॑ सं यन्मि॒त्रावरु॑णा वृ॒ञ्ज उ॒क्थैर्ज्येष्ठे॑भिरर्य॒मणं॒ वरू॑थैः
verses.transliteration: sá dvibándhur vaitaraṇó yáṣṭā  sabardhúṃ dhenúm asvàṃ duhádhyai  sáṃ yán mitrā́váruṇā vr̥ñjá ukthaír  jyéṣṭhebhir aryamáṇaṃ várūthaiḥ

translation.text: Vaitaraṇa, doubly kinsman, sacrificer, shall milk the cow who ne'er hath calved, Sabardhu, When I encompass Varuṇa and Mitra with lauds, and Aryaman in safest shelter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्ब॑न्धुः सू॒रिर्दि॒वि ते॑ धियं॒धा नाभा॒नेदि॑ष्ठो रपति॒ प्र वेन॑न् सा नो॒ नाभिः॑ पर॒मास्य वा॑ घा॒हं तत्प॒श्चा क॑ति॒थश्चि॑दास
verses.transliteration: tádbandhuḥ sūrír diví te dhiyaṃdhā́ḥ-  nā́bhānédiṣṭho rapati prá vénan  sā́ no nā́bhiḥ paramā́syá vā gha-  -aháṃ tát paścā́ katitháś cid āsa

translation.text: Their kin, the Prince in heaven, thy nearest kinsman, turning his thought to thee thus speaks in kindness: This is our highest bond: I am his offspring. How many others came ere I succeeded?

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं मे॒ नाभि॑रि॒ह मे॑ स॒धस्थ॑मि॒मे मे॑ दे॒वा अ॒यम॑स्मि॒ सर्वः॑ द्वि॒जा अह॑ प्रथम॒जा ऋ॒तस्ये॒दं धे॒नुर॑दुह॒ज्जाय॑माना
verses.transliteration: iyám me nā́bhir ihá me sadhástham  imé me devā́ ayám asmi sárvaḥ  dvijā́ áha prathamajā́ r̥tásya-  -idáṃ dhenúr aduhaj jā́yamānā

translation.text: Here is my kinship, here the place I dwell in: these are my Gods; I in full strength am present. Twice-born am I, the first-born Son of Order: the Cow milked this when first she had her being.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑सु म॒न्द्रो अ॑र॒तिर्वि॒भावाव॑ स्यति द्विवर्त॒निर्व॑ने॒षाट् ऊ॒र्ध्वा यच्छ्रेणि॒र्न शिशु॒र्दन्म॒क्षू स्थि॒रं शे॑वृ॒धं सू॑त मा॒ता
verses.transliteration: ádhāsu mandró aratír vibhā́vā-  -áva syati dvivartanír vaneṣā́ṭ  ūrdhvā́ yác chréṇir ná śíśur dán  makṣū́ sthiráṃ śevr̥dháṃ sūta mātā́

translation.text: So mid these tribes he rests, the friendly envoy, borne on two paths, refulgent Lord of fuel. When, like a line, the Babe springs up erectly, his Mother straight hath borne him strong to bless us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॒ गाव॒ उप॑मातिं क॒नाया॒ अनु॑ श्वा॒न्तस्य॒ कस्य॑ चि॒त्परे॑युः श्रु॒धि त्वं सु॑द्रविणो न॒स्त्वं या॑ळाश्व॒घ्नस्य॑ वावृधे सू॒नृता॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ádhā gā́va úpamātiṃ kanā́yāḥ-  ánu śvāntásya kásya cit páreyuḥ  śrudhí tváṃ sudraviṇo nas tváṃ yāḷ  āśvaghnásya vāvr̥dhe sūnŕ̥tābhiḥ

translation.text: Then went the milch-kine forth to please the damsel, and for the good of every man that liveth. Hear us, O wealthy Lord; begin our worship. Thou hast grown mighty through Âṣvaghna's virtues.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ त्वमि॑न्द्र वि॒द्ध्य१॒॑स्मान्म॒हो रा॒ये नृ॑पते॒ वज्र॑बाहुः रक्षा॑ च नो म॒घोनः॑ पा॒हि सू॒रीन॑ने॒हस॑स्ते हरिवो अ॒भिष्टौ॑
verses.transliteration: ádha tvám indra viddhy àsmā́n  mahó rāyé nr̥pate vájrabāhuḥ  rákṣā ca no maghónaḥ pāhí sūrī́n  anehásas te harivo abhíṣṭau

translation.text: And take thou notice of us also, Indra, for ample riches, King whose arm wields thunder! Protect our wealthy nobles, guard our princes unmenaced near thee, Lord of Tawny Coursers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ यद्रा॑जाना॒ गवि॑ष्टौ॒ सर॑त्सर॒ण्युः का॒रवे॑ जर॒ण्युः विप्रः॒ प्रेष्ठः॒ स ह्ये॑षां ब॒भूव॒ परा॑ च॒ वक्ष॑दु॒त प॑र्षदेनान्
verses.transliteration: ádha yád rājānā gáviṣṭau  sárat saraṇyúḥ kāráve jaraṇyúḥ  vípraḥ préṣṭhaḥ sá hy èṣām babhū́va  párā ca vákṣad utá parṣad enān

translation.text: When he goes forth, ye Pair of Kings, for booty, speeding to war and praise to please the singer,– I was the dearest sage of those about him,– let him lead these away and bring them safely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॒ न्व॑स्य॒ जेन्य॑स्य पु॒ष्टौ वृथा॒ रेभ॑न्त ईमहे॒ तदू॒ नु स॒र॒ण्युर॑स्य सू॒नुरश्वो॒ विप्र॑श्चासि॒ श्रव॑सश्च सा॒तौ
verses.transliteration: ádhā nv àsya jényasya puṣṭaú  vŕ̥thā rébhanta īmahe tád ū nú  saraṇyúr asya sūnúr áśvo  vípraś cāsi śrávasaś ca sātaú

translation.text: Now for this noble man's support and comfort, singing with easy voice we thus implore thee: Impetuous be his son and fleet his courser: and may I be his priest to win him glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वोर्यदि॑ स॒ख्याया॒स्मे शर्धा॑य॒ स्तोमं॑ जुजु॒षे नम॑स्वान् वि॒श्वत्र॒ यस्मि॒न्ना गिरः॑ समी॒चीः पू॒र्वीव॑ गा॒तुर्दाश॑त्सू॒नृता॑यै
verses.transliteration: yuvór yádi sakhyā́yāsmé  śárdhāya stómaṃ jujuṣé námasvān  viśvátra yásminn ā́ gíraḥ samīcī́ḥ  pūrvī́va gātúr dā́śat sūnŕ̥tāyai

translation.text: If, for our strength, the priest with adoration to win your friendship made the laud accepted, That laud shall be a branching road to virtue for every one to whom the songs are suited.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स गृ॑णा॒नो अ॒द्भिर्दे॒ववा॒निति॑ सु॒बन्धु॒र्नम॑सा सू॒क्तैः वर्ध॑दु॒क्थैर्वचो॑भि॒रा हि नू॒नं व्यध्वै॑ति॒ पय॑स उ॒स्रिया॑याः
verses.transliteration: sá gr̥ṇānó adbhír devávān  íti subándhur námasā sūktaíḥ  várdhad ukthaír vácobhir ā́ hí nūnáṃ  vy ádhvaiti páyasa usríyāyāḥ

translation.text: Glorified thus, with holy hymns and homage:-Of noble race, with Waters, God-attended May he enrich us for our prayers and praises: now can the cow be milked; the path is open.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त ऊ॒ षु णो॑ म॒हो य॑जत्रा भू॒त दे॑वास ऊ॒तये॑ स॒जोषाः॑ ये वाजाँ॒ अन॑यता वि॒यन्तो॒ ये स्था नि॑चे॒तारो॒ अमू॑राः
verses.transliteration: tá ū ṣú ṇo mahó yajatrāḥ-  bhūtá devāsa ūtáye sajóṣāḥ  yé vā́jām̐ ánayatā viyánto  yé sthā́ nicetā́ro ámūrāḥ

translation.text: Be to us, then, ye Gods who merit worship, be ye of one accord our strong protection, Who went on various ways and brought us vigour, ye who are undeceivable explorers.

suktas.deity: All the Gods or the Angiras, Thanksgiving to Savarni

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये य॒ज्ञेन॒ दक्षि॑णया॒ सम॑क्ता॒ इन्द्र॑स्य स॒ख्यम॑मृत॒त्वमा॑न॒श तेभ्यो॑ भ॒द्रम॑ङ्गिरसो वो अस्तु॒ प्रति॑ गृभ्णीत मान॒वं सु॑मेधसः
verses.transliteration: yé yajñéna dákṣiṇayā sámaktāḥ-  índrasya sakhyám amr̥tatvám ānaśá  tébhyo bhadrám aṅgiraso vo astu  práti gr̥bhṇīta mānaváṃ sumedhasaḥ

translation.text: YE, who, adorned with guerdon through the sacrifice, have won you Indra's friendship and eternal life, Even to you be happiness, Angirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य उ॒दाज॑न्पि॒तरो॑ गो॒मयं॒ वस्वृ॒तेनाभि॑न्दन्परिवत्स॒रे व॒लम् दी॒र्घा॒यु॒त्वम॑ङ्गिरसो वो अस्तु॒ प्रति॑ गृभ्णीत मान॒वं सु॑मेधसः
verses.transliteration: yá udā́jan pitáro gomáyaṃ vásu-  r̥ténā́bhindan parivatsaré valám  dīrghāyutvám aṅgiraso vo astu  práti gr̥bhṇīta mānaváṃ sumedhasaḥ

translation.text: The Fathers, who drave forth the wealth in cattle, have in the year's courses cleft Vala by Eternal Law: A lengthened life be yours, O ye Angirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ऋ॒तेन॒ सूर्य॒मारो॑हयन्दि॒व्यप्र॑थयन्पृथि॒वीं मा॒तरं॒ वि सु॒प्र॒जा॒स्त्वम॑ङ्गिरसो वो अस्तु॒ प्रति॑ गृभ्णीत मान॒वं सु॑मेधसः
verses.transliteration: yá r̥téna sū́ryam ā́rohayan diví-  áprathayan pr̥thivī́m mātáraṃ ví  suprajāstvám aṅgiraso vo astu  práti gr̥bhṇīta mānaváṃ sumedhasaḥ

translation.text: Ye raised the Sun to heaven by everlasting Law, and spread broad earth, the Mother, out on every side. Fair wealth of progeny be yours, Angirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं नाभा॑ वदति व॒ल्गु वो॑ गृ॒हे देव॑पुत्रा ऋषय॒स्तच्छृ॑णोतन सु॒ब्र॒ह्म॒ण्यम॑ङ्गिरसो वो अस्तु॒ प्रति॑ गृभ्णीत मान॒वं सु॑मेधसः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ nā́bhā vadati valgú vo gr̥hé  dévaputrā r̥ṣayas tác chr̥ṇotana  subrahmaṇyám aṅgiraso vo astu  práti gr̥bhṇīta mānaváṃ sumedhasaḥ

translation.text: This kinsman in your dwellingplace speaks pleasant words: give car to this, ye R̥ishis, children of the Gods. High Brahman dignity be yours, Angirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विरू॑पास॒ इदृष॑य॒स्त इद्ग॑म्भी॒रवे॑पसः ते अङ्गि॑रसः सू॒नव॒स्ते अ॒ग्नेः परि॑ जज्ञिरे
verses.transliteration: vírūpāsa íd ŕ̥ṣayas  tá íd gambhīrávepasaḥ  té áṅgirasaḥ sūnávas  té agnéḥ pári jajñire

translation.text: Distinguished by their varied form, these R̥ishis have been deeply moved. These are the sons of Angirases: from Agni have they sprung to life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये अ॒ग्नेः परि॑ जज्ञि॒रे विरू॑पासो दि॒वस्परि॑ नव॑ग्वो॒ नु दश॑ग्वो॒ अङ्गि॑रस्तमः॒ सचा॑ दे॒वेषु॑ मंहते
verses.transliteration: yé agnéḥ pári jajñiré  vírūpāso divás pári  návagvo nú dáśagvo áṅgirastamo  sácā devéṣu maṃhate

translation.text: Distinguished by their varied form, they sprang from Agni, from the sky. Navagva and Daṣagva, noblest Angiras, he giveth bounty with the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रे॑ण यु॒जा निः सृ॑जन्त वा॒घतो॑ व्र॒जं गोम॑न्तम॒श्विन॑म् स॒हस्रं॑ मे॒ दद॑तो अष्टक॒र्ण्य१॒॑ः श्रवो॑ दे॒वेष्व॑क्रत
verses.transliteration: índreṇa yujā́ níḥ sr̥janta vāgháto  vrajáṃ gómantam aśvínaṃ  sahásram me dádato aṣṭakarṇyàḥ  śrávo devéṣv akrata

translation.text: With Indra for associate the priests have cleared the stable full of steeds and kine, Giving to me a thousand with their eightmarked cars, they gained renown among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नू॒नं जा॑यताम॒यं मनु॒स्तोक्मे॑व रोहतु यः स॒हस्रं॑ श॒ताश्वं॑ स॒द्यो दा॒नाय॒ मंह॑ते
verses.transliteration: prá nūnáṃ jāyatām ayám  mánus tókmeva rohatu  yáḥ sahásraṃ śatā́śvaṃ  sadyó dānā́ya máṃhate

translation.text: May this man's sons be multiplied; like springing corn may Manu grow, Who gives at once in bounteous gift a thousand kine, a hundred steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न तम॑श्नोति॒ कश्च॒न दि॒व इ॑व॒ सान्वा॒रभ॑म् सा॒व॒र्ण्यस्य॒ दक्षि॑णा॒ वि सिन्धु॑रिव पप्रथे
verses.transliteration: ná tám aśnoti káś caná  divá iva sā́nv ārábham  sāvarṇyásya dákṣiṇā  ví síndhur iva paprathe

translation.text: No one attains to him, as though a man would grasp the heights of heaven. Sâvarṇya's sacrificial meed hath broadened like an ample flood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त दा॒सा प॑रि॒विषे॒ स्मद्दि॑ष्टी॒ गोप॑रीणसा यदु॑स्तु॒र्वश्च॑ मामहे
verses.transliteration: utá dāsā́ parivíṣe  smáddiṣṭī góparīṇasā  yádus turváś ca māmahe

translation.text: Yadu and Turva, too, have given two Dâsas, well-disposed, to serve, Together with great store of kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒ह॒स्र॒दा ग्रा॑म॒णीर्मा रि॑ष॒न्मनुः॒ सूर्ये॑णास्य॒ यत॑मानैतु॒ दक्षि॑णा साव॑र्णेर्दे॒वाः प्र ति॑र॒न्त्वायु॒र्यस्मि॒न्नश्रा॑न्ता॒ अस॑नाम॒ वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: sahasradā́ grāmaṇī́r mā́ riṣan mánuḥ  sū́ryeṇāsya yátamānaitu dákṣiṇā  sā́varṇer devā́ḥ prá tirantv ā́yur  yásminn áśrāntā ásanāma vā́jam

translation.text: Blest be the hamlet's chief, most liberal Manu, and may his bounty rival that of Sûrya. May the God let Sâvarṇi's life be leng thened, with whom, unwearied, we have lived and prospered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रा॒वतो॒ ये दिधि॑षन्त॒ आप्यं॒ मनु॑प्रीतासो॒ जनि॑मा वि॒वस्व॑तः य॒याते॒र्ये न॑हु॒ष्य॑स्य ब॒र्हिषि॑ दे॒वा आस॑ते॒ ते अधि॑ ब्रुवन्तु नः
verses.transliteration: parāváto yé dídhiṣanta ā́pyam  mánuprītāso jánimā vivásvataḥ  yayā́ter yé nahuṣyàsya barhíṣi  devā́ ā́sate té ádhi bruvantu naḥ

translation.text: MAY they who would assume kinship from far away, Vivasvan's generations, dearly loved of men, Even the Gods who sit upon the sacred grass of Nahusha's son Yayati, bless and comfort us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॒ हि वो॑ नम॒स्या॑नि॒ वन्द्या॒ नामा॑नि देवा उ॒त य॒ज्ञिया॑नि वः ये स्थ जा॒ता अदि॑तेर॒द्भ्यस्परि॒ ये पृ॑थि॒व्यास्ते म॑ इ॒ह श्रु॑ता॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: víśvā hí vo namasyā̀ni vándyā  nā́māni devā utá yajñíyāni vaḥ  yé sthá jātā́ áditer adbhyás pári  yé pr̥thivyā́s té ma ihá śrutā hávam

translation.text: For worthy of obeisance, Gods, are all your names, worthy of adoration and of sacrifice. Ye who were born from waters, and from Aditi, and from the earth, do ye here listen to my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येभ्यो॑ मा॒ता मधु॑म॒त्पिन्व॑ते॒ पयः॑ पी॒यूषं॒ द्यौरदि॑ति॒रद्रि॑बर्हाः उ॒क्थशु॑ष्मान्वृषभ॒रान्त्स्वप्न॑स॒स्ताँ आ॑दि॒त्याँ अनु॑ मदा स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: yébhyo mātā́ mádhumat pínvate páyaḥ  pīyū́ṣaṃ dyaúr áditir ádribarhāḥ  uktháśuṣmān vr̥ṣabharā́n svápnasas  tā́m̐ ādityā́m̐ ánu madā svastáye

translation.text: I will rejoice in these Âdityas for my weal, for whom the Mother pours forth water rich in balm, And Dyaus the Infinite, firm as a rock, sweet milk,– Gods active, strong through lauds, whose might the Bull upholds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृ॒चक्ष॑सो॒ अनि॑मिषन्तो अ॒र्हणा॑ बृ॒हद्दे॒वासो॑ अमृत॒त्वमा॑नशुः ज्यो॒तीर॑था॒ अहि॑माया॒ अना॑गसो दि॒वो व॒र्ष्माणं॑ वसते स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: nr̥cákṣaso ánimiṣanto arháṇā  br̥hád devā́so amr̥tatvám ānaśuḥ  jyotī́rathā áhimāyā ánāgaso  divó varṣmā́ṇaṃ vasate svastáye

translation.text: Looking on men, ne'er slumbering, they by their deserts attained as Gods to lofty immortality. Borne on refulgent cars, sinless, with serpents' powers, they robe them, for our welfare, in the height of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्राजो॒ ये सु॒वृधो॑ य॒ज्ञमा॑य॒युरप॑रिह्वृता दधि॒रे दि॒वि क्षय॑म् ताँ आ वि॑वास॒ नम॑सा सुवृ॒क्तिभि॑र्म॒हो आ॑दि॒त्याँ अदि॑तिं स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: samrā́jo yé suvŕ̥dho yajñám āyayúr  áparihvr̥tā dadhiré diví kṣáyam  tā́m̐ ā́ vivāsa námasā suvr̥ktíbhir  mahó ādityā́m̐ áditiṃ svastáye

translation.text: Great Kings who bless us, who have come to sacrifice, who, ne'er assailed, have set their mansion in the sky,– These I invite with adoration and with hymns, mighty Âdityas, Aditi, for happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को वः॒ स्तोमं॑ राधति॒ यं जुजो॑षथ॒ विश्वे॑ देवासो मनुषो॒ यति॒ ष्ठन॑ को वो॑ऽध्व॒रं तु॑विजाता॒ अरं॑ कर॒द्यो नः॒ पर्ष॒दत्यंहः॑ स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: kó va stómaṃ rādhati yáṃ jújoṣatha  víśve devāso manuṣo yáti ṣṭhána  kó vo 'dhvaráṃ tuvijātā áraṃ karad  yó naḥ párṣad áty áṃhaḥ svastáye

translation.text: Who offereth to you the laud that ye accept, O ye All-Gods of Manu, many as ye are? Who, Mighty Ones, will prepare for you the sacrifice to bear us over trouble to felicity?

verses.sanskrit_deva: येभ्यो॒ होत्रां॑ प्रथ॒मामा॑ये॒जे मनुः॒ समि॑द्धाग्नि॒र्मन॑सा स॒प्त होतृ॑भिः त आ॑दित्या॒ अभ॑यं॒ शर्म॑ यच्छत सु॒गा नः॑ कर्त सु॒पथा॑ स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: yébhyo hótrām prathamā́m āyejé mánuḥ  sámiddhāgnir mánasā saptá hótr̥bhiḥ  tá ādityā ábhayaṃ śárma yachata  sugā́ naḥ karta supáthā svastáye

translation.text: Ye to whom Manu, by seven priests, with kindled fire, offered the first oblation with his heart and soul, Vouchsafe us, ye Âdityas, sheitcr free from fear, and make us good and easy paths to happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ईशि॑रे॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ प्रचे॑तसो॒ विश्व॑स्य स्था॒तुर्जग॑तश्च॒ मन्त॑वः ते नः॑ कृ॒तादकृ॑ता॒देन॑स॒स्पर्य॒द्या दे॑वासः पिपृता स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: yá ī́śire bhúvanasya prácetaso  víśvasya sthātúr jágataś ca mántavaḥ  té naḥ kr̥tā́d ákr̥tād énasas pári-  adyā́ devāsaḥ pipr̥tā svastáye

translation.text: Wise Deities, who have dominion o'er the world, ye thinkers over all that moves not and that moves, Save us from uncommitted and committed sin, preserve us from all sin to-day for happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भरे॒ष्विन्द्रं॑ सु॒हवं॑ हवामहेंऽहो॒मुचं॑ सु॒कृतं॒ दैव्यं॒ जन॑म् अ॒ग्निं मि॒त्रं वरु॑णं सा॒तये॒ भगं॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी म॒रुतः॑ स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: bháreṣv índraṃ suhávaṃ havāmahe  -aṃhomúcaṃ sukŕ̥taṃ daívyaṃ jánam  agním mitráṃ váruṇaṃ sātáye bhágaṃ  dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ marútaḥ svastáye

translation.text: In battles we invoke Indra still swift to hear, and all the holy Host of Heaven who banish grief, Agni, Mitra, and Varuṇa that we may gain, Dyays, Bhaga, Maruts, Pr̥ithivî for happiness:

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒त्रामा॑णं पृथि॒वीं द्याम॑ने॒हसं॑ सु॒शर्मा॑ण॒मदि॑तिं सु॒प्रणी॑तिम् दैवीं॒ नावं॑ स्वरि॒त्रामना॑गस॒मस्र॑वन्ती॒मा रु॑हेमा स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: sutrā́māṇam pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m anehásaṃ  suśármāṇam áditiṃ supráṇītim  daívīṃ nā́vaṃ svaritrā́m ánāgasam  ásravantīm ā́ ruhemā svastáye

translation.text: Mightily-saving Earth, incomparable Heaven the good guide Aditi who gives secure defence The well-oared heavenly Ship that lets no waters in, free from defect, will we ascend for happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ यजत्रा॒ अधि॑ वोचतो॒तये॒ त्राय॑ध्वं नो दु॒रेवा॑या अभि॒ह्रुतः॑ स॒त्यया॑ वो दे॒वहू॑त्या हुवेम शृण्व॒तो दे॑वा॒ अव॑से स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: víśve yajatrā ádhi vocatotáye  trā́yadhvaṃ no durévāyā abhihrútaḥ  satyáyā vo deváhūtyā huvema  śr̥ṇvató devā ávase svastáye
