translation.text: Bless us, all Holy Ones, that we may have your help, guard and protect us from malignant injury. With fruitful invocation may we call on you, Gods, who give ear to us for grace, for happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपामी॑वा॒मप॒ विश्वा॒मना॑हुति॒मपारा॑तिं दुर्वि॒दत्रा॑मघाय॒तः आ॒रे दे॑वा॒ द्वेषो॑ अ॒स्मद्यु॑योतनो॒रु णः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छता स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: ápā́mīvām ápa víśvām ánāhutim  ápā́rātiṃ durvidátrām aghāyatáḥ  āré devā dvéṣo asmád yuyotana-  -urú ṇaḥ śárma yachatā svastáye

translation.text: Keep all disease afar and sordid sacrifice, keep off the wicked man's malicious enmity. Keep far away from us all hatred, O ye Gods, and give us ample shelter for our happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरि॑ष्टः॒ स मर्तो॒ विश्व॑ एधते॒ प्र प्र॒जाभि॑र्जायते॒ धर्म॑ण॒स्परि॑ यमा॑दित्यासो॒ नय॑था सुनी॒तिभि॒रति॒ विश्वा॑नि दुरि॒ता स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: áriṣṭaḥ sá márto víśva edhate  prá prajā́bhir jāyate dhármaṇas pári  yám ādityāso náyathā sunītíbhir  áti víśvāni duritā́ svastáye

translation.text: Untouched by any evil, every mortal thrives, and, following the Law, spreads in his progeny. Whom ye with your good guidance, O Âdityas, lead safely through all his pain and grief to happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं दे॑वा॒सोऽव॑थ॒ वाज॑सातौ॒ यं शूर॑साता मरुतो हि॒ते धने॑ प्रा॒त॒र्यावा॑णं॒ रथ॑मिन्द्र सान॒सिमरि॑ष्यन्त॒मा रु॑हेमा स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: yáṃ devāsó 'vatha vā́jasātau  yáṃ śū́rasātā maruto hité dháne  prātaryā́vāṇaṃ rátham indra sānasím  áriṣyantam ā́ ruhemā svastáye

translation.text: That which ye guard and grace in battle, O ye Gods, ye Maruts, where the prize is wealth, where heroes win, That conquering Car, O Indra, that sets forth at dawn, that never breaks, may we ascend for happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्ति नः॑ प॒थ्या॑सु॒ धन्व॑सु स्व॒स्त्य१॒॑प्सु वृ॒जने॒ स्व॑र्वति स्व॒स्ति नः॑ पुत्रकृ॒थेषु॒ योनि॑षु स्व॒स्ति रा॒ये म॑रुतो दधातन
verses.transliteration: svastí naḥ pathyā̀su dhánvasu  svasty àpsú vr̥jáne svàrvati  svastí naḥ putrakr̥théṣu yóniṣu  svastí rāyé maruto dadhātana

translation.text: Vouchsafe us blessing in our paths and desert tracts, blessing in waters and in battle, for the light; Blessing upon the wombs that bring male children forth, and blessing, O ye Maruts, for the gain of wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्तिरिद्धि प्रप॑थे॒ श्रेष्ठा॒ रेक्ण॑स्वत्य॒भि या वा॒ममेति॑ सा नो॑ अ॒मा सो अर॑णे॒ नि पा॑तु स्वावे॒शा भ॑वतु दे॒वगो॑पा
verses.transliteration: svastír íd dhí prápathe śréṣṭhā  rékṇasvaty abhí yā́ vāmám éti  sā́ no amā́ só áraṇe ní pātu  svāveśā́ bhavatu devágopā

translation.text: The noblest Svasti with abundant riches, who comes to what is good by distant pathway,– May she at home and far away preserve us, and dwell with us under the Gods' protection

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा प्ल॒तेः सू॒नुर॑वीवृधद्वो॒ विश्व॑ आदित्या अदिते मनी॒षी ई॒शा॒नासो॒ नरो॒ अम॑र्त्ये॒नास्ता॑वि॒ जनो॑ दि॒व्यो गये॑न
verses.transliteration: evā́ platéḥ sūnúr avīvr̥dhad vo  víśva ādityā adite manīṣī́  īśānā́so náro ámartyena-  -ástāvi jáno divyó gáyena

translation.text: Thus hath the thoughtful sage, the son of Plati, praised you, O Aditi and all Âdityas, Men are made rich by those who are Immortal: the Heavenly Folk have been extolled by Gaya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒था दे॒वानां॑ कत॒मस्य॒ याम॑नि सु॒मन्तु॒ नाम॑ शृण्व॒तां म॑नामहे को मृ॑ळाति कत॒मो नो॒ मय॑स्करत्कत॒म ऊ॒ती अ॒भ्या व॑वर्तति
verses.transliteration: kathā́ devā́nāṃ katamásya yā́mani  sumántu nā́ma śr̥ṇvatā́m manāmahe  kó mr̥ḷāti katamó no máyas karat  katamá ūtī́ abhy ā́ vavartati

translation.text: WHAT God, of those who hear, is he whose well-praised name we may record in this our sacrifice; and how? Who will be gracious? Who of many give us bliss? Who out of all the Host will come to lend us aid?

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्र॒तू॒यन्ति॒ क्रत॑वो हृ॒त्सु धी॒तयो॒ वेन॑न्ति वे॒नाः प॒तय॒न्त्या दिशः॑ न म॑र्डि॒ता वि॑द्यते अ॒न्य ए॑भ्यो दे॒वेषु॑ मे॒ अधि॒ कामा॑ अयंसत
verses.transliteration: kratūyánti krátavo hr̥tsú dhītáyo  vénanti venā́ḥ patáyanty ā́ díśaḥ  ná marḍitā́ vidyate anyá ebhyo  devéṣu me ádhi kā́mā ayaṃsata

translation.text: The will and thoughts within my breast exert their power: they yearn with love, and fly to all the regions round. None other comforter is found save only these: my longings and my hopes are fixt upon the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नरा॑ वा॒ शंसं॑ पू॒षण॒मगो॑ह्यम॒ग्निं दे॒वेद्ध॑म॒भ्य॑र्चसे गि॒रा सूर्या॒मासा॑ च॒न्द्रम॑सा य॒मं दि॒वि त्रि॒तं वात॑मु॒षस॑म॒क्तुम॒श्विना॑
verses.transliteration: nárā vā śáṃsam pūṣáṇam ágohyam  agníṃ devéddham abhy àrcase girā́  sū́ryāmā́sā candrámasā yamáṃ diví  tritáṃ vā́tam uṣásam aktúm aśvínā

translation.text: To Narâṣansa and to Pûshan I sing forth, unconcealable Agni kindied by the Gods. To Sun and Moon, two Moons, to Yama in the heaven, to Trita, Vâta, Dawn, Night, and the Atvins Twain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒था क॒विस्तु॑वी॒रवा॒न्कया॑ गि॒रा बृह॒स्पति॑र्वावृधते सुवृ॒क्तिभिः॑ अ॒ज एक॑पात्सु॒हवे॑भि॒र्ऋक्व॑भि॒रहिः॑ शृणोतु बु॒ध्न्यो॒३॒॑ हवी॑मनि
verses.transliteration: kathā́ kavís tuvīrávān káyā girā́  bŕ̥haspátir vāvr̥dhate suvr̥ktíbhiḥ  ajá ékapāt suhávebhir ŕ̥kvabhir  áhiḥ śr̥ṇotu budhnyò hávīmani

translation.text: How is the Sage extolled whom the loud singers praise? What voice, what hymn is used to laud Br̥ihaspati? May Aja-Ekapad with Rkvans swift to hear, and Ahi of the Deep listen unto our call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दक्ष॑स्य वादिते॒ जन्म॑नि व्र॒ते राजा॑ना मि॒त्रावरु॒णा वि॑वाससि अतू॑र्तपन्थाः पुरु॒रथो॑ अर्य॒मा स॒प्तहो॑ता॒ विषु॑रूपेषु॒ जन्म॑सु
verses.transliteration: dákṣasya vādite jánmani vraté  rā́jānā mitrā́váruṇā́ vivāsasi  átūrtapanthāḥ pururátho aryamā́  saptáhotā víṣurūpeṣu jánmasu

translation.text: Aditi, to the birth of Daksha and the vow thou summonest the Kings Mitra and Varuṇa. With course unchecked, with many chariots Aryaman comes with the seven priests to tribes of varied sort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते नो॒ अर्व॑न्तो हवन॒श्रुतो॒ हवं॒ विश्वे॑ शृण्वन्तु वा॒जिनो॑ मि॒तद्र॑वः स॒ह॒स्र॒सा मे॒धसा॑ताविव॒ त्मना॑ म॒हो ये धनं॑ समि॒थेषु॑ जभ्रि॒रे
verses.transliteration: té no árvanto havanaśrúto hávaṃ  víśve śr̥ṇvantu vājíno mitádravaḥ  sahasrasā́ medhásātāv iva tmánā  mahó yé dhánaṃ samithéṣu jabhriré

translation.text: May all those vigorous Coursers listen to our cry, hearers of invocation, speeding on their way; Winners of thousands where the priestly meed is won, who gather of themselves great wealth in every race.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ वा॒युं र॑थ॒युजं॒ पुरं॑धिं॒ स्तोमैः॑ कृणुध्वं स॒ख्याय॑ पू॒षण॑म् ते हि दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुः सवी॑मनि॒ क्रतुं॒ सच॑न्ते स॒चितः॒ सचे॑तसः
verses.transliteration: prá vo vāyúṃ rathayújam púraṃdhiṃ  stómaiḥ kr̥ṇudhvaṃ sakhyā́ya pūṣáṇam  té hí devásya savitúḥ sávīmani  krátuṃ sácante sacítaḥ sácetasaḥ

translation.text: Bring ye Purandbi, bring Vâyu who yokes his steeds, for friendship bring ye Pûshan with your songs of praise: They with one mind, one thought attend the sacrifice, urged by the favouring aid of Savitar the God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिः स॒प्त स॒स्रा न॒द्यो॑ म॒हीर॒पो वन॒स्पती॒न्पर्व॑ताँ अ॒ग्निमू॒तये॑ कृ॒शानु॒मस्तॄ॑न्ति॒ष्यं॑ स॒धस्थ॒ आ रु॒द्रं रु॒द्रेषु॑ रु॒द्रियं॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: tríḥ saptá sasrā́ nadyò mahī́r apó  vánaspátīn párvatām̐ agním ūtáye  kr̥śā́num ástr̥̄n tiṣyàṃ sadhástha~ā́  rudráṃ rudréṣu rudríyaṃ havāmahe

translation.text: The thrice-seven wandering Rivers, yea, the mighty floods, the forest trees, the mountains, Agni to our aid, Kr̥iṣanu, Tisya, archers to our gathering-place, and Rudra strong amid the Rudras we invoke.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर॑स्वती स॒रयुः॒ सिन्धु॑रू॒र्मिभि॑र्म॒हो म॒हीरव॒सा य॑न्तु॒ वक्ष॑णीः दे॒वीरापो॑ मा॒तरः॑ सूदयि॒त्न्वो॑ घृ॒तव॒त्पयो॒ मधु॑मन्नो अर्चत
verses.transliteration: sárasvatī saráyuḥ síndhur ūrmíbhir  mahó mahī́r ávasā́ yantu vákṣaṇīḥ  devī́r ā́po mātáraḥ sūdayitnvò  ghr̥távat páyo mádhuman no arcata

translation.text: Let the great Streams come hither with their mighty help, Sindhu, Sarasvatî, and Sarayu with waves. Ye Goddess Floods, ye Mothers, animating all, promise us water rich in fatness and in balm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त मा॒ता बृ॑हद्दि॒वा शृ॑णोतु न॒स्त्वष्टा॑ दे॒वेभि॒र्जनि॑भिः पि॒ता वचः॑ ऋ॒भु॒क्षा वाजो॒ रथ॒स्पति॒र्भगो॑ र॒ण्वः शंसः॑ शशमा॒नस्य॑ पातु नः
verses.transliteration: utá mātā́ br̥haddivā́ śr̥ṇotu nas  tváṣṭā devébhir jánibhiḥ pitā́ vácaḥ  r̥bhukṣā́ vā́jo ráthaspátir bhágo  raṇváḥ śáṃsaḥ śaśamānásya pātu naḥ

translation.text: And let Br̥ihaddiva, the Mother, hear our call, and Tvashṭar, Father, with the Goddesses and Dames. R̥ibhukshan, Vâja, Bhaga, and Rathaspati, and the sweet speech of him who labours guard us well!

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒ण्वः संदृ॑ष्टौ पितु॒माँ इ॑व॒ क्षयो॑ भ॒द्रा रु॒द्राणां॑ म॒रुता॒मुप॑स्तुतिः गोभिः॑ ष्याम य॒शसो॒ जने॒ष्वा सदा॑ देवास॒ इळ॑या सचेमहि
verses.transliteration: raṇváḥ sáṃdr̥ṣṭau pitumā́m̐ iva kṣáyaḥ  bhadrā́ rudrā́ṇām marútām úpastutiḥ  góbhiḥ ṣyāma yaśáso jáneṣv~ā́  sádā devāsa íḷayā sacemahi

translation.text: Pleasant to look on as a dwelling rich in food is the blest favour of the Maruts, Rudra's Sons. May we be famed among the folk for wealth in kine. and ever come to you, ye Gods, with sacred food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यां मे॒ धियं॒ मरु॑त॒ इन्द्र॒ देवा॒ अद॑दात वरुण मित्र यू॒यम् तां पी॑पयत॒ पय॑सेव धे॒नुं कु॒विद्गिरो॒ अधि॒ रथे॒ वहा॑थ
verses.transliteration: yā́m me dhíyam máruta índra dévāḥ-  ádadāta varuṇa mitra yūyám  tā́m pīpayata páyaseva dhenúṃ  kuvíd gíro ádhi ráthe váhātha

translation.text: The thought which ye, O Maruts, Indra and ye Gods have given to me, and ye, Mitra and Varuṇa,– Cause this to grow and swell like a milchcow with milk. Will ye not bear away my songs upon your car?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒विद॒ङ्ग प्रति॒ यथा॑ चिद॒स्य नः॑ सजा॒त्य॑स्य मरुतो॒ बुबो॑धथ नाभा॒ यत्र॑ प्रथ॒मं सं॒नसा॑महे॒ तत्र॑ जामि॒त्वमदि॑तिर्दधातु नः
verses.transliteration: kuvíd aṅgá práti yáthā cid asyá naḥ  sajātyàsya maruto búbodhatha  nā́bhā yátra prathamáṃ saṃnásāmahe  tátra jāmitvám áditir dadhātu naḥ

translation.text: O Maruts, do ye never, never recollect and call again to mind this our relationship? When next we meet together at the central point, even there shall Aditi confirm our brotherhood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी मा॒तरा॑ म॒ही दे॒वी दे॒वाञ्जन्म॑ना य॒ज्ञिये॑ इ॒तः उ॒भे बि॑भृत उ॒भयं॒ भरी॑मभिः पु॒रू रेतां॑सि पि॒तृभि॑श्च सिञ्चतः
verses.transliteration: té hí dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ mātárā mahī́  devī́ devā́ñ jánmanā yajñíye itáḥ  ubhé bibhr̥ta ubháyam bhárīmabhiḥ  purū́ rétāṃsi pitŕ̥bhiś ca siñcataḥ

translation.text: The Mothers, Heaven and Earth, those mighty Goddesses, worthy of sacrifice, ecune with the race of Gods. These Two with their support uphold both Gods and men, and with the Fathers pour the copious genial stream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि षा होत्रा॒ विश्व॑मश्नोति॒ वार्यं॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र॒रम॑तिः॒ पनी॑यसी ग्रावा॒ यत्र॑ मधु॒षुदु॒च्यते॑ बृ॒हदवी॑वशन्त म॒तिभि॑र्मनी॒षिणः॑
verses.transliteration: ví ṣā́ hótrā víśvam aśnoti vā́ryam  bŕ̥haspátir arámatiḥ pánīyasī  grā́vā yátra madhuṣúd ucyáte br̥hád  ávīvaśanta matíbhir manīṣíṇaḥ

translation.text: This invocation wins all good that we desire Br̥ihaspati, highly-praised Aramati, are here, Even where the stone that presses meath rings loudly out, and where the sages make their voices heard with hymns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा क॒विस्तु॑वी॒रवाँ॑ ऋत॒ज्ञा द्र॑विण॒स्युर्द्रवि॑णसश्चका॒नः उ॒क्थेभि॒रत्र॑ म॒तिभि॑श्च॒ विप्रोऽपी॑पय॒द्गयो॑ दि॒व्यानि॒ जन्म॑
verses.transliteration: evā́ kavís tuvīrávām̐ r̥tajñā́ḥ-  draviṇasyúr dráviṇasaś cakānáḥ  ukthébhir átra matíbhiś ca vípraḥ-  -ápīpayad gáyo divyā́ni jánma

translation.text: Thus hath the sage, skilled in loud singers' duties, desiring riches, yearning after treasure, Gaya, the priestly singer, with his praises and hymns contented the Celestial people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा प्ल॒तेः सू॒नुर॑वीवृधद्वो॒ विश्व॑ आदित्या अदिते मनी॒षी ई॒शा॒नासो॒ नरो॒ अम॑र्त्ये॒नास्ता॑वि॒ जनो॑ दि॒व्यो गये॑न
verses.transliteration: evā́ platéḥ sūnúr avīvr̥dhad vo  víśva ādityā adite manīṣī́  īśānā́so náro ámartyena-  -ástāvi jáno divyó gáyena

translation.text: Thus hath the thoughtful sage the son of Plati, praised you, O Aditi and all Âdityas. Men are made rich by those who are Immortal: the Heavenly Folk have been extolled by Gaya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निरिन्द्रो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा वा॒युः पू॒षा सर॑स्वती स॒जोष॑सः आ॒दि॒त्या विष्णु॑र्म॒रुतः॒ स्व॑र्बृ॒हत्सोमो॑ रु॒द्रो अदि॑ति॒र्ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
verses.transliteration: agnír índro váruṇo mitró aryamā́  vāyúḥ pūṣā́ sárasvatī sajóṣasaḥ  ādityā́ víṣṇur marútaḥ svàr br̥hát  sómo rudró áditir bráhmaṇas pátiḥ

translation.text: MAY Agni, Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa consent, Aryaman, Vâyu, Pûshan, and Sarasvatî, Âdityas, Maruts, Vishṇu, Soma, lofty Sky, Rudra and Aditi, and Brahmaṇaspati.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒न्द्रा॒ग्नी वृ॑त्र॒हत्ये॑षु॒ सत्प॑ती मि॒थो हि॑न्वा॒ना त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ समो॑कसा अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ मह्या प॑प्रु॒रोज॑सा॒ सोमो॑ घृत॒श्रीर्म॑हि॒मान॑मी॒रय॑न्
verses.transliteration: indrāgnī́ vr̥trahátyeṣu sátpatī  mithó hinvānā́ tanvā̀ sámokasā  antárikṣam máhy ā́ paprur ójasā  sómo ghr̥taśrī́r mahimā́nam īráyan

translation.text: Indra and Agni, Hero-lords when Vr̥itra fell, dwelling together, speeding emulously on, And Soma blent with oil, putting his greatness forth, have with their power filled full the mighty firmament.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तेषां॒ हि म॒ह्ना म॑ह॒ताम॑न॒र्वणां॒ स्तोमाँ॒ इय॑र्म्यृत॒ज्ञा ऋ॑ता॒वृधा॑म् ये अ॑प्स॒वम॑र्ण॒वं चि॒त्ररा॑धस॒स्ते नो॑ रासन्तां म॒हये॑ सुमि॒त्र्याः
verses.transliteration: téṣāṃ hí mahnā́ mahatā́m anarváṇāṃ  stómām̐ íyarmy r̥tajñā́ r̥tāvŕ̥dhām  yé apsavám arṇaváṃ citrárādhasas  té no rāsantām maháye sumitryā́ḥ

translation.text: Skilled in the Law I lift the hymn of praise to these, Law-strengtheners, unassailed, and great in majesty. These in their wondrous bounty send the watery sea: may they as kindly Friends send gifts to make us great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॑र्णरम॒न्तरि॑क्षाणि रोच॒ना द्यावा॒भूमी॑ पृथि॒वीं स्क॑म्भु॒रोज॑सा पृ॒क्षा इ॑व म॒हय॑न्तः सुरा॒तयो॑ दे॒वाः स्त॑वन्ते॒ मनु॑षाय सू॒रयः॑
verses.transliteration: svàrṇaram antárikṣāṇi rocanā́  dyā́vābhū́mī pr̥thivī́ṃ skambhur ójasā  pr̥kṣā́ iva maháyantaḥ surātáyo  devā́ stavante mánuṣāya sūráyaḥ

translation.text: They with their might have stayed Heaven, Earth, and Pr̥ithivî, the Lord of Light, the firmament, – the lustrous spheres. Even as fleet-foot steeds who make their masters glad, the princely Gods are praised, most bountiful to man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्राय॑ शिक्ष॒ वरु॑णाय दा॒शुषे॒ या स॒म्राजा॒ मन॑सा॒ न प्र॒युच्छ॑तः ययो॒र्धाम॒ धर्म॑णा॒ रोच॑ते बृ॒हद्ययो॑रु॒भे रोद॑सी॒ नाध॑सी॒ वृतौ॑
verses.transliteration: mitrā́ya śikṣa váruṇāya dāśúṣe  yā́ samrā́jā mánasā ná prayúchataḥ  yáyor dhā́ma dhármaṇā rócate br̥hád  yáyor ubhé ródasī nā́dhasī vŕ̥tau

translation.text: Bring gifts to Mitra and to Varuṇa who, Lords of all, in spirit never fail the worshipper, Whose statute shines on high through everlasting Law, whose places of sure refuge are the heavens and earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या गौर्व॑र्त॒निं प॒र्येति॑ निष्कृ॒तं पयो॒ दुहा॑ना व्रत॒नीर॑वा॒रतः॑ सा प्र॑ब्रुवा॒णा वरु॑णाय दा॒शुषे॑ दे॒वेभ्यो॑ दाशद्ध॒विषा॑ वि॒वस्व॑ते
verses.transliteration: yā́ gaúr vartaním paryéti niṣkr̥tám  páyo dúhānā vratanī́r avārátaḥ  sā́ prabruvāṇā́ váruṇāya dāśúṣe  devébhyo dāśad dhavíṣā vivásvate

translation.text: The cow who yielding milk goes her appointed way hither to us as leader of holy rites, Speaking aloud to Varuṇa and the worshipper, shall with oblation serve Vivasvan and the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वक्ष॑सो अग्निजि॒ह्वा ऋ॑ता॒वृध॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ योनिं॑ विमृ॒शन्त॑ आसते द्यां स्क॑भि॒त्व्य१॒॑प आ च॑क्रु॒रोज॑सा य॒ज्ञं ज॑नि॒त्वी त॒न्वी॒३॒॑ नि मा॑मृजुः
verses.transliteration: divákṣaso agnijihvā́ r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ-  r̥tásya yóniṃ vimr̥śánta āsate  dyā́ṃ skabhitvy àpá ā́ cakrur ójasā  yajñáṃ janitvī́ tanvī̀ ní māmr̥juḥ

translation.text: The Gods whose tongue is Agni dwell in heaven, and sit, aiders of Law, reflecting, in the seat of Law. They propped up heaven and then brought waters with their might, got sacrifice and in a body made it fair.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रि॒क्षिता॑ पि॒तरा॑ पूर्व॒जाव॑री ऋ॒तस्य॒ योना॑ क्षयतः॒ समो॑कसा द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वरु॑णाय॒ सव्र॑ते घृ॒तव॒त्पयो॑ महि॒षाय॑ पिन्वतः
verses.transliteration: parikṣítā pitárā pūrvajā́varī  r̥tásya yónā kṣayataḥ sámokasā  dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ váruṇāya sávrate  ghr̥távat páyo mahiṣā́ya pinvataḥ

translation.text: Born in the oldest time, the Parents dwelling round are sharers of one mansion in the home of Law. Bound by their common vow Dyaus, Pr̥ithivî stream forth the moisture rich in oil to Varuṇa the Steer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒र्जन्या॒वाता॑ वृष॒भा पु॑री॒षिणे॑न्द्रवा॒यू वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा दे॒वाँ आ॑दि॒त्याँ अदि॑तिं हवामहे॒ ये पार्थि॑वासो दि॒व्यासो॑ अ॒प्सु ये
verses.transliteration: parjányāvā́tā vr̥ṣabhā́ purīṣíṇā-  -indravāyū́ váruṇo mitró aryamā́  devā́m̐ ādityā́m̐ áditiṃ havāmahe  yé pā́rthivāso divyā́so apsú yé

translation.text: Parjanya, Vâta, mighty, senders of the rain, Indra and Vâyu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman: We call on Aditi, Âdityas, and the Gods, those who are on the earth, in waters, and in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वष्टा॑रं वा॒युमृ॑भवो॒ य ओह॑ते॒ दैव्या॒ होता॑रा उ॒षसं॑ स्व॒स्तये॑ बृह॒स्पतिं॑ वृत्रखा॒दं सु॑मे॒धस॑मिन्द्रि॒यं सोमं॑ धन॒सा उ॑ ईमहे
verses.transliteration: tváṣṭāraṃ vāyúm r̥bhavo yá óhate  daívyā hótārā uṣásaṃ svastáye  bŕ̥haspátiṃ vr̥trakhādáṃ sumedhásam  indriyáṃ sómaṃ dhanasā́ u īmahe

translation.text: Tvashṭar and Vâyu, those who count as R̥ibhus, both celestial Hotar-priests, and Dawn for happiness, Winners of wealth, we call, and wise Br̥ihaspati, destroyer of our foes, and Soma Indra's Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्म॒ गामश्वं॑ ज॒नय॑न्त॒ ओष॑धी॒र्वन॒स्पती॑न्पृथि॒वीं पर्व॑ताँ अ॒पः सूर्यं॑ दि॒वि रो॒हय॑न्तः सु॒दान॑व॒ आर्या॑ व्र॒ता वि॑सृ॒जन्तो॒ अधि॒ क्षमि॑
verses.transliteration: bráhma gā́m áśvaṃ janáyanta óṣadhīr  vánaspátīn pr̥thivī́m párvatām̐ apáḥ  sū́ryaṃ diví roháyantaḥ sudā́navaḥ-  ā́ryā vratā́ visr̥jánto ádhi kṣámi

translation.text: They generated prayer, the cow, the horse, the plants, the forest trees, the earth, the waters, and the hills. These very bounteous Gods made the Sun mount to heaven, and spread the righteous laws of Aryas o'er the land.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भु॒ज्युमंह॑सः पिपृथो॒ निर॑श्विना॒ श्यावं॑ पु॒त्रं व॑ध्रिम॒त्या अ॑जिन्वतम् क॒म॒द्युवं॑ विम॒दायो॑हथुर्यु॒वं वि॑ष्णा॒प्वं१॒॑ विश्व॑का॒याव॑ सृजथः
verses.transliteration: bhujyúm áṃhasaḥ pipr̥tho nír aśvinā  śyā́vam putráṃ vadhrimatyā́ ajinvatam  kamadyúvaṃ vimadā́yohathur yuváṃ  viṣṇāpvàṃ víśvakāyā́va sr̥jathaḥ

translation.text: O Aṣvins, ye delivered Bhujyu from distress, ye animated Ṣyâva, Vadhrimatî's son. To Vimada ye brought his consort Kamadyû, and gave his lost Vishṇâpû back to Viṣvaka.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पावी॑रवी तन्य॒तुरेक॑पाद॒जो दि॒वो ध॒र्ता सिन्धु॒रापः॑ समु॒द्रियः॑ विश्वे॑ दे॒वासः॑ शृणव॒न्वचां॑सि मे॒ सर॑स्वती स॒ह धी॒भिः पुरं॑ध्या
verses.transliteration: pā́vīravī tanyatúr ékapād ajó  divó dhartā́ síndhur ā́paḥ samudríyaḥ  víśve devā́saḥ śr̥ṇavan vácāṃsi me  sárasvatī sahá dhībhíḥ púraṃdhyā

translation.text: Thunder, the lightning's daughter, Aja-Ekapad, heaven's bearer, Sindhu, and the waters of the sea: Hear all the Gods my words, Sarasvatî give ear together with Purandhi and with Holy Thoughts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ दे॒वाः स॒ह धी॒भिः पुरं॑ध्या॒ मनो॒र्यज॑त्रा अ॒मृता॑ ऋत॒ज्ञाः रा॒ति॒षाचो॑ अभि॒षाचः॑ स्व॒र्विदः॒ स्व१॒॑र्गिरो॒ ब्रह्म॑ सू॒क्तं जु॑षेरत
verses.transliteration: víśve devā́ḥ sahá dhībhíḥ púraṃdhyā  mánor yájatrā amŕ̥tā r̥tajñā́ḥ  rātiṣā́co abhiṣā́caḥ svarvídaḥ  svàr gíro bráhma sūktáṃ juṣerata

translation.text: With Holy Thoughts and with Purandhi may all Gods, knowing the Law immortal, Manu's Holy Ones, Boon-givers, favourers, finders of light, and Heaven, with gracious love accept my songs, my prayer, my hymn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वान्वसि॑ष्ठो अ॒मृता॑न्ववन्दे॒ ये विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒भि प्र॑त॒स्थुः ते नो॑ रासन्तामुरुगा॒यम॒द्य यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: devā́n vásiṣṭho amŕ̥tān vavande  yé víśvā bhúvanābhí pratasthúḥ  té no rāsantām urugāyám adyá  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Immortal Gods have I, Vasishṭha, lauded, Gods set on high above all other beings. May they this day grant us wide space and freedom: ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वान्हु॑वे बृ॒हच्छ्र॑वसः स्व॒स्तये॑ ज्योति॒ष्कृतो॑ अध्व॒रस्य॒ प्रचे॑तसः ये वा॑वृ॒धुः प्र॑त॒रं वि॒श्ववे॑दस॒ इन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठासो अ॒मृता॑ ऋता॒वृधः॑
verses.transliteration: devā́n huve br̥hácchravasaḥ svastáye  jyotiṣkŕ̥to adhvarásya prácetasaḥ  yé vāvr̥dhúḥ prataráṃ viśvávedasaḥ-  índrajyeṣṭhāso amŕ̥tā r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ

translation.text: I CALL the Gods of lofty glory for our weal, the makers of the light, well-skilled in sacrifice; Those who have waxen mightily, Masters of all wealth, Immortal, strengthening Law, the Gods whom Indra leads.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑प्रसूता॒ वरु॑णप्रशिष्टा॒ ये सूर्य॑स्य॒ ज्योति॑षो भा॒गमा॑न॒शुः म॒रुद्ग॑णे वृ॒जने॒ मन्म॑ धीमहि॒ माघो॑ने य॒ज्ञं ज॑नयन्त सू॒रयः॑
verses.transliteration: índraprasūtā váruṇapraśiṣṭāḥ-  yé sū́ryasya jyótiṣo bhāgám ānaśúḥ  marúdgaṇe vr̥jáne mánma dhīmahi  mā́ghone yajñáṃ janayanta sūráyaḥ

translation.text: For the strong band of Maruts will we frame a hymn: the chiefs shall bring forth sacrifice for Indra's troop, Who, sent by Indra and advised by Varuṇa, have gotten for themselves a share of Sûrya's light

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ वसु॑भिः॒ परि॑ पातु नो॒ गय॑मादि॒त्यैर्नो॒ अदि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतु रु॒द्रो रु॒द्रेभि॑र्दे॒वो मृ॑ळयाति न॒स्त्वष्टा॑ नो॒ ग्नाभिः॑ सुवि॒ताय॑ जिन्वतु
verses.transliteration: índro vásubhiḥ pári pātu no gáyam  ādityaír no áditiḥ śárma yachatu  rudró rudrébhir devó mr̥ḷayāti nas  tváṣṭā no gnā́bhiḥ suvitā́ya jinvatu

translation.text: May Indra with the Vasus keep our dwelling safe, and Aditi with Âdityas lend us sure defence. May the God Rudra with the Rudras favour us, and Tvashṭar with the Dames further us to success.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदि॑ति॒र्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी ऋ॒तं म॒हदिन्द्रा॒विष्णू॑ म॒रुतः॒ स्व॑र्बृ॒हत् दे॒वाँ आ॑दि॒त्याँ अव॑से हवामहे॒ वसू॑न्रु॒द्रान्त्स॑वि॒तारं॑ सु॒दंस॑सम्
verses.transliteration: áditir dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ r̥tám mahád  índrāvíṣṇū marútaḥ svàr br̥hát  devā́m̐ ādityā́m̐ ávase havāmahe  vásūn rudrā́n savitā́raṃ sudáṃsasam

translation.text: Aditi, Heaven and Earth, the great eternal Law, Indra, Vishṇu, the Maruts, and the lofty Sky. We call upon Âdityas, on the Gods, for help, on Vasus, Rudras, Savitar of wondrous deeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर॑स्वान्धी॒भिर्वरु॑णो धृ॒तव्र॑तः पू॒षा विष्णु॑र्महि॒मा वा॒युर॒श्विना॑ ब्र॒ह्म॒कृतो॑ अ॒मृता॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दसः॒ शर्म॑ नो यंसन्त्रि॒वरू॑थ॒मंह॑सः
verses.transliteration: sárasvān dhībhír váruṇo dhr̥távrataḥ  pūṣā́ víṣṇur mahimā́ vāyúr aśvínā  brahmakŕ̥to amŕ̥tā viśvávedasaḥ  śárma no yaṃsan trivárūtham áṃhasaḥ

translation.text: With Holy Thoughts Sarasvan, firm-lawed Varuṇa, great Vâyu, Pûshan, Vishṇu, and the Aṣvins Twain, Lords of all wealth, Immortal, furtherers of prayer, grant us a triply-guarding refuge from distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॑ य॒ज्ञो वृष॑णः सन्तु य॒ज्ञिया॒ वृष॑णो दे॒वा वृष॑णो हवि॒ष्कृतः॑ वृष॑णा॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी ऋ॒ताव॑री॒ वृषा॑ प॒र्जन्यो॒ वृष॑णो वृष॒स्तुभः॑
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā yajñó vŕ̥ṣaṇaḥ santu yajñíyāḥ-  vŕ̥ṣaṇo devā́ vŕ̥ṣaṇo haviṣkŕ̥taḥ  vŕ̥ṣaṇā dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ r̥tā́varī  vŕ̥ṣā parjányo vŕ̥ṣaṇo vr̥ṣastúbhaḥ

translation.text: Strong be the sacrifice, strong be the Holy Ones, strong the preparers of oblation, strong the Gods. Mighty be Heaven and Earth, true to eternal Law, strong be Parjanya, strong be they who laud the Strong.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्नीषोमा॒ वृष॑णा॒ वाज॑सातये पुरुप्रश॒स्ता वृष॑णा॒ उप॑ ब्रुवे यावी॑जि॒रे वृष॑णो देवय॒ज्यया॒ ता नः॒ शर्म॑ त्रि॒वरू॑थं॒ वि यं॑सतः
verses.transliteration: agnī́ṣómā vŕ̥ṣaṇā vā́jasātaye  purupraśastā́ vŕ̥ṣaṇā úpa bruve  yā́v ījiré vŕ̥ṣaṇo devayajyáyā  tā́ naḥ śárma trivárūthaṃ ví yaṃsataḥ

translation.text: To win us strength I glorify the Mighty Twain, Agni and Soma, Mighty Ones whom many laud. May these vouchsafe us shelter with a triple guard, these whom the strong have served in worship of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धृ॒तव्र॑ताः क्ष॒त्रिया॑ यज्ञनि॒ष्कृतो॑ बृहद्दि॒वा अ॑ध्व॒राणा॑मभि॒श्रियः॑ अ॒ग्निहो॑तार ऋत॒सापो॑ अ॒द्रुहो॒ऽपो अ॑सृज॒न्ननु॑ वृत्र॒तूर्ये॑
verses.transliteration: dhr̥távratāḥ kṣatríyā yajñaniṣkŕ̥to  br̥haddivā́ adhvarā́ṇām abhiśríyaḥ  agníhotāra r̥tasā́po adrúho  -apó asr̥jann ánu vr̥tratū́rye

translation.text: Potent, with firm-fixt laws, arranging sacrifice, visiting solemn rites in splendour of the day, Obeying Order, these whose priest is Agni, free from falsehood, poured the waters out when Vr̥itra died.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी ज॑नयन्न॒भि व्र॒ताप॒ ओष॑धीर्व॒निना॑नि य॒ज्ञिया॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ स्व१॒॑रा प॑प्रुरू॒तये॒ वशं॑ दे॒वास॑स्त॒न्वी॒३॒॑ नि मा॑मृजुः
verses.transliteration: dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ janayann abhí vratā́-  -ā́pa óṣadhīr vanínāni yajñíyā  antárikṣaṃ svàr ā́ paprur ūtáye  váśaṃ devā́sas tanvī̀ ní māmr̥juḥ

translation.text: The Holy Ones engendered, for their several laws, the heavens and earth, the waters, and the plants and trees. They filled the firmament with heavenly light for help: the Gods embodied Wish and made it beautiful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ध॒र्तारो॑ दि॒व ऋ॒भवः॑ सु॒हस्ता॑ वातापर्ज॒न्या म॑हि॒षस्य॑ तन्य॒तोः आप॒ ओष॑धीः॒ प्र ति॑रन्तु नो॒ गिरो॒ भगो॑ रा॒तिर्वा॒जिनो॑ यन्तु मे॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: dhartā́ro divá r̥bhávaḥ suhástāḥ-  vātāparjanyā́ mahiṣásya tanyatóḥ  ā́pa óṣadhīḥ prá tirantu no gíro  bhágo rātír vājíno yantu me hávam

translation.text: May they who bear up heaven, the R̥ibhus deft of hand, and Vâta and Parjanya of the thundering Bull, The waters and the plants, promote the songs we sing: come Bhaga, Rati, and the Vaijns to my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मु॒द्रः सिन्धू॒ रजो॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम॒ज एक॑पात्तनयि॒त्नुर॑र्ण॒वः अहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्यः॑ शृणव॒द्वचां॑सि मे॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वास॑ उ॒त सू॒रयो॒ मम॑
verses.transliteration: samudráḥ síndhū rájo antárikṣam  ajá ékapāt tanayitnúr arṇaváḥ  áhir budhnyàḥ śr̥ṇavad vácāṃsi me  víśve devā́sa utá sūráyo máma

translation.text: Sindhu, the sea, the region, and the firmament, the thunder, and the ocean, Aja-Ekapad, The Dragon of the Deep, shall listen to my words, and all the Deities and Princes shall give ear.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्याम॑ वो॒ मन॑वो दे॒ववी॑तये॒ प्राञ्चं॑ नो य॒ज्ञं प्र ण॑यत साधु॒या आदि॑त्या॒ रुद्रा॒ वस॑वः॒ सुदा॑नव इ॒मा ब्रह्म॑ श॒स्यमा॑नानि जिन्वत
verses.transliteration: syā́ma vo mánavo devávītaye  prā́ñcaṃ no yajñám prá ṇayata sādhuyā́  ā́dityā rúdrā vásavaḥ súdānavaḥ-  imā́ bráhma śasyámānāni jinvata

translation.text: May we, be yours, we men, to entertain the Gods: further our sacrifice and give it full success. Âdityas, Rudras, Vasus, givers of good gifts, quicken the holy hymns which we are singing now

verses.sanskrit_deva: दैव्या॒ होता॑रा प्रथ॒मा पु॒रोहि॑त ऋ॒तस्य॒ पन्था॒मन्वे॑मि साधु॒या क्षेत्र॑स्य॒ पतिं॒ प्रति॑वेशमीमहे॒ विश्वा॑न्दे॒वाँ अ॒मृताँ॒ अप्र॑युच्छतः
verses.transliteration: daívyā hótārā prathamā́ puróhitā-  r̥tásya pánthām ánv emi sādhuyā́  kṣétrasya pátim prátiveśam īmahe  víśvān devā́m̐ amŕ̥tām̐ áprayuchataḥ

translation.text: I follow with success upon the path of Law the two celestial Hotars, Priests of oldest time. We pray to him who dwelleth near, Guard of the Field, to all Immortal Gods who never are remiss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वसि॑ष्ठासः पितृ॒वद्वाच॑मक्रत दे॒वाँ ईळा॑ना ऋषि॒वत्स्व॒स्तये॑ प्री॒ता इ॑व ज्ञा॒तयः॒ काम॒मेत्या॒स्मे दे॑वा॒सोऽव॑ धूनुता॒ वसु॑
verses.transliteration: vásiṣṭhāsaḥ pitr̥vád vā́cam akrata  devā́m̐ ī́ḷānā r̥ṣivát svastáye  prītā́ iva jñātáyaḥ kā́mam étya-  -asmé devāsó 'va dhūnutā vásu

translation.text: Vasishṭha's sons have raised their voices, like their sire. R̥ishi-like praying to the Gods for happiness. Like friendly-minded kinsmen, come at our desire, O Gods, and shake down treasures on us from above.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वान्वसि॑ष्ठो अ॒मृता॑न्ववन्दे॒ ये विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒भि प्र॑त॒स्थुः ते नो॑ रासन्तामुरुगा॒यम॒द्य यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: devā́n vásiṣṭho amŕ̥tān vavande  yé víśvā bhúvanābhí pratasthúḥ  té no rāsantām urugāyám adyá  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Immortal Gods have I, Vasishṭha, lauded, Gods set on high above all other beings. May they this day grant us wide space and freedom: ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां धियं॑ स॒प्तशी॑र्ष्णीं पि॒ता न॑ ऋ॒तप्र॑जातां बृह॒तीम॑विन्दत् तु॒रीयं॑ स्विज्जनयद्वि॒श्वज॑न्यो॒ऽयास्य॑ उ॒क्थमिन्द्रा॑य॒ शंस॑न्
verses.transliteration: imā́ṃ dhíyaṃ saptáśīrṣṇīm pitā́ naḥ-  r̥táprajātām br̥hatī́m avindat  turī́yaṃ svij janayad viśvájanyo  -ayā́sya ukthám índrāya śáṃsan

translation.text: THIS holy hymn, sublime and sevenheaded, sprung from eternal Law, our sire discovered. Ayasya, friend of all men, hath engendered the fourth hymn as he sang his laud to Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तं शंस॑न्त ऋ॒जु दीध्या॑ना दि॒वस्पु॒त्रासो॒ असु॑रस्य वी॒राः विप्रं॑ प॒दमङ्गि॑रसो॒ दधा॑ना य॒ज्ञस्य॒ धाम॑ प्रथ॒मं म॑नन्त
verses.transliteration: r̥táṃ śáṃsanta r̥jú dī́dhyānāḥ-  divás putrā́so ásurasya vīrā́ḥ  vípram padám áṅgiraso dádhānāḥ-  yajñásya dhā́ma prathamám mananta

translation.text: Thinking aright, praising eternal Order, the sons of Dyaus the Asura, those heroes, Angirases, holding the rank of sages, first honoured sacrifice's holy statute.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हं॒सैरि॑व॒ सखि॑भि॒र्वाव॑दद्भिरश्म॒न्मया॑नि॒ नह॑ना॒ व्यस्य॑न् बृह॒स्पति॑रभि॒कनि॑क्रद॒द्गा उ॒त प्रास्तौ॒दुच्च॑ वि॒द्वाँ अ॑गायत्
verses.transliteration: haṃsaír iva sákhibhir vā́vadadbhir  aśmanmáyāni náhanā vyásyan  bŕ̥haspátir abhikánikradad gā́ḥ-  utá prā́staud úc ca vidvā́m̐ agāyat

translation.text: Girt by his friends who cried with swanlike voices, bursting the stony barriers of the prison, Br̥ihaspati spake in thunder to the cattle, and uttered praise and song when he had found them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वो द्वाभ्यां॑ प॒र एक॑या॒ गा गुहा॒ तिष्ठ॑न्ती॒रनृ॑तस्य॒ सेतौ॑ बृह॒स्पति॒स्तम॑सि॒ ज्योति॑रि॒च्छन्नुदु॒स्रा आक॒र्वि हि ति॒स्र आवः॑
verses.transliteration: avó dvā́bhyām pará ékayā gā́ḥ-  gúhā tíṣṭhantīr ánr̥tasya sétau  bŕ̥haspátis támasi jyótir ichánn  úd usrā́ ā́kar ví hí tisrá ā́vaḥ

translation.text: Apart from one, away from two above him, he drave the kine that stood in bonds of falsehood. Br̥ihaspati, seeking light amid the darkness, drave forth the bright cows: three he made apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒भिद्या॒ पुरं॑ श॒यथे॒मपा॑चीं॒ निस्त्रीणि॑ सा॒कमु॑द॒धेर॑कृन्तत् बृह॒स्पति॑रु॒षसं॒ सूर्यं॒ गाम॒र्कं वि॑वेद स्त॒नय॑न्निव॒ द्यौः
verses.transliteration: vibhídyā púraṃ śayáthem ápācīṃ  nís trī́ṇi sākám udadhér akr̥ntat  bŕ̥haspátir uṣásaṃ sū́ryaṃ gā́m  arkáṃ viveda stanáyann iva dyaúḥ

translation.text: When he had cleft the lairs and western castle, he cut off three from him who held the waters. Br̥ihaspati discovered, while he thundered like Dyaus, the dawn, the Sun, the cow, the lightning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ व॒लं र॑क्षि॒तारं॒ दुघा॑नां क॒रेणे॑व॒ वि च॑कर्ता॒ रवे॑ण स्वेदा॑ञ्जिभिरा॒शिर॑मि॒च्छमा॒नोऽरो॑दयत्प॒णिमा गा अ॑मुष्णात्
verses.transliteration: índro valáṃ rakṣitā́raṃ dúghānāṃ  karéṇeva ví cakartā ráveṇa  svédāñjibhir āśíram ichámānaḥ-  -árodayat paṇím ā́ gā́ amuṣṇāt

translation.text: As with a hand, so with his roaring Indra cleft Vala through, the guardian of the cattle. Seeking the milk-draught with sweatshining comrades he stole the Paṇi's kine and left him weeping.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ईं॑ स॒त्येभिः॒ सखि॑भिः शु॒चद्भि॒र्गोधा॑यसं॒ वि ध॑न॒सैर॑दर्दः ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॒र्वृष॑भिर्व॒राहै॑र्घ॒र्मस्वे॑देभि॒र्द्रवि॑णं॒ व्या॑नट्
verses.transliteration: sá īṃ satyébhiḥ sákhibhiḥ śucádbhir  gódhāyasaṃ ví dhanasaír adardaḥ  bráhmaṇas pátir vŕ̥ṣabhir varā́hair  gharmásvedebhir dráviṇaṃ vy ā̀naṭ

translation.text: He with bright faithful Friends, winners of booty, hath rent the milker of the cows asunder. Br̥ihaspati with wild boars strong and mighty, sweating with heat, hath gained a rich possession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते स॒त्येन॒ मन॑सा॒ गोप॑तिं॒ गा इ॑या॒नास॑ इषणयन्त धी॒भिः बृह॒स्पति॑र्मि॒थोअ॑वद्यपेभि॒रुदु॒स्रिया॑ असृजत स्व॒युग्भिः॑
verses.transliteration: té satyéna mánasā gópatiṃ gā́ḥ-  iyānā́sa iṣaṇayanta dhībhíḥ  bŕ̥haspátir mithóavadyapebhir  úd usríyā asr̥jata svayúgbhiḥ

translation.text: They, longing for the kine, with faithful spirit incited with their hymns the Lord of cattle. Br̥ihaspati freed the radiant cows with comrades self-yoked, averting shame from one another.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं व॒र्धय॑न्तो म॒तिभिः॑ शि॒वाभिः॑ सिं॒हमि॑व॒ नान॑दतं स॒धस्थे॑ बृह॒स्पतिं॒ वृष॑णं॒ शूर॑सातौ॒ भरे॑भरे॒ अनु॑ मदेम जि॒ष्णुम्
verses.transliteration: táṃ vardháyanto matíbhiḥ śivā́bhiḥ  siṃhám iva nā́nadataṃ sadhásthe  bŕ̥haspátiṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ śū́rasātau  bháre-bhare ánu madema jiṣṇúm

translation.text: In our assembly with auspicious praises exalting him who roareth like a lion, Maywe, in every fight where heroes conquer, rejoice in strong Br̥ihaspati the Victor.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒दा वाज॒मस॑नद्वि॒श्वरू॑प॒मा द्यामरु॑क्ष॒दुत्त॑राणि॒ सद्म॑ बृह॒स्पतिं॒ वृष॑णं व॒र्धय॑न्तो॒ नाना॒ सन्तो॒ बिभ्र॑तो॒ ज्योति॑रा॒सा
verses.transliteration: yadā́ vā́jam ásanad viśvárūpam  ā́ dyā́m árukṣad úttarāṇi sádma  bŕ̥haspátiṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vardháyanto  nā́nā sánto bíbhrato jyótir āsā́

translation.text: When he had won him every sort of booty and gone to heaven and its most lofty mansions, Men praised Br̥ihaspati the Mighty, bringing the light within their mouths from sundry places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्यामा॒शिषं॑ कृणुता वयो॒धै की॒रिं चि॒द्ध्यव॑थ॒ स्वेभि॒रेवैः॑ प॒श्चा मृधो॒ अप॑ भवन्तु॒ विश्वा॒स्तद्रो॑दसी शृणुतं विश्वमि॒न्वे
verses.transliteration: satyā́m āśíṣaṃ kr̥ṇutā vayodhaí  kīríṃ cid dhy ávatha svébhir évaiḥ  paścā́ mŕ̥dho ápa bhavantu víśvās  tád rodasī śr̥ṇutaṃ viśvaminvé

translation.text: Fulfil the prayer that begs for vital vigour: aid in your wonted manner even the humble. Let all our foes be turned and driven backward. Hear this, O Heaven and Earth, ye All-producers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ म॒ह्ना म॑ह॒तो अ॑र्ण॒वस्य॒ वि मू॒र्धान॑मभिनदर्बु॒दस्य॑ अह॒न्नहि॒मरि॑णात्स॒प्त सिन्धू॑न्दे॒वैर्द्या॑वापृथिवी॒ प्राव॑तं नः
verses.transliteration: índro mahnā́ maható arṇavásya  ví mūrdhā́nam abhinad arbudásya  áhann áhim áriṇāt saptá síndhūn  devaír dyāvāpr̥thivī prā́vataṃ naḥ

translation.text: Indra with mighty strength cleft asunder the head of Arbuda the watery monster, Slain Ahi, and set free the Seven Rivers. O Heaven and Earth, with all the Gods protect us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒द॒प्रुतो॒ न वयो॒ रक्ष॑माणा॒ वाव॑दतो अ॒भ्रिय॑स्येव॒ घोषाः॑ गि॒रि॒भ्रजो॒ नोर्मयो॒ मद॑न्तो॒ बृह॒स्पति॑म॒भ्य१॒॑र्का अ॑नावन्
verses.transliteration: udaprúto ná váyo rákṣamāṇāḥ-  vā́vadato abhríyasyeva ghóṣāḥ  giribhrájo nórmáyo mádanto  bŕ̥haspátim abhy àrkā́ anāvan

translation.text: LIKE birds who keep their watch, plashing in water, like the loud voices of the thundering raincloud, Like merry streamlets bursting from the mountain, thus to Br̥ihaspati our hymns have sounded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं गोभि॑राङ्गिर॒सो नक्ष॑माणो॒ भग॑ इ॒वेद॑र्य॒मणं॑ निनाय जने॑ मि॒त्रो न दम्प॑ती अनक्ति॒ बृह॑स्पते वा॒जया॒शूँरि॑वा॒जौ
verses.transliteration: sáṃ góbhir āṅgirasó nákṣamāṇo  bhága ivéd aryamáṇaṃ nināya  jáne mitró ná dámpatī anakti  bŕ̥haspate vājáyāśū́m̐r ivājaú

translation.text: The Son of Angirases, meeting the cattle, as Bhaga, brought in Aryaman among us. As Friend of men he decks the wife and husband: as for the race, Br̥ihaspati, nerve our coursers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒ध्व॒र्या अ॑ति॒थिनी॑रिषि॒राः स्पा॒र्हाः सु॒वर्णा॑ अनव॒द्यरू॑पाः बृह॒स्पतिः॒ पर्व॑तेभ्यो वि॒तूर्या॒ निर्गा ऊ॑पे॒ यव॑मिव स्थि॒विभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: sādhvaryā́ atithínīr iṣirā́ḥ-  spārhā́ḥ suvárṇā anavadyárūpāḥ  bŕ̥haspátiḥ párvatebhyo vitū́ryā  nír gā́ ūpe yávam iva sthivíbhyaḥ

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati, having won them from the mountains, strewed down, like barley out of winnowingbaskets, The vigorous, wandering cows who aid the pious, desired of all, of blameless form, well-coloured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒प्रु॒षा॒यन्मधु॑न ऋ॒तस्य॒ योनि॑मवक्षि॒पन्न॒र्क उ॒ल्कामि॑व॒ द्योः बृह॒स्पति॑रु॒द्धर॒न्नश्म॑नो॒ गा भूम्या॑ उ॒द्नेव॒ वि त्वचं॑ बिभेद
verses.transliteration: āpruṣāyán mádhuna r̥tásya yónim  avakṣipánn arká ulkā́m iva dyóḥ  bŕ̥haspátir uddhárann áśmano gā́ḥ-  bhū́myā udnéva ví tvácam bibheda

translation.text: As the Sun dews with meath the seat of Order, and casts a flaming meteor down from heaven. So from the rock Br̥ihaspati forced the cattle, and cleft the earth's skin as it were with water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॒ ज्योति॑षा॒ तमो॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षादु॒द्नः शीपा॑लमिव॒ वात॑ आजत् बृह॒स्पति॑रनु॒मृश्या॑ व॒लस्या॒भ्रमि॑व॒ वात॒ आ च॑क्र॒ आ गाः
verses.transliteration: ápa jyótiṣā támo antárikṣād  udnáḥ śī́pālam iva vā́ta ājat  bŕ̥haspátir anumŕ̥śyā valásya-  -abhrám iva vā́ta ā́ cakra ā́ gā́ḥ

translation.text: Forth from mid air with light he drave the darkness, as the gale blows a lily from the river. Like the wind grasping at the cloud of Vala, Br̥ihaspati gathered to himself the cattle,

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒दा व॒लस्य॒ पीय॑तो॒ जसुं॒ भेद्बृह॒स्पति॑रग्नि॒तपो॑भिर॒र्कैः द॒द्भिर्न जि॒ह्वा परि॑विष्ट॒माद॑दा॒विर्नि॒धीँर॑कृणोदु॒स्रिया॑णाम्
verses.transliteration: yadā́ valásya pī́yato jásum bhéd  bŕ̥haspátir agnitápobhir arkaíḥ  dadbhír ná jihvā́ páriviṣṭam ā́dad  āvír nidhī́m̐r akr̥ṇod usríyāṇām

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati, when he with fiery lightnings cleft through the weapon of reviling Vala, Consumed.him as tongues cat what teeth have compassed: he threw the prisons of the red cows open.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॒स्पति॒रम॑त॒ हि त्यदा॑सां॒ नाम॑ स्व॒रीणां॒ सद॑ने॒ गुहा॒ यत् आ॒ण्डेव॑ भि॒त्त्वा श॑कु॒नस्य॒ गर्भ॒मुदु॒स्रियाः॒ पर्व॑तस्य॒ त्मना॑जत्
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspátir ámata hí tyád āsāṃ  nā́ma svarī́ṇāṃ sádane gúhā yát  āṇḍéva bhittvā́ śakunásya gárbham  úd usríyāḥ párvatasya tmánājat

translation.text: That secret name borne by the lowing cattle within the cave Br̥ihaspati discovered, And drave, himself, the bright kine from the mountain, like a bird's young after the egg's disclosure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्नापि॑नद्धं॒ मधु॒ पर्य॑पश्य॒न्मत्स्यं॒ न दी॒न उ॒दनि॑ क्षि॒यन्त॑म् निष्टज्ज॑भार चम॒सं न वृ॒क्षाद्बृह॒स्पति॑र्विर॒वेणा॑ वि॒कृत्य॑
verses.transliteration: áśnā́pinaddham mádhu páry apaśyat-  mátsyaṃ ná dīná udáni kṣiyántam  níṣ ṭáj jabhāra camasáṃ ná vr̥kṣā́d  bŕ̥haspátir viravéṇā vikŕ̥tya

translation.text: He looked around on rock-imprisoned sweetness as one who eyes a fish in scanty water. Br̥ihaspati, cleaving through with varied clamour, brought it forth like a bowl from out the timber.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोषाम॑विन्द॒त्स स्व१॒॑ः सो अ॒ग्निं सो अ॒र्केण॒ वि ब॑बाधे॒ तमां॑सि बृह॒स्पति॒र्गोव॑पुषो व॒लस्य॒ निर्म॒ज्जानं॒ न पर्व॑णो जभार
verses.transliteration: sóṣā́m avindat sá svàḥ só agníṃ  só arkéṇa ví babādhe támāṃsi  bŕ̥haspátir góvapuṣo valásya  nír majjā́naṃ ná párvaṇo jabhāra

translation.text: He found the light of heaven, and fire, and Morning: with lucid rays he forced apart the darkness. As from a joint, Br̥ihaspati took the marrow of Vala as he gloried in his cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒मेव॑ प॒र्णा मु॑षि॒ता वना॑नि॒ बृह॒स्पति॑नाकृपयद्व॒लो गाः अ॒ना॒नु॒कृ॒त्यम॑पु॒नश्च॑कार॒ यात्सूर्या॒मासा॑ मि॒थ उ॒च्चरा॑तः
verses.transliteration: himéva parṇā́ muṣitā́ vánāni  bŕ̥haspátinākr̥payad való gā́ḥ  anānukr̥tyám apunáś cakāra  yā́t sū́ryāmā́sā mithá uccárātaḥ

translation.text: As trees for foliage robbed by winter, Vala mourned for the cows Br̥ihaspati had taken. He did a deed ne'er done, ne'er to be equalled, whereby the Sun and Moon ascend alternate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि श्या॒वं न कृश॑नेभि॒रश्वं॒ नक्ष॑त्रेभिः पि॒तरो॒ द्याम॑पिंशन् रात्र्यां॒ तमो॒ अद॑धु॒र्ज्योति॒रह॒न्बृह॒स्पति॑र्भि॒नदद्रिं॑ वि॒दद्गाः
verses.transliteration: abhí śyāváṃ ná kŕ̥śanebhir áśvaṃ  nákṣatrebhiḥ pitáro dyā́m apiṃśan  rā́tryāṃ támo ádadhur jyótir áhan  bŕ̥haspátir bhinád ádriṃ vidád gā́ḥ

translation.text: Like a dark steed adorned with pearl, the Fathers have decorated heaven With constellations. They set the light in day, in night the darkness. Br̥ihaspati cleft the rock and found the cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दम॑कर्म॒ नमो॑ अभ्रि॒याय॒ यः पू॒र्वीरन्वा॒नोन॑वीति बृह॒स्पतिः॒ स हि गोभिः॒ सो अश्वैः॒ स वी॒रेभिः॒ स नृभि॑र्नो॒ वयो॑ धात्
verses.transliteration: idám akarma námo abhriyā́ya  yáḥ pūrvī́r ánv ānónavīti  bŕ̥haspátiḥ sá hí góbhiḥ só áśvaiḥ  sá vīrébhiḥ sá nŕ̥bhir no váyo dhāt

translation.text: This homage have we.offered to the Cloud God who thunders out to many in succession. May this Br̥ihaspati vouchsafe us fulness of life with kine and horses, men, and heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रा अ॒ग्नेर्व॑ध्र्य॒श्वस्य॑ सं॒दृशो॑ वा॒मी प्रणी॑तिः सु॒रणा॒ उपे॑तयः यदीं॑ सुमि॒त्रा विशो॒ अग्र॑ इ॒न्धते॑ घृ॒तेनाहु॑तो जरते॒ दवि॑द्युतत्
verses.transliteration: bhadrā́ agnér vadhryaśvásya saṃdŕ̥śo  vāmī́ práṇītiḥ suráṇā úpetayaḥ  yád īṃ sumitrā́ víśo ágra indháte  ghr̥ténā́huto jarate dávidyutat

translation.text: Auspicious is the aspect of Vadhryaṣva's fire good is its guidance, pleasant are its visitings. When first the people Of Sumitra kindle it, with butter poured thercon it crackles and shines bright.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒तम॒ग्नेर्व॑ध्र्य॒श्वस्य॒ वर्ध॑नं घृ॒तमन्नं॑ घृ॒तम्व॑स्य॒ मेद॑नम् घृ॒तेनाहु॑त उर्वि॒या वि प॑प्रथे॒ सूर्य॑ इव रोचते स॒र्पिरा॑सुतिः
verses.transliteration: ghr̥tám agnér vadhryaśvásya várdhanaṃ  ghr̥tám ánnaṃ ghr̥tám v asya médanam  ghr̥ténā́huta urviyā́ ví paprathe  sū́rya iva rocate sarpírāsutiḥ

translation.text: Butter is that which makes Vadhryaṣva's fire growstrong: the butter is its food, the butter makes it fat. It spreads abroad when butter hath been offered it, and balmed with streams of butter shines forth like the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ मनु॒र्यदनी॑कं सुमि॒त्रः स॑मी॒धे अ॑ग्ने॒ तदि॒दं नवी॑यः स रे॒वच्छो॑च॒ स गिरो॑ जुषस्व॒ स वाजं॑ दर्षि॒ स इ॒ह श्रवो॑ धाः
verses.transliteration: yát te mánur yád ánīkaṃ sumitráḥ  samīdhé agne tád idáṃ návīyaḥ  sá revác choca sá gíro juṣasva  sá vā́jaṃ darṣi sá ihá śrávo dhāḥ

translation.text: Still newest is this face of thine, O Agni, which Manu and Sumitra have enkindled. So richly shine, accept our songs with favour, so give us strengthening food, so send us glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्वा॒ पूर्व॑मीळि॒तो व॑ध्र्य॒श्वः स॑मी॒धे अ॑ग्ने॒ स इ॒दं जु॑षस्व स नः॑ स्ति॒पा उ॒त भ॑वा तनू॒पा दा॒त्रं र॑क्षस्व॒ यदि॒दं ते॑ अ॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: yáṃ tvā pū́rvam īḷitó vadhryaśváḥ  samīdhé agne sá idáṃ juṣasva  sá na stipā́ utá bhavā tanūpā́ḥ-  dātráṃ rakṣasva yád idáṃ te asmé

translation.text: Accept this offering, Agni, whom aforetime Vadhryaṣva, hath entreated and enkindled. Guard well our homes and ople, guard our bodies, protect thy girt to us which thou hast granted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भवा॑ द्यु॒म्नी वा॑ध्र्यश्वो॒त गो॒पा मा त्वा॑ तारीद॒भिमा॑ति॒र्जना॑नाम् शूर॑ इव धृ॒ष्णुश्च्यव॑नः सुमि॒त्रः प्र नु वो॑चं॒ वाध्र्य॑श्वस्य॒ नाम॑
verses.transliteration: bhávā dyumnī́ vādhryaśvotá gopā́ḥ-  mā́ tvā tārīd abhímātir jánānām  śū́ra iva dhr̥ṣṇúś cyávanaḥ sumitráḥ  prá nú vocaṃ vā́dhryaśvasya nā́ma

translation.text: Be splendid, guard us Kinsman of Vadhryaṣva: let not the enmity of men o'ercome thee, Like the bold hero Chyavâna, I Sumitra tell forth the title of Vadhryaṣva's Kinsman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॒ज्र्या॑ पर्व॒त्या॒३॒॑ वसू॑नि॒ दासा॑ वृ॒त्राण्यार्या॑ जिगेथ शूर॑ इव धृ॒ष्णुश्च्यव॑नो॒ जना॑नां॒ त्वम॑ग्ने पृतना॒यूँर॒भि ष्याः॑
verses.transliteration: sám ajryā̀ parvatyā̀ vásūni  dā́sā vr̥trā́ṇy ā́ryā jigetha  śū́ra iva dhr̥ṣṇúś cyávano jánānāṃ  tvám agne pr̥tanāyū́m̐r abhí ṣyāḥ

translation.text: All treasures hast thou won, of plains and mountains, and quelled the Dâsas' and Aryas' hatred. Like the bold hero Chyavâna, O Agni, mayst thou subdue the men who long for battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दी॒र्घत॑न्तुर्बृ॒हदु॑क्षा॒यम॒ग्निः स॒हस्र॑स्तरीः श॒तनी॑थ॒ ऋभ्वा॑ द्यु॒मान्द्यु॒मत्सु॒ नृभि॑र्मृ॒ज्यमा॑नः सुमि॒त्रेषु॑ दीदयो देव॒यत्सु॑
verses.transliteration: dīrghátantur br̥hádukṣāyám agníḥ  sahásrastarīḥ śatánītha ŕ̥bhvā  dyumā́n dyumátsu nŕ̥bhir mr̥jyámānaḥ  sumitréṣu dīdayo devayátsu

translation.text: Deft Agni hath a lengthened thread, tall oxen, a thousand heifers, numberless devices. Decked by the men, splendid among the splendid, shine brightly forth amid devout Sumitras.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे धे॒नुः सु॒दुघा॑ जातवेदोऽस॒श्चते॑व सम॒ना स॑ब॒र्धुक् त्वं नृभि॒र्दक्षि॑णावद्भिरग्ने सुमि॒त्रेभि॑रिध्यसे देव॒यद्भिः॑
verses.transliteration: tvé dhenúḥ sudúghā jātavedo  -asaścáteva samanā́ sabardhúk  tváṃ nŕ̥bhir dákṣiṇāvadbhir agne  sumitrébhir idhyase devayádbhiḥ

translation.text: Thine is the teeming cow, O Jâtavedas, who pours at once her ceaseless flow, Sabardhuk, Thou. art lit up by men enriched with guerdon, O Agni, by the pious-souled Sumitras.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वाश्चि॑त्ते अ॒मृता॑ जातवेदो महि॒मानं॑ वाध्र्यश्व॒ प्र वो॑चन् यत्स॒म्पृच्छं॒ मानु॑षी॒र्विश॒ आय॒न्त्वं नृभि॑रजय॒स्त्वावृ॑धेभिः
verses.transliteration: devā́ś cit te amŕ̥tā jātavedo  mahimā́naṃ vādhryaśva prá vocan  yát sampŕ̥cham mā́nuṣīr víśa ā́yan  tváṃ nŕ̥bhir ajayas tvā́vr̥dhebhiḥ

translation.text: Even Immortal Gods, O Jâtavedas, Vadhryaṣva's Kinsman, have declared thy grandeur. When human tribes drew near with supplication thou conqueredst with men whom thou hadst strengthened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒तेव॑ पु॒त्रम॑बिभरु॒पस्थे॒ त्वाम॑ग्ने वध्र्य॒श्वः स॑प॒र्यन् जु॒षा॒णो अ॑स्य स॒मिधं॑ यविष्ठो॒त पूर्वाँ॑ अवनो॒र्व्राध॑तश्चित्
verses.transliteration: pitéva putrám abibhar upásthe  tvā́m agne vadhryaśváḥ saparyán  juṣāṇó asya samídhaṃ yaviṣṭha-  -utá pū́rvām̐ avanor vrā́dhataś cit

translation.text: Like as a father bears his son, O Agni, Vadhryaṣva bare thee in his lap and served thee. Thou, Youngest God, having enjoyed his fuel, didst vanquish those of old though they were mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शश्व॑द॒ग्निर्व॑ध्र्य॒श्वस्य॒ शत्रू॒न्नृभि॑र्जिगाय सु॒तसो॑मवद्भिः सम॑नं चिददहश्चित्रभा॒नोऽव॒ व्राध॑न्तमभिनद्वृ॒धश्चि॑त्
verses.transliteration: śáśvad agnír vadhryaśvásya śátrūn  nŕ̥bhir jigāya sutásomavadbhiḥ  sámanaṃ cid adahaś citrabhāno-  -áva vrā́dhantam abhinad vr̥dháś cit

translation.text: Vadhryaṣva's Agni evermore hath vanquished his foes with heroes who had pressed the Soma. Lord of bright rays, thou burntest up the battle, subduing, as our help, e'en mighty foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यम॒ग्निर्व॑ध्र्य॒श्वस्य॑ वृत्र॒हा स॑न॒कात्प्रेद्धो॒ नम॑सोपवा॒क्यः॑ स नो॒ अजा॑मीँरु॒त वा॒ विजा॑मीन॒भि ति॑ष्ठ॒ शर्ध॑तो वाध्र्यश्व
verses.transliteration: ayám agnír vadhryaśvásya vr̥trahā́  sanakā́t préddho námasopavākyàḥ  sá no ájāmīm̐r utá vā víjāmīn  abhí tiṣṭha śárdhato vādhryaśva

translation.text: This Agni of Vadhryaṣva, Vr̥itra-slayer, lit from of old, must be invoked with homage. As such assail our enemies, Vadhryaṣva, whether the foes be strangers or be kinsmen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां मे॑ अग्ने स॒मिधं॑ जुषस्वे॒ळस्प॒दे प्रति॑ हर्या घृ॒ताची॑म् वर्ष्म॑न्पृथि॒व्याः सु॑दिन॒त्वे अह्ना॑मू॒र्ध्वो भ॑व सुक्रतो देवय॒ज्या
verses.transliteration: imā́m me agne samídhaṃ juṣasva-  -iḷás padé práti haryā ghr̥tā́cīm  várṣman pr̥thivyā́ḥ sudinatvé áhnām  ūrdhvó bhava sukrato devayajyā́

translation.text: ENJOY, O Agni, this my Fuel, welcome the oil-filled ladle where we pour libation. Rise up for worship of the Gods, wise Agni, on the earth's height, while days are bright with beauty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ दे॒वाना॑मग्र॒यावे॒ह या॑तु॒ नरा॒शंसो॑ वि॒श्वरू॑पेभि॒रश्वैः॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒था नम॑सा मि॒येधो॑ दे॒वेभ्यो॑ दे॒वत॑मः सुषूदत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ devā́nām agrayā́vehá yātu  nárāśáṃso viśvárūpebhir áśvaiḥ  r̥tásya pathā́ námasā miyédho  devébhyo devátamaḥ suṣūdat

translation.text: May he who goes before the Gods come hither with steeds whose shapes are varied, Narasarhsa. May he, most Godlike, speed our offered viands with homage God-ward on the path of Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒श्व॒त्त॒ममी॑ळते दू॒त्या॑य ह॒विष्म॑न्तो मनु॒ष्या॑सो अ॒ग्निम् वहि॑ष्ठै॒रश्वैः॑ सु॒वृता॒ रथे॒ना दे॒वान्व॑क्षि॒ नि ष॑दे॒ह होता॑
verses.transliteration: śaśvattamám īḷate dūtyā̀ya  havíṣmanto manuṣyā̀so agním  váhiṣṭhair áśvaiḥ suvŕ̥tā ráthena-  -ā́ devā́n vakṣi ní ṣadehá hótā

translation.text: Men with oblations laud most constant Agni, and pray him to perform an envoy's duty. With lightly-rolling car and best draught-horses, bring the Gods hither and sit down as Hotar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि प्र॑थतां दे॒वजु॑ष्टं तिर॒श्चा दी॒र्घं द्रा॒घ्मा सु॑र॒भि भू॑त्व॒स्मे अहे॑ळता॒ मन॑सा देव बर्हि॒रिन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठाँ उश॒तो य॑क्षि दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: ví prathatāṃ devájuṣṭaṃ tiraścā́  dīrgháṃ drāghmā́ surabhí bhūtv asmé  áheḷatā mánasā deva barhir  índrajyeṣṭhām̐ uśató yakṣi devā́n

translation.text: May the delight of Gods spread out transversely: may it be with us long in length and fragrant. O Holy Grass divine, with friendly spirit bring thou the willing Gods whose Chief is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो वा॒ सानु॑ स्पृ॒शता॒ वरी॑यः पृथि॒व्या वा॒ मात्र॑या॒ वि श्र॑यध्वम् उ॒श॒तीर्द्वा॑रो महि॒ना म॒हद्भि॑र्दे॒वं रथं॑ रथ॒युर्धा॑रयध्वम्
verses.transliteration: divó vā sā́nu spr̥śátā várīyaḥ  pr̥thivyā́ vā mā́trayā ví śrayadhvam  uśatī́r dvāro mahinā́ mahádbhir  deváṃ ráthaṃ rathayúr dhārayadhvam

translation.text: Touch ye the far-extending height of heaven or spring apart to suit the wide earth's measure. Yearning, ye Doors, with those sublime in greatness, seize eagerly the heavenly Car that cometh.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वी दि॒वो दु॑हि॒तरा॑ सुशि॒ल्पे उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ सदतां॒ नि योनौ॑ आ वां॑ दे॒वास॑ उशती उ॒शन्त॑ उ॒रौ सी॑दन्तु सुभगे उ॒पस्थे॑
verses.transliteration: devī́ divó duhitárā suśilpé  uṣā́sānáktā sadatāṃ ní yónau  ā́ vāṃ devā́sa uśatī uśántaḥ-  uraú sīdantu subhage upásthe

translation.text: Here in this shrine may Dawn and Night, the Daughters of Heaven, the skilful Goddesses, be seated. In your wide lap, auspicious, willing Ladies may the Gods seat them with a willing spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वो ग्रावा॑ बृ॒हद॒ग्निः समि॑द्धः प्रि॒या धामा॒न्यदि॑तेरु॒पस्थे॑ पु॒रोहि॑तावृत्विजा य॒ज्ञे अ॒स्मिन्वि॒दुष्ट॑रा॒ द्रवि॑ण॒मा य॑जेथाम्
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvó grā́vā br̥hád agníḥ sámiddhaḥ  priyā́ dhā́māny áditer upásthe  puróhitāv r̥tvijā yajñé asmín  vidúṣṭarā dráviṇam ā́ yajethām

translation.text: Up stands the stone, high burns the fire enkindled: Aditi's lap contains the Friendly Natures Ye Two Chief Priests who serve at this our worship, may ye, more skilled, win for us rich possessions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तिस्रो॑ देवीर्ब॒र्हिरि॒दं वरी॑य॒ आ सी॑दत चकृ॒मा वः॑ स्यो॒नम् म॒नु॒ष्वद्य॒ज्ञं सुधि॑ता ह॒वींषीळा॑ दे॒वी घृ॒तप॑दी जुषन्त
verses.transliteration: tísro devīr barhír idáṃ várīyaḥ-  ā́ sīdata cakr̥mā́ vaḥ syonám  manuṣvád yajñáṃ súdhitā havī́ṃṣi-  -íḷā devī́ ghr̥tápadī juṣanta

translation.text: On our wide grass, Three Goddesses be seated: for you have we prepared and made it pleasant. May Iḷâ, she whose foot drops oil, the Goddess, taste, man-like, sacrifice and well-set presents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: देव॑ त्वष्ट॒र्यद्ध॑ चारु॒त्वमान॒ड्यदङ्गि॑रसा॒मभ॑वः सचा॒भूः स दे॒वानां॒ पाथ॒ उप॒ प्र वि॒द्वाँ उ॒शन्य॑क्षि द्रविणोदः सु॒रत्नः॑
verses.transliteration: déva tvaṣṭar yád dha cārutvám ā́naḍ  yád áṅgirasām ábhavaḥ sacābhū́ḥ  sá devā́nām pā́tha úpa prá vidvā́m̐  uśán yakṣi draviṇodaḥ surátnaḥ

translation.text: Since thou, God Tvashṭar, hast made beauty perfect, since hou hast been the Angirases' Companion, Willing, most wealthy, Giver of possessions, grant us the Gods' assembly, thou who knowest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वन॑स्पते रश॒नया॑ नि॒यूया॑ दे॒वानां॒ पाथ॒ उप॑ वक्षि वि॒द्वान् स्वदा॑ति दे॒वः कृ॒णव॑द्ध॒वींष्यव॑तां॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी हवं॑ मे
verses.transliteration: vánaspate raśanáyā niyū́yā  devā́nām pā́tha úpa vakṣi vidvā́n  svádāti deváḥ kr̥ṇávad dhavī́ṃṣi-  ávatāṃ dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ hávam me

translation.text: Well-knowing, binding with thy cord, bring hither, Lord of the Wood, the Deities' assembly. The God prepare and season our oblations may Heaven and Earth be gracious to my calling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आग्ने॑ वह॒ वरु॑णमि॒ष्टये॑ न॒ इन्द्रं॑ दि॒वो म॒रुतो॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षात् सीद॑न्तु ब॒र्हिर्विश्व॒ आ यज॑त्राः॒ स्वाहा॑ दे॒वा अ॒मृता॑ मादयन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: ā́gne vaha váruṇam iṣṭáye naḥ-  índraṃ divó marúto antárikṣāt  sī́dantu barhír víśva ā́ yájatrāḥ  svā́hā devā́ amŕ̥tā mādayantām

translation.text: Agni, bring hither Varuṇa to help us, Indra from heaven, from air's mid-realm the Maruts. On sacred grass all Holy ones be seated and let the Immortal Gods rejoice in Svâhâ.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॑स्पते प्रथ॒मं वा॒चो अग्रं॒ यत्प्रैर॑त नाम॒धेयं॒ दधा॑नाः यदे॑षां॒ श्रेष्ठं॒ यद॑रि॒प्रमासी॑त्प्रे॒णा तदे॑षां॒ निहि॑तं॒ गुहा॒विः
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate prathamáṃ vācó ágraṃ  yát praírata nāmadhéyaṃ dádhānāḥ  yád eṣāṃ śréṣṭhaṃ yád ariprám ā́sīt  preṇā́ tád eṣāṃ níhitaṃ gúhāvíḥ

translation.text: WHEN-men, Br̥ihaspati, giving names to objects, sent out Vâk's first and earliest utterances, All that was excellent and spotless, treasured within them, was disclosed through their affection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सक्तु॑मिव॒ तित॑उना पु॒नन्तो॒ यत्र॒ धीरा॒ मन॑सा॒ वाच॒मक्र॑त अत्रा॒ सखा॑यः स॒ख्यानि॑ जानते भ॒द्रैषां॑ ल॒क्ष्मीर्निहि॒ताधि॑ वा॒चि
verses.transliteration: sáktum iva títa:unā punánto  yátra dhī́rā mánasā vā́cam ákrata  átrā sákhāyaḥ sakhyā́ni jānate  bhadraíṣāṃ lakṣmī́r níhitā́dhi vācí

translation.text: Where, like men cleansing corn-flour in a cribble, the wise in spirit have created language, Friends see and recognize the marks of friendship: their speech retains the blessed sign imprinted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञेन॑ वा॒चः प॑द॒वीय॑माय॒न्तामन्व॑विन्द॒न्नृषि॑षु॒ प्रवि॑ष्टाम् तामा॒भृत्या॒ व्य॑दधुः पुरु॒त्रा तां स॒प्त रे॒भा अ॒भि सं न॑वन्ते
verses.transliteration: yajñéna vācáḥ padavī́yam āyan  tā́m ánv avindann ŕ̥ṣiṣu práviṣṭām  tā́m ābhŕ̥tyā vy àdadhuḥ purutrā́  tā́ṃ saptá rebhā́ abhí sáṃ navante

translation.text: With sacrifice the trace of Vâk they foIlowed, and found her harbouring within the R̥ishis. They brought her, dealt her forth in many places: seven singers make her tones resound in concert.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्वः॒ पश्य॒न्न द॑दर्श॒ वाच॑मु॒त त्वः॑ शृ॒ण्वन्न शृ॑णोत्येनाम् उ॒तो त्व॑स्मै त॒न्वं१॒॑ वि स॑स्रे जा॒येव॒ पत्य॑ उश॒ती सु॒वासाः॑
verses.transliteration: utá tvaḥ páśyan ná dadarśa vā́cam  utá tvaḥ śr̥ṇván ná śr̥ṇoty enām  utó tvasmai tanvàṃ ví sasre  jāyéva pátya uśatī́ suvā́sāḥ-

translation.text: One man hath ne'er seen Vâk, and yet he seeth: one man hath hearing but hath never heard her. But to another hath she shown her beauty as a fond well-dressed woman to her husband.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्वं॑ स॒ख्ये स्थि॒रपी॑तमाहु॒र्नैनं॑ हिन्व॒न्त्यपि॒ वाजि॑नेषु अधे॑न्वा चरति मा॒ययै॒ष वाचं॑ शुश्रु॒वाँ अ॑फ॒लाम॑पु॒ष्पाम्
verses.transliteration: utá tvaṃ sakhyé sthirápītam āhur  naínaṃ hinvanty ápi vā́jineṣu  ádhenvā carati māyáyaiṣá  vā́caṃ śuśruvā́m̐ aphalā́m apuṣpā́m

translation.text: One man they call a laggard, dull in friendship: they never urge him on to deeds of valour. He wanders on in profitless illusion: the Voice he heard yields neither fruit,nor blossom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ति॒त्याज॑ सचि॒विदं॒ सखा॑यं॒ न तस्य॑ वा॒च्यपि॑ भा॒गो अ॑स्ति यदीं॑ शृ॒णोत्यल॑कं शृणोति न॒हि प्र॒वेद॑ सुकृ॒तस्य॒ पन्था॑म्
verses.transliteration: yás tityā́ja sacivídaṃ sákhāyaṃ  ná tásya vācy ápi bhāgó asti  yád īṃ śr̥ṇóty álakaṃ śr̥ṇoti  nahí pravéda sukr̥tásya pánthām

translation.text: No part in Vâk hath he who hath abandoned his own dear friend who knows the truth of friendship. Even if he hears her still in vain he listens: naught knows he of the path of righteous action.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒क्ष॒ण्वन्तः॒ कर्ण॑वन्तः॒ सखा॑यो मनोज॒वेष्वस॑मा बभूवुः आ॒द॒घ्नास॑ उपक॒क्षास॑ उ त्वे ह्र॒दा इ॑व॒ स्नात्वा॑ उ त्वे ददृश्रे
verses.transliteration: akṣaṇvántaḥ kárṇavantaḥ sákhāyo  manojavéṣv ásamā babhūvuḥ  ādaghnā́sa upakakṣā́sa u tve  hradā́ iva snā́tvā u tve dadr̥śre

translation.text: Unequal in the quickness of their spirit are friends endowed alike with eyes and hearing. Some look like tanks that reach the mouth or shoulder, others like pools of water fit to bathe in.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हृ॒दा त॒ष्टेषु॒ मन॑सो ज॒वेषु॒ यद्ब्रा॑ह्म॒णाः सं॒यज॑न्ते॒ सखा॑यः अत्राह॑ त्वं॒ वि ज॑हुर्वे॒द्याभि॒रोह॑ब्रह्माणो॒ वि च॑रन्त्यु त्वे
verses.transliteration: hr̥dā́ taṣṭéṣu mánaso javéṣu  yád brāhmaṇā́ḥ saṃyájante sákhāyaḥ  átrā́ha tvaṃ ví jahur vedyā́bhir  óhabrahmāṇo ví caranty u tve

translation.text: When friendly Brahmans sacrifice together with mental impulse which the heart hath fashioned, They leave one far behind through their attainments, and some who count as Brahmans wander elsewhere.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे ये नार्वाङ्न प॒रश्चर॑न्ति॒ न ब्रा॑ह्म॒णासो॒ न सु॒तेक॑रासः त ए॒ते वाच॑मभि॒पद्य॑ पा॒पया॑ सि॒रीस्तन्त्रं॑ तन्वते॒ अप्र॑जज्ञयः
verses.transliteration: imé yé nā́rvā́ṅ ná paráś cáranti  ná brāhmaṇā́so ná sutékarāsaḥ  tá eté vā́cam abhipádya pāpáyā  sirī́s tántraṃ tanvate áprajajñayaḥ

translation.text: Those men who step not back and move not forward, nor Brahmans nor preparers of libations, Having attained to Vâk in sinful fashion spin out their thread in ignorance like spinsters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर्वे॑ नन्दन्ति य॒शसाग॑तेन सभासा॒हेन॒ सख्या॒ सखा॑यः कि॒ल्बि॒ष॒स्पृत्पि॑तु॒षणि॒र्ह्ये॑षा॒मरं॑ हि॒तो भव॑ति॒ वाजि॑नाय
verses.transliteration: sárve nandanti yaśásā́gatena  sabhāsāhéna sákhyā sákhāyaḥ  kilbiṣaspŕ̥t pituṣáṇir hy èṣām  áraṃ hitó bhávati vā́jināya

translation.text: All friends are joyful in the friend who cometh in triumph, having conquered in assembly. He is their blame-averter, food-provider prepared is he and fit for deed of vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒चां त्वः॒ पोष॑मास्ते पुपु॒ष्वान्गा॑य॒त्रं त्वो॑ गायति॒ शक्व॑रीषु ब्र॒ह्मा त्वो॒ वद॑ति जातवि॒द्यां य॒ज्ञस्य॒ मात्रां॒ वि मि॑मीत उ त्वः
verses.transliteration: r̥cā́ṃ tvaḥ póṣam āste pupuṣvā́n  gāyatráṃ tvo gāyati śákvarīṣu  brahmā́ tvo vádati jātavidyā́ṃ  yajñásya mā́trāṃ ví mimīta u tvaḥ

translation.text: One plies his constant task reciting verses. one sings the holy psalm in Ṣakvarî measures. One more, the Brahman, tells the lore of being, and one lays down the rules of sacrificing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वानां॒ नु व॒यं जाना॒ प्र वो॑चाम विप॒न्यया॑ उ॒क्थेषु॑ श॒स्यमा॑नेषु॒ यः पश्या॒दुत्त॑रे यु॒गे
verses.transliteration: devā́nāṃ nú vayáṃ jā́nā  prá vocāma vipanyáyā  ukthéṣu śasyámāneṣu  yáḥ páśyād úttare yugé

translation.text: LET US with tuneful skill proclaim these generations of the Gods, That one may see them when these hymns are chanted in a future age.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॑रे॒ता सं क॒र्मार॑ इवाधमत् दे॒वानां॑ पू॒र्व्ये यु॒गेऽस॑तः॒ सद॑जायत
verses.transliteration: bráhmaṇas pátir etā́  sáṃ karmā́ra ivādhamat  devā́nām pūrvyé yugé  -ásataḥ sád ajāyata

translation.text: These Brahmaṇaspati produced with blast and smelting, like a Smith, Existence, in an earlier age of Gods, from Non-existence sprang.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वानां॑ यु॒गे प्र॑थ॒मेऽस॑तः॒ सद॑जायत तदाशा॒ अन्व॑जायन्त॒ तदु॑त्ता॒नप॑द॒स्परि॑
verses.transliteration: devā́nāṃ yugé prathamé  -ásataḥ sád ajāyata  tád ā́śā ánv ajāyanta  tád uttānápadas pári

translation.text: Existence, in the earliest age of Gods, from Non-existence sprang. Thereafter were the regions born. This sprang from the Productive Power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूर्ज॑ज्ञ उत्ता॒नप॑दो भु॒व आशा॑ अजायन्त अदि॑ते॒र्दक्षो॑ अजायत॒ दक्षा॒द्वदि॑तिः॒ परि॑
verses.transliteration: bhū́r jajña uttānápado  bhuvá ā́śā ajāyanta  áditer dákṣo ajāyata  dákṣād v áditiḥ pári

translation.text: Earth sprang from the Productive Power the regions from the earth were born. Daksha was born of Aditi, and Aditi was Daksha's Child.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदि॑ति॒र्ह्यज॑निष्ट॒ दक्ष॒ या दु॑हि॒ता तव॑ तां दे॒वा अन्व॑जायन्त भ॒द्रा अ॒मृत॑बन्धवः
verses.transliteration: áditir hy ájaniṣṭa  dákṣa yā́ duhitā́ táva  tā́ṃ devā́ ánv ajāyanta  bhadrā́ amŕ̥tabandhavaḥ

translation.text: For Aditi, O Daksha, she who is thy Daughter, was brought forth. After her were the blessed Gods born sharers of immortal life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्दे॑वा अ॒दः स॑लि॒ले सुसं॑रब्धा॒ अति॑ष्ठत अत्रा॑ वो॒ नृत्य॑तामिव ती॒व्रो रे॒णुरपा॑यत
verses.transliteration: yád devā adáḥ salilé  súsaṃrabdhā átiṣṭhata  átrā vo nŕ̥tyatām iva  tīvró reṇúr ápāyata

translation.text: When ye, O Gods, in yonder deep closeclasping one another stood, Thence, as of dancers, from your feet a thickening cloud of dust arose.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्दे॑वा॒ यत॑यो यथा॒ भुव॑ना॒न्यपि॑न्वत अत्रा॑ समु॒द्र आ गू॒ळ्हमा सूर्य॑मजभर्तन
verses.transliteration: yád devā yátayo yathā  bhúvanāny ápinvata  átrā samudrá ā́ gūḷhám  ā́ sū́ryam ajabhartana

translation.text: When, O ye Gods, like Yatis, ye caused all existing things to grow, Then ye brought Sûrya forward who was lying hidden in the sea.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ष्टौ पु॒त्रासो॒ अदि॑ते॒र्ये जा॒तास्त॒न्व१॒॑स्परि॑ दे॒वाँ उप॒ प्रैत्स॒प्तभिः॒ परा॑ मार्ता॒ण्डमा॑स्यत्
verses.transliteration: aṣṭaú putrā́so áditer  yé jātā́s tanvàs pári  devā́m̐ úpa praít saptábhiḥ  párā mārtāṇḍám āsyat

translation.text: Eight are the Sons of Adid who from her body sprang to life. With seven she went to meet the Gods she cast Mârtâṇḍa far away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्तभिः॑ पु॒त्रैरदि॑ति॒रुप॒ प्रैत्पू॒र्व्यं यु॒गम् प्र॒जायै॑ मृ॒त्यवे॑ त्व॒त्पुन॑र्मार्ता॒ण्डमाभ॑रत्
verses.transliteration: saptábhiḥ putraír áditir  úpa praít pūrvyáṃ yugám  prajā́yai mr̥tyáve tvat  púnar mārtāṇḍám ā́bharat

translation.text: So with her Seven Sons Aditi went forth to meet the earlier age. She brought Mârtâṇḍa thitherward to spring to life and die again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जनि॑ष्ठा उ॒ग्रः सह॑से तु॒राय॑ म॒न्द्र ओजि॑ष्ठो बहु॒लाभि॑मानः अव॑र्ध॒न्निन्द्रं॑ म॒रुत॑श्चि॒दत्र॑ मा॒ता यद्वी॒रं द॒धन॒द्धनि॑ष्ठा
verses.transliteration: jániṣṭhā ugráḥ sáhase turā́ya  mandrá ójiṣṭho bahulā́bhimānaḥ  ávardhann índram marútaś cid átra  mātā́ yád vīráṃ dadhánad dhániṣṭhā

translation.text: THOU wast born mighty for victorious valour, exulting, strongest, full of pride and courage. There, even there, the Maruts strengthened Indra when. his most rapid Mother stirred the Hero.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्रु॒हो निष॑त्ता पृश॒नी चि॒देवैः॑ पु॒रू शंसे॑न वावृधु॒ष्ट इन्द्र॑म् अ॒भीवृ॑तेव॒ ता म॑हाप॒देन॑ ध्वा॒न्तात्प्र॑पि॒त्वादुद॑रन्त॒ गर्भाः॑
verses.transliteration: druhó níṣattā pr̥śanī́ cid évaiḥ  purū́ śáṃsena vāvr̥dhuṣ ṭá índram  abhī́vr̥teva tā́ mahāpadéna  dhvāntā́t prapitvā́d úd aranta gárbhāḥ

translation.text: There with fiend's ways e'en Pr̥iṣni was seated: with much laudation they exalted Indra. As if encompassed by the Mighty-footed, from darkness, near at hand, forth came the Children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒ष्वा ते॒ पादा॒ प्र यज्जिगा॒स्यव॑र्ध॒न्वाजा॑ उ॒त ये चि॒दत्र॑ त्वमि॑न्द्र सालावृ॒कान्त्स॒हस्र॑मा॒सन्द॑धिषे अ॒श्विना व॑वृत्याः
verses.transliteration: r̥ṣvā́ te pā́dā prá yáj jígāsi-  ávardhan vā́jā utá yé cid átra  tvám indra sālāvr̥kā́n sahásram  āsán dadhiṣe aśvínā́ vavr̥tyāḥ

translation.text: High are thy feet when on thy way thou goest: the strength thou foundest here hath lent thee vigour. Thousand hyenas in thy mouth thou holdest. O Indra, mayst thou turn the Aṣvins hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म॒ना तूर्णि॒रुप॑ यासि य॒ज्ञमा नास॑त्या स॒ख्याय॑ वक्षि व॒साव्या॑मिन्द्र धारयः स॒हस्रा॒श्विना॑ शूर ददतुर्म॒घानि॑
verses.transliteration: samanā́ tū́rṇir úpa yāsi yajñám  ā́ nā́satyā sakhyā́ya vakṣi  vasā́vyām indra dhārayaḥ sahásrā-  -aśvínā śūra dadatur maghā́ni

translation.text: Speeding at once to sacrifice thou comest for friendship thou art bringing both Nâsatyas. Thou hadst a thousand treasures in possession. The Aṣvins, O thou Hero, gave thee riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मन्द॑मान ऋ॒तादधि॑ प्र॒जायै॒ सखि॑भि॒रिन्द्र॑ इषि॒रेभि॒रर्थ॑म् आभि॒र्हि मा॒या उप॒ दस्यु॒मागा॒न्मिहः॒ प्र त॒म्रा अ॑वप॒त्तमां॑सि
verses.transliteration: mándamāna r̥tā́d ádhi prajā́yai  sákhibhir índra iṣirébhir ártham  ā́bhir hí māyā́ úpa dásyum ā́gāt-  míhaḥ prá tamrā́ avapat támāṃsi

translation.text: Glad, for the race that rests on holy Order, with friends who hasten to their goal, hath Indra With these his magic powers assailed the Dasyu: he cast away the gloomy mists, the darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सना॑माना चिद्ध्वसयो॒ न्य॑स्मा॒ अवा॑ह॒न्निन्द्र॑ उ॒षसो॒ यथानः॑ ऋ॒ष्वैर॑गच्छः॒ सखि॑भि॒र्निका॑मैः सा॒कं प्र॑ति॒ष्ठा हृद्या॑ जघन्थ
verses.transliteration: sánāmānā cid dhvasayo ny àsmai-  ávāhann índra uṣáso yáthā́naḥ  r̥ṣvaír agachaḥ sákhibhir níkāmaiḥ  sākám pratiṣṭhā́ hŕ̥dyā jaghantha

translation.text: Two of like name for him didst thou demolish, as Indra striking down the car of Ushas. With thy beloved lofty Friends thou camest, and with the assurance of thine heart thou slewest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ज॑घन्थ॒ नमु॑चिं मख॒स्युं दासं॑ कृण्वा॒न ऋष॑ये॒ विमा॑यम् त्वं च॑कर्थ॒ मन॑वे स्यो॒नान्प॒थो दे॑व॒त्राञ्ज॑सेव॒ याना॑न्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ jaghantha námucim makhasyúṃ  dā́saṃ kr̥ṇvāná ŕ̥ṣaye vímāyam  tváṃ cakartha mánave syonā́n  pathó devatrā́ñjaseva yā́nān

translation.text: War-loving Namuci thou smotest, robbing the Dâsa of his magic for the R̥ishi. For man thou madest ready pleasant pathways, paths leading as it were directly God-ward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमे॒तानि॑ पप्रिषे॒ वि नामेशा॑न इन्द्र दधिषे॒ गभ॑स्तौ अनु॑ त्वा दे॒वाः शव॑सा मदन्त्यु॒परि॑बुध्नान्व॒निन॑श्चकर्थ
verses.transliteration: tvám etā́ni papriṣe ví nā́ma-  -ī́śāna indra dadhiṣe gábhastau  ánu tvā devā́ḥ śávasā madanti-  upáribudhnān vanínaś cakartha

translation.text: These names of thine thou hast fulfilled completely: as Lord, thou boldest in thine arm, O Indra. In thee, through thy great might, the Gods are joyful: the roots of trees hast thou directed upward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒क्रं यद॑स्या॒प्स्वा निष॑त्तमु॒तो तद॑स्मै॒ मध्विच्च॑च्छद्यात् पृ॒थि॒व्यामति॑षितं॒ यदूधः॒ पयो॒ गोष्वद॑धा॒ ओष॑धीषु
verses.transliteration: cakráṃ yád asyāpsv ā́ níṣattam  utó tád asmai mádhv íc cachadyāt  pr̥thivyā́m átiṣitaṃ yád ū́dhaḥ  páyo góṣv ádadhā óṣadhīṣu

translation.text: May the sweet Soma juices make him happy to cast his quoit that lies in depth of waters. Thou from the udder which o'er earth is fastened hast poured the milk into the kine and herbage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑दिया॒येति॒ यद्वद॒न्त्योज॑सो जा॒तमु॒त म॑न्य एनम् म॒न्योरि॑याय ह॒र्म्येषु॑ तस्थौ॒ यतः॑ प्रज॒ज्ञ इन्द्रो॑ अस्य वेद
verses.transliteration: áśvād iyāyéti yád vádanti-  ójaso jātám utá manya enam  manyór iyāya harmyéṣu tasthau  yátaḥ prajajñá índro asya veda

translation.text: When others call him offspring of the Courser, my meaning is that Mighty Power produced him. He came from Manyu and remained in houses: whence he hath sprung is known to Indra only.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वयः॑ सुप॒र्णा उप॑ सेदु॒रिन्द्रं॑ प्रि॒यमे॑धा॒ ऋष॑यो॒ नाध॑मानाः अप॑ ध्वा॒न्तमू॑र्णु॒हि पू॒र्धि चक्षु॑र्मुमु॒ग्ध्य१॒॑स्मान्नि॒धये॑व ब॒द्धान्
verses.transliteration: váyaḥ suparṇā́ úpa sedur índram  priyámedhā ŕ̥ṣayo nā́dhamānāḥ  ápa dhvāntám ūrṇuhí pūrdhí cákṣur  mumugdhy àsmā́n nidháyeva baddhā́n

translation.text: Like birds of beauteous wing the Priyamedhas, R̥ishis, imploring, have come nigh to Indra: Dispel the darkness and fill full our vision deliver us as men whom snares entangle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वसू॑नां वा चर्कृष॒ इय॑क्षन्धि॒या वा॑ य॒ज्ञैर्वा॒ रोद॑स्योः अर्व॑न्तो वा॒ ये र॑यि॒मन्तः॑ सा॒तौ व॒नुं वा॒ ये सु॒श्रुणं॑ सु॒श्रुतो॒ धुः
verses.transliteration: vásūnāṃ vā carkr̥ṣa íyakṣan  dhiyā́ vā yajñaír vā ródasyoḥ  árvanto vā yé rayimántaḥ sātaú  vanúṃ vā yé suśrúṇaṃ suśrúto dhúḥ

translation.text: I AM prepared to laud with song or worship the Noble Ones who are in earth and heaven, Or Coursers who have triumphed in, the contest, or those who famed, have won the prize with glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हव॑ एषा॒मसु॑रो नक्षत॒ द्यां श्र॑वस्य॒ता मन॑सा निंसत॒ क्षाम् चक्षा॑णा॒ यत्र॑ सुवि॒ताय॑ दे॒वा द्यौर्न वारे॑भिः कृ॒णव॑न्त॒ स्वैः
verses.transliteration: háva eṣām ásuro nakṣata dyā́ṃ  śravasyatā́ mánasā niṃsata kṣā́m  cákṣāṇā yátra suvitā́ya devā́ḥ-  dyaúr ná vā́rebhiḥ kr̥ṇávanta svaíḥ

translation.text: Their call, the call of Gods, went up to heaven: they kissed the ground with glory-seeking spirit, There where the Gods look on for happy fortune, and like the kindly heavens bestow their bounties.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यमे॑षाम॒मृता॑नां॒ गीः स॒र्वता॑ता॒ ये कृ॒पण॑न्त॒ रत्न॑म् धियं॑ च य॒ज्ञं च॒ साध॑न्त॒स्ते नो॑ धान्तु वस॒व्य१॒॑मसा॑मि
verses.transliteration: iyám eṣām amŕ̥tānāṃ gī́ḥ  sarvátātā yé kr̥páṇanta rátnam  dhíyaṃ ca yajñáṃ ca sā́dhantas  té no dhāntu vasavyàm ásāmi

translation.text: This is the song of those Immortal Beings who long for treasures in their full perfection. May these, completing prayers and sacrifices, bestow upon us wealth where naught is wanting.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तत्त॑ इन्द्रा॒यवः॑ पनन्ता॒भि य ऊ॒र्वं गोम॑न्तं॒ तितृ॑त्सान् स॒कृ॒त्स्वं१॒॑ ये पु॑रुपु॒त्रां म॒हीं स॒हस्र॑धारां बृह॒तीं दुदु॑क्षन्
verses.transliteration: ā́ tát ta indrāyávaḥ pananta-  -abhí yá ūrváṃ gómantaṃ títr̥tsān  sakr̥tsvàṃ yé puruputrā́m mahī́ṃ  sahásradhārām br̥hatī́ṃ dúdukṣan

translation.text: Those living men extolled thy deed, O Indra, those who would fain burst through the stall of cattle, Fain to milk her who bare but once, great, lofty, whose Sons are many and her streams past number.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शची॑व॒ इन्द्र॒मव॑से कृणुध्व॒मना॑नतं द॒मय॑न्तं पृत॒न्यून् ऋ॒भु॒क्षणं॑ म॒घवा॑नं सुवृ॒क्तिं भर्ता॒ यो वज्रं॒ नर्यं॑ पुरु॒क्षुः
verses.transliteration: śácīva índram ávase kr̥ṇudhvam  -ánānataṃ damáyantam pr̥tanyū́n  r̥bhukṣáṇam maghávānaṃ suvr̥ktím  bhártā yó vájraṃ náryam purukṣúḥ

translation.text: Sacivan, win to your assistance Indra who never bends, who overcomes his foemen. R̥ibhukshan, Maghavan, the hymn's upholder, who, rich in food, bears man's kind friend, the thunder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वा॒वान॑ पुरु॒तमं॑ पुरा॒षाळा वृ॑त्र॒हेन्द्रो॒ नामा॑न्यप्राः अचे॑ति प्रा॒सह॒स्पति॒स्तुवि॑ष्मा॒न्यदी॑मु॒श्मसि॒ कर्त॑वे॒ कर॒त्तत्
verses.transliteration: yád vāvā́na purutámam purāṣā́ḷ  ā́ vr̥trahéndro nā́māny aprāḥ  áceti prāsáhas pátis túviṣmān  yád īm uśmási kártave kárat tát

translation.text: Since he who won of old anew hath triumphed, Indra hath earned his name of Vr̥itra-slaycr. He hath appeared, the mighty Lord of Conquest. What we would have him do let him accomplish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सु व॑ आपो महि॒मान॑मुत्त॒मं का॒रुर्वो॑चाति॒ सद॑ने वि॒वस्व॑तः प्र स॒प्तस॑प्त त्रे॒धा हि च॑क्र॒मुः प्र सृत्व॑रीणा॒मति॒ सिन्धु॒रोज॑सा
verses.transliteration: prá sú va āpo mahimā́nam uttamáṃ  kārúr vocāti sádane vivásvataḥ  prá saptá-sapta tredhā́ hí cakramúḥ  prá sŕ̥tvarīṇām áti síndhur ójasā

translation.text: THE singer, O ye Waters in Vivasvan's place, shall tell your grandeur forth that is beyond compare. The Rivers have come forward triply, seven and seven. Sindhu in might surpasses all the streams that flow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॑ऽरद॒द्वरु॑णो॒ यात॑वे प॒थः सिन्धो॒ यद्वाजाँ॑ अ॒भ्यद्र॑व॒स्त्वम् भूम्या॒ अधि॑ प्र॒वता॑ यासि॒ सानु॑ना॒ यदे॑षा॒मग्रं॒ जग॑तामिर॒ज्यसि॑
verses.transliteration: prá te 'radad váruṇo yā́tave patháḥ  síndho yád vā́jām̐ abhy ádravas tvám  bhū́myā ádhi pravátā yāsi sā́nunā  yád eṣām ágraṃ jágatām irajyási

translation.text: Varuṇa cut the channels for thy forward course, O Sindhu, when thou rannest on to win the race. Thou speedest o'er precipitous ridges of the earth, when thou art Lord and Leader of these moving floods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वि स्व॒नो य॑तते॒ भूम्यो॒पर्य॑न॒न्तं शुष्म॒मुदि॑यर्ति भा॒नुना॑ अ॒भ्रादि॑व॒ प्र स्त॑नयन्ति वृ॒ष्टयः॒ सिन्धु॒र्यदेति॑ वृष॒भो न रोरु॑वत्
verses.transliteration: diví svanó yatate bhū́myopári-  anantáṃ śúṣmam úd iyarti bhānúnā  abhrā́d iva prá stanayanti vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ  síndhur yád éti vr̥ṣabhó ná róruvat

translation.text: His roar is lifted up to heaven above the earth: he puts forth endless vigour with a flash of light. Like floods of rain that fall- in thunder from the cloud, so Sindhu rushes on bellowing like a bull.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्वा॑ सिन्धो॒ शिशु॒मिन्न मा॒तरो॑ वा॒श्रा अ॑र्षन्ति॒ पय॑सेव धे॒नवः॑ राजे॑व॒ युध्वा॑ नयसि॒ त्वमित्सिचौ॒ यदा॑सा॒मग्रं॑ प्र॒वता॒मिन॑क्षसि
verses.transliteration: abhí tvā sindho śíśum ín ná mātáro  vāśrā́ arṣanti páyaseva dhenávaḥ  rā́jeva yúdhvā nayasi tvám ít sícau  yád āsām ágram pravátām ínakṣasi

translation.text: Like mothers to their calves, like milch kine with their milk, so, Sindhu, unto thee the roaring rivers run. Thou leadest as a warrior king thine army's wings what time thou comest in the van of these swift streams.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं मे॑ गङ्गे यमुने सरस्वति॒ शुतु॑द्रि॒ स्तोमं॑ सचता॒ परु॒ष्ण्या अ॒सि॒क्न्या म॑रुद्वृधे वि॒तस्त॒यार्जी॑कीये शृणु॒ह्या सु॒षोम॑या
verses.transliteration: imám me gaṅge yamune sarasvati  śútudri stómaṃ sacatā páruṣṇy ā́  asiknyā́ marudvr̥dhe vitástayā-  -ā́rjīkīye śr̥ṇuhy ā́ suṣómayā

translation.text: Favour ye this my laud, O Gangâ, Yamunâ, O Ṣutudrî, Parushṇî and Sarasvatî: With Asiknî, Vitastâ, O Marudvr̥idhâ, O Ârjîkîyâ with Sushomâ hear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तृ॒ष्टाम॑या प्रथ॒मं यात॑वे स॒जूः सु॒सर्त्वा॑ र॒सया॑ श्वे॒त्या त्या त्वं सि॑न्धो॒ कुभ॑या गोम॒तीं क्रुमुं॑ मेह॒त्न्वा स॒रथं॒ याभि॒रीय॑से
verses.transliteration: tr̥ṣṭā́mayā prathamáṃ yā́tave sajū́ḥ  susártvā rasáyā śvetyā́ tyā́  tváṃ sindho kúbhayā gomatī́ṃ krúmum  mehatnvā́ saráthaṃ yā́bhir ī́yase

translation.text: First with Tr̥ishṭâmâ thou art eager to flow forth, with Rasâ, and Susartu, and with Ṣvetyâ here, With Kubhâ; and with these, Sindhu and Mehatnu, thou seekest in thy course Krumu and Gomatî.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋजी॒त्येनी॒ रुश॑ती महि॒त्वा परि॒ ज्रयां॑सि भरते॒ रजां॑सि अद॑ब्धा॒ सिन्धु॑र॒पसा॑म॒पस्त॒माश्वा॒ न चि॒त्रा वपु॑षीव दर्श॒ता
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥jīty énī rúśatī mahitvā́  pári jráyāṃsi bharate rájāṃsi  ádabdhā síndhur apásām apástamā-  -áśvā ná citrā́ vápuṣīva darśatā́

translation.text: Flashing and whitely-gleaming in her mightiness, she moves along her ample volumes through the realms, Most active of the active, Sindhu unrestrained, like to a dappled mare, beautiful, fair to see.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वश्वा॒ सिन्धुः॑ सु॒रथा॑ सु॒वासा॑ हिर॒ण्ययी॒ सुकृ॑ता वा॒जिनी॑वती ऊर्णा॑वती युव॒तिः सी॒लमा॑वत्यु॒ताधि॑ वस्ते सु॒भगा॑ मधु॒वृध॑म्
verses.transliteration: sváśvā síndhuḥ suráthā suvā́sāḥ-  hiraṇyáyī súkr̥tā vājínīvatī  ū́rṇāvatī yuvatíḥ sīlámāvatī-  utā́dhi vaste subhágā madhuvŕ̥dham

translation.text: Rich in good steeds is Sindhu, rich in cars and robes, rich in gold, nobly-fashioned, rich in ample wealth. Blest Sîlamâvatî and young Urnavati invest themselves with raiment rich in store of sweets.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒खं रथं॑ युयुजे॒ सिन्धु॑र॒श्विनं॒ तेन॒ वाजं॑ सनिषद॒स्मिन्ना॒जौ म॒हान्ह्य॑स्य महि॒मा प॑न॒स्यतेऽद॑ब्धस्य॒ स्वय॑शसो विर॒प्शिनः॑
verses.transliteration: sukháṃ ráthaṃ yuyuje síndhur aśvínaṃ  téna vā́jaṃ saniṣad asmínn ājaú  mahā́n hy àsya mahimā́ panasyáte-  -ádabdhasya sváyaśaso virapśínaḥ

translation.text: Sindhu hath yoked her car, light-rolling, drawn by steeds, and with that car shall she win booty in this fight. So have I praised its power, mighty and unrestrained, of independent glory, roaring as it runs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ व॑ ऋञ्जस ऊ॒र्जां व्यु॑ष्टि॒ष्विन्द्रं॑ म॒रुतो॒ रोद॑सी अनक्तन उ॒भे यथा॑ नो॒ अह॑नी सचा॒भुवा॒ सदः॑सदो वरिव॒स्यात॑ उ॒द्भिदा॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ va r̥ñjasa ūrjā́ṃ vyùṣṭiṣu-  índram marúto ródasī anaktana  ubhé yáthā no áhanī sacābhúvā  sádaḥ-sado varivasyā́ta udbhídā

translation.text: I GRASP at you when power and strength begin to dawn: bedew ye, Indra and the Maruts, Heaven and Earth, That Day and Night, in every hall of sacrifice, may wait on us and bless us when they first spring forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदु॒ श्रेष्ठं॒ सव॑नं सुनोत॒नात्यो॒ न हस्त॑यतो॒ अद्रिः॑ सो॒तरि॑ वि॒दद्ध्य१॒॑र्यो अ॒भिभू॑ति॒ पौंस्यं॑ म॒हो रा॒ये चि॑त्तरुते॒ यदर्व॑तः
verses.transliteration: tád u śréṣṭhaṃ sávanaṃ sunotana-  -átyo ná hástayato ádriḥ sotári  vidád dhy àryó abhíbhūti paúṃsyam  mahó rāyé cit tarute yád árvataḥ

translation.text: Press the libation out, most excellent of all: the Pressing-stone is grasped like a hand-guided steed. So let it win the valour that subdues the foe, and the fleet courser's might that speeds to ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदिद्ध्य॑स्य॒ सव॑नं वि॒वेर॒पो यथा॑ पु॒रा मन॑वे गा॒तुमश्रे॑त् गोअ॑र्णसि त्वा॒ष्ट्रे अश्व॑निर्णिजि॒ प्रेम॑ध्व॒रेष्व॑ध्व॒राँ अ॑शिश्रयुः
verses.transliteration: tád íd dhy àsya sávanaṃ vivér apó  yáthā purā́ mánave gātúm áśret  góarṇasi tvāṣṭré áśvanirṇiji  prém adhvaréṣv adhvarā́m̐ aśiśrayuḥ

translation.text: Juice that this Stone pours out removes defect of ours, as in old time it brought prosperity to man. At sacrifices they established holy rites on Tvashṭar's milk-blent juice bright with the hue of steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॑ हत र॒क्षसो॑ भङ्गु॒राव॑तः स्कभा॒यत॒ निर्ऋ॑तिं॒ सेध॒ताम॑तिम् आ नो॑ र॒यिं सर्व॑वीरं सुनोतन देवा॒व्यं॑ भरत॒ श्लोक॑मद्रयः
verses.transliteration: ápa hata rakṣáso bhaṅgurā́vataḥ-  skabhāyáta nírr̥tiṃ sédhatā́matim  ā́ no rayíṃ sárvavīraṃ sunotana  devāvyàm bharata ślókam adrayaḥ

translation.text: Drive ye the treacherous demons far away from us: keep Nirr̥iti afar and banish Penury. Pour riches forth for us with troops of hero sons, and bear ye up, O Stones, the song that visits Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वश्चि॒दा वोऽम॑वत्तरेभ्यो वि॒भ्वना॑ चिदा॒श्व॑पस्तरेभ्यः वा॒योश्चि॒दा सोम॑रभस्तरेभ्यो॒ऽग्नेश्चि॑दर्च पितु॒कृत्त॑रेभ्यः
verses.transliteration: diváś cid ā́ vó 'mavattarebhyo  vibhvánā cid āśvàpastarebhyaḥ  vāyóś cid ā́ sómarabhastarebhyo  -agnéś cid arca pitukŕ̥ttarebhyaḥ

translation.text: To you who are more mighty than the heavens themselves, who, finishing your task with more than Vibhvan's speed, More rapidly than Vâyu seize the Soma juice, better than Agni give us food, to you I sing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भु॒रन्तु॑ नो य॒शसः॒ सोत्वन्ध॑सो॒ ग्रावा॑णो वा॒चा दि॒विता॑ दि॒वित्म॑ता नरो॒ यत्र॑ दुह॒ते काम्यं॒ मध्वा॑घो॒षय॑न्तो अ॒भितो॑ मिथ॒स्तुरः॑
verses.transliteration: bhurántu no yaśásaḥ sótv ándhaso  grā́vāṇo vācā́ divítā divítmatā  náro yátra duhaté kā́myam mádhu-  āghoṣáyanto abhíto mithastúraḥ

translation.text: Stirred be the glorious Stones: let it press out the juice, the Stone with heavenly song that reaches up to heaven, There where the men draw forth the meath for which they long, sending their voice around in rivalry of speed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒न्वन्ति॒ सोमं॑ रथि॒रासो॒ अद्र॑यो॒ निर॑स्य॒ रसं॑ ग॒विषो॑ दुहन्ति॒ ते दु॒हन्त्यूध॑रुप॒सेच॑नाय॒ कं नरो॑ ह॒व्या न म॑र्जयन्त आ॒सभिः॑
verses.transliteration: sunvánti sómaṃ rathirā́so ádrayo  nír asya rásaṃ gavíṣo duhanti té  duhánty ū́dhar upasécanāya káṃ  náro havyā́ ná marjayanta āsábhiḥ

translation.text: The Stones press out the Soma, swift as car-borne men, and, eager for the spoil, drain forth the sap thereof To fill the beaker, they exhaust the udder's store, as the men purify oblations with their lips.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते न॑रः॒ स्वप॑सो अभूतन॒ य इन्द्रा॑य सुनु॒थ सोम॑मद्रयः वा॒मंवा॑मं वो दि॒व्याय॒ धाम्ने॒ वसु॑वसु वः॒ पार्थि॑वाय सुन्व॒ते
verses.transliteration: eté naraḥ svápaso abhūtana  yá índrāya sunuthá sómam adrayaḥ  vāmáṃ-vāmaṃ vo divyā́ya dhā́mne  vásu-vasu vaḥ pā́rthivāya sunvaté

translation.text: Ye, present men, have been most skilful in your work, even ye, O Stones who pressed Soma for Indra's drink. May all ye have of fair go to the Heavenly Race, and all your treasure to the earthly worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भ्र॒प्रुषो॒ न वा॒चा प्रु॑षा॒ वसु॑ ह॒विष्म॑न्तो॒ न य॒ज्ञा वि॑जा॒नुषः॑ सु॒मारु॑तं॒ न ब्र॒ह्माण॑म॒र्हसे॑ ग॒णम॑स्तोष्येषां॒ न शो॒भसे॑
verses.transliteration: abhraprúṣo ná vācā́ pruṣā vásu  havíṣmanto ná yajñā́ vijānúṣaḥ  sumā́rutaṃ ná brahmā́ṇam arháse  gaṇám astoṣy eṣāṃ ná śobháse

translation.text: As with their voice from cloud they sprinkle treasure so are the wise man's liberal sacrifices. I praise their Company that merits worship as the good Martits' priest to pay them honour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रि॒ये मर्या॑सो अ॒ञ्जीँर॑कृण्वत सु॒मारु॑तं॒ न पू॒र्वीरति॒ क्षपः॑ दि॒वस्पु॒त्रास॒ एता॒ न ये॑तिर आदि॒त्यास॒स्ते अ॒क्रा न वा॑वृधुः
verses.transliteration: śriyé máryāso añjī́m̐r akr̥ṇvata  sumā́rutaṃ ná pūrvī́r áti kṣápaḥ  divás putrā́sa étā ná yetire-  ādityā́sas té akrā́ ná vāvr̥dhuḥ

translation.text: The youths have wrought their ornaments for glory through many nights,– this noble band of Maruts. Like stags the Sons of Dyatis have striven onward, the Sons of Aditi grown strong like pillars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये दि॒वः पृ॑थि॒व्या न ब॒र्हणा॒ त्मना॑ रिरि॒च्रे अ॒भ्रान्न सूर्यः॑ पाज॑स्वन्तो॒ न वी॒राः प॑न॒स्यवो॑ रि॒शाद॑सो॒ न मर्या॑ अ॒भिद्य॑वः
