verses.transliteration: prá yé diváḥ pr̥thivyā́ ná barháṇā  tmánā riricré abhrā́n ná sū́ryaḥ  pā́jasvanto ná vīrā́ḥ panasyávo  riśā́daso ná máryā abhídyavaḥ

translation.text: They who extend beyond the earth and heaven, by their own mass, as from the cloud spreads Sûrya; Like mighty Heroes covetous of glory, like heavenly gallants who destroy the wicked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ष्माकं॑ बु॒ध्ने अ॒पां न याम॑नि विथु॒र्यति॒ न म॒ही श्र॑थ॒र्यति॑ वि॒श्वप्सु॑र्य॒ज्ञो अ॒र्वाग॒यं सु वः॒ प्रय॑स्वन्तो॒ न स॒त्राच॒ आ ग॑त
verses.transliteration: yuṣmā́kam budhné apā́ṃ ná yā́mani  vithuryáti ná mahī́ śratharyáti  viśvápsur yajñó arvā́g ayáṃ sú vaḥ  práyasvanto ná satrā́ca ā́ gata

translation.text: When ye come nigh, as in the depth of waters, the earth is loosened, as it were, and shaken. This your all-feedin sacrifice approaches: come all united, fraught, as 'twere with viands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं धू॒र्षु प्र॒युजो॒ न र॒श्मिभि॒र्ज्योति॑ष्मन्तो॒ न भा॒सा व्यु॑ष्टिषु श्ये॒नासो॒ न स्वय॑शसो रि॒शाद॑सः प्र॒वासो॒ न प्रसि॑तासः परि॒प्रुषः॑
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ dhūrṣú prayújo ná raśmíbhir  jyótiṣmanto ná bhāsā́ vyùṣṭiṣu  śyenā́so ná sváyaśaso riśā́dasaḥ  pravā́so ná prásitāsaḥ pariprúṣaḥ

translation.text: Ye are like horses fastened to the chariot poles, luminous with your beams, with splendour as at dawn; Like self-bright falcons, punishers of wicked men, like hovering birds urged forward, scattering rain around.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यद्वह॑ध्वे मरुतः परा॒काद्यू॒यं म॒हः सं॒वर॑णस्य॒ वस्वः॑ वि॒दा॒नासो॑ वसवो॒ राध्य॑स्या॒राच्चि॒द्द्वेषः॑ सनु॒तर्यु॑योत
verses.transliteration: prá yád váhadhve marutaḥ parākā́d  yūyám maháḥ saṃváraṇasya vásvaḥ  vidānā́so vasavo rā́dhyasya-  -ārā́c cid dvéṣaḥ sanutár yuyota

translation.text: When ye come forth, O Maruts, from the distance, from the great treasury of rich possessions, Knowing, O Vasus, boons that should be granted, even from afar drive back the men who hate us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य उ॒दृचि॑ य॒ज्ञे अ॑ध्वरे॒ष्ठा म॒रुद्भ्यो॒ न मानु॑षो॒ ददा॑शत् रे॒वत्स वयो॑ दधते सु॒वीरं॒ स दे॒वाना॒मपि॑ गोपी॒थे अ॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: yá udŕ̥ci yajñé adhvareṣṭhā́ḥ-  marúdbhyo ná mā́nuṣo dádāśat  revát sá váyo dadhate suvī́raṃ  sá devā́nām ápi gopīthé astu

translation.text: He who, engaged in the rite's final duty brings, as a man, oblation to the Maruts, Wins him life's wealthy fulness, blest with heroes: he shall be present, too, where Gods drink Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि य॒ज्ञेषु॑ य॒ज्ञिया॑स॒ ऊमा॑ आदि॒त्येन॒ नाम्ना॒ शम्भ॑विष्ठाः ते नो॑ऽवन्तु रथ॒तूर्म॑नी॒षां म॒हश्च॒ याम॑न्नध्व॒रे च॑का॒नाः
verses.transliteration: té hí yajñéṣu yajñíyāsa ū́māḥ  ādityéna nā́mnā śámbhaviṣṭhāḥ  té no 'vantu rathatū́r manīṣā́m  maháś ca yā́mann adhvaré cakānā́ḥ

translation.text: For these are helps adored at sacrifices, bringing good fortune by their name Âdityas. Speeding on cars let them protect our praises, delighting in our sacrifice and worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विप्रा॑सो॒ न मन्म॑भिः स्वा॒ध्यो॑ देवा॒व्यो॒३॒॑ न य॒ज्ञैः स्वप्न॑सः राजा॑नो॒ न चि॒त्राः सु॑सं॒दृशः॑ क्षिती॒नां न मर्या॑ अरे॒पसः॑
verses.transliteration: víprāso ná mánmabhiḥ svādhyò  devāvyò ná yajñaíḥ svápnasaḥ  rā́jāno ná citrā́ḥ susaṃdŕ̥śaḥ  kṣitīnā́ṃ ná máryā arepásaḥ

translation.text: Ye by your hymns are like high-thoughted singers, skilful, inviting Gods with sacrifices; Fair to behold, like Kings, with bright adornment, like spotless gallants, leaders of the people:

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्न ये भ्राज॑सा रु॒क्मव॑क्षसो॒ वाता॑सो॒ न स्व॒युजः॑ स॒द्यऊ॑तयः प्र॒ज्ञा॒तारो॒ न ज्येष्ठाः॑ सुनी॒तयः॑ सु॒शर्मा॑णो॒ न सोमा॑ ऋ॒तं य॒ते
verses.transliteration: agnír ná yé bhrā́jasā rukmávakṣaso  vā́tāso ná svayújaḥ sadyáūtayaḥ  prajñātā́ro ná jyéṣṭhāḥ sunītáyaḥ  suśármāṇo ná sómā r̥táṃ yaté

translation.text: Like fire with flashing flame, breast-bound with chains of gold, like tempest-blasts, self-moving, swift to lend your aid; As best of all foreknowers, excellent to guide, like Somas, good to guard the man who follows Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाता॑सो॒ न ये धुन॑यो जिग॒त्नवो॑ऽग्नी॒नां न जि॒ह्वा वि॑रो॒किणः॑ वर्म॑ण्वन्तो॒ न यो॒धाः शिमी॑वन्तः पितॄ॒णां न शंसाः॑ सुरा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: vā́tāso ná yé dhúnayo jigatnávo  -agnīnā́ṃ ná jihvā́ virokíṇaḥ  vármaṇvanto ná yodhā́ḥ śímīvantaḥ  pitr̥̄ṇā́ṃ ná śáṃsāḥ surātáyaḥ

translation.text: Shakers of all, like gales of wind they travel, like tongues of burning fires in their effulgence. Mighty are they as warriors clad in armour, and, like the Fathers' prayers, Most Bounteous Givers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथा॑नां॒ न ये१॒॑ऽराः सना॑भयो जिगी॒वांसो॒ न शूरा॑ अ॒भिद्य॑वः व॒रे॒यवो॒ न मर्या॑ घृत॒प्रुषो॑ऽभिस्व॒र्तारो॑ अ॒र्कं न सु॒ष्टुभः॑
verses.transliteration: ráthānāṃ ná yè 'rā́ḥ sánābhayo  jigīvā́ṃso ná śū́rā abhídyavaḥ  vareyávo ná máryā ghr̥taprúṣo  -abhisvartā́ro arkáṃ ná suṣṭúbhaḥ

translation.text: Like spokes of car-wheels in one nave united, ever victorious like heavenly Heroes, Shedding their precious balm like youthful suitors, they raise their voice and chant their psalm as singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑सो॒ न ये ज्येष्ठा॑स आ॒शवो॑ दिधि॒षवो॒ न र॒थ्यः॑ सु॒दान॑वः आपो॒ न नि॒म्नैरु॒दभि॑र्जिग॒त्नवो॑ वि॒श्वरू॑पा॒ अङ्गि॑रसो॒ न साम॑भिः
verses.transliteration: áśvāso ná yé jyéṣṭhāsa āśávo  didhiṣávo ná rathyàḥ sudā́navaḥ  ā́po ná nimnaír udábhir jigatnávo  viśvárūpā áṅgiraso ná sā́mabhiḥ

translation.text: They who are fleet to travel like the noblest steeds, long to obtain the prize like bounteous charioteers, Like waters speeding on with their precipitous floods, like omniform Angirases with Sâma-hymns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्रावा॑णो॒ न सू॒रयः॒ सिन्धु॑मातर आदर्दि॒रासो॒ अद्र॑यो॒ न वि॒श्वहा॑ शि॒शूला॒ न क्री॒ळयः॑ सुमा॒तरो॑ महाग्रा॒मो न याम॑न्नु॒त त्वि॒षा
verses.transliteration: grā́vāṇo ná sūráyaḥ síndhumātaraḥ-  ādardirā́so ádrayo ná viśváhā  śiśū́lā ná krīḷáyaḥ sumātáro  mahāgrāmó ná yā́mann utá tviṣā́

translation.text: Born from the stream, like press-stones are the Princes, for ever like the stones that crush in pieces; Sons of a beauteous Dame, like playful children, like a great host upon the march with splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒षसां॒ न के॒तवो॑ऽध्वर॒श्रियः॑ शुभं॒यवो॒ नाञ्जिभि॒र्व्य॑श्वितन् सिन्ध॑वो॒ न य॒यियो॒ भ्राज॑दृष्टयः परा॒वतो॒ न योज॑नानि ममिरे
verses.transliteration: uṣásāṃ ná ketávo 'dhvaraśríyaḥ  śubhaṃyávo nā́ñjíbhir vy àśvitan  síndhavo ná yayíyo bhrā́jadr̥ṣṭayaḥ  parāváto ná yójanāni mamire

translation.text: Like rays of Dawn, the visitors of sacrifice, they shine with ornaments as eager to be bright. Like rivers hasting on, glittering with their spears, from far away they measure out the distances.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒भा॒गान्नो॑ देवाः कृणुता सु॒रत्ना॑न॒स्मान्त्स्तो॒तॄन्म॑रुतो वावृधा॒नाः अधि॑ स्तो॒त्रस्य॑ स॒ख्यस्य॑ गात स॒नाद्धि वो॑ रत्न॒धेया॑नि॒ सन्ति॑
verses.transliteration: subhāgā́n no devāḥ kr̥ṇutā surátnān  asmā́n stotr̥̄́n maruto vāvr̥dhānā́ḥ  ádhi stotrásya sakhyásya gāta  sanā́d dhí vo ratnadhéyāni sánti

translation.text: Gods, send us happiness and make us wealthy, letting us singers prosper, O ye Maruts. Bethink you of our praise and of our friendship: ye from of old have riches to vouchsafe us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॑श्यमस्य मह॒तो म॑हि॒त्वमम॑र्त्यस्य॒ मर्त्या॑सु वि॒क्षु नाना॒ हनू॒ विभृ॑ते॒ सं भ॑रेते॒ असि॑न्वती॒ बप्स॑ती॒ भूर्य॑त्तः
verses.transliteration: ápaśyam asya maható mahitvám  ámartyasya mártyāsu vikṣú  nā́nā hánū víbhr̥te sám bharete  ásinvatī bápsatī bhū́ry attaḥ

translation.text: I HAVE beheld the might of this Great Being. Immortal in the midst of tribes of mortals. His jaws now open and now shut together: much they devour, insatiately chewing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गुहा॒ शिरो॒ निहि॑त॒मृध॑ग॒क्षी असि॑न्वन्नत्ति जि॒ह्वया॒ वना॑नि अत्रा॑ण्यस्मै प॒ड्भिः सं भ॑रन्त्युत्ता॒नह॑स्ता॒ नम॒साधि॑ वि॒क्षु
verses.transliteration: gúhā śíro níhitam ŕ̥dhag akṣī́  ásinvann atti jihváyā vánāni  átrāṇy asmai paḍbhíḥ sám bharanti-  uttānáhastā námasā́dhi vikṣú

translation.text: His eyes are turned away, his head is hidden: unsated with his tongue he eats the fuel. With hands upraised, with reverence in the houses, for him they quickly bring his food together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र मा॒तुः प्र॑त॒रं गुह्य॑मि॒च्छन्कु॑मा॒रो न वी॒रुधः॑ सर्पदु॒र्वीः स॒सं न प॒क्वम॑विदच्छु॒चन्तं॑ रिरि॒ह्वांसं॑ रि॒प उ॒पस्थे॑ अ॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: prá mātúḥ prataráṃ gúhyam ichán  kumāró ná vīrúdhaḥ sarpad urvī́ḥ  sasáṃ ná pakvám avidac chucántaṃ  ririhvā́ṃsaṃ ripá upásthe antáḥ

translation.text: Seeking, as 'twere, his Mother's secret bosom, he, like a child, creeps on through wide-spread bushes. One he finds glowing like hot food made ready, and kissing deep within the earth's recmes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वा॑मृ॒तं रो॑दसी॒ प्र ब्र॑वीमि॒ जाय॑मानो मा॒तरा॒ गर्भो॑ अत्ति नाहं दे॒वस्य॒ मर्त्य॑श्चिकेता॒ग्निर॒ङ्ग विचे॑ताः॒ स प्रचे॑ताः
verses.transliteration: tád vām r̥táṃ rodasī prá bravīmi  jā́yamāno mātárā gárbho atti  nā́háṃ devásya mártyaś ciketa-  -agnír aṅgá vícetāḥ sá prácetāḥ

translation.text: This holy Law I tell you, Earth and Heaven: the Infant at his birth dovours his Parents. No knowledge of the God have I, a mortal. Yea, Agni knoweth best, for he hath wisdom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॑स्मा॒ अन्नं॑ तृ॒ष्वा॒३॒॑दधा॒त्याज्यै॑र्घृ॒तैर्जु॒होति॒ पुष्य॑ति तस्मै॑ स॒हस्र॑म॒क्षभि॒र्वि च॒क्षेऽग्ने॑ वि॒श्वतः॑ प्र॒त्यङ्ङ॑सि॒ त्वम्
verses.transliteration: yó asmā ánnaṃ tr̥ṣv ā̀dádhāti-  ā́jyair ghr̥taír juhóti púṣyati  tásmai sahásram akṣábhir ví cakṣe-  -ágne viśvátaḥ pratyáṅṅ asi tvám

translation.text: This man who quickly gives him food, who offers his gifts of oil and butter and supports him, – Him with his thousand eyes he closely looks on: thou showest him thy face from all sides, Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं दे॒वेषु॒ त्यज॒ एन॑श्चक॒र्थाग्ने॑ पृ॒च्छामि॒ नु त्वामवि॑द्वान् अक्री॑ळ॒न्क्रीळ॒न्हरि॒रत्त॑वे॒ऽदन्वि प॑र्व॒शश्च॑कर्त॒ गामि॑वा॒सिः
verses.transliteration: kíṃ devéṣu tyája énaś cakartha-  -ágne pr̥chā́mi nú tvā́m ávidvān  ákrīḷan krī́ḷan hárir áttave 'dán  ví parvaśáś cakarta gā́m ivāsíḥ

translation.text: Agni, hast thou committed sin or treason among the Gods? In ignorance I ask thee. Playing, not playing, he gold-hued and toothless, hath cut his food up as the knife a victim.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विषू॑चो॒ अश्वा॑न्युयुजे वने॒जा ऋजी॑तिभी रश॒नाभि॑र्गृभी॒तान् च॒क्ष॒दे मि॒त्रो वसु॑भिः॒ सुजा॑तः॒ समा॑नृधे॒ पर्व॑भिर्वावृधा॒नः
verses.transliteration: víṣūco áśvān yuyuje vanejā́ḥ-  ŕ̥jītibhī raśanā́bhir gr̥bhītā́n  cakṣadé mitró vásubhiḥ sújātaḥ  sám ānr̥dhe párvabhir vāvr̥dhānáḥ

translation.text: He born in wood hath yoked his horses rushing in all directions, held with reins that glitter. The well-born friend hath carved his food with Vasus: in all his limbs he hath increased and prospered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निः सप्तिं॑ वाजम्भ॒रं द॑दात्य॒ग्निर्वी॒रं श्रुत्यं॑ कर्मनिः॒ष्ठाम् अ॒ग्नी रोद॑सी॒ वि च॑रत्सम॒ञ्जन्न॒ग्निर्नारीं॑ वी॒रकु॑क्षिं॒ पुरं॑धिम्
verses.transliteration: agníḥ sáptiṃ vājambharáṃ dadāti-  agnír vīráṃ śrútyaṃ karmaniṣṭhā́m  agnī́ ródasī ví carat samañjánn  agnír nā́rīṃ vīrákukṣim púraṃdhim

translation.text: AGNI bestows the fleet prize-winning courser: Agni, the hero famed and firm in duty. Agni pervades and decks the earth and heaven, and fills the fruitful dame who teems with heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्नेरप्न॑सः स॒मिद॑स्तु भ॒द्राग्निर्म॒ही रोद॑सी॒ आ वि॑वेश अ॒ग्निरेकं॑ चोदयत्स॒मत्स्व॒ग्निर्वृ॒त्राणि॑ दयते पु॒रूणि॑
verses.transliteration: agnér ápnasaḥ samíd astu bhadrā́-  -agnír mahī́ ródasī ā́ viveśa  agnír ékaṃ codayat samátsu-  agnír vr̥trā́ṇi dayate purū́ṇi

translation.text: Blest be the wood that feeds the active Agni: within the two great worlds hath Agni entered. Agni impels a single man to battle, and with him rends in pieces many a foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्ह॒ त्यं जर॑तः॒ कर्ण॑मावा॒ग्निर॒द्भ्यो निर॑दह॒ज्जरू॑थम् अ॒ग्निरत्रिं॑ घ॒र्म उ॑रुष्यद॒न्तर॒ग्निर्नृ॒मेधं॑ प्र॒जया॑सृज॒त्सम्
verses.transliteration: agnír ha tyáṃ járataḥ kárṇam āva-  -agnír adbhyó nír adahaj járūtham  agnír átriṃ gharmá uruṣyad antár  agnír nr̥médham prajáyāsr̥jat sám

translation.text: Agni rejoiced the car of him who praised lim, and from the waters burnt away Jarûtha. Agni saved Atri in the fiery cavem, and made Nr̥imedha rich with troops of children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्दा॒द्द्रवि॑णं वी॒रपे॑शा अ॒ग्निर्ऋषिं॒ यः स॒हस्रा॑ स॒नोति॑ अ॒ग्निर्दि॒वि ह॒व्यमा त॑ताना॒ग्नेर्धामा॑नि॒ विभृ॑ता पुरु॒त्रा
verses.transliteration: agnír dād dráviṇaṃ vīrápeśāḥ-  agnír ŕ̥ṣiṃ yáḥ sahásrā sanóti  agnír diví havyám ā́ tatāna-  -agnér dhā́māni víbhr̥tā purutrā́

translation.text: Agni hath granted wealth that decks the hero, and sent the sage who wins a thousand cattle. Agni hath made oblations rise to heaven: to every place are Agni's laws extended.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निमु॒क्थैर्ऋष॑यो॒ वि ह्व॑यन्ते॒ऽग्निं नरो॒ याम॑नि बाधि॒तासः॑ अ॒ग्निं वयो॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ पत॑न्तो॒ऽग्निः स॒हस्रा॒ परि॑ याति॒ गोना॑म्
verses.transliteration: agním ukthaír ŕ̥ṣayo ví hvayante  -agníṃ náro yā́mani bādhitā́saḥ  agníṃ váyo antárikṣe pátanto  -agníḥ sahásrā pári yāti gónām

translation.text: With songs of praise the R̥ishis call on Agni; on Agni, heroes worsted in the foray. Birds flying in the region call on Agni around a thousand cattle Agni wanders.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं विश॑ ईळते॒ मानु॑षी॒र्या अ॒ग्निं मनु॑षो॒ नहु॑षो॒ वि जा॒ताः अ॒ग्निर्गान्ध॑र्वीं प॒थ्या॑मृ॒तस्या॒ग्नेर्गव्यू॑तिर्घृ॒त आ निष॑त्ता
verses.transliteration: agníṃ víśa īḷate mā́nuṣīr yā́ḥ-  agním mánuṣo náhuṣo ví jātā́ḥ  agnír gā́ndharvīm pathyā̀m r̥tásya-  -agnér gávyūtir ghr̥tá ā́ níṣattā

translation.text: Races of human birth pay Agni worship, men who have sprung from Nahus' line adore him. Stablished in holy oil is Agni's pasture, on the Gandharva path of Law and Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्नये॒ ब्रह्म॑ ऋ॒भव॑स्ततक्षुर॒ग्निं म॒हाम॑वोचामा सुवृ॒क्तिम् अग्ने॒ प्राव॑ जरि॒तारं॑ यवि॒ष्ठाग्ने॒ महि॒ द्रवि॑ण॒मा य॑जस्व
verses.transliteration: agnáye bráhma r̥bhávas tatakṣur  agním mahā́m avocāmā suvr̥ktím  ágne prā́va jaritā́raṃ yaviṣṭha-  -ágne máhi dráviṇam ā́ yajasva

translation.text: The R̥ibhus fabricated prayer for Agni, and we with mighty hymns have called on Agni. Agni, Most Youthful God, protect the singer: win us by worship, Agni, great possessions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॒मा विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि॒ जुह्व॒दृषि॒र्होता॒ न्यसी॑दत्पि॒ता नः॑ स आ॒शिषा॒ द्रवि॑णमि॒च्छमा॑नः प्रथम॒च्छदव॑राँ॒ आ वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: yá imā́ víśvā bhúvanāni júhvad  ŕ̥ṣir hótā ny ásīdat pitā́ naḥ  sá āśíṣā dráviṇam ichámānaḥ  prathamachád ávarām̐ ā́ viveśa

translation.text: HE who sate down as Hotar-priest, the R̥ishi, our Father, offering up all things existing,– He, seeking through his wish a great possession, came among men on earth as archetypal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं स्वि॑दासीदधि॒ष्ठान॑मा॒रम्भ॑णं कत॒मत्स्वि॑त्क॒थासी॑त् यतो॒ भूमिं॑ ज॒नय॑न्वि॒श्वक॑र्मा॒ वि द्यामौर्णो॑न्महि॒ना वि॒श्वच॑क्षाः
verses.transliteration: kíṃ svid āsīd adhiṣṭhā́nam  ārámbhaṇaṃ katamát svit kathā́sīt  yáto bhū́miṃ janáyan viśvákarmā  ví dyā́m aúrṇon mahinā́ viśvácakṣāḥ

translation.text: What was the place whereon he took his station? What was it that supported him? How was it? Whence Viṣvakarman, seeing all, producing the earth, with mighty power disclosed the heavens.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्वत॑श्चक्षुरु॒त वि॒श्वतो॑मुखो वि॒श्वतो॑बाहुरु॒त वि॒श्वत॑स्पात् सं बा॒हुभ्यां॒ धम॑ति॒ सं पत॑त्रै॒र्द्यावा॒भूमी॑ ज॒नय॑न्दे॒व एकः॑
verses.transliteration: viśvátaścakṣur utá viśvátomukho  viśvátobāhur utá viśvátaspāt  sám bāhúbhyāṃ dhámati sám pátatrair  dyā́vābhū́mī janáyan devá ékaḥ

translation.text: He who hath eyes on all sides round about him, a mouth on all sides, arms and feet on all sides, He, the Sole God, producing earth and heaven, weldeth them, with his arms as wings, together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं स्वि॒द्वनं॒ क उ॒ स वृ॒क्ष आ॑स॒ यतो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी नि॑ष्टत॒क्षुः मनी॑षिणो॒ मन॑सा पृ॒च्छतेदु॒ तद्यद॒ध्यति॑ष्ठ॒द्भुव॑नानि धा॒रय॑न्
verses.transliteration: kíṃ svid vánaṃ ká u sá vr̥kṣá āsa  yáto dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ niṣṭatakṣúḥ  mánīṣiṇo mánasā pr̥chátéd u tád  yád adhyátiṣṭhad bhúvanāni dhāráyan

translation.text: What was the tree, what wood in sooth produced it, from which they fashioned out the earth and heaven? Ye thoughtful men inquire within your spirit whereon he stood when he established all things.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ते॒ धामा॑नि पर॒माणि॒ याव॒मा या म॑ध्य॒मा वि॑श्वकर्मन्नु॒तेमा शिक्षा॒ सखि॑भ्यो ह॒विषि॑ स्वधावः स्व॒यं य॑जस्व त॒न्वं॑ वृधा॒नः
verses.transliteration: yā́ te dhā́māni paramā́ṇi yā́vamā́  yā́ madhyamā́ viśvakarmann utémā́  śíkṣā sákhibhyo havíṣi svadhāvaḥ  svayáṃ yajasva tanvàṃ vr̥dhānáḥ

translation.text: Nine highest, lowest, sacrificial natures, and these thy mid-most here, O Viṣvakarman, Teach thou thy friends at sacrifice, O Blessed, and come thyself, exalted, to our worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑कर्मन्ह॒विषा॑ वावृधा॒नः स्व॒यं य॑जस्व पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्याम् मुह्य॑न्त्व॒न्ये अ॒भितो॒ जना॑स इ॒हास्माकं॑ म॒घवा॑ सू॒रिर॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: víśvakarman havíṣā vāvr̥dhānáḥ  svayáṃ yajasva pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m  múhyantv anyé abhíto jánāsaḥ-  ihā́smā́kam maghávā sūrír astu

translation.text: Bring thou thyself, exalted with oblation, O Viṣvakarman, Earth and Heaven to worship. Let other men around us live in folly here let us have a rich and liberal patron.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒चस्पतिं॑ वि॒श्वक॑र्माणमू॒तये॑ मनो॒जुवं॒ वाजे॑ अ॒द्या हु॑वेम स नो॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ हव॑नानि जोषद्वि॒श्वश॑म्भू॒रव॑से सा॒धुक॑र्मा
verses.transliteration: vācás pátiṃ viśvákarmāṇam ūtáye  manojúvaṃ vā́je adyā́ huvema  sá no víśvāni hávanāni joṣad  viśváśambhūr ávase sādhúkarmā

translation.text: Let us invoke to-day, to aid our labour, the Lord of Speech, the thought-swift Viṣvakarman. May he hear kindly all our invocations who gives all bliss for aid, whose works are righteous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चक्षु॑षः पि॒ता मन॑सा॒ हि धीरो॑ घृ॒तमे॑ने अजन॒न्नन्न॑माने य॒देदन्ता॒ अद॑दृहन्त॒ पूर्व॒ आदिद्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॑प्रथेताम्
verses.transliteration: cákṣuṣaḥ pitā́ mánasā hí dhī́ro  ghr̥tám ene ajanan nánnamāne  yadéd ántā ádadr̥hanta pū́rve-  ā́d íd dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ aprathetām

translation.text: THE Father of the eye, the Wise in spirit, created both these worlds submerged in fatness. Then when the eastern ends were firmly fastened, the heavens and the earth were far extended.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्वक॑र्मा॒ विम॑ना॒ आद्विहा॑या धा॒ता वि॑धा॒ता प॑र॒मोत सं॒दृक् तेषा॑मि॒ष्टानि॒ समि॒षा म॑दन्ति॒ यत्रा॑ सप्तऋ॒षीन्प॒र एक॑मा॒हुः
verses.transliteration: viśvákarmā vímanā ā́d víhāyāḥ-  dhātā́ vidhātā́ paramótá saṃdŕ̥k  téṣām iṣṭā́ni sám iṣā́ madanti  yátrā saptar̥ṣī́n pará ékam āhúḥ

translation.text: Mighty in mind and power is Viṣvakarman, Maker, Disposer, and most lofty Presence. Their offerings joy in rich juice where they value One, only One, beyond the Seven R̥ishis.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो नः॑ पि॒ता ज॑नि॒ता यो वि॑धा॒ता धामा॑नि॒ वेद॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ यो दे॒वानां॑ नाम॒धा एक॑ ए॒व तं स॑म्प्र॒श्नं भुव॑ना यन्त्य॒न्या
verses.transliteration: yó naḥ pitā́ janitā́ yó vidhātā́  dhā́māni véda bhúvanāni víśvā  yó devā́nāṃ nāmadhā́ éka evá  táṃ sampraśnám bhúvanā yanty anyā́

translation.text: Father who made us, he who, as Disposer, knoweth all races and all things existing, Even he alone, the Deities' narne-giver,him other beings seek for information.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त आय॑जन्त॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ सम॑स्मा॒ ऋष॑यः॒ पूर्वे॑ जरि॒तारो॒ न भू॒ना अ॒सूर्ते॒ सूर्ते॒ रज॑सि निष॒त्ते ये भू॒तानि॑ स॒मकृ॑ण्वन्नि॒मानि॑
verses.transliteration: tá ā́yajanta dráviṇaṃ sám asmai-  ŕ̥ṣayaḥ pū́rve jaritā́ro ná bhūnā́  asū́rte sū́rte rájasi niṣatté  yé bhūtā́ni samákr̥ṇvann imā́ni

translation.text: To him in sacrifice they offered treasures,– R̥ishis of old, in numerous troops, as singers, Who, in the distant, near, and lower region, made ready all these things that have existence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रो दि॒वा प॒र ए॒ना पृ॑थि॒व्या प॒रो दे॒वेभि॒रसु॑रै॒र्यदस्ति॑ कं स्वि॒द्गर्भं॑ प्रथ॒मं द॑ध्र॒ आपो॒ यत्र॑ दे॒वाः स॒मप॑श्यन्त॒ विश्वे॑
verses.transliteration: paró divā́ pará enā́ pr̥thivyā́  paró devébhir ásurair yád ásti  káṃ svid gárbham prathamáṃ dadhra ā́po  yátra devā́ḥ samápaśyanta víśve

translation.text: That which is earlier than this earth and heaven, before the Asuras and Gods had being,– What was the germ primeval which the waters received where all the Gods were seen together?

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमिद्गर्भं॑ प्रथ॒मं द॑ध्र॒ आपो॒ यत्र॑ दे॒वाः स॒मग॑च्छन्त॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒जस्य॒ नाभा॒वध्येक॒मर्पि॑तं॒ यस्मि॒न्विश्वा॑नि॒ भुव॑नानि त॒स्थुः
verses.transliteration: tám íd gárbham prathamáṃ dadhra ā́po  yátra devā́ḥ samágachanta víśve  ajásya nā́bhāv ádhy ékam árpitaṃ  yásmin víśvāni bhúvanāni tasthús

translation.text: The waters, they received that germ primeval wherein the Gods were gathered all together. It rested set upon the Unborn's navel, that One wherein abide all things existing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न तं वि॑दाथ॒ य इ॒मा ज॒जाना॒न्यद्यु॒ष्माक॒मन्त॑रं बभूव नी॒हा॒रेण॒ प्रावृ॑ता॒ जल्प्या॑ चासु॒तृप॑ उक्थ॒शास॑श्चरन्ति
verses.transliteration: ná táṃ vidātha yá imā́ jajā́na-  -anyád yuṣmā́kam ántaram babhūva  nīhāréṇa prā́vr̥tā jálpyā ca-  -asutŕ̥pa ukthaśā́saś caranti

translation.text: Ye will not find him who produced these creatures: another thing hath risen up among you. Enwrapt in misty cloud, with lips that stammer, hymn-chanters wander and are discontented.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॑ म॒न्योऽवि॑धद्वज्र सायक॒ सह॒ ओजः॑ पुष्यति॒ विश्व॑मानु॒षक् सा॒ह्याम॒ दास॒मार्यं॒ त्वया॑ यु॒जा सह॑स्कृतेन॒ सह॑सा॒ सह॑स्वता
verses.transliteration: yás te manyó 'vidhad vajra sāyaka  sáha ójaḥ puṣyati víśvam ānuṣák  sāhyā́ma dā́sam ā́ryaṃ tváyā yujā́  sáhaskr̥tena sáhasā sáhasvatā

translation.text: HE who hath reverenced thee, Manyu, destructive bolt, breeds for himself forthwith all conquering energy. Ârya and Dâsa will we conquer with thine aid, with thee the Conqueror, with conquest conquestsped.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒न्युरिन्द्रो॑ म॒न्युरे॒वास॑ दे॒वो म॒न्युर्होता॒ वरु॑णो जा॒तवे॑दाः म॒न्युं विश॑ ईळते॒ मानु॑षी॒र्याः पा॒हि नो॑ मन्यो॒ तप॑सा स॒जोषाः॑
verses.transliteration: manyúr índro manyúr evā́sa devó  manyúr hótā váruṇo jātávedāḥ  manyúṃ víśa īḷate mā́nuṣīr yā́ḥ  pāhí no manyo tápasā sajóṣāḥ

translation.text: Manyu was Indra, yea, the God, was Manyu, Manyu was Hotar, Varuṇa, Jâtavedas. The tribes of human lineage worship Manyu. Accordant with thy fervour, Manyu, guard us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी॑हि मन्यो त॒वस॒स्तवी॑या॒न्तप॑सा यु॒जा वि ज॑हि॒ शत्रू॑न् अ॒मि॒त्र॒हा वृ॑त्र॒हा द॑स्यु॒हा च॒ विश्वा॒ वसू॒न्या भ॑रा॒ त्वं नः॑
verses.transliteration: abhī̀hi manyo tavásas távīyān  tápasā yujā́ ví jahi śátrūn  amitrahā́ vr̥trahā́ dasyuhā́ ca  víśvā vásūny ā́ bharā tváṃ naḥ

translation.text: Come hither, Manyu, mightier tham the mighty; chase, with thy fervour for ally, our foemen. Slayer of foes, of Vr̥itra, and of Dasyu, bring thou to us all kinds of wealth and treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं हि म॑न्यो अ॒भिभू॑त्योजाः स्वय॒म्भूर्भामो॑ अभिमातिषा॒हः वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिः॒ सहु॑रिः॒ सहा॑वान॒स्मास्वोजः॒ पृत॑नासु धेहि
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hí manyo abhíbhūtyojāḥ  svayambhū́r bhā́mo abhimātiṣāháḥ  viśvácarṣaṇiḥ sáhuriḥ sáhāvān  asmā́sv ójaḥ pŕ̥tanāsu dhehi

translation.text: For thou art, Manyu, of surpassing vigour, fierce, queller of the foe, and self-existent, Shared by all men, victorious, subduer: vouchsafe to us superior strengith in battles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भा॒गः सन्नप॒ परे॑तो अस्मि॒ तव॒ क्रत्वा॑ तवि॒षस्य॑ प्रचेतः तं त्वा॑ मन्यो अक्र॒तुर्जि॑हीळा॒हं स्वा त॒नूर्ब॑ल॒देया॑य॒ मेहि॑
verses.transliteration: abhāgáḥ sánn ápa páreto asmi  táva krátvā taviṣásya pracetaḥ  táṃ tvā manyo akratúr jihīḷāháṃ  svā́ tanū́r baladéyāya méhi

translation.text: I have departed, still without a portion, wise God! according to thy will, the Mighty. I, feeble man, was wroth thee, O Manyu I am myself; come thou to give me vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं ते॑ अ॒स्म्युप॒ मेह्य॒र्वाङ्प्र॑तीची॒नः स॑हुरे विश्वधायः मन्यो॑ वज्रिन्न॒भि मामा व॑वृत्स्व॒ हना॑व॒ दस्यूँ॑रु॒त बो॑ध्या॒पेः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ te asmy úpa méhy arvā́ṅ  pratīcīnáḥ sahure viśvadhāyaḥ  mányo vajrinn abhí mā́m ā́ vavr̥tsva  hánāva dásyūm̐r utá bodhy āpéḥ

translation.text: Come hither. I am all thine own; advancing turn thou to me, Victorious, All-supporter! Come to me, Manyu, Wielder of the Thunder: bethink thee of thy friend, and slay the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि प्रेहि॑ दक्षिण॒तो भ॑वा॒ मेऽधा॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ जङ्घनाव॒ भूरि॑ जु॒होमि॑ ते ध॒रुणं॒ मध्वो॒ अग्र॑मु॒भा उ॑पां॒शु प्र॑थ॒मा पि॑बाव
verses.transliteration: abhí préhi dakṣiṇató bhavā me-  -ádhā vr̥trā́ṇi jaṅghanāva bhū́ri  juhómi te dharúṇam mádhvo ágram  ubhā́ upāṃśú prathamā́ pibāva

translation.text: Approach, and on my right hand hold thy station: so shall we slay a multitude of foemen. The best of meath I offer to support thee: may we be first to drink thereof in quiet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॑ मन्यो स॒रथ॑मारु॒जन्तो॒ हर्ष॑माणासो धृषि॒ता म॑रुत्वः ति॒ग्मेष॑व॒ आयु॑धा सं॒शिशा॑ना अ॒भि प्र य॑न्तु॒ नरो॑ अ॒ग्निरू॑पाः
verses.transliteration: tváyā manyo sarátham ārujánto  hárṣamāṇāso dhr̥ṣitā́ marutvaḥ  tigméṣava ā́yudhā saṃśíśānāḥ-  abhí prá yantu náro agnírūpāḥ

translation.text: BORNE on with thee, O Manyu girt by Maruts, let our brave men, impetuous, bursting forward, March on, like flames of fire in form, exulting, with pointed arrows, sharpening their weapons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निरि॑व मन्यो त्विषि॒तः स॑हस्व सेना॒नीर्नः॑ सहुरे हू॒त ए॑धि ह॒त्वाय॒ शत्रू॒न्वि भ॑जस्व॒ वेद॒ ओजो॒ मिमा॑नो॒ वि मृधो॑ नुदस्व
verses.transliteration: agnír iva manyo tviṣitáḥ sahasva  senānī́r naḥ sahure hūtá edhi  hatvā́ya śátrūn ví bhajasva védaḥ-  ójo mímāno ví mŕ̥dho nudasva

translation.text: Flashing like fire, be thou, O conquering Manyu, invoked, O Victor, as our army's leader. Slay thou our foes, distribute their possessions: show forth thy vigour, scatter those who hate us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सह॑स्व मन्यो अ॒भिमा॑तिम॒स्मे रु॒जन्मृ॒णन्प्र॑मृ॒णन्प्रेहि॒ शत्रू॑न् उ॒ग्रं ते॒ पाजो॑ न॒न्वा रु॑रुध्रे व॒शी वशं॑ नयस एकज॒ त्वम्
verses.transliteration: sáhasva manyo abhímātim asmé  ruján mr̥ṇán pramr̥ṇán préhi śátrūn  ugráṃ te pā́jo nanv ā́ rurudhre  vaśī́ váśaṃ nayasa ekaja tvám

translation.text: O Manyu, overcome thou our assailant on! breaking, slaying, crushing down the foemen. They have not hindered thine impetuous vigour: Mighty, Sole born! thou makest them thy subjects.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एको॑ बहू॒नाम॑सि मन्यवीळि॒तो विशं॑विशं यु॒धये॒ सं शि॑शाधि अकृ॑त्तरु॒क्त्वया॑ यु॒जा व॒यं द्यु॒मन्तं॒ घोषं॑ विज॒याय॑ कृण्महे
verses.transliteration: éko bahūnā́m asi manyav īḷitó  víśaṃ-viśaṃ yudháye sáṃ śiśādhi  ákr̥ttaruk tváyā yujā́ vayáṃ  dyumántaṃ ghóṣaṃ vijayā́ya kr̥ṇmahe

translation.text: Alone or many thou art worshipped, Manyu: sharpen the spirit of each clan for battle. With thee to aid, O thou of perfect splendour, we will uplift the glorious shout for conquest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒जे॒ष॒कृदिन्द्र॑ इवानवब्र॒वो॒३॒॑ऽस्माकं॑ मन्यो अधि॒पा भ॑वे॒ह प्रि॒यं ते॒ नाम॑ सहुरे गृणीमसि वि॒द्मा तमुत्सं॒ यत॑ आब॒भूथ॑
verses.transliteration: vijeṣakŕ̥d índra ivānavabraváḥ-  -asmā́kam manyo adhipā́ bhavehá  priyáṃ te nā́ma sahure gr̥ṇīmasi  vidmā́ tám útsaṃ yáta ābabhū́tha

translation.text: Unyielding bringing victory like Indra, O Manyu, be thou here our Sovran Ruler. To thy dear name, O Victor, we sing praises: we know the spring from which thou art come hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आभू॑त्या सह॒जा व॑ज्र सायक॒ सहो॑ बिभर्ष्यभिभूत॒ उत्त॑रम् क्रत्वा॑ नो मन्यो स॒ह मे॒द्ये॑धि महाध॒नस्य॑ पुरुहूत सं॒सृजि॑
verses.transliteration: ā́bhūtyā sahajā́ vajra sāyaka  sáho bibharṣy abhibhūta úttaram  krátvā no manyo sahá medy èdhi  mahādhanásya puruhūta saṃsŕ̥ji

translation.text: Twin-born with power, destructive bolt of thunder, the highest conquering might is thine, Subduer! Be friendly to its in thy spirit, Manyu, O Much-invoked, in shock of mighty battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: संसृ॑ष्टं॒ धन॑मु॒भयं॑ स॒माकृ॑तम॒स्मभ्यं॑ दत्तां॒ वरु॑णश्च म॒न्युः भियं॒ दधा॑ना॒ हृद॑येषु॒ शत्र॑वः॒ परा॑जितासो॒ अप॒ नि ल॑यन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: sáṃsr̥ṣṭaṃ dhánam ubháyaṃ samā́kr̥tam  asmábhyaṃ dattāṃ váruṇaś ca manyúḥ  bhíyaṃ dádhānā hŕ̥dayeṣu śátravaḥ  párājitāso ápa ní layantām

translation.text: For spoil let Varuṇa and Manyu give us the wealth of both sides gathered and collected; And let our enemies with stricken spirits, o'erwhelmed with terror, slink away defeated.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्येनोत्त॑भिता॒ भूमिः॒ सूर्ये॒णोत्त॑भिता॒ द्यौः ऋ॒तेना॑दि॒त्यास्ति॑ष्ठन्ति दि॒वि सोमो॒ अधि॑ श्रि॒तः
verses.transliteration: satyénóttabhitā bhū́miḥ  sū́ryeṇóttabhitā dyaúḥ  r̥ténādityā́s tiṣṭhanti  diví sómo ádhi śritáḥ

translation.text: TRUTH is the base that bears the earth; by Sûrya are the heavens sustained. By Law the Âdityas stand secure, and Soma holds his place in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमे॑नादि॒त्या ब॒लिनः॒ सोमे॑न पृथि॒वी म॒ही अथो॒ नक्ष॑त्राणामे॒षामु॒पस्थे॒ सोम॒ आहि॑तः
verses.transliteration: sómenādityā́ balínaḥ  sómena pr̥thivī́ mahī́  átho nákṣatrāṇām eṣā́m  upásthe sóma ā́hitaḥ

translation.text: By Soma are the Âdityas strong, by Soma mighty is the earth. Thus Soma in the midst of all these constellations hath his place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमं॑ मन्यते पपि॒वान्यत्स॑म्पिं॒षन्त्योष॑धिम् सोमं॒ यं ब्र॒ह्माणो॑ वि॒दुर्न तस्या॑श्नाति॒ कश्च॒न
verses.transliteration: sómam manyate papivā́n  yát sampiṃṣánty óṣadhim  sómaṃ yám brahmā́ṇo vidúr  ná tásyāśnāti káś caná

translation.text: One thinks, when they have brayed the plant, that he hath drunk the Soma's juice; Of him whom Brahmans truly know as Soma no one ever tastes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒च्छद्वि॑धानैर्गुपि॒तो बार्ह॑तैः सोम रक्षि॒तः ग्राव्णा॒मिच्छृ॒ण्वन्ति॑ष्ठसि॒ न ते॑ अश्नाति॒ पार्थि॑वः
verses.transliteration: āchádvidhānair gupitó  bā́rhataiḥ soma rakṣitáḥ  grā́vṇām íc chr̥ṇván tiṣṭhasi  ná te aśnāti pā́rthivaḥ

translation.text: Soma, secured by sheltering rules, guarded by hymns in Br̥ihatî, Thou standest listening to the stones none tastes of thee who dwells on earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्त्वा॑ देव प्र॒पिब॑न्ति॒ तत॒ आ प्या॑यसे॒ पुनः॑ वा॒युः सोम॑स्य रक्षि॒ता समा॑नां॒ मास॒ आकृ॑तिः
verses.transliteration: yát tvā deva prapíbanti  táta ā́ pyāyase púnaḥ  vāyúḥ sómasya rakṣitā́  sámānām mā́sa ā́kr̥tiḥ

translation.text: When they begin to drink thee then, O God, thou swellest out again. Vâyu is Soma's guardian God. The Moon is that which shapes the years.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रैभ्या॑सीदनु॒देयी॑ नाराशं॒सी न्योच॑नी सू॒र्याया॑ भ॒द्रमिद्वासो॒ गाथ॑यैति॒ परि॑ष्कृतम्
verses.transliteration: raíbhy āsīd anudéyī  nārāśaṃsī́ nyócanī  sūryā́yā bhadrám íd vā́so  gā́thayaiti páriṣkr̥tam

translation.text: Raibhî was her dear bridal friend, and Nârâṣansî led her home. Lovely was Sûryâ's robe: she came to that which Gâthâ had adorned.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चित्ति॑रा उप॒बर्ह॑णं॒ चक्षु॑रा अ॒भ्यञ्ज॑नम् द्यौर्भूमिः॒ कोश॑ आसी॒द्यदया॑त्सू॒र्या पति॑म्
verses.transliteration: cíttir ā upabárhaṇaṃ  cákṣur ā abhyáñjanam  dyaúr bhū́miḥ kóśa āsīd  yád áyāt sūryā́ pátim

translation.text: Thought was the pillow of her couch, sight was the unguent for her eyes: Her treasury was earth and heaven..when Sûryâ went unto her Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तोमा॑ आसन्प्रति॒धयः॑ कु॒रीरं॒ छन्द॑ ओप॒शः सू॒र्याया॑ अ॒श्विना॑ व॒राग्निरा॑सीत्पुरोग॒वः
verses.transliteration: stómā āsan pratidháyaḥ  kurī́raṃ chánda opaśáḥ  sūryā́yā aśvínā varā́-  -agnír āsīt purogaváḥ

translation.text: Hymns were the cross-bars of the pole, Kurîra-metre decked the car: The bridesmen were the Aṣvin Pair Agni was leader of the train.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमो॑ वधू॒युर॑भवद॒श्विना॑स्तामु॒भा व॒रा सू॒र्यां यत्पत्ये॒ शंस॑न्तीं॒ मन॑सा सवि॒ताद॑दात्
verses.transliteration: sómo vadhūyúr abhavad  aśvínāstām ubhā́ varā́  sūryā́ṃ yát pátye śáṃsantīm  mánasā savitā́dadāt

translation.text: Soma was he who wooed the maid: the groomsmen were both Aṣvins, when The Sun-God Savitar bestowed his willing Sûryâ on her Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मनो॑ अस्या॒ अन॑ आसी॒द्द्यौरा॑सीदु॒त च्छ॒दिः शु॒क्राव॑न॒ड्वाहा॑वास्तां॒ यदया॑त्सू॒र्या गृ॒हम्
verses.transliteration: máno asyā ána āsīd  dyaúr āsīd utá chadíḥ  śukrā́v anaḍvā́hāv āstāṃ  yád áyāt sūryā́ gr̥hám

translation.text: Her spirit was the bridal car; the covering thereof was heaven: Bright were both Steers that drew it when Sûryâ approached her husband's, home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒क्सा॒माभ्या॑म॒भिहि॑तौ॒ गावौ॑ ते साम॒नावि॑तः श्रोत्रं॑ ते च॒क्रे आ॑स्तां दि॒वि पन्था॑श्चराचा॒रः
verses.transliteration: r̥ksāmā́bhyām abhíhitau  gā́vau te sāmanā́v itaḥ  śrótraṃ te cakré āstāṃ  diví pánthāś carācaráḥ

translation.text: Thy Steers were steady, kept in place by holy verse and Sâma-hymn: All car were thy two chariot wheels: thy path was tremulous in the sky,

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुची॑ ते च॒क्रे या॒त्या व्या॒नो अक्ष॒ आह॑तः अनो॑ मन॒स्मयं॑ सू॒र्यारो॑हत्प्रय॒ती पति॑म्
verses.transliteration: śúcī te cakré yātyā́ḥ-  vyānó ákṣa ā́hataḥ  áno manasmáyaṃ sūryā́-  -ā́rohat prayatī́ pátim

translation.text: Clean, as thou wentest, were thy wheels wind, was the axle fastened there. Sûryâ, proceeding to her Lord, mounted a spirit-fashioried car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सू॒र्याया॑ वह॒तुः प्रागा॑त्सवि॒ता यम॒वासृ॑जत् अ॒घासु॑ हन्यन्ते॒ गावोऽर्जु॑न्योः॒ पर्यु॑ह्यते
verses.transliteration: sūryā́yā vahatúḥ prā́gāt  savitā́ yám avā́sr̥jat  aghā́su hanyante gā́vaḥ-  -árjunyoḥ páry uhyate

translation.text: The bridal pomp of Sûryâ, which Savitar started, moved along. In Maghâ days are oxen slain, in Arjunîs they wed the bride.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॑श्विना पृ॒च्छमा॑ना॒वया॑तं त्रिच॒क्रेण॑ वह॒तुं सू॒र्यायाः॑ विश्वे॑ दे॒वा अनु॒ तद्वा॑मजानन्पु॒त्रः पि॒तरा॑ववृणीत पू॒षा
verses.transliteration: yád aśvinā pr̥chámānāv áyātaṃ  tricakréṇa vahatúṃ sūryā́yāḥ  víśve devā́ ánu tád vām ajānan  putráḥ pitárāv avr̥ṇīta pūṣā́

translation.text: When on your three-wheeled chariot, O Aṣvins, ye came as wooers unto Sûryâ's bridal, Then all the Gods agreed to your proposal Pûshan as Son elected you as Fathers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदया॑तं शुभस्पती वरे॒यं सू॒र्यामुप॑ क्वैकं॑ च॒क्रं वा॑मासी॒त्क्व॑ दे॒ष्ट्राय॑ तस्थथुः
verses.transliteration: yád áyātaṃ śubhas patī  vareyáṃ sūryā́m úpa  kvaíkaṃ cakráṃ vām āsīt  kvà deṣṭrā́ya tasthathuḥ

translation.text: O ye Two Lords of lustre, then when ye to Sûryâ's wooing came, Where was one chariot wheel of yours? Where stood ye for die Sire's command?

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वे ते॑ च॒क्रे सू॑र्ये ब्र॒ह्माण॑ ऋतु॒था वि॑दुः अथैकं॑ च॒क्रं यद्गुहा॒ तद॑द्धा॒तय॒ इद्वि॑दुः
verses.transliteration: dvé te cakré sūrye  brahmā́ṇa r̥tuthā́ viduḥ  áthaíkaṃ cakráṃ yád gúhā  tád addhātáya íd viduḥ

translation.text: The Brahmans, by their seasons, know, O Sûryâ, those two wheels of thine: One kept concealed, those only who are skilled in highest truths have learned.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सू॒र्यायै॑ दे॒वेभ्यो॑ मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय च ये भू॒तस्य॒ प्रचे॑तस इ॒दं तेभ्यो॑ऽकरं॒ नमः॑
verses.transliteration: sūryā́yai devébhyo  mitrā́ya váruṇāya ca  yé bhūtásya prácetasaḥ-  idáṃ tébhyo 'karaṃ námaḥ

translation.text: To Sûryâ and the Deities, to Mitra and to Varuṇa. Who know aright the thing that is, this adoration have I paid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒र्वा॒प॒रं च॑रतो मा॒ययै॒तौ शिशू॒ क्रीळ॑न्तौ॒ परि॑ यातो अध्व॒रम् विश्वा॑न्य॒न्यो भुव॑नाभि॒चष्ट॑ ऋ॒तूँर॒न्यो वि॒दध॑ज्जायते॒ पुनः॑
verses.transliteration: pūrvāparáṃ carato māyáyaitaú  śíśū krī́ḷantau pári yāto adhvarám  víśvāny anyó bhúvanābhicáṣṭe-  r̥tū́m̐r anyó vidádhaj jāyate púnaḥ

translation.text: By their own power these Twain in close succession move; They go as playing children round the sacrifice. One of the Pair beholdeth all existing things; the other ordereth seasons and is born again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नवो॑नवो भवति॒ जाय॑मा॒नोऽह्नां॑ के॒तुरु॒षसा॑मे॒त्यग्र॑म् भा॒गं दे॒वेभ्यो॒ वि द॑धात्या॒यन्प्र च॒न्द्रमा॑स्तिरते दी॒र्घमायुः॑
verses.transliteration: návo-navo bhavati jā́yamānaḥ-  -áhnāṃ ketúr uṣásām ety ágram  bhāgáṃ devébhyo ví dadhāty āyán  prá candrámās tirate dīrghám ā́yuḥ

translation.text: He, born afresh, is new and new for ever ensign of days he goes before the Mornings Coming, he orders f6r the Gods their portion. The Moon prolongs the days of our existence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒किं॒शु॒कं श॑ल्म॒लिं वि॒श्वरू॑पं॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्णं सु॒वृतं॑ सुच॒क्रम् आ रो॑ह सूर्ये अ॒मृत॑स्य लो॒कं स्यो॒नं पत्ये॑ वह॒तुं कृ॑णुष्व
verses.transliteration: sukiṃśukáṃ śalmalíṃ viśvárūpaṃ  híraṇyavarṇaṃ suvŕ̥taṃ sucakrám  ā́ roha sūrye amŕ̥tasya lokáṃ  syonám pátye vahatúṃ kr̥ṇuṣva

translation.text: Mount this, all-shaped, gold-hued, with strong wheels, fashioned of Kinṣuka and Ṣalmali, lightrolling, Bound for the world of life immortal, Sûryâ: make for thy lord a happy bridal journey.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदी॒र्ष्वातः॒ पति॑वती॒ ह्ये॒३॒॑षा वि॒श्वाव॑सुं॒ नम॑सा गी॒र्भिरी॑ळे अ॒न्यामि॑च्छ पितृ॒षदं॒ व्य॑क्तां॒ स ते॑ भा॒गो ज॒नुषा॒ तस्य॑ विद्धि
verses.transliteration: úd īrṣvā́taḥ pátivatī hy èṣā́  viśvā́vasuṃ námasā gīrbhír īḷe  anyā́m icha pitr̥ṣádaṃ vyàktāṃ  sá te bhāgó janúṣā tásya viddhi

translation.text: Rise up from hence: this maiden hath a husband. I laud Viṣvâvasu with hymns and homage. Seek in her father's home another fair one, and find the portion from of old assigned thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदी॒र्ष्वातो॑ विश्वावसो॒ नम॑सेळा महे त्वा अ॒न्यामि॑च्छ प्रफ॒र्व्यं१॒॑ सं जा॒यां पत्या॑ सृज
verses.transliteration: úd īrṣvā́to viśvāvaso  námaseḷāmahe tvā  anyā́m icha prapharvyàṃ  sáṃ jāyā́m pátyā sr̥ja

translation.text: Rise up from hence, Viṣvâvasu: with reverence we worship thee. Seek thou another willing maid, and with her husband leave the bride.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒नृ॒क्ष॒रा ऋ॒जवः॑ सन्तु॒ पन्था॒ येभिः॒ सखा॑यो॒ यन्ति॑ नो वरे॒यम् सम॑र्य॒मा सं भगो॑ नो निनीया॒त्सं जा॑स्प॒त्यं सु॒यम॑मस्तु देवाः
verses.transliteration: anr̥kṣarā́ r̥jávaḥ santu pánthāḥ-  yébhiḥ sákhāyo yánti no vareyám  sám aryamā́ sám bhágo no ninīyāt  sáṃ jāspatyáṃ suyámam astu devāḥ

translation.text: Straight in direction be the path:s, and thornless, whereon our fellows travel to the wooing. Let Aryaman and Bhaga lead us: perfect, O Gods, the union of the wife and husband.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र त्वा॑ मुञ्चामि॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ पाशा॒द्येन॒ त्वाब॑ध्नात्सवि॒ता सु॒शेवः॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ योनौ॑ सुकृ॒तस्य॑ लो॒केऽरि॑ष्टां त्वा स॒ह पत्या॑ दधामि
verses.transliteration: prá tvā muñcāmi váruṇasya pā́śād  yéna tvā́badhnāt savitā́ suśévaḥ  r̥tásya yónau sukr̥tásya loké  -áriṣṭāṃ tvā sahá pátyā dadhāmi

translation.text: Now from the noose of Varuṇa I free thee, wherewith Most Blessed Savitar hath bound thee. In Law's seat, to the world of virtuous action, I give thee up uninjured with thy consort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेतो मु॒ञ्चामि॒ नामुतः॑ सुब॒द्धाम॒मुत॑स्करम् यथे॒यमि॑न्द्र मीढ्वः सुपु॒त्रा सु॒भगास॑ति
verses.transliteration: prétó muñcā́mi nā́mútaḥ  subaddhā́m amútas karam  yátheyám indra mīḍhvaḥ  suputrā́ subhágā́sati

translation.text: Hence, and not thence, I send these free. I make thee softly fettered there. That, Bounteous Indra, she may live blest in her fortune and her sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒षा त्वे॒तो न॑यतु हस्त॒गृह्या॒श्विना॑ त्वा॒ प्र व॑हतां॒ रथे॑न गृ॒हान्ग॑च्छ गृ॒हप॑त्नी॒ यथासो॑ व॒शिनी॒ त्वं वि॒दथ॒मा व॑दासि
verses.transliteration: pūṣā́ tvetó nayatu hastagŕ̥hya-  -aśvínā tvā prá vahatāṃ ráthena  gr̥hā́n gacha gr̥hápatnī yáthā́so  vaśínī tváṃ vidátham ā́ vadāsi

translation.text: Let Pûshan take thy hand and hence conduct thee; may the two Aṣvins on their car transport thee. Go to the house to be the household's mistress and speak as lady ito thy gathered people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह प्रि॒यं प्र॒जया॑ ते॒ समृ॑ध्यताम॒स्मिन्गृ॒हे गार्ह॑पत्याय जागृहि ए॒ना पत्या॑ त॒न्वं१॒॑ सं सृ॑ज॒स्वाधा॒ जिव्री॑ वि॒दथ॒मा व॑दाथः
verses.transliteration: ihá priyám prajáyā te sám r̥dhyatām  asmín gr̥hé gā́rhapatyāya jāgr̥hi  enā́ pátyā tanvàṃ sáṃ sr̥jasva-  -ádhā jívrī vidátham ā́ vadāthaḥ

translation.text: Happy be thou and prosper with thy children here: be vigilant to rule thy household in this home. Closely unite thy body with this; man, thy lord. So shall ye, full of years, address your company.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नी॒ल॒लो॒हि॒तं भ॑वति कृ॒त्यास॒क्तिर्व्य॑ज्यते एध॑न्ते अस्या ज्ञा॒तयः॒ पति॑र्ब॒न्धेषु॑ बध्यते
verses.transliteration: nīlalohitám bhavati  kr̥tyā́saktír vy àjyate  édhante asyā jñātáyaḥ  pátir bandhéṣu badhyate

translation.text: Her hue is blue and red: the fienod who clingeth close is driven off. Well thrive the kinsmen of this bride the husband is bourid fast in bonds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑ देहि शामु॒ल्यं॑ ब्र॒ह्मभ्यो॒ वि भ॑जा॒ वसु॑ कृ॒त्यैषा प॒द्वती॑ भू॒त्व्या जा॒या वि॑शते॒ पति॑म्
verses.transliteration: párā dehi śāmulyàm  brahmábhyo ví bhajā vásu  kr̥tyaíṣā́ padvátī bhūtvī́-  ā́ jāyā́ viśate pátim

translation.text: Give thou the woollen robe away: deal treasure to the Brahman priests. This female fiend hath got her feet, and as a wife attends her lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒श्री॒रा त॒नूर्भ॑वति॒ रुश॑ती पा॒पया॑मु॒या पति॒र्यद्व॒ध्वो॒३॒॑ वास॑सा॒ स्वमङ्ग॑मभि॒धित्स॑ते
verses.transliteration: aśrīrā́ tanū́r bhavati  rúśatī pāpáyāmuyā́  pátir yád vadhvò vā́sasā  svám áṅgam abhidhítsate

translation.text: Unlovely is his body when it glistens with this wicked fiend, What time the husband wraps about his limbs the garment of his wife.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये व॒ध्व॑श्च॒न्द्रं व॑ह॒तुं यक्ष्मा॒ यन्ति॒ जना॒दनु॑ पुन॒स्तान्य॒ज्ञिया॑ दे॒वा नय॑न्तु॒ यत॒ आग॑ताः
verses.transliteration: yé vadhvàś candráṃ vahatúṃ  yákṣmā yánti jánād ánu  púnas tā́n yajñíyā devā́ḥ-  náyantu yáta ā́gatāḥ

translation.text: Consumptions, from her people, which follow the bride's resplendent train,– These let the Holy Gods again bear to the place from which they came.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा वि॑दन्परिप॒न्थिनो॒ य आ॒सीद॑न्ति॒ दम्प॑ती सु॒गेभि॑र्दु॒र्गमती॑ता॒मप॑ द्रा॒न्त्वरा॑तयः
verses.transliteration: mā́ vidan paripanthíno  yá āsī́danti dámpatī  sugébhir durgám átītām  ápa drāntv árātayaḥ

translation.text: Let not the highway thieves who lie in ambush find the wedded pair. By pleasant ways let them escape the danger, and let foes depart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒म॒ङ्ग॒लीरि॒यं व॒धूरि॒मां स॒मेत॒ पश्य॑त सौभा॑ग्यमस्यै द॒त्त्वायाथास्तं॒ वि परे॑तन
verses.transliteration: sumaṅgalī́r iyáṃ vadhū́r  imā́ṃ saméta páśyata  saúbhāgyam asyai dattvā́ya-  -áthā́staṃ ví páretana

translation.text: Signs of good fortune mark the bride come all of you and look at her. Wish her prosperity, and then return unto your homes again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तृ॒ष्टमे॒तत्कटु॑कमे॒तद॑पा॒ष्ठव॑द्वि॒षव॒न्नैतदत्त॑वे सू॒र्यां यो ब्र॒ह्मा वि॒द्यात्स इद्वाधू॑यमर्हति
verses.transliteration: tr̥ṣṭám etát káṭukam etád  apāṣṭhávad viṣávan naítád áttave  sūryā́ṃ yó brahmā́ vidyā́t  sá íd vā́dhūyam arhati

translation.text: Pungent is this, and bitter this, filled, as it were, with arrow-barbs, Empoisoned and not fit for use. The Brahman who knows Sûryâ well deserves the garment of the bride.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒शस॑नं वि॒शस॑न॒मथो॑ अधिवि॒कर्त॑नम् सू॒र्यायाः॑ पश्य रू॒पाणि॒ तानि॑ ब्र॒ह्मा तु शु॑न्धति
verses.transliteration: āśásanaṃ viśásanam  átho adhivikártanam  sūryā́yāḥ paśya rūpā́ṇi  tā́ni brahmā́ tú śundhati

translation.text: The fringe, the cloth that decks her head, and then the triply parted robe,– Behold the hues which Sûryâ wears these doth the Brahman purify.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गृ॒भ्णामि॑ ते सौभग॒त्वाय॒ हस्तं॒ मया॒ पत्या॑ ज॒रद॑ष्टि॒र्यथासः॑ भगो॑ अर्य॒मा स॑वि॒ता पुरं॑धि॒र्मह्यं॑ त्वादु॒र्गार्ह॑पत्याय दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: gr̥bhṇā́mi te saubhagatvā́ya hástam  máyā pátyā jarádaṣṭir yáthā́saḥ  bhágo aryamā́ savitā́ púraṃdhir  máhyaṃ tvādur gā́rhapatyāya devā́ḥ

translation.text: I take thy hand in mine for happy fortune that thou mayst reach old age with me thy husband. Gods, Aryaman, Bhaga, Savitar, Purandhi, have given thee to be my household's mistress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तां पू॑षञ्छि॒वत॑मा॒मेर॑यस्व॒ यस्यां॒ बीजं॑ मनु॒ष्या॒३॒॑ वप॑न्ति या न॑ ऊ॒रू उ॑श॒ती वि॒श्रया॑ते॒ यस्या॑मु॒शन्तः॑ प्र॒हरा॑म॒ शेप॑म्
verses.transliteration: tā́m pūṣañ chivátamām érayasva  yásyām bī́jam manuṣyā̀ vápanti  yā́ na ūrū́ uśatī́ viśráyāte  yásyām uśántaḥ prahárāma śépam

translation.text: O Pûshan, send her on as most auspicious, her who shall be the sharer of my pleasures; Her who shall twine her loving arms about me, and welcome all my love and mine embraces.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्य॒मग्रे॒ पर्य॑वहन्त्सू॒र्यां व॑ह॒तुना॑ स॒ह पुनः॒ पति॑भ्यो जा॒यां दा अ॑ग्ने प्र॒जया॑ स॒ह
verses.transliteration: túbhyam ágre páry avahan  sūryā́ṃ vahatúnā sahá  púnaḥ pátibhyo jāyā́ṃ  dā́ agne prajáyā sahá

translation.text: For thee, with bridal train, they, first, escorted Sûryâ to her home. Give to the husband in return, Agni, the wife with progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुनः॒ पत्नी॑म॒ग्निर॑दा॒दायु॑षा स॒ह वर्च॑सा दी॒र्घायु॑रस्या॒ यः पति॒र्जीवा॑ति श॒रदः॑ श॒तम्
verses.transliteration: púnaḥ pátnīm agnír adād  ā́yuṣā sahá várcasā  dīrghā́yur asyā yáḥ pátir  jī́vāti śarádaḥ śatám

translation.text: Agni hath given the bride again with splendour and with ample life. Long lived be he who is her lord; a hundred autumns let him live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमः॑ प्रथ॒मो वि॑विदे गन्ध॒र्वो वि॑विद॒ उत्त॑रः तृ॒तीयो॑ अ॒ग्निष्टे॒ पति॑स्तु॒रीय॑स्ते मनुष्य॒जाः
verses.transliteration: sómaḥ prathamó vivide  gandharvó vivida úttaraḥ  tr̥tī́yo agníṣ ṭe pátis  turī́yas te manuṣyajā́ḥ

translation.text: Soma obtained her first of all; next the Gandharva was her lord. Agai was thy third husband: now one bornof woman is thy fourth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमो॑ ददद्गन्ध॒र्वाय॑ गन्ध॒र्वो द॑दद॒ग्नये॑ र॒यिं च॑ पु॒त्राँश्चा॑दाद॒ग्निर्मह्य॒मथो॑ इ॒माम्
verses.transliteration: sómo dadad gandharvā́ya  gandharvó dadad agnáye  rayíṃ ca putrā́ṃś cādād  agnír máhyam átho imā́m

translation.text: Soma to the Gandharva, and to Agni the Gandharva gave: And Agni hath bestowed on me riches and sons and this my spouse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒हैव स्तं॒ मा वि यौ॑ष्टं॒ विश्व॒मायु॒र्व्य॑श्नुतम् क्रीळ॑न्तौ पु॒त्रैर्नप्तृ॑भि॒र्मोद॑मानौ॒ स्वे गृ॒हे
verses.transliteration: ihaívá stam mā́ ví yauṣṭaṃ  víśvam ā́yur vy àśnutam  krī́ḷantau putraír náptr̥bhir  módamānau své gr̥hé

translation.text: Be ye not parted; dwell ye here reach the full time of human life. With sons and grandsons sport and play, rejoicing in your own abode.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नः॑ प्र॒जां ज॑नयतु प्र॒जाप॑तिराजर॒साय॒ सम॑नक्त्वर्य॒मा अदु॑र्मङ्गलीः पतिलो॒कमा वि॑श॒ शं नो॑ भव द्वि॒पदे॒ शं चतु॑ष्पदे
verses.transliteration: ā́ naḥ prajā́ṃ janayatu prajā́patir  ājarasā́ya sám anaktv aryamā́  ádurmaṅgalīḥ patilokám ā́ viśa  śáṃ no bhava dvipáde śáṃ cátuṣpade

translation.text: So may Prajâpati bring children forth to us; may Aryaman adorn us till old age come nigh. Not inauspicious enter thou thy husband's house: bring blessing to our bipeds and our quadrupeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अघो॑रचक्षु॒रप॑तिघ्न्येधि शि॒वा प॒शुभ्यः॑ सु॒मनाः॑ सु॒वर्चाः॑ वी॒र॒सूर्दे॒वका॑मा स्यो॒ना शं नो॑ भव द्वि॒पदे॒ शं चतु॑ष्पदे
verses.transliteration: ághoracakṣur ápatighny edhi  śivā́ paśúbhyaḥ sumánāḥ suvárcāḥ  vīrasū́r devákāmā syonā́  śáṃ no bhava dvipáde śáṃ cátuṣpade

translation.text: Not evil-eyed, no slayer of thy husband, bring weal to cattle, radiant, gentlehearted; Loving the Gods, delightful, bearing heroes, bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां त्वमि॑न्द्र मीढ्वः सुपु॒त्रां सु॒भगां॑ कृणु दशा॑स्यां पु॒त्राना धे॑हि॒ पति॑मेकाद॒शं कृ॑धि
verses.transliteration: imā́ṃ tvám indra mīḍhvaḥ  suputrā́ṃ subhágāṃ kr̥ṇu  dáśāsyām putrā́n ā́ dhehi  pátim ekādaśáṃ kr̥dhi

translation.text: O Bounteous Indra, make this bride blest in her sons and fortunate. Vouchsafe to her ten sons, and make her husband the eleventh man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्राज्ञी॒ श्वशु॑रे भव स॒म्राज्ञी॑ श्व॒श्र्वां भ॑व नना॑न्दरि स॒म्राज्ञी॑ भव स॒म्राज्ञी॒ अधि॑ दे॒वृषु॑
verses.transliteration: samrā́jñī śváśure bhava  samrā́jñī śvaśrvā́m bhava  nánāndari samrā́jñī bhava  samrā́jñī ádhi devŕ̥ṣu

translation.text: Over thy husband's father and thy husband's mother bear full sway. Over the sister of thy lord, over his brothers rule supreme.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॑ञ्जन्तु॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वाः समापो॒ हृद॑यानि नौ सं मा॑त॒रिश्वा॒ सं धा॒ता समु॒ देष्ट्री॑ दधातु नौ
verses.transliteration: sám añjantu víśve devā́ḥ  sám ā́po hŕ̥dayāni nau  sám mātaríśvā sáṃ dhātā́  sám u déṣṭrī dadhātu nau

translation.text: So may the Universal Gods, so may the Waters join our hearts. May Mâtariṣvan, Dhatar, and Destri together bind us close.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि हि सोतो॒रसृ॑क्षत॒ नेन्द्रं॑ दे॒वम॑मंसत यत्राम॑दद्वृ॒षाक॑पिर॒र्यः पु॒ष्टेषु॒ मत्स॑खा॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: ví hí sótor ásr̥kṣata  néndraṃ devám amaṃsata  yátrā́madad vr̥ṣā́kapir  aryáḥ puṣṭéṣu mátsakhā  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: MEN have abstained from pouring juice they count not Indra as a God. Where at the votary's store my friend Vr̥ishâkapi hath drunk his fill. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॒ ही॑न्द्र॒ धाव॑सि वृ॒षाक॑पे॒रति॒ व्यथिः॑ नो अह॒ प्र वि॑न्दस्य॒न्यत्र॒ सोम॑पीतये॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: párā hī̀ndra dhā́vasi  vr̥ṣā́kaper áti vyáthiḥ  nó áha prá vindasi-  anyátra sómapītaye  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Thou, Indra, heedless passest by the ill Vr̥ishâkapi hath wrought; Yet nowhere else thou findest place wherein to drink the Soma juice. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किम॒यं त्वां वृ॒षाक॑पिश्च॒कार॒ हरि॑तो मृ॒गः यस्मा॑ इर॒स्यसीदु॒ न्व१॒॑र्यो वा॑ पुष्टि॒मद्वसु॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: kím ayáṃ tvā́ṃ vr̥ṣā́kapiś  cakā́ra hárito mr̥gáḥ  yásmā irasyásī́d u nú-  -aryó vā puṣṭimád vásu  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: What hath he done to injure thee, this tawny beast Vr̥ishâkapi, With whom thou art so angry now? What is the votary's foodful store? Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमि॒मं त्वं वृ॒षाक॑पिं प्रि॒यमि॑न्द्राभि॒रक्ष॑सि श्वा न्व॑स्य जम्भिष॒दपि॒ कर्णे॑ वराह॒युर्विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: yám imáṃ tváṃ vr̥ṣā́kapim  priyám indrābhirákṣasi  śvā́ nv àsya jambhiṣad  ápi kárṇe varāhayúr  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Soon may the hound who hunts the boar seize him and bite him in the car, O Indra, that Vr̥ishâkapi whom thou protectest as a friend, Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रि॒या त॒ष्टानि॑ मे क॒पिर्व्य॑क्ता॒ व्य॑दूदुषत् शिरो॒ न्व॑स्य राविषं॒ न सु॒गं दु॒ष्कृते॑ भुवं॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: priyā́ taṣṭā́ni me kapír  vyàktā vy àdūduṣat  śíro nv àsya rāviṣaṃ  ná sugáṃ duṣkŕ̥te bhuvaṃ  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Kapi hath marred the beauteous things, all deftly wrought, that were my joy. In pieces will I rend his head; the sinner's portion sball be woo. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न मत्स्त्री सु॑भ॒सत्त॑रा॒ न सु॒याशु॑तरा भुवत् न मत्प्रति॑च्यवीयसी॒ न सक्थ्युद्य॑मीयसी॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: ná mát strī́ subhasáttarā  ná suyā́śutarā bhuvat  ná mát práticyavīyasī  ná sákthy údyamīyasī  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: No Dame hath ampler charms than I, or greater wealth of love's delights. None with more ardour offers all her beauty to her lord's embrace. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒वे अ॑म्ब सुलाभिके॒ यथे॑वा॒ङ्ग भ॑वि॒ष्यति॑ भ॒सन्मे॑ अम्ब॒ सक्थि॑ मे॒ शिरो॑ मे॒ वी॑व हृष्यति॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: uvé amba sulābhike  yáthevāṅgá bhaviṣyáti  bhasán me amba sákthi me  śíro me vī̀va hr̥ṣyati  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Mother whose love is quickly wibn, I say what verily will be. My,breast, O Mother, and my head and both my hips seem quivering. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं सु॑बाहो स्वङ्गुरे॒ पृथु॑ष्टो॒ पृथु॑जाघने किं शू॑रपत्नि न॒स्त्वम॒भ्य॑मीषि वृ॒षाक॑पिं॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: kíṃ subāho svaṅgure  pŕ̥thuṣṭo pŕ̥thujāghane  kíṃ śūrapatni nas tvám  abhy àmīṣi vr̥ṣā́kapiṃ  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Dame with the lovely hands and arms, with broad hair-plaits add ample hips, Why, O thou Hero's wife, art thou angry with our Vr̥ishâkapi? Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वीरा॑मिव॒ माम॒यं श॒रारु॑र॒भि म॑न्यते उ॒ताहम॑स्मि वी॒रिणीन्द्र॑पत्नी म॒रुत्स॑खा॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: avī́rām iva mā́m ayáṃ  śarā́rur abhí manyate  utā́hám asmi vīríṇī-  -índrapatnī marútsakhā  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: This noxious creature looks on me as one bereft of hero's love, Yet Heroes for my sons have I, the Maruts' Friend and Indra's Queen. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं॒हो॒त्रं स्म॑ पु॒रा नारी॒ सम॑नं॒ वाव॑ गच्छति वे॒धा ऋ॒तस्य॑ वी॒रिणीन्द्र॑पत्नी महीयते॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: saṃhotráṃ sma purā́ nā́rī  sámanaṃ vā́va gachati  vedhā́ r̥tásya vīríṇī-  -índrapatnī mahīyate  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: From olden time the matron goes to feast and general sacrifice. Mother of Heroes, Indra's Queen, the rite's ordainer is extolled. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒न्द्रा॒णीमा॒सु नारि॑षु सु॒भगा॑म॒हम॑श्रवम् न॒ह्य॑स्या अप॒रं च॒न ज॒रसा॒ मर॑ते॒ पति॒र्विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: indrāṇī́m āsú nā́riṣu  subhágām ahám aśravam  nahy àsyā aparáṃ caná  jarásā márate pátir  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: So have I heard Indrâṇî called most fortunate among these Dames, For never shall her Consort die in future time through length of days. Supreme is Indra overall.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाहमि॑न्द्राणि रारण॒ सख्यु॑र्वृ॒षाक॑पेर्ऋ॒ते यस्ये॒दमप्यं॑ ह॒विः प्रि॒यं दे॒वेषु॒ गच्छ॑ति॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: nā́hám indrāṇi rāraṇa  sákhyur vr̥ṣā́kaper r̥té  yásyedám ápyaṃ havíḥ  priyáṃ devéṣu gáchati  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Never, Indrâṇî, have I joyed without my friend Vr̥ishâkapi, Whose welcome offering here, made pure with water, goeth to the Gods. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॑कपायि॒ रेव॑ति॒ सुपु॑त्र॒ आदु॒ सुस्नु॑षे घस॑त्त॒ इन्द्र॑ उ॒क्षणः॑ प्रि॒यं का॑चित्क॒रं ह॒विर्विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣākapāyi révati  súputra ā́d u súsnuṣe  ghásat ta índra ukṣáṇaḥ  priyáṃ kācitkaráṃ havír  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Wealthy Vrsakapayi, blest with sons and consorts of thy sons, Indra will eat thy bulls, thy dear oblation that effecteth much. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्ष्णो हि मे॒ पञ्च॑दश सा॒कं पच॑न्ति विंश॒तिम् उ॒ताहम॑द्मि॒ पीव॒ इदु॒भा कु॒क्षी पृ॑णन्ति मे॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: ukṣṇó hí me páñcadaśa  sākám pácanti viṃśatím  utā́hám admi pī́va íd  ubhā́ kukṣī́ pr̥ṇanti me  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Fifteen in number, then, for me a score of bullocks they prepare, And I devour the fat thereof: they fill my belly full with food. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒ष॒भो न ति॒ग्मशृ॑ङ्गो॒ऽन्तर्यू॒थेषु॒ रोरु॑वत् म॒न्थस्त॑ इन्द्र॒ शं हृ॒दे यं ते॑ सु॒नोति॑ भाव॒युर्विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: vr̥ṣabhó ná tigmáśr̥ṅgo  -antár yūthéṣu róruvat  manthás ta indra śáṃ hr̥dé  yáṃ te sunóti bhāvayúr  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Like as a bull with pointed horn, loud bellowing amid the herds, Sweet to thine heart, O Indra, is the brew which she who tends thee pours. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न सेशे॒ यस्य॒ रम्ब॑तेऽन्त॒रा स॒क्थ्या॒३॒॑ कपृ॑त् सेदी॑शे॒ यस्य॑ रोम॒शं नि॑षे॒दुषो॑ वि॒जृम्भ॑ते॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: ná séśe yásya rámbate  -antarā́ sakthyā̀ kápr̥t  séd īśe yásya romaśáṃ  niṣedúṣo vijŕ̥mbhate  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: [Griffith: "I pass over stanzas 16 and 17, which I cannot translate into decent English."]

verses.sanskrit_deva: न सेशे॒ यस्य॑ रोम॒शं नि॑षे॒दुषो॑ वि॒जृम्भ॑ते सेदी॑शे॒ यस्य॒ रम्ब॑तेऽन्त॒रा स॒क्थ्या॒३॒॑ कपृ॒द्विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: ná séśe yásya romaśáṃ  niṣedúṣo vijŕ̥mbhate  séd īśe yásya rámbate  -antarā́ sakthyā̀ kápr̥t  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: [Griffith: "I pass over stanzas 16 and 17, which I cannot translate into decent English."]

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमि॑न्द्र वृ॒षाक॑पिः॒ पर॑स्वन्तं ह॒तं वि॑दत् अ॒सिं सू॒नां नवं॑ च॒रुमादेध॒स्यान॒ आचि॑तं॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: ayám indra vr̥ṣā́kapiḥ  párasvantaṃ hatáṃ vidat  asíṃ sūnā́ṃ návaṃ carúm  ā́d édhasyā́na ā́citaṃ  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: O Indra this Vr̥ishâkapi hath found a slain wild animal, Dresser, and new-made pan, and knife, and wagon with a load of wood. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमे॑मि वि॒चाक॑शद्विचि॒न्वन्दास॒मार्य॑म् पिबा॑मि पाक॒सुत्व॑नो॒ऽभि धीर॑मचाकशं॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: ayám emi vicā́kaśad  vicinván dā́sam ā́ryam  píbāmi pākasútvano  -abhí dhī́ram acākaśaṃ  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Distinguishing the Dâsa and the Ârya, viewing all, I go. I look upon the wise, and drink the simple votary's Soma juice. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धन्व॑ च॒ यत्कृ॒न्तत्रं॑ च॒ कति॑ स्वि॒त्ता वि योज॑ना नेदी॑यसो वृषाक॒पेऽस्त॒मेहि॑ गृ॒हाँ उप॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: dhánva ca yát kr̥ntátraṃ ca  káti svit tā́ ví yójanā  nédīyaso vr̥ṣākape-  -ástam éhi gr̥hā́m̐ úpa  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: The desert plains and steep descents, how many leagues in length they spread! Go to the nearest houses, go unto thine home, Vr̥ishâkapi. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुन॒रेहि॑ वृषाकपे सुवि॒ता क॑ल्पयावहै य ए॒ष स्व॑प्न॒नंश॒नोऽस्त॒मेषि॑ प॒था पुन॒र्विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: púnar éhi vr̥ṣākape  suvitā́ kalpayāvahai  yá eṣá svapnanáṃśanaḥ-  -ástam éṣi pathā́ púnar  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Turn thee again Vr̥ishâkapi: we twain will bring thee happiness. Thou goest homeward on thy way along this path which leads to sleep. Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदुद॑ञ्चो वृषाकपे गृ॒हमि॒न्द्राज॑गन्तन क्व१॒॑ स्य पु॑ल्व॒घो मृ॒गः कम॑गञ्जन॒योप॑नो॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: yád údañco vr̥ṣākape  gr̥hám indrā́jagantana  kvà syá pulvaghó mr̥gáḥ  kám agañ janayópano  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: When, Indra and Vr̥ishâkapi, ye travelled upward to your home, Where was that noisome beast, to whom went it, the beast that troubles man? Supreme is Indra over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पर्शु॑र्ह॒ नाम॑ मान॒वी सा॒कं स॑सूव विंश॒तिम् भ॒द्रं भ॑ल॒ त्यस्या॑ अभू॒द्यस्या॑ उ॒दर॒माम॑य॒द्विश्व॑स्मा॒दिन्द्र॒ उत्त॑रः
verses.transliteration: párśur ha nā́ma mānavī́  sākáṃ sasūva viṃśatím  bhadrám bhala tyásyā abhūd  yásyā udáram ā́mayad  víśvasmād índra úttaraḥ

translation.text: Daughter of Manu, Parṣu bare a score of children at a birth. Her portion verily was bliss although her burthen caused her grief.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒क्षो॒हणं॑ वा॒जिन॒मा जि॑घर्मि मि॒त्रं प्रथि॑ष्ठ॒मुप॑ यामि॒ शर्म॑ शिशा॑नो अ॒ग्निः क्रतु॑भिः॒ समि॑द्धः॒ स नो॒ दिवा॒ स रि॒षः पा॑तु॒ नक्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: rakṣoháṇaṃ vājínam ā́ jigharmi  mitrám práthiṣṭham úpa yāmi śárma  śíśāno agníḥ krátubhiḥ sámiddhaḥ  sá no dívā sá riṣáḥ pātu náktam

translation.text: I BALM with oil the mighty Raksas-slayer; to the most famous Friend I come for shelter Enkindled, sharpened by our rites, may Agni protect us in the day and night from evil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अयो॑दंष्ट्रो अ॒र्चिषा॑ यातु॒धाना॒नुप॑ स्पृश जातवेदः॒ समि॑द्धः आ जि॒ह्वया॒ मूर॑देवान्रभस्व क्र॒व्यादो॑ वृ॒क्त्व्यपि॑ धत्स्वा॒सन्
verses.transliteration: áyodaṃṣṭro arcíṣā yātudhā́nān  úpa spr̥śa jātavedaḥ sámiddhaḥ  ā́ jihváyā mū́radevān rabhasva  kravyā́do vr̥ktvy ápi dhatsvāsán

translation.text: O Jâtavedas with the teeth of iron, enkindled with thy flame attack the demons. Seize with thy longue the foolish gods' adorers: rend, put within thy mouth the raw-flesh caters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भोभ॑यावि॒न्नुप॑ धेहि॒ दंष्ट्रा॑ हिं॒स्रः शिशा॒नोऽव॑रं॒ परं॑ च उ॒तान्तरि॑क्षे॒ परि॑ याहि राज॒ञ्जम्भैः॒ सं धे॑ह्य॒भि या॑तु॒धाना॑न्
verses.transliteration: ubhóbhayāvinn úpa dhehi dáṃṣṭrā  hiṃsráḥ śíśānó 'varam páraṃ ca  utā́ntárikṣe pári yāhi rājañ  jámbhaiḥ sáṃ dhehy abhí yātudhā́nān

translation.text: Apply thy teeth, the upper and the lower, thou who hast both, enkindled and destroying. Roam also in the air, O King, around us, and with thy jaws assail the wicked spirits.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञैरिषूः॑ सं॒नम॑मानो अग्ने वा॒चा श॒ल्याँ अ॒शनि॑भिर्दिहा॒नः ताभि॑र्विध्य॒ हृद॑ये यातु॒धाना॑न्प्रती॒चो बा॒हून्प्रति॑ भङ्ध्येषाम्
verses.transliteration: yajñaír íṣūḥ saṃnámamāno agne  vācā́ śalyā́m̐ aśánibhir dihānáḥ  tā́bhir vidhya hŕ̥daye yātudhā́nān  pratīcó bāhū́n práti bhaṅdhy eṣām

translation.text: Bending thy shafts through sacrifices, Agni, whetting their points with song as if with whetstones, Pierce to the heart therewith the Yatudhanas, and break their arms uplifed to attack thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ त्वचं॑ यातु॒धान॑स्य भिन्धि हिं॒स्राशनि॒र्हर॑सा हन्त्वेनम् प्र पर्वा॑णि जातवेदः शृणीहि क्र॒व्यात्क्र॑वि॒ष्णुर्वि चि॑नोतु वृ॒क्णम्
verses.transliteration: ágne tvácaṃ yātudhā́nasya bhindhi  hiṃsrā́śánir hárasā hantv enam  prá párvāṇi jātavedaḥ śr̥ṇīhi  kravyā́t kraviṣṇúr ví cinotu vr̥kṇám

translation.text: Pierce through the Yatudhana's skin, O Agni; let the destroying dart with fire consume him. Rend his joints, Jâtavedas, let the cater of flesh, flesh-seeking, track his mangled body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्रे॒दानीं॒ पश्य॑सि जातवेद॒स्तिष्ठ॑न्तमग्न उ॒त वा॒ चर॑न्तम् यद्वा॒न्तरि॑क्षे प॒थिभिः॒ पत॑न्तं॒ तमस्ता॑ विध्य॒ शर्वा॒ शिशा॑नः
verses.transliteration: yátredā́nīm páśyasi jātavedas  tíṣṭhantam agna utá vā cárantam  yád vāntárikṣe pathíbhiḥ pátantaṃ  tám ástā vidhya śárvā śíśānaḥ

translation.text: Where now thou seest Agni Jâtavedas, one of these demons standing still or roaming, Or flying on those paths in air's midregion, sharpen the shaft and as an archer pierce him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ताल॑ब्धं स्पृणुहि जातवेद आलेभा॒नादृ॒ष्टिभि॑र्यातु॒धाना॑त् अग्ने॒ पूर्वो॒ नि ज॑हि॒ शोशु॑चान आ॒मादः॒ क्ष्विङ्का॒स्तम॑द॒न्त्वेनीः॑
verses.transliteration: utā́labdhaṃ spr̥ṇuhi jātavedaḥ-  ālebhānā́d r̥ṣṭíbhir yātudhā́nāt  ágne pū́rvo ní jahi śóśucānaḥ-  āmā́daḥ kṣvíṅkās tám adantv énīḥ

translation.text: Tear from the evil spirit, Jâtavedas, what he hath seized and with his spears hath captured. Blazing before him strike him down, O Agni; let spotted carrion-eating kites devour him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह प्र ब्रू॑हि यत॒मः सो अ॑ग्ने॒ यो या॑तु॒धानो॒ य इ॒दं कृ॒णोति॑ तमा र॑भस्व स॒मिधा॑ यविष्ठ नृ॒चक्ष॑स॒श्चक्षु॑षे रन्धयैनम्
verses.transliteration: ihá prá brūhi yatamáḥ só agne  yó yātudhā́no yá idáṃ kr̥ṇóti  tám ā́ rabhasva samídhā yaviṣṭha  nr̥cákṣasaś cákṣuṣe randhayainam

translation.text: Here tell this forth, O Agni: whosoever is, he himself, or acteth as, a demon, Him grasp, O thou Most Youthful, with thy fuel. to the Mati-seer's eye give him as booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ती॒क्ष्णेना॑ग्ने॒ चक्षु॑षा रक्ष य॒ज्ञं प्राञ्चं॒ वसु॑भ्यः॒ प्र ण॑य प्रचेतः हिं॒स्रं रक्षां॑स्य॒भि शोशु॑चानं॒ मा त्वा॑ दभन्यातु॒धाना॑ नृचक्षः
verses.transliteration: tīkṣṇénāgne cákṣuṣā rakṣa yajñám  prā́ñcaṃ vásubhyaḥ prá ṇaya pracetaḥ  hiṃsráṃ rákṣāṃsy abhí śóśucānam  mā́ tvā dabhan yātudhā́nā nr̥cakṣaḥ

translation.text: With keen glance guard the sacrifice, O Agni: thou Sage, conduct it onward to the Vasus. Let not the fiends, O Man-beholder, harm thee burning against the Raksasas to slay them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृ॒चक्षा॒ रक्षः॒ परि॑ पश्य वि॒क्षु तस्य॒ त्रीणि॒ प्रति॑ शृणी॒ह्यग्रा॑ तस्या॑ग्ने पृ॒ष्टीर्हर॑सा शृणीहि त्रे॒धा मूलं॑ यातु॒धान॑स्य वृश्च
verses.transliteration: nr̥cákṣā rákṣaḥ pári paśya vikṣú  tásya trī́ṇi práti śr̥ṇīhy ágrā  tásyāgne pr̥ṣṭī́r hárasā śr̥ṇīhi  tredhā́ mū́laṃ yātudhā́nasya vr̥śca

translation.text: Look on the fiend mid men, as Man-beholder: rend thou his three extremities in pieces. Demolish with thy flame his ribs, O Agni, the Yatudhana's root destroy thou triply.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर्या॑तु॒धानः॒ प्रसि॑तिं त एत्वृ॒तं यो अ॑ग्ने॒ अनृ॑तेन॒ हन्ति॑ तम॒र्चिषा॑ स्फू॒र्जय॑ञ्जातवेदः सम॒क्षमे॑नं गृण॒ते नि वृ॑ङ्धि
verses.transliteration: trír yātudhā́naḥ prásitiṃ ta etu-  r̥táṃ yó agne ánr̥tena hánti  tám arcíṣā sphūrjáyañ jātavedaḥ  samakṣám enaṃ gr̥ṇaté ní vr̥ṅdhi

translation.text: Thrice, Agni, let thy noose surround the demon who with his falsehood injures Holy Order. Loud roaring with thy flame, O Jâtavedas, crush him and cast him down before the singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद॑ग्ने॒ चक्षुः॒ प्रति॑ धेहि रे॒भे श॑फा॒रुजं॒ येन॒ पश्य॑सि यातु॒धान॑म् अ॒थ॒र्व॒वज्ज्योति॑षा॒ दैव्ये॑न स॒त्यं धूर्व॑न्तम॒चितं॒ न्यो॑ष
verses.transliteration: tád agne cákṣuḥ práti dhehi rebhé  śaphārújaṃ yéna páśyasi yātudhā́nam  atharvaváj jyótiṣā daívyena  satyáṃ dhū́rvantam acítaṃ ny òṣa

translation.text: Lead thou the worshipper that eye, O Agni, wherewith thou lookest on the hoof-armed demon. With light celestial in Atharvan's manner burn up the foot who ruins truth with falsehood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॑ग्ने अ॒द्य मि॑थु॒ना शपा॑तो॒ यद्वा॒चस्तृ॒ष्टं ज॒नय॑न्त रे॒भाः म॒न्योर्मन॑सः शर॒व्या॒३॒॑ जाय॑ते॒ या तया॑ विध्य॒ हृद॑ये यातु॒धाना॑न्
verses.transliteration: yád agne adyá mithunā́ śápāto  yád vācás tr̥ṣṭáṃ janáyanta rebhā́ḥ  manyór mánasaḥ śaravyā̀ jā́yate yā́  táyā vidhya hŕ̥daye yātudhā́nān

translation.text: Agni, what curse the pair this day have uttered, what heated word the worshippers have spoken, Each arrowy taunt sped from the angry spirit,– pierce to the heart therewith the Yatudhanas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑ शृणीहि॒ तप॑सा यातु॒धाना॒न्परा॑ग्ने॒ रक्षो॒ हर॑सा शृणीहि परा॒र्चिषा॒ मूर॑देवाञ्छृणीहि॒ परा॑सु॒तृपो॑ अ॒भि शोशु॑चानः
verses.transliteration: párā śr̥ṇīhi tápasā yātudhā́nān  párāgne rákṣo hárasā śr̥ṇīhi  párārcíṣā mū́radevāñ chr̥ṇīhi  párāsutŕ̥po abhí śóśucānaḥ

translation.text: With fervent heat exterminate the demons; destroy the fiends with burning flame, O Agni. Destroy with fire the foolish gods' adorers; blaze and destrepy the insatiable monsters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॒द्य दे॒वा वृ॑जि॒नं शृ॑णन्तु प्र॒त्यगे॑नं श॒पथा॑ यन्तु तृ॒ष्टाः वा॒चास्ते॑नं॒ शर॑व ऋच्छन्तु॒ मर्म॒न्विश्व॑स्यैतु॒ प्रसि॑तिं यातु॒धानः॑
verses.transliteration: párādyá devā́ vr̥jináṃ śr̥ṇantu  pratyág enaṃ śapáthā yantu tr̥ṣṭā́ḥ  vācā́stenaṃ śárava r̥chantu márman  víśvasyaitu prásitiṃ yātudhā́naḥ

translation.text: May Gods destroy this day the evil-doer may each hot curse of his return and blast him. Let arrows pierce the liar in his vitals, and Viṣva's net enclose the Yatudhana.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः पौरु॑षेयेण क्र॒विषा॑ सम॒ङ्क्ते यो अश्व्ये॑न प॒शुना॑ यातु॒धानः॑ यो अ॒घ्न्याया॒ भर॑ति क्षी॒रम॑ग्ने॒ तेषां॑ शी॒र्षाणि॒ हर॒सापि॑ वृश्च
verses.transliteration: yáḥ paúruṣeyeṇa kravíṣā samaṅkté  yó áśvyena paśúnā yātudhā́naḥ  yó aghnyā́yā bhárati kṣīrám agne  téṣāṃ śīrṣā́ṇi hárasā́pi vr̥śca

translation.text: The fiend who smears himself with flesh of cattle, with flesh of horses and of human bodies, Who steals the milch-cow's milk away, O Agni,– tear off the heads of such with fiery fury.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं॒व॒त्स॒रीणं॒ पय॑ उ॒स्रिया॑या॒स्तस्य॒ माशी॑द्यातु॒धानो॑ नृचक्षः पी॒यूष॑मग्ने यत॒मस्तितृ॑प्सा॒त्तं प्र॒त्यञ्च॑म॒र्चिषा॑ विध्य॒ मर्म॑न्
verses.transliteration: saṃvatsarī́ṇam páya usríyāyās  tásya mā́śīd yātudhā́no nr̥cakṣaḥ  pīyū́ṣam agne yatamás títr̥psāt  tám pratyáñcam arcíṣā vidhya márman

translation.text: The cow gives milk each year, O Man-regarder: let not the Yatudhana ever taste it. If one would glut him with the biesting, Agni, pierce with thy flame his vitals as he meets thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒षं गवां॑ यातु॒धानाः॑ पिब॒न्त्वा वृ॑श्च्यन्ता॒मदि॑तये दु॒रेवाः॑ परै॑नान्दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता द॑दातु॒ परा॑ भा॒गमोष॑धीनां जयन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: viṣáṃ gávāṃ yātudhā́nāḥ pibantu-  ā́ vr̥ścyantām áditaye durévāḥ  párainān deváḥ savitā́ dadātu  párā bhāgám óṣadhīnāṃ jayantām

translation.text: Let the fiends drink the poison of the cattle; may Aditi cast off the evildoers. May the God Savitar give them up to ruin, and be their share of plants and herbs denied them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒नाद॑ग्ने मृणसि यातु॒धाना॒न्न त्वा॒ रक्षां॑सि॒ पृत॑नासु जिग्युः अनु॑ दह स॒हमू॑रान्क्र॒व्यादो॒ मा ते॑ हे॒त्या मु॑क्षत॒ दैव्या॑याः
verses.transliteration: sanā́d agne mr̥ṇasi yātudhā́nān  ná tvā rákṣāṃsi pŕ̥tanāsu jigyuḥ  ánu daha sahámūrān kravyā́do  mā́ te hetyā́ mukṣata daívyāyāḥ

translation.text: Agni, from days of old thou slayest demons: never shall Raksasas in fight o'ercome thee. Burn up the foolish ones, the flesh-devourers: let none of them escape thine heavenly arrow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ अग्ने अध॒रादुद॑क्ता॒त्त्वं प॒श्चादु॒त र॑क्षा पु॒रस्ता॑त् प्रति॒ ते ते॑ अ॒जरा॑स॒स्तपि॑ष्ठा अ॒घशं॑सं॒ शोशु॑चतो दहन्तु
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no agne adharā́d údaktāt  tvám paścā́d utá rakṣā purástāt  práti té te ajárāsas tápiṣṭhāḥ-  agháśaṃsaṃ śóśucato dahantu

translation.text: Guard us, O Agni, from above and under, protect us fl-om behind us and before us; And may thy flames, most fierce and never wasting, glowing with fervent heat, consume the sinner.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒श्चात्पु॒रस्ता॑दध॒रादुद॑क्तात्क॒विः काव्ये॑न॒ परि॑ पाहि राजन् सखे॒ सखा॑यम॒जरो॑ जरि॒म्णेऽग्ने॒ मर्ताँ॒ अम॑र्त्य॒स्त्वं नः॑
verses.transliteration: paścā́t purástād adharā́d údaktāt  kavíḥ kā́vyena pári pāhi rājan  sákhe sákhāyam ajáro jarimṇé  -ágne mártām̐ ámartyas tváṃ naḥ

translation.text: From rear, from front, from under, from above us, O King, protect us as a Sage with wisdom. Guard to old age thy friend, O Friend, Eternal: O Agni, as Immortal, guard us mortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ त्वाग्ने॒ पुरं॑ व॒यं विप्रं॑ सहस्य धीमहि धृ॒षद्व॑र्णं दि॒वेदि॑वे ह॒न्तारं॑ भङ्गु॒राव॑ताम्
verses.transliteration: pári tvāgne púraṃ vayáṃ  vípraṃ sahasya dhīmahi  dhr̥ṣádvarṇaṃ divé-dive  hantā́ram bhaṅgurā́vatām

translation.text: We set thee round us as a fort, victorious Agni, thee a Sage, Of hero lineage, day by day, destroyer of our treacherous foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒षेण॑ भङ्गु॒राव॑तः॒ प्रति॑ ष्म र॒क्षसो॑ दह अग्ने॑ ति॒ग्मेन॑ शो॒चिषा॒ तपु॑रग्राभिर्ऋ॒ष्टिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: viṣéṇa bhaṅgurā́vataḥ  práti ṣma rakṣáso daha  ágne tigména śocíṣā  tápuragrābhir r̥ṣṭíbhiḥ

translation.text: Burn with thy poison turned against the treacherous brood of Raksasas, O Agni, with thy sharpened glow, with lances armed with points of flame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्य॑ग्ने मिथु॒ना द॑ह यातु॒धाना॑ किमी॒दिना॑ सं त्वा॑ शिशामि जागृ॒ह्यद॑ब्धं विप्र॒ मन्म॑भिः
verses.transliteration: práty agne mithunā́ daha  yātudhā́nā kimīdínā  sáṃ tvā śiśāmi jāgr̥hí-  ádabdhaṃ vipra mánmabhiḥ

translation.text: Burn thou the paired Kimîdins, brun, Agni, the Yatudhana pairs. I sharpen thee, Infallible, with hymns. O Sage, be vigilant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्य॑ग्ने॒ हर॑सा॒ हरः॑ शृणी॒हि वि॒श्वतः॒ प्रति॑ या॒तु॒धान॑स्य र॒क्षसो॒ बलं॒ वि रु॑ज वी॒र्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: práty agne hárasā háraḥ  śr̥ṇīhí viśvátaḥ práti  yātudhā́nasya rakṣáso  bálaṃ ví ruja vīryàm

translation.text: Shoot forth, O Agni, with thy flame demolish them on every side. Break thou the Yatudhana's strength, the vigour of the Raksasa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह॒विष्पान्त॑म॒जरं॑ स्व॒र्विदि॑ दिवि॒स्पृश्याहु॑तं॒ जुष्ट॑म॒ग्नौ तस्य॒ भर्म॑णे॒ भुव॑नाय दे॒वा धर्म॑णे॒ कं स्व॒धया॑ पप्रथन्त
verses.transliteration: havíṣ pā́ntam ajáraṃ svarvídi  divispŕ̥śy ā́hutaṃ júṣṭam agnaú  tásya bhármaṇe bhúvanāya devā́ḥ-  dhármaṇe káṃ svadháyā paprathanta

translation.text: DEAR, ageless sacrificial drink is offered in light-discovering, heaven-pervading Agni. The Gods spread forth through his Celestial Nature, that he might bear the world up and sustain it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गी॒र्णं भुव॑नं॒ तम॒साप॑गूळ्हमा॒विः स्व॑रभवज्जा॒ते अ॒ग्नौ तस्य॑ दे॒वाः पृ॑थि॒वी द्यौरु॒तापोऽर॑णय॒न्नोष॑धीः स॒ख्ये अ॑स्य
verses.transliteration: gīrṇám bhúvanaṃ támasā́pagūḷham  āvíḥ svàr abhavaj jāté agnaú  tásya devā́ḥ pr̥thivī́ dyaúr utā́paḥ-  -áraṇayann óṣadhīḥ sakhyé asya

translation.text: The world was swallowed and concealed in darkness: Agni was born, and light became apparent. The Deities, the broad earth, and the heavens, and plants, and waters gloried in his friendship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वेभि॒र्न्वि॑षि॒तो य॒ज्ञिये॑भिर॒ग्निं स्तो॑षाण्य॒जरं॑ बृ॒हन्त॑म् यो भा॒नुना॑ पृथि॒वीं द्यामु॒तेमामा॑त॒तान॒ रोद॑सी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम्
verses.transliteration: devébhir nv ìṣitó yajñíyebhir  agníṃ stoṣāṇy ajáram br̥hántam  yó bhānúnā pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m utémā́m  ātatā́na ródasī antárikṣam

translation.text: Inspired by Gods who claim our adoration, I now will laud Eternal Lofty Agni, Him who hath spread abroad the earth with lustre, this heaven, and both the worlds, and air's midregion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो होतासी॑त्प्रथ॒मो दे॒वजु॑ष्टो॒ यं स॒माञ्ज॒न्नाज्ये॑ना वृणा॒नाः स प॑त॒त्री॑त्व॒रं स्था जग॒द्यच्छ्वा॒त्रम॒ग्निर॑कृणोज्जा॒तवे॑दाः
verses.transliteration: yó hótā́sīt prathamó devájuṣṭo  yáṃ samā́ñjann ā́jyenā vr̥ṇānā́ḥ  sá patatrī̀tvaráṃ sthā́ jágad yác  -śvātrám agnír akr̥ṇoj jātávedāḥ

translation.text: Earliest Priest whom all the Gods accepted, and chose him, and anointed him with butter, He swiftly made all things that fly, stand, travel, all that hath motion, Agni Jâtavedas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यज्जा॑तवेदो॒ भुव॑नस्य मू॒र्धन्नति॑ष्ठो अग्ने स॒ह रो॑च॒नेन॑ तं त्वा॑हेम म॒तिभि॑र्गी॒र्भिरु॒क्थैः स य॒ज्ञियो॑ अभवो रोदसि॒प्राः
verses.transliteration: yáj jātavedo bhúvanasya mūrdhánn  átiṣṭho agne sahá rocanéna  táṃ tvāhema matíbhir gīrbhír ukthaíḥ  sá yajñíyo abhavo rodasiprā́ḥ

translation.text: Because thou, Agni, Jâtavedas, stoodest at the world's head with thy refulgent splendour, We sent thee forth with hymns and songs and praises: thou filledst heaven and earth, God meet for worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मू॒र्धा भु॒वो भ॑वति॒ नक्त॑म॒ग्निस्ततः॒ सूर्यो॑ जायते प्रा॒तरु॒द्यन् मा॒यामू॒ तु य॒ज्ञिया॑नामे॒तामपो॒ यत्तूर्णि॒श्चर॑ति प्रजा॒नन्
verses.transliteration: mūrdhā́ bhuvó bhavati náktam agnís  tátaḥ sū́ryo jāyate prātár udyán  māyā́m ū tú yajñíyānām etā́m  ápo yát tū́rṇiś cárati prajānán

translation.text: Head of the world is Agni in the night-time; then, as the Sun, at morn springs up and rises. Then to his task goes the prompt Priest foreknowing the wondrous power of Gods who must be honoured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दृ॒शेन्यो॒ यो म॑हि॒ना समि॒द्धोऽरो॑चत दि॒वियो॑निर्वि॒भावा॑ तस्मि॑न्न॒ग्नौ सू॑क्तवा॒केन॑ दे॒वा ह॒विर्विश्व॒ आजु॑हवुस्तनू॒पाः
verses.transliteration: dr̥śényo yó mahinā́ sámiddhaḥ-  -árocata divíyonir vibhā́vā  tásminn agnaú sūktavākéna devā́ḥ-  havír víśva ā́juhavus tanūpā́ḥ

translation.text: Lovely is he who, kindled in his greatness, hath shone forth, seated in the heavens, refulgent. With resonant hymns all Gods who guard our bodies have offered up oblation in this Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सू॒क्त॒वा॒कं प्र॑थ॒ममादिद॒ग्निमादिद्ध॒विर॑जनयन्त दे॒वाः स ए॑षां य॒ज्ञो अ॑भवत्तनू॒पास्तं द्यौर्वे॑द॒ तं पृ॑थि॒वी तमापः॑
verses.transliteration: sūktavākám prathamám ā́d íd agním  ā́d íd dhavír ajanayanta devā́ḥ  sá eṣāṃ yajñó abhavat tanūpā́s  táṃ dyaúr veda tám pr̥thivī́ tám ā́paḥ

translation.text: First the Gods brought the hymnal into being; then they engendered Agni, then oblation. He was their satrifice that guards our bodies: him the heavens know, the earth, the waters know him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं दे॒वासोऽज॑नयन्ता॒ग्निं यस्मि॒न्नाजु॑हवु॒र्भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ सो अ॒र्चिषा॑ पृथि॒वीं द्यामु॒तेमामृ॑जू॒यमा॑नो अतपन्महि॒त्वा
verses.transliteration: yáṃ devā́só 'janayantāgníṃ  yásminn ā́juhavur bhúvanāni víśvā  só arcíṣā pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m utémā́m  r̥jūyámāno atapan mahitvā́

translation.text: He, Agni, whom the Gods have generated, in whom they offered up all worlds and creatures, He with his bright glow heated earth and heaven, urging himself right onward in his grandeur.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तोमे॑न॒ हि दि॒वि दे॒वासो॑ अ॒ग्निमजी॑जन॒ञ्छक्ति॑भी रोदसि॒प्राम् तमू॑ अकृण्वन्त्रे॒धा भु॒वे कं स ओष॑धीः पचति वि॒श्वरू॑पाः
verses.transliteration: stómena hí diví devā́so agním  ájījanañ cháktibhī rodasiprā́m  tám ū akr̥ṇvan tredhā́ bhuvé káṃ  sá óṣadhīḥ pacati viśvárūpāḥ

translation.text: Then by the laud the Gods engendered Agni in heaven, who fills both worlds through strength and vigour. They made him to appear in threefold essence: he ripens plants of every form and nature.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒देदे॑न॒मद॑धुर्य॒ज्ञिया॑सो दि॒वि दे॒वाः सूर्य॑मादिते॒यम् य॒दा च॑रि॒ष्णू मि॑थु॒नावभू॑ता॒मादित्प्राप॑श्य॒न्भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: yadéd enam ádadhur yajñíyāso  diví devā́ḥ sū́ryam āditeyám  yadā́ cariṣṇū́ mithunā́v ábhūtām  ā́d ít prā́paśyan bhúvanāni víśvā

translation.text: What time the Gods, whose due is worship, set him as Sûrya, Son of Aditi, in heaven, When the Pair, ever wandering, sprang to being, all creatures that existed looked upon them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑स्मा अ॒ग्निं भुव॑नाय दे॒वा वै॑श्वान॒रं के॒तुमह्ना॑मकृण्वन् आ यस्त॒तानो॒षसो॑ विभा॒तीरपो॑ ऊर्णोति॒ तमो॑ अ॒र्चिषा॒ यन्
verses.transliteration: víśvasmā agním bhúvanāya devā́ḥ-  vaiśvānaráṃ ketúm áhnām akr̥ṇvan  ā́ yás tatā́noṣáso vibhātī́r  ápo ūrṇoti támo arcíṣā yán

translation.text: For all the world of life the Gods made Agni Vaiṣvânara to be the days' bright Banner,– Him who hath spread abroad the radiant Mornings, and, coming with his light, unveils the darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रं क॒वयो॑ य॒ज्ञिया॑सो॒ऽग्निं दे॒वा अ॑जनयन्नजु॒र्यम् नक्ष॑त्रं प्र॒त्नममि॑नच्चरि॒ष्णु य॒क्षस्याध्य॑क्षं तवि॒षं बृ॒हन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānaráṃ kaváyo yajñíyāso  -agníṃ devā́ ajanayann ajuryám  nákṣatram pratnám áminac cariṣṇú  yakṣásyā́dhyakṣaṃ taviṣám br̥hántam

translation.text: The wise and holy Deities engendered Agni Vaiṣvânara whom age ne'er touches. The Ancient Star that wanders on for ever, lofty and. strong, Lord of the Living Being.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रं वि॒श्वहा॑ दीदि॒वांसं॒ मन्त्रै॑र॒ग्निं क॒विमच्छा॑ वदामः यो म॑हि॒म्ना प॑रिब॒भूवो॒र्वी उ॒तावस्ता॑दु॒त दे॒वः प॒रस्ता॑त्
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānaráṃ viśváhā dīdivā́ṃsam  mántrair agníṃ kavím áchā vadāmaḥ  yó mahimnā́ paribabhū́vorvī́  utā́vástād utá deváḥ parástāt

translation.text: We call upon the Sage with holy verses, Agni Vaiṣvânara the ever-beaming, Who hath surpassed both heaven and earth in greatness: lie is a God below, a God above us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वे स्रु॒ती अ॑शृणवं पितॄ॒णाम॒हं दे॒वाना॑मु॒त मर्त्या॑नाम् ताभ्या॑मि॒दं विश्व॒मेज॒त्समे॑ति॒ यद॑न्त॒रा पि॒तरं॑ मा॒तरं॑ च
verses.transliteration: dvé srutī́ aśr̥ṇavam pitr̥̄ṇā́m  aháṃ devā́nām utá mártyānām  tā́bhyām idáṃ víśvam éjat sám eti  yád antarā́ pitáram mātáraṃ ca

translation.text: I have heard mention of two several pathways, ways of the Fathers and of Gods and mortals. On these two paths each moving creature travels, each thing between the Father and the Mother.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वे स॑मी॒ची बि॑भृत॒श्चर॑न्तं शीर्ष॒तो जा॒तं मन॑सा॒ विमृ॑ष्टम् स प्र॒त्यङ्विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि तस्था॒वप्र॑युच्छन्त॒रणि॒र्भ्राज॑मानः
verses.transliteration: dvé samīcī́ bibhr̥taś cárantaṃ  śīrṣató jātám mánasā vímr̥ṣṭam  sá pratyáṅ víśvā bhúvanāni tasthāv  áprayuchan taráṇir bhrā́jamānaḥ

translation.text: These two united paths bear him who journeys born from the head and pondered with the spirit He stands directed to all things existing, hasting, unresting in his fiery splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्रा॒ वदे॑ते॒ अव॑रः॒ पर॑श्च यज्ञ॒न्योः॑ कत॒रो नौ॒ वि वे॑द आ शे॑कु॒रित्स॑ध॒मादं॒ सखा॑यो॒ नक्ष॑न्त य॒ज्ञं क इ॒दं वि वो॑चत्
verses.transliteration: yátrā vádete ávaraḥ páraś ca  yajñanyòḥ kataró nau ví veda  ā́ śekur ít sadhamā́daṃ sákhāyo  nákṣanta yajñáṃ ká idáṃ ví vocat

translation.text: Which of us twain knows where they speak together, upper and lower of the two rite-leaders? Our friends have helped to gather our assembly. They came to sacrifice; who will announce it?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कत्य॒ग्नयः॒ कति॒ सूर्या॑सः॒ कत्यु॒षासः॒ कत्यु॑ स्वि॒दापः॑ नोप॒स्पिजं॑ वः पितरो वदामि पृ॒च्छामि॑ वः कवयो वि॒द्मने॒ कम्
verses.transliteration: káty agnáyaḥ káti sū́ryāsaḥ  káty uṣā́saḥ káty u svid ā́paḥ  nópaspíjaṃ vaḥ pitaro vadāmi  pr̥chā́mi vaḥ kavayo vidmáne kám

translation.text: How many are the Fires and Suns in number? What is the number of the Dawns and Waters? Not jestingly I speak to you, O Fathers. Sages, I ask you this for information.
