verses.sanskrit_deva: या॒व॒न्मा॒त्रमु॒षसो॒ न प्रती॑कं सुप॒र्ण्यो॒३॒॑ वस॑ते मातरिश्वः ताव॑द्दधा॒त्युप॑ य॒ज्ञमा॒यन्ब्रा॑ह्म॒णो होतु॒रव॑रो नि॒षीद॑न्
verses.transliteration: yāvanmātrám uṣáso ná prátīkaṃ  suparṇyò vásate mātariśvaḥ  tā́vad dadhāty úpa yajñám āyán  brāhmaṇó hótur ávaro niṣī́dan

translation.text: As great as is the fair-winged Morning's presence to him who dwells beside us, Mâtariṣvan! Is what the Brahman does when he approaches to sacrifice and sits below the Hotar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॑ स्तवा॒ नृत॑मं॒ यस्य॑ म॒ह्ना वि॑बबा॒धे रो॑च॒ना वि ज्मो अन्ता॑न् आ यः प॒प्रौ च॑र्षणी॒धृद्वरो॑भिः॒ प्र सिन्धु॑भ्यो रिरिचा॒नो म॑हि॒त्वा
verses.transliteration: índraṃ stavā nŕ̥tamaṃ yásya mahnā́  vibabādhé rocanā́ ví jmó ántān  ā́ yáḥ papraú carṣaṇīdhŕ̥d várobhiḥ  prá síndhubhyo riricānó mahitvā́

translation.text: I WILL extol the most heroic Indra who with his might forced earth and sky asunder; Who hath filled all with width as man's Upholder, surpassing floods and rivers in his greatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सूर्यः॒ पर्यु॒रू वरां॒स्येन्द्रो॑ ववृत्या॒द्रथ्ये॑व च॒क्रा अति॑ष्ठन्तमप॒स्यं१॒॑ न सर्गं॑ कृ॒ष्णा तमां॑सि॒ त्विष्या॑ जघान
verses.transliteration: sá sū́ryaḥ páry urū́ várāṃsi-  éndro vavr̥tyād ráthyeva cakrā́  átiṣṭhantam apasyàṃ ná sárgaṃ  kr̥ṣṇā́ támāṃsi tvíṣyā jaghāna

translation.text: Sûrya is he: throughout the wide expanses shall Indra turn him, swift as car-wheels, hither, Like a stream resting not but ever active he hath destroyed, with light, the blackhued darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नम॑स्मा॒ अन॑पावृदर्च क्ष्म॒या दि॒वो अस॑मं॒ ब्रह्म॒ नव्य॑म् वि यः पृ॒ष्ठेव॒ जनि॑मान्य॒र्य इन्द्र॑श्चि॒काय॒ न सखा॑यमी॒षे
verses.transliteration: samānám asmā ánapāvr̥d arca  kṣmayā́ divó ásamam bráhma návyam  ví yáḥ pr̥ṣṭhéva jánimāny aryáḥ-  índraś cikā́ya ná sákhāyam īṣé

translation.text: To him I sing a holy prayer, incessant new, matchless, common to the earth and heaven, Who marks, as they were backs, all living creatures: ne'er doth he fail a friend, the noble Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य॒ गिरो॒ अनि॑शितसर्गा अ॒पः प्रेर॑यं॒ सग॑रस्य बु॒ध्नात् यो अक्षे॑णेव च॒क्रिया॒ शची॑भि॒र्विष्व॑क्त॒स्तम्भ॑ पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्याम्
verses.transliteration: índrāya gíro ániśitasargāḥ-  apáḥ prérayaṃ ságarasya budhnā́t  yó ákṣeṇeva cakríyā śácībhir  víṣvak tastámbha pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m

translation.text: I will send forth my songs in flow unceasing, like water from the ocean's depth, to Indra. Who to his car on both its sides securely hath fixed the earth and heaven as with an axle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपा॑न्तमन्युस्तृ॒पल॑प्रभर्मा॒ धुनिः॒ शिमी॑वा॒ञ्छरु॑माँ ऋजी॒षी सोमो॒ विश्वा॑न्यत॒सा वना॑नि॒ नार्वागिन्द्रं॑ प्रति॒माना॑नि देभुः
verses.transliteration: ā́pāntamanyus tr̥pálaprabharmā  dhúniḥ śímīvāñ chárumām̐ r̥jīṣī́  sómo víśvāny atasā́ vánāni  nā́rvā́g índram pratimā́nāni debhuḥ

translation.text: Rousing with draughts, the Shaker, rushing onward, impetuous, very strong, armed as with arrows Is Soma; forest trees and all the bushes deceive not Indra with their offered likeness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यस्य॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी न धन्व॒ नान्तरि॑क्षं॒ नाद्र॑यः॒ सोमो॑ अक्षाः यद॑स्य म॒न्युर॑धिनी॒यमा॑नः शृ॒णाति॑ वी॒ळु रु॒जति॑ स्थि॒राणि॑
verses.transliteration: ná yásya dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ná dhánva  nā́ntárikṣaṃ nā́drayaḥ sómo akṣāḥ  yád asya manyúr adhinīyámānaḥ  śr̥ṇā́ti vīḷú rujáti sthirā́ṇi

translation.text: Soma hath flowed to him whom naught can equal, the earth, the heavens, the firmament, the mountains,– When heightened in his ire his indignation shatters the firm and breaks the strong in pieces.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒घान॑ वृ॒त्रं स्वधि॑ति॒र्वने॑व रु॒रोज॒ पुरो॒ अर॑द॒न्न सिन्धू॑न् बि॒भेद॑ गि॒रिं नव॒मिन्न कु॒म्भमा गा इन्द्रो॑ अकृणुत स्व॒युग्भिः॑
verses.transliteration: jaghā́na vr̥tráṃ svádhitir váneva  rurója púro áradan ná síndhūn  bibhéda giríṃ návam ín ná kumbhám  ā́ gā́ índro akr̥ṇuta svayúgbhiḥ

translation.text: As an axe fells the tree so be slew Vr̥itra, brake down the strongholds and dug out the rivers. He cleft the mountain like a new-made pitcher. Indra brought forth the kine with his Companions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह॒ त्यदृ॑ण॒या इ॑न्द्र॒ धीरो॒ऽसिर्न पर्व॑ वृजि॒ना शृ॑णासि प्र ये मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धाम॒ युजं॒ न जना॑ मि॒नन्ति॑ मि॒त्रम्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ ha tyád r̥ṇayā́ indra dhī́ro  -asír ná párva vr̥jinā́ śr̥ṇāsi  prá yé mitrásya váruṇasya dhā́ma  yújaṃ ná jánā minánti mitrám

translation.text: Wise art thou, Punisher of guilt, O Indra. The sword lops limbs, thou smitest down the sinner, The men who injure, as it were a comrade, the lofty Law of Varuṇa and Mitra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये मि॒त्रं प्रार्य॒मणं॑ दु॒रेवाः॒ प्र सं॒गिरः॒ प्र वरु॑णं मि॒नन्ति॑ न्य१॒॑मित्रे॑षु व॒धमि॑न्द्र॒ तुम्रं॒ वृष॒न्वृषा॑णमरु॒षं शि॑शीहि
verses.transliteration: prá yé mitrám prā́ryamáṇaṃ durévāḥ  prá saṃgíraḥ prá váruṇam minánti  ny àmítreṣu vadhám indra túmraṃ  vŕ̥ṣan vŕ̥ṣāṇam aruṣáṃ śiśīhi

translation.text: Men who lead evil lives, who break agreements, and injure Varuṇa, Aryaman and Mitra,– Against these foes, O Mighty Indra, sharpen, as furious death, thy Bull of fiery colour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ दि॒व इन्द्र॑ ईशे पृथि॒व्या इन्द्रो॑ अ॒पामिन्द्र॒ इत्पर्व॑तानाम् इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒धामिन्द्र॒ इन्मेधि॑राणा॒मिन्द्रः॒ क्षेमे॒ योगे॒ हव्य॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: índro divá índra īśe pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  índro apā́m índra ít párvatānām  índro vr̥dhā́m índra ín médhirāṇām  índraḥ kṣéme yóge hávya índraḥ

translation.text: Indra is Sovran Lord of Earth and Heaven, Indra is Lord of waters and of mountains. Indra is Lord of prosperers and sages Indra must be invoked in rest and effort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्राक्तुभ्य॒ इन्द्रः॒ प्र वृ॒धो अह॑भ्यः॒ प्रान्तरि॑क्षा॒त्प्र स॑मु॒द्रस्य॑ धा॒सेः प्र वात॑स्य॒ प्रथ॑सः॒ प्र ज्मो अन्ता॒त्प्र सिन्धु॑भ्यो रिरिचे॒ प्र क्षि॒तिभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: prā́ktúbhya índraḥ prá vr̥dhó áhabhyaḥ  prā́ntárikṣāt prá samudrásya dhāséḥ  prá vā́tasya práthasaḥ prá jmó ántāt  prá síndhubhyo ririce prá kṣitíbhyaḥ

translation.text: Vaster than days and nights, Giver of increase, vaster than firmament and flood of ocean, Vaster than bounds of earth and wind's extension, vaster than rivers and our lands is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र शोशु॑चत्या उ॒षसो॒ न के॒तुर॑सि॒न्वा ते॑ वर्ततामिन्द्र हे॒तिः अश्मे॑व विध्य दि॒व आ सृ॑जा॒नस्तपि॑ष्ठेन॒ हेष॑सा॒ द्रोघ॑मित्रान्
verses.transliteration: prá śóśucatyā uṣáso ná ketúr  asinvā́ te vartatām indra hetíḥ  áśmeva vidhya divá ā́ sr̥jānás  tápiṣṭhena héṣasā dróghamitrān

translation.text: Forward, as herald of refulgent Morning, let thine insatiate arrow fly, O Indra. And pierce, as 'twere a stone launched forth from heaven, with hottest blaze the men who love deception.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अन्वह॒ मासा॒ अन्विद्वना॒न्यन्वोष॑धी॒रनु॒ पर्व॑तासः अन्विन्द्रं॒ रोद॑सी वावशा॒ने अन्वापो॑ अजिहत॒ जाय॑मानम्
verses.transliteration: ánv áha mā́sā ánv íd vánāni-  ánv óṣadhīr ánu párvatāsaḥ  ánv índraṃ ródasī vāvaśāné  ánv ā́po ajihata jā́yamānam

translation.text: Him, verily, the moons, the mountains followed, the tall trees followed and the plants and herbage. Yearning with love both Worlds approached, the Waters waited on Indra when he first had being.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कर्हि॑ स्वि॒त्सा त॑ इन्द्र चे॒त्यास॑द॒घस्य॒ यद्भि॒नदो॒ रक्ष॒ एष॑त् मि॒त्र॒क्रुवो॒ यच्छस॑ने॒ न गावः॑ पृथि॒व्या आ॒पृग॑मु॒या शय॑न्ते
verses.transliteration: kárhi svit sā́ ta indra cetyā́sad  aghásya yád bhinádo rákṣa éṣat  mitrakrúvo yác chásane ná gā́vaḥ  pr̥thivyā́ āpŕ̥g amuyā́ śáyante

translation.text: Where was the vengeful dart when thou, O Indra, clavest the demon ever beat on outrage? When fiends lay there upon the ground extended like cattle in the place of immolation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒त्रू॒यन्तो॑ अ॒भि ये न॑स्तत॒स्रे महि॒ व्राध॑न्त ओग॒णास॑ इन्द्र अ॒न्धेना॒मित्रा॒स्तम॑सा सचन्तां सुज्यो॒तिषो॑ अ॒क्तव॒स्ताँ अ॒भि ष्युः॑
verses.transliteration: śatrūyánto abhí yé nas tatasré  máhi vrā́dhanta ogaṇā́sa indra  andhénāmítrās támasā sacantāṃ  sujyotíṣo aktávas tā́m̐ abhí ṣyuḥ

translation.text: Those who are set in enmity against us, the Oganas, O Indra, waxen mighty,– Let blinding darkness follow those our fbemen, while these shall have bright shining nights to light them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रूणि॒ हि त्वा॒ सव॑ना॒ जना॑नां॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ मन्द॑न्गृण॒तामृषी॑णाम् इ॒मामा॒घोष॒न्नव॑सा॒ सहू॑तिं ति॒रो विश्वाँ॒ अर्च॑तो याह्य॒र्वाङ्
verses.transliteration: purū́ṇi hí tvā sávanā jánānām  bráhmāṇi mándan gr̥ṇatā́m ŕ̥ṣīṇām  imā́m āghóṣann ávasā sáhūtiṃ  tiró víśvām̐ árcato yāhy arvā́ṅ

translation.text: May plentiful libations of the people, and singing R̥ishis' holy prayers rejoice thee. Hearing with love this common invocation, come unto us, pass by all those who praise thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा ते॑ व॒यमि॑न्द्र भुञ्जती॒नां वि॒द्याम॑ सुमती॒नां नवा॑नाम् वि॒द्याम॒ वस्तो॒रव॑सा गृ॒णन्तो॑ वि॒श्वामि॑त्रा उ॒त त॑ इन्द्र नू॒नम्
verses.transliteration: evā́ te vayám indra bhuñjatīnā́ṃ  vidyā́ma sumatīnā́ṃ návānām  vidyā́ma vástor ávasā gr̥ṇánto  viśvā́mitrā utá ta indra nūnám

translation.text: O Indra, thus may we be made partakers of thy new favours that shall bring us profit. Singing with love, may we the Viṣvâmitras win daylight even now through thee, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑शीर्षा॒ पुरु॑षः सहस्रा॒क्षः स॒हस्र॑पात् स भूमिं॑ वि॒श्वतो॑ वृ॒त्वात्य॑तिष्ठद्दशाङ्गु॒लम्
verses.transliteration: sahásraśīrṣā púruṣaḥ  sahasrākṣáḥ sahásrapāt  sá bhū́miṃ viśváto vr̥tvā́-  -áty atiṣṭhad daśāṅgulám

translation.text: A THOUSAND heads hath Purusha, a thousand eyes, a thousand feet. On every side pervading earth he fills a space ten fingers wide.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुरु॑ष ए॒वेदं सर्वं॒ यद्भू॒तं यच्च॒ भव्य॑म् उ॒तामृ॑त॒त्वस्येशा॑नो॒ यदन्ने॑नाति॒रोह॑ति
verses.transliteration: púruṣa evédáṃ sárvaṃ  yád bhūtáṃ yác ca bhávyam  utā́mr̥tatvásyéśāno  yád ánnenātiróhati

translation.text: This Purusha is all that yet hath been and all that is to be; The Lord of Immortality which waxes greater still by food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तावा॑नस्य महि॒मातो॒ ज्यायाँ॑श्च॒ पूरु॑षः पादो॑ऽस्य॒ विश्वा॑ भू॒तानि॑ त्रि॒पाद॑स्या॒मृतं॑ दि॒वि
verses.transliteration: etā́vān asya mahimā́-  -áto jyā́yāṃś ca pū́ruṣaḥ  pā́do 'sya víśvā bhūtā́ni  tripā́d asyāmŕ̥taṃ diví

translation.text: So mighty is his greatness; yea, greater than this is Purusha. All creatures are one-fourth of him, three-fourths eternal life in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒पादू॒र्ध्व उदै॒त्पुरु॑षः॒ पादो॑ऽस्ये॒हाभ॑व॒त्पुनः॑ ततो॒ विष्व॒ङ्व्य॑क्रामत्साशनानश॒ने अ॒भि
verses.transliteration: tripā́d ūrdhvá úd ait púruṣaḥ  pā́do 'syehā́bhavat púnaḥ  táto víṣvaṅ vy àkrāmat  sāśanānaśané abhí

translation.text: With three-fourths Purusha went up: onefourth of him again was here. Thence he strode out to every side over what cats not and what cats.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्मा॑द्वि॒राळ॑जायत वि॒राजो॒ अधि॒ पूरु॑षः स जा॒तो अत्य॑रिच्यत प॒श्चाद्भूमि॒मथो॑ पु॒रः
verses.transliteration: tásmād virā́ḷ ajāyata  virā́jo ádhi pū́ruṣaḥ  sá jātó áty aricyata  paścā́d bhū́mim átho puráḥ

translation.text: From him Virâj was born; again Purusha from Virâj was born. As soon as he was born he spread eastward and westward o'er the earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्पुरु॑षेण ह॒विषा॑ दे॒वा य॒ज्ञमत॑न्वत व॒स॒न्तो अ॑स्यासी॒दाज्यं॑ ग्री॒ष्म इ॒ध्मः श॒रद्ध॒विः
verses.transliteration: yát púruṣeṇa havíṣā  devā́ yajñám átanvata  vasantó asyāsīd ā́jyaṃ  grīṣmá idhmáḥ śarád dhavíḥ

translation.text: When Gods prepared the sacrifice with Purusha as their offering, Its oil was spring, the holy gift was autumn; summer was the wood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं य॒ज्ञं ब॒र्हिषि॒ प्रौक्ष॒न्पुरु॑षं जा॒तम॑ग्र॒तः तेन॑ दे॒वा अ॑यजन्त सा॒ध्या ऋष॑यश्च॒ ये
verses.transliteration: táṃ yajñám barhíṣi praúkṣan  púruṣaṃ jātám agratáḥ  téna devā́ ayajanta  sādhyā́ ŕ̥ṣayaś ca yé

translation.text: They balmed as victim on the grass Purusha born in earliest time. With him the Deities and all Sâdhyas and R̥ishis sacrificed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्मा॑द्य॒ज्ञात्स॑र्व॒हुतः॒ सम्भृ॑तं पृषदा॒ज्यम् प॒शून्ताँश्च॑क्रे वाय॒व्या॑नार॒ण्यान्ग्रा॒म्याश्च॒ ये
verses.transliteration: tásmād yajñā́t sarvahútaḥ  sámbhr̥tam pr̥ṣadājyám  paśū́n tā́ṃś cakre vāyavyā̀n  āraṇyā́n grāmyā́ś ca yé

translation.text: From that great general sacrifice the dripping fat was gathered up. He formed the creatures of-the air, and animals both wild and tame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्मा॑द्य॒ज्ञात्स॑र्व॒हुत॒ ऋचः॒ सामा॑नि जज्ञिरे छन्दां॑सि जज्ञिरे॒ तस्मा॒द्यजु॒स्तस्मा॑दजायत
verses.transliteration: tásmād yajñā́t sarvahútaḥ  ŕ̥caḥ sā́māni jajñire  chándāṃsi jajñire tásmād  yájus tásmād ajāyata

translation.text: From that great general sacrifice R̥ichas and Sâma-hymns were born: Therefrom were spells and charms produced; the Yajus had its birth from it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्मा॒दश्वा॑ अजायन्त॒ ये के चो॑भ॒याद॑तः गावो॑ ह जज्ञिरे॒ तस्मा॒त्तस्मा॑ज्जा॒ता अ॑जा॒वयः॑
verses.transliteration: tásmād áśvā ajāyanta  yé ké cobhayā́dataḥ  gā́vo ha jajñire tásmāt  tásmāj jātā́ ajāváyaḥ

translation.text: From it were horses born, from it all cattle with two rows of teeth: From it were generated kine, from it the goats and sheep were born.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्पुरु॑षं॒ व्यद॑धुः कति॒धा व्य॑कल्पयन् मुखं॒ किम॑स्य॒ कौ बा॒हू का ऊ॒रू पादा॑ उच्येते
verses.transliteration: yát púruṣaṃ vy ádadhuḥ  katidhā́ vy àkalpayan  múkhaṃ kím asya kaú bāhū́  kā́ ūrū́ pā́dā ucyete

translation.text: When they divided Purusha how many portions did they make? What do they call his mouth, his arms? What do they call his thighs and feet?

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रा॒ह्म॒णो॑ऽस्य॒ मुख॑मासीद्बा॒हू रा॑ज॒न्यः॑ कृ॒तः ऊ॒रू तद॑स्य॒ यद्वैश्यः॑ प॒द्भ्यां शू॒द्रो अ॑जायत
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇò 'sya múkham āsīd  bāhū́ rājanyàḥ kr̥táḥ  ūrū́ tád asya yád vaíśyaḥ  padbhyā́ṃ śūdró ajāyata

translation.text: The Brâhman was his mouth, of both his arms was the Râjanya made. His thighs became the Vaiṣya, from his feet the Ṣûdra was produced.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒न्द्रमा॒ मन॑सो जा॒तश्चक्षोः॒ सूर्यो॑ अजायत मुखा॒दिन्द्र॑श्चा॒ग्निश्च॑ प्रा॒णाद्वा॒युर॑जायत
verses.transliteration: candrámā mánaso jātáś  cákṣoḥ sū́ryo ajāyata  múkhād índraś cāgníś ca  prāṇā́d vāyúr ajāyata

translation.text: The Moon was gendered from his mind, and from his eye the Sun had birth; Indra and Agni from his mouth were born, and Vâyu from his breath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाभ्या॑ आसीद॒न्तरि॑क्षं शी॒र्ष्णो द्यौः सम॑वर्तत प॒द्भ्यां भूमि॒र्दिशः॒ श्रोत्रा॒त्तथा॑ लो॒काँ अ॑कल्पयन्
verses.transliteration: nā́bhyā āsīd antárikṣaṃ  śīrṣṇó dyaúḥ sám avartata  padbhyā́m bhū́mir díśaḥ śrótrāt  táthā lokā́m̐ akalpayan

translation.text: Forth from his navel came mid-air the sky was fashioned from his head Earth from his feet, and from his car the regions. Thus they formed the worlds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्तास्या॑सन्परि॒धय॒स्त्रिः स॒प्त स॒मिधः॑ कृ॒ताः दे॒वा यद्य॒ज्ञं त॑न्वा॒ना अब॑ध्न॒न्पुरु॑षं प॒शुम्
verses.transliteration: saptā́syāsan paridháyas  tríḥ saptá samídhaḥ kr̥tā́ḥ  devā́ yád yajñáṃ tanvānā́ḥ-  ábadhnan púruṣam paśúm

translation.text: Seven fencing-sticks had he, thrice seven layers of fuel were prepared, When the Gods, offering sacrifice, bound, as their victim, Purusha.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञेन॑ य॒ज्ञम॑यजन्त दे॒वास्तानि॒ धर्मा॑णि प्रथ॒मान्या॑सन् ते ह॒ नाकं॑ महि॒मानः॑ सचन्त॒ यत्र॒ पूर्वे॑ सा॒ध्याः सन्ति॑ दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: yajñéna yajñám ayajanta devā́s  tā́ni dhármāṇi prathamā́ny āsan  té ha nā́kam mahimā́naḥ sacanta  yátra pū́rve sādhyā́ḥ sánti devā́ḥ

translation.text: Gods, sacrificing, sacrificed the victim these were the carliest holy ordinances. The Mighty Ones attained the height of heaven, there where the Sâdhyas, Gods of old, are dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं जा॑गृ॒वद्भि॒र्जर॑माण इध्यते॒ दमे॒ दमू॑ना इ॒षय॑न्नि॒ळस्प॒दे विश्व॑स्य॒ होता॑ ह॒विषो॒ वरे॑ण्यो वि॒भुर्वि॒भावा॑ सु॒षखा॑ सखीय॒ते
verses.transliteration: sáṃ jāgr̥vádbhir járamāṇa idhyate  dáme dámūnā iṣáyann iḷás padé  víśvasya hótā havíṣo váreṇyo  vibhúr vibhā́vā suṣákhā sakhīyaté

translation.text: BRISK, at the place of Iḷâ, hymned by men who wake, our own familiar Friend is kindled in the house; Hotar of all oblation, worthy of our choice, Lord, beaming, trusty friend to one who loveth him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स द॑र्शत॒श्रीरति॑थिर्गृ॒हेगृ॑हे॒ वने॑वने शिश्रिये तक्व॒वीरि॑व जनं॑जनं॒ जन्यो॒ नाति॑ मन्यते॒ विश॒ आ क्षे॑ति वि॒श्यो॒३॒॑ विशं॑विशम्
verses.transliteration: sá darśataśrī́r átithir gr̥hé-gr̥he  váne-vane śiśriye takvavī́r iva  jánaṃ-janaṃ jányo nā́ti manyate  víśa ā́ kṣeti viśyò víśaṃ-viśam

translation.text: He, excellent in glory, guest in every house, finds like a swift-winged bird a home in every tree. Benevolent to men, he scorns no living man: Friend to the tribes of men he dwells with every tribe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒दक्षो॒ दक्षैः॒ क्रतु॑नासि सु॒क्रतु॒रग्ने॑ क॒विः काव्ये॑नासि विश्व॒वित् वसु॒र्वसू॑नां क्षयसि॒ त्वमेक॒ इद्द्यावा॑ च॒ यानि॑ पृथि॒वी च॒ पुष्य॑तः
verses.transliteration: sudákṣo dákṣaiḥ krátunāsi sukrátur  ágne kavíḥ kā́vyenāsi viśvavít  vásur vásūnāṃ kṣayasi tvám éka íd  dyā́vā ca yā́ni pr̥thivī́ ca púṣyataḥ

translation.text: Most sage with insight, passing skilful with thy powers art thou, O Agni, wise with wisdom, knowing all. As Vasu, thou alone art Lord of all good things, of all the treasures that the heavens and earth produce.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒जा॒नन्न॑ग्ने॒ तव॒ योनि॑मृ॒त्विय॒मिळा॑यास्प॒दे घृ॒तव॑न्त॒मास॑दः आ ते॑ चिकित्र उ॒षसा॑मि॒वेत॑योऽरे॒पसः॒ सूर्य॑स्येव र॒श्मयः॑
verses.transliteration: prajānánn agne táva yónim r̥tvíyam  íḷāyās padé ghr̥távantam ā́sadaḥ  ā́ te cikitra uṣásām ivétayo  -arepásaḥ sū́ryasyeva raśmáyaḥ

translation.text: Foreknowing well, O Agni, thou in Iḷâ's place hast occupied thy regular station balmed with oil. Marked are thy comings like the comings of the Dawns, the rays of him who shineth spotless as the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ श्रियो॑ व॒र्ष्य॑स्येव वि॒द्युत॑श्चि॒त्राश्चि॑कित्र उ॒षसां॒ न के॒तवः॑ यदोष॑धीर॒भिसृ॑ष्टो॒ वना॑नि च॒ परि॑ स्व॒यं चि॑नु॒षे अन्न॑मा॒स्ये॑
verses.transliteration: táva śríyo varṣyàsyeva vidyútaś  citrā́ś cikitra uṣásāṃ ná ketávaḥ  yád óṣadhīr abhísr̥ṣṭo vánāni ca  pári svayáṃ cinuṣé ánnam āsyè

translation.text: Thy glories are, as lightnings from the rainy cloud, marked, many-hued, like heralds of the Dawns' approach, When, loosed to wander over plants and forest trees, thou crammest by thyself thy food into thy mouth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमोष॑धीर्दधिरे॒ गर्भ॑मृ॒त्वियं॒ तमापो॑ अ॒ग्निं ज॑नयन्त मा॒तरः॑ तमित्स॑मा॒नं व॒निन॑श्च वी॒रुधो॒ऽन्तर्व॑तीश्च॒ सुव॑ते च वि॒श्वहा॑
verses.transliteration: tám óṣadhīr dadhire gárbham r̥tvíyaṃ  tám ā́po agníṃ janayanta mātáraḥ  tám ít samānáṃ vanínaś ca vīrúdho  -antárvatīś ca súvate ca viśváhā

translation.text: Him, duly coming as their germ, have plants received: this Agni have maternal Waters brought to life. So in like manner do the forest trees and plants bear him within them and produce him evermore.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वातो॑पधूत इषि॒तो वशाँ॒ अनु॑ तृ॒षु यदन्ना॒ वेवि॑षद्वि॒तिष्ठ॑से आ ते॑ यतन्ते र॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ यथा॒ पृथ॒क्छर्धां॑स्यग्ने अ॒जरा॑णि॒ धक्ष॑तः
verses.transliteration: vā́topadhūta iṣitó váśām̐ ánu  tr̥ṣú yád ánnā véviṣad vitíṣṭhase  ā́ te yatante rathyò yáthā pŕ̥thak  chárdhāṃsy agne ajárāṇi dhákṣataḥ

translation.text: When, sped and urged by wind, thou spreadest thee abroad, swift piercing through thy food according to thy will, Thy never-ceasing blazes, longing to consume, like men on chariots, Agni, strive on every side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मे॒धा॒का॒रं वि॒दथ॑स्य प्र॒साध॑नम॒ग्निं होता॑रं परि॒भूत॑मं म॒तिम् तमिदर्भे॑ ह॒विष्या स॑मा॒नमित्तमिन्म॒हे वृ॑णते॒ नान्यं त्वत्
verses.transliteration: medhākāráṃ vidáthasya prasā́dhanam  agníṃ hótāram paribhū́tamam matím  tám íd árbhe havíṣy ā́ samānám ít  tám ín mahé vr̥ṇate nā́nyáṃ tvát

translation.text: Agni, the Hotar-priest who fills the assembly full, Waker of knowledge, chief Controller of the thought,– Him, yea, none other than thyself, doth man elect at sacrificial offerings great and small alike.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामिदत्र॑ वृणते त्वा॒यवो॒ होता॑रमग्ने वि॒दथे॑षु वे॒धसः॑ यद्दे॑व॒यन्तो॒ दध॑ति॒ प्रयां॑सि ते ह॒विष्म॑न्तो॒ मन॑वो वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषः
verses.transliteration: tvā́m íd átra vr̥ṇate tvāyávo  hótāram agne vidátheṣu vedhásaḥ  yád devayánto dádhati práyāṃsi te  havíṣmanto mánavo vr̥ktábarhiṣaḥ

translation.text: Here, Api, the arrangers, those attached to thee, elect thee as their Priest in sacred gatherings, When men with strewn clipt grass and sacrificial gifts offer thee entertainment, piously inclined.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवा॑ग्ने हो॒त्रं तव॑ पो॒त्रमृ॒त्वियं॒ तव॑ ने॒ष्ट्रं त्वम॒ग्निदृ॑ताय॒तः तव॑ प्रशा॒स्त्रं त्वम॑ध्वरीयसि ब्र॒ह्मा चासि॑ गृ॒हप॑तिश्च नो॒ दमे॑
verses.transliteration: távāgne hotráṃ táva potrám r̥tvíyaṃ  táva neṣṭráṃ tvám agníd r̥tāyatáḥ  táva praśāstráṃ tvám adhvarīyasi  brahmā́ cā́si gr̥hápatiś ca no dáme

translation.text: Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man. Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्तुभ्य॑मग्ने अ॒मृता॑य॒ मर्त्यः॑ स॒मिधा॒ दाश॑दु॒त वा॑ ह॒विष्कृ॑ति तस्य॒ होता॑ भवसि॒ यासि॑ दू॒त्य१॒॑मुप॑ ब्रूषे॒ यज॑स्यध्वरी॒यसि॑
verses.transliteration: yás túbhyam agne amŕ̥tāya mártyaḥ  samídhā dā́śad utá vā havíṣkr̥ti  tásya hótā bhavasi yā́si dūtyàm  úpa brūṣe yájasy adhvarīyási

translation.text: When mortal man presents to thee Immortal God, Agni, his fuel or his sacrificial gift, Then thou art his Adhvaryu, Hotar, messenger, callest the Gods and orderest the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा अ॑स्मै म॒तयो॒ वाचो॑ अ॒स्मदाँ ऋचो॒ गिरः॑ सुष्टु॒तयः॒ सम॑ग्मत व॒सू॒यवो॒ वस॑वे जा॒तवे॑दसे वृ॒द्धासु॑ चि॒द्वर्ध॑नो॒ यासु॑ चा॒कन॑त्
verses.transliteration: imā́ asmai matáyo vā́co asmád ā́m̐  ŕ̥co gíraḥ suṣṭutáyaḥ sám agmata  vasūyávo vásave jātávedase  vr̥ddhā́su cid várdhano yā́su cākánat

translation.text: From us these hymns in concert have gone forth to him, these. holy words, these R̥ichas, songs and eulogies, Eager for wealth, to Jâtavedas fain for wealth: when they have waxen strong they please their Strengthener.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां प्र॒त्नाय॑ सुष्टु॒तिं नवी॑यसीं वो॒चेय॑मस्मा उश॒ते शृ॒णोतु॑ नः भू॒या अन्त॑रा हृ॒द्य॑स्य नि॒स्पृशे॑ जा॒येव॒ पत्य॑ उश॒ती सु॒वासाः॑
verses.transliteration: imā́m pratnā́ya suṣṭutíṃ návīyasīṃ  vocéyam asmā uśaté śr̥ṇótu naḥ  bhūyā́ ántarā hr̥dy àsya nispŕ̥śe  jāyéva pátya uśatī́ suvā́sāḥ-

translation.text: This newest eulogy will I speak forth to him, the Ancient One who loves it. May he hear our voice. May it come near his heart and make it stir with love, as a fond well-dressed matron clings about her lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मि॒न्नश्वा॑स ऋष॒भास॑ उ॒क्षणो॑ व॒शा मे॒षा अ॑वसृ॒ष्टास॒ आहु॑ताः की॒ला॒ल॒पे सोम॑पृष्ठाय वे॒धसे॑ हृ॒दा म॒तिं ज॑नये॒ चारु॑म॒ग्नये॑
verses.transliteration: yásminn áśvāsa r̥ṣabhā́sa ukṣáṇo  vaśā́ meṣā́ avasr̥ṣṭā́sa ā́hutāḥ  kīlālapé sómapr̥ṣṭhāya vedháse  hr̥dā́ matíṃ janaye cā́rum agnáye

translation.text: He in whom horses, bulls, oxen, and barren cows, and rams, when duly set apart, are offered up,– To Agni, Soma-sprinkled, drinker of sweet juice, Disposer, with my heart I bring a fair hymn forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अहा॑व्यग्ने ह॒विरा॒स्ये॑ ते स्रु॒ची॑व घृ॒तं च॒म्वी॑व॒ सोमः॑ वा॒ज॒सनिं॑ र॒यिम॒स्मे सु॒वीरं॑ प्रश॒स्तं धे॑हि य॒शसं॑ बृ॒हन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: áhāvy agne havír āsyè te  srucī̀va ghr̥táṃ camvī̀va sómaḥ  vājasániṃ rayím asmé suvī́ram  praśastáṃ dhehi yaśásam br̥hántam

translation.text: Into thy mouth is poured the offering, Agni, as Soma into cup, oil into ladle. Vouchsafe us wealth. strength-winning, blest with heroes, wealth lofty, praised by men, and full of splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञस्य॑ वो र॒थ्यं॑ वि॒श्पतिं॑ वि॒शां होता॑रम॒क्तोरति॑थिं वि॒भाव॑सुम् शोच॒ञ्छुष्का॑सु॒ हरि॑णीषु॒ जर्भु॑र॒द्वृषा॑ के॒तुर्य॑ज॒तो द्याम॑शायत
verses.transliteration: yajñásya vo rathyàṃ viśpátiṃ viśā́ṃ  hótāram aktór átithiṃ vibhā́vasum  śócañ chúṣkāsu háriṇīṣu járbhurad  vŕ̥ṣā ketúr yajató dyā́m aśāyata

translation.text: I PRAISE your Charioteer of sacrifice, the Lord of men, Priest of the tribes, refulgent, Guest of night. Blazing amid dry plants, snatching amid the green, the Strong, the Holy Herald hath attained to heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मम॑ञ्ज॒स्पामु॒भये॑ अकृण्वत ध॒र्माण॑म॒ग्निं वि॒दथ॑स्य॒ साध॑नम् अ॒क्तुं न य॒ह्वमु॒षसः॑ पु॒रोहि॑तं॒ तनू॒नपा॑तमरु॒षस्य॑ निंसते
verses.transliteration: imám añjaspā́m ubháye akr̥ṇvata  dharmā́ṇam agníṃ vidáthasya sā́dhanam  aktúṃ ná yahvám uṣásaḥ puróhitaṃ  tánūnápātam aruṣásya niṃsate

translation.text: Him, Agni, Gods and men have made their chief support, who drinks the fatness and completes the sacrifice. With kisses they caress the Grandson of the Red, like the swift ray of light, the Household Priest of Dawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बळ॑स्य नी॒था वि प॒णेश्च॑ मन्महे व॒या अ॑स्य॒ प्रहु॑ता आसु॒रत्त॑वे य॒दा घो॒रासो॑ अमृत॒त्वमाश॒तादिज्जन॑स्य॒ दैव्य॑स्य चर्किरन्
verses.transliteration: báḷ asya nīthā́ ví paṇéś ca manmahe  vayā́ asya práhutā āsur áttave  yadā́ ghorā́so amr̥tatvám ā́śata-  -ā́d íj jánasya daívyasya carkiran

translation.text: Yea, we discriminate his and the niggard's ways: his branches evermore are sent forth to consume. When his terrific flames have reached the Immortal's world, then men remember and extol the Heavenly Folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॒ हि प्रसि॑ति॒र्द्यौरु॒रु व्यचो॒ नमो॑ म॒ह्य१॒॑रम॑तिः॒ पनी॑यसी इन्द्रो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णः॒ सं चि॑कित्रि॒रेऽथो॒ भगः॑ सवि॒ता पू॒तद॑क्षसः
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya hí prásitir dyaúr urú vyáco  námo mahy àrámatiḥ pánīyasī  índro mitró váruṇaḥ sáṃ cikitrire-  -átho bhágaḥ savitā́ pūtádakṣasaḥ

translation.text: For then the net of Law, Dyaus, and the wide expanse, Earth, Worship, and Devotion meet for highest praise, Varuṇa, Indra, Mitra were of one accord, and Savitar and Bhaga, Lords of holy might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र रु॒द्रेण॑ य॒यिना॑ यन्ति॒ सिन्ध॑वस्ति॒रो म॒हीम॒रम॑तिं दधन्विरे येभिः॒ परि॑ज्मा परि॒यन्नु॒रु ज्रयो॒ वि रोरु॑वज्ज॒ठरे॒ विश्व॑मु॒क्षते॑
verses.transliteration: prá rudréṇa yayínā yanti síndhavas  tiró mahī́m arámatiṃ dadhanvire  yébhiḥ párijmā pariyánn urú jráyo  ví róruvaj jaṭháre víśvam ukṣáte

translation.text: Onward, with ever-roaming Rudra, speed the floods: over Aramati the Mighty have they run. With them Parijman, moving round his vast domain, loud bellowing, bedews all things that are within.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्रा॒णा रु॒द्रा म॒रुतो॑ वि॒श्वकृ॑ष्टयो दि॒वः श्ये॒नासो॒ असु॑रस्य नी॒ळयः॑ तेभि॑श्चष्टे॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मेन्द्रो॑ दे॒वेभि॑रर्व॒शेभि॒रर्व॑शः
verses.transliteration: krāṇā́ rudrā́ marúto viśvákr̥ṣṭayo  diváḥ śyenā́so ásurasya nīḷáyaḥ  tébhiś caṣṭe váruṇo mitró aryamā́-  -índro devébhir arvaśébhir árvaśaḥ

translation.text: Straightway the Rudras, Maruts visiting all men, Falcons of Dyaus, home-dwellers with the Asura,– Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman look on with these, and the swift-moving Indra with swift-moving Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रे॒ भुजं॑ शशमा॒नास॑ आशत॒ सूरो॒ दृशी॑के॒ वृष॑णश्च॒ पौंस्ये॑ प्र ये न्व॑स्या॒र्हणा॑ ततक्षि॒रे युजं॒ वज्रं॑ नृ॒षद॑नेषु का॒रवः॑
verses.transliteration: índre bhújaṃ śaśamānā́sa āśata  sū́ro dŕ̥śīke vŕ̥ṣaṇaś ca paúṃsye  prá yé nv àsyārháṇā tatakṣiré  yújaṃ vájraṃ nr̥ṣádaneṣu kārávaḥ

translation.text: With Indra have they found enjoyment, they who toil, in the light's beauty, in the very Strong One's strength; The singers who in men's assemblies forged for him, according to his due, his friend the thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सूर॑श्चि॒दा ह॒रितो॑ अस्य रीरम॒दिन्द्रा॒दा कश्चि॑द्भयते॒ तवी॑यसः भी॒मस्य॒ वृष्णो॑ ज॒ठरा॑दभि॒श्वसो॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ सहु॑रिः स्त॒न्नबा॑धितः
verses.transliteration: sū́raś cid ā́ haríto asya rīramad  índrād ā́ káś cid bhayate távīyasaḥ  bhīmásya vŕ̥ṣṇo jaṭhárād abhiśváso  divé-dive sáhuri stann ábādhitaḥ

translation.text: Even the Sun's Bay Coursers hath lie held in check: each one fears Indra as the mightiest of all. Unhindered, from the air's vault thunders day by day the loud triumphant breathing of the fearful Bull.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तोमं॑ वो अ॒द्य रु॒द्राय॒ शिक्व॑से क्ष॒यद्वी॑राय॒ नम॑सा दिदिष्टन येभिः॑ शि॒वः स्ववाँ॑ एव॒याव॑भिर्दि॒वः सिष॑क्ति॒ स्वय॑शा॒ निका॑मभिः
verses.transliteration: stómaṃ vo adyá rudrā́ya śíkvase  kṣayádvīrāya námasā didiṣṭana  yébhiḥ śiváḥ svávām̐ evayā́vabhir  diváḥ síṣakti sváyaśā níkāmabhiḥ

translation.text: With humble adoration show this day your song of praise to mighty Rudra, Ruler of the brave: With whom, the Eager Ones, going their ordered course, he comes from heaven Self-bright, auspicious, strong to guard.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि प्र॒जाया॒ अभ॑रन्त॒ वि श्रवो॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्वृष॒भः सोम॑जामयः य॒ज्ञैरथ॑र्वा प्रथ॒मो वि धा॑रयद्दे॒वा दक्षै॒र्भृग॑वः॒ सं चि॑कित्रिरे
verses.transliteration: té hí prajā́yā ábharanta ví śrávo  bŕ̥haspátir vr̥ṣabháḥ sómajāmayaḥ  yajñaír átharvā prathamó ví dhārayad  devā́ dákṣair bhŕ̥gavaḥ sáṃ cikitrire

translation.text: For these have spread abroad the fame of human kind, the Bull Br̥ihaspati and Soma's brotherhood. Atharvan first by sacrifices made men sure: through skill the Bhr̥igus were esteemed of all as Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी भूरि॑रेतसा॒ नरा॒शंस॒श्चतु॑रङ्गो य॒मोऽदि॑तिः दे॒वस्त्वष्टा॑ द्रविणो॒दा ऋ॑भु॒क्षणः॒ प्र रो॑द॒सी म॒रुतो॒ विष्णु॑रर्हिरे
verses.transliteration: té hí dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ bhū́riretasā  nárāśáṃsaś cáturaṅgo yamó 'ditiḥ  devás tváṣṭā draviṇodā́ r̥bhukṣáṇaḥ  prá rodasī́ marúto víṣṇur arhire

translation.text: For these, the Earth and Heaven with their abundant seed, four-bodied Narasmsa, Yama, Aditi, God Tvashṭar Wealth-bestower, the R̥ibhukshanas, Rodasî, Maruts, Vishṇu, claim and merit praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्य न॑ उ॒शिजा॑मुर्वि॒या क॒विरहिः॑ शृणोतु बु॒ध्न्यो॒३॒॑ हवी॑मनि सूर्या॒मासा॑ वि॒चर॑न्ता दिवि॒क्षिता॑ धि॒या श॑मीनहुषी अ॒स्य बो॑धतम्
verses.transliteration: utá syá na uśíjām urviyā́ kavír  áhiḥ śr̥ṇotu budhnyò hávīmani  sū́ryāmā́sā vicárantā divikṣítā  dhiyā́ śamīnahuṣī asyá bodhatam

translation.text: And may he too give car, the Sage, from far away, the Dragon of the Deep, to this our yearning call. Ye Sun and Moon who dwell in heaven and move in turn, and with your thought, O Earth and Sky, observe this well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नः॑ पू॒षा च॒रथं॑ वि॒श्वदे॑व्यो॒ऽपां नपा॑दवतु वा॒युरि॒ष्टये॑ आ॒त्मानं॒ वस्यो॑ अ॒भि वात॑मर्चत॒ तद॑श्विना सुहवा॒ याम॑नि श्रुतम्
verses.transliteration: prá naḥ pūṣā́ caráthaṃ viśvádevyo  -apā́ṃ nápād avatu vāyúr iṣṭáye  ātmā́naṃ vásyo abhí vā́tam arcata  tád aśvinā suhavā yā́mani śrutam

translation.text: Dear to all Gods, may Pûshan guard the ways we go, the Waters' child and Vâyu help us to success. Sing lauds for your great bliss to Wind, the breath of all: ye Aṣvins prompt to hear, hear this upon your way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒शामा॒सामभ॑यानामधि॒क्षितं॑ गी॒र्भिरु॒ स्वय॑शसं गृणीमसि ग्नाभि॒र्विश्वा॑भि॒रदि॑तिमन॒र्वण॑म॒क्तोर्युवा॑नं नृ॒मणा॒ अधा॒ पति॑म्
verses.transliteration: viśā́m āsā́m ábhayānām adhikṣítaṃ  gīrbhír u sváyaśasaṃ gr̥ṇīmasi  gnā́bhir víśvābhir áditim anarváṇam  aktór yúvānaṃ nr̥máṇā ádhā pátim

translation.text: With hymns of praise we sing him who is throned as Lord over these fearless tribes, the Selfresplendent One. We praise Night's youthful Lord benevolent to men, the foeless One, the free, with all celestial Dames.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रेभ॒दत्र॑ ज॒नुषा॒ पूर्वो॒ अङ्गि॑रा॒ ग्रावा॑ण ऊ॒र्ध्वा अ॒भि च॑क्षुरध्व॒रम् येभि॒र्विहा॑या॒ अभ॑वद्विचक्ष॒णः पाथः॑ सु॒मेकं॒ स्वधि॑ति॒र्वन॑न्वति
verses.transliteration: rébhad átra janúṣā pū́rvo áṅgirāḥ-  grā́vāṇa ūrdhvā́ abhí cakṣur adhvarám  yébhir víhāyā ábhavad vicakṣaṇáḥ  pā́thaḥ sumékaṃ svádhitir vánanvati

translation.text: By reason of his birth here Angiras first sang: the pressing-stones upraised bebeld the sacrifice- The stones through which the Sage became exceeding vast, and the sharp axe obtains in fight the beauteous place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॑ द्यावापृथिवी भूतमु॒र्वी नारी॑ य॒ह्वी न रोद॑सी॒ सदं॑ नः तेभि॑र्नः पातं॒ सह्य॑स ए॒भिर्नः॑ पातं शू॒षणि॑
verses.transliteration: máhi dyāvāpr̥thivī bhūtam urvī́  nā́rī yahvī́ ná ródasī sádaṃ naḥ  tébhir naḥ pātaṃ sáhyasaḥ-  ebhír naḥ pātaṃ śūṣáṇi

translation.text: MIGHTY are ye, and far-extended, Heaven and Earth: both Worlds are evermore to us like two young Dames. Guard us thereby from stronger foe; guard us hereby to give us strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञेय॑ज्ञे॒ स मर्त्यो॑ दे॒वान्त्स॑पर्यति यः सु॒म्नैर्दी॑र्घ॒श्रुत्त॑म आ॒विवा॑सत्येनान्
verses.transliteration: yajñé-yajñe sá mártyo  devā́n saparyati  yáḥ sumnaír dīrghaśrúttamaḥ-  āvívāsaty enān

translation.text: In each succeeding sacrifice that mortal honoureth the Gods, He who, most widely known and famed for happiness, inviteth them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑षामिरज्यवो दे॒वानां॒ वार्म॒हः विश्वे॒ हि वि॒श्वम॑हसो॒ विश्वे॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॑ य॒ज्ञियाः॑
verses.transliteration: víśveṣām irajyavo  devā́nāṃ vā́r maháḥ  víśve hí viśvámahaso  víśve yajñéṣu yajñíyāḥ

translation.text: Ye who are Rulers over all, great is your sovran power as Gods. Ye all possess all majesty: all must be served in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते घा॒ राजा॑नो अ॒मृत॑स्य म॒न्द्रा अ॑र्य॒मा मि॒त्रो वरु॑णः॒ परि॑ज्मा कद्रु॒द्रो नृ॒णां स्तु॒तो म॒रुतः॑ पू॒षणो॒ भगः॑
verses.transliteration: té ghā rā́jāno amŕ̥tasya mandrā́ḥ-  aryamā́ mitró váruṇaḥ párijmā  kád rudró nr̥ṇā́ṃ stutó  marútaḥ pūṣáṇo bhágaḥ

translation.text: These are the joyous Kings of Immortality, Parijman, Mitra, Aryaman, and Varuṇa. What else is Rudra, praised of men? the Maruts, Bhaga, Pûshana?

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॒ नक्त॑म॒पां वृ॑षण्वसू॒ सूर्या॒मासा॒ सद॑नाय सध॒न्या॑ सचा॒ यत्साद्ये॑षा॒महि॑र्बु॒ध्नेषु॑ बु॒ध्न्यः॑
verses.transliteration: utá no náktam apā́ṃ vr̥ṣaṇvasū  sū́ryāmā́sā sádanāya sadhanyā̀  sácā yát sā́dy eṣām  áhir budhnéṣu budhnyàḥ

translation.text: Come also to our dwelling, Lords of ample wealth, common partakers of our waters, Sun and Moon, When the great Dragon of the Deep hath settled down upon their floors.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॑ दे॒वाव॒श्विना॑ शु॒भस्पती॒ धाम॑भिर्मि॒त्रावरु॑णा उरुष्यताम् म॒हः स रा॒य एष॒तेऽति॒ धन्वे॑व दुरि॒ता
verses.transliteration: utá no devā́v aśvínā śubhás pátī  dhā́mabhir mitrā́váruṇā uruṣyatām  maháḥ sá rāyá éṣate-  -áti dhánveva duritā́

translation.text: And let the Aṣvins, Lords of splendour, set us free,– both Gods, and, with their Laws, Mitra and Varuṇa. Through woes, as over desert lands, he speeds to ample opulence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॑ रु॒द्रा चि॑न्मृळताम॒श्विना॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वासो॒ रथ॒स्पति॒र्भगः॑ ऋ॒भुर्वाज॑ ऋभुक्षणः॒ परि॑ज्मा विश्ववेदसः
verses.transliteration: utá no rudrā́ cin mr̥ḷatām aśvínā  víśve devā́so ráthaspátir bhágaḥ  r̥bhúr vā́ja r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ  párijmā viśvavedasaḥ

translation.text: Yea, let the Aṣvins Twain he gracious unto us, even Rudras, and all Gods, Bhaga, Rathaspati; Parijman, R̥ibhu, Vâja, O Lords of all wealth R̥ibhukshanas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒भुर्ऋ॑भु॒क्षा ऋ॒भुर्वि॑ध॒तो मद॒ आ ते॒ हरी॑ जूजुवा॒नस्य॑ वा॒जिना॑ दु॒ष्टरं॒ यस्य॒ साम॑ चि॒दृध॑ग्य॒ज्ञो न मानु॑षः
verses.transliteration: r̥bhúr r̥bhukṣā́ r̥bhúr vidható mádaḥ-  ā́ te hárī jūjuvānásya vājínā  duṣṭáraṃ yásya sā́ma cid  ŕ̥dhag yajñó ná mā́nuṣaḥ

translation.text: Prompt is R̥ibhukshan, prompt the worshipper's strong drink: may thy fleet Bay Steeds, thine who sperdest on, approach. Not mans but God's is sacrifice whose psalm is unassailable.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒धी नो॒ अह्र॑यो देव सवितः॒ स च॑ स्तुषे म॒घोना॑म् स॒हो न॒ इन्द्रो॒ वह्नि॑भि॒र्न्ये॑षां चर्षणी॒नां च॒क्रं र॒श्मिं न यो॑युवे
verses.transliteration: kr̥dhī́ no áhrayo deva savitaḥ  sá ca stuṣe maghónām  sahó na índro váhnibhir ny èṣāṃ  carṣaṇīnā́ṃ cakráṃ raśmíṃ ná yoyuve

translation.text: O God Savitar, harmed by none, lauded, give us a place among wealthy princes. With his Car-steeds at once 'hath our Indra guided the reins and the car of these men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऐषु॑ द्यावापृथिवी धातं म॒हद॒स्मे वी॒रेषु॑ वि॒श्वच॑र्षणि॒ श्रवः॑ पृ॒क्षं वाज॑स्य सा॒तये॑ पृ॒क्षं रा॒योत तु॒र्वणे॑
verses.transliteration: aíṣu dyāvāpr̥thivī dhātam mahád  asmé vīréṣu viśvácarṣaṇi śrávaḥ  pr̥kṣáṃ vā́jasya sātáye  pr̥kṣáṃ rāyótá turváṇe

translation.text: To these men present here, O Heaven and Earth, to us grant lofty fame extending over all mankind. Give us a steed to win us strength, a steed with wealth for victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तं शंस॑मिन्द्रास्म॒युष्ट्वं कूचि॒त्सन्तं॑ सहसावन्न॒भिष्ट॑ये सदा॑ पाह्य॒भिष्ट॑ये मे॒दतां॑ वे॒दता॑ वसो
verses.transliteration: etáṃ śáṃsam indrāsmayúṣ ṭváṃ  kū́cit sántaṃ sahasāvann abhíṣṭaye  sádā pāhy abhíṣṭaye  medátāṃ vedátā vaso

translation.text: This speaker, Indra-for thou art our Friend-wherever he may be, guard thou, Victor! for help, ever for help Thy wisdom, Vasu! prosper him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तं मे॒ स्तोमं॑ त॒ना न सूर्ये॑ द्यु॒तद्या॑मानं वावृधन्त नृ॒णाम् सं॒वन॑नं॒ नाश्व्यं॒ तष्टे॒वान॑पच्युतम्
verses.transliteration: etám me stómaṃ tanā́ ná sū́rye  dyutádyāmānaṃ vāvr̥dhanta nr̥ṇā́m  saṃvánanaṃ nā́śvyaṃ  táṣṭevā́napacyutam

translation.text: So have they strengthened this mine hymn which seems to take its bright path to the Sun, and reconciles the men: Thus forms a carpenter the yoke of horses, not to be displaced.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒वर्त॒ येषां॑ रा॒या यु॒क्तैषां॑ हिर॒ण्ययी॑ ने॒मधि॑ता॒ न पौंस्या॒ वृथे॑व वि॒ष्टान्ता॑
verses.transliteration: vāvárta yéṣāṃ rāyā́  yuktaíṣāṃ hiraṇyáyī  nemádhitā ná paúṃsyā  vŕ̥theva viṣṭā́ntā

translation.text: Whose chariot-seat hath come again laden with wealth and bright with gold, Lightly, with piercing ends, as 'twere two ranks of heroes ranged for fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तद्दुः॒शीमे॒ पृथ॑वाने वे॒ने प्र रा॒मे वो॑च॒मसु॑रे म॒घव॑त्सु ये यु॒क्त्वाय॒ पञ्च॑ श॒तास्म॒यु प॒था वि॒श्राव्ये॑षाम्
verses.transliteration: prá tád duḥśī́me pŕ̥thavāne vené  prá rāmé vocam ásure maghávatsu  yé yuktvā́ya páñca śatā́smayú  pathā́ viśrā́vy eṣām

translation.text: This to Duḥṣîma Pr̥ithavâna have I sung, to Vena, Râma, to the nobles, and the King. They yoked five hundred, and their love of us was famed upon their way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधीन्न्वत्र॑ सप्त॒तिं च॑ स॒प्त च॑ स॒द्यो दि॑दिष्ट॒ तान्वः॑ स॒द्यो दि॑दिष्ट पा॒र्थ्यः स॒द्यो दि॑दिष्ट माय॒वः
verses.transliteration: ádhī́n nv átra saptatíṃ ca saptá ca  sadyó didiṣṭa tā́nvaḥ  sadyó didiṣṭa pārthyáḥ  sadyó didiṣṭa māyaváḥ

translation.text: Besides, they showed us seven -and-seventy horses here. Tânva at once displayed his gift, Pârthya at once displayed his gift; and straightway Mâyava showed his.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रैते व॑दन्तु॒ प्र व॒यं व॑दाम॒ ग्राव॑भ्यो॒ वाचं॑ वदता॒ वद॑द्भ्यः यद॑द्रयः पर्वताः सा॒कमा॒शवः॒ श्लोकं॒ घोषं॒ भर॒थेन्द्रा॑य सो॒मिनः॑
verses.transliteration: praíté vadantu prá vayáṃ vadāma  grā́vabhyo vā́caṃ vadatā vádadbhyaḥ  yád adrayaḥ parvatāḥ sākám āśávaḥ  ślókaṃ ghóṣam bhárathéndrāya somínaḥ

translation.text: LET these speak loudly forth; let us speak out aloud: to the loud speaking Pressing-stones address the speech; When, rich with Soma juice, Stones of the mountain, ye, united, swift to Indra bring the sound of praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते व॑दन्ति श॒तव॑त्स॒हस्र॑वद॒भि क्र॑न्दन्ति॒ हरि॑तेभिरा॒सभिः॑ वि॒ष्ट्वी ग्रावा॑णः सु॒कृतः॑ सुकृ॒त्यया॒ होतु॑श्चि॒त्पूर्वे॑ हवि॒रद्य॑माशत
verses.transliteration: eté vadanti śatávat sahásravad  abhí krandanti háritebhir āsábhiḥ  viṣṭvī́ grā́vāṇaḥ sukŕ̥taḥ sukr̥tyáyā  hótuś cit pū́rve havirádyam āśata

translation.text: They speak out like a hundred, like a thousand men: they cry aloud to us with their green-tinted mouths, While, pious Stones, they ply their task with piety, and, even before the Hotar, taste the offered food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते व॑द॒न्त्यवि॑दन्न॒ना मधु॒ न्यू॑ङ्खयन्ते॒ अधि॑ प॒क्व आमि॑षि वृ॒क्षस्य॒ शाखा॑मरु॒णस्य॒ बप्स॑त॒स्ते सूभ॑र्वा वृष॒भाः प्रेम॑राविषुः
verses.transliteration: eté vadanty ávidann anā́ mádhu  ny ū̀ṅkhayante ádhi pakvá ā́miṣi  vr̥kṣásya śā́khām aruṇásya bápsatas  té sū́bharvā vr̥ṣabhā́ḥ prém arāviṣuḥ

translation.text: Loudly they speak, for they have found the savoury meath: they make a humming sound over the meat prepared. As they devour the branch of the Red-coloured Tree, these, the well-pastured Bulls, have uttered bellowings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हद्व॑दन्ति मदि॒रेण॑ म॒न्दिनेन्द्रं॒ क्रोश॑न्तोऽविदन्न॒ना मधु॑ सं॒रभ्या॒ धीराः॒ स्वसृ॑भिरनर्तिषुराघो॒षय॑न्तः पृथि॒वीमु॑प॒ब्दिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: br̥hád vadanti madiréṇa mandínā-  -índraṃ króśanto 'vidann anā́ mádhu  saṃrábhyā dhī́rāḥ svásr̥bhir anartiṣur  āghoṣáyantaḥ pr̥thivī́m upabdíbhiḥ

translation.text: They cry aloud, with strong exhilarating drink, calling on Indra now, for they have found the meath. Bold, with the sisters they have danced, embraced by them, making the earth reecho with their ringing sound.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒प॒र्णा वाच॑मक्र॒तोप॒ द्यव्या॑ख॒रे कृष्णा॑ इषि॒रा अ॑नर्तिषुः न्य१॒॑ङ्नि य॒न्त्युप॑रस्य निष्कृ॒तं पु॒रू रेतो॑ दधिरे सूर्य॒श्वितः॑
verses.transliteration: suparṇā́ vā́cam akratópa dyávi-  ākharé kŕ̥ṣṇā iṣirā́ anartiṣuḥ  nyàṅ ní yanty úparasya niṣkr̥tám  purū́ réto dadhire sūryaśvítaḥ

translation.text: The Eagles have sent forth their cry aloft in heaven; in the sky's vault the dark impetuous ones have danced. Then downward to the nether stone's fixt place they sink, and, splendid as the Sun, effuse their copious stream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ग्रा इ॑व प्र॒वह॑न्तः स॒माय॑मुः सा॒कं यु॒क्ता वृष॑णो॒ बिभ्र॑तो॒ धुरः॑ यच्छ्व॒सन्तो॑ जग्रसा॒ना अरा॑विषुः शृ॒ण्व ए॑षां प्रो॒थथो॒ अर्व॑तामिव
verses.transliteration: ugrā́ iva praváhantaḥ samā́yamuḥ  sākáṃ yuktā́ vŕ̥ṣaṇo bíbhrato dhúraḥ  yác chvasánto jagrasānā́ árāviṣuḥ  śr̥ṇvá eṣām prothátho árvatām iva

translation.text: Like strong ones drawing, they have put forth all their strength: the Bulls, harnessed together, bear the chariot-poles. When they have bellowed, panting, swallowing their food, the sound of their loud snorting is like that of steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दशा॑वनिभ्यो॒ दश॑कक्ष्येभ्यो॒ दश॑योक्त्रेभ्यो॒ दश॑योजनेभ्यः दशा॑भीशुभ्यो अर्चता॒जरे॑भ्यो॒ दश॒ धुरो॒ दश॑ यु॒क्ता वह॑द्भ्यः
verses.transliteration: dáśāvanibhyo dáśakakṣyebhyo  dáśayoktrebhyo dáśayojanebhyaḥ  dáśābhīśubhyo arcatājárebhyo  dáśa dhúro dáśa yuktā́ váhadbhyaḥ

translation.text: To these who have ten workers and a tenfold girth, to these who have ten yoke-straps and ten binding thongs, To these who bear ten reins, the eternal, sing ye praise, to these who bear ten car-poles, ten when they are yoked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते अद्र॑यो॒ दश॑यन्त्रास आ॒शव॒स्तेषा॑मा॒धानं॒ पर्ये॑ति हर्य॒तम् त ऊ॑ सु॒तस्य॑ सो॒म्यस्यान्ध॑सों॒ऽशोः पी॒यूषं॑ प्रथ॒मस्य॑ भेजिरे
verses.transliteration: té ádrayo dáśayantrāsa āśávas  téṣām ādhā́nam páry eti haryatám  tá ū sutásya somyásyā́ndhaso  -aṃśóḥ pīyū́ṣam prathamásya bhejire

translation.text: These Stones with ten conductors, rapid in their course, with lovely revolution travel round and round. They have been first to drink the flowing Soma juice, first to enjoy the milky fluid of the stalk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते सो॒मादो॒ हरी॒ इन्द्र॑स्य निंसतें॒ऽशुं दु॒हन्तो॒ अध्या॑सते॒ गवि॑ तेभि॑र्दु॒ग्धं प॑पि॒वान्त्सो॒म्यं मध्विन्द्रो॑ वर्धते॒ प्रथ॑ते वृषा॒यते॑
verses.transliteration: té somā́do hárī índrasya niṃsate  -aṃśúṃ duhánto ádhy āsate gávi  tébhir dugdhám papivā́n somyám mádhu-  índro vardhate práthate vr̥ṣāyáte

translation.text: These Soma-eaters kiss Indra's Bay-coloured Steeds: draining. the stalk they sit upon the ox's hide. Indra, when he hath drunk Soma-nicath drawn by them, waxes in strength, is famed, is mighty as a Bull.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॑ वो अं॒शुर्न किला॑ रिषाथ॒नेळा॑वन्तः॒ सद॒मित्स्थ॒नाशि॑ताः रै॒व॒त्येव॒ मह॑सा॒ चार॑वः स्थन॒ यस्य॑ ग्रावाणो॒ अजु॑षध्वमध्व॒रम्
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā vo aṃśúr ná kílā riṣāthana-  -íḷāvantaḥ sádam ít sthanā́śitāḥ  raivatyéva máhasā cā́rava sthana  yásya grāvāṇo ájuṣadhvam adhvarám

translation.text: Strong is your stalk; ye, verily, never shall be harmed; ye have refreshment, ye are ever satisfied. Fair are ye, as it were, through splendour of his wealth, his in whose sacrifice, O Stones, ye find delight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तृ॒दि॒ला अतृ॑दिलासो॒ अद्र॑योऽश्रम॒णा अशृ॑थिता॒ अमृ॑त्यवः अ॒ना॒तु॒रा अ॒जराः॒ स्थाम॑विष्णवः सुपी॒वसो॒ अतृ॑षिता॒ अतृ॑ष्णजः
verses.transliteration: tr̥dilā́ átr̥dilāso ádrayo  -aśramaṇā́ áśr̥thitā ámr̥tyavaḥ  anāturā́ ajárā sthā́maviṣṇavaḥ  supīváso átr̥ṣitā átr̥ṣṇajaḥ

translation.text: Bored deep, but not pierced through with holes, are ye, O Stones, not loosened, never weary, and exempt from death, Eternal, undiseased, moving in sundry ways, unthirsting, full of fatness, void of all desire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ध्रु॒वा ए॒व वः॑ पि॒तरो॑ यु॒गेयु॑गे॒ क्षेम॑कामासः॒ सद॑सो॒ न यु॑ञ्जते अ॒जु॒र्यासो॑ हरि॒षाचो॑ ह॒रिद्र॑व॒ आ द्यां रवे॑ण पृथि॒वीम॑शुश्रवुः
verses.transliteration: dhruvā́ evá vaḥ pitáro yugé-yuge  kṣémakāmāsaḥ sádaso ná yuñjate  ajuryā́so hariṣā́co harídravaḥ-  ā́ dyā́ṃ ráveṇa pr̥thivī́m aśuśravuḥ

translation.text: Your fathers, verily, stand firm from age to age: they, loving rest, are not dissevered from their seat. Untouched by time, ne'er lacking green plants and green trees, they with their voice have caused the heavens and earth to hear.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदिद्व॑द॒न्त्यद्र॑यो वि॒मोच॑ने॒ याम॑न्नञ्ज॒स्पा इ॑व॒ घेदु॑प॒ब्दिभिः॑ वप॑न्तो॒ बीज॑मिव धान्या॒कृतः॑ पृ॒ञ्चन्ति॒ सोमं॒ न मि॑नन्ति॒ बप्स॑तः
verses.transliteration: tád íd vadanty ádrayo vimócane  yā́mann añjaspā́ iva ghéd upabdíbhiḥ  vápanto bī́jam iva dhānyākŕ̥taḥ  pr̥ñcánti sómaṃ ná minanti bápsataḥ

translation.text: This, this the Stones proclaim, what time they are disjoined, and when with ringing sounds they move and drink the balm. Like tillers of the ground when they are sowing seed, they mix the Soma, nor, devouring, minish it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒ते अ॑ध्व॒रे अधि॒ वाच॑मक्र॒ता क्री॒ळयो॒ न मा॒तरं॑ तु॒दन्तः॑ वि षू मु॑ञ्चा सुषु॒वुषो॑ मनी॒षां वि व॑र्तन्ता॒मद्र॑य॒श्चाय॑मानाः
verses.transliteration: suté adhvaré ádhi vā́cam akrata-  -ā́ krīḷáyo ná mātáraṃ tudántaḥ  ví ṣū́ muñcā suṣuvúṣo manīṣā́ṃ  ví vartantām ádrayaś cā́yamānāḥ

translation.text: They have raised high their voice for juice, for sacrifice, striking the Mother earth as though they danced thereon. So loose thou too his thought who hath effused the sap, and let the Stones which we are honouring be disjoined.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह॒ये जाये॒ मन॑सा॒ तिष्ठ॑ घोरे॒ वचां॑सि मि॒श्रा कृ॑णवावहै॒ नु न नौ॒ मन्त्रा॒ अनु॑दितास ए॒ते मय॑स्कर॒न्पर॑तरे च॒नाह॑न्
verses.transliteration: hayé jā́ye mánasā tíṣṭha ghore  vácāṃsi miśrā́ kr̥ṇavāvahai nú  ná nau mántrā ánuditāsa eté  máyas karan páratare canā́han

translation.text: Ho there, my consort! Stay, thou fierce-souled lady, and let us reason for a while together. Such thoughts as these of ours, while yet unspoken in days gone by have never brought us comfort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किमे॒ता वा॒चा कृ॑णवा॒ तवा॒हं प्राक्र॑मिषमु॒षसा॑मग्रि॒येव॑ पुरू॑रवः॒ पुन॒रस्तं॒ परे॑हि दुराप॒ना वात॑ इवा॒हम॑स्मि
verses.transliteration: kím etā́ vācā́ kr̥ṇavā távāhám  prā́kramiṣam uṣásām agriyéva  púrūravaḥ púnar ástam párehi  durāpanā́ vā́ta ivāhám asmi

translation.text: What am I now to do with this thy saying? I have gone from thee like the first of Mornings. Purûravâs, return thou to thy dwelling: I, like the wind, am difficult to capture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इषु॒र्न श्रि॒य इ॑षु॒धेर॑स॒ना गो॒षाः श॑त॒सा न रंहिः॑ अ॒वीरे॒ क्रतौ॒ वि द॑विद्युत॒न्नोरा॒ न मा॒युं चि॑तयन्त॒ धुन॑यः
verses.transliteration: íṣur ná śriyá iṣudhér  asanā́ goṣā́ḥ śatasā́ ná ráṃhiḥ  avī́re krátau ví davidyutan ná-  -úrā ná māyúṃ citayanta dhúnayaḥ

translation.text: Like a shaft sent for glory from the quiver, or swift-steed winning cattle winning hundreds. The lightning seemed to flash, as cowards planned it. The minstrels bleated like a lamb in trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा वसु॒ दध॑ती॒ श्वशु॑राय॒ वय॒ उषो॒ यदि॒ वष्ट्यन्ति॑गृहात् अस्तं॑ ननक्षे॒ यस्मि॑ञ्चा॒कन्दिवा॒ नक्तं॑ श्नथि॒ता वै॑त॒सेन॑
verses.transliteration: sā́ vásu dádhatī śváśurāya  váya úṣo yádi váṣṭy ántigr̥hāt  ástaṃ nanakṣe yásmiñ cākán  dívā náktaṃ śnathitā́ vaitaséna

translation.text: Giving her husband's father life and riches, from the near dwelling, when her lover craved her, She sought the home wherein she found her pleasure, accepting day and night her lord's embraces.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिः स्म॒ माह्नः॑ श्नथयो वैत॒सेनो॒त स्म॒ मेऽव्य॑त्यै पृणासि पुरू॑र॒वोऽनु॑ ते॒ केत॑मायं॒ राजा॑ मे वीर त॒न्व१॒॑स्तदा॑सीः
verses.transliteration: tríḥ sma mā́hnaḥ śnathayo vaitaséna-  -utá sma mé 'vyatyai pr̥ṇāsi  púrūravó 'nu te kétam āyaṃ  rā́jā me vīra tanvàs tád āsīḥ

translation.text: Thrice in the day didst thou embrace thy consort, though coldly she received thy fond caresses. To thy desires, Purûravâs, I yielded: so wast thou king, O hero, of my body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या सु॑जू॒र्णिः श्रेणिः॑ सु॒म्नआ॑पिर्ह्र॒देच॑क्षु॒र्न ग्र॒न्थिनी॑ चर॒ण्युः ता अ॒ञ्जयो॑ऽरु॒णयो॒ न स॑स्रुः श्रि॒ये गावो॒ न धे॒नवो॑ऽनवन्त
verses.transliteration: yā́ sujūrṇíḥ śréṇiḥ sumnáāpir  hradécakṣur ná granthínī caraṇyúḥ  tā́ añjáyo 'ruṇáyo ná sasruḥ  śriyé gā́vo ná dhenávo 'navanta

translation.text: The maids Sujûrṇi, Ṣreṇi, Sumne-âpi, Charaṇyu, Granthinî, and Hradechakshus,– These like red kine have hastened forth, the bright ones, and like milch-cows have lowed in emulation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॑स्मि॒ञ्जाय॑मान आसत॒ ग्ना उ॒तेम॑वर्धन्न॒द्य१॒॑ः स्वगू॑र्ताः म॒हे यत्त्वा॑ पुरूरवो॒ रणा॒याव॑र्धयन्दस्यु॒हत्या॑य दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: sám asmiñ jā́yamāna āsata gnā́ḥ-  utém avardhan nadyàḥ svágūrtāḥ  mahé yát tvā purūravo ráṇāya-  -ávardhayan dasyuhátyāya devā́ḥ

translation.text: While he was born the Dames sate down together, the Rivers with free kindness gave him nurture; And then, Purûravâs, the Gods increased thee for mighty battle, to destroy the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सचा॒ यदा॑सु॒ जह॑ती॒ष्वत्क॒ममा॑नुषीषु॒ मानु॑षो नि॒षेवे॑ अप॑ स्म॒ मत्त॒रस॑न्ती॒ न भु॒ज्युस्ता अ॑त्रसन्रथ॒स्पृशो॒ नाश्वाः॑
verses.transliteration: sácā yád āsu jáhatīṣv átkam  ámānuṣīṣu mā́nuṣo niṣéve  ápa sma mát tarásantī ná bhujyús  tā́ atrasan rathaspŕ̥śo nā́śvāḥ

translation.text: When I, a mortal, wooed to mine embraces these heavenly nymphs who laid aside their raiment, Like a scared snake they fled from me in terror, like chariot horses when the car has touched them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदा॑सु॒ मर्तो॑ अ॒मृता॑सु नि॒स्पृक्सं क्षो॒णीभिः॒ क्रतु॑भि॒र्न पृ॒ङ्क्ते ता आ॒तयो॒ न त॒न्वः॑ शुम्भत॒ स्वा अश्वा॑सो॒ न क्री॒ळयो॒ दन्द॑शानाः
verses.transliteration: yád āsu márto amŕ̥tāsu nispŕ̥k  sáṃ kṣoṇī́bhiḥ krátubhir ná pr̥ṅkté  tā́ ātáyo ná tanvàḥ śumbhata svā́ḥ-  áśvāso ná krīḷáyo dándaśānāḥ

translation.text: When, loving these Immortal Ones, the mortal hath converse with the nymphs as they allow him. Like swans they show the beauty of their bodies, like horses in their play they bite and nibble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्युन्न या पत॑न्ती॒ दवि॑द्यो॒द्भर॑न्ती मे॒ अप्या॒ काम्या॑नि जनि॑ष्टो अ॒पो नर्यः॒ सुजा॑तः॒ प्रोर्वशी॑ तिरत दी॒र्घमायुः॑
verses.transliteration: vidyún ná yā́ pátantī dávidyod  bhárantī me ápyā kā́myāni  jániṣṭo apó náryaḥ sújātaḥ  prórváśī tirata dīrghám ā́yuḥ

translation.text: She who flashed brilliant as the falling lightning brought me delicious presents from the waters. Now from the flood be born a strong young hero May Urvaṣî prolong her life for ever

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒ज्ञि॒ष इ॒त्था गो॒पीथ्या॑य॒ हि द॒धाथ॒ तत्पु॑रूरवो म॒ ओजः॑ अशा॑सं त्वा वि॒दुषी॒ सस्मि॒न्नह॒न्न म॒ आशृ॑णोः॒ किम॒भुग्व॑दासि
verses.transliteration: jajñiṣá itthā́ gopī́thyāya hí  dadhā́tha tát purūravo ma ójaḥ  áśāsaṃ tvā vidúṣī sásminn áhan  ná ma ā́śr̥ṇoḥ kím abhúg vadāsi

translation.text: Thy birth hath made me drink from earthly milch-kine: this power, Purûravâs, hast thou vouchsafed me. I knew, and, warned thee, on that day. Thou wouldst not hear me. What sayest thou, when naught avails thee?

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒दा सू॒नुः पि॒तरं॑ जा॒त इ॑च्छाच्च॒क्रन्नाश्रु॑ वर्तयद्विजा॒नन् को दम्प॑ती॒ सम॑नसा॒ वि यू॑यो॒दध॒ यद॒ग्निः श्वशु॑रेषु॒ दीद॑यत्
verses.transliteration: kadā́ sūnúḥ pitáraṃ jātá ichāc  cakrán nā́śru vartayad vijānán  kó dámpatī sámanasā ví yūyod  ádha yád agníḥ śváśureṣu dī́dayat

translation.text: When will the son be born and seek his father? Mourner-like, will he weep when first he knows him? Who shall divide the accordant wife and husband, while fire is shining with thy consort's parents?

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ ब्रवाणि व॒र्तय॑ते॒ अश्रु॑ च॒क्रन्न क्र॑न्ददा॒ध्ये॑ शि॒वायै॑ प्र तत्ते॑ हिनवा॒ यत्ते॑ अ॒स्मे परे॒ह्यस्तं॑ न॒हि मू॑र॒ मापः॑
verses.transliteration: práti bravāṇi vartáyate áśru  cakrán ná krandad ādhyè śivā́yai  prá tát te hinavā yát te asmé  párehy ástaṃ nahí mūra mā́paḥ

translation.text: I will console him when his tears are falling: he shall not weep and cry for care that blesses. That which is thine, between us, will I send thee. Go home again, thou fool;.thou hast not won me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒दे॒वो अ॒द्य प्र॒पते॒दना॑वृत्परा॒वतं॑ पर॒मां गन्त॒वा उ॑ अधा॒ शयी॑त॒ निर्ऋ॑तेरु॒पस्थेऽधै॑नं॒ वृका॑ रभ॒सासो॑ अ॒द्युः
verses.transliteration: sudevó adyá prapáted ánāvr̥t  parāvátam paramā́ṃ gántavā́ u  ádhā śáyīta nírr̥ter upásthe-  -ádhainaṃ vŕ̥kā rabhasā́so adyúḥ

translation.text: Thy lover shall flee forth this day for ever, to seek, without return, the farthest distance. Then let his bed be in Destruction's bosom, and there let fierce rapacious wolves devour him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुरू॑रवो॒ मा मृ॑था॒ मा प्र प॑प्तो॒ मा त्वा॒ वृका॑सो॒ अशि॑वास उ क्षन् न वै स्त्रैणा॑नि स॒ख्यानि॑ सन्ति सालावृ॒काणां॒ हृद॑यान्ये॒ता
verses.transliteration: púrūravo mā́ mr̥thā mā́ prá papto  mā́ tvā vŕ̥kāso áśivāsa u kṣan  ná vaí straíṇāni sakhyā́ni santi  sālāvr̥kā́ṇāṃ hŕ̥dayāny etā́

translation.text: Nay, do not die, Purûravâs, nor vanish: let not the evil-omened wolves devour thee. With women there can be no lasting friendship: hearts of hyenas are the hearts of women.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्विरू॒पाच॑रं॒ मर्त्ये॒ष्वव॑सं॒ रात्रीः॑ श॒रद॒श्चत॑स्रः घृ॒तस्य॑ स्तो॒कं स॒कृदह्न॑ आश्नां॒ तादे॒वेदं ता॑तृपा॒णा च॑रामि
verses.transliteration: yád vírūpā́caram mártyeṣu-  ávasaṃ rā́trīḥ śarádaś cátasraḥ  ghr̥tásya stokáṃ sakŕ̥d áhna āśnāṃ  tā́d evédáṃ tātr̥pāṇā́ carāmi

translation.text: When amid men in altered shape I sojourned, and through four autumns spent the nights among them, I tasted once a day a drop of butter; and even now with that am I am contented.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्त॒रि॒क्ष॒प्रां रज॑सो वि॒मानी॒मुप॑ शिक्षाम्यु॒र्वशीं॒ वसि॑ष्ठः उप॑ त्वा रा॒तिः सु॑कृ॒तस्य॒ तिष्ठा॒न्नि व॑र्तस्व॒ हृद॑यं तप्यते मे
verses.transliteration: antarikṣaprā́ṃ rájaso vimā́nīm  úpa śikṣāmy urváśīṃ vásiṣṭhaḥ  úpa tvā rātíḥ sukr̥tásya tíṣṭhāt-  ní vartasva hŕ̥dayaṃ tapyate me

translation.text: I, her best love, call Urvaṣî to meet me, her who fills air and measures out the region. Let the gift brought by piety approach thee. Turn thou to me again: my heart is troubled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इति॑ त्वा दे॒वा इ॒म आ॑हुरैळ॒ यथे॑मे॒तद्भव॑सि मृ॒त्युब॑न्धुः प्र॒जा ते॑ दे॒वान्ह॒विषा॑ यजाति स्व॒र्ग उ॒ त्वमपि॑ मादयासे
verses.transliteration: íti tvā devā́ imá āhur aiḷa  yáthem etád bhávasi mr̥tyúbandhuḥ  prajā́ te devā́n havíṣā yajāti  svargá u tvám ápi mādayāse

translation.text: Thus speak these Gods to thee, O son of Iḷâ: As death hath verily got thee for his subject, Thy sons shall serve the Gods with their oblation, and thou, moreover, shalt rejoice in Svarga.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॑ म॒हे वि॒दथे॑ शंसिषं॒ हरी॒ प्र ते॑ वन्वे व॒नुषो॑ हर्य॒तं मद॑म् घृ॒तं न यो हरि॑भि॒श्चारु॒ सेच॑त॒ आ त्वा॑ विशन्तु॒ हरि॑वर्पसं॒ गिरः॑
verses.transliteration: prá te mahé vidáthe śaṃsiṣaṃ hárī  prá te vanve vanúṣo haryatám mádam  ghr̥táṃ ná yó háribhiś cā́ru sécate-  ā́ tvā viśantu hárivarpasaṃ gíraḥ

translation.text: In the great synod will I laud thy two Bay Steeds: I prize the sweet strong drink of thee the Warrior- God, His who pours lovely oil as 'twere with yellow drops. Let my songs enter thee whose form hath golden tints.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हरिं॒ हि योनि॑म॒भि ये स॒मस्व॑रन्हि॒न्वन्तो॒ हरी॑ दि॒व्यं यथा॒ सदः॑ आ यं पृ॒णन्ति॒ हरि॑भि॒र्न धे॒नव॒ इन्द्रा॑य शू॒षं हरि॑वन्तमर्चत
verses.transliteration: háriṃ hí yónim abhí yé samásvaran  hinvánto hárī divyáṃ yáthā sádaḥ  ā́ yám pr̥ṇánti háribhir ná dhenávaḥ-  índrāya śūṣáṃ hárivantam arcata

translation.text: Ye who in concert sing unto the goldhued place, like Bay Steeds driving onward to the heavenly seat, For Indra laud ye strength allied with Tawny Steeds, laud him whom cows content as 'twere with yellow drops.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो अ॑स्य॒ वज्रो॒ हरि॑तो॒ य आ॑य॒सो हरि॒र्निका॑मो॒ हरि॒रा गभ॑स्त्योः द्यु॒म्नी सु॑शि॒प्रो हरि॑मन्युसायक॒ इन्द्रे॒ नि रू॒पा हरि॑ता मिमिक्षिरे
verses.transliteration: só asya vájro hárito yá āyasó  hárir níkāmo hárir ā́ gábhastyoḥ  dyumnī́ suśipró hárimanyusāyakaḥ-  índre ní rūpā́ háritā mimikṣire

translation.text: His is that thunderbolt, of iron, goldenhued, gold-coloured, very dear, and yellow in his arms; Bright with strong teeth, destroying with its tawny rage. In Indra are set fast all forms of golden hue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वि न के॒तुरधि॑ धायि हर्य॒तो वि॒व्यच॒द्वज्रो॒ हरि॑तो॒ न रंह्या॑ तु॒ददहिं॒ हरि॑शिप्रो॒ य आ॑य॒सः स॒हस्र॑शोका अभवद्धरिम्भ॒रः
verses.transliteration: diví ná ketúr ádhi dhāyi haryató  vivyácad vájro hárito ná ráṃhyā  tudád áhiṃ háriśipro yá āyasáḥ  sahásraśokā abhavad dharimbharáḥ

translation.text: As if a lovely ray were laid upon the sky, the golden thunderbolt spread out as in a race. That iron bolt with yellow jaw smote Ahi down. A thousand flames had he who bore the tawny-hued.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वंत्व॑महर्यथा॒ उप॑स्तुतः॒ पूर्वे॑भिरिन्द्र हरिकेश॒ यज्व॑भिः त्वं ह॑र्यसि॒ तव॒ विश्व॑मु॒क्थ्य१॒॑मसा॑मि॒ राधो॑ हरिजात हर्य॒तम्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ-tvam aharyathā úpastutaḥ  pū́rvebhir indra harikeśa yájvabhiḥ  tváṃ haryasi táva víśvam ukthyàm  ásāmi rā́dho harijāta haryatám

translation.text: Thou, thou, when praised by men who sacrificed of old. hadst pleasure in their lauds, O Indra golden-haired. All that befits thy song of praise thou welcornest, the perfect pleasant gift, O Golden-hued from birth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता व॒ज्रिणं॑ म॒न्दिनं॒ स्तोम्यं॒ मद॒ इन्द्रं॒ रथे॑ वहतो हर्य॒ता हरी॑ पु॒रूण्य॑स्मै॒ सव॑नानि॒ हर्य॑त॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमा॒ हर॑यो दधन्विरे
verses.transliteration: tā́ vajríṇam mandínaṃ stómyam máde-  índraṃ ráthe vahato haryatā́ hárī  purū́ṇy asmai sávanāni háryate-  índrāya sómā hárayo dadhanvire

translation.text: These two dear Bays bring hither Indra on his car, Thunder-armed, joyous, meet for laud, to drink his fill. Many libations flow for him who loveth them: to Indra have the gold-hued Soma juices run.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरं॒ कामा॑य॒ हर॑यो दधन्विरे स्थि॒राय॑ हिन्व॒न्हर॑यो॒ हरी॑ तु॒रा अर्व॑द्भि॒र्यो हरि॑भि॒र्जोष॒मीय॑ते॒ सो अ॑स्य॒ कामं॒ हरि॑वन्तमानशे
verses.transliteration: áraṃ kā́māya hárayo dadhanvire  sthirā́ya hinvan hárayo hárī turā́  árvadbhir yó háribhir jóṣam ī́yate  só asya kā́maṃ hárivantam ānaśe

translation.text: Tle gold-hued drops have flowed to gratify his wish: the yellow dro s have urged the swift Bays to the Strong. He who speeds on with Bay Steeds even as he lists hath satisfied his longing for the golden drops.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हरि॑श्मशारु॒र्हरि॑केश आय॒सस्तु॑र॒स्पेये॒ यो ह॑रि॒पा अव॑र्धत अर्व॑द्भि॒र्यो हरि॑भिर्वा॒जिनी॑वसु॒रति॒ विश्वा॑ दुरि॒ता पारि॑ष॒द्धरी॑
verses.transliteration: háriśmaśārur hárikeśa āyasás  turaspéye yó haripā́ ávardhata  árvadbhir yó háribhir vājínīvasur  áti víśvā duritā́ pā́riṣad dhárī

translation.text: At the swift draught the Soma-drinker waxed in might, the Iron One with yellow beard and yellow hair. He, Lord of Tawny Coursers, Lord of fleet-foot Mares, will bear his Bay Steeds safely over all distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्रुवे॑व॒ यस्य॒ हरि॑णी विपे॒ततुः॒ शिप्रे॒ वाजा॑य॒ हरि॑णी॒ दवि॑ध्वतः प्र यत्कृ॒ते च॑म॒से मर्मृ॑ज॒द्धरी॑ पी॒त्वा मद॑स्य हर्य॒तस्यान्ध॑सः
verses.transliteration: srúveva yásya háriṇī vipetátuḥ  śípre vā́jāya háriṇī dávidhvataḥ  prá yát kr̥té camasé mármr̥jad dhárī  pītvā́ mádasya haryatásyā́ndhasaḥ

translation.text: His yellow-coloured jaws, like ladles move apart, what time, for strength, he makes the yellowtinted stir, When, while the bowl stands there, he grooms his Tawny Steeds, when he hath drunk strong drink, the sweet juice that he loves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्म॒ सद्म॑ हर्य॒तस्य॑ प॒स्त्यो॒३॒॑रत्यो॒ न वाजं॒ हरि॑वाँ अचिक्रदत् म॒ही चि॒द्धि धि॒षणाह॑र्य॒दोज॑सा बृ॒हद्वयो॑ दधिषे हर्य॒तश्चि॒दा
verses.transliteration: utá sma sádma haryatásya pastyòr  átyo ná vā́jaṃ hárivām̐ acikradat  mahī́ cid dhí dhiṣáṇā́haryad ójasā  br̥hád váyo dadhiṣe haryatáś cid ā́

translation.text: Yea, to the Dear One's seat in homes of heaven and earth the Bay Steeds' Lord hath whinnied like a horse for food. Then the great wish hath seized upon him mightily, and the Beloved One hath gained high power of life,

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रोद॑सी॒ हर्य॑माणो महि॒त्वा नव्यं॑नव्यं हर्यसि॒ मन्म॒ नु प्रि॒यम् प्र प॒स्त्य॑मसुर हर्य॒तं गोरा॒विष्कृ॑धि॒ हर॑ये॒ सूर्या॑य
verses.transliteration: ā́ ródasī háryamāṇo mahitvā́  návyaṃ-navyaṃ haryasi mánma nú priyám  prá pastyàm asura haryatáṃ gór  āvíṣ kr̥dhi háraye sū́ryāya

translation.text: Thou, comprehending with thy might the earth and heaven, acceptest the dear hymn for ever new and new. O Asura, disclose thou and make visible the Cow's beloved home to the bright golden Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॑ ह॒र्यन्तं॑ प्र॒युजो॒ जना॑नां॒ रथे॑ वहन्तु॒ हरि॑शिप्रमिन्द्र पिबा॒ यथा॒ प्रति॑भृतस्य॒ मध्वो॒ हर्य॑न्य॒ज्ञं स॑ध॒मादे॒ दशो॑णिम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā haryántam prayújo jánānāṃ  ráthe vahantu háriśipram indra  píbā yáthā prátibhr̥tasya mádhvo  háryan yajñáṃ sadhamā́de dáśoṇim

translation.text: O Indra, let the eager wishes of the folk bring thee, delightful, golden-visored, on thy car, That, pleased with sacrifice wherein ten fingers toil, thou mayest, at the feast, drink of our offered meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपाः॒ पूर्वे॑षां हरिवः सु॒ताना॒मथो॑ इ॒दं सव॑नं॒ केव॑लं ते म॒म॒द्धि सोमं॒ मधु॑मन्तमिन्द्र स॒त्रा वृ॑षञ्ज॒ठर॒ आ वृ॑षस्व
verses.transliteration: ápāḥ pū́rveṣāṃ harivaḥ sutā́nām  átho idáṃ sávanaṃ kévalaṃ te  mamaddhí sómam mádhumantam indra  satrā́ vr̥ṣañ jaṭhára ā́ vr̥ṣasva

translation.text: Juices aforetime, Lord of Bays, thou drankest; and thine especially is this libation. Gladden thee, Indra, with the meath-rich Soma: pour it down ever, Mighty One! within thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ओष॑धीः॒ पूर्वा॑ जा॒ता दे॒वेभ्य॑स्त्रियु॒गं पु॒रा मनै॒ नु ब॒भ्रूणा॑म॒हं श॒तं धामा॑नि स॒प्त च॑
verses.transliteration: yā́ óṣadhīḥ pū́rvā jātā́ḥ-  devébhyas triyugám purā́  mánai nú babhrū́ṇām aháṃ  śatáṃ dhā́māni saptá ca

translation.text: HERBS that sprang up in time of old, three ages earlier than the Gods,– Of these, whose hue is brown, will I declare the hundred powers and seven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं वो॑ अम्ब॒ धामा॑नि स॒हस्र॑मु॒त वो॒ रुहः॑ अधा॑ शतक्रत्वो यू॒यमि॒मं मे॑ अग॒दं कृ॑त
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ vo amba dhā́māni  sahásram utá vo rúhaḥ  ádhā śatakratvo yūyám  imám me agadáṃ kr̥ta

translation.text: Ye, Mothers, have a hundred homes, yea, and a thousand are your growths. Do ye who have a thousand powers free this my patient from disease.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओष॑धीः॒ प्रति॑ मोदध्वं॒ पुष्प॑वतीः प्र॒सूव॑रीः अश्वा॑ इव स॒जित्व॑रीर्वी॒रुधः॑ पारयि॒ष्ण्वः॑
verses.transliteration: óṣadhīḥ práti modadhvam  púṣpavatīḥ prasū́varīḥ  áśvā iva sajítvarīr  vīrúdhaḥ pārayiṣṇvàḥ

translation.text: Be glad and joyful in the Plants, both blossoming and bearing fruit, Plants that will lead us to success like mares who conquer in the race.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओष॑धी॒रिति॑ मातर॒स्तद्वो॑ देवी॒रुप॑ ब्रुवे स॒नेय॒मश्वं॒ गां वास॑ आ॒त्मानं॒ तव॑ पूरुष
verses.transliteration: óṣadhīr íti mātaras  tád vo devīr úpa bruve  sanéyam áśvaṃ gā́ṃ vā́saḥ-  ātmā́naṃ táva pūruṣa

translation.text: Plants, by this name I speak to you, Mothers, to you the Goddesses: Steed, cow, and garment may I win, win back thy very self, O man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒श्व॒त्थे वो॑ नि॒षद॑नं प॒र्णे वो॑ वस॒तिष्कृ॒ता गो॒भाज॒ इत्किला॑सथ॒ यत्स॒नव॑थ॒ पूरु॑षम्
verses.transliteration: aśvatthé vo niṣádanam  parṇé vo vasatíṣ kr̥tā́  gobhā́ja ít kílāsatha  yát sanávatha pū́ruṣam

translation.text: The Holy Fig tree is your home, your mansion is the Parṇa tree: Winners of cattle shali ye be if ye regain for me this man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्रौष॑धीः स॒मग्म॑त॒ राजा॑नः॒ समि॑ताविव विप्रः॒ स उ॑च्यते भि॒षग्र॑क्षो॒हामी॑व॒चात॑नः
verses.transliteration: yátraúṣadhīḥ samágmata  rā́jānaḥ sámitāv iva  vípraḥ sá ucyate bhiṣág  rakṣohā́mīvacā́tanaḥ

translation.text: He who hath store of Herbs at hand like Kings amid a crowd of men,– Physician is that sage's name, fiend-slayer, chaser of disease.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒श्वा॒व॒तीं सो॑माव॒तीमू॒र्जय॑न्ती॒मुदो॑जसम् आवि॑त्सि॒ सर्वा॒ ओष॑धीर॒स्मा अ॑रि॒ष्टता॑तये
verses.transliteration: aśvāvatī́ṃ somāvatī́m  ūrjáyantīm údojasam  ā́vitsi sárvā óṣadhīr  asmā́ ariṣṭátātaye

translation.text: Herbs rich in Soma, rich in steeds, in nourishments, in strengthening power,– All these have I provided here, that this man may be whole again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उच्छुष्मा॒ ओष॑धीनां॒ गावो॑ गो॒ष्ठादि॑वेरते धनं॑ सनि॒ष्यन्ती॑नामा॒त्मानं॒ तव॑ पूरुष
verses.transliteration: úc chúṣmā óṣadhīnāṃ  gā́vo goṣṭhā́d iverate  dhánaṃ saniṣyántīnām  ātmā́naṃ táva pūruṣa

translation.text: The healing virtues of the Plants stream forth like cattle from the stall,– Plants that shall win me store of wealth, and save thy vital breath, O man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इष्कृ॑ति॒र्नाम॑ वो मा॒ताथो॑ यू॒यं स्थ॒ निष्कृ॑तीः सी॒राः प॑त॒त्रिणीः॑ स्थन॒ यदा॒मय॑ति॒ निष्कृ॑थ
verses.transliteration: íṣkr̥tir nā́ma vo mātā́-  -átho yūyáṃ stha níṣkr̥tīḥ  sīrā́ḥ patatríṇī sthana  yád āmáyati níṣ kr̥tha

translation.text: Reliever is your mother's name, and hence Restorers are ye called. Rivers are ye with wings that fly: keep far whatever brings disease.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अति॒ विश्वाः॑ परि॒ष्ठाः स्ते॒न इ॑व व्र॒जम॑क्रमुः ओष॑धीः॒ प्राचु॑च्यवु॒र्यत्किं च॑ त॒न्वो॒३॒॑ रपः॑
verses.transliteration: áti víśvāḥ pariṣṭhā́ḥ-  stená iva vrajám akramuḥ  óṣadhīḥ prā́cucyavur  yát kíṃ ca tanvò rápaḥ

translation.text: Over all fences have they passed, as steals a thief into the fold. The Plants have driven from the frame whatever malady was there.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॒मा वा॒जय॑न्न॒हमोष॑धी॒र्हस्त॑ आद॒धे आ॒त्मा यक्ष्म॑स्य नश्यति पु॒रा जी॑व॒गृभो॑ यथा
verses.transliteration: yád imā́ vājáyann ahám  óṣadhīr hásta ādadhé  ātmā́ yákṣmasya naśyati  purā́ jīvagŕ̥bho yathā

translation.text: When, bringing back the vanished strength, I hold these herbs within my hand, The spirit of disease departs ere he can seize upon the life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्यौ॑षधीः प्र॒सर्प॒थाङ्ग॑मङ्गं॒ परु॑ष्परुः ततो॒ यक्ष्मं॒ वि बा॑धध्व उ॒ग्रो म॑ध्यम॒शीरि॑व
verses.transliteration: yásyauṣadhīḥ prasárpatha-  -áṅgam-aṅgam páruṣ-paruḥ  táto yákṣmaṃ ví bādhadhve-  ugró madhyamaśī́r iva

translation.text: He through whose frame, O Plants, ye creep member by member, joint by joint,– From him ye drive away disease like some strong arbiter of strife.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒कं य॑क्ष्म॒ प्र प॑त॒ चाषे॑ण किकिदी॒विना॑ सा॒कं वात॑स्य॒ ध्राज्या॑ सा॒कं न॑श्य नि॒हाक॑या
verses.transliteration: sākáṃ yakṣma prá pata  cā́ṣeṇa kikidīvínā  sākáṃ vā́tasya dhrā́jyā  sākáṃ naśya nihā́kayā

translation.text: Fly, Spirit of Disease, begone, with the blue jay and kingfisher. Fly with the wind's impetuousspeed, vanish together with the storm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्या वो॑ अ॒न्याम॑वत्व॒न्यान्यस्या॒ उपा॑वत ताः सर्वाः॑ संविदा॒ना इ॒दं मे॒ प्राव॑ता॒ वचः॑
verses.transliteration: anyā́ vo anyā́m avatu-  anyā́nyásyā úpāvata  tā́ḥ sárvāḥ saṃvidānā́ḥ-  idám me prā́vatā vácaḥ

translation.text: Help every one the other, lend assistance each of you to each, All of you be accordant, give furtherance to this speech of mine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याः फ॒लिनी॒र्या अ॑फ॒ला अ॑पु॒ष्पा याश्च॑ पु॒ष्पिणीः॑ बृह॒स्पति॑प्रसूता॒स्ता नो॑ मुञ्च॒न्त्वंह॑सः
verses.transliteration: yā́ḥ phalínīr yā́ aphalā́ḥ-  apuṣpā́ yā́ś ca puṣpíṇīḥ  bŕ̥haspátiprasūtās  tā́ no muñcantv áṃhasaḥ

translation.text: Let fruitful Plants, and fruitless, those that blossom, and the blossomless, Urged onward by Br̥ihaspati, release us from our pain and grief;

verses.sanskrit_deva: मु॒ञ्चन्तु॑ मा शप॒थ्या॒३॒॑दथो॑ वरु॒ण्या॑दु॒त अथो॑ य॒मस्य॒ पड्बी॑शा॒त्सर्व॑स्माद्देवकिल्बि॒षात्
verses.transliteration: muñcántu mā śapathyā̀d  átho varuṇyā̀d utá  átho yamásya páḍbīśāt  sárvasmād devakilbiṣā́t

translation.text: Release me from the curse's plague and woe that comes from Varuṇa; Free me from Yama's fetter, from sin and offence against the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒व॒पत॑न्तीरवदन्दि॒व ओष॑धय॒स्परि॑ यं जी॒वम॒श्नवा॑महै॒ न स रि॑ष्याति॒ पूरु॑षः
verses.transliteration: avapátantīr avadan  divá óṣadhayas pári  yáṃ jīvám aśnávāmahai  ná sá riṣyāti pū́ruṣaḥ

translation.text: What time, descending from the sky, the Plants flew earthward, thus they spake: No evil shall befall the man whom while he liveth we pervade,

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ओष॑धीः॒ सोम॑राज्ञीर्ब॒ह्वीः श॒तवि॑चक्षणाः तासां॒ त्वम॑स्युत्त॒मारं॒ कामा॑य॒ शं हृ॒दे
verses.transliteration: yā́ óṣadhīḥ sómarājñīr  bahvī́ḥ śatávicakṣaṇāḥ  tā́sāṃ tvám asy uttamā́-  -áraṃ kā́māya śáṃ hr̥dé

translation.text: Of all the many Plants whose King is, Soma, Plants of hundred forms, Thou art the Plant most excellent, prompt to the wish, sweet to the heart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ओष॑धीः॒ सोम॑राज्ञी॒र्विष्ठि॑ताः पृथि॒वीमनु॑ बृह॒स्पति॑प्रसूता अ॒स्यै सं द॑त्त वी॒र्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: yā́ óṣadhīḥ sómarājñīr  víṣṭhitāḥ pr̥thivī́m ánu  bŕ̥haspátiprasūtās  asyaí sáṃ datta vīryàm

translation.text: O all ye various Herbs whose King is Soma, that o'erspread the earth, Urged onward by Br̥ihaspati, combine your virtue in this Plant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा वो॑ रिषत्खनि॒ता यस्मै॑ चा॒हं खना॑मि वः द्वि॒पच्चतु॑ष्पद॒स्माकं॒ सर्व॑मस्त्वनातु॒रम्
verses.transliteration: mā́ vo riṣat khanitā́  yásmai cāháṃ khánāmi vaḥ  dvipác cátuṣpad asmā́kaṃ  sárvam astv anāturám

translation.text: Unharmed be he who digs you up, unharmed the man for whom I dig: And let no malady attack biped or quadruped of ours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याश्चे॒दमु॑पशृ॒ण्वन्ति॒ याश्च॑ दू॒रं परा॑गताः सर्वाः॑ सं॒गत्य॑ वीरुधो॒ऽस्यै सं द॑त्त वी॒र्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: yā́ś cedám upaśr̥ṇvánti  yā́ś ca dūrám párāgatāḥ  sárvāḥ saṃgátya vīrudho  asyaí sáṃ datta vīryàm

translation.text: All Plants that hear this speech, and those that have departed far away, Come all assembled and confer your healing power upon this Herb.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओष॑धयः॒ सं व॑दन्ते॒ सोमे॑न स॒ह राज्ञा॑ यस्मै॑ कृ॒णोति॑ ब्राह्म॒णस्तं रा॑जन्पारयामसि
verses.transliteration: óṣadhayaḥ sáṃ vadante  sómena sahá rā́jñā  yásmai kr̥ṇóti brāhmaṇás  táṃ rājan pārayāmasi

translation.text: With Soma as their Sovran Lord the Plants hold colloquy and say: O King, we save from death the man whose cure a Brahman undertakes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमु॑त्त॒मास्यो॑षधे॒ तव॑ वृ॒क्षा उप॑स्तयः उप॑स्तिरस्तु॒ सो॒३॒॑ऽस्माकं॒ यो अ॒स्माँ अ॑भि॒दास॑ति
verses.transliteration: tvám uttamā́sy oṣadhe  táva vr̥kṣā́ úpastayaḥ  úpastir astu sò 'smā́kaṃ  yó asmā́m̐ abhidā́sati

translation.text: Most excellent of all art thou, O Plant thy vassals are the trees. Let him be subject to our power, the man who seeks to injure us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॑स्पते॒ प्रति॑ मे दे॒वता॑मिहि मि॒त्रो वा॒ यद्वरु॑णो॒ वासि॑ पू॒षा आ॒दि॒त्यैर्वा॒ यद्वसु॑भिर्म॒रुत्वा॒न्त्स प॒र्जन्यं॒ शंत॑नवे वृषाय
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate práti me devátām ihi  mitró vā yád váruṇo vā́si pūṣā́  ādityaír vā yád vásubhir marútvān  sá parjányaṃ śáṃtanave vr̥ṣāya

translation.text: COME, be thou Mitra, Varuṇa, or Pûshan, come, O Br̥ihaspati, to mine oblation: With Maruts, Vasus, or Âdityas, make thou Parjanya pour for Ṣantanu his rain-drops.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ दे॒वो दू॒तो अ॑जि॒रश्चि॑कि॒त्वान्त्वद्दे॑वापे अ॒भि माम॑गच्छत् प्र॒ती॒ची॒नः प्रति॒ मामा व॑वृत्स्व॒ दधा॑मि ते द्यु॒मतीं॒ वाच॑मा॒सन्
verses.transliteration: ā́ devó dūtó ajiráś cikitvā́n  tvád devāpe abhí mā́m agachat  pratīcīnáḥ práti mā́m ā́ vavr̥tsva  dádhāmi te dyumátīṃ vā́cam āsán

translation.text: The God, intelligent, the speedy envoy whom thou hast sent hath come to me, Devâpi: Address thyself to me and turn thee hither within thy lips will I put brilliant language.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे धे॑हि द्यु॒मतीं॒ वाच॑मा॒सन्बृह॑स्पते अनमी॒वामि॑षि॒राम् यया॑ वृ॒ष्टिं शंत॑नवे॒ वना॑व दि॒वो द्र॒प्सो मधु॑माँ॒ आ वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: asmé dhehi dyumátīṃ vā́cam āsán  bŕ̥haspate anamīvā́m iṣirā́m  yáyā vr̥ṣṭíṃ śáṃtanave vánāva  divó drapsó mádhumām̐ ā́ viveśa

translation.text: Within my mouth, Br̥ihaspati, deposit speech lucid, vigorous, and free from weakness, Thereby to win for Ṣantanu the rain-fall. The meath-rich drop from heaven hath passed within it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ द्र॒प्सा मधु॑मन्तो विश॒न्त्विन्द्र॑ दे॒ह्यधि॑रथं स॒हस्र॑म् नि षी॑द हो॒त्रमृ॑तु॒था य॑जस्व दे॒वान्दे॑वापे ह॒विषा॑ सपर्य
verses.transliteration: ā́ no drapsā́ mádhumanto viśantu-  índra dehy ádhirathaṃ sahásram  ní ṣīda hotrám r̥tuthā́ yajasva  devā́n devāpe havíṣā saparya

translation.text: Let the sweet drops descend on us, O Indra: give us enough to lade a thousand wagons. Sit to thy Hotar task; pay worship duly, and serve the Gods, Devâpi, with oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒र्ष्टि॒षे॒णो हो॒त्रमृषि॑र्नि॒षीद॑न्दे॒वापि॑र्देवसुम॒तिं चि॑कि॒त्वान् स उत्त॑रस्मा॒दध॑रं समु॒द्रम॒पो दि॒व्या अ॑सृजद्व॒र्ष्या॑ अ॒भि
verses.transliteration: ārṣṭiṣeṇó hotrám ŕ̥ṣir niṣī́dan  devā́pir devasumatíṃ cikitvā́n  sá úttarasmād ádharaṃ samudrám  apó divyā́ asr̥jad varṣyā̀ abhí

translation.text: Knowing the God's good-will, Devâpi, R̥ishi, the son of R̥ishṭisheṇa, sate as Hotar. He hath brought down from heaven's most lofty summit the ocean of the rain, celestial waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मिन्त्स॑मु॒द्रे अध्युत्त॑रस्मि॒न्नापो॑ दे॒वेभि॒र्निवृ॑ता अतिष्ठन् ता अ॑द्रवन्नार्ष्टिषे॒णेन॑ सृ॒ष्टा दे॒वापि॑ना॒ प्रेषि॑ता मृ॒क्षिणी॑षु
verses.transliteration: asmín samudré ádhy úttarasminn  ā́po devébhir nívr̥tā atiṣṭhan  tā́ adravann ārṣṭiṣeṇéna sr̥ṣṭā́ḥ-  devā́pinā préṣitā mr̥kṣíṇīṣu

translation.text: Gathered together in that highest ocean, the waters stood by deities obstructed. They burried down set free by Ârshṭisheṇa, in gaping clefts, urged onward by Devâpi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्दे॒वापिः॒ शंत॑नवे पु॒रोहि॑तो हो॒त्राय॑ वृ॒तः कृ॒पय॒न्नदी॑धेत् दे॒व॒श्रुतं॑ वृष्टि॒वनिं॒ ररा॑णो॒ बृह॒स्पति॒र्वाच॑मस्मा अयच्छत्
verses.transliteration: yád devā́piḥ śáṃtanave puróhito  hotrā́ya vr̥táḥ kr̥páyann ádīdhet  devaśrútaṃ vr̥ṣṭivániṃ rárāṇo  bŕ̥haspátir vā́cam asmā ayachat

translation.text: When as chief priest for Ṣantanu, Devâpi, chosen for Hotar's duty, prayed beseeching, Graciously pleased Br̥ihaspati vouchsafed him a voice that reached the Gods and won the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्वा॑ दे॒वापिः॑ शुशुचा॒नो अ॑ग्न आर्ष्टिषे॒णो म॑नु॒ष्यः॑ समी॒धे विश्वे॑भिर्दे॒वैर॑नुम॒द्यमा॑नः॒ प्र प॒र्जन्य॑मीरया वृष्टि॒मन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: yáṃ tvā devā́piḥ śuśucānó agne-  ārṣṭiṣeṇó manuṣyàḥ samīdhé  víśvebhir devaír anumadyámānaḥ  prá parjányam īrayā vr̥ṣṭimántam

translation.text: O Agni whom Devâpi Arstisena, the mortal man, hath kindled in his glory, Joying in him with all the Gods together, urge on the sender of the rain, Parjanya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां पूर्व॒ ऋष॑यो गी॒र्भिरा॑य॒न्त्वाम॑ध्व॒रेषु॑ पुरुहूत॒ विश्वे॑ स॒हस्रा॒ण्यधि॑रथान्य॒स्मे आ नो॑ य॒ज्ञं रो॑हिद॒श्वोप॑ याहि
verses.transliteration: tvā́m pū́rva ŕ̥ṣayo gīrbhír āyan  tvā́m adhvaréṣu puruhūta víśve  sahásrāṇy ádhirathāny asmé  ā́ no yajñáṃ rohidaśvópa yāhi

translation.text: All ancient R̥ishis with their songs approached thee, even thee, O Much-invoked, at sacrifices. We have provided wagon-loads in thousands: come to the solemn rite, Lord of Red Horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तान्य॑ग्ने नव॒तिर्नव॒ त्वे आहु॑ता॒न्यधि॑रथा स॒हस्रा॑ तेभि॑र्वर्धस्व त॒न्वः॑ शूर पू॒र्वीर्दि॒वो नो॑ वृ॒ष्टिमि॑षि॒तो रि॑रीहि
verses.transliteration: etā́ny agne navatír náva tvé  ā́hutāny ádhirathā sahásrā  tébhir vardhasva tanvàḥ śūra pūrvī́r  divó no vr̥ṣṭím iṣitó rirīhi

translation.text: The wagon-loads, the nine-and-ninety thousand, these have been offered up to thee, O Agni. Hero, with these increase thy many bodies, and, stimulated, send us rain from heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तान्य॑ग्ने नव॒तिं स॒हस्रा॒ सं प्र य॑च्छ॒ वृष्ण॒ इन्द्रा॑य भा॒गम् वि॒द्वान्प॒थ ऋ॑तु॒शो दे॑व॒याना॒नप्यौ॑ला॒नं दि॒वि दे॒वेषु॑ धेहि
verses.transliteration: etā́ny agne navatíṃ sahásrā  sám prá yacha vŕ̥ṣṇa índrāya bhāgám  vidvā́n pathá r̥tuśó devayā́nān  ápy aulānáṃ diví devéṣu dhehi

translation.text: Give thou these ninety thousand loads, O Agni, to Indra, to the Bull, to be his portion. Knowing the paths which Deities duly travel, set mid the Gods in heaven Aulâna also.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ बाध॑स्व॒ वि मृधो॒ वि दु॒र्गहापामी॑वा॒मप॒ रक्षां॑सि सेध अ॒स्मात्स॑मु॒द्राद्बृ॑ह॒तो दि॒वो नो॒ऽपां भू॒मान॒मुप॑ नः सृजे॒ह
verses.transliteration: ágne bā́dhasva ví mŕ̥dho ví durgáhā-  -ápā́mīvām ápa rákṣāṃsi sedha  asmā́t samudrā́d br̥ható divó no  -apā́m bhūmā́nam úpa naḥ sr̥jehá

translation.text: O Agni, drive afar our foes, our troubles chase malady away and wicked demons. From this air-ocean, from the lofty heavens, send down on us a mighty flood of waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कं न॑श्चि॒त्रमि॑षण्यसि चिकि॒त्वान्पृ॑थु॒ग्मानं॑ वा॒श्रं वा॑वृ॒धध्यै॑ कत्तस्य॒ दातु॒ शव॑सो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ॒ तक्ष॒द्वज्रं॑ वृत्र॒तुर॒मपि॑न्वत्
verses.transliteration: káṃ naś citrám iṣaṇyasi cikitvā́n  pr̥thugmā́naṃ vāśráṃ vāvr̥dhádhyai  kát tásya dā́tu śávaso vyùṣṭau  tákṣad vájraṃ vr̥tratúram ápinvat

translation.text: WHAT Splendid One, Loud-voiced, Farstriding, dost thou, well knowing, urge us to exalt with praises? What give we him? When his might dawned, he fashioned the Vr̥itra-slaying bolt, and sent us waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि द्यु॒ता वि॒द्युता॒ वेति॒ साम॑ पृ॒थुं योनि॑मसुर॒त्वा स॑साद स सनी॑ळेभिः प्रसहा॒नो अ॑स्य॒ भ्रातु॒र्न ऋ॒ते स॒प्तथ॑स्य मा॒याः
verses.transliteration: sá hí dyutā́ vidyútā véti sā́ma  pr̥thúṃ yónim asuratvā́ sasāda  sá sánīḷebhiḥ prasahānó asya  bhrā́tur ná r̥té saptáthasya māyā́ḥ

translation.text: He goes to end his work with lightning flashes: wide is the seat his Asura glory gives him. With his Companions, not without his Brother, he quells Saptatha's magic devices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वाजं॒ याताप॑दुष्पदा॒ यन्त्स्व॑र्षाता॒ परि॑ षदत्सनि॒ष्यन् अ॒न॒र्वा यच्छ॒तदु॑रस्य॒ वेदो॒ घ्नञ्छि॒श्नदे॑वाँ अ॒भि वर्प॑सा॒ भूत्
verses.transliteration: sá vā́jaṃ yā́tā́paduṣpadā yán  svàrṣātā pári ṣadat saniṣyán  anarvā́ yác chatádurasya védo  ghnáñ chiśnádevām̐ abhí várpasā bhū́t

translation.text: On most auspicious path he goes to battle he toiled to win heaven's light, full fain to gain it; He seized the hundred-gated castle's treasure by craft, unchecked, and slew the lustful demons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स य॒ह्व्यो॒३॒॑ऽवनी॒र्गोष्वर्वा जु॑होति प्रध॒न्या॑सु॒ सस्रिः॑ अ॒पादो॒ यत्र॒ युज्या॑सोऽर॒था द्रो॒ण्य॑श्वास॒ ईर॑ते घृ॒तं वाः
verses.transliteration: sá yahvyò 'vánīr góṣv árvā-  ā́ juhoti pradhanyā̀su sásriḥ  apā́do yátra yújyāso 'rathā́ḥ-  droṇyàśvāsa ī́rate ghr̥táṃ vā́ḥ

translation.text: Fighting for kine, the prize of war, and I roaming among the berd be brings the young streams hither, Where, footless, joined, without a car to bear them, with jars for steeds, they pour their flood like butter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रु॒द्रेभि॒रश॑स्तवार॒ ऋभ्वा॑ हि॒त्वी गय॑मा॒रेअ॑वद्य॒ आगा॑त् व॒म्रस्य॑ मन्ये मिथु॒ना विव॑व्री॒ अन्न॑म॒भीत्या॑रोदयन्मुषा॒यन्
verses.transliteration: sá rudrébhir áśastavāra ŕ̥bhvā  hitvī́ gáyam āréavadya ā́gāt  vamrásya manye mithunā́ vívavrī  ánnam abhī́tyārodayan muṣāyán

translation.text: Bold, unsolicited for wealth, with Rudras he came, the Blameless, having left his dwelling, Came, seized the food of Vamra and his consort, and left the couple weeping and unsheltered.
