verses.sanskrit_deva: स इद्दासं॑ तुवी॒रवं॒ पति॒र्दन्त्श॑ळ॒क्षं त्रि॑शी॒र्षाणं॑ दमन्यत् अ॒स्य त्रि॒तो न्वोज॑सा वृधा॒नो वि॒पा व॑रा॒हमयो॑अग्रया हन्
verses.transliteration: sá íd dā́saṃ tuvīrávam pátir dán  ṣaḷakṣáṃ triśīrṣā́ṇaṃ damanyat  asyá tritó nv ójasā vr̥dhānó  vipā́ varāhám áyoagrayā han

translation.text: Lord of the dwelling, he subdued the demon who roared aloud, six-eyed and triple-headed. Trita, made stronger by the might he lent him, struck down the boar with shaft whose point was iron.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स द्रुह्व॑णे॒ मनु॑ष ऊर्ध्वसा॒न आ सा॑विषदर्शसा॒नाय॒ शरु॑म् स नृत॑मो॒ नहु॑षो॒ऽस्मत्सुजा॑तः॒ पुरो॑ऽभिन॒दर्ह॑न्दस्यु॒हत्ये॑
verses.transliteration: sá drúhvaṇe mánuṣa ūrdhvasānáḥ-  ā́ sāviṣad arśasānā́ya śárum  sá nŕ̥tamo náhuṣo 'smát sújātaḥ  púro 'bhinad árhan dasyuhátye

translation.text: He raised himself on high and shot his arrow against the guileful and oppressive foeman. Strong, glorious, manliest, for us he shattered the forts of Nabus when he slew the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो अ॒भ्रियो॒ न यव॑स उद॒न्यन्क्षया॑य गा॒तुं वि॒दन्नो॑ अ॒स्मे उप॒ यत्सीद॒दिन्दुं॒ शरी॑रैः श्ये॒नोऽयो॑पाष्टिर्हन्ति॒ दस्यू॑न्
verses.transliteration: só abhríyo ná yávasa udanyán  kṣáyāya gātúṃ vidán no asmé  úpa yát sī́dad índuṃ śárīraiḥ  śyenó 'yopāṣṭir hanti dásyūn

translation.text: He, like a cloud that rains upon the pasture, hath found for us the way to dwell in safety. When the Hawk comes in body to the Soma, armed with his iron claws he slays the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स व्राध॑तः शवसा॒नेभि॑रस्य॒ कुत्सा॑य॒ शुष्णं॑ कृ॒पणे॒ परा॑दात् अ॒यं क॒विम॑नयच्छ॒स्यमा॑न॒मत्कं॒ यो अ॑स्य॒ सनि॑तो॒त नृ॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: sá vrā́dhataḥ śavasānébhir asya  kútsāya śúṣṇaṃ kr̥páṇe párādāt  ayáṃ kavím anayac chasyámānam  átkaṃ yó asya sánitotá nr̥ṇā́m

translation.text: He with his potent Friends gave up the mighty, gave gusnia up to Kutsa for affliction. He led the lauded Kavi, he delivered Atka as prey to him and to his heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं द॑श॒स्यन्नर्ये॑भिरस्य द॒स्मो दे॒वेभि॒र्वरु॑णो॒ न मा॒यी अ॒यं क॒नीन॑ ऋतु॒पा अ॑वे॒द्यमि॑मीता॒ररुं॒ यश्चतु॑ष्पात्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ daśasyán náryebhir asya  dasmó devébhir váruṇo ná māyī́  ayáṃ kanī́na r̥tupā́ avedi-  ámimītāráruṃ yáś cátuṣpāt

translation.text: He, with his Gods who love mankind, the Wondrous, giving like Varuṇa who works with magic, Was known, yet young as guardian of the seasons; and he quelled Araru, four-footed dernon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य स्तोमे॑भिरौशि॒ज ऋ॒जिश्वा॑ व्र॒जं द॑रयद्वृष॒भेण॒ पिप्रोः॑ सुत्वा॒ यद्य॑ज॒तो दी॒दय॒द्गीः पुर॑ इया॒नो अ॒भि वर्प॑सा॒ भूत्
verses.transliteration: asyá stómebhir auśijá r̥jíśvā  vrajáṃ darayad vr̥ṣabhéṇa píproḥ  sútvā yád yajató dīdáyad gī́ḥ  púra iyānó abhí várpasā bhū́t

translation.text: Through lauds of him hath Auṣija R̥ijiṣvan burst, with the Mighty's aid, the stall of Pipru. When the saint pressed the juice and shone as singer, he seized the forts and with his craft subdued them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा म॒हो अ॑सुर व॒क्षथा॑य वम्र॒कः प॒ड्भिरुप॑ सर्प॒दिन्द्र॑म् स इ॑या॒नः क॑रति स्व॒स्तिम॑स्मा॒ इष॒मूर्जं॑ सुक्षि॒तिं विश्व॒माभाः॑
verses.transliteration: evā́ mahó asura vakṣáthāya  vamrakáḥ paḍbhír úpa sarpad índram  sá iyānáḥ karati svastím asmai-  íṣam ū́rjaṃ sukṣitíṃ víśvam ā́bhāḥ

translation.text: So, swiftly Asura, for exaltation, hath the great Vamraka come nigh to Indra. He will, when supplicated, bring him blessing: he hath brought all, food, strength, a happy dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ दृह्य॑ मघव॒न्त्वाव॒दिद्भु॒ज इ॒ह स्तु॒तः सु॑त॒पा बो॑धि नो वृ॒धे दे॒वेभि॑र्नः सवि॒ता प्राव॑तु श्रु॒तमा स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: índra dŕ̥hya maghavan tvā́vad íd bhujé-  ihá stutáḥ sutapā́ bodhi no vr̥dhé  devébhir naḥ savitā́ prā́vatu śrutám  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Be, like thyself, O Indra, strong for our delight: here lauded, aid us, Maghavan, drinker of the juice. Savitar with the Gods protect us: hear ye Twain. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भरा॑य॒ सु भ॑रत भा॒गमृ॒त्वियं॒ प्र वा॒यवे॑ शुचि॒पे क्र॒न्ददि॑ष्टये गौ॒रस्य॒ यः पय॑सः पी॒तिमा॑न॒श आ स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: bhárāya sú bharata bhāgám r̥tvíyam  prá vāyáve śucipé krandádiṣṭaye  gaurásya yáḥ páyasaḥ pītím ānaśé-  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Bring swift, for offering, the snare that suits the time, to the pure-drinker Vâyu, roaring as he goes, To him who hath approached the draught of shining milk. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता सा॑विष॒द्वय॑ ऋजूय॒ते यज॑मानाय सुन्व॒ते यथा॑ दे॒वान्प्र॑ति॒भूषे॑म पाक॒वदा स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: ā́ no deváḥ savitā́ sāviṣad váyaḥ-  r̥jūyaté yájamānāya sunvaté  yáthā devā́n pratibhū́ṣema pākavád  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: May Savitar the God send us full life, to each who sacrifices, lives aright and pours the juice That we with simple hearts may wait upon the Gods. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ अ॒स्मे सु॒मना॑ अस्तु वि॒श्वहा॒ राजा॒ सोमः॑ सुवि॒तस्याध्ये॑तु नः यथा॑यथा मि॒त्रधि॑तानि संद॒धुरा स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: índro asmé sumánā astu viśváhā  rā́jā sómaḥ suvitásyā́dhy etu naḥ  yáthā-yathā mitrádhitāni saṃdadhúr  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: May Indra evermore be gracious unto us, and may King Soma meditate our happiness, Even as men secure the comfort of a friend. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ उ॒क्थेन॒ शव॑सा॒ परु॑र्दधे॒ बृह॑स्पते प्रतरी॒तास्यायु॑षः य॒ज्ञो मनुः॒ प्रम॑तिर्नः पि॒ता हि क॒मा स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: índra ukthéna śávasā párur dadhe  bŕ̥haspate pratarītā́sy ā́yuṣaḥ  yajñó mánuḥ prámatir naḥ pitā́ hí kam  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Indra hath given the body with its song and strength: Br̥ihaspati, thou art the lengthener of life. The sacrifice is Manu, Providence, our Sire. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्य॒ नु सुकृ॑तं॒ दैव्यं॒ सहो॒ऽग्निर्गृ॒हे ज॑रि॒ता मेधि॑रः क॒विः य॒ज्ञश्च॑ भूद्वि॒दथे॒ चारु॒रन्त॑म॒ आ स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: índrasya nú súkr̥taṃ daívyaṃ sáho  -agnír gr̥hé jaritā́ médhiraḥ kavíḥ  yajñáś ca bhūd vidáthe cā́rur ántamaḥ-  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Indra possesseth might celestial nobly formed: the singer in the hotise is Agni, prudent Sage. lie is the sacrifice in synod, fair, most near. We ask for freedom and complete felicity,

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वो॒ गुहा॑ चकृम॒ भूरि॑ दुष्कृ॒तं नाविष्ट्यं॑ वसवो देव॒हेळ॑नम् माकि॑र्नो देवा॒ अनृ॑तस्य॒ वर्प॑स॒ आ स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: ná vo gúhā cakr̥ma bhū́ri duṣkr̥táṃ  nā́víṣṭyaṃ vasavo devahéḷanam  mā́kir no devā ánr̥tasya várpasaḥ-  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Not often have we sinned against you secretly, nor, Vasus, have we openly provoked the Gods. Not one of its, ye Gods, hath worn an alien shape. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपामी॑वां सवि॒ता सा॑विष॒न्न्य१॒॑ग्वरी॑य॒ इदप॑ सेध॒न्त्वद्र॑यः ग्रावा॒ यत्र॑ मधु॒षुदु॒च्यते॑ बृ॒हदा स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: ápā́mīvāṃ savitā́ sāviṣan nyàg  várīya íd ápa sedhantv ádrayaḥ  grā́vā yátra madhuṣúd ucyáte br̥hád  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: May Savitar remove from us our malady, and may the Mountains keep it far away from where The press-stone as it sheds the meath rings loudly forth. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वो ग्रावा॑ वसवोऽस्तु सो॒तरि॒ विश्वा॒ द्वेषां॑सि सनु॒तर्यु॑योत स नो॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता पा॒युरीड्य॒ आ स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvó grā́vā vasavo 'stu sotári  víśvā dvéṣāṃsi sanutár yuyota  sá no deváḥ savitā́ pāyúr ī́ḍyaḥ-  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Ye Vasus, let the stone, the presser stand erect: avert all enmities and keep them far remote. Our guard to be adored is Savitar this God. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊर्जं॑ गावो॒ यव॑से॒ पीवो॑ अत्तन ऋ॒तस्य॒ याः सद॑ने॒ कोशे॑ अ॒ङ्ग्ध्वे त॒नूरे॒व त॒न्वो॑ अस्तु भेष॒जमा स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: ū́rjaṃ gāvo yávase pī́vo attana  r̥tásya yā́ḥ sádane kóśe aṅgdhvé  tanū́r evá tanvò astu bheṣajám  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Eat strength and fatness in the pasture, kine, who are balmed at the reservoir and at the seat of Law. So let your body be our body's medicine. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्र॒तु॒प्रावा॑ जरि॒ता शश्व॑ता॒मव॒ इन्द्र॒ इद्भ॒द्रा प्रम॑तिः सु॒ताव॑ताम् पू॒र्णमूध॑र्दि॒व्यं यस्य॑ सि॒क्तय॒ आ स॒र्वता॑ति॒मदि॑तिं वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: kratuprā́vā jaritā́ śáśvatām ávaḥ-  índra íd bhadrā́ prámatiḥ sutā́vatām  pūrṇám ū́dhar divyáṃ yásya siktáye-  ā́ sarvátātim áditiṃ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: The singer fills the spirit: all mens, love hath he. Indra takes kindly care of those who pour the juice. For his libation is the heavenly udder full. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चि॒त्रस्ते॑ भा॒नुः क्र॑तु॒प्रा अ॑भि॒ष्टिः सन्ति॒ स्पृधो॑ जरणि॒प्रा अधृ॑ष्टाः रजि॑ष्ठया॒ रज्या॑ प॒श्व आ गोस्तूतू॑र्षति॒ पर्यग्रं॑ दुव॒स्युः
verses.transliteration: citrás te bhānúḥ kratuprā́ abhiṣṭíḥ  sánti spŕ̥dho jaraṇiprā́ ádhr̥ṣṭāḥ  rájiṣṭhayā rájyā paśvá ā́ gós  tū́tūrṣaty páry ágraṃ duvasyúḥ

translation.text: Wondrous thy spirit-filling light, triumpliant; thy hosts save from decay and are resistless. The pious votary by straightest pathway speeds to possess the best of all the cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्बु॑ध्यध्वं॒ सम॑नसः सखायः॒ सम॒ग्निमि॑न्ध्वं ब॒हवः॒ सनी॑ळाः द॒धि॒क्राम॒ग्निमु॒षसं॑ च दे॒वीमिन्द्रा॑व॒तोऽव॑से॒ नि ह्व॑ये वः
verses.transliteration: úd budhyadhvaṃ sámanasaḥ sakhāyaḥ  sám agním indhvam bahávaḥ sánīḷāḥ  dadhikrā́m agním uṣásaṃ ca devī́m  índrāvató 'vase ní hvaye vaḥ

translation.text: WAKE with one mind, my friends, and kindle Agni, ye who are many and who dwell together. Agni and Dadhikrâs and Dawn the Goddess, you, Gods with Indra, I call down to help us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒न्द्रा कृ॑णुध्वं॒ धिय॒ आ त॑नुध्वं॒ नाव॑मरित्र॒पर॑णीं कृणुध्वम् इष्कृ॑णुध्व॒मायु॒धारं॑ कृणुध्वं॒ प्राञ्चं॑ य॒ज्ञं प्र ण॑यता सखायः
verses.transliteration: mandrā́ kr̥ṇudhvaṃ dhíya ā́ tanudhvaṃ  nā́vam aritrapáraṇīṃ kr̥ṇudhvam  íṣkr̥ṇudhvam ā́yudhā́raṃ kr̥ṇudhvam  prā́ñcaṃ yajñám prá ṇayatā sakhāyaḥ

translation.text: Make pleasant hymns, spin out your songs and praises: build ye a ship equipped with oars for transport. Prepare the implements, make all things ready, and let the sacrifice, my friends, go forward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒नक्त॒ सीरा॒ वि यु॒गा त॑नुध्वं कृ॒ते योनौ॑ वपते॒ह बीज॑म् गि॒रा च॑ श्रु॒ष्टिः सभ॑रा॒ अस॑न्नो॒ नेदी॑य॒ इत्सृ॒ण्यः॑ प॒क्वमेया॑त्
verses.transliteration: yunákta sī́rā ví yugā́ tanudhvaṃ  kr̥té yónau vapatehá bī́jam  girā́ ca śruṣṭíḥ sábharā ásan no  nédīya ít sr̥ṇyàḥ pakvám éyāt

translation.text: Lay on the yokes, and fasten well the traces: formed is the furrow, sow the seed within it. Through song may we find bearing fraught with plenty: near to the ripened grain approach the sickle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सीरा॑ युञ्जन्ति क॒वयो॑ यु॒गा वि त॑न्वते॒ पृथ॑क् धीरा॑ दे॒वेषु॑ सुम्न॒या
verses.transliteration: sī́rā yuñjanti kaváyo  yugā́ ví tanvate pŕ̥thak  dhī́rā devéṣu sumnayā́

translation.text: Wise, through desire of bliss from Gods, the skilful bind the traces fast, And lay the yokes on either side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निरा॑हा॒वान्कृ॑णोतन॒ सं व॑र॒त्रा द॑धातन सि॒ञ्चाम॑हा अव॒तमु॒द्रिणं॑ व॒यं सु॒षेक॒मनु॑पक्षितम्
verses.transliteration: nír āhāvā́n kr̥ṇotana  sáṃ varatrā́ dadhātana  siñcā́mahā avatám udríṇaṃ vayáṃ  suṣékam ánupakṣitam

translation.text: Arrange the buckets in their place securely fasten on the straps. We will pour forth the well that hath a copious stream, fair-flowing well that never fails.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इष्कृ॑ताहावमव॒तं सु॑वर॒त्रं सु॑षेच॒नम् उ॒द्रिणं॑ सिञ्चे॒ अक्षि॑तम्
verses.transliteration: íṣkr̥tāhāvam avatáṃ  suvaratráṃ suṣecanám  udríṇaṃ siñce ákṣitam

translation.text: I pour the water from the well with pails prepared and goodly straps, Unfailing, full, with plenteous stream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्री॒णी॒ताश्वा॑न्हि॒तं ज॑याथ स्वस्ति॒वाहं॒ रथ॒मित्कृ॑णुध्वम् द्रोणा॑हावमव॒तमश्म॑चक्र॒मंस॑त्रकोशं सिञ्चता नृ॒पाण॑म्
verses.transliteration: prīṇītā́śvān hitáṃ jayātha  svastivā́haṃ rátham ít kr̥ṇudhvam  dróṇāhāvam avatám áśmacakram  áṃsatrakośaṃ siñcatā nr̥pā́ṇam

translation.text: Refresh the horses, win the prize before you: equip a chariot fraught with happy fortune. Pour forth the well with stone wheel, wooden buckets, the drink of heroes, with the trough for armour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्र॒जं कृ॑णुध्वं॒ स हि वो॑ नृ॒पाणो॒ वर्म॑ सीव्यध्वं बहु॒ला पृ॒थूनि॑ पुरः॑ कृणुध्व॒माय॑सी॒रधृ॑ष्टा॒ मा वः॑ सुस्रोच्चम॒सो दृंह॑ता॒ तम्
verses.transliteration: vrajáṃ kr̥ṇudhvaṃ sá hí vo nr̥pā́ṇo  várma sīvyadhvam bahulā́ pr̥thū́ni  púraḥ kr̥ṇudhvam ā́yasīr ádhr̥ṣṭāḥ-  mā́ vaḥ susroc camasó dŕ̥ṃhatā tám

translation.text: Prepare the cow-stall, for there drink your heroes: stitch ye the coats of armour, wide and many. Make iron forts, secure from all assailants let not your pitcher leak: stay it securely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वो॒ धियं॑ य॒ज्ञियां॑ वर्त ऊ॒तये॒ देवा॑ दे॒वीं य॑ज॒तां य॒ज्ञिया॑मि॒ह सा नो॑ दुहीय॒द्यव॑सेव ग॒त्वी स॒हस्र॑धारा॒ पय॑सा म॒ही गौः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vo dhíyaṃ yajñíyāṃ varta ūtáye  dévā devī́ṃ yajatā́ṃ yajñíyām ihá  sā́ no duhīyad yávaseva gatvī́  sahásradhārā páyasā mahī́ gaúḥ

translation.text: Hither, for help, I turn the holy heavenly mind of you the Holy Gods, that longs for sacrifice. May it pour milk for us, even as a stately cow who, having sought the pasture, yields a thousand streams.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तू षि॑ञ्च॒ हरि॑मीं॒ द्रोरु॒पस्थे॒ वाशी॑भिस्तक्षताश्म॒न्मयी॑भिः परि॑ ष्वजध्वं॒ दश॑ क॒क्ष्या॑भिरु॒भे धुरौ॒ प्रति॒ वह्निं॑ युनक्त
verses.transliteration: ā́ tū́ ṣiñca hárim īṃ drór upásthe  vā́śībhis takṣatāśmanmáyībhiḥ  pári ṣvajadhvaṃ dáśa kakṣyā̀bhir  ubhé dhúrau práti váhniṃ yunakta

translation.text: Pour golden juice within the wooden vessel: with stone-made axes fashion ye and form it. Embrace and compass it with tenfold girdle, and to both chariot-poles attach the car-horse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भे धुरौ॒ वह्नि॑रा॒पिब्द॑मानो॒ऽन्तर्योने॑व चरति द्वि॒जानिः॑ वन॒स्पतिं॒ वन॒ आस्था॑पयध्वं॒ नि षू द॑धिध्व॒मख॑नन्त॒ उत्स॑म्
verses.transliteration: ubhé dhúrau váhnir āpíbdamāno  -antár yóneva carati dvijā́niḥ  vánaspátiṃ vána ā́sthāpayadhvaṃ  ní ṣū́ dadhidhvam ákhananta útsam

translation.text: Between both poles the car-horse goes pressed closely, as in his dwelling moves the doublywedded. Lay in the wood the Soviran of the Forest, and sink the well although ye do not dig it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कपृ॑न्नरः कपृ॒थमुद्द॑धातन चो॒दय॑त खु॒दत॒ वाज॑सातये नि॒ष्टि॒ग्र्यः॑ पु॒त्रमा च्या॑वयो॒तय॒ इन्द्रं॑ स॒बाध॑ इ॒ह सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: kápr̥n naraḥ kapr̥thám úd dadhātana  codáyata khudáta vā́jasātaye  niṣṭigryàḥ putrám ā́ cyāvayotáye-  índraṃ sabā́dha ihá sómapītaye

translation.text: Indra is he, O men, who gives us happiness: sport, urge the giver of delight to win us strength Bring quickly down, O priests, hither to give us aid, to drink the Soma, Indra Son of Nishṭigrî.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॒ रथं॑ मिथू॒कृत॒मिन्द्रो॑ऽवतु धृष्णु॒या अ॒स्मिन्ना॒जौ पु॑रुहूत श्र॒वाय्ये॑ धनभ॒क्षेषु॑ नोऽव
verses.transliteration: prá te rátham mithūkŕ̥tam  índro 'vatu dhr̥ṣṇuyā́  asmínn ājaú puruhūta śravā́yye  dhanabhakṣéṣu no 'va

translation.text: FOR thee may Indra boldly speed the car that works on either side. Favour us, Much-invoked! in this most glorious fight against the raiders of our wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्स्म॒ वातो॑ वहति॒ वासो॑ऽस्या॒ अधि॑रथं॒ यदज॑यत्स॒हस्र॑म् र॒थीर॑भून्मुद्ग॒लानी॒ गवि॑ष्टौ॒ भरे॑ कृ॒तं व्य॑चेदिन्द्रसे॒ना
verses.transliteration: út sma vā́to vahati vā́so 'syāḥ-  ádhirathaṃ yád ájayat sahásram  rathī́r abhūn mudgalā́nī gáviṣṭau  bháre kr̥táṃ vy àced indrasenā́

translation.text: Loose in the wind the woman's robe was streaming what time she won a car-load worth a thousand. The charioteer in fight was Mudgalani: she Indra's dart, heaped up the prize of battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्तर्य॑च्छ॒ जिघां॑सतो॒ वज्र॑मिन्द्राभि॒दास॑तः दास॑स्य वा मघव॒न्नार्य॑स्य वा सनु॒तर्य॑वया व॒धम्
verses.transliteration: antár yacha jíghāṃsato  vájram indrābhidā́sataḥ  dā́sasya vā maghavann ā́ryasya vā  sanutár yavayā vadhám

translation.text: O Indra, cast thy bolt among assailants who would slaughter us: The weapon both of Dâsa and of Ârya foe keep far away, O Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒द्नो ह्र॒दम॑पिब॒ज्जर्हृ॑षाणः॒ कूटं॑ स्म तृं॒हद॒भिमा॑तिमेति प्र मु॒ष्कभा॑रः॒ श्रव॑ इ॒च्छमा॑नोऽजि॒रं बा॒हू अ॑भर॒त्सिषा॑सन्
verses.transliteration: udnó hradám apibaj járhr̥ṣāṇaḥ  kū́ṭaṃ sma tr̥ṃhád abhímātim eti  prá muṣkábhāraḥ śráva ichámāno  -ajirám bāhū́ abharat síṣāsan

translation.text: The bull in joy had drunk a lake of water. His shattering horn encountered an opponent. Swiftly, in vigorous strength, eager for glory, he stretched his forefeet, fain to win and triumph.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न्य॑क्रन्दयन्नुप॒यन्त॑ एन॒ममे॑हयन्वृष॒भं मध्य॑ आ॒जेः तेन॒ सूभ॑र्वं श॒तव॑त्स॒हस्रं॒ गवां॒ मुद्ग॑लः प्र॒धने॑ जिगाय
verses.transliteration: ny àkrandayann upayánta enam  ámehayan vr̥ṣabhám mádhya ājéḥ  téna sū́bharvaṃ śatávat sahásraṃ  gávām múdgalaḥ pradháne jigāya

translation.text: They came anear the bull; they made him thunder, made him pour rain down ere the fight was ended. And Mudgala thereby won in the contest well-pastured kine in hundreds and in thousands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒कर्द॑वे वृष॒भो यु॒क्त आ॑सी॒दवा॑वची॒त्सार॑थिरस्य के॒शी दुधे॑र्यु॒क्तस्य॒ द्रव॑तः स॒हान॑स ऋ॒च्छन्ति॑ ष्मा नि॒ष्पदो॑ मुद्ग॒लानी॑म्
verses.transliteration: kakárdave vr̥ṣabhó yuktá āsīd  ávāvacīt sā́rathir asya keśī́  dúdher yuktásya drávataḥ sahā́nasā-  r̥chánti ṣmā niṣpádo mudgalā́nīm

translation.text: In hope of victory that bull was harnessed: Kesi the driver urged him on with shouting. As he ran swiftly with the car behind him his lifted heels pressed close on Mudgalani.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त प्र॒धिमुद॑हन्नस्य वि॒द्वानुपा॑युन॒ग्वंस॑ग॒मत्र॒ शिक्ष॑न् इन्द्र॒ उदा॑व॒त्पति॒मघ्न्या॑ना॒मरं॑हत॒ पद्या॑भिः क॒कुद्मा॑न्
verses.transliteration: utá pradhím úd ahann asya vidvā́n  úpāyunag váṃsagam átra śíkṣan  índra úd āvat pátim ághnyānām  áraṃhata pádyābhiḥ kakúdmān

translation.text: Deftly for him he stretched the car-pole forward, guided the bull thereto and firmly yoked him. Indra vouchsafed the lord of cows his favour: with mighty steps the buffalo ran onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नम॑ष्ट्रा॒व्य॑चरत्कप॒र्दी व॑र॒त्रायां॒ दार्वा॒नह्य॑मानः नृ॒म्णानि॑ कृ॒ण्वन्ब॒हवे॒ जना॑य॒ गाः प॑स्पशा॒नस्तवि॑षीरधत्त
verses.transliteration: śunám aṣṭrāvy àcarat kapardī́  varatrā́yāṃ dā́rv ānáhyamānaḥ  nr̥mṇā́ni kr̥ṇván baháve jánāya  gā́ḥ paspaśānás táviṣīr adhatta

translation.text: Touched by the goad the shaggy beast went nobly, bound to the pole by the yoke's thong of leather. Performing deeds of might for many people, he, looking on the cows, gained strength and vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं तं प॑श्य वृष॒भस्य॒ युञ्जं॒ काष्ठा॑या॒ मध्ये॑ द्रुघ॒णं शया॑नम् येन॑ जि॒गाय॑ श॒तव॑त्स॒हस्रं॒ गवां॒ मुद्ग॑लः पृत॒नाज्ये॑षु
verses.transliteration: imáṃ tám paśya vr̥ṣabhásya yúñjaṃ  kā́ṣṭhāyā mádhye drughaṇáṃ śáyānam  yéna jigā́ya śatávat sahásraṃ  gávām múdgalaḥ pr̥tanā́jyeṣu

translation.text: Here look upon this mace, this bull's companion, now lying midway on the field of battle. Therewith hath Mudgala in ordered contest won for cattle for himself, a hundred thousand.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒रे अ॒घा को न्वि१॒॑त्था द॑दर्श॒ यं यु॒ञ्जन्ति॒ तम्वा स्था॑पयन्ति नास्मै॒ तृणं॒ नोद॒कमा भ॑र॒न्त्युत्त॑रो धु॒रो व॑हति प्र॒देदि॑शत्
verses.transliteration: āré aghā́ kó nv ìtthā́ dadarśa  yáṃ yuñjánti tám v ā́ sthāpayanti  nā́smai tŕ̥ṇaṃ nódakám ā́ bharanti-  úttaro dhuró vahati pradédiśat

translation.text: Far is the evil: who hath here beheld it? Hither they bring the bull whom they are yoking.. To this they give not either food or water. Reaching beyond the pole it gives directions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रि॒वृ॒क्तेव॑ पति॒विद्य॑मान॒ट् पीप्या॑ना॒ कूच॑क्रेणेव सि॒ञ्चन् ए॒षै॒ष्या॑ चिद्र॒थ्या॑ जयेम सुम॒ङ्गलं॒ सिन॑वदस्तु सा॒तम्
verses.transliteration: parivr̥ktéva pativídyam ānaṭ  pī́pyānā kū́cakreṇeva siñcán  eṣaiṣyā̀ cid rathyā̀ jayema  sumaṅgálaṃ sínavad astu sātám

translation.text: Like one forsaken, she hath found a husband, and teemed as if her breast were full and flowing. With swiftly-racing chariot may we conquer, and rich and blessed be our gains in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं विश्व॑स्य॒ जग॑त॒श्चक्षु॑रिन्द्रासि॒ चक्षु॑षः वृषा॒ यदा॒जिं वृष॑णा॒ सिषा॑ससि चो॒दय॒न्वध्रि॑णा यु॒जा
verses.transliteration: tváṃ víśvasya jágataś  cákṣur indrāsi cákṣuṣaḥ  vŕ̥ṣā yád ājíṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇā síṣāsasi  codáyan vádhriṇā yujā́

translation.text: Thou, Indra, art the mark whereon the eyes of all life rest, when thou, A Bull who drivest with thy bull, wilt win the race together with thy weakling friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒शुः शिशा॑नो वृष॒भो न भी॒मो घ॑नाघ॒नः क्षोभ॑णश्चर्षणी॒नाम् सं॒क्रन्द॑नोऽनिमि॒ष ए॑कवी॒रः श॒तं सेना॑ अजयत्सा॒कमिन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: āśúḥ śíśāno vr̥ṣabhó ná bhīmó  ghanāghanáḥ kṣóbhaṇaś carṣaṇīnā́m  saṃkrándano 'nimiṣá ekavīráḥ  śatáṃ sénā ajayat sākám índraḥ

translation.text: SWIFT, rapidly striking, like a bull who sharpens his horns, terrific, stirring up the people, With eyes that close not, bellowing, Sole Hero, Indra. subdued at once a hundred armies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं॒क्रन्द॑नेनानिमि॒षेण॑ जि॒ष्णुना॑ युत्का॒रेण॑ दुश्च्यव॒नेन॑ धृ॒ष्णुना॑ तदिन्द्रे॑ण जयत॒ तत्स॑हध्वं॒ युधो॑ नर॒ इषु॑हस्तेन॒ वृष्णा॑
verses.transliteration: saṃkrándanenānimiṣéṇa jiṣṇúnā  yutkāréṇa duścyavanéna dhr̥ṣṇúnā  tád índreṇa jayata tát sahadhvaṃ  yúdho nara íṣuhastena vŕ̥ṣṇā

translation.text: With him loud-roaring, ever watchful, Victor, bold, hard to overthrow, Rouser of battle, Indra. the Strong, whose hand bears arrows, conquer, ye warriors, now, now vanquish in the combat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इषु॑हस्तैः॒ स नि॑ष॒ङ्गिभि॑र्व॒शी संस्र॑ष्टा॒ स युध॒ इन्द्रो॑ ग॒णेन॑ सं॒सृ॒ष्ट॒जित्सो॑म॒पा बा॑हुश॒र्ध्यु१॒॑ग्रध॑न्वा॒ प्रति॑हिताभि॒रस्ता॑
verses.transliteration: sá íṣuhastaiḥ sá niṣaṅgíbhir vaśī́  sáṃsraṣṭā sá yúdha índro gaṇéna  saṃsr̥ṣṭajít somapā́ bāhuśardhī́-  -ugrádhanvā prátihitābhir ástā

translation.text: He rules with those who carry shafts and quivers, Indra who with his band rings hosts together, Foe-conquering, strong of arm, the Soma-drinker, with mighty bow, shooting with well-laid arrows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॑स्पते॒ परि॑ दीया॒ रथे॑न रक्षो॒हामित्राँ॑ अप॒बाध॑मानः प्र॒भ॒ञ्जन्त्सेनाः॑ प्रमृ॒णो यु॒धा जय॑न्न॒स्माक॑मेध्यवि॒ता रथा॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate pári dīyā ráthena  rakṣohā́mítrām̐ apabā́dhamānaḥ  prabhañján sénāḥ pramr̥ṇó yudhā́ jáyann  asmā́kam edhy avitā́ ráthānām

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati, fly with thy chariot hither, slayer of demons, driving off our foemen. Be thou protector of our cars, destroyer, victor in battle, breaker-up of armies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब॒ल॒वि॒ज्ञा॒यः स्थवि॑रः॒ प्रवी॑रः॒ सह॑स्वान्वा॒जी सह॑मान उ॒ग्रः अ॒भिवी॑रो अ॒भिस॑त्वा सहो॒जा जैत्र॑मिन्द्र॒ रथ॒मा ति॑ष्ठ गो॒वित्
verses.transliteration: balavijñāyá stháviraḥ právīraḥ  sáhasvān vājī́ sáhamāna ugráḥ  abhívīro abhísatvā sahojā́ḥ-  jaítram indra rátham ā́ tiṣṭha govít

translation.text: Conspicuous by thy strength, firm, foremost fighter, mighty and fierce, victorious, all-subduing, The Son of Conquest, passing men and heroes, kine-winner, mount thy conquering car, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गो॒त्र॒भिदं॑ गो॒विदं॒ वज्र॑बाहुं॒ जय॑न्त॒मज्म॑ प्रमृ॒णन्त॒मोज॑सा इ॒मं स॑जाता॒ अनु॑ वीरयध्व॒मिन्द्रं॑ सखायो॒ अनु॒ सं र॑भध्वम्
verses.transliteration: gotrabhídaṃ govídaṃ vájrabāhuṃ  jáyantam ájma pramr̥ṇántam ójasā  imáṃ sajātā ánu vīrayadhvam  índraṃ sakhāyo ánu sáṃ rabhadhvam

translation.text: Cleaver of stalls, kine-winner, armed with thunder, who quells an army and with might destroys it.- Follow him, brothers! quit yourselves like heroes, and like this Indra show your zeal and courage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि गो॒त्राणि॒ सह॑सा॒ गाह॑मानोऽद॒यो वी॒रः श॒तम॑न्यु॒रिन्द्रः॑ दु॒श्च्य॒व॒नः पृ॑तना॒षाळ॑यु॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ऽस्माकं॒ सेना॑ अवतु॒ प्र यु॒त्सु
verses.transliteration: abhí gotrā́ṇi sáhasā gā́hamāno  -adayó vīráḥ śatámanyur índraḥ  duścyavanáḥ pr̥tanāṣā́ḷ ayudhyáḥ-  -asmā́kaṃ sénā avatu prá yutsú

translation.text: Piercing the cow-stalls with surpassing vigour, Indra, the pitiless Hero, wild with anger, Victor in fight, unshaken and resistless,may he protect our armies in our battles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ आसां ने॒ता बृह॒स्पति॒र्दक्षि॑णा य॒ज्ञः पु॒र ए॑तु॒ सोमः॑ दे॒व॒से॒नाना॑मभिभञ्जती॒नां जय॑न्तीनां म॒रुतो॑ य॒न्त्वग्र॑म्
verses.transliteration: índra āsāṃ netā́ bŕ̥haspátir  dákṣiṇā yajñáḥ purá etu sómaḥ  devasenā́nām abhibhañjatīnā́ṃ  jáyantīnām marúto yantv ágram

translation.text: Indra guide these: Br̥ihaspati precede them, the guerdon, and the sacrifice, and Soma; And let the banded Maruts march in forefront of heavenly hosts that conquer and demolish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्य॒ वृष्णो॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ राज्ञ॑ आदि॒त्यानां॑ म॒रुतां॒ शर्ध॑ उ॒ग्रम् म॒हाम॑नसां भुवनच्य॒वानां॒ घोषो॑ दे॒वानां॒ जय॑ता॒मुद॑स्थात्
verses.transliteration: índrasya vŕ̥ṣṇo váruṇasya rā́jñaḥ-  ādityā́nām marútāṃ śárdha ugrám  mahā́manasām bhuvanacyavā́nāṃ  ghóṣo devā́nāṃ jáyatām úd asthāt

translation.text: Ours be the potent host of mighty Indra, King Varuṇa, and Maruts, and Âdityas. Uplifted is the shout of Gods who conquer high-minded Gods who cause the worlds to tremble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्ध॑र्षय मघव॒न्नायु॑धा॒न्युत्सत्व॑नां माम॒कानां॒ मनां॑सि उद्वृ॑त्रहन्वा॒जिनां॒ वाजि॑ना॒न्युद्रथा॑नां॒ जय॑तां यन्तु॒ घोषाः॑
verses.transliteration: úd dharṣaya maghavann ā́yudhāni-  út sátvanām māmakā́nām mánāṃsi  úd vr̥trahan vājínāṃ vā́jināni-  úd ráthānāṃ jáyatāṃ yantu ghóṣāḥ

translation.text: Bristle thou up, O Maghavan, our weapons: excite the spirits of my warring heroes. Urge on the strong steeds' might, O Vr̥itra-slayer, and let the din of conquering cars go upward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॒मिन्द्रः॒ समृ॑तेषु ध्व॒जेष्व॒स्माकं॒ या इष॑व॒स्ता ज॑यन्तु अ॒स्माकं॑ वी॒रा उत्त॑रे भवन्त्व॒स्माँ उ॑ देवा अवता॒ हवे॑षु
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam índraḥ sámr̥teṣu dhvajéṣu-  asmā́kaṃ yā́ íṣavas tā́ jayantu  asmā́kaṃ vīrā́ úttare bhavantu-  asmā́m̐ u devā avatā háveṣu

translation.text: May Indra aid us when our flags are gathered: victorious be the arrows of our army. May our brave men of war prevail in battle. Ye Gods, protect us in the shout of onset.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒मीषां॑ चि॒त्तं प्र॑तिलो॒भय॑न्ती गृहा॒णाङ्गा॑न्यप्वे॒ परे॑हि अ॒भि प्रेहि॒ निर्द॑ह हृ॒त्सु शोकै॑र॒न्धेना॒मित्रा॒स्तम॑सा सचन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: amī́ṣāṃ cittám pratilobháyantī  gr̥hāṇā́ṅgāny apve párehi  abhí préhi nír daha hr̥tsú śókair  andhénāmítrās támasā sacantāṃ

translation.text: Bewildering the senses of our foemen, seize thou their bodies and depart, O Apva. Attack them, set their hearts on fire and burn them: so let our foes abide in utter darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेता॒ जय॑ता नर॒ इन्द्रो॑ वः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतु उ॒ग्रा वः॑ सन्तु बा॒हवो॑ऽनाधृ॒ष्या यथास॑थ
verses.transliteration: prétā jáyatā naraḥ-  índro vaḥ śárma yachatu  ugrā́ vaḥ santu bāhávo  -anādhr̥ṣyā́ yáthā́satha

translation.text: Advance, O heroes, win the day. May Indra be your sure defence. Exceeding mighty be your arms, that none may wound or injure you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असा॑वि॒ सोमः॑ पुरुहूत॒ तुभ्यं॒ हरि॑भ्यां य॒ज्ञमुप॑ याहि॒ तूय॑म् तुभ्यं॒ गिरो॒ विप्र॑वीरा इया॒ना द॑धन्वि॒र इ॑न्द्र॒ पिबा॑ सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: ásāvi sómaḥ puruhūta túbhyaṃ  háribhyāṃ yajñám úpa yāhi tū́yam  túbhyaṃ gíro vípravīrā iyānā́ḥ-  dadhanvirá indra píbā sutásya

translation.text: Soma hath flowed for thee, Invoked of mat Speed to our sacrifice with both thy Coursers. To thee have streameld the songs or mighty singers, imploring, Indra, drink of our libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒प्सु धू॒तस्य॑ हरिवः॒ पिबे॒ह नृभिः॑ सु॒तस्य॑ ज॒ठरं॑ पृणस्व मि॒मि॒क्षुर्यमद्र॑य इन्द्र॒ तुभ्यं॒ तेभि॑र्वर्धस्व॒ मद॑मुक्थवाहः
verses.transliteration: apsú dhūtásya harivaḥ píbehá  nŕ̥bhiḥ sutásya jaṭháram pr̥ṇasva  mimikṣúr yám ádraya indra túbhyaṃ  tébhir vardhasva mádam ukthavāhaḥ

translation.text: Drink of the juice which men have washed in waters, and fill thee full, O Lord of Tawny Horses. O Indra, hearer of the laud, with Soma which stones have mixed for thee enhance thy rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रोग्रां पी॒तिं वृष्ण॑ इयर्मि स॒त्यां प्र॒यै सु॒तस्य॑ हर्यश्व॒ तुभ्य॑म् इन्द्र॒ धेना॑भिरि॒ह मा॑दयस्व धी॒भिर्विश्वा॑भिः॒ शच्या॑ गृणा॒नः
verses.transliteration: prógrā́m pītíṃ vŕ̥ṣṇa iyarmi satyā́m  prayaí sutásya haryaśva túbhyam  índra dhénābhir ihá mādayasva  dhībhír víśvābhiḥ śácyā gr̥ṇānáḥ

translation.text: To make thee start, a strong true draught I offer to thee, the Bull, O thou whom Bay Steeds carry. Here take delight, O Indra, in our voices while thou art hymned with power and all our spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒ती श॑चीव॒स्तव॑ वी॒र्ये॑ण॒ वयो॒ दधा॑ना उ॒शिज॑ ऋत॒ज्ञाः प्र॒जाव॑दिन्द्र॒ मनु॑षो दुरो॒णे त॒स्थुर्गृ॒णन्तः॑ सध॒माद्या॑सः
verses.transliteration: ūtī́ śacīvas táva vīryèṇa  váyo dádhānā uśíja r̥tajñā́ḥ  prajā́vad indra mánuṣo duroṇé  tasthúr gr̥ṇántaḥ sadhamā́dyāsaḥ

translation.text: O Mighty Indra, through thine aid, thy prowess, obtaining life, zealous, and skilled in Order, Men in the house who share the sacred banquet stand singing praise that brings them store of children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रणी॑तिभिष्टे हर्यश्व सु॒ष्टोः सु॑षु॒म्नस्य॑ पुरु॒रुचो॒ जना॑सः मंहि॑ष्ठामू॒तिं वि॒तिरे॒ दधा॑नाः स्तो॒तार॑ इन्द्र॒ तव॑ सू॒नृता॑भिः
verses.transliteration: práṇītibhiṣ ṭe haryaśva suṣṭóḥ  suṣumnásya pururúco jánāsaḥ  máṃhiṣṭhām ūtíṃ vitíre dádhānāḥ-  stotā́ra indra táva sūnŕ̥tābhiḥ

translation.text: Through thy directions, Lord of Tawny Coursers, thine who art firm, splendid, and blest, the people Obtain most liberal aid for their salvation, and praise thee, Indra, through thine excellencies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि हरिवो॒ हरि॑भ्यां॒ सोम॑स्य याहि पी॒तये॑ सु॒तस्य॑ इन्द्र॑ त्वा य॒ज्ञः क्षम॑माणमानड्दा॒श्वाँ अ॑स्यध्व॒रस्य॑ प्रके॒तः
verses.transliteration: úpa bráhmāṇi harivo háribhyāṃ  sómasya yāhi pītáye sutásya  índra tvā yajñáḥ kṣámamāṇam ānaḍ  dāśvā́m̐ asy adhvarásya praketáḥ

translation.text: Lord of the Bays, come with thy two Bay Horses, come to our prayers, to drink the juice of Soma. To thee comes sacrifice which thou acceptest: thou, skilled in holy rites, art he who giveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑वाजमभिमाति॒षाहं॑ सु॒तेर॑णं म॒घवा॑नं सुवृ॒क्तिम् उप॑ भूषन्ति॒ गिरो॒ अप्र॑तीत॒मिन्द्रं॑ नम॒स्या ज॑रि॒तुः प॑नन्त
verses.transliteration: sahásravājam abhimātiṣā́haṃ  sutéraṇam maghávānaṃ suvr̥ktím  úpa bhūṣanti gíro ápratītam  índraṃ namasyā́ jaritúḥ pananta

translation.text: Him of a thousand powers, subduing foemen, Maghavan praised with hymns and pleased with Soma,– Even him our songs approach, resistless Indra: the adorations of the singer laud him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्तापो॑ दे॒वीः सु॒रणा॒ अमृ॑क्ता॒ याभिः॒ सिन्धु॒मत॑र इन्द्र पू॒र्भित् न॒व॒तिं स्रो॒त्या नव॑ च॒ स्रव॑न्तीर्दे॒वेभ्यो॑ गा॒तुं मनु॑षे च विन्दः
verses.transliteration: saptā́po devī́ḥ suráṇā ámr̥ktāḥ-  yā́bhiḥ síndhum átara indra pūrbhít  navatíṃ srotyā́ náva ca srávantīr  devébhyo gātúm mánuṣe ca vindaḥ

translation.text: The way to bliss for Gods and man thou foundest, Indra, seven lovely floods, divine, untroubled, Wherewith thou, rending forts, didst move the ocean, and nine-and-ninety flowing streams of water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पो म॒हीर॒भिश॑स्तेरमु॒ञ्चोऽजा॑गरा॒स्वधि॑ दे॒व एकः॑ इन्द्र॒ यास्त्वं वृ॑त्र॒तूर्ये॑ च॒कर्थ॒ ताभि॑र्वि॒श्वायु॑स्त॒न्वं॑ पुपुष्याः
verses.transliteration: apó mahī́r abhíśaster amuñcaḥ-  -ájāgar āsv ádhi devá ékaḥ  índra yā́s tváṃ vr̥tratū́rye cakártha  tā́bhir viśvā́yus tanvàm pupuṣyāḥ

translation.text: Thou from the curse didst free the mighty Waters, and as their only God didst watch and guard them. O Indra, cherish evermore thy body with those which thou hast won in quelling Vr̥itra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वी॒रेण्यः॒ क्रतु॒रिन्द्रः॑ सुश॒स्तिरु॒तापि॒ धेना॑ पुरुहू॒तमी॑ट्टे आर्द॑यद्वृ॒त्रमकृ॑णोदु लो॒कं स॑सा॒हे श॒क्रः पृत॑ना अभि॒ष्टिः
verses.transliteration: vīréṇyaḥ krátur índraḥ suśastír  utā́pi dhénā puruhūtám īṭṭe  ā́rdayad vr̥trám ákr̥ṇod ulokáṃ  sasāhé śakráḥ pŕ̥tanā abhiṣṭíḥ

translation.text: Heroic power and noble praise is Indra yea, the song worships him invoked of many. Vr̥itra he quelled, and gave men room and freedom: gakra, victorious, hath conquered armies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं हु॑वेम म॒घवा॑न॒मिन्द्र॑म॒स्मिन्भरे॒ नृत॑मं॒ वाज॑सातौ शृ॒ण्वन्त॑मु॒ग्रमू॒तये॑ स॒मत्सु॒ घ्नन्तं॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ सं॒जितं॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ huvema maghávānam índram  asmín bháre nŕ̥tamaṃ vā́jasātau  śr̥ṇvántam ugrám ūtáye samátsu  ghnántaṃ vr̥trā́ṇi saṃjítaṃ dhánānām

translation.text: Call we on Maghayan, auspicious Indra. best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, wins and gathers riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒दा व॑सो स्तो॒त्रं हर्य॑त॒ आव॑ श्म॒शा रु॑ध॒द्वाः दी॒र्घं सु॒तं वा॒ताप्या॑य
verses.transliteration: kadā́ vaso stotráṃ háryata ā́-  -áva śmaśā́ru dhad vā́ḥ  dīrgháṃ sutáṃ vātā́pyāya

translation.text: WHEN, Vasu, wilt thou love the laud? Now let the channel bring the stream. The juice is ready to ferment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हरी॒ यस्य॑ सु॒युजा॒ विव्र॑ता॒ वेरर्व॒न्तानु॒ शेपा॑ उ॒भा र॒जी न के॒शिना॒ पति॒र्दन्
verses.transliteration: hárī yásya suyújā vívratā vér  árvantā́nu śépā  ubhā́ rajī́ ná keśínā pátir dán

translation.text: He whose two Bay Steeds harnessed well, swerving, pursue the Bird's tail-plumes, With Rowing manes, like heaven and earth, he is the Lord with power to give.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॒ योरिन्द्रः॒ पाप॑ज॒ आ मर्तो॒ न श॑श्रमा॒णो बि॑भी॒वान् शु॒भे यद्यु॑यु॒जे तवि॑षीवान्
verses.transliteration: ápa yór índraḥ pā́paja ā́ márto ná  śaśramāṇó bibhīvā́n  śubhé yád yuyujé táviṣīvān

translation.text: Bereft of skill is Indra, if, like some outwearied man he fears The sinner, when the Mighty hath prepared himself for victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सचा॒योरिन्द्र॒श्चर्कृ॑ष॒ आँ उ॑पान॒सः स॑प॒र्यन् न॒दयो॒र्विव्र॑तयोः॒ शूर॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: sácāyór índraś cárkr̥ṣa ā́m̐  upānasáḥ saparyán  nadáyor vívratayoḥ śū́ra índraḥ

translation.text: Indra with these drives round, until he meets with one to worship him: Indra is Master of the pair who snort and swerve upon their way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॒ यस्त॒स्थौ केश॑वन्ता॒ व्यच॑स्वन्ता॒ न पु॒ष्ट्यै व॒नोति॒ शिप्रा॑भ्यां शि॒प्रिणी॑वान्
verses.transliteration: ádhi yás tasthaú kéśavantā  vyácasvantā ná puṣṭyaí  vanóti śíprābhyāṃ śipríṇīvān

translation.text: Borne onward by the long-maned Steeds who stretch themselves as 'twere for food, The God who wears the helm defends them with his jaws.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रास्तौ॑दृ॒ष्वौजा॑ ऋ॒ष्वेभि॑स्त॒तक्ष॒ शूरः॒ शव॑सा ऋ॒भुर्न क्रतु॑भिर्मात॒रिश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: prā́staud r̥ṣvaújā r̥ṣvébhis  tatákṣa śū́raḥ śávasā  r̥bhúr ná krátubhir mātaríśvā

translation.text: The Mighty sang with Lofty Ones: the Hero fashioned with his strength, Like skilful Mâtariṣvan with his power and might,

verses.sanskrit_deva: वज्रं॒ यश्च॒क्रे सु॒हना॑य॒ दस्य॑वे हिरीम॒शो हिरी॑मान् अरु॑तहनु॒रद्भु॑तं॒ न रजः॑
verses.transliteration: vájraṃ yáś cakré suhánāya dásyave  hirīmaśó hírīmān  árutahanur ádbhutaṃ ná rájaḥ

translation.text: The bolt, which pierced at once the vitals of the Dasyu easy to be slain, With jaw uninjured like the wondrous firmament.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ नो वृजि॒ना शि॑शीह्यृ॒चा व॑नेमा॒नृचः॑ नाब्र॑ह्मा य॒ज्ञ ऋध॒ग्जोष॑ति॒ त्वे
verses.transliteration: áva no vr̥jinā́ śiśīhi-  r̥cā́ vanemānŕ̥caḥ  nā́brahmā yajñá ŕ̥dhag jóṣati tvé

translation.text: Grind off our sins: with song will we conquer the men who sing no hymns: Not easily art thou pleased with prayerless sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वा यत्ते॑ त्रे॒तिनी॒ भूद्य॒ज्ञस्य॑ धू॒र्षु सद्म॑न् स॒जूर्नावं॒ स्वय॑शसं॒ सचा॒योः
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvā́ yát te tretínī bhū́d  yajñásya dhūrṣú sádman  sajū́r nā́vaṃ sváyaśasaṃ sácāyóḥ

translation.text: When threefold flame burns high for thee, to rest on poles of sacrifice, Thou with the living joyest in the self-bright Ship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रि॒ये ते॒ पृश्नि॑रुप॒सेच॑नी भूच्छ्रि॒ये दर्वि॑ररे॒पाः यया॒ स्वे पात्रे॑ सि॒ञ्चस॒ उत्
verses.transliteration: śriyé te pŕ̥śnir upasécanī bhūc  -śriyé dárvir arepā́ḥ  yáyā své pā́tre siñcása út

translation.text: Thy glory was the speckled cup, thy glory was the flawless scoop. Wherewith thou pourest into thy receptacle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं वा॒ यद॑सुर्य॒ प्रति॑ त्वा सुमि॒त्र इ॒त्थास्तौ॑द्दुर्मि॒त्र इ॒त्थास्तौ॑त् आवो॒ यद्द॑स्यु॒हत्ये॑ कुत्सपु॒त्रं प्रावो॒ यद्द॑स्यु॒हत्ये॑ कुत्सव॒त्सम्
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ vā yád asurya práti tvā  sumitrá itthā́staud  durmitrá itthā́staut  ā́vo yád dasyuhátye kutsaputrám  prā́vo yád dasyuhátye kutsavatsám

translation.text: As hundreds, O Immortal God, have sung to thee, so hath Sumitra, yea, Durmitra praised thee here, What time thou holpest Kutsa's son, when Dasyus fell, yea, holpest Kutsa's darling when the Dasyus died.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भा उ॑ नू॒नं तदिद॑र्थयेथे॒ वि त॑न्वाथे॒ धियो॒ वस्त्रा॒पसे॑व स॒ध्री॒ची॒ना यात॑वे॒ प्रेम॑जीगः सु॒दिने॑व॒ पृक्ष॒ आ तं॑सयेथे
verses.transliteration: ubhā́ u nūnáṃ tád íd arthayethe  ví tanvāthe dhíyo vástrāpáseva  sadhrīcīnā́ yā́tave prém ajīgaḥ  sudíneva pŕ̥kṣa ā́ taṃsayethe

translation.text: THIS very thing ye Twain hold as your object: ye weave your songs as skilful men weave garments. That ye may come united have I waked you: ye spread out food like days of lovely weather.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ष्टारे॑व॒ फर्व॑रेषु श्रयेथे प्रायो॒गेव॒ श्वात्र्या॒ शासु॒रेथः॑ दू॒तेव॒ हि ष्ठो य॒शसा॒ जने॑षु॒ माप॑ स्थातं महि॒षेवा॑व॒पाना॑त्
verses.transliteration: uṣṭā́reva phárvareṣu śrayethe  prāyogéva śvā́tryā śā́sur éthaḥ  dūtéva hí ṣṭhó yaśásā jáneṣu  mā́pa sthātam mahiṣévāvapā́nāt

translation.text: Like two plough-bulls ye move along in traces, and seek like eager guests your bidder's banquet. Ye are like glorious envoys mid the people: like bulls, approach the place where ye are watered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒कं॒युजा॑ शकु॒नस्ये॑व प॒क्षा प॒श्वेव॑ चि॒त्रा यजु॒रा ग॑मिष्टम् अ॒ग्निरि॑व देव॒योर्दी॑दि॒वांसा॒ परि॑ज्मानेव यजथः पुरु॒त्रा
verses.transliteration: sākaṃyújā śakunásyeva pakṣā́  paśvéva citrā́ yájur ā́ gamiṣṭam  agnír iva devayór dīdivā́ṃsā  párijmāneva yajathaḥ purutrā́

translation.text: Like the two pinions of a bird, connected, like two choice animals, ye have sought our worship. Bright as the fire the votary hath kindled, ye sacrifice in many a spot as roamers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒पी वो॑ अ॒स्मे पि॒तरे॑व पु॒त्रोग्रेव॑ रु॒चा नृ॒पती॑व तु॒र्यै इर्ये॑व पु॒ष्ट्यै कि॒रणे॑व भु॒ज्यै श्रु॑ष्टी॒वाने॑व॒ हव॒मा ग॑मिष्टम्
verses.transliteration: āpī́ vo asmé pitáreva putrā́-  -ugréva rucā́ nr̥pátīva turyaí  íryeva puṣṭyaí kiráṇeva bhujyaí  śruṣṭīvā́neva hávam ā́ gamiṣṭam

translation.text: Ye are our kinsmen, like two sons, two fathers, strong in your splendour and like kings for conquest; Like rays for our enjoyment, Lords to feed us, ye, like quick bearers, have obeyed our calling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वंस॑गेव पूष॒र्या॑ शि॒म्बाता॑ मि॒त्रेव॑ ऋ॒ता श॒तरा॒ शात॑पन्ता वाजे॑वो॒च्चा वय॑सा घर्म्ये॒ष्ठा मेषे॑वे॒षा स॑प॒र्या॒३॒॑ पुरी॑षा
verses.transliteration: váṃsageva pūṣaryā̀ śimbā́tā  mitréva r̥tā́ śatárā śā́tapantā  vā́jevoccā́ váyasā gharmyeṣṭhā́  méṣeveṣā́ saparyā̀ púrīṣā

translation.text: You are like two pleasantly moving well-fed (hills) like Mitra and Varuṇa, the two bestowers of felicity, veracious, possessors of infinite wealth, happy, like two horses plump with fodder, abiding in the firmament, like two rams (are you) to be nourished with sacrificial food, to be cherished (with oblations).

verses.sanskrit_deva: सृ॒ण्ये॑व ज॒र्भरी॑ तु॒र्फरी॑तू नैतो॒शेव॑ तु॒र्फरी॑ पर्फ॒रीका॑ उ॒द॒न्य॒जेव॒ जेम॑ना मदे॒रू ता मे॑ ज॒राय्व॒जरं॑ म॒रायु॑
verses.transliteration: sr̥ṇyèva jarbhárī turphárītū  naitośéva turphárī parpharī́kā  udanyajéva jémanā maderū́  tā́ me jarā́yv ajáram marā́yu

translation.text: You are like two mad elephants bending their forequarters and smiting the foe, like the two sons of Nitosa destroying (foes), and cherishing (friends); you are bright as two water-born (jewels), do you, who are victorious, (render) my decaying mortal body free from decay.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒ज्रेव॒ चर्च॑रं॒ जारं॑ म॒रायु॒ क्षद्मे॒वार्थे॑षु तर्तरीथ उग्रा ऋ॒भू नाप॑त्खरम॒ज्रा ख॒रज्रु॑र्वा॒युर्न प॑र्फरत्क्षयद्रयी॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: pajréva cárcaraṃ jā́ram marā́yu  kṣádmevā́rtheṣu tartarītha ugrā  r̥bhū́ nā́pat kharamajrā́ kharájrur  vāyúr ná parpharat kṣayad rayīṇā́m

translation.text: Fierce (Aṣvins), like two powerful (heroes), you enable this moving, perishable mortal (frame) to cross over to the objects (of its destination) as over water; extremely strong, like the R̥ibhus, your chariot, attained its destination swift as the wind, it pervaded (everywhere), it dispensed riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घ॒र्मेव॒ मधु॑ ज॒ठरे॑ स॒नेरू॒ भगे॑विता तु॒र्फरी॒ फारि॒वार॑म् प॒त॒रेव॑ चच॒रा च॒न्द्रनि॑र्णि॒ङ्मन॑ऋङ्गा मन॒न्या॒३॒॑ न जग्मी॑
verses.transliteration: gharméva mádhu jaṭháre sanérū  bhágevitā turphárī phā́rivā́ram  pataréva cacarā́ candránirṇik-  mánar̥ṅgā mananyā̀ ná jágmī

translation.text: With your bellies full of the Soma, like two saucepans, preservers of wealth, destroyers of enemies. (you are) armed with hatchets, moving like two flying (birds) with forms like the moon, attaining success through the mind, like two laudable beings, (you are) approaching (the sacrifice).

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हन्ते॑व ग॒म्भरे॑षु प्रति॒ष्ठां पादे॑व गा॒धं तर॑ते विदाथः कर्णे॑व॒ शासु॒रनु॒ हि स्मरा॒थोंऽशे॑व नो भजतं चि॒त्रमप्नः॑
verses.transliteration: br̥hánteva gambháreṣu pratiṣṭhā́m  pā́deva gādháṃ tárate vidāthaḥ  kárṇeva śā́sur ánu hí smárāthaḥ-  -áṃśeva no bhajataṃ citrám ápnaḥ

translation.text: Like giants, ye will find firm ground to stand on in depths, like feet for one who fords a shallow. Like ears ye will attend to him who orders: ye Two enjoy our wondrous work as sharers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒र॒ङ्ग॒रेव॒ मध्वेर॑येथे सार॒घेव॒ गवि॑ नी॒चीन॑बारे की॒नारे॑व॒ स्वेद॑मासिष्विदा॒ना क्षामे॑वो॒र्जा सू॑यव॒सात्स॑चेथे
verses.transliteration: āraṅgaréva mádhv érayethe  sāraghéva gávi nīcī́nabāre  kīnā́reva svédam āsiṣvidānā́  kṣā́mevorjā́ sūyavasā́t sacethe

translation.text: Like toiling bees ye bring to us your honey, as bees into the hide that opens downward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒ध्याम॒ स्तोमं॑ सनु॒याम॒ वाज॒मा नो॒ मन्त्रं॑ स॒रथे॒होप॑ यातम् यशो॒ न प॒क्वं मधु॒ गोष्व॒न्तरा भू॒तांशो॑ अ॒श्विनोः॒ काम॑मप्राः
verses.transliteration: r̥dhyā́ma stómaṃ sanuyā́ma vā́jam  ā́ no mántraṃ saráthehópa yātam  yáśo ná pakvám mádhu góṣv antár  ā́ bhūtā́ṃśo aśvínoḥ kā́mam aprāḥ

translation.text: May we increase the laud and gain us vigour: come to our song, ye whom one chariot carries. Filled be our kine with ripened meath like glory: Bhûtânṣa hath fulfilled the Aṣvins' longing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒विर॑भू॒न्महि॒ माघो॑नमेषां॒ विश्वं॑ जी॒वं तम॑सो॒ निर॑मोचि महि॒ ज्योतिः॑ पि॒तृभि॑र्द॒त्तमागा॑दु॒रुः पन्था॒ दक्षि॑णाया अदर्शि
verses.transliteration: āvír abhūn máhi mā́ghonam eṣāṃ  víśvaṃ jīváṃ támaso nír amoci  máhi jyótiḥ pitŕ̥bhir dattám ā́gād  urúḥ pánthā dákṣiṇāyā adarśi

translation.text: THESE men's great bounty hath been manifested, and the whole world of life set free from darkness. Great light hath come, vouchsafed us by the Fathers: apparent is the spacious path of Guerdon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒च्चा दि॒वि दक्षि॑णावन्तो अस्थु॒र्ये अ॑श्व॒दाः स॒ह ते सूर्ये॑ण हि॒र॒ण्य॒दा अ॑मृत॒त्वं भ॑जन्ते वासो॒दाः सो॑म॒ प्र ति॑रन्त॒ आयुः॑
verses.transliteration: uccā́ diví dákṣiṇāvanto asthur  yé aśvadā́ḥ sahá té sū́ryeṇa  hiraṇyadā́ amr̥tatvám bhajante  vāsodā́ḥ soma prá tiranta ā́yuḥ

translation.text: High up in heaven abide the Guerdon-givers: they who give steeds dwell with the Sun for ever. They who give gold are blest with life eternal. they who give robes prolong their lives, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दैवी॑ पू॒र्तिर्दक्षि॑णा देवय॒ज्या न क॑वा॒रिभ्यो॑ न॒हि ते पृ॒णन्ति॑ अथा॒ नरः॒ प्रय॑तदक्षिणासोऽवद्यभि॒या ब॒हवः॑ पृणन्ति
verses.transliteration: daívī pūrtír dákṣiṇā devayajyā́  ná kavāríbhyo nahí té pr̥ṇánti  áthā náraḥ práyatadakṣiṇāso  -avadyabhiyā́ bahávaḥ pr̥ṇanti

translation.text: Not from the niggards-for they give not fireely-comes Meed at sacrifice, Gods' satisfaction: Yea, many men with hands stretched out with Guerdon present their gifts because they dread dishonour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तधा॑रं वा॒युम॒र्कं स्व॒र्विदं॑ नृ॒चक्ष॑स॒स्ते अ॒भि च॑क्षते ह॒विः ये पृ॒णन्ति॒ प्र च॒ यच्छ॑न्ति संग॒मे ते दक्षि॑णां दुहते स॒प्तमा॑तरम्
verses.transliteration: śatádhāraṃ vāyúm arkáṃ svarvídaṃ  nr̥cákṣasas té abhí cakṣate havíḥ  yé pr̥ṇánti prá ca yáchanti saṃgamé  té dákṣiṇāṃ duhate saptámātaram

translation.text: These who observe mankind regard oblation as streamy Vâyu and light-finding Arka. They satisfy and give their gifts in synod, and pour in streams the seven-mothered Guerdon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दक्षि॑णावान्प्रथ॒मो हू॒त ए॑ति॒ दक्षि॑णावान्ग्राम॒णीरग्र॑मेति तमे॒व म॑न्ये नृ॒पतिं॒ जना॑नां॒ यः प्र॑थ॒मो दक्षि॑णामावि॒वाय॑
verses.transliteration: dákṣiṇāvān prathamó hūtá eti  dákṣiṇāvān grāmaṇī́r ágram eti  tám evá manye nr̥pátiṃ jánānāṃ  yáḥ prathamó dákṣiṇām āvivā́ya

translation.text: He who brings Guerdon comes as first invited: chief of the hamlet comes the Guerdon-bearer. Him I account the ruler of the people who was the first to introduce the Guerdon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमे॒व ऋषिं॒ तमु॑ ब्र॒ह्माण॑माहुर्यज्ञ॒न्यं॑ साम॒गामु॑क्थ॒शास॑म् स शु॒क्रस्य॑ त॒न्वो॑ वेद ति॒स्रो यः प्र॑थ॒मो दक्षि॑णया र॒राध॑
verses.transliteration: tám evá ŕ̥ṣiṃ tám u brahmā́ṇam āhur  yajñanyàṃ sāmagā́m ukthaśā́sam  sá śukrásya tanvò veda tisró  yáḥ prathamó dákṣiṇayā rarā́dha

translation.text: They call him R̥ishi, Brahman, Sâma-chanter, reciter of the laud, leader of worship. The brightly-shining God's three forms he knoweth who first bestowed the sacrificial Guerdon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दक्षि॒णाश्वं॒ दक्षि॑णा॒ गां द॑दाति॒ दक्षि॑णा च॒न्द्रमु॒त यद्धिर॑ण्यम् दक्षि॒णान्नं॑ वनुते॒ यो न॑ आ॒त्मा दक्षि॑णां॒ वर्म॑ कृणुते विजा॒नन्
verses.transliteration: dákṣiṇā́śvaṃ dákṣiṇā gā́ṃ dadāti  dákṣiṇā candrám utá yád dhíraṇyam  dákṣiṇā́nnaṃ vanute yó na ātmā́  dákṣiṇāṃ várma kr̥ṇute vijānán

translation.text: Guerdon bestows the horse, bestows the bullock, Guerdon bestows, moreover, gold that R̥ishisters. Guerdon gives food which is our life and spirit. He who is wise takes Guerdon for his armour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न भो॒जा म॑म्रु॒र्न न्य॒र्थमी॑यु॒र्न रि॑ष्यन्ति॒ न व्य॑थन्ते ह भो॒जाः इ॒दं यद्विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं॒ स्व॑श्चै॒तत्सर्वं॒ दक्षि॑णैभ्यो ददाति
verses.transliteration: ná bhojā́ mamrur ná nyarthám īyur  ná riṣyanti ná vyathante ha bhojā́ḥ  idáṃ yád víśvam bhúvanaṃ svàś ca-  -etát sárvaṃ dákṣiṇaibhyo dadāti

translation.text: The liberal die not, never are they ruined: the liberal suffer neither harm nor trouble. The light of heaven, the universe about us,– all this doth sacrificial Guerdon give them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भो॒जा जि॑ग्युः सुर॒भिं योनि॒मग्रे॑ भो॒जा जि॑ग्युर्व॒ध्वं१॒॑ या सु॒वासाः॑ भो॒जा जि॑ग्युरन्तः॒पेयं॒ सुरा॑या भो॒जा जि॑ग्यु॒र्ये अहू॑ताः प्र॒यन्ति॑
verses.transliteration: bhojā́ jigyuḥ surabhíṃ yónim ágre  bhojā́ jigyur vadhvàṃ yā́ suvā́sāḥ  bhojā́ jigyur antaḥpéyaṃ súrāyāḥ-  bhojā́ jigyur yé áhūtāḥ prayánti

translation.text: First have the liberal gained a fragrant dwelling, and got themselves a bride in fair apparel. The liberal have obtained their draught of liquor, and conquered those who, unprovoked, assailed them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भो॒जायाश्वं॒ सं मृ॑जन्त्या॒शुं भो॒जाया॑स्ते क॒न्या॒३॒॑ शुम्भ॑माना भो॒जस्ये॒दं पु॑ष्क॒रिणी॑व॒ वेश्म॒ परि॑ष्कृतं देवमा॒नेव॑ चि॒त्रम्
verses.transliteration: bhojā́yā́śvaṃ sám mr̥janty āśúm  bhojā́yāste kanyā̀ śúmbhamānā  bhojásyedám puṣkaríṇīva véśma  páriṣkr̥taṃ devamānéva citrám

translation.text: They deck the fleet steed for the bounteous giver: the maid adorns herself and waits to meet him. His home is like a lake with lotus blossoms, like the Gods' palaces adorned and splendid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भो॒जमश्वाः॑ सुष्ठु॒वाहो॑ वहन्ति सु॒वृद्रथो॑ वर्तते॒ दक्षि॑णायाः भो॒जं दे॑वासोऽवता॒ भरे॑षु भो॒जः शत्रू॑न्त्समनी॒केषु॒ जेता॑
verses.transliteration: bhojám áśvāḥ suṣṭhuvā́ho vahanti  suvŕ̥d rátho vartate dákṣiṇāyāḥ  bhojáṃ devāso 'vatā bháreṣu  bhojáḥ śátrūn samanīkéṣu jétā

translation.text: Steeds good at draught convey the liberal giver, and lightly rolling moves the car of Guerdon. Assist, ye Gods, the liberal man in battles: the liberal giver conquers foes in combat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किमि॒च्छन्ती॑ स॒रमा॒ प्रेदमा॑नड्दू॒रे ह्यध्वा॒ जगु॑रिः परा॒चैः कास्मेहि॑तिः॒ का परि॑तक्म्यासीत्क॒थं र॒साया॑ अतरः॒ पयां॑सि
verses.transliteration: kím ichántī sarámā prédám ānaḍ  dūré hy ádhvā jáguriḥ parācaíḥ  kā́sméhitiḥ kā́ páritakmyāsīt  katháṃ rasā́yā ataraḥ páyāṃsi

translation.text: WHAT wish of Saramâ hath brought her hither? The path leads far away to distant places. What charge hast thou for us? Where turns thy journey? How hast thou made thy way o'er Rasâ's waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्य दू॒तीरि॑षि॒ता च॑रामि म॒ह इ॒च्छन्ती॑ पणयो नि॒धीन्वः॑ अ॒ति॒ष्कदो॑ भि॒यसा॒ तन्न॑ आव॒त्तथा॑ र॒साया॑ अतरं॒ पयां॑सि
verses.transliteration: índrasya dūtī́r iṣitā́ carāmi  mahá ichántī paṇayo nidhī́n vaḥ  atiṣkádo bhiyásā tán na āvat  táthā rasā́yā ataram páyāṃsi

translation.text: I come appointed messenger of Indra, seeking your ample stores of wealth, O Paṇis. This hath preserved me from the fear of crossing: thus have I made my way o'er Rasâ's waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: की॒दृङ्ङिन्द्रः॑ सरमे॒ का दृ॑शी॒का यस्ये॒दं दू॒तीरस॑रः परा॒कात् आ च॒ गच्छा॑न्मि॒त्रमे॑ना दधा॒माथा॒ गवां॒ गोप॑तिर्नो भवाति
verses.transliteration: kīdŕ̥ṅṅ índraḥ sarame kā́ dr̥śīkā́  yásyedáṃ dūtī́r ásaraḥ parākā́t  ā́ ca gáchān mitrám enā dadhāma-  -áthā gávāṃ gópatir no bhavāti

translation.text: What is that Indra like, what is his aspect whose envoy, Saramâ, from afar thou comest? Let him approach, and we will show him friendship: he shall be made the herdsman of our cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाहं तं वे॑द॒ दभ्यं॒ दभ॒त्स यस्ये॒दं दू॒तीरस॑रं परा॒कात् न तं गू॑हन्ति स्र॒वतो॑ गभी॒रा ह॒ता इन्द्रे॑ण पणयः शयध्वे
verses.transliteration: nā́háṃ táṃ veda dábhyaṃ dábhat sá  yásyedáṃ dūtī́r ásaram parākā́t  ná táṃ gūhanti sraváto gabhīrā́ḥ-  hatā́ índreṇa paṇayaḥ śayadhve

translation.text: I know him safe from harm: but he can punish who sent me hither from afar as envoy. Him rivers flowing with deep waters bide not. Low will ye be, O Paṇis, slain by Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा गावः॑ सरमे॒ या ऐच्छः॒ परि॑ दि॒वो अन्ता॑न्त्सुभगे॒ पत॑न्ती कस्त॑ एना॒ अव॑ सृजा॒दयु॑ध्व्यु॒तास्माक॒मायु॑धा सन्ति ति॒ग्मा
verses.transliteration: imā́ gā́vaḥ sarame yā́ aíchaḥ  pári divó ántān subhage pátantī  kás ta enā áva sr̥jād áyudhvī-  utā́smā́kam ā́yudhā santi tigmā́

translation.text: These are the kine which, Saramâ, thou seekest, flying, O Blest One, to the ends of heaven. Who will loose these for thee without a battle? Yea, and sharp-pointed are our warlike weapons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒से॒न्या वः॑ पणयो॒ वचां॑स्यनिष॒व्यास्त॒न्वः॑ सन्तु पा॒पीः अधृ॑ष्टो व॒ एत॒वा अ॑स्तु॒ पन्था॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्व उभ॒या न मृ॑ळात्
verses.transliteration: asenyā́ vaḥ paṇayo vácāṃsi-  aniṣavyā́s tanvàḥ santu pāpī́ḥ  ádhr̥ṣṭo va étavā́ astu pánthāḥ-  bŕ̥haspátir va ubhayā́ ná mr̥ḷāt

translation.text: Even if your wicked bodies, O ye Paṇis, were arrow-proof, your words are weak for wounding; And were the path to you as yet unmastered, Br̥ihaspati in neither case will spare you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं नि॒धिः स॑रमे॒ अद्रि॑बुध्नो॒ गोभि॒रश्वे॑भि॒र्वसु॑भि॒र्न्यृ॑ष्टः रक्ष॑न्ति॒ तं प॒णयो॒ ये सु॑गो॒पा रेकु॑ प॒दमल॑क॒मा ज॑गन्थ
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ nidhíḥ sarame ádribudhno  góbhir áśvebhir vásubhir nyr̥̀ṣṭaḥ  rákṣanti tám paṇáyo yé sugopā́ḥ-  réku padám álakam ā́ jagantha

translation.text: Paved with the rock is this our treasure-chamber; filled full of precious things, of kine, and horses. These Paṇis who are watchful keepers guard it. In vain hast thou approached this lonely station.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एह ग॑म॒न्नृष॑यः॒ सोम॑शिता अ॒यास्यो॒ अङ्गि॑रसो॒ नव॑ग्वाः त ए॒तमू॒र्वं वि भ॑जन्त॒ गोना॒मथै॒तद्वचः॑ प॒णयो॒ वम॒न्नित्
verses.transliteration: éhá gamann ŕ̥ṣayaḥ sómaśitāḥ-  ayā́syo áṅgiraso návagvāḥ  tá etám ūrváṃ ví bhajanta gónām  áthaitád vácaḥ paṇáyo vámann ít

translation.text: R̥ishis will come inspirited with Soma, Angirases unwearied, and Navagvas. This stall of cattle will they part among them: then will the Paṇis wish these words unspoken.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा च॒ त्वं स॑रम आज॒गन्थ॒ प्रबा॑धिता॒ सह॑सा॒ दैव्ये॑न स्वसा॑रं त्वा कृणवै॒ मा पुन॑र्गा॒ अप॑ ते॒ गवां॑ सुभगे भजाम
verses.transliteration: evā́ ca tváṃ sarama ājagántha  prábādhitā sáhasā daívyena  svásāraṃ tvā kr̥ṇavai mā́ púnar gāḥ-  ápa te gávāṃ subhage bhajāma

translation.text: Even thus, O Saramâ, hast thou come hither, forced by celestial might to make the journey. Turn thee not back, for thou shalt be our sister: O Blest One, we will give thee of the cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाहं वे॑द भ्रातृ॒त्वं नो स्व॑सृ॒त्वमिन्द्रो॑ विदु॒रङ्गि॑रसश्च घो॒राः गोका॑मा मे अच्छदय॒न्यदाय॒मपात॑ इत पणयो॒ वरी॑यः
verses.transliteration: nā́háṃ veda bhrātr̥tváṃ nó svasr̥tvám  índro vidur áṅgirasaś ca ghorā́ḥ  gókāmā me achadayan yád ā́yam  ápā́ta ita paṇayo várīyaḥ

translation.text: Brotherhood, sisterhood, I know not either: the dread Angirases and Indra know them. They seemed to long for kine when I departed. Hence, into distance, be ye gone, O Paṇis.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दू॒रमि॑त पणयो॒ वरी॑य॒ उद्गावो॑ यन्तु मिन॒तीर्ऋ॒तेन॑ बृह॒स्पति॒र्या अवि॑न्द॒न्निगू॑ळ्हाः॒ सोमो॒ ग्रावा॑ण॒ ऋष॑यश्च॒ विप्राः॑
verses.transliteration: dūrám ita paṇayo várīyaḥ-  úd gā́vo yantu minatī́r r̥téna  bŕ̥haspátir yā́ ávindan nígūḷhāḥ  sómo grā́vāṇa ŕ̥ṣayaś ca víprāḥ

translation.text: Hence, far away, ye Paṇis! Let the cattle lowing come forth as holy Law commandeth, Kine which Br̥ihaspati, and Soma, R̥ishis, sages, and pressing-stones have found when hidden.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते॑ऽवदन्प्रथ॒मा ब्र॑ह्मकिल्बि॒षेऽकू॑पारः सलि॒लो मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑ वी॒ळुह॑रा॒स्तप॑ उ॒ग्रो म॑यो॒भूरापो॑ दे॒वीः प्र॑थम॒जा ऋ॒तेन॑
verses.transliteration: tè 'vadan prathamā́ brahmakilbiṣé  -ákūpāraḥ saliló mātaríśvā  vīḷúharās tápa ugró mayobhū́r  ā́po devī́ḥ prathamajā́ r̥téna

translation.text: THESE first, the boundless Sea, and Mâtariṣvan, fierce-glowing Fire, the Strong, the Blissbestower. And heavenly Floods, first-born by holy Order, exclaimed against the outrage on a Brahman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमो॒ राजा॑ प्रथ॒मो ब्र॑ह्मजा॒यां पुनः॒ प्राय॑च्छ॒दहृ॑णीयमानः अ॒न्व॒र्ति॒ता वरु॑णो मि॒त्र आ॑सीद॒ग्निर्होता॑ हस्त॒गृह्या नि॑नाय
verses.transliteration: sómo rā́jā prathamó brahmajāyā́m  púnaḥ prā́yachad áhr̥ṇīyamānaḥ  anvartitā́ váruṇo mitrá āsīd  agnír hótā hastagŕ̥hyā́ nināya

translation.text: King Soma first of all, without reluctance, made restitution of the Brahman's consort. Mitra and Varuṇa were the inviters: Agni as Hota; took her hand and led her.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हस्ते॑नै॒व ग्रा॒ह्य॑ आ॒धिर॑स्या ब्रह्मजा॒येयमिति॒ चेदवो॑चन् न दू॒ताय॑ प्र॒ह्ये॑ तस्थ ए॒षा तथा॑ रा॒ष्ट्रं गु॑पि॒तं क्ष॒त्रिय॑स्य
verses.transliteration: hástenaivá grāhyà ādhír asyāḥ-  brahmajāyéyám íti céd ávocan  ná dūtā́ya prahyè tastha eṣā́  táthā rāṣṭráṃ gupitáṃ kṣatríyasya

translation.text: The man, her pledge, must by her hand be taken when they have cried, She is a Brahman's consort. She stayed not for a herald to conduct her: thus is the kingdom of a ruler guarded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वा ए॒तस्या॑मवदन्त॒ पूर्वे॑ सप्तऋ॒षय॒स्तप॑से॒ ये नि॑षे॒दुः भी॒मा जा॒या ब्रा॑ह्म॒णस्योप॑नीता दु॒र्धां द॑धाति पर॒मे व्यो॑मन्
verses.transliteration: devā́ etásyām avadanta pū́rve  saptar̥ṣáyas tápase yé niṣedúḥ  bhīmā́ jāyā́ brāhmaṇásyópanītā  durdhā́ṃ dadhāti paramé vyòman

translation.text: Thus spake of her those Gods of old, Seven R̥ishis who sate them down to their austere devotion: Dire is a Brahman's wife led home by others: in the supremest heaven she plants confusion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्र॒ह्म॒चा॒री च॑रति॒ वेवि॑ष॒द्विषः॒ स दे॒वानां॑ भव॒त्येक॒मङ्ग॑म् तेन॑ जा॒यामन्व॑विन्द॒द्बृह॒स्पतिः॒ सोमे॑न नी॒तां जु॒ह्वं१॒॑ न दे॑वाः
verses.transliteration: brahmacārī́ carati véviṣad víṣaḥ  sá devā́nām bhavaty ékam áṅgam  téna jāyā́m ánv avindad bŕ̥haspátiḥ  sómena nītā́ṃ juhvàṃ ná devāḥ

translation.text: The Brahmachâri goes engaged in duty: he is a member of the Gods' own body. Through him Br̥ihaspati obtained his consort, as the Gods gained the ladle brought by Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुन॒र्वै दे॒वा अ॑ददुः॒ पुन॑र्मनु॒ष्या॑ उ॒त राजा॑नः स॒त्यं कृ॑ण्वा॒ना ब्र॑ह्मजा॒यां पुन॑र्ददुः
verses.transliteration: púnar vaí devā́ adaduḥ  púnar manuṣyā̀ utá  rā́jānaḥ satyáṃ kr̥ṇvānā́ḥ-  brahmajāyā́m púnar daduḥ

translation.text: So then the Gods restored her, so men gave the woman back again. The Kings who kept their promises restored the Brahman's wedded wife,

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒न॒र्दाय॑ ब्रह्मजा॒यां कृ॒त्वी दे॒वैर्नि॑किल्बि॒षम् ऊर्जं॑ पृथि॒व्या भ॒क्त्वायो॑रुगा॒यमुपा॑सते
verses.transliteration: punardā́ya brahmajāyā́ṃ  kr̥tvī́ devaír nikilbiṣám  ū́rjam pr̥thivyā́ bhaktvā́ya-  -urugāyám úpāsate

translation.text: Having restored the Brahman's wife, and freed them, with Gods' aid, from sin, They shared the fulness of the earth, and won themselves extended sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑द्धो अ॒द्य मनु॑षो दुरो॒णे दे॒वो दे॒वान्य॑जसि जातवेदः आ च॒ वह॑ मित्रमहश्चिकि॒त्वान्त्वं दू॒तः क॒विर॑सि॒ प्रचे॑ताः
verses.transliteration: sámiddho adyá mánuṣo duroṇé  devó devā́n yajasi jātavedaḥ  ā́ ca váha mitramahaś cikitvā́n  tváṃ dūtáḥ kavír asi prácetāḥ

translation.text: THOU in the house of man this day enkindled worshippest Gods as God, O Jâtavedas. Observant, bright as Mitra, bring them hither: thou art a sapient and foreknowing envoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तनू॑नपात्प॒थ ऋ॒तस्य॒ याना॒न्मध्वा॑ सम॒ञ्जन्त्स्व॑दया सुजिह्व मन्मा॑नि धी॒भिरु॒त य॒ज्ञमृ॒न्धन्दे॑व॒त्रा च॑ कृणुह्यध्व॒रं नः॑
verses.transliteration: tánūnapāt pathá r̥tásya yā́nān  mádhvā samañján svadayā sujihva  mánmāni dhībhír utá yajñám r̥ndhán  devatrā́ ca kr̥ṇuhy adhvaráṃ naḥ

translation.text: Tanûnapât, fair-tongued, with sweet meath balming the paths and waysof Order, make them pleasant. Convey our sacrifice to heaven, exalting with holy thoughts ourhymns of praise and worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒जुह्वा॑न॒ ईड्यो॒ वन्द्य॒श्चा या॑ह्यग्ने॒ वसु॑भिः स॒जोषाः॑ त्वं दे॒वाना॑मसि यह्व॒ होता॒ स ए॑नान्यक्षीषि॒तो यजी॑यान्
verses.transliteration: ājúhvāna ī́ḍyo vándyaś ca-  -ā́ yāhy agne vásubhiḥ sajóṣāḥ  tváṃ devā́nām asi yahva hótā  sá enān yakṣīṣitó yájīyān

translation.text: Invoked, deserving prayer and adoration, O Agni, come accordant with the Vasus. Thou art, O Youthful Lord, the Gods' Invoker, so, best of Sacrificers, bring them quickly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒चीनं॑ ब॒र्हिः प्र॒दिशा॑ पृथि॒व्या वस्तो॑र॒स्या वृ॑ज्यते॒ अग्रे॒ अह्ना॑म् व्यु॑ प्रथते वित॒रं वरी॑यो दे॒वेभ्यो॒ अदि॑तये स्यो॒नम्
verses.transliteration: prācī́nam barhíḥ pradíśā pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  vástor asyā́ vr̥jyate ágre áhnām  vy ù prathate vitaráṃ várīyaḥ-  devébhyo áditaye syonám

translation.text: By rule the Sacred Grass is scattered eastward, a robe to clothe this earth when dawns are breaking. Widely it spreads around and far-extended, fair for the Gods and bringing peace and freedom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्यच॑स्वतीरुर्वि॒या वि श्र॑यन्तां॒ पति॑भ्यो॒ न जन॑यः॒ शुम्भ॑मानाः देवी॑र्द्वारो बृहतीर्विश्वमिन्वा दे॒वेभ्यो॑ भवत सुप्राय॒णाः
verses.transliteration: vyácasvatīr urviyā́ ví śrayantām  pátibhyo ná jánayaḥ śúmbhamānāḥ  dévīr dvāro br̥hatīr viśvaminvāḥ-  devébhyo bhavata suprāyaṇā́ḥ

translation.text: Let the expansive Doors be widely opened, like wives who deck their beauty for their husbands. Lofty, celestial, all-impelling Portals, admit the Gods and give them easy entrance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ सु॒ष्वय॑न्ती यज॒ते उपा॑के उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ सदतां॒ नि योनौ॑ दि॒व्ये योष॑णे बृह॒ती सु॑रु॒क्मे अधि॒ श्रियं॑ शुक्र॒पिशं॒ दधा॑ने
verses.transliteration: ā́ suṣváyantī yajaté úpāke  uṣā́sānáktā sadatāṃ ní yónau  divyé yóṣaṇe br̥hatī́ surukmé  ádhi śríyaṃ śukrapíśaṃ dádhāne

translation.text: Pouring sweet dews let holy Night and Morning, each close to each, he seated at their station, Lofty, celestial Dames with gold to deck them. assuming all their fair and radiant beauty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दैव्या॒ होता॑रा प्रथ॒मा सु॒वाचा॒ मिमा॑ना य॒ज्ञं मनु॑षो॒ यज॑ध्यै प्र॒चो॒दय॑न्ता वि॒दथे॑षु का॒रू प्रा॒चीनं॒ ज्योतिः॑ प्र॒दिशा॑ दि॒शन्ता॑
verses.transliteration: daívyā hótārā prathamā́ suvā́cā  mímānā yajñám mánuṣo yájadhyai  pracodáyantā vidátheṣu kārū́  prācī́naṃ jyótiḥ pradíśā diśántā

translation.text: Come the two first celestial sweet-voiced Hotars, arranging sacrifice for man to worship As singers who inspire us in assemblies, showing the eastward light with their direction.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ य॒ज्ञं भार॑ती॒ तूय॑मे॒त्विळा॑ मनु॒ष्वदि॒ह चे॒तय॑न्ती ति॒स्रो दे॒वीर्ब॒र्हिरेदं स्यो॒नं सर॑स्वती॒ स्वप॑सः सदन्तु
verses.transliteration: ā́ no yajñám bhā́ratī tū́yam etu-  íḷā manuṣvád ihá cetáyantī  tisró devī́r barhír édáṃ syonáṃ  sárasvatī svápasaḥ sadantu

translation.text: Let Bhâratî come quickly to our worship, and Iḷâ showing like a human being. So let Sarasvatî and both her fellows, deft Goddesses, on this fair grass be seated.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॒मे द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी जनि॑त्री रू॒पैरपिं॑श॒द्भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ तम॒द्य हो॑तरिषि॒तो यजी॑यान्दे॒वं त्वष्टा॑रमि॒ह य॑क्षि वि॒द्वान्
verses.transliteration: yá imé dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ jánitrī  rūpaír ápiṃśad bhúvanāni víśvā  tám adyá hotar iṣitó yájīyān  deváṃ tváṣṭāram ihá yakṣi vidvā́n

translation.text: Hotar more skilled in sacrifice, bring hither with speed to-day God Tvashṭar, thou who knowest. Even him who formed these two, the Earth and Heaven the Parents, with their forms, and every creature.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒पाव॑सृज॒ त्मन्या॑ सम॒ञ्जन्दे॒वानां॒ पाथ॑ ऋतु॒था ह॒वींषि॑ वन॒स्पतिः॑ शमि॒ता दे॒वो अ॒ग्निः स्वद॑न्तु ह॒व्यं मधु॑ना घृ॒तेन॑
verses.transliteration: upā́vasr̥ja tmányā samañján  devā́nām pā́tha r̥tuthā́ havī́ṃṣi  vánaspátiḥ śamitā́ devó agníḥ  svádantu havyám mádhunā ghr̥téna

translation.text: Send to our offerings which thyself thou balmest the Companies of Gods in ordered season. Agni, Vanaspati the Immolator sweeten our offered gift with meath and butter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒द्यो जा॒तो व्य॑मिमीत य॒ज्ञम॒ग्निर्दे॒वाना॑मभवत्पुरो॒गाः अ॒स्य होतुः॑ प्र॒दिश्यृ॒तस्य॑ वा॒चि स्वाहा॑कृतं ह॒विर॑दन्तु दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: sadyó jātó vy àmimīta yajñám  agnír devā́nām abhavat purogā́ḥ  asyá hótuḥ pradíśy r̥tásya vācí  svā́hākr̥taṃ havír adantu devā́ḥ

translation.text: Agni, as soon as he was born, made ready the sacrifice, and was the Gods' preceder. May the Gods cat our offering consecrated according to this true Priest's voice and guidance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मनी॑षिणः॒ प्र भ॑रध्वं मनी॒षां यथा॑यथा म॒तयः॒ सन्ति॑ नृ॒णाम् इन्द्रं॑ स॒त्यैरेर॑यामा कृ॒तेभिः॒ स हि वी॒रो गि॑र्वण॒स्युर्विदा॑नः
verses.transliteration: mánīṣiṇaḥ prá bharadhvam manīṣā́ṃ  yáthā-yathā matáyaḥ sánti nr̥ṇā́m  índraṃ satyaír érayāmā kr̥tébhiḥ  sá hí vīró girvaṇasyúr vídānaḥ

translation.text: BRING forth your sacred song ye prudent singers, even as are the thoughts of human beings. Let us draw Indra with true deeds anear us: he loves our songs, the Hero, and is potent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॒ हि सद॑सो धी॒तिरद्यौ॒त्सं गा॑र्ष्टे॒यो वृ॑ष॒भो गोभि॑रानट् उद॑तिष्ठत्तवि॒षेणा॒ रवे॑ण म॒हान्ति॑ चि॒त्सं वि॑व्याचा॒ रजां॑सि
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya hí sádaso dhītír ádyaut  sáṃ gārṣṭeyó vr̥ṣabhó góbhir ānaṭ  úd atiṣṭhat taviṣéṇā ráveṇa  mahā́nti cit sáṃ vivyācā rájāṃsi

translation.text: The hymn shone brightly from the seat of worship: to the kine came the Bull, the Heifer's Offipring With mighty bellowing hath he arisen, and hath pervaded even the spacious regions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॒ किल॒ श्रुत्या॑ अ॒स्य वे॑द॒ स हि जि॒ष्णुः प॑थि॒कृत्सूर्या॑य आन्मेनां॑ कृ॒ण्वन्नच्यु॑तो॒ भुव॒द्गोः पति॑र्दि॒वः स॑न॒जा अप्र॑तीतः
verses.transliteration: índraḥ kíla śrútyā asyá veda  sá hí jiṣṇúḥ pathikŕ̥t sū́ryāya  ā́n ménāṃ kr̥ṇvánn ácyuto bhúvad góḥ  pátir diváḥ sanajā́ ápratītaḥ

translation.text: Indra knows, verily, how to hear our singing, for he, victorious, made a path for Sûrya. He made the Cow, and be became the Sovran of Heaven, primeval, matchless, and unshaken.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ म॒ह्ना म॑ह॒तो अ॑र्ण॒वस्य॑ व्र॒तामि॑ना॒दङ्गि॑रोभिर्गृणा॒नः पु॒रूणि॑ चि॒न्नि त॑ताना॒ रजां॑सि दा॒धार॒ यो ध॒रुणं॑ स॒त्यता॑ता
verses.transliteration: índro mahnā́ maható arṇavásya  vratā́minād áṅgirobhir gr̥ṇānáḥ  purū́ṇi cin ní tatānā rájāṃsi  dādhā́ra yó dharúṇaṃ satyátātā

translation.text: Praised by Angirases, Indra demolished with might the works of the great watery monster Full many regions, too, hath he pervaded, and by his truth supported earth's foundation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ दि॒वः प्र॑ति॒मानं॑ पृथि॒व्या विश्वा॑ वेद॒ सव॑ना॒ हन्ति॒ शुष्ण॑म् म॒हीं चि॒द्द्यामात॑नो॒त्सूर्ये॑ण चा॒स्कम्भ॑ चि॒त्कम्भ॑नेन॒ स्कभी॑यान्
verses.transliteration: índro diváḥ pratimā́nam pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  víśvā veda sávanā hánti śúṣṇam  mahī́ṃ cid dyā́m ā́tanot sū́ryeṇa  cāskámbha cit kámbhanena skábhīyān

translation.text: The counterpart of heaven and earth is Indra: he knoweth all libations, slayeth Ṣushṇa. The vast sky with the Sun hath he extended, and, best otpillars, stayed it with a pillar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वज्रे॑ण॒ हि वृ॑त्र॒हा वृ॒त्रमस्त॒रदे॑वस्य॒ शूशु॑वानस्य मा॒याः वि धृ॑ष्णो॒ अत्र॑ धृष॒ता ज॑घ॒न्थाथा॑भवो मघवन्बा॒ह्वो॑जाः
verses.transliteration: vájreṇa hí vr̥trahā́ vr̥trám ástar  ádevasya śū́śuvānasya māyā́ḥ  ví dhr̥ṣṇo átra dhr̥ṣatā́ jaghantha-  -áthābhavo maghavan bāhvòjāḥ

translation.text: The Vr̥itra-slaver with his bolt felled Vr̥itra: the magic of the godless, waxen mighty, Here hast thou, Bold Assailant, boldly conquered. Yea, then thine arms, O Maghavan, were potent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सच॑न्त॒ यदु॒षसः॒ सूर्ये॑ण चि॒त्राम॑स्य के॒तवो॒ राम॑विन्दन् आ यन्नक्ष॑त्रं॒ ददृ॑शे दि॒वो न पुन॑र्य॒तो नकि॑र॒द्धा नु वे॑द
verses.transliteration: sácanta yád uṣásaḥ sū́ryeṇa  citrā́m asya ketávo rā́m avindan  ā́ yán nákṣatraṃ dádr̥śe divó ná  púnar yató nákir addhā́ nú veda

translation.text: When the Dawns come attendant upon Sûrya their rays discover wealth of divers colours. The Star of heaven is seen as 'twere approaching: none knoweth aught of it as it departeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दू॒रं किल॑ प्रथ॒मा ज॑ग्मुरासा॒मिन्द्र॑स्य॒ याः प्र॑स॒वे स॒स्रुरापः॑ क्व॑ स्वि॒दग्रं॒ क्व॑ बु॒ध्न आ॑सा॒मापो॒ मध्यं॒ क्व॑ वो नू॒नमन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: dūráṃ kíla prathamā́ jagmur āsām  índrasya yā́ḥ prasavé sasrúr ā́paḥ  kvà svid ágraṃ kvà budhná āsām  ā́po mádhyaṃ kvà vo nūnám ántaḥ

translation.text: Far have they gone, the first of all these waters, the waters that flowed forth when Indra sent them. Where is their spring, and where is their foundation? Where now, ye Waters, is your inmost centre?

verses.sanskrit_deva: सृ॒जः सिन्धूँ॒रहि॑ना जग्रसा॒नाँ आदिदे॒ताः प्र वि॑विज्रे ज॒वेन॑ मुमु॑क्षमाणा उ॒त या मु॑मु॒च्रेऽधेदे॒ता न र॑मन्ते॒ निति॑क्ताः
verses.transliteration: sr̥jáḥ síndhūm̐r áhinā jagrasānā́n  ā́d íd etā́ḥ prá vivijre javéna  múmukṣamāṇā utá yā́ mumucre-  -ádhéd etā́ ná ramante nítiktāḥ

translation.text: Thou didst free rivers swallowed by the Dragon; and rapidly they set themselves in motion, Those that were loosed and those that longed for freedom. Excited now to speed they run unresting.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒ध्रीचीः॒ सिन्धु॑मुश॒तीरि॑वायन्त्स॒नाज्जा॒र आ॑रि॒तः पू॒र्भिदा॑साम् अस्त॒मा ते॒ पार्थि॑वा॒ वसू॑न्य॒स्मे ज॑ग्मुः सू॒नृता॑ इन्द्र पू॒र्वीः
verses.transliteration: sadhrī́cīḥ síndhum uśatī́r ivāyan  sanā́j jārá āritáḥ pūrbhíd āsām  ástam ā́ te pā́rthivā vásūni-  asmé jagmuḥ sūnŕ̥tā indra pūrvī́ḥ

translation.text: Yearning together they have sped to Sindhu: the Fort-destroyer, praised, of old, hath loved them. Indra, may thy terrestrial treasures reach us, and our full songs of joy approach thy dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ पिब॑ प्रतिका॒मं सु॒तस्य॑ प्रातःसा॒वस्तव॒ हि पू॒र्वपी॑तिः हर्ष॑स्व॒ हन्त॑वे शूर॒ शत्रू॑नु॒क्थेभि॑ष्टे वी॒र्या॒३॒॑ प्र ब्र॑वाम
verses.transliteration: índra píba pratikāmáṃ sutásya  prātaḥsāvás táva hí pūrvápītiḥ  hárṣasva hántave śūra śátrūn  ukthébhiṣ ṭe vīryā̀ prá bravāma

translation.text: DRINK of the juice, O Indra, at thy plea. sure, for thy first draught is early morn's libation. Rejoice, that thou mayst slay our foes, O Hero, and we with lauds will tell thy mighty exploits.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॒ रथो॒ मन॑सो॒ जवी॑या॒नेन्द्र॒ तेन॑ सोम॒पेया॑य याहि तूय॒मा ते॒ हर॑यः॒ प्र द्र॑वन्तु॒ येभि॒र्यासि॒ वृष॑भि॒र्मन्द॑मानः
verses.transliteration: yás te rátho mánaso jávīyān  éndra téna somapéyāya yāhi  tū́yam ā́ te hárayaḥ prá dravantu  yébhir yā́si vŕ̥ṣabhir mándamānaḥ

translation.text: Thou hast a car more swift than thought, O Indra; thercon come hither, come to drink the Soma. Let thy Bay Steeds, thy Stallions, hasten hither, with whom thou cornest nigh and art delighted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हरि॑त्वता॒ वर्च॑सा॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ श्रेष्ठै॑ रू॒पैस्त॒न्वं॑ स्पर्शयस्व अ॒स्माभि॑रिन्द्र॒ सखि॑भिर्हुवा॒नः स॑ध्रीची॒नो मा॑दयस्वा नि॒षद्य॑
verses.transliteration: háritvatā várcasā sū́ryasya  śréṣṭhai rūpaís tanvàṃ sparśayasva  asmā́bhir indra sákhibhir huvānáḥ  sadhrīcīnó mādayasvā niṣádya

translation.text: Deck out thy body with the fairest colours, with golden splendour of the Sun adorn it. O Indra, turn thee hitherward invited by us thy friends; be seated and be joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ त्यत्ते॑ महि॒मानं॒ मदे॑ष्वि॒मे म॒ही रोद॑सी॒ नावि॑विक्ताम् तदोक॒ आ हरि॑भिरिन्द्र यु॒क्तैः प्रि॒येभि॑र्याहि प्रि॒यमन्न॒मच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: yásya tyát te mahimā́nam mádeṣu-  imé mahī́ ródasī nā́viviktām  tád óka ā́ háribhir indra yuktaíḥ  priyébhir yāhi priyám ánnam ácha

translation.text: O thou whose grandeur in thy festive transports not even these two great worlds have comprehended. Come, Indra, with thy dear Bay Horses harnessed, come to our dwelling and the food thou lovest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ शश्व॑त्पपि॒वाँ इ॑न्द्र॒ शत्रू॑ननानुकृ॒त्या रण्या॑ च॒कर्थ॑ स ते॒ पुरं॑धिं॒ तवि॑षीमियर्ति॒ स ते॒ मदा॑य सु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ सोमः॑
verses.transliteration: yásya śáśvat papivā́m̐ indra śátrūn  anānukr̥tyā́ ráṇyā cakártha  sá te púraṃdhiṃ táviṣīm iyarti  sá te mádāya sutá indra sómaḥ

translation.text: Pressed for thy joyous banquet is the Soma, Soma whereof thou, Indra, ever drinking, Hast waged unequalled battles with thy foemen, which prompts the mighty flow of thine abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं ते॒ पात्रं॒ सन॑वित्तमिन्द्र॒ पिबा॒ सोम॑मे॒ना श॑तक्रतो पू॒र्ण आ॑हा॒वो म॑दि॒रस्य॒ मध्वो॒ यं विश्व॒ इद॑भि॒हर्य॑न्ति दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: idáṃ te pā́traṃ sánavittam indra  píbā sómam enā́ śatakrato  pūrṇá āhāvó madirásya mádhvo  yáṃ víśva íd abhiháryanti devā́ḥ

translation.text: Found from of old is this thy cup, O Indra: Ṣatakratu, drink therefrom the Soma. Filled is the beaker with the meath that gladdens, the beaker which all Deities delight in.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि हि त्वामि॑न्द्र पुरु॒धा जना॑सो हि॒तप्र॑यसो वृषभ॒ ह्वय॑न्ते अ॒स्माकं॑ ते॒ मधु॑मत्तमानी॒मा भु॑व॒न्त्सव॑ना॒ तेषु॑ हर्य
verses.transliteration: ví hí tvā́m indra purudhā́ jánāso  hitáprayaso vr̥ṣabha hváyante  asmā́kaṃ te mádhumattamāni-  -imā́ bhuvan sávanā téṣu harya

translation.text: From many a side with proffered entertainment the folk are calling thee, O Mighty Indra. These our libations shall for thee be richest in sweet meath: dvink thereof and find them pleasant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र त॑ इन्द्र पू॒र्व्याणि॒ प्र नू॒नं वी॒र्या॑ वोचं प्रथ॒मा कृ॒तानि॑ स॒ती॒नम॑न्युरश्रथायो॒ अद्रिं॑ सुवेद॒नाम॑कृणो॒र्ब्रह्म॑णे॒ गाम्
verses.transliteration: prá ta indra pūrvyā́ṇi prá nūnáṃ  vīryā̀ vocam prathamā́ kr̥tā́ni  satīnámanyur aśrathāyo ádriṃ  suvedanā́m akr̥ṇor bráhmaṇe gā́m

translation.text: I will declare thy deeds of old, O Indra, the mighty acts which thou hast first accomplished. In genuine wrath thou loosenedst the mountain so that the Brahman easily found the cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि षु सी॑द गणपते ग॒णेषु॒ त्वामा॑हु॒र्विप्र॑तमं कवी॒नाम् न ऋ॒ते त्वत्क्रि॑यते॒ किं च॒नारे म॒हाम॒र्कं म॑घवञ्चि॒त्रम॑र्च
verses.transliteration: ní ṣú sīda gaṇapate gaṇéṣu  tvā́m āhur vípratamaṃ kavīnā́m  ná r̥té tvát kriyate kíṃ canā́ré  mahā́m arkám maghavañ citrám arca

translation.text: Lord of the hosts, amid our bands be seated: they call thee greatest Sage among the sages. Nothing is done, even far away, without thee: great, wondrous, Maghavan, is the hymn I sing thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि॒ख्या नो॑ मघव॒न्नाध॑माना॒न्त्सखे॑ बो॒धि व॑सुपते॒ सखी॑नाम् रणं॑ कृधि रणकृत्सत्यशु॒ष्माभ॑क्ते चि॒दा भ॑जा रा॒ये अ॒स्मान्
verses.transliteration: abhikhyā́ no maghavan nā́dhamānān  sákhe bodhí vasupate sákhīnām  ráṇaṃ kr̥dhi raṇakr̥t satyaśuṣma-  -ábhakte cid ā́ bhajā rāyé asmā́n

translation.text: Aim of our eyes be thou, for we implore thee, O Maghavan, Friend of friends and Lord of treasures. Fight, Warrior strong in truth, fight thou the battle: give us our share of undivided riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॑स्य॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी सचे॑तसा॒ विश्वे॑भिर्दे॒वैरनु॒ शुष्म॑मावताम् यदैत्कृ॑ण्वा॒नो म॑हि॒मान॑मिन्द्रि॒यं पी॒त्वी सोम॑स्य॒ क्रतु॑माँ अवर्धत
verses.transliteration: tám asya dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ sácetasā  víśvebhir devaír ánu śúṣmam āvatām  yád aít kr̥ṇvānó mahimā́nam indriyám  pītvī́ sómasya krátumām̐ avardhata

translation.text: THE Heavens and the Earth accordant with all Gods encouraged graciously that vigorous might of his. When he came showing forth his majesty and power, he drank of Soma juice and waxed exceeding strong.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॑स्य॒ विष्णु॑र्महि॒मान॒मोज॑सां॒शुं द॑ध॒न्वान्मधु॑नो॒ वि र॑प्शते दे॒वेभि॒रिन्द्रो॑ म॒घवा॑ स॒याव॑भिर्वृ॒त्रं ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अ॑भव॒द्वरे॑ण्यः
verses.transliteration: tám asya víṣṇur mahimā́nam ójasā-  -aṃśúṃ dadhanvā́n mádhuno ví rapśate  devébhir índro maghávā sayā́vabhir  vr̥tráṃ jaghanvā́m̐ abhavad váreṇyaḥ

translation.text: This majesty of his Vishṇu extols and lauds, making the stalCthat gives the meath flow forth with inight. When Indra Maghavan with those who followed him had smitten Vr̥itra he deserved the choice of Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒त्रेण॒ यदहि॑ना॒ बिभ्र॒दायु॑धा स॒मस्थि॑था यु॒धये॒ शंस॑मा॒विदे॑ विश्वे॑ ते॒ अत्र॑ म॒रुतः॑ स॒ह त्मनाव॑र्धन्नुग्र महि॒मान॑मिन्द्रि॒यम्
verses.transliteration: vr̥tréṇa yád áhinā bíbhrad ā́yudhā  samásthithā yudháye śáṃsam āvíde  víśve te átra marútaḥ sahá tmánā-  -ávardhann ugra mahimā́nam indriyám

translation.text: When, bearing warlike weapons, fain to win thee praise, thou mettest Vr̥itra, yea, the Dragon, for the fight, Then all the Maruts who were gathered with dice there extolled, O Mighty One, thy powerful majesty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒ज्ञा॒न ए॒व व्य॑बाधत॒ स्पृधः॒ प्राप॑श्यद्वी॒रो अ॒भि पौंस्यं॒ रण॑म् अवृ॑श्च॒दद्रि॒मव॑ स॒स्यदः॑ सृज॒दस्त॑भ्ना॒न्नाकं॑ स्वप॒स्यया॑ पृ॒थुम्
verses.transliteration: jajñāná evá vy àbādhata spŕ̥dhaḥ  prā́paśyad vīró abhí paúṃsyaṃ ráṇam  ávr̥ścad ádrim áva sasyádaḥ sr̥jad  ástabhnān nā́kaṃ svapasyáyā pr̥thúm

translation.text: Soon as he sprang to life he forced asun. der hosts: forward the Hero looked to manly deed and war. He cleft the rock, he let concurrent streams flow forth, and with his skilful art stablished the heavens' wide vault.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदिन्द्रः॑ स॒त्रा तवि॑षीरपत्यत॒ वरी॑यो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॑बाधत अवा॑भरद्धृषि॒तो वज्र॑माय॒सं शेवं॑ मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: ā́d índraḥ satrā́ táviṣīr apatya  várīyo dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ abādhata  ávābharad dhr̥ṣitó vájram āyasáṃ  śévam mitrā́ya váruṇāya dāśúṣe

translation.text: Indra hath evermore possessed surpassing power: he forced, far from each other, heaven and earth apart. He hurled impetuous down his iron thunderbolt, a joy to Varuṇa's and Mitra's worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒स्यात्र॒ तवि॑षीभ्यो विर॒प्शिन॑ ऋघाय॒तो अ॑रंहयन्त म॒न्यवे॑ वृ॒त्रं यदु॒ग्रो व्यवृ॑श्च॒दोज॑सा॒पो बिभ्र॑तं॒ तम॑सा॒ परी॑वृतम्
verses.transliteration: índrasyā́tra táviṣībhyo virapśínaḥ-  r̥ghāyató araṃhayanta manyáve  vr̥tráṃ yád ugró vy ávr̥ścad ójasā-  -apó bíbhrataṃ támasā párīvr̥tam

translation.text: Then to the mighty powers of Indra, to his wrath, his the fierce Stormer, loud of voice, they came with speed; What time the Potent One rent Vr̥itra with his strength, who held the waters back, whom darkness compassed round.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या वी॒र्या॑णि प्रथ॒मानि॒ कर्त्वा॑ महि॒त्वेभि॒र्यत॑मानौ समी॒यतुः॑ ध्वा॒न्तं तमोऽव॑ दध्वसे ह॒त इन्द्रो॑ म॒ह्ना पू॒र्वहू॑तावपत्यत
verses.transliteration: yā́ vīryā̀ṇi prathamā́ni kártvā  mahitvébhir yátamānau samīyátuḥ  dhvāntáṃ támó 'va dadhvase haté-  índro mahnā́ pūrváhūtāv apatyata

translation.text: Even in the first of those heroic acts which they who strove together came with might to execute, Deep darkness fell upon the slain, and Indra won by victory the right of being first invoked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ दे॒वासो॒ अध॒ वृष्ण्या॑नि॒ तेऽव॑र्धय॒न्त्सोम॑वत्या वच॒स्यया॑ र॒द्धं वृ॒त्रमहि॒मिन्द्र॑स्य॒ हन्म॑ना॒ग्निर्न जम्भै॑स्तृ॒ष्वन्न॑मावयत्
verses.transliteration: víśve devā́so ádha vŕ̥ṣṇyāni te-  -ávardhayan sómavatyā vacasyáyā  raddháṃ vr̥trám áhim índrasya hánmanā-  -agnír ná jámbhais tr̥ṣv ánnam āvayat

translation.text: Then all the Gods extolled, with eloquence inspired by draughts of Soma juice, thy deeds of manly might. As Agni eats the dry food with his tcetlv, he ate Vr̥itra, the Dragon, maimed by Indra's deadly dart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरि॒ दक्षे॑भिर्वच॒नेभि॒र्ऋक्व॑भिः स॒ख्येभिः॑ स॒ख्यानि॒ प्र वो॑चत इन्द्रो॒ धुनिं॑ च॒ चुमु॑रिं च द॒म्भय॑ञ्छ्रद्धामन॒स्या शृ॑णुते द॒भीत॑ये
verses.transliteration: bhū́ri dákṣebhir vacanébhir ŕ̥kvabhiḥ  sakhyébhiḥ sakhyā́ni prá vocata  índro dhúniṃ ca cúmuriṃ ca dambháyañ  -śraddhāmanasyā́ śr̥ṇute dabhī́taye

translation.text: Proclaim his many friendships, met with friendship, made with singers, with the skilful and the eloquent. Indra, when he subdues Dhuni and Chumuri, lists to Dabhîti for his faithful spirit's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं पु॒रूण्या भ॑रा॒ स्वश्व्या॒ येभि॒र्मंसै॑ नि॒वच॑नानि॒ शंस॑न् सु॒गेभि॒र्विश्वा॑ दुरि॒ता त॑रेम वि॒दो षु ण॑ उर्वि॒या गा॒धम॒द्य
verses.transliteration: tvám purū́ṇy ā́ bharā sváśvyā  yébhir máṃsai nivácanāni śáṃsan  sugébhir víśvā duritā́ tarema  vidó ṣú ṇa urviyā́ gādhám adyá

translation.text: Give riches manifold with noble horses, to be remembered while my songs address thee. May we by easy paths pass all our troubles: find us this day a ford wide and extensive.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घ॒र्मा सम॑न्ता त्रि॒वृतं॒ व्या॑पतु॒स्तयो॒र्जुष्टिं॑ मात॒रिश्वा॑ जगाम दि॒वस्पयो॒ दिधि॑षाणा अवेषन्वि॒दुर्दे॒वाः स॒हसा॑मानम॒र्कम्
verses.transliteration: gharmā́ sámantā trivŕ̥taṃ vy ā̀patus  táyor júṣṭim mātaríśvā jagāma  divás páyo dídhiṣāṇā aveṣan  vidúr devā́ḥ sahásāmānam arkám

translation.text: Two perfect springs of heat pervade the Threefold, and come for their delight is Mâtariṣvan. Craving the milk of heaven the Gods are present: well do they know the praisesong and the Sâman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒स्रो दे॒ष्ट्राय॒ निर्ऋ॑ती॒रुपा॑सते दीर्घ॒श्रुतो॒ वि हि जा॒नन्ति॒ वह्न॑यः तासां॒ नि चि॑क्युः क॒वयो॑ नि॒दानं॒ परे॑षु॒ या गुह्ये॑षु व्र॒तेषु॑
verses.transliteration: tisró deṣṭrā́ya nírr̥tīr úpāsate  dīrghaśrúto ví hí jānánti váhnayaḥ  tā́sāṃ ní cikyuḥ kaváyo nidā́nam  páreṣu yā́ gúhyeṣu vratéṣu

translation.text: The priests beard far away, as they are ordered, serve the three Nirr̥itis, for well they know them. Sages have traced the cause that first produced them, dwelling in distant and mysterious chambers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चतु॑ष्कपर्दा युव॒तिः सु॒पेशा॑ घृ॒तप्र॑तीका व॒युना॑नि वस्ते तस्यां॑ सुप॒र्णा वृष॑णा॒ नि षे॑दतु॒र्यत्र॑ दे॒वा द॑धि॒रे भा॑ग॒धेय॑म्
verses.transliteration: cátuṣkapardā yuvatíḥ supéśāḥ-  ghr̥tápratīkā vayúnāni vaste  tásyāṃ suparṇā́ vŕ̥ṣaṇā ní ṣedatur  yátra devā́ dadhiré bhāgadhéyam
