translation.text: The Youthful One, well-shaped, with four locks braided, brightened with oil, puts on the ordinances. Two Birds of mighty power are seated near her, there where the Deities receive their portion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एकः॑ सुप॒र्णः स स॑मु॒द्रमा वि॑वेश॒ स इ॒दं विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं॒ वि च॑ष्टे तं पाके॑न॒ मन॑सापश्य॒मन्ति॑त॒स्तं मा॒ता रे॑ळ्हि॒ स उ॑ रेळ्हि मा॒तर॑म्
verses.transliteration: ékaḥ suparṇáḥ sá samudrám ā́ viveśa  sá idáṃ víśvam bhúvanaṃ ví caṣṭe  tám pā́kena mánasāpaśyam ántitas  tám mātā́ reḷhi sá u reḷhi mātáram

translation.text: One of these Birds hath passed into the sea of air: thence he looks round and views this universal world. With simple heart I have beheld him from anear: his Mother kisses him and he returns her kiss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒प॒र्णं विप्राः॑ क॒वयो॒ वचो॑भि॒रेकं॒ सन्तं॑ बहु॒धा क॑ल्पयन्ति छन्दां॑सि च॒ दध॑तो अध्व॒रेषु॒ ग्रहा॒न्त्सोम॑स्य मिमते॒ द्वाद॑श
verses.transliteration: suparṇáṃ víprāḥ kaváyo vácobhir  ékaṃ sántam bahudhā́ kalpayanti  chándāṃsi ca dádhato adhvaréṣu  gráhān sómasya mimate dvā́daśa

translation.text: Him with fair wings though only One in nature, wise singers shape, with songs, in many figures. While they at sacrifices fix the metres, they measure out twelve chalices of Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ष॒ट्त्रिं॒शाँश्च॑ च॒तुरः॑ क॒ल्पय॑न्त॒श्छन्दां॑सि च॒ दध॑त आद्वाद॒शम् य॒ज्ञं वि॒माय॑ क॒वयो॑ मनी॒ष ऋ॑क्सा॒माभ्यां॒ प्र रथं॑ वर्तयन्ति
verses.transliteration: ṣaṭtriṃśā́ṃś ca catúraḥ kalpáyantaś  chándāṃsi ca dádhata ādvādaśám  yajñáṃ vimā́ya kaváyo manīṣā́-  r̥ksāmā́bhyām prá ráthaṃ vartayanti

translation.text: While they arrange the four and six-and-thirty, and duly order, up to twelve, the measures, Having disposed the sacrifice thoughtful sages send the Car forward with the R̥ich and Sâman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चतु॑र्दशा॒न्ये म॑हि॒मानो॑ अस्य॒ तं धीरा॑ वा॒चा प्र ण॑यन्ति स॒प्त आप्ना॑नं ती॒र्थं क इ॒ह प्र वो॑च॒द्येन॑ प॒था प्र॒पिब॑न्ते सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: cáturdaśānyé mahimā́no asya  táṃ dhī́rā vācā́ prá ṇayanti saptá  ā́pnānaṃ tīrtháṃ ká ihá prá vocad  yéna pathā́ prapíbante sutásya

translation.text: The Chariot's majesties are fourteen others: seven sages lead it onward with their Voices. Who will declare to us the ford Âpnâna, the path whereby they drink first draughts of Soma?

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒ह॒स्र॒धा प॑ञ्चद॒शान्यु॒क्था याव॒द्द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी ताव॒दित्तत् स॒ह॒स्र॒धा म॑हि॒मानः॑ स॒हस्रं॒ याव॒द्ब्रह्म॒ विष्ठि॑तं॒ ताव॑ती॒ वाक्
verses.transliteration: sahasradhā́ pañcadaśā́ny ukthā́  yā́vad dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ tā́vad ít tát  sahasradhā́ mahimā́naḥ sahásraṃ  yā́vad bráhma víṣṭhitaṃ tā́vatī vā́k

translation.text: The fifteen lauds are in a thousand places that is as vast as heaven and earth in measure. A thousand spots contain the mighty thousand. Vâk spreadeth forth as far as Prayer extendeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कश्छन्द॑सां॒ योग॒मा वे॑द॒ धीरः॒ को धिष्ण्यां॒ प्रति॒ वाचं॑ पपाद कमृ॒त्विजा॑मष्ट॒मं शूर॑माहु॒र्हरी॒ इन्द्र॑स्य॒ नि चि॑काय॒ कः स्वि॑त्
verses.transliteration: káś chándasāṃ yógam ā́ veda dhī́raḥ  kó dhíṣṇyām práti vā́cam papāda  kám r̥tvíjām aṣṭamáṃ śū́ram āhur  hárī índrasya ní cikāya káḥ svit

translation.text: What sage hath learned the metres' application? Who hath gained Vâk, the spirit's aim and object? Which ministering priest is called eighth Hero? Who then hath tracked the two Bay Steeds of Indra?

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूम्या॒ अन्तं॒ पर्येके॑ चरन्ति॒ रथ॑स्य धू॒र्षु यु॒क्तासो॑ अस्थुः श्रम॑स्य दा॒यं वि भ॑जन्त्येभ्यो य॒दा य॒मो भव॑ति ह॒र्म्ये हि॒तः
verses.transliteration: bhū́myā ántam páry éke caranti  ráthasya dhūrṣú yuktā́so asthuḥ  śrámasya dāyáṃ ví bhajanty ebhyo  yadā́ yamó bhávati harmyé hitáḥ

translation.text: Yoked to his chariot-pole there stood the Coursers: they only travel round earth's farthest limits. These, when their driver in his home is settled, receive the allotted meed of their exertion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चि॒त्र इच्छिशो॒स्तरु॑णस्य व॒क्षथो॒ न यो मा॒तरा॑व॒प्येति॒ धात॑वे अ॒नू॒धा यदि॒ जीज॑न॒दधा॑ च॒ नु व॒वक्ष॑ स॒द्यो महि॑ दू॒त्यं१॒॑ चर॑न्
verses.transliteration: citrá íc chíśos táruṇasya vakṣátho  ná yó mātárāv apyéti dhā́tave  anūdhā́ yádi jī́janad ádhā ca nú  vavákṣa sadyó máhi dūtyàṃ cáran

translation.text: VERILY wondrous is the tender Youngling's growth who never draweth nigh to drink his Mothers' milk. As soon as she who hath no udder bore him, he, faring on his great errand, suddenly grew strong.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्ह॒ नाम॑ धायि॒ दन्न॒पस्त॑मः॒ सं यो वना॑ यु॒वते॒ भस्म॑ना द॒ता अ॒भि॒प्र॒मुरा॑ जु॒ह्वा॑ स्वध्व॒र इ॒नो न प्रोथ॑मानो॒ यव॑से॒ वृषा॑
verses.transliteration: agnír ha nā́ma dhāyi dánn apástamaḥ  sáṃ yó vánā yuváte bhásmanā datā́  abhipramúrā juhvā̀ svadhvaráḥ-  inó ná próthamāno yávase vŕ̥ṣā

translation.text: Then Agni was his name, most active to bestow, gathering up the trees with his consuming tooth; Skilled in fair sacrifice, armed with destroying tongue, impetuous as a bull that snorteth in the mead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वो॒ विं न द्रु॒षदं॑ दे॒वमन्ध॑स॒ इन्दुं॒ प्रोथ॑न्तं प्र॒वप॑न्तमर्ण॒वम् आ॒सा वह्निं॒ न शो॒चिषा॑ विर॒प्शिनं॒ महि॑व्रतं॒ न स॒रज॑न्त॒मध्व॑नः
verses.transliteration: táṃ vo víṃ ná druṣádaṃ devám ándhasaḥ-  índum próthantam pravápantam arṇavám  āsā́ váhniṃ ná śocíṣā virapśínam  máhivrataṃ ná sarájantam ádhvanaḥ

translation.text: Praise him, yourGod who, bird-like, rests upon a tree, scattering drops of juice and pouring forth his flood, Speaking aloud with flame as with his lips a priest, and broadening his paths like one of high command.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि यस्य॑ ते ज्रयसा॒नस्या॑जर॒ धक्षो॒र्न वाताः॒ परि॒ सन्त्यच्यु॑ताः आ र॒ण्वासो॒ युयु॑धयो॒ न स॑त्व॒नं त्रि॒तं न॑शन्त॒ प्र शि॒षन्त॑ इ॒ष्टये॑
verses.transliteration: ví yásya te jrayasānásyājara  dhákṣor ná vā́tāḥ pári sánty ácyutāḥ  ā́ raṇvā́so yúyudhayo ná satvanáṃ  tritáṃ naśanta prá śiṣánta iṣṭáye

translation.text: Thou Everlasting, whom, far-striding fain to burn, the winds, uninterrupted, never overcome, They have approached, as warriors eager for the fight, heroic Trita, guiding him to gain his wish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इद॒ग्निः कण्व॑तमः॒ कण्व॑सखा॒र्यः पर॒स्यान्त॑रस्य॒ तरु॑षः अ॒ग्निः पा॑तु गृण॒तो अ॒ग्निः सू॒रीन॒ग्निर्द॑दातु॒ तेषा॒मवो॑ नः
verses.transliteration: sá íd agníḥ káṇvatamaḥ káṇvasakhā-  aryáḥ párasyā́ntarasya táruṣaḥ  agníḥ pātu gr̥ṇató agníḥ sūrī́n  agnír dadātu téṣām ávo naḥ

translation.text: This Agni is the best of Kaṇvas, Kaṇvas' Friend, Conqueror of the foe whether afar or near. May Agni guard the singers, guard the princes well: may Agni grant to us our princes' gracious help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒जिन्त॑माय॒ सह्य॑से सुपित्र्य तृ॒षु च्यवा॑नो॒ अनु॑ जा॒तवे॑दसे अ॒नु॒द्रे चि॒द्यो धृ॑ष॒ता वरं॑ स॒ते म॒हिन्त॑माय॒ धन्व॒नेद॑विष्य॒ते
verses.transliteration: vājíntamāya sáhyase supitrya  tr̥ṣú cyávāno ánu jātávedase  anudré cid yó dhr̥ṣatā́ váraṃ saté  mahíntamāya dhánvanéd aviṣyaté

translation.text: Do thou, Supitrya, swiftly following, make thyself the lord of Jâtavedas, mightiest of all, Who surely gives a boon even in thirsty land most powerful, prepared to aid us in the wilds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वाग्निर्मर्तैः॑ स॒ह सू॒रिभि॒र्वसुः॑ ष्टवे॒ सह॑सः सू॒नरो॒ नृभिः॑ मि॒त्रासो॒ न ये सुधि॑ता ऋता॒यवो॒ द्यावो॒ न द्यु॒म्नैर॒भि सन्ति॒ मानु॑षान्
verses.transliteration: evā́gnír mártaiḥ sahá sūríbhir  vásu ṣṭave sáhasaḥ sūnáro nŕ̥bhiḥ  mitrā́so ná yé súdhitā r̥tāyávo  dyā́vo ná dyumnaír abhí sánti mā́nuṣān

translation.text: Thus noble Agni with princes and mortal men is lauded, excellent for conquering strength with chiefs, Men who are well-disposed as friends and true to Law, even as the heavens in majesty surpass mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊर्जो॑ नपात्सहसाव॒न्निति॑ त्वोपस्तु॒तस्य॑ वन्दते॒ वृषा॒ वाक् त्वां स्तो॑षाम॒ त्वया॑ सु॒वीरा॒ द्राघी॑य॒ आयुः॑ प्रत॒रं दधा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: ū́rjo napāt sahasāvann íti tvā-  -upastutásya vandate vŕ̥ṣā vā́k  tvā́ṃ stoṣāma tváyā suvī́rāḥ-  drā́ghīya ā́yuḥ prataráṃ dádhānāḥ

translation.text: O Son of Strength, Victorious, with this title Upastuta's most potent voice reveres thee. Blest with brave sons by thee we will extol thee, and lengthen out the days of our existence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इति॑ त्वाग्ने वृष्टि॒हव्य॑स्य पु॒त्रा उ॑पस्तु॒तास॒ ऋष॑योऽवोचन् ताँश्च॑ पा॒हि गृ॑ण॒तश्च॑ सू॒रीन्वष॒ड्वष॒ळित्यू॒र्ध्वासो॑ अनक्ष॒न्नमो॒ नम॒ इत्यू॒र्ध्वासो॑ अनक्षन्
verses.transliteration: íti tvāgne vr̥ṣṭihávyasya putrā́ḥ-  upastutā́sa ŕ̥ṣayo 'vocan  tā́ṃś ca pāhí gr̥ṇatáś ca sūrī́n  váṣaḍ váṣaḷ íty ūrdhvā́so anakṣan  námo náma íty ūrdhvā́so anakṣan

translation.text: Thus, Agni, have the sons of Vr̥ishṭihavya, the R̥ishis, the Upastutas invoked thee. Protect them, guard the singers and the princes. With Vashaṭ! have they come, with hands uplifted, with their uplifted hands and cries of Glory!

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिबा॒ सोमं॑ मह॒त इ॑न्द्रि॒याय॒ पिबा॑ वृ॒त्राय॒ हन्त॑वे शविष्ठ पिब॑ रा॒ये शव॑से हू॒यमा॑नः॒ पिब॒ मध्व॑स्तृ॒पदि॒न्द्रा वृ॑षस्व
verses.transliteration: píbā sómam mahatá indriyā́ya  píbā vr̥trā́ya hántave śaviṣṭha  píba rāyé śávase hūyámānaḥ  píba mádhvas tr̥pád indrā́ vr̥ṣasva

translation.text: DRINK Soma juice for mighty power and vigour, drink, Strongest One, that thou mayst smite down Vr̥itra. Drink thou, invoked, for strength, and riches: drink thou thy fill of meath and pour it down, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य पि॑ब क्षु॒मतः॒ प्रस्थि॑त॒स्येन्द्र॒ सोम॑स्य॒ वर॒मा सु॒तस्य॑ स्व॒स्ति॒दा मन॑सा मादयस्वार्वाची॒नो रे॒वते॒ सौभ॑गाय
verses.transliteration: asyá piba kṣumátaḥ prásthitasya-  -índra sómasya váram ā́ sutásya  svastidā́ mánasā mādayasva-  -arvācīnó reváte saúbhagāya

translation.text: Drink of the foodful juice stirred into motion, drink what thou choosest of the flowing Soma. Giver of weal, be joyful in thy spirit, and turn thee hitherward to bless and prosper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒मत्तु॑ त्वा दि॒व्यः सोम॑ इन्द्र म॒मत्तु॒ यः सू॒यते॒ पार्थि॑वेषु म॒मत्तु॒ येन॒ वरि॑वश्च॒कर्थ॑ म॒मत्तु॒ येन॑ निरि॒णासि॒ शत्रू॑न्
verses.transliteration: mamáttu tvā divyáḥ sóma indra  mamáttu yáḥ sūyáte pā́rthiveṣu  mamáttu yéna várivaś cakártha  mamáttu yéna niriṇā́si śátrūn

translation.text: Let heavenly Soma gladden thee, O Indra, let that effused among mankind delight thee. Rejoice in that whereby thou gavest freedom, and that whereby thou conquerest thy foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ द्वि॒बर्हा॑ अमि॒नो या॒त्विन्द्रो॒ वृषा॒ हरि॑भ्यां॒ परि॑षिक्त॒मन्धः॑ गव्या सु॒तस्य॒ प्रभृ॑तस्य॒ मध्वः॑ स॒त्रा खेदा॑मरुश॒हा वृ॑षस्व
verses.transliteration: ā́ dvibárhā aminó yātv índro  vŕ̥ṣā háribhyām páriṣiktam ándhaḥ  gávy ā́ sutásya prábhr̥tasya mádhvaḥ  satrā́ khédām aruśahā́ vr̥ṣasva

translation.text: Let Indra come, impetuous, doubly mighty, to the poured juice, the Bull, with two Bay Coursers. With juices pressed in milk, with meath presented, glut evermore thy bolt, O Foe-destroyer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि ति॒ग्मानि॑ भ्रा॒शय॒न्भ्राश्या॒न्यव॑ स्थि॒रा त॑नुहि यातु॒जूना॑म् उ॒ग्राय॑ ते॒ सहो॒ बलं॑ ददामि प्र॒तीत्या॒ शत्रू॑न्विग॒देषु॑ वृश्च
verses.transliteration: ní tigmā́ni bhrāśáyan bhrā́śyāni-  áva sthirā́ tanuhi yātujū́nāṃ  ugrā́ya te sáho bálaṃ dadāmi  pratī́tyā śátrūn vigadéṣu vr̥śca

translation.text: Dash down, outffaming their sharp flaming weapons, the strong-holds of the men urged on by demons. I give thee, Mighty One, great strength and conquest: go, meet thy foes and rend them in the battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्य१॒॑र्य इ॑न्द्र तनुहि॒ श्रवां॒स्योजः॑ स्थि॒रेव॒ धन्व॑नो॒ऽभिमा॑तीः अ॒स्म॒द्र्य॑ग्वावृधा॒नः सहो॑भि॒रनि॑भृष्टस्त॒न्वं॑ वावृधस्व
verses.transliteration: vy àryá indra tanuhi śrávāṃsi-  ója sthiréva dhánvano 'bhímātīḥ  asmadryàg vāvr̥dhānáḥ sáhobhir  ánibhr̥ṣṭas tanvàṃ vāvr̥dhasva

translation.text: Extend afar the votary's fame and glory, as the firm archer's strength drives off the foeman. Ranged on our side, grown strong in might that conquers, never defeated, still increase thy body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं ह॒विर्म॑घव॒न्तुभ्यं॑ रा॒तं प्रति॑ सम्रा॒ळहृ॑णानो गृभाय तुभ्यं॑ सु॒तो म॑घव॒न्तुभ्यं॑ प॒क्वो॒३॒॑ऽद्धी॑न्द्र॒ पिब॑ च॒ प्रस्थि॑तस्य
verses.transliteration: idáṃ havír maghavan túbhyaṃ rātám  práti samrāḷ áhr̥ṇāno gr̥bhāya  túbhyaṃ sutó maghavan túbhyam pakváḥ-  -addhī̀ndra píba ca prásthitasya

translation.text: To thee have we presented this oblation: accept it, Sovran Ruler, free from anger. Juice, Maghavan, for thee is pressed and ripened: eat, Indra, drink of that which stirs to meet thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्धीदि॑न्द्र॒ प्रस्थि॑ते॒मा ह॒वींषि॒ चनो॑ दधिष्व पच॒तोत सोम॑म् प्रय॑स्वन्तः॒ प्रति॑ हर्यामसि त्वा स॒त्याः स॑न्तु॒ यज॑मानस्य॒ कामाः॑
verses.transliteration: addhī́d indra prásthitemā́ havī́ṃṣi  cáno dadhiṣva pacatótá sómam  práyasvantaḥ práti haryāmasi tvā  satyā́ḥ santu yájamānasya kā́māḥ

translation.text: Eat, Indra, these oblations which approach thee: be pleased with food made ready and with Soma. With entertainment we receive thee friendly: effectual be the sacrificer's wishes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेन्द्रा॒ग्निभ्यां॑ सुवच॒स्यामि॑यर्मि॒ सिन्धा॑विव॒ प्रेर॑यं॒ नाव॑म॒र्कैः अया॑ इव॒ परि॑ चरन्ति दे॒वा ये अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ धन॒दा उ॒द्भिद॑श्च
verses.transliteration: préndrāgníbhyāṃ suvacasyā́m iyarmi  síndhāv iva prérayaṃ nā́vam arkaíḥ  áyā iva pári caranti devā́ḥ-  yé asmábhyaṃ dhanadā́ udbhídaś ca

translation.text: I send sweet speech to Indra and to Agni: with hymns I speed it like a boat through waters. Even thus, the Gods seem moving round about me, the fountains and bestowers of our riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वा उ॑ दे॒वाः क्षुध॒मिद्व॒धं द॑दुरु॒ताशि॑त॒मुप॑ गच्छन्ति मृ॒त्यवः॑ उ॒तो र॒यिः पृ॑ण॒तो नोप॑ दस्यत्यु॒तापृ॑णन्मर्डि॒तारं॒ न वि॑न्दते
verses.transliteration: ná vā́ u devā́ḥ kṣúdham íd vadháṃ dadur  utā́śitam úpa gachanti mr̥tyávaḥ  utó rayíḥ pr̥ṇató nópa dasyati-  utā́pr̥ṇan marḍitā́raṃ ná vindate

translation.text: THE Gods have not ordained hunger to be our death: even to the well-fed man comes death in varied shape. The riches of the liberal never waste away, while he who will not give finds none to comfort him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य आ॒ध्राय॑ चकमा॒नाय॑ पि॒त्वोऽन्न॑वा॒न्त्सन्र॑फि॒तायो॑पज॒ग्मुषे॑ स्थि॒रं मनः॑ कृणु॒ते सेव॑ते पु॒रोतो चि॒त्स म॑र्डि॒तारं॒ न वि॑न्दते
verses.transliteration: yá ādhrā́ya cakamānā́ya pitvó  -ánnavān sán raphitā́yopajagmúṣe  sthirám mánaḥ kr̥ṇuté sévate purā́-  -utó cit sá marḍitā́raṃ ná vindate

translation.text: The man with food in store who, when the needy comes in miserable case begging for bread to eat, Hardens his heart against him-even when of old he did him service-finds not one to comfort him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इद्भो॒जो यो गृ॒हवे॒ ददा॒त्यन्न॑कामाय॒ चर॑ते कृ॒शाय॑ अर॑मस्मै भवति॒ याम॑हूता उ॒ताप॒रीषु॑ कृणुते॒ सखा॑यम्
verses.transliteration: sá íd bhojó yó gr̥háve dádāti-  ánnakāmāya cárate kr̥śā́ya  áram asmai bhavati yā́mahūtau-  utā́parī́ṣu kr̥ṇute sákhāyam

translation.text: Bounteous is he who gives unto the beggar who comes to him in want of food and feeble. Success attends him in the shout of battle. He makes a friend of him in future troubles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न स सखा॒ यो न ददा॑ति॒ सख्ये॑ सचा॒भुवे॒ सच॑मानाय पि॒त्वः अपा॑स्मा॒त्प्रेया॒न्न तदोको॑ अस्ति पृ॒णन्त॑म॒न्यमर॑णं चिदिच्छेत्
verses.transliteration: ná sá sákhā yó ná dádāti sákhye  sacābhúve sácamānāya pitváḥ  ápāsmāt préyān ná tád óko asti  pr̥ṇántam anyám áraṇaṃ cid ichet

translation.text: No friend is he who to his friend and comrade who comes imploring food, will offer nothing. Let him depart-no home is that to rest in-, and rather seek a stranger to support him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒णी॒यादिन्नाध॑मानाय॒ तव्या॒न्द्राघी॑यांस॒मनु॑ पश्येत॒ पन्था॑म् ओ हि वर्त॑न्ते॒ रथ्ये॑व च॒क्रान्यम॑न्य॒मुप॑ तिष्ठन्त॒ रायः॑
verses.transliteration: pr̥ṇīyā́d ín nā́dhamānāya távyān  drā́ghīyāṃsam ánu paśyeta pánthām  ó hí vártante ráthyeva cakrā́-  -anyám-anyam úpa tiṣṭhanta rā́yaḥ

translation.text: Let the rich satisfy the poor implorer, and bend his eye upon a longer pathway. Riches come now to one, now to another, and like the wheels of cars are ever rolling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मोघ॒मन्नं॑ विन्दते॒ अप्र॑चेताः स॒त्यं ब्र॑वीमि व॒ध इत्स तस्य॑ नार्य॒मणं॒ पुष्य॑ति॒ नो सखा॑यं॒ केव॑लाघो भवति केवला॒दी
verses.transliteration: mógham ánnaṃ vindate ápracetāḥ  satyám bravīmi vadhá ít sá tásya  nā́ryamáṇam púṣyati nó sákhāyaṃ  kévalāgho bhavati kevalādī́

translation.text: The foolish man wins food with fruitless labour: that food -I speak the truth- shall be his ruin. He feeds no trusty friend, no man to love him. All guilt is he who eats with no partaker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒षन्नित्फाल॒ आशि॑तं कृणोति॒ यन्नध्वा॑न॒मप॑ वृङ्क्ते च॒रित्रैः॑ वद॑न्ब्र॒ह्माव॑दतो॒ वनी॑यान्पृ॒णन्ना॒पिरपृ॑णन्तम॒भि ष्या॑त्
verses.transliteration: kr̥ṣánn ít phā́la ā́śitaṃ kr̥ṇoti  yánn ádhvānam ápa vr̥ṅkte carítraiḥ  vádan brahmā́vadato vánīyān  pr̥ṇánn āpír ápr̥ṇantam abhí ṣyāt

translation.text: The ploughshare ploughing makes the food that feeds us, and with its feet cuts through the path it follows. Better the speaking than the silent Brahman: the liberal friend outyalues him who gives not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एक॑पा॒द्भूयो॑ द्वि॒पदो॒ वि च॑क्रमे द्वि॒पात्त्रि॒पाद॑म॒भ्ये॑ति प॒श्चात् चतु॑ष्पादेति द्वि॒पदा॑मभिस्व॒रे स॒म्पश्य॑न्प॒ङ्क्तीरु॑प॒तिष्ठ॑मानः
verses.transliteration: ékapād bhū́yo dvipádo ví cakrame  dvipā́t tripā́dam abhy èti paścā́t  cátuṣpād eti dvipádām abhisvaré  sampáśyan paṅktī́r upatíṣṭhamānaḥ

translation.text: He with one foot hath far outrun the biped, and the two-footed catches the three-footed. Four-footed creatures come when bipeds call them, and stand and look where five are met together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मौ चि॒द्धस्तौ॒ न स॒मं वि॑विष्टः सम्मा॒तरा॑ चि॒न्न स॒मं दु॑हाते य॒मयो॑श्चि॒न्न स॒मा वी॒र्या॑णि ज्ञा॒ती चि॒त्सन्तौ॒ न स॒मं पृ॑णीतः
verses.transliteration: samaú cid dhástau ná samáṃ viviṣṭaḥ  sammātárā cin ná samáṃ duhāte  yamáyoś cin ná samā́ vīryā̀ṇi  jñātī́ cit sántau ná samám pr̥ṇītaḥ

translation.text: The hands are both alike: their labour differs. The yield of sister milch-kine is unequal. Twins even diffier in their strength and vigour: two, even kinsmen, differ in their bounty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ हंसि॒ न्य१॒॑त्रिणं॒ दीद्य॒न्मर्त्ये॒ष्वा स्वे क्षये॑ शुचिव्रत
verses.transliteration: ágne háṃsi ny àtríṇaṃ  dī́dyan mártyeṣv ā́  své kṣáye śucivrata

translation.text: AGNI, refulgent among men thou slayest the devouring fiend, Bright Ruler in thine own abode.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ति॑ष्ठसि॒ स्वा॑हुतो घृ॒तानि॒ प्रति॑ मोदसे यत्त्वा॒ स्रुचः॑ स॒मस्थि॑रन्
verses.transliteration: út tiṣṭhasi svā̀huto  ghr̥tā́ni práti modase  yát tvā srúcaḥ samásthiran

translation.text: Thou springest up when worshipped well the drops of butter are thy joy When ladies are brought near to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स आहु॑तो॒ वि रो॑चते॒ऽग्निरी॒ळेन्यो॑ गि॒रा स्रु॒चा प्रती॑कमज्यते
verses.transliteration: sá ā́huto ví rocate  agnír īḷényo girā́  srucā́ prátīkam ajyate

translation.text: Honoured with gifts he shines afar, Agni adorable with song: The dripping ladle balms his face.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒तेना॒ग्निः सम॑ज्यते॒ मधु॑प्रतीक॒ आहु॑तः रोच॑मानो वि॒भाव॑सुः
verses.transliteration: ghr̥ténāgníḥ sám ajyate  mádhupratīka ā́hutaḥ  rócamāno vibhā́vasuḥ

translation.text: Agni with honey in his mouth, honoured with gifts, is balmed with oil, Refulgent in his wealth of light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जर॑माणः॒ समि॑ध्यसे दे॒वेभ्यो॑ हव्यवाहन तं त्वा॑ हवन्त॒ मर्त्याः॑
verses.transliteration: járamāṇaḥ sám idhyase  devébhyo havyavāhana  táṃ tvā havanta mártyāḥ

translation.text: Praised by our hymns thou kindlest thee, Oblation-bearer, for the Gods As such do mortals call on thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं म॑र्ता॒ अम॑र्त्यं घृ॒तेना॒ग्निं स॑पर्यत अदा॑भ्यं गृ॒हप॑तिम्
verses.transliteration: tám martā ámartyaṃ  ghr̥ténāgníṃ saparyata  ádābhyaṃ gr̥hápatim

translation.text: To that Immortal Agni pay worship with oil, ye mortal men,– Lord of the house, whom none deceives.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदा॑भ्येन शो॒चिषाग्ने॒ रक्ष॒स्त्वं द॑ह गो॒पा ऋ॒तस्य॑ दीदिहि
verses.transliteration: ádābhyena śocíṣā-  -ágne rákṣas tváṃ daha  gopā́ r̥tásya dīdihi

translation.text: O Agni, burn the Raksasas with thine unconquerable flame Shine guardian of Eternal Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वम॑ग्ने॒ प्रती॑केन॒ प्रत्यो॑ष यातुधा॒न्यः॑ उ॒रु॒क्षये॑षु॒ दीद्य॑त्
verses.transliteration: sá tvám agne prátīkena  práty oṣa yātudhānyàḥ  urukṣáyeṣu dī́dyat

translation.text: So, Agni, with thy glowing face burn fierce against the female fiends, Shining among Urukshayas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ गी॒र्भिरु॑रु॒क्षया॑ हव्य॒वाहं॒ समी॑धिरे यजि॑ष्ठं॒ मानु॑षे॒ जने॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā gīrbhír urukṣáyā  havyavā́haṃ sám īdhire  yájiṣṭham mā́nuṣe jáne

translation.text: Urukshayas have kindled thee, Oblation-bearer, thee, with hymns. Best Worshipper among mankind.

suktas.deity: Soliloquy of One Intoxicated by Soma

verses.sanskrit_deva: इति॒ वा इति॑ मे॒ मनो॒ गामश्वं॑ सनुया॒मिति॑ कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: íti vā́ íti me máno  gā́m áśvaṃ sanuyām íti  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: THIS, even this was my resolve, to win a cow, to win a steed: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वाता॑ इव॒ दोध॑त॒ उन्मा॑ पी॒ता अ॑यंसत कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: prá vā́tā iva dódhataḥ-  ún mā pītā́ ayaṃsata  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: Like violent gusts of wind the draughts that I have drunk have lifted me Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: उन्मा॑ पी॒ता अ॑यंसत॒ रथ॒मश्वा॑ इवा॒शवः॑ कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: ún mā pītā́ ayaṃsata  rátham áśvā ivāśávaḥ  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: The draughts I drank have borne me up, as fleet-foot horses draw a car: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ मा म॒तिर॑स्थित वा॒श्रा पु॒त्रमि॑व प्रि॒यम् कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: úpa mā matír asthita  vāśrā́ putrám iva priyám  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: The hymn hath reached me, like a cow who lows to meet her darling calf: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं तष्टे॑व व॒न्धुरं॒ पर्य॑चामि हृ॒दा म॒तिम् कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: aháṃ táṣṭeva vandhúram  páry acāmi hr̥dā́ matím  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: As a wright bends a chariot-seat so round my heart I bend the hymn: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि मे॑ अक्षि॒पच्च॒नाच्छा॑न्त्सुः॒ पञ्च॑ कृ॒ष्टयः॑ कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: nahí me akṣipác caná-  -áchāntsuḥ páñca kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: Not as a mote within the eye count the Five Tribes of men with me: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि मे॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे अ॒न्यं प॒क्षं च॒न प्रति॑ कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: nahí me ródasī ubhé  anyám pakṣáṃ caná práti  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: The heavens and earth themselves have not grown equal to one half of me Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि द्यां म॑हि॒ना भु॑वम॒भी॒३॒॑मां पृ॑थि॒वीं म॒हीम् कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: abhí dyā́m mahinā́ bhuvam  abhī̀mā́m pr̥thivī́m mahī́m  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: I in my grandeur have surpassed the heavens and all this spacious earth Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: हन्ता॒हं पृ॑थि॒वीमि॒मां नि द॑धानी॒ह वे॒ह वा॑ कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: hántāhám pr̥thivī́m imā́ṃ  ní dadhānīhá vehá vā  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: Aha! this spacious earth will I deposit either here or there Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ॒षमित्पृ॑थि॒वीम॒हं ज॒ङ्घना॑नी॒ह वे॒ह वा॑ कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: oṣám ít pr̥thivī́m aháṃ  jaṅghánānīhá vehá vā  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: In one short moment will I smite the earth in fury here or there: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वि मे॑ अ॒न्यः प॒क्षो॒३॒॑ऽधो अ॒न्यम॑चीकृषम् कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: diví me anyáḥ pakṣáḥ-  -adhó anyám acīkr̥ṣam  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: One of my flanks is in the sky; I let the other trail below: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हम॑स्मि महाम॒हो॑ऽभिन॒भ्यमुदी॑षितः कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: ahám asmi mahāmaháḥ-  -abhinabhyám údīṣitaḥ  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: I, greatest of the Mighty Ones, am lifted to the firmament: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: गृ॒हो या॒म्यरं॑कृतो दे॒वेभ्यो॑ हव्य॒वाह॑नः कु॒वित्सोम॒स्यापा॒मिति॑
verses.transliteration: gr̥hó yāmy áraṃkr̥to  devébhyo havyavā́hanaḥ  kuvít sómasyā́pām íti

translation.text: I seek the worshipper's abode; oblation-bearer to the Gods: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदिदा॑स॒ भुव॑नेषु॒ ज्येष्ठं॒ यतो॑ ज॒ज्ञ उ॒ग्रस्त्वे॒षनृ॑म्णः स॒द्यो ज॑ज्ञा॒नो नि रि॑णाति॒ शत्रू॒ननु॒ यं विश्वे॒ मद॒न्त्यूमाः॑
verses.transliteration: tád íd āsa bhúvaneṣu jyéṣṭhaṃ  yáto jajñá ugrás tveṣánr̥mṇaḥ  sadyó jajñānó ní riṇāti śátrūn  ánu yáṃ víśve mádanty ū́māḥ

translation.text: IN all the worlds That was the Best and Highest whence sprang the Mighty Gods, of splendid valour. As soon as born he overcomes his foemen, be in whom all who lend him aid are joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒वृ॒धा॒नः शव॑सा॒ भूर्यो॑जाः॒ शत्रु॑र्दा॒साय॑ भि॒यसं॑ दधाति अव्य॑नच्च व्य॒नच्च॒ सस्नि॒ सं ते॑ नवन्त॒ प्रभृ॑ता॒ मदे॑षु
verses.transliteration: vāvr̥dhānáḥ śávasā bhū́ryojāḥ  śátrur dāsā́ya bhiyásaṃ dadhāti  ávyanac ca vyanác ca sásni  sáṃ te navanta prábhr̥tā mádeṣu

translation.text: Grown mighty in his strength, with ample vigour, he as a foe strikes fear into the Dâsa, Eager to win the breathing and the breathless. All sang thy praise at banquet and oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे क्रतु॒मपि॑ वृञ्जन्ति॒ विश्वे॒ द्विर्यदे॒ते त्रिर्भव॒न्त्यूमाः॑ स्वा॒दोः स्वादी॑यः स्वा॒दुना॑ सृजा॒ सम॒दः सु मधु॒ मधु॑ना॒भि यो॑धीः
verses.transliteration: tvé krátum ápi vr̥ñjanti víśve  dvír yád eté trír bhávanty ū́māḥ  svādóḥ svā́dīyaḥ svādúnā sr̥jā sám  adáḥ sú mádhu mádhunābhí yodhīḥ

translation.text: All concentrate on thee their mental vigour, what time these, twice or thrice, are thine assistants. Blend what is sweeter than the sweet with sweetness: win. quickly with our meath that meath in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इति॑ चि॒द्धि त्वा॒ धना॒ जय॑न्तं॒ मदे॑मदे अनु॒मद॑न्ति॒ विप्राः॑ ओजी॑यो धृष्णो स्थि॒रमा त॑नुष्व॒ मा त्वा॑ दभन्यातु॒धाना॑ दु॒रेवाः॑
verses.transliteration: íti cid dhí tvā dhánā jáyantam  máde-made anumádanti víprāḥ  ójīyo dhr̥ṣṇo sthirám ā́ tanuṣva  mā́ tvā dabhan yātudhā́nā durévāḥ

translation.text: Therefore in thee too, thou who winnest riches, at every banquet are the sages joyful. With mightier power, Bold God, extend thy firmness: let not malignant Yatudhanas harm thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॑ व॒यं शा॑शद्महे॒ रणे॑षु प्र॒पश्य॑न्तो यु॒धेन्या॑नि॒ भूरि॑ चो॒दया॑मि त॒ आयु॑धा॒ वचो॑भिः॒ सं ते॑ शिशामि॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ वयां॑सि
verses.transliteration: tváyā vayáṃ śāśadmahe ráṇeṣu  prapáśyanto yudhényāni bhū́ri  codáyāmi ta ā́yudhā vácobhiḥ  sáṃ te śiśāmi bráhmaṇā váyāṃsi

translation.text: Proudly we put our trust in thee in battles, when we behold great wealth the prize of combat. I with my words impel thy weapons onward, and sharpen with my prayer thy vital vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒षेय्यं॑ पुरु॒वर्प॑स॒मृभ्व॑मि॒नत॑ममा॒प्त्यमा॒प्त्याना॑म् आ द॑र्षते॒ शव॑सा स॒प्त दानू॒न्प्र सा॑क्षते प्रति॒माना॑नि॒ भूरि॑
verses.transliteration: stuṣéyyam puruvárpasam ŕ̥bhvam  inátamam āptyám āptyā́nām  ā́ darṣate śávasā saptá dā́nūn  prá sākṣate pratimā́nāni bhū́ri

translation.text: Worthy of praises, many-shaped, most skilful, most energetic, Âptya of the Âptyas: He with his might destroys the seven Dânus, subduing many who were deemed his equals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि तद्द॑धि॒षेऽव॑रं॒ परं॑ च॒ यस्मि॒न्नावि॒थाव॑सा दुरो॒णे आ मा॒तरा॑ स्थापयसे जिग॒त्नू अत॑ इनोषि॒ कर्व॑रा पु॒रूणि॑
verses.transliteration: ní tád dadhiṣé 'varam páraṃ ca  yásminn ā́vithā́vasā duroṇé  ā́ mātárā sthāpayase jigatnū́  áta inoṣi kárvarā purū́ṇi

translation.text: Thou in that house which thy protection guardeth bestowest wealth, the higher and the lower. Thou stablishest the two much-wandering Mothers, and bringest many deeds to their completion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा ब्रह्म॑ बृ॒हद्दि॑वो विव॒क्तीन्द्रा॑य शू॒षम॑ग्रि॒यः स्व॒र्षाः म॒हो गो॒त्रस्य॑ क्षयति स्व॒राजो॒ दुर॑श्च॒ विश्वा॑ अवृणो॒दप॒ स्वाः
verses.transliteration: imā́ bráhma br̥háddivo vivakti-  -índrāya śūṣám agriyáḥ svarṣā́ḥ  mahó gotrásya kṣayati svarā́jo  dúraś ca víśvā avr̥ṇod ápa svā́ḥ

translation.text: Br̥ihaddiva, the foremost of light-winners, repeats these holy prayers, this strength of Indra. He rules the great self-luminous fold of cattle, and all the doors of light hath he thrown open.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा म॒हान्बृ॒हद्दि॑वो॒ अथ॒र्वावो॑च॒त्स्वां त॒न्व१॒॑मिन्द्र॑मे॒व स्वसा॑रो मात॒रिभ्व॑रीररि॒प्रा हि॒न्वन्ति॑ च॒ शव॑सा व॒र्धय॑न्ति च
verses.transliteration: evā́ mahā́n br̥háddivo átharvā-  -ávocat svā́ṃ tanvàm índram evá  svásāro mātaríbhvarīr ariprā́ḥ-  hinvánti ca śávasā vardháyanti ca

translation.text: Thus hath Br̥ihaddiva, the great Atharvan, spoken to Indra as himself in person. The spotless Sisters, they who are his Mothers, with power exalt him and impel him onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒र॒ण्य॒ग॒र्भः सम॑वर्त॒ताग्रे॑ भू॒तस्य॑ जा॒तः पति॒रेक॑ आसीत् स दा॑धार पृथि॒वीं द्यामु॒तेमां कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyagarbháḥ sám avartatā́gre  bhūtásya jātáḥ pátir éka āsīt  sá dādhāra pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m utémā́ṃ  kásmai devā́ya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: IN the beginning rose Hiranyagarbha, born Only Lord of all created beings. He fixed and holdeth up this earth and heaven. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: य आ॑त्म॒दा ब॑ल॒दा यस्य॒ विश्व॑ उ॒पास॑ते प्र॒शिषं॒ यस्य॑ दे॒वाः यस्य॑ छा॒यामृतं॒ यस्य॑ मृ॒त्युः कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: yá ātmadā́ baladā́ yásya víśve-  upā́sate praśíṣaṃ yásya devā́ḥ  yásya chāyā́mŕ̥taṃ yásya mr̥tyúḥ  kásmai devā́ya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: Giver of vital breath, of power and vigour, he whose commandments all the Gods acknowledge -. The Lord of death, whose shade is life immortal. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः प्रा॑ण॒तो नि॑मिष॒तो म॑हि॒त्वैक॒ इद्राजा॒ जग॑तो ब॒भूव॑ य ईशे॑ अ॒स्य द्वि॒पद॒श्चतु॑ष्पदः॒ कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: yáḥ prāṇató nimiṣató mahitvā́-  -éka íd rā́jā jágato babhū́va  yá ī́śe asyá dvipádaś cátuṣpadaḥ  kásmai devā́ya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: Who by his grandeur hath become Sole Ruler of all the moving world that breathes and slumbers; He who is Loord of men and Lord of cattle. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ये॒मे हि॒मव॑न्तो महि॒त्वा यस्य॑ समु॒द्रं र॒सया॑ स॒हाहुः यस्ये॒माः प्र॒दिशो॒ यस्य॑ बा॒हू कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: yásyemé himávanto mahitvā́  yásya samudráṃ rasáyā sahā́húḥ  yásyemā́ḥ pradíśo yásya bāhū́  kásmai devā́ya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: His, through his might, are these snow-covered mountains, and men call sea and Rasâ his possession: His arms are these, his are these heavenly regions. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: येन॒ द्यौरु॒ग्रा पृ॑थि॒वी च॑ दृ॒ळ्हा येन॒ स्वः॑ स्तभि॒तं येन॒ नाकः॑ यो अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ रज॑सो वि॒मानः॒ कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: yéna dyaúr ugrā́ pr̥thivī́ ca dr̥ḷhā́  yéna svà stabhitáṃ yéna nā́kaḥ  yó antárikṣe rájaso vimā́naḥ  kásmai devā́ya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: By him the heavens are strong and earth is stedfast, by him light's realm and sky-vault are supported: By him the regions in mid-air were measured. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं क्रन्द॑सी॒ अव॑सा तस्तभा॒ने अ॒भ्यैक्षे॑तां॒ मन॑सा॒ रेज॑माने यत्राधि॒ सूर॒ उदि॑तो वि॒भाति॒ कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: yáṃ krándasī ávasā tastabhāné  abhy aíkṣetām mánasā réjamāne  yátrā́dhi sū́ra údito vibhā́ti  kásmai devā́ya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: To him, supported by his help, two armies embattled look while trembling in their spirit, When over them the risen Sun is shining. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपो॑ ह॒ यद्बृ॑ह॒तीर्विश्व॒माय॒न्गर्भं॒ दधा॑ना ज॒नय॑न्तीर॒ग्निम् ततो॑ दे॒वानां॒ सम॑वर्त॒तासु॒रेकः॒ कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: ā́po ha yád br̥hatī́r víśvam ā́yan  gárbhaṃ dádhānā janáyantīr agním  táto devā́nāṃ sám avartatā́sur ékaḥ  kásmai devā́ya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: What time the mighty waters came, containing the universal germ, producing Agni, Thence sprang the Gods' one spirit into being. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यश्चि॒दापो॑ महि॒ना प॒र्यप॑श्य॒द्दक्षं॒ दधा॑ना ज॒नय॑न्तीर्य॒ज्ञम् यो दे॒वेष्वधि॑ दे॒व एक॒ आसी॒त्कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: yáś cid ā́po mahinā́ paryápaśyad  dákṣaṃ dádhānā janáyantīr yajñám  yó devéṣv ádhi devá éka ā́sīt  kásmai devā́ya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: He in his might surveyed the floods containing productive force and generating Worship. He is the God of gods, and none beside him. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ हिंसीज्जनि॒ता यः पृ॑थि॒व्या यो वा॒ दिवं॑ स॒त्यध॑र्मा ज॒जान॑ यश्चा॒पश्च॒न्द्रा बृ॑ह॒तीर्ज॒जान॒ कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: mā́ no hiṃsīj janitā́ yáḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  yó vā dívaṃ satyádharmā jajā́na  yáś cāpáś candrā́ br̥hatī́r jajā́na  kásmai devā́ya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: Neer may he harm us who is earth's Begetter, nor he whose laws are sure, the heavens' Creator, He who brought forth the great and lucid waters. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रजा॑पते॒ न त्वदे॒तान्य॒न्यो विश्वा॑ जा॒तानि॒ परि॒ ता ब॑भूव यत्का॑मास्ते जुहु॒मस्तन्नो॑ अस्तु व॒यं स्या॑म॒ पत॑यो रयी॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: prájāpate ná tvád etā́ny anyó  víśvā jātā́ni pári tā́ babhūva  yátkāmās te juhumás tán no astu  vayáṃ syāma pátayo rayīṇā́m

translation.text: Prajâpati! thou only comprehendest all these created things, and none beside thee. Grant us our hearts' desire when we invoke thee: may we have store of riches in possession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वसुं॒ न चि॒त्रम॑हसं गृणीषे वा॒मं शेव॒मति॑थिमद्विषे॒ण्यम् स रा॑सते शु॒रुधो॑ वि॒श्वधा॑यसो॒ऽग्निर्होता॑ गृ॒हप॑तिः सु॒वीर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: vásuṃ ná citrámahasaṃ gr̥ṇīṣe  vāmáṃ śévam átithim adviṣeṇyám  sá rāsate śurúdho viśvádhāyaso  -agnír hótā gr̥hápatiḥ suvī́ryam

translation.text: I PRAISE the God of wondrous might like Indra, the lovely pleasant Guest whom all must welcome. May Agni, Priest and Master of the household, give hero strength and all-sustaining riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जु॒षा॒णो अ॑ग्ने॒ प्रति॑ हर्य मे॒ वचो॒ विश्वा॑नि वि॒द्वान्व॒युना॑नि सुक्रतो घृत॑निर्णि॒ग्ब्रह्म॑णे गा॒तुमेर॑य॒ तव॑ दे॒वा अ॑जनय॒न्ननु॑ व्र॒तम्
verses.transliteration: juṣāṇó agne práti harya me váco  víśvāni vidvā́n vayúnāni sukrato  ghŕ̥tanirṇig bráhmaṇe gātúm éraya  táva devā́ ajanayann ánu vratám

translation.text: O Agni, graciously accept this song of mine, thou passing-wise who knowest every ordinance. Enwrapped in holy oil further the course of prayer: the Gods bestow according to thy holy law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त धामा॑नि परि॒यन्नम॑र्त्यो॒ दाश॑द्दा॒शुषे॑ सु॒कृते॑ मामहस्व सु॒वीरे॑ण र॒यिणा॑ग्ने स्वा॒भुवा॒ यस्त॒ आन॑ट् स॒मिधा॒ तं जु॑षस्व
verses.transliteration: saptá dhā́māni pariyánn ámartyo  dā́śad dāśúṣe sukŕ̥te māmahasva  suvī́reṇa rayíṇāgne svābhúvā  yás ta ā́naṭ samídhā táṃ juṣasva

translation.text: Immortal, wandering round the seven stations, give, a liberal Giver, to the pious worshipper, Wealth, Agni, with brave sons and ready for his use: welcome the man who comes with fuel unto thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुं प्र॑थ॒मं पु॒रोहि॑तं ह॒विष्म॑न्त ईळते स॒प्त वा॒जिन॑म् शृ॒ण्वन्त॑म॒ग्निं घृ॒तपृ॑ष्ठमु॒क्षणं॑ पृ॒णन्तं॑ दे॒वं पृ॑ण॒ते सु॒वीर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: yajñásya ketúm prathamám puróhitam  havíṣmanta īḷate saptá vājínam  śr̥ṇvántam agníṃ ghr̥tápr̥ṣṭham ukṣáṇam  pr̥ṇántaṃ devám pr̥ṇaté suvī́ryam

translation.text: The seven who bring oblations worship thee, the Strong, the first, the Great Chief Priest, Ensign of sacrifice, The oil-anointed Bull, Agni who hears, who sends as God full hero strength to him who freely gives.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं दू॒तः प्र॑थ॒मो वरे॑ण्यः॒ स हू॒यमा॑नो अ॒मृता॑य मत्स्व त्वां म॑र्जयन्म॒रुतो॑ दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हे त्वां स्तोमे॑भि॒र्भृग॑वो॒ वि रु॑रुचुः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ dūtáḥ prathamó váreṇyaḥ  sá hūyámāno amŕ̥tāya matsva  tvā́m marjayan marúto dāśúṣo gr̥hé  tvā́ṃ stómebhir bhŕ̥gavo ví rurucuḥ

translation.text: First messenger art thou, meet for election: drink thou thy fill invited to the Anirta, The Maruts in the votary's house adorned thee; with lauds the Bhr̥igus gave thee light and glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इषं॑ दु॒हन्त्सु॒दुघां॑ वि॒श्वधा॑यसं यज्ञ॒प्रिये॒ यज॑मानाय सुक्रतो अग्ने॑ घृ॒तस्नु॒स्त्रिर्ऋ॒तानि॒ दीद्य॑द्व॒र्तिर्य॒ज्ञं प॑रि॒यन्त्सु॑क्रतूयसे
verses.transliteration: íṣaṃ duhán sudúghāṃ viśvádhāyasaṃ  yajñapríye yájamānāya sukrato  ágne ghr̥tásnus trír r̥tā́ni dī́dyad  vartír yajñám pariyán sukratūyase

translation.text: Milking the teeming Cow for all-sustaining food. O Wise One, for the worship-loving worshipper, Thou, Agni, dropping oil, thrice lighting works of Law, showest thy wisdom circling home and sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामिद॒स्या उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु दू॒तं कृ॑ण्वा॒ना अ॑यजन्त॒ मानु॑षाः त्वां दे॒वा म॑ह॒याय्या॑य वावृधु॒राज्य॑मग्ने निमृ॒जन्तो॑ अध्व॒रे
verses.transliteration: tvā́m íd asyā́ uṣáso vyùṣṭiṣu  dūtáṃ kr̥ṇvānā́ ayajanta mā́nuṣāḥ  tvā́ṃ devā́ mahayā́yyāya vāvr̥dhur  ā́jyam agne nimr̥jánto adhvaré

translation.text: They who at flushing of this dawn appointed thee their messenger, these men have paid thee reverence. Gods strengthened thee for work that must be glorified, Agni, while they made butter pure for sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि त्वा॒ वसि॑ष्ठा अह्वन्त वा॒जिनं॑ गृ॒णन्तो॑ अग्ने वि॒दथे॑षु वे॒धसः॑ रा॒यस्पोषं॒ यज॑मानेषु धारय यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः
verses.transliteration: ní tvā vásiṣṭhā ahvanta vājínaṃ  gr̥ṇánto agne vidátheṣu vedhásaḥ  rāyás póṣaṃ yájamāneṣu dhāraya  yūyám pāta svastíbhiḥ sádā naḥ

translation.text: Arrangers in our synods, Agni, while they sang Vasisistha s sons have called thee down, the Potent One. Maintain the growth of wealth with men who sacrifice. Ye Gods, preserve us with your blessings evermore.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं वे॒नश्चो॑दय॒त्पृश्नि॑गर्भा॒ ज्योति॑र्जरायू॒ रज॑सो वि॒माने॑ इ॒मम॒पां सं॑ग॒मे सूर्य॑स्य॒ शिशुं॒ न विप्रा॑ म॒तिभी॑ रिहन्ति
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ venáś codayat pŕ̥śnigarbhāḥ-  jyótirjarāyū rájaso vimā́ne  imám apā́ṃ saṃgamé sū́ryasya  śíśuṃ ná víprā matíbhī rihanti

translation.text: SEE, Vena, born in light, hath driven hither, on chariot of the air, the Calves of Pr̥iṣni. Singers with hymns caress him as an infant there where the waters and the sunlight mingle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मु॒द्रादू॒र्मिमुदि॑यर्ति वे॒नो न॑भो॒जाः पृ॒ष्ठं ह॑र्य॒तस्य॑ दर्शि ऋ॒तस्य॒ साना॒वधि॑ वि॒ष्टपि॒ भ्राट् स॑मा॒नं योनि॑म॒भ्य॑नूषत॒ व्राः
verses.transliteration: samudrā́d ūrmím úd iyarti venó  nabhojā́ḥ pr̥ṣṭháṃ haryatásya darśi  r̥tásya sā́nāv ádhi viṣṭápi bhrā́ṭ  samānáṃ yónim abhy ànūṣata vrā́ḥ

translation.text: Vena draws up his wave from out the ocean. mist-born, the fair one's back is made apparent, Brightly he shone aloft on Order's summit: the hosts sang glory to their common birthplace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नं पू॒र्वीर॒भि वा॑वशा॒नास्तिष्ठ॑न्व॒त्सस्य॑ मा॒तरः॒ सनी॑ळाः ऋ॒तस्य॒ साना॒वधि॑ चक्रमा॒णा रि॒हन्ति॒ मध्वो॑ अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ वाणीः॑
verses.transliteration: samānám pūrvī́r abhí vāvaśānā́s  tíṣṭhan vatsásya mātáraḥ sánīḷāḥ  r̥tásya sā́nāv ádhi cakramāṇā́ḥ-  rihánti mádhvo amŕ̥tasya vā́ṇīḥ

translation.text: Full many, lowing to their joint-possession, dwelling together stood the Darling's Mothers. Ascending to the lofty height of Order, the bands of singers 'sip the sweets of Amrit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒नन्तो॑ रू॒पम॑कृपन्त॒ विप्रा॑ मृ॒गस्य॒ घोषं॑ महि॒षस्य॒ हि ग्मन् ऋ॒तेन॒ यन्तो॒ अधि॒ सिन्धु॑मस्थुर्वि॒दद्ग॑न्ध॒र्वो अ॒मृता॑नि॒ नाम॑
verses.transliteration: jānánto rūpám akr̥panta víprāḥ-  mr̥gásya ghóṣam mahiṣásya hí gmán  r̥téna yánto ádhi síndhum asthur  vidád gandharvó amŕ̥tāni nā́ma

translation.text: Knowing his form, the sages yearned to meet him: they have come nigh to hear the wild Bull's bellow. Performing sacrifice they reached the river: for the Gandharva found the immortal waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒प्स॒रा जा॒रमु॑पसिष्मिया॒णा योषा॑ बिभर्ति पर॒मे व्यो॑मन् चर॑त्प्रि॒यस्य॒ योनि॑षु प्रि॒यः सन्त्सीद॑त्प॒क्षे हि॑र॒ण्यये॒ स वे॒नः
verses.transliteration: apsarā́ jārám upasiṣmiyāṇā́  yóṣā bibharti paramé vyòman  cárat priyásya yóniṣu priyáḥ sán  sī́dat pakṣé hiraṇyáye sá venáḥ

translation.text: The Apsaras, the Lady, sweetly smiling, supports her Lover in sublimest heaven. In his Friend's dwelling as a Friend he wanders: he, Vena, rests him on his golden pinion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाके॑ सुप॒र्णमुप॒ यत्पत॑न्तं हृ॒दा वेन॑न्तो अ॒भ्यच॑क्षत त्वा हिर॑ण्यपक्षं॒ वरु॑णस्य दू॒तं य॒मस्य॒ योनौ॑ शकु॒नं भु॑र॒ण्युम्
verses.transliteration: nā́ke suparṇám úpa yát pátantaṃ  hr̥dā́ vénanto abhy ácakṣata tvā  híraṇyapakṣaṃ váruṇasya dūtáṃ  yamásya yónau śakunám bhuraṇyúm

translation.text: They gaze on thee with longing in their spirit, as on a strong-winged bird that mounteth sky-ward; On thee with wings of gold, Varuṇa's envoy, the Bird that hasteneth to the home of Yama.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वो ग॑न्ध॒र्वो अधि॒ नाके॑ अस्थात्प्र॒त्यङ्चि॒त्रा बिभ्र॑द॒स्यायु॑धानि वसा॑नो॒ अत्कं॑ सुर॒भिं दृ॒शे कं स्व१॒॑र्ण नाम॑ जनत प्रि॒याणि॑
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvó gandharvó ádhi nā́ke asthād  pratyáṅ citrā́ bíbhrad asyā́yudhāni  vásāno átkaṃ surabhíṃ dr̥śé káṃ  svàr ṇá nā́ma janata priyā́ṇi

translation.text: Erect, to heaven hath the Gandharva mounted, pointing at us his many-coloured weapons; Clad in sweet raiment beautiful to look on, for he, as light, produceth forms that please us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्र॒प्सः स॑मु॒द्रम॒भि यज्जिगा॑ति॒ पश्य॒न्गृध्र॑स्य॒ चक्ष॑सा॒ विध॑र्मन् भा॒नुः शु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषा॑ चका॒नस्तृ॒तीये॑ चक्रे॒ रज॑सि प्रि॒याणि॑
verses.transliteration: drapsáḥ samudrám abhí yáj jígāti  páśyan gŕ̥dhrasya cákṣasā vídharman  bhānúḥ śukréṇa śocíṣā cakānás  tr̥tī́ye cakre rájasi priyā́ṇi

translation.text: When as a spark he cometh near the ocean, still looking with a vulture's eye to heaven, His lustre, joying in its own bright splendour, maketh dear glories in the lowest region.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं नो॑ अग्न॒ उप॑ य॒ज्ञमेहि॒ पञ्च॑यामं त्रि॒वृतं॑ स॒प्तत॑न्तुम् असो॑ हव्य॒वाळु॒त नः॑ पुरो॒गा ज्योगे॒व दी॒र्घं तम॒ आश॑यिष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: imáṃ no agna úpa yajñám éhi  páñcayāmaṃ trivŕ̥taṃ saptátantum  áso havyavā́ḷ utá naḥ purogā́ḥ-  jyóg evá dīrgháṃ táma ā́śayiṣṭhāḥ

translation.text: COME to this sacrifice of ours, O Agni, threefold, with seven threads and five divisions. Be our oblation-bearer and preceder: thou hast lain long enough in during darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदे॑वाद्दे॒वः प्र॒चता॒ गुहा॒ यन्प्र॒पश्य॑मानो अमृत॒त्वमे॑मि शि॒वं यत्सन्त॒मशि॑वो॒ जहा॑मि॒ स्वात्स॒ख्यादर॑णीं॒ नाभि॑मेमि
verses.transliteration: ádevād deváḥ pracátā gúhā yán  prapáśyamāno amr̥tatvám emi  śiváṃ yát sántam áśivo jáhāmi  svā́t sakhyā́d áraṇīṃ nā́bhim emi

translation.text: I come a God foreseeing from the godless to immortality by secret pathways, While I, ungracious one, desert the gracious, leave mine own friends and seek the kin of strangers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पश्य॑न्न॒न्यस्या॒ अति॑थिं व॒याया॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ धाम॒ वि मि॑मे पु॒रूणि॑ शंसा॑मि पि॒त्रे असु॑राय॒ शेव॑मयज्ञि॒याद्य॒ज्ञियं॑ भा॒गमे॑मि
verses.transliteration: páśyann anyásyā átithiṃ vayā́yāḥ-  r̥tásya dhā́ma ví mime purū́ṇi  śáṃsāmi pitré ásurāya śévam  ayajñiyā́d yajñíyam bhāgám emi

translation.text: I, looking to the guest of other lineage, have founded many a rule of Law and Order. I bid farewell to the Great God, the Father, and, for neglect, obtain my share of worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब॒ह्वीः समा॑ अकरम॒न्तर॑स्मि॒न्निन्द्रं॑ वृणा॒नः पि॒तरं॑ जहामि अ॒ग्निः सोमो॒ वरु॑ण॒स्ते च्य॑वन्ते प॒र्याव॑र्द्रा॒ष्ट्रं तद॑वाम्या॒यन्
verses.transliteration: bahvī́ḥ sámā akaram antár asminn  índraṃ vr̥ṇānáḥ pitáraṃ jahāmi  agníḥ sómo váruṇas té cyavante  paryā́vard rāṣṭráṃ tád avāmy āyán

translation.text: I tarried many a year within this altar: I leave the Father, for my choice is Indra. Away pass Agni, Varuṇa and Soma. Rule ever changes: this I come to favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निर्मा॑या उ॒ त्ये असु॑रा अभूव॒न्त्वं च॑ मा वरुण का॒मया॑से ऋ॒तेन॑ राज॒न्ननृ॑तं विवि॒ञ्चन्मम॑ रा॒ष्ट्रस्याधि॑पत्य॒मेहि॑
verses.transliteration: nírmāyā u tyé ásurā abhūvan  tváṃ ca mā varuṇa kāmáyāse  r̥téna rājann ánr̥taṃ viviñcán  máma rāṣṭrásyā́dhipatyam éhi

translation.text: These Asuras have lost their powers of magic. But thou, O Varuṇa, if thou dost love me, O King, discerning truth and right from falsehood, come and be Lord and Ruler of my kingdom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं स्व॑रि॒दमिदा॑स वा॒मम॒यं प्र॑का॒श उ॒र्व१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षम् हना॑व वृ॒त्रं नि॒रेहि॑ सोम ह॒विष्ट्वा॒ सन्तं॑ ह॒विषा॑ यजाम
verses.transliteration: idáṃ svàr idám íd āsa vāmám  ayám prakāśá urv àntárikṣam  hánāva vr̥tráṃ niréhi soma  havíṣ ṭvā sántaṃ havíṣā yajāma

translation.text: Here is the light of heaven, here allis lovely; here there is radiance, here is air's wide region. Let us two slaughter Vr̥itra. Forth, O Soma! Thou art oblation: we therewith will serve thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒विः क॑वि॒त्वा दि॒वि रू॒पमास॑ज॒दप्र॑भूती॒ वरु॑णो॒ निर॒पः सृ॑जत् क्षेमं॑ कृण्वा॒ना जन॑यो॒ न सिन्ध॑व॒स्ता अ॑स्य॒ वर्णं॒ शुच॑यो भरिभ्रति
verses.transliteration: kavíḥ kavitvā́ diví rūpám ā́sajad  áprabhūtī váruṇo nír apáḥ sr̥jat  kṣémaṃ kr̥ṇvānā́ jánayo ná síndhavas  tā́ asya várṇaṃ śúcayo bharibhrati

translation.text: The Sage hath fixed his form by wisdom in the heavens: Varuṇa with no violence let the waters flow. Like women-folk, the floods that bring prosperity have eau lit his hue and colour as they gleamed and shone.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता अ॑स्य॒ ज्येष्ठ॑मिन्द्रि॒यं स॑चन्ते॒ ता ई॒मा क्षे॑ति स्व॒धया॒ मद॑न्तीः ता ईं॒ विशो॒ न राजा॑नं वृणा॒ना बी॑भ॒त्सुवो॒ अप॑ वृ॒त्राद॑तिष्ठन्
verses.transliteration: tā́ asya jyéṣṭham indriyáṃ sacante  tā́ īm ā́ kṣeti svadháyā mádantīḥ  tā́ īṃ víśo ná rā́jānaṃ vr̥ṇānā́ḥ-  bībhatsúvo ápa vr̥trā́d atiṣṭhan

translation.text: These wait upon his loftiest power and vigour: he dwells in these who triumph in their Godhead; And they, like people who elect their ruler, have in abhorrence turned away from Vr̥itra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बी॒भ॒त्सूनां॑ स॒युजं॑ हं॒समा॑हुर॒पां दि॒व्यानां॑ स॒ख्ये चर॑न्तम् अ॒नु॒ष्टुभ॒मनु॑ चर्चू॒र्यमा॑ण॒मिन्द्रं॒ नि चि॑क्युः क॒वयो॑ मनी॒षा
verses.transliteration: bībhatsū́nāṃ sayújaṃ haṃsám āhur  apā́ṃ divyā́nāṃ sakhyé cárantam  anuṣṭúbham ánu carcūryámāṇam  índraṃ ní cikyuḥ kaváyo manīṣā́

translation.text: They call him Swan, the abhorrent floods' Companion, moving in friendship with celestial Waters. The poets in their thought have looked on Indra swiftly approaching when Anushṭup calls him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं रु॒द्रेभि॒र्वसु॑भिश्चराम्य॒हमा॑दि॒त्यैरु॒त वि॒श्वदे॑वैः अ॒हं मि॒त्रावरु॑णो॒भा बि॑भर्म्य॒हमि॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी अ॒हम॒श्विनो॒भा
verses.transliteration: aháṃ rudrébhir vásubhiś carāmi-  ahám ādityaír utá viśvádevaiḥ  ahám mitrā́váruṇobhā́ bibharmi-  ahám indrāgnī́ ahám aśvínobhā́

translation.text: I TRAVEL with the Rudras and the Vasus, with the Âdityas and All-Gods I wander. I hold aloft both Varuṇa and Mitra, Indra and Agni, and the Pair of Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं सोम॑माह॒नसं॑ बिभर्म्य॒हं त्वष्टा॑रमु॒त पू॒षणं॒ भग॑म् अ॒हं द॑धामि॒ द्रवि॑णं ह॒विष्म॑ते सुप्रा॒व्ये॒३॒॑ यज॑मानाय सुन्व॒ते
verses.transliteration: aháṃ sómam āhanásam bibharmi-  aháṃ tváṣṭāram utá pūṣáṇam bhágam  aháṃ dadhāmi dráviṇaṃ havíṣmate  suprāvyè yájamānāya sunvaté

translation.text: I cherish and sustain high-swelling Soma, and Tvashṭar I support, Pûshan, and Bhaga. I load with wealth the zealous sdcrificer who pours the juice and offers his oblation

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं राष्ट्री॑ सं॒गम॑नी॒ वसू॑नां चिकि॒तुषी॑ प्रथ॒मा य॒ज्ञिया॑नाम् तां मा॑ दे॒वा व्य॑दधुः पुरु॒त्रा भूरि॑स्थात्रां॒ भूर्या॑वे॒शय॑न्तीम्
verses.transliteration: aháṃ rā́ṣṭrī saṃgámanī vásūnāṃ  cikitúṣī prathamā́ yajñíyānām  tā́m mā devā́ vy àdadhuḥ purutrā́  bhū́risthātrām bhū́ry āveśáyantīm

translation.text: I am the Queen, the gatherer-up of treasures, most thoughtful, first of those who merit worship. Thus Gods have stablished me in many places with many homes to enter and abide in.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मया॒ सो अन्न॑मत्ति॒ यो वि॒पश्य॑ति॒ यः प्राणि॑ति॒ य ईं॑ शृ॒णोत्यु॒क्तम् अ॒म॒न्तवो॒ मां त उप॑ क्षियन्ति श्रु॒धि श्रु॑त श्रद्धि॒वं ते॑ वदामि
verses.transliteration: máyā só ánnam atti yó vipáśyati  yáḥ prā́ṇiti yá īṃ śr̥ṇóty uktám  amantávo mā́ṃ tá úpa kṣiyanti  śrudhí śruta śraddhiváṃ te vadāmi

translation.text: Through me alone all eat the food that feeds them,– each man who sees, brewhes, hears the word outspoken They know it not, but yet they dwell beside me. Hear, one and all, the truth as I declare it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हमे॒व स्व॒यमि॒दं व॑दामि॒ जुष्टं॑ दे॒वेभि॑रु॒त मानु॑षेभिः यं का॒मये॒ तंत॑मु॒ग्रं कृ॑णोमि॒ तं ब्र॒ह्माणं॒ तमृषिं॒ तं सु॑मे॒धाम्
verses.transliteration: ahám evá svayám idáṃ vadāmi  júṣṭaṃ devébhir utá mā́nuṣebhiḥ  yáṃ kāmáye táṃ-tam ugráṃ kr̥ṇomi  tám brahmā́ṇaṃ tám ŕ̥ṣiṃ táṃ sumedhā́m

translation.text: I, verily, myself announce and utter the word that Gods and men alike shall welcome. I make the man I love exceeding mighty, make him a sage, a R̥ishi, and a Brahman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं रु॒द्राय॒ धनु॒रा त॑नोमि ब्रह्म॒द्विषे॒ शर॑वे॒ हन्त॒वा उ॑ अ॒हं जना॑य स॒मदं॑ कृणोम्य॒हं द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी आ वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: aháṃ rudrā́ya dhánur ā́ tanomi  brahmadvíṣe śárave hántavā́ u  aháṃ jánāya samádaṃ kr̥ṇomi-  aháṃ dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ā́ viveśa

translation.text: I bend the bow for Rudra that his arrow may strike and slay the hater of devotion. I rouse and order battle for the people, and I have penetrated Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं सु॑वे पि॒तर॑मस्य मू॒र्धन्मम॒ योनि॑र॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तः स॑मु॒द्रे ततो॒ वि ति॑ष्ठे॒ भुव॒नानु॒ विश्वो॒तामूं द्यां व॒र्ष्मणोप॑ स्पृशामि
verses.transliteration: aháṃ suve pitáram asya mūrdhán  máma yónir apsv àntáḥ samudré  táto ví tiṣṭhe bhúvanā́nu víśvā-  -utā́mū́ṃ dyā́ṃ varṣmáṇópa spr̥śāmi

translation.text: On the world's summit I bring forth the Father: my home is in the waters, in the ocean. Thence I extend o'er all existing creatures, and touch even yonder heaven with my forehead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हमे॒व वात॑ इव॒ प्र वा॑म्या॒रभ॑माणा॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ प॒रो दि॒वा प॒र ए॒ना पृ॑थि॒व्यैताव॑ती महि॒ना सं ब॑भूव
verses.transliteration: ahám evá vā́ta iva prá vāmi-  ārábhamāṇā bhúvanāni víśvā  paró divā́ pará enā́ pr̥thivyā́  -etā́vatī mahinā́ sám babhūva

translation.text: I breathe a strong breath like the wind and tempest, the while I hold together all existence. Beyond this wide earth and beyond the heavens I have become so mighty in my grandeur.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न तमंहो॒ न दु॑रि॒तं देवा॑सो अष्ट॒ मर्त्य॑म् स॒जोष॑सो॒ यम॑र्य॒मा मि॒त्रो नय॑न्ति॒ वरु॑णो॒ अति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: ná tám áṃho ná duritáṃ  dévāso aṣṭa mártyam  sajóṣaso yám aryamā́  mitró náyanti váruṇo  áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: No peril, no severe distress, ye Gods, affects the mortal man, Whom Aryaman and Mitra lead, and Varima, of one accord, beyond his foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्धि व॒यं वृ॑णी॒महे॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्रार्य॑मन् येना॒ निरंह॑सो यू॒यं पा॒थ ने॒था च॒ मर्त्य॒मति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: tád dhí vayáṃ vr̥ṇīmáhe  váruṇa mítrā́ryaman  yénā nír áṃhaso yūyám  pāthá nethā́ ca mártyam  áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: This very thing do we desire, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Whereby ye guhrd the mortal man from sore distress, and lead him safe beyond his foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते नू॒नं नो॒ऽयमू॒तये॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा नयि॑ष्ठा उ नो ने॒षणि॒ पर्षि॑ष्ठा उ नः प॒र्षण्यति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: té nūnáṃ no 'yám ūtáye  váruṇo mitró aryamā́  náyiṣṭhā u no neṣáṇi  párṣiṣṭhā u naḥ parṣáṇi-  áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: These are, each one, our present helps, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman. Best leaders, best deliverers to lead us on and bear as safe beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं विश्वं॒ परि॑ पाथ॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा यु॒ष्माकं॒ शर्म॑णि प्रि॒ये स्याम॑ सुप्रणीत॒योऽति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ víśvam pári pātha  váruṇo mitró aryamā́  yuṣmā́kaṃ śármaṇi priyé  syā́ma supraṇītayaḥ-  áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: Ye compass round and guard each man, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman: In your dear keeping may we be, ye who are excellent as guides beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दि॒त्यासो॒ अति॒ स्रिधो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा उ॒ग्रं म॒रुद्भी॑ रु॒द्रं हु॑वे॒मेन्द्र॑म॒ग्निं स्व॒स्तयेऽति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: ādityā́so áti srídho  váruṇo mitró aryamā́  ugrám marúdbhī rudráṃ huvema-  -índram agníṃ svastáye-  áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: Âdityas are beyond all foes,– Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman: Strong Rudra with the Marut host, Indra, Agni let us call for weal beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नेता॑र ऊ॒ षु ण॑स्ति॒रो वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा अति॒ विश्वा॑नि दुरि॒ता राजा॑नश्चर्षणी॒नामति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: nétāra ū ṣú ṇas tiró  váruṇo mitró aryamā́  áti víśvāni duritā́  rā́jānaś carṣaṇīnā́m  áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: These lead us safely over all, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, These who are Kings of living men, over all troubles far away beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नम॒स्मभ्य॑मू॒तये॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा शर्म॑ यच्छन्तु स॒प्रथ॑ आदि॒त्यासो॒ यदीम॑हे॒ अति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: śunám asmábhyam ūtáye  váruṇo mitró aryamā́  śárma yachantu saprátho  ādityā́so yád ī́mahe  áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: May they give bliss to aid us well, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman: May the Âdityas, when we pray, grant us wide shelter and defence beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ ह॒ त्यद्व॑सवो गौ॒र्यं॑ चित्प॒दि षि॒ताममु॑ञ्चता यजत्राः ए॒वो ष्व१॒॑स्मन्मु॑ञ्चता॒ व्यंहः॒ प्र ता॑र्यग्ने प्रत॒रं न॒ आयुः॑
verses.transliteration: yáthā ha tyád vasavo gauryàṃ cit  padí ṣitā́m ámuñcatā yajatrāḥ  evó ṣv àsmán muñcatā vy áṃhaḥ  prá tāry agne prataráṃ na ā́yuḥ

translation.text: As in this place, O Holy Ones, ye Vasus freed even the Gaud when her feet were fettered. So free us now from trouble and affliction: and let our life be lengthened still, O Api.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रात्री॒ व्य॑ख्यदाय॒ती पु॑रु॒त्रा दे॒व्य१॒॑क्षभिः॑ विश्वा॒ अधि॒ श्रियो॑ऽधित
verses.transliteration: rā́trī vy àkhyad āyatī́  purutrā́ devy àkṣábhiḥ  víśvā ádhi śríyo 'dhita

translation.text: WITH all her eyes the Goddess Night looks forth approaching many a spot: She hath put all her glories on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओर्व॑प्रा॒ अम॑र्त्या नि॒वतो॑ दे॒व्यु१॒॑द्वतः॑ ज्योति॑षा बाधते॒ तमः॑
verses.transliteration: órv àprā ámartyā  niváto devy ùdvátaḥ  jyótiṣā bādhate támaḥ

translation.text: Immortal. she hath filled the waste, the Goddess hath filled height and depth: She conquers darkness with her light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निरु॒ स्वसा॑रमस्कृतो॒षसं॑ दे॒व्या॑य॒ती अपेदु॑ हासते॒ तमः॑
verses.transliteration: nír u svásāram askr̥ta-  -uṣásaṃ devy ā̀yatī́  ápéd u hāsate támaḥ

translation.text: The Goddess as she comes hath set the Dawn her Sister in her place: And then the darkness vanishes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा नो॑ अ॒द्य यस्या॑ व॒यं नि ते॒ याम॒न्नवि॑क्ष्महि वृ॒क्षे न व॑स॒तिं वयः॑
verses.transliteration: sā́ no adyá yásyā vayáṃ  ní te yā́mann ávikṣmahi  vr̥kṣé ná vasatíṃ váyaḥ

translation.text: So favour us this night, O thou whose pathways we have visited As birds their nest upon the tree.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि ग्रामा॑सो अविक्षत॒ नि प॒द्वन्तो॒ नि प॒क्षिणः॑ नि श्ये॒नास॑श्चिद॒र्थिनः॑
verses.transliteration: ní grā́māso avikṣata  ní padvánto ní pakṣíṇaḥ  ní śyenā́saś cid arthínaḥ

translation.text: The villagers have sought their homes, and all that walks and all that flies, Even the falcons fain for prey.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या॒वया॑ वृ॒क्यं१॒॑ वृकं॑ य॒वय॑ स्ते॒नमू॑र्म्ये अथा॑ नः सु॒तरा॑ भव
verses.transliteration: yāváyā vr̥kyàṃ vŕ̥kaṃ  yaváya stenám ūrmye  áthā naḥ sutárā bhava

translation.text: Keep off the she-wolf and the wolf, O Urmya, keep the thief away; Easy be thou for us to pass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ मा॒ पेपि॑श॒त्तमः॑ कृ॒ष्णं व्य॑क्तमस्थित उष॑ ऋ॒णेव॑ यातय
verses.transliteration: úpa mā pépiśat támaḥ  kr̥ṣṇáṃ vyàktam asthita  úṣa r̥ṇéva yātaya

translation.text: Clearly hath she come nigh to me who decks the dark with richest hues: O Morning, cancel it like debts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ ते॒ गा इ॒वाक॑रं वृणी॒ष्व दु॑हितर्दिवः रात्रि॒ स्तोमं॒ न जि॒ग्युषे॑
verses.transliteration: úpa te gā́ ivā́karaṃ  vr̥ṇīṣvá duhitar divaḥ  rā́tri stómaṃ ná jigyúṣe

translation.text: These have I brought to thee like kine. O Night, thou Child of Heaven, accept This laud as for a conqueror.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ममा॑ग्ने॒ वर्चो॑ विह॒वेष्व॑स्तु व॒यं त्वेन्धा॑नास्त॒न्वं॑ पुषेम मह्यं॑ नमन्तां प्र॒दिश॒श्चत॑स्र॒स्त्वयाध्य॑क्षेण॒ पृत॑ना जयेम
verses.transliteration: mámāgne várco vihavéṣv astu  vayáṃ tvéndhānās tanvàm puṣema  máhyaṃ namantām pradíśaś cátasras  tváyā́dhyakṣeṇa pŕ̥tanā jayema

translation.text: LET me win glory, Agni, in our battles: enkindling thee, may we support our bodies. May the four regions bend and bow before me: with thee for guardian may we win in combat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मम॑ दे॒वा वि॑ह॒वे स॑न्तु॒ सर्व॒ इन्द्र॑वन्तो म॒रुतो॒ विष्णु॑र॒ग्निः ममा॒न्तरि॑क्षमु॒रुलो॑कमस्तु॒ मह्यं॒ वातः॑ पवतां॒ कामे॑ अ॒स्मिन्
verses.transliteration: máma devā́ vihavé santu sárve-  índravanto marúto víṣṇur agníḥ  mámāntárikṣam urúlokam astu  máhyaṃ vā́taḥ pavatāṃ kā́me asmín

translation.text: May all the Gods be on my side in battle, the Maruts led by Indra, Vishṇu, Agni. Mine be the middle air's extended region, ani may the wind blow favouring these my wishes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मयि॑ दे॒वा द्रवि॑ण॒मा य॑जन्तां॒ मय्या॒शीर॑स्तु॒ मयि॑ दे॒वहू॑तिः दैव्या॒ होता॑रो वनुषन्त॒ पूर्वेऽरि॑ष्टाः स्याम त॒न्वा॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: máyi devā́ dráviṇam ā́ yajantām  máyy āśī́r astu máyi deváhūtiḥ  daívyā hótāro vanuṣanta pū́rve-  -áriṣṭāḥ syāma tanvā̀ suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: May the Gods grant me riches; may the blessing and invocation of the Gods assist me. Foremost in fight be the divine Invokers: may we, unwounded, have brave heroes round us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मह्यं॑ यजन्तु॒ मम॒ यानि॑ ह॒व्याकू॑तिः स॒त्या मन॑सो मे अस्तु एनो॒ मा नि गां॑ कत॒मच्च॒नाहं विश्वे॑ देवासो॒ अधि॑ वोचता नः
verses.transliteration: máhyaṃ yajantu máma yā́ni havyā́-  -ā́kūtiḥ satyā́ mánaso me astu  éno mā́ ní gāṃ katamác canā́háṃ  víśve devāso ádhi vocatā naḥ

translation.text: For me let them present all mine oblations, and let my mind's intention be accomplished. May I he guiltless of the least transgression: and, all ye Go-is, do ye combine to bless us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: देवीः॑ षळुर्वीरु॒रु नः॑ कृणोत॒ विश्वे॑ देवास इ॒ह वी॑रयध्वम् मा हा॑स्महि प्र॒जया॒ मा त॒नूभि॒र्मा र॑धाम द्विष॒ते सो॑म राजन्
verses.transliteration: dévīḥ ṣaḷ urvīr urú naḥ kr̥ṇota  víśve devāsa ihá vīrayadhvam  mā́ hāsmahi prajáyā mā́ tanū́bhir  mā́ radhāma dviṣaté soma rājan

translation.text: Ye six divine Expanses, grant us freedom: here, all ye Gods, acquit yourselves like heroes. Let us not lose our children or our bodies: let us not benefit the foe, King Soma!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ म॒न्युं प्र॑तिनु॒दन्परे॑षा॒मद॑ब्धो गो॒पाः परि॑ पाहि न॒स्त्वम् प्र॒त्यञ्चो॑ यन्तु नि॒गुतः॒ पुन॒स्ते॒३॒॑ऽमैषां॑ चि॒त्तं प्र॒बुधां॒ वि ने॑शत्
verses.transliteration: ágne manyúm pratinudán páreṣām  ádabdho gopā́ḥ pári pāhi nas tvám  pratyáñco yantu nigútaḥ púnas té-  -amaíṣāṃ cittám prabúdhāṃ ví neśat

translation.text: Baffling the wrath of our opponents, Agni, guard us as our infallible Protector. Let these thy foes turn back and seek their houses, and let their thought who watch at home be ruined.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धा॒ता धा॑तॄ॒णां भुव॑नस्य॒ यस्पति॑र्दे॒वं त्रा॒तार॑मभिमातिषा॒हम् इ॒मं य॒ज्ञम॒श्विनो॒भा बृह॒स्पति॑र्दे॒वाः पा॑न्तु॒ यज॑मानं न्य॒र्थात्
verses.transliteration: dhātā́ dhātr̥̄ṇā́m bhúvanasya yás pátir  deváṃ trātā́ram abhimātiṣāhám  imáṃ yajñám aśvínobhā́ bŕ̥haspátir  devā́ḥ pāntu yájamānaṃ nyarthā́t

translation.text: Lord of the world, Creator of creators the saviour God who overcomes the foeman. May Gods, Br̥ihaspati, both Aṣvins shelter from ill thii sacrifice and sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रु॒व्यचा॑ नो महि॒षः शर्म॑ यंसद॒स्मिन्हवे॑ पुरुहू॒तः पु॑रु॒क्षुः स नः॑ प्र॒जायै॑ हर्यश्व मृळ॒येन्द्र॒ मा नो॑ रीरिषो॒ मा परा॑ दाः
verses.transliteration: uruvyácā no mahiṣáḥ śárma yaṃsad  asmín háve puruhūtáḥ purukṣúḥ  sá naḥ prajā́yai haryaśva mr̥ḷaya-  -índra mā́ no rīriṣo mā́ párā dāḥ

translation.text: Foodful, and much-invoked, at this our calling mty the great Bull vouchsafe us wide protection. Lord of Bay Coursers, Indra, blew our children: harm us not, give us riot as prey to others.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये नः॑ स॒पत्ना॒ अप॒ ते भ॑वन्त्विन्द्रा॒ग्निभ्या॒मव॑ बाधामहे॒ तान् वस॑वो रु॒द्रा आ॑दि॒त्या उ॑परि॒स्पृशं॑ मो॒ग्रं चेत्ता॑रमधिरा॒जम॑क्रन्
verses.transliteration: yé naḥ sapátnā ápa té bhavantu-  indrāgníbhyām áva bādhāmahe tā́n  vásavo rudrā́ ādityā́ uparispŕ̥śam mā-  -ugráṃ céttāram adhirājám akran

translation.text: Let those who are our foemen stay. afar from us: with Indra and with Agni we will drive them off. Vasus, Âdityas, Rudras have exalted me, made me far-reaching, inighty, thinker, sovran lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नास॑दासी॒न्नो सदा॑सीत्त॒दानीं॒ नासी॒द्रजो॒ नो व्यो॑मा प॒रो यत् किमाव॑रीवः॒ कुह॒ कस्य॒ शर्म॒न्नम्भः॒ किमा॑सी॒द्गह॑नं गभी॒रम्
verses.transliteration: nā́sad āsīn nó sád āsīt tadā́nīṃ  nā́sīd rájo nó vyòmā paró yát  kím ā́varīvaḥ kúha kásya śármann  ámbhaḥ kím āsīd gáhanaṃ gabhīrám

translation.text: THEN was not non-existent nor existent: there was no realm of air, no sky beyond it. What covered in, and where? and what gave shelter? Was water there, unfathomed depth of water?

verses.sanskrit_deva: न मृ॒त्युरा॑सीद॒मृतं॒ न तर्हि॒ न रात्र्या॒ अह्न॑ आसीत्प्रके॒तः आनी॑दवा॒तं स्व॒धया॒ तदेकं॒ तस्मा॑द्धा॒न्यन्न प॒रः किं च॒नास॑
verses.transliteration: ná mr̥tyúr āsīd amŕ̥taṃ ná tárhi  ná rā́tryā áhna āsīt praketáḥ  ā́nīd avātáṃ svadháyā tád ékaṃ  tásmād dhānyán ná paráḥ kíṃ canā́sa

translation.text: Death was not then, nor was there aught immortal: no sign was there, the day's and night's divider. That One Thing, breathless, breathed by its own nature: apart from it was nothing whatsoever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॑ आसी॒त्तम॑सा गू॒ळ्हमग्रे॑ऽप्रके॒तं स॑लि॒लं सर्व॑मा इ॒दम् तु॒च्छ्येना॒भ्वपि॑हितं॒ यदासी॒त्तप॑स॒स्तन्म॑हि॒नाजा॑य॒तैक॑म्
verses.transliteration: táma āsīt támasā gūḷhám ágre  -apraketáṃ saliláṃ sárvam ā idám  tuchyénābhv ápihitaṃ yád ā́sīt  tápasas tán mahinā́jāyataíkam

translation.text: Darkness there was: at first concealed in darknew this All was indiscriminated chaos. All that existed then was void and form less: by the great power of Warmth was born that Unit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: काम॒स्तदग्रे॒ सम॑वर्त॒ताधि॒ मन॑सो॒ रेतः॑ प्रथ॒मं यदासी॑त् स॒तो बन्धु॒मस॑ति॒ निर॑विन्दन्हृ॒दि प्र॒तीष्या॑ क॒वयो॑ मनी॒षा
verses.transliteration: kā́mas tád ágre sám avartatā́dhi  mánaso rétaḥ prathamáṃ yád ā́sīt  sató bándhum ásati nír avindan  hr̥dí pratī́ṣyā kaváyo manīṣā́

translation.text: Thereafter rose Desire in the beginning, Desire, the primal seed and germ of Spirit. Sages who searched with their heart's thought discovered the existent's kinship in the non-existent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒र॒श्चीनो॒ वित॑तो र॒श्मिरे॑षाम॒धः स्वि॑दा॒सी३दु॒परि॑ स्विदासी३त् रे॒तो॒धा आ॑सन्महि॒मान॑ आसन्त्स्व॒धा अ॒वस्ता॒त्प्रय॑तिः प॒रस्ता॑त्
verses.transliteration: tiraścī́no vítato raśmír eṣām  adháḥ svid āsī́3d upári svid āsī3t  retodhā́ āsan mahimā́na āsan  svadhā́ avástāt práyatiḥ parástāt

translation.text: Transversely was their severing line extended: what was above it then, and what below it? There were begetters, there were mighty forces, free action here and energy up yonder

verses.sanskrit_deva: को अ॒द्धा वे॑द॒ क इ॒ह प्र वो॑च॒त्कुत॒ आजा॑ता॒ कुत॑ इ॒यं विसृ॑ष्टिः अ॒र्वाग्दे॒वा अ॒स्य वि॒सर्ज॑ने॒नाथा॒ को वे॑द॒ यत॑ आब॒भूव॑
verses.transliteration: kó addhā́ veda ká ihá prá vocad  kúta ā́jātā kúta iyáṃ vísr̥ṣṭiḥ  arvā́g devā́ asyá visárjanena-  -áthā kó veda yáta ābabhū́va

translation.text: Who verily knows and who can here declare it, whence it was born and whence comes this creation? TheGods are later than this world's production. Who knows then whence it first came into being?

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं विसृ॑ष्टि॒र्यत॑ आब॒भूव॒ यदि॑ वा द॒धे यदि॑ वा॒ न यो अ॒स्याध्य॑क्षः पर॒मे व्यो॑म॒न्त्सो अ॒ङ्ग वे॑द॒ यदि॑ वा॒ न वेद॑
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ vísr̥ṣṭir yáta ābabhū́va  yádi vā dadhé yádi vā ná  yó asyā́dhyakṣaḥ paramé vyòman  só aṅgá veda yádi vā ná véda

translation.text: He, the first origin of this creation, whether he formed it all or did not form it, Whose eye controls this world in highest heaven, he verily knows it, or perhaps he knows not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो य॒ज्ञो वि॒श्वत॒स्तन्तु॑भिस्त॒त एक॑शतं देवक॒र्मेभि॒राय॑तः इ॒मे व॑यन्ति पि॒तरो॒ य आ॑य॒युः प्र व॒याप॑ व॒येत्या॑सते त॒ते
verses.transliteration: yó yajñó viśvátas tántubhis tatáḥ-  ékaśataṃ devakarmébhir ā́yataḥ  imé vayanti pitáro yá āyayúḥ  prá vayā́pa vayéty āsate taté

translation.text: THE sacrifice drawn out with threads on every side, stretched by a hundred sacred ministers and one,– This do these Fathers weave who hitherward are come: they sit beside the warp and cry, Weave forth, weave back.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुमाँ॑ एनं तनुत॒ उत्कृ॑णत्ति॒ पुमा॒न्वि त॑त्ने॒ अधि॒ नाके॑ अ॒स्मिन् इ॒मे म॒यूखा॒ उप॑ सेदुरू॒ सदः॒ सामा॑नि चक्रु॒स्तस॑रा॒ण्योत॑वे
verses.transliteration: púmām̐ enaṃ tanuta út kr̥ṇatti  púmān ví tatne ádhi nā́ke asmín  imé mayū́khā úpa sedur ū sádaḥ  sā́māni cakrus tásarāṇy ótave

translation.text: The Man extends it and the Man unbinds it: even to this vault of heaven hath he outspun, it. These pegs are fastened to the seat of worship: they made the Sâma-hymns their weaving shuttles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कासी॑त्प्र॒मा प्र॑ति॒मा किं नि॒दान॒माज्यं॒ किमा॑सीत्परि॒धिः क आ॑सीत् छन्दः॒ किमा॑सी॒त्प्रउ॑गं॒ किमु॒क्थं यद्दे॒वा दे॒वमय॑जन्त॒ विश्वे॑
verses.transliteration: kā́sīt pramā́ pratimā́ kíṃ nidā́nam  ā́jyaṃ kím āsīt paridhíḥ ká āsīt  chándaḥ kím āsīt prá:ugaṃ kím uktháṃ  yád devā́ devám áyajanta víśve

translation.text: What were the rule, the order and the model? What were the wooden fender and the butter? What were the hymn, the chant, the recitation, when to the God all Deities paid worship?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्नेर्गा॑य॒त्र्य॑भवत्स॒युग्वो॒ष्णिह॑या सवि॒ता सं ब॑भूव अ॒नु॒ष्टुभा॒ सोम॑ उ॒क्थैर्मह॑स्वा॒न्बृह॒स्पते॑र्बृह॒ती वाच॑मावत्
verses.transliteration: agnér gāyatry àbhavat sayúgvā-  -uṣṇíhayā savitā́ sám babhūva  anuṣṭúbhā sóma ukthaír máhasvān  bŕ̥haspáter br̥hatī́ vā́cam āvat

translation.text: Closely was Gâyatrî conjoined with Agni, and closely Savitar combined with Ushṇih. Brilliant with Ukthas, Soma joined Anushṭup: Br̥ihaspati's voice by Br̥ihatî was aided.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒राण्मि॒त्रावरु॑णयोरभि॒श्रीरिन्द्र॑स्य त्रि॒ष्टुबि॒ह भा॒गो अह्नः॑ विश्वा॑न्दे॒वाञ्जग॒त्या वि॑वेश॒ तेन॑ चाकॢप्र॒ ऋष॑यो मनु॒ष्याः॑
verses.transliteration: virā́ṇ mitrā́váruṇayor abhiśrī́r  índrasya triṣṭúb ihá bhāgó áhnaḥ  víśvān devā́ñ jágaty ā́ viveśa  téna cākl̥pra ŕ̥ṣayo manuṣyā̀ḥ

translation.text: Virâj adhered to Varuṇa and Mitra: here Trishṭup day by day was Indra's portion. Jagatî entered all the Gods together: so by this knowledge men were raised to R̥ishis.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चा॒कॢ॒प्रे तेन॒ ऋष॑यो मनु॒ष्या॑ य॒ज्ञे जा॒ते पि॒तरो॑ नः पुरा॒णे पश्य॑न्मन्ये॒ मन॑सा॒ चक्ष॑सा॒ तान्य इ॒मं य॒ज्ञमय॑जन्त॒ पूर्वे॑
verses.transliteration: cākl̥pré téna ŕ̥ṣayo manuṣyā̀ḥ-  yajñé jāté pitáro naḥ purāṇé  páśyan manye mánasā cákṣasā tā́n  yá imáṃ yajñám áyajanta pū́rve

translation.text: So by this knowledge men were raised to R̥ishis, when ancient sacrifice sprang up, our Fathers. With the mind's eye I think that I behold them who first performed this sacrificial worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्तो॑माः स॒हछ॑न्दस आ॒वृतः॑ स॒हप्र॑मा॒ ऋष॑यः स॒प्त दैव्याः॑ पूर्वे॑षां॒ पन्था॑मनु॒दृश्य॒ धीरा॑ अ॒न्वाले॑भिरे र॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ न र॒श्मीन्
verses.transliteration: sahástomāḥ saháchandasa āvŕ̥taḥ  sahápramā ŕ̥ṣayaḥ saptá daívyāḥ  pū́rveṣām pánthām anudŕ̥śya dhī́rāḥ-  anvā́lebhire rathyò ná raśmī́n

translation.text: They who were versed in ritual and metre, in hymns and rules, were the Seven Godlike R̥ishis. Viewing the path of those of old, the sages have taken up the reins like chariot-drivers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॒ प्राच॑ इन्द्र॒ विश्वाँ॑ अ॒मित्रा॒नपापा॑चो अभिभूते नुदस्व अपोदी॑चो॒ अप॑ शूराध॒राच॑ उ॒रौ यथा॒ तव॒ शर्म॒न्मदे॑म
verses.transliteration: ápa prā́ca indra víśvām̐ amítrān  ápā́pāco abhibhūte nudasva  ápódīco ápa śūrādharā́caḥ-  uraú yáthā táva śárman mádema

translation.text: DRIVE all our enemies away, O Indra, the western, mighty Conqueror, and the eastern. Hero, drive off our northem foes and southem, that we in thy wide shelter may be joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒विद॒ङ्ग यव॑मन्तो॒ यवं॑ चि॒द्यथा॒ दान्त्य॑नुपू॒र्वं वि॒यूय॑ इ॒हेहै॑षां कृणुहि॒ भोज॑नानि॒ ये ब॒र्हिषो॒ नमो॑वृक्तिं॒ न ज॒ग्मुः
verses.transliteration: kuvíd aṅgá yávamanto yávaṃ cid  yáthā dā́nty anupūrváṃ viyū́ya  ihéhaiṣāṃ kr̥ṇuhi bhójanāni  yé barhíṣo námovr̥ktiṃ ná jagmúḥ

translation.text: What then? As men whose fields are full of barley reap the ripe corn removing it in order, So bring the food of those men, bring it hither, who went not to prepare the grass for worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि स्थूर्यृ॑तु॒था या॒तमस्ति॒ नोत श्रवो॑ विविदे संग॒मेषु॑ ग॒व्यन्त॒ इन्द्रं॑ स॒ख्याय॒ विप्रा॑ अश्वा॒यन्तो॒ वृष॑णं वा॒जय॑न्तः
verses.transliteration: nahí sthū́ry r̥tuthā́ yātám ásti  nótá śrávo vivide saṃgaméṣu  gavyánta índraṃ sakhyā́ya víprāḥ-  aśvāyánto vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vājáyantaḥ

translation.text: Men come not with one horse at sacred seasons; thus they obtain no honour in assemblies. Sages desiring herds of kine and horses strengthen the mighty Indra for his friendship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं सु॒राम॑मश्विना॒ नमु॑चावासु॒रे सचा॑ वि॒पि॒पा॒ना शु॑भस्पती॒ इन्द्रं॒ कर्म॑स्वावतम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ surā́mam aśvinā  námucāv āsuré sácā  vipipānā́ śubhas patī  índraṃ kármasv āvatam

translation.text: Ye, Aṣvins, Lords of Splendour, drank full draughts of grateful Soma juice, And aided Indra in his work with Namuci of Asura birth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒त्रमि॑व पि॒तरा॑व॒श्विनो॒भेन्द्रा॒वथुः॒ काव्यै॑र्दं॒सना॑भिः यत्सु॒रामं॒ व्यपि॑बः॒ शची॑भिः॒ सर॑स्वती त्वा मघवन्नभिष्णक्
verses.transliteration: putrám iva pitárāv aśvínobhā́-  -índrāváthuḥ kā́vyair daṃsánābhiḥ  yát surā́maṃ vy ápibaḥ śácībhiḥ  sárasvatī tvā maghavann abhiṣṇak

translation.text: As parents aid a son, both Aṣvins, Indra, aided thee with their wondrous Powers and wisdom. When thou, with might. hadst drunk the draught that gladdens, Sarasvatî, O Maghavan, refreshed thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॑ सु॒त्रामा॒ स्ववाँ॒ अवो॑भिः सुमृळी॒को भ॑वतु वि॒श्ववे॑दाः बाध॑तां॒ द्वेषो॒ अभ॑यं कृणोतु सु॒वीर्य॑स्य॒ पत॑यः स्याम
verses.transliteration: índraḥ sutrā́mā svávām̐ ávobhiḥ  sumr̥ḷīkó bhavatu viśvávedāḥ  bā́dhatāṃ dvéṣo ábhayaṃ kr̥ṇotu  suvī́ryasya pátayaḥ syāma

translation.text: Indra is strong to save, rich in assistance may he, possessing all, be kind and gracious. May he disperse our foes and give us safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigou r.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्य॑ व॒यं सु॑म॒तौ य॒ज्ञिय॒स्यापि॑ भ॒द्रे सौ॑मन॒से स्या॑म स सु॒त्रामा॒ स्ववाँ॒ इन्द्रो॑ अ॒स्मे आ॒राच्चि॒द्द्वेषः॑ सनु॒तर्यु॑योतु
verses.transliteration: tásya vayáṃ sumataú yajñíyasya-  -ápi bhadré saumanasé syāma  sá sutrā́mā svávām̐ índro asmé  ārā́c cid dvéṣaḥ sanutár yuyotu

translation.text: May we enjoy his favour, his the Holy may we enjoy his blessed loving kindness. May this rich Indra, as our good Protector, drive off and keep afar all those who hate us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒जा॒नमिद्द्यौर्गू॒र्ताव॑सुरीजा॒नं भूमि॑र॒भि प्र॑भू॒षणि॑ ई॒जा॒नं दे॒वाव॒श्विना॑व॒भि सु॒म्नैर॑वर्धताम्
verses.transliteration: ījānám íd dyaúr gūrtā́vasur  ījānám bhū́mir abhí prabhūṣáṇi  ījānáṃ devā́v aśvínāv  abhí sumnaír avardhatām

translation.text: MAY Dyaus the Lord of lauded wealth, and Earth stand by the man who offers sacrifice, And may the Aṣvins, both the Gods, strengthen the worshipper with bliss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वां॑ मित्रावरुणा धार॒यत्क्षि॑ती सुषु॒म्नेषि॑त॒त्वता॑ यजामसि यु॒वोः क्रा॒णाय॑ स॒ख्यैर॒भि ष्या॑म र॒क्षसः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ vām mitrāvaruṇā dhārayátkṣitī  suṣumnéṣitatvátā yajāmasi  yuvóḥ krāṇā́ya sakhyaír  abhí ṣyāma rakṣásaḥ

translation.text: As such we honour you, Mitra and Varuṇa, with hasty zeal, most blest, you who sustain the folk. So may we, through your friendship for the worshipper, subdue the fiends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑ चि॒न्नु यद्दिधि॑षामहे वाम॒भि प्रि॒यं रेक्णः॒ पत्य॑मानाः द॒द्वाँ वा॒ यत्पुष्य॑ति॒ रेक्णः॒ सम्वा॑र॒न्नकि॑रस्य म॒घानि॑
verses.transliteration: ádhā cin nú yád dídhiṣāmahe vām  abhí priyáṃ rékṇaḥ pátyamānāḥ  dadvā́m̐ vā yát púṣyati rékṇaḥ  sám v āran nákir asya maghā́ni

translation.text: And when we seek to win your love and friendship, we.who have precious wealth in our possession, Or when the worshipper augments his riches let not his treasures be shut up

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒साव॒न्यो अ॑सुर सूयत॒ द्यौस्त्वं विश्वे॑षां वरुणासि॒ राजा॑ मू॒र्धा रथ॑स्य चाक॒न्नैताव॒तैन॑सान्तक॒ध्रुक्
verses.transliteration: asā́v anyó asura sūyata dyaús  tváṃ víśveṣāṃ varuṇāsi rā́jā  mūrdhā́ ráthasya cākan  naítā́vataínasāntakadhrúk

translation.text: That other, Asura! too was born of Heaven. thou art, O Varuṇa, the King of all men. The chariot's Lord was well content, forbearing to anger Death by sin so great. This sin hath Ṣakapûta here committed. Heroes who fled to their dear friend he slayeth, When the Steed bringeth down your grace and favour in bodies dear and worshipful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मिन्त्स्वे॒३॒॑तच्छक॑पूत॒ एनो॑ हि॒ते मि॒त्रे निग॑तान्हन्ति वी॒रान् अ॒वोर्वा॒ यद्धात्त॒नूष्ववः॑ प्रि॒यासु॑ य॒ज्ञिया॒स्वर्वा॑
verses.transliteration: asmín sv ètác chákapūta éno  hité mitré nígatān hanti vīrā́n  avór vā yád dhā́t tanū́ṣu-  ávaḥ priyā́su yajñíyāsv árvā

translation.text: This sin hath Ṣakapûta here committed. Heroes who fled to their dear friend he slayeth, When the Steed bringeth down your grace and favour in bodies dear and worshipful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वोर्हि मा॒तादि॑तिर्विचेतसा॒ द्यौर्न भूमिः॒ पय॑सा पुपू॒तनि॑ अव॑ प्रि॒या दि॑दिष्टन॒ सूरो॑ निनिक्त र॒श्मिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: yuvór hí mātā́ditir vicetasā  dyaúr ná bhū́miḥ páyasā pupūtáni  áva priyā́ didiṣṭana  sū́ro ninikta raśmíbhiḥ

translation.text: Your Mother Aditi, ye wise, was purified with water even as earth is purified from heaven. Show love and kindness here below: wash her in rays of heavenly light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं ह्य॑प्न॒राजा॒वसी॑दतं॒ तिष्ठ॒द्रथं॒ न धू॒र्षदं॑ वन॒र्षद॑म् ता नः॑ कणूक॒यन्ती॑र्नृ॒मेध॑स्तत्रे॒ अंह॑सः सु॒मेध॑स्तत्रे॒ अंह॑सः
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ hy àpnarā́jāv ásīdataṃ  tíṣṭhad ráthaṃ ná dhūrṣádaṃ vanarṣádam  tā́ naḥ kaṇūkayántīr  nr̥médhas tatre áṃhasaḥ  sumédhas tatre áṃhasaḥ

translation.text: Ye Twain have seated you as Lords of Wealth, as one who mounts a car to him who sits upon the pole, upon the wood. These our disheartened tribes Nr̥imedhas saved from woe, Sumedhas saved from Woe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रो ष्व॑स्मै पुरोर॒थमिन्द्रा॑य शू॒षम॑र्चत अ॒भीके॑ चिदु लोक॒कृत्सं॒गे स॒मत्सु॑ वृत्र॒हास्माकं॑ बोधि चोदि॒ता नभ॑न्तामन्य॒केषां॑ ज्या॒का अधि॒ धन्व॑सु
verses.transliteration: pró ṣv àsmai purorathám  índrāya śūṣám arcata  abhī́ke cid ulokakŕ̥t  saṃgé samátsu vr̥trahā́-  -asmā́kam bodhi coditā́  nábhantām anyakéṣāṃ  jyākā́ ádhi dhánvasu

translation.text: SING strength to Indra that shall set his chariot in the foremost place. Giver of room in closest fight, slayer of foes in shock of war, be thou our great encourager. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सिन्धूँ॒रवा॑सृजोऽध॒राचो॒ अह॒न्नहि॑म् अ॒श॒त्रुरि॑न्द्र जज्ञिषे॒ विश्वं॑ पुष्यसि॒ वार्यं॒ तं त्वा॒ परि॑ ष्वजामहे॒ नभ॑न्तामन्य॒केषां॑ ज्या॒का अधि॒ धन्व॑सु
verses.transliteration: tváṃ síndhūm̐r ávāsr̥jo  -adharā́co áhann áhim  aśatrúr indra jajñiṣe  víśvam puṣyasi vā́ryaṃ  táṃ tvā pári ṣvajāmahe  nábhantām anyakéṣāṃ  jyākā́ ádhi dhánvasu

translation.text: Thou didst destroy the Dragon: thou sentest the rivers down to earth. Foeless, O Indra, wast thou born. Thou tendest well each choicest thing. Therefore we draw us close to thee. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि षु विश्वा॒ अरा॑तयो॒ऽर्यो न॑शन्त नो॒ धियः॑ अस्ता॑सि॒ शत्र॑वे व॒धं यो न॑ इन्द्र॒ जिघां॑सति॒ या ते॑ रा॒तिर्द॒दिर्वसु॒ नभ॑न्तामन्य॒केषां॑ ज्या॒का अधि॒ धन्व॑सु
verses.transliteration: ví ṣú víśvā árātayo  -aryó naśanta no dhíyaḥ  ástāsi śátrave vadháṃ  yó na indra jíghāṃsati  yā́ te rātír dadír vásu  nábhantām anyakéṣāṃ  jyākā́ ádhi dhánvasu

translation.text: Destroyed be all malignities and all our enemy's designs. Thy bolt thou castest, at the foe, O Indra, who would srnite us dead: thy liberal bounty gives us wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो न॑ इन्द्रा॒भितो॒ जनो॑ वृका॒युरा॒दिदे॑शति अ॒ध॒स्प॒दं तमीं॑ कृधि विबा॒धो अ॑सि सास॒हिर्नभ॑न्तामन्य॒केषां॑ ज्या॒का अधि॒ धन्व॑सु
verses.transliteration: yó na indrābhíto jáno  vr̥kāyúr ādídeśati  adhaspadáṃ tám īṃ kr̥dhi  vibādhó asi sāsahír  nábhantām anyakéṣāṃ  jyākā́ ádhi dhánvasu

translation.text: The robber people round about, Indra, who watch and aim at us,– Trample them down beneath thy foot; a conquering scatterer art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो न॑ इन्द्राभि॒दास॑ति॒ सना॑भि॒र्यश्च॒ निष्ट्यः॑ अव॒ तस्य॒ बलं॑ तिर म॒हीव॒ द्यौरध॒ त्मना॒ नभ॑न्तामन्य॒केषां॑ ज्या॒का अधि॒ धन्व॑सु
verses.transliteration: yó na indrābhidā́sati  sánābhir yáś ca níṣṭyaḥ  áva tásya bálaṃ tira  mahī́va dyaúr ádha tmánā  nábhantām anyakéṣāṃ  jyākā́ ádhi dhánvasu

translation.text: Whoso assails us, Indra, be the man a stranger or akin, Bring down, thyself, his strength although it be as vast as are the heavens.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यमि॑न्द्र त्वा॒यवः॑ सखि॒त्वमा र॑भामहे ऋ॒तस्य॑ नः प॒था न॒याति॒ विश्वा॑नि दुरि॒ता नभ॑न्तामन्य॒केषां॑ ज्या॒का अधि॒ धन्व॑सु
verses.transliteration: vayám indra tvāyávo  sakhitvám ā́ rabhāmahe  r̥tásya naḥ pathā́ naya-  áti víśvāni duritā́  nábhantām anyakéṣāṃ  jyākā́ ádhi dhánvasu

translation.text: Close to thy friendship do we cling, O Indra, and depend, or, thee. Lead us beyond all pain and grief along the path of holy Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ सु त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ तां शि॑क्ष॒ या दोह॑ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे अच्छि॑द्रोध्नी पी॒पय॒द्यथा॑ नः स॒हस्र॑धारा॒ पय॑सा म॒ही गौः
verses.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ sú tvám indra tā́ṃ śikṣa  yā́ dóhate práti váraṃ jaritré  áchidrodhnī pīpáyad yáthā naḥ  sahásradhārā páyasā mahī́ gaúḥ

translation.text: Do thou bestow upon us her, O Indra, who yields according to the singer's longing, That the great Cow may, with exhaustless udder, pouring a thousand streams, give milk to feed us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भे यदि॑न्द्र॒ रोद॑सी आप॒प्राथो॒षा इ॑व म॒हान्तं॑ त्वा म॒हीनां॑ स॒म्राजं॑ चर्षणी॒नां दे॒वी जनि॑त्र्यजीजनद्भ॒द्रा जनि॑त्र्यजीजनत्
verses.transliteration: ubhé yád indra ródasī  āpaprā́thoṣā́ iva  mahā́ntaṃ tvā mahī́nāṃ  samrā́jaṃ carṣaṇīnā́m  devī́ jánitry ajījanad  bhadrā́ jánitry ajījanat

translation.text: As, like the Morning, thou hast filled, O Indra, both the earth and heaven. So as the Mighty One, great King of all the mighty world of men, the Goddess Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed Mother gave thee life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ स्म दुर्हणाय॒तो मर्त॑स्य तनुहि स्थि॒रम् अ॒ध॒स्प॒दं तमीं॑ कृधि॒ यो अ॒स्माँ आ॒दिदे॑शति दे॒वी जनि॑त्र्यजीजनद्भ॒द्रा जनि॑त्र्यजीजनत्
verses.transliteration: áva sma durhaṇāyató  mártasya tanuhi sthirám  adhaspadáṃ tám īṃ kr̥dhi  yó asmā́m̐ ādídeśati  devī́ jánitry ajījanad  bhadrā́ jánitry ajījanat
