translation.text: Relax that mortal's stubborn strength whose heart is bent on wickedness. Trample him down beneath thy feet who watches for and aims at us. The Goddess Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed Mother gave thee life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॒ त्या बृ॑ह॒तीरिषो॑ वि॒श्वश्च॑न्द्रा अमित्रहन् शची॑भिः शक्र धूनु॒हीन्द्र॒ विश्वा॑भिरू॒तिभि॑र्दे॒वी जनि॑त्र्यजीजनद्भ॒द्रा जनि॑त्र्यजीजनत्
verses.transliteration: áva tyā́ br̥hatī́r íṣo  viśváścandrā amitrahan  śácībhiḥ śakra dhūnuhi-  índra víśvābhir ūtíbhir  devī́ jánitry ajījanad  bhadrā́ jánitry ajījanat

translation.text: Shake down, O Slayer of the foe, those great all splendid enemies. With all thy powers, O Ṣakra, all thine helps, O Indra, shake them down:

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॒ यत्त्वं श॑तक्रत॒विन्द्र॒ विश्वा॑नि धूनु॒षे र॒यिं न सु॑न्व॒ते सचा॑ सह॒स्रिणी॑भिरू॒तिभि॑र्दे॒वी जनि॑त्र्यजीजनद्भ॒द्रा जनि॑त्र्यजीजनत्
verses.transliteration: áva yát tváṃ śatakratav  índra víśvāni dhūnuṣé  rayíṃ ná sunvaté sácā  sahasríṇībhir ūtíbhiḥ  devī́ jánitry ajījanad  bhadrā́ jánitry ajījanat

translation.text: As thou, O Ṣatakratu, thou, O Indrv, shakest all things down As wealth for him who sheds the juice, with thine assistance thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॒ स्वेदा॑ इवा॒भितो॒ विष्व॑क्पतन्तु दि॒द्यवः॑ दूर्वा॑या इव॒ तन्त॑वो॒ व्य१॒॑स्मदे॑तु दुर्म॒तिर्दे॒वी जनि॑त्र्यजीजनद्भ॒द्रा जनि॑त्र्यजीजनत्
verses.transliteration: áva svédā ivābhíto  víṣvak patantu didyávaḥ  dū́rvāyā iva tántavo  vy àsmád etu durmatír  devī́ jánitry ajījanad  bhadrā́ jánitry ajījanat

translation.text: Around, on every side like drops of sweat let lightning-flashes fall. Let all malevolence pass away from us like threads of Darva grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दी॒र्घं ह्य॑ङ्कु॒शं य॑था॒ शक्तिं॒ बिभ॑र्षि मन्तुमः पूर्वे॑ण मघवन्प॒दाजो व॒यां यथा॑ यमो दे॒वी जनि॑त्र्यजीजनद्भ॒द्रा जनि॑त्र्यजीजनत्
verses.transliteration: dīrgháṃ hy àṅkuśáṃ yathā  śáktim bíbharṣi mantumaḥ  pū́rveṇa maghavan padā́-  -ajó vayā́ṃ yáthā yamo  devī́ jánitry ajījanad  bhadrā́ jánitry ajījanat

translation.text: Thou bearest in thine hand a lance like a long hook, great Counsellor! As with his foremost foot a goat, draw down the branch, O Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नकि॑र्देवा मिनीमसि॒ नकि॒रा यो॑पयामसि मन्त्र॒श्रुत्यं॑ चरामसि प॒क्षेभि॑रपिक॒क्षेभि॒रत्रा॒भि सं र॑भामहे
verses.transliteration: nákir devā minīmasi  nákir ā́ yopayāmasi  mantraśrútyaṃ carāmasi  pakṣébhir apikakṣébhir  átrābhí sáṃ rabhāmahe

translation.text: Never, O Gods, do we offend, nor are we ever obstinate: we walk as holy texts command. Closely we clasp and cling to you, cling to your sides, beneath your arms.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मि॑न्वृ॒क्षे सु॑पला॒शे दे॒वैः स॒म्पिब॑ते य॒मः अत्रा॑ नो वि॒श्पतिः॑ पि॒ता पु॑रा॒णाँ अनु॑ वेनति
verses.transliteration: yásmin vr̥kṣé supalāśé  devaíḥ sampíbate yamáḥ  átrā no viśpátiḥ pitā́  purāṇā́m̐ ánu venati

translation.text: IN the Tree clothed with goodly leaves where Yama drinketh with the Gods, The Father, Master of the house, tendeth with love our ancient Sires.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रा॒णाँ अ॑नु॒वेन॑न्तं॒ चर॑न्तं पा॒पया॑मु॒या अ॒सू॒यन्न॒भ्य॑चाकशं॒ तस्मा॑ अस्पृहयं॒ पुनः॑
verses.transliteration: purāṇā́m̐ anuvénantaṃ  cárantam pāpáyāmuyā́  asūyánn abhy àcākaśaṃ  tásmā aspr̥hayam púnaḥ

translation.text: I looked reluctantly on him who cherishes those men of old, On him who treads that evil path, and then I yearned for this again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं कु॑मार॒ नवं॒ रथ॑मच॒क्रं मन॒साकृ॑णोः एके॑षं वि॒श्वतः॒ प्राञ्च॒मप॑श्य॒न्नधि॑ तिष्ठसि
verses.transliteration: yáṃ kumāra návaṃ rátham  acakrám mánasā́kr̥ṇoḥ  ékeṣaṃ viśvátaḥ prā́ñcam  ápaśyann ádhi tiṣṭhasi

translation.text: Thou mountest, though thou dost not see, O Child, the new and wheel-less car Which thou hast fashioned mentally, onepoled but turning every way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं कु॑मार॒ प्राव॑र्तयो॒ रथं॒ विप्रे॑भ्य॒स्परि॑ तं सामानु॒ प्राव॑र्तत॒ समि॒तो ना॒व्याहि॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yáṃ kumāra prā́vartayo  ráthaṃ víprebhyas pári  táṃ sā́mā́nu prā́vartata  sám itó nāvy ā́hitam

translation.text: The car which thou hast made to roll hitherward from the Sages, Child! This hath the Sâman followed close, hence, laid together on a ship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कः कु॑मा॒रम॑जनय॒द्रथं॒ को निर॑वर्तयत् कः स्वि॒त्तद॒द्य नो॑ ब्रूयादनु॒देयी॒ यथाभ॑वत्
verses.transliteration: káḥ kumārám ajanayad  ráthaṃ kó nír avartayat  káḥ svit tád adyá no brūyād  anudéyī yáthā́bhavat

translation.text: Who was the father of the child? Who made the chariot roll away? Who will this day declare to us how the funeral gift was made?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथाभ॑वदनु॒देयी॒ ततो॒ अग्र॑मजायत पु॒रस्ता॑द्बु॒ध्न आत॑तः प॒श्चान्नि॒रय॑णं कृ॒तम्
verses.transliteration: yáthā́bhavad anudéyī  táto ágram ajāyata  purástād budhná ā́tataḥ  paścā́n niráyaṇaṃ kr̥tám

translation.text: When the funeral gift was placed, straightway the point of flame appeared. A depth extended in the front: a passage out was made behind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं य॒मस्य॒ साद॑नं देवमा॒नं यदु॒च्यते॑ इ॒यम॑स्य धम्यते ना॒ळीर॒यं गी॒र्भिः परि॑ष्कृतः
verses.transliteration: idáṃ yamásya sā́danaṃ  devamānáṃ yád ucyáte  iyám asya dhamyate nāḷī́r  ayáṃ gīrbhíḥ páriṣkr̥taḥ

translation.text: Here is the seat where Yama dwells, that which is called the Home of Gods: Here minstrels blow the flute for him here he is glorified with songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: के॒श्य१॒॑ग्निं के॒शी वि॒षं के॒शी बि॑भर्ति॒ रोद॑सी के॒शी विश्वं॒ स्व॑र्दृ॒शे के॒शीदं ज्योति॑रुच्यते
verses.transliteration: keśy àgníṃ keśī́ viṣáṃ  keśī́ bibharti ródasī  keśī́ víśvaṃ svàr dr̥śé  keśī́dáṃ jyótir ucyate

translation.text: HE with the long loose locks supports Agni, and moisture, heaven, and earth: He is all sky to look upon: he with long hair is called this light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मुन॑यो॒ वात॑रशनाः पि॒शङ्गा॑ वसते॒ मला॑ वात॒स्यानु॒ ध्राजिं॑ यन्ति॒ यद्दे॒वासो॒ अवि॑क्षत
verses.transliteration: múnayo vā́taraśanāḥ  piśáṅgā vasate málā  vā́tasyā́nu dhrā́jiṃ yanti  yád devā́so ávikṣata

translation.text: The Munis, girdled with the wind, wear garments soiled of yellow hue. They, following the wind's swift course go where the Gods have gone before.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उन्म॑दिता॒ मौने॑येन॒ वाताँ॒ आ त॑स्थिमा व॒यम् शरी॒रेद॒स्माकं॑ यू॒यं मर्ता॑सो अ॒भि प॑श्यथ
verses.transliteration: únmaditā maúneyena  vā́tām̐ ā́ tasthimā vayám  śárīréd asmā́kaṃ yūyám  mártāso abhí paśyatha

translation.text: Transported with our Munihood we have pressed on into the winds: You therefore, mortal men. behold our natural bodies and no more.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्तरि॑क्षेण पतति॒ विश्वा॑ रू॒पाव॒चाक॑शत् मुनि॑र्दे॒वस्य॑देवस्य॒ सौकृ॑त्याय॒ सखा॑ हि॒तः
verses.transliteration: antárikṣeṇa patati  víśvā rūpā́vacā́kaśat  múnir devásya-devasya  saúkr̥tyāya sákhā hitáḥ

translation.text: The Muni, made associate in the holy work of every God, Looking upon all varied forms flies through the region of the air.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वात॒स्याश्वो॑ वा॒योः सखाथो॑ दे॒वेषि॑तो॒ मुनिः॑ उ॒भौ स॑मु॒द्रावा क्षे॑ति॒ यश्च॒ पूर्व॑ उ॒ताप॑रः
verses.transliteration: vā́tasyā́śvo vāyóḥ sákhā-  -átho devéṣito múniḥ  ubhaú samudrā́v ā́ kṣeti  yáś ca pū́rva utā́paraḥ

translation.text: The Steed of Vâta, Vâyu's friend, the Muni, by the Gods impelled, In both the oceans hath his home, in eastern and in western sea.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒प्स॒रसां॑ गन्ध॒र्वाणां॑ मृ॒गाणां॒ चर॑णे॒ चर॑न् के॒शी केत॑स्य वि॒द्वान्त्सखा॑ स्वा॒दुर्म॒दिन्त॑मः
verses.transliteration: apsarásāṃ gandharvā́ṇām  mr̥gā́ṇāṃ cáraṇe cáran  keśī́ kétasya vidvā́n  sákhā svādúr madíntamaḥ

translation.text: Treading the path of sylvan beasts, Gandharvas, and Apsarases, He with long locks, who knows the wish, is a sweet most delightful friend

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒युर॑स्मा॒ उपा॑मन्थत्पि॒नष्टि॑ स्मा कुनन्न॒मा के॒शी वि॒षस्य॒ पात्रे॑ण॒ यद्रु॒द्रेणापि॑बत्स॒ह
verses.transliteration: vāyúr asmā úpāmanthat  pináṣṭi smā kunannamā́  keśī́ viṣásya pā́treṇa  yád rudréṇā́pibat sahá

translation.text: Vâyu hath churned for him: for him he poundeth things most hard to bend, When he with long loose locks hath drunk, with Rudra, water from the cup.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त दे॑वा॒ अव॑हितं॒ देवा॒ उन्न॑यथा॒ पुनः॑ उ॒ताग॑श्च॒क्रुषं॑ देवा॒ देवा॑ जी॒वय॑था॒ पुनः॑
verses.transliteration: utá devā ávahitaṃ  dévā ún nayathā púnaḥ  utā́gaś cakrúṣaṃ devāḥ-  dévā jīváyathā púnaḥ

translation.text: YE Gods, raise up once more the man whom ye have humbled and brought low. O Gods, restore to life again the man who hath committed sin.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वावि॒मौ वातौ॑ वात॒ आ सिन्धो॒रा प॑रा॒वतः॑ दक्षं॑ ते अ॒न्य आ वा॑तु॒ परा॒न्यो वा॑तु॒ यद्रपः॑
verses.transliteration: dvā́v imaú vā́tau vātaḥ-  ā́ síndhor ā́ parāvátaḥ  dákṣaṃ te anyá ā́ vātu  párānyó vātu yád rápaḥ

translation.text: Two several winds are blowing here, from Sindhu, from a distant land. May one breathe energy to thee, the other blow disease away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वा॑त वाहि भेष॒जं वि वा॑त वाहि॒ यद्रपः॑ त्वं हि वि॒श्वभे॑षजो दे॒वानां॑ दू॒त ईय॑से
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāta vāhi bheṣajáṃ  ví vāta vāhi yád rápaḥ  tváṃ hí viśvábheṣajo  devā́nāṃ dūtá ī́yase

translation.text: Hither, O Wind, blow healing balm, blow all disease away, thou Wind; For thou who hast all medicine comest as envoy of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॑गमं॒ शंता॑तिभि॒रथो॑ अरि॒ष्टता॑तिभिः दक्षं॑ ते भ॒द्रमाभा॑र्षं॒ परा॒ यक्ष्मं॑ सुवामि ते
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvāgamaṃ śáṃtātibhir  átho ariṣṭátātibhiḥ  dákṣaṃ te bhadrám ā́bhārṣam  párā yákṣmaṃ suvāmi te

translation.text: I am come nigh to thee with balms to give thee rest and keep thee safe. I bring thee blessed strength, I drive thy weakening malady away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्राय॑न्तामि॒ह दे॒वास्त्राय॑तां म॒रुतां॑ ग॒णः त्राय॑न्तां॒ विश्वा॑ भू॒तानि॒ यथा॒यम॑र॒पा अस॑त्
verses.transliteration: trā́yantām ihá devā́s  trā́yatām marútāṃ gaṇáḥ  trā́yantāṃ víśvā bhūtā́ni  yáthāyám arapā́ ásat

translation.text: Here let the Gods deliver him, the Maruts' band deliver him: All things that be deliver him that he be freed from his disease.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आप॒ इद्वा उ॑ भेष॒जीरापो॑ अमीव॒चात॑नीः आपः॒ सर्व॑स्य भेष॒जीस्तास्ते॑ कृण्वन्तु भेष॒जम्
verses.transliteration: ā́pa íd vā́ u bheṣajī́r  ā́po amīvacā́tanīḥ  ā́paḥ sárvasya bheṣajī́s  tā́s te kr̥ṇvantu bheṣajám

translation.text: The Waters have their healing power, the Waters drive disease away. The Waters have a balm for all: let them make medicine for thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हस्ता॑भ्यां॒ दश॑शाखाभ्यां जि॒ह्वा वा॒चः पु॑रोग॒वी अ॒ना॒म॒यि॒त्नुभ्यां॑ त्वा॒ ताभ्यां॒ त्वोप॑ स्पृशामसि
verses.transliteration: hástābhyāṃ dáśaśākhābhyāṃ  jihvā́ vācáḥ purogavī́  anāmayitnúbhyāṃ tvā  tā́bhyāṃ tvópa spr̥śāmasi

translation.text: The tongue that leads the voice precedes. Then with our ten-fold branching hands, With these two chasers of disease we stroke thee with a gentle touch.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ त्य इ॑न्द्र स॒ख्येषु॒ वह्न॑य ऋ॒तं म॑न्वा॒ना व्य॑दर्दिरुर्व॒लम् यत्रा॑ दश॒स्यन्नु॒षसो॑ रि॒णन्न॒पः कुत्सा॑य॒ मन्म॑न्न॒ह्य॑श्च दं॒सयः॑
verses.transliteration: táva tyá indra sakhyéṣu váhnayaḥ-  r̥tám manvānā́ vy àdardirur valám  yátrā daśasyánn uṣáso riṇánn apáḥ  kútsāya mánmann ahyàś ca daṃsáyaḥ

translation.text: ALLIED with thee in friendship, Indra, these, thy priests, remembering Holy Law, rent Vr̥itra limb from limb, When they bestowed the Dawns and let the waters flow, and when thou didst chastise dragons at Kutsa's call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवा॑सृजः प्र॒स्वः॑ श्व॒ञ्चयो॑ गि॒रीनुदा॑ज उ॒स्रा अपि॑बो॒ मधु॑ प्रि॒यम् अव॑र्धयो व॒निनो॑ अस्य॒ दंस॑सा शु॒शोच॒ सूर्य॑ ऋ॒तजा॑तया गि॒रा
verses.transliteration: ávāsr̥jaḥ prasvàḥ śvañcáyo girī́n  úd āja usrā́ ápibo mádhu priyám  ávardhayo vaníno asya dáṃsasā  śuśóca sū́rya r̥tájātayā girā́

translation.text: Thou sentest forth productive powers, clavest the hills, thou dravest forth the kine, thou drankest pleasant meath. Thou gavest increase through this Tree's surpassing might. The Sun shone by the hymn that sprang from Holy Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि सूर्यो॒ मध्ये॑ अमुच॒द्रथं॑ दि॒वो वि॒दद्दा॒साय॑ प्रति॒मान॒मार्यः॑ दृ॒ळ्हानि॒ पिप्रो॒रसु॑रस्य मा॒यिन॒ इन्द्रो॒ व्या॑स्यच्चकृ॒वाँ ऋ॒जिश्व॑ना
verses.transliteration: ví sū́ryo mádhye amucad ráthaṃ divó  vidád dāsā́ya pratimā́nam ā́ryaḥ  dr̥ḷhā́ni pípror ásurasya māyínaḥ-  índro vy ā̀syac cakr̥vā́m̐ r̥jíśvanā

translation.text: In the mid-way of heaven the Sun unyoked his car: the Ârya found a match to meet his Dam foe. Associate with R̥ijiṣvan Indra overthrew the solid forts of Pipru, conjuring Asura.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अना॑धृष्टानि धृषि॒तो व्या॑स्यन्नि॒धीँरदे॑वाँ अमृणद॒यास्यः॑ मा॒सेव॒ सूर्यो॒ वसु॒ पुर्य॒मा द॑दे गृणा॒नः शत्रूँ॑रशृणाद्वि॒रुक्म॑ता
verses.transliteration: ánādhr̥ṣṭāni dhr̥ṣitó vy ā̀syat-  nidhī́m̐r ádevām̐ amr̥ṇad ayā́syaḥ  māséva sū́ryo vásu púryam ā́ dade  gr̥ṇānáḥ śátrūm̐r aśr̥ṇād virúkmatā

translation.text: He boldly cast down forts which none had e'er assailed: unwearied he destroycd the godless treasure-stores. Like Sun and Moon he took the stronghold's wealth away, and, praised in song, demolished foes with flashing dart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अयु॑द्धसेनो वि॒भ्वा॑ विभिन्द॒ता दाश॑द्वृत्र॒हा तुज्या॑नि तेजते इन्द्र॑स्य॒ वज्रा॑दबिभेदभि॒श्नथः॒ प्राक्रा॑मच्छु॒न्ध्यूरज॑हादु॒षा अनः॑
verses.transliteration: áyuddhaseno vibhvā̀ vibhindatā́  dā́śad vr̥trahā́ tújyāni tejate  índrasya vájrād abibhed abhiśnáthaḥ  prā́krāmac chundhyū́r ájahād uṣā́ ánaḥ

translation.text: Armed with resistless weapons, with vast power to cleave, the Vr̥itra-slayer whets his darts and deals fordi wounds. Bright Ushas was afraid of Indra's slaughtering bolt: she went upon her way and left her chariot there.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता त्या ते॒ श्रुत्या॑नि॒ केव॑ला॒ यदेक॒ एक॒मकृ॑णोरय॒ज्ञम् मा॒सां वि॒धान॑मदधा॒ अधि॒ द्यवि॒ त्वया॒ विभि॑न्नं भरति प्र॒धिं पि॒ता
verses.transliteration: etā́ tyā́ te śrútyāni kévalā  yád éka ékam ákr̥ṇor ayajñám  māsā́ṃ vidhā́nam adadhā ádhi dyávi  tváyā víbhinnam bharati pradhím pitā́

translation.text: These are thy famous exploits, only thine, when thou alone hast left the other reft of sacrifice. Thou in the heavens hast set the ordering of the Moons: the Father bears the felly portioned out by thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सूर्य॑रश्मि॒र्हरि॑केशः पु॒रस्ता॑त्सवि॒ता ज्योति॒रुद॑याँ॒ अज॑स्रम् तस्य॑ पू॒षा प्र॑स॒वे या॑ति वि॒द्वान्त्स॒म्पश्य॒न्विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि गो॒पाः
verses.transliteration: sū́ryaraśmir hárikeśaḥ purástāt  savitā́ jyótir úd ayām̐ ájasram  tásya pūṣā́ prasavé yāti vidvā́n  sampáśyan víśvā bhúvanāni gopā́ḥ

translation.text: SAVITAR, golden-haired, hath lifted eastward, bright With the sunbeams, his eternal lustre; He in whose energy wise Pûshan marches, surveying all existence like a herdsman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृ॒चक्षा॑ ए॒ष दि॒वो मध्य॑ आस्त आपप्रि॒वान्रोद॑सी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम् स वि॒श्वाची॑र॒भि च॑ष्टे घृ॒ताची॑रन्त॒रा पूर्व॒मप॑रं च के॒तुम्
verses.transliteration: nr̥cákṣā eṣá divó mádhya āste-  āpaprivā́n ródasī antárikṣam  sá viśvā́cīr abhí caṣṭe ghr̥tā́cīr  antarā́ pū́rvam áparaṃ ca ketúm

translation.text: Beholding men he sits amid the heaven filling the two world-halves and air's wide region. He looks upon the rich far-spreading pastures between the eastern and the western limit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रा॒यो बु॒ध्नः सं॒गम॑नो॒ वसू॑नां॒ विश्वा॑ रू॒पाभि च॑ष्टे॒ शची॑भिः दे॒व इ॑व सवि॒ता स॒त्यध॒र्मेन्द्रो॒ न त॑स्थौ सम॒रे धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: rāyó budhnáḥ saṃgámano vásūnāṃ  víśvā rūpā́bhí caṣṭe śácībhiḥ  devá iva savitā́ satyádharmā  -índro ná tasthau samaré dhánānām

translation.text: He, root of wealth, the gatherer-up of treasures, looks with his might on every form and figure. Savitar, like a God.whose Law is constant, stands in the battle for the spoil like Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्वाव॑सुं सोम गन्ध॒र्वमापो॑ ददृ॒शुषी॒स्तदृ॒तेना॒ व्या॑यन् तद॒न्ववै॒दिन्द्रो॑ रारहा॒ण आ॑सां॒ परि॒ सूर्य॑स्य परि॒धीँर॑पश्यत्
verses.transliteration: viśvā́vasuṃ soma gandharvám ā́po  dadr̥śúṣīs tád r̥ténā vy ā̀yan  tád anvávaid índro rārahāṇá āsām  pári sū́ryasya paridhī́m̐r apaśyat

translation.text: Waters from sacrifice came to the Gandharva Viṣvâvasu, O Soma, when they saw him. Indra, approaching quickly, marked their going, and looked around upon the Sun's enclosures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्वाव॑सुर॒भि तन्नो॑ गृणातु दि॒व्यो ग॑न्ध॒र्वो रज॑सो वि॒मानः॑ यद्वा॑ घा स॒त्यमु॒त यन्न वि॒द्म धियो॑ हिन्वा॒नो धिय॒ इन्नो॑ अव्याः
verses.transliteration: viśvā́vasur abhí tán no gr̥ṇātu  divyó gandharvó rájaso vimā́naḥ  yád vā ghā satyám utá yán ná vidmá  dhíyo hinvānó dhíya ín no avyāḥ

translation.text: This song Viṣvâvasu shall sing us, meter of air's mid-realm celestial Gandharva, That we may know aright both truth and falsehood: may he inspire our thoughts and help our praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सस्नि॑मविन्द॒च्चर॑णे न॒दीना॒मपा॑वृणो॒द्दुरो॒ अश्म॑व्रजानाम् प्रासां॑ गन्ध॒र्वो अ॒मृता॑नि वोच॒दिन्द्रो॒ दक्षं॒ परि॑ जानाद॒हीना॑म्
verses.transliteration: sásnim avindac cáraṇe nadī́nām  ápāvr̥ṇod dúro áśmavrajānām  prā́sāṃ gandharvó amŕ̥tāni vocad  índro dákṣam pári jānād ahī́nām

translation.text: In the floods' track he found the bootyseeker: the rocky cow-pen's doors he threw wide open. These, the Gandharva told him, Rowed with Amrit. Indra knew well the puissancc of the dragons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ तव॒ श्रवो॒ वयो॒ महि॑ भ्राजन्ते अ॒र्चयो॑ विभावसो बृह॑द्भानो॒ शव॑सा॒ वाज॑मु॒क्थ्यं१॒॑ दधा॑सि दा॒शुषे॑ कवे
verses.transliteration: ágne táva śrávo váyo  máhi bhrājante arcáyo vibhāvaso  bŕ̥hadbhāno śávasā vā́jam ukthyàṃ  dádhāsi dāśúṣe kave

translation.text: AGNI, life-power and fame are thine: thy fires blaze mightily, thou rich in wealth of beams! Sage, passing bright, thou givest to the worshipper, with strength, the food that merits laud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पा॒व॒कव॑र्चाः शु॒क्रव॑र्चा॒ अनू॑नवर्चा॒ उदि॑यर्षि भा॒नुना॑ पु॒त्रो मा॒तरा॑ वि॒चर॒न्नुपा॑वसि पृ॒णक्षि॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे
verses.transliteration: pāvakávarcāḥ śukrávarcāḥ-  ánūnavarcā úd iyarṣi bhānúnā  putró mātárā vicárann úpāvasi  pr̥ṇákṣi ródasī ubhé

translation.text: With brilliant, purifying sheen, with perfect sheen thou liftest up thyself in light. Thou, visiting both thy Mothers, aidest them as Son: thou joinest close the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊर्जो॑ नपाज्जातवेदः सुश॒स्तिभि॒र्मन्द॑स्व धी॒तिभि॑र्हि॒तः त्वे इषः॒ सं द॑धु॒र्भूरि॑वर्पसश्चि॒त्रोत॑यो वा॒मजा॑ताः
verses.transliteration: ū́rjo napāj jātavedaḥ suśastíbhir  mándasva dhītíbhir hitáḥ  tvé íṣaḥ sáṃ dadhur bhū́rivarpasaś  citrótayo vāmájātāḥ

translation.text: O Jâtavedas, Son of Strength, rejoice ihyself, gracious, in our fair hymns and songs. In thee are treasured various forms of strengthening food, born nobly and of wondrous help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒र॒ज्यन्न॑ग्ने प्रथयस्व ज॒न्तुभि॑र॒स्मे रायो॑ अमर्त्य स द॑र्श॒तस्य॒ वपु॑षो॒ वि रा॑जसि पृ॒णक्षि॑ सान॒सिं क्रतु॑म्
verses.transliteration: irajyánn agne prathayasva jantúbhir  asmé rā́yo amartya  sá darśatásya vápuṣo ví rājasi  pr̥ṇákṣi sānasíṃ krátum

translation.text: Agni, spread forth, as Ruler, over living things: give wealth to us, Immortal God. Thou shinest out from beauty fair to look upon: thou leadest us to conquering power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ष्क॒र्तार॑मध्व॒रस्य॒ प्रचे॑तसं॒ क्षय॑न्तं॒ राध॑सो म॒हः रा॒तिं वा॒मस्य॑ सु॒भगां॑ म॒हीमिषं॒ दधा॑सि सान॒सिं र॒यिम्
verses.transliteration: iṣkartā́ram adhvarásya prácetasaṃ  kṣáyantaṃ rā́dhaso maháḥ  rātíṃ vāmásya subhágām mahī́m íṣaṃ  dádhāsi sānasíṃ rayím

translation.text: To him, the wise, who orders sacrifice, who hath great riches un der his control, Thou givest blest award of good, and plenteous food, givest him wealth that conquers all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तावा॑नं महि॒षं वि॒श्वद॑र्शतम॒ग्निं सु॒म्नाय॑ दधिरे पु॒रो जनाः॑ श्रुत्क॑र्णं स॒प्रथ॑स्तमं त्वा गि॒रा दैव्यं॒ मानु॑षा यु॒गा
verses.transliteration: r̥tā́vānam mahiṣáṃ viśvádarśatam  agníṃ sumnā́ya dadhire puró jánāḥ-  śrútkarṇaṃ sapráthastamaṃ tvā girā́  daívyam mā́nuṣā yugā́

translation.text: The men have set before them them for their welfare Agni, strong, visible to all, the Holy. Thee, Godlike One, with ears to hear, most famous, men's generations magnify with praise-songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ अच्छा॑ वदे॒ह नः॑ प्र॒त्यङ्नः॑ सु॒मना॑ भव प्र नो॑ यच्छ विशस्पते धन॒दा अ॑सि न॒स्त्वम्
verses.transliteration: ágne áchā vadehá naḥ  pratyáṅ naḥ sumánā bhava  prá no yacha viśas pate  dhanadā́ asi nas tvám

translation.text: TURN hither, Agni, speak to us: come to us with a gracious mind. Enrich us, Master of the house: thou art the Giver of our wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नो॑ यच्छत्वर्य॒मा प्र भगः॒ प्र बृह॒स्पतिः॑ प्र दे॒वाः प्रोत सू॒नृता॑ रा॒यो दे॒वी द॑दातु नः
verses.transliteration: prá no yachatv aryamā́  prá bhágaḥ prá bŕ̥haspátiḥ  prá devā́ḥ prótá sūnŕ̥tā  rāyó devī́ dadātu naḥ

translation.text: Let Aryaman vouchsafe us wealth, and Bhaga, and Br̥ihaspati. Let the Gods give their gifts, and let Sûnr̥itâ, Goddess, grant us wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमं॒ राजा॑न॒मव॑से॒ऽग्निं गी॒र्भिर्ह॑वामहे आ॒दि॒त्यान्विष्णुं॒ सूर्यं॑ ब्र॒ह्माणं॑ च॒ बृह॒स्पति॑म्
verses.transliteration: sómaṃ rā́jānam ávase  agníṃ gīrbhír havāmahe  ādityā́n víṣṇuṃ sū́ryam  brahmā́ṇaṃ ca bŕ̥haspátim

translation.text: We call King Soma to our aid, and Agni with our songs and hymns, Âdityas, Vishṇu, Sûrya, and the Brahman Priest Br̥ihaspati.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒न्द्र॒वा॒यू बृह॒स्पतिं॑ सु॒हवे॒ह ह॑वामहे यथा॑ नः॒ सर्व॒ इज्जनः॒ संग॑त्यां सु॒मना॒ अस॑त्
verses.transliteration: indravāyū́ bŕ̥haspátim  suhávehá havāmahe  yáthā naḥ sárva íj jánaḥ  sáṃgatyāṃ sumánā ásat

translation.text: Indra, Vâyu, Br̥ihaspati, Gods swift to listen, we invoke, That in the synod all the folk may be benevolent to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्य॒मणं॒ बृह॒स्पति॒मिन्द्रं॒ दाना॑य चोदय वातं॒ विष्णुं॒ सर॑स्वतीं सवि॒तारं॑ च वा॒जिन॑म्
verses.transliteration: aryamáṇam bŕ̥haspátim  índraṃ dā́nāya codaya  vā́taṃ víṣṇuṃ sárasvatīṃ  savitā́raṃ ca vājínam

translation.text: Urge Aryaman to send us gifts, and Indra, and Br̥ihaspati, Vâta, Vishṇu, Sarasvatî and the Strong Courser Savitar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ अग्ने अ॒ग्निभि॒र्ब्रह्म॑ य॒ज्ञं च॑ वर्धय त्वं नो॑ दे॒वता॑तये रा॒यो दाना॑य चोदय
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no agne agníbhir  bráhma yajñáṃ ca vardhaya  tváṃ no devátātaye  rāyó dā́nāya codaya

translation.text: Do thou, O Agni, with thy fires strengthen our prayer and sacrifice: Urge givers to bestow their wealth to aid our service of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यम॑ग्ने जरि॒ता त्वे अ॑भू॒दपि॒ सह॑सः सूनो न॒ह्य१॒॑न्यदस्त्याप्य॑म् भ॒द्रं हि शर्म॑ त्रि॒वरू॑थ॒मस्ति॑ त आ॒रे हिंसा॑ना॒मप॑ दि॒द्युमा कृ॑धि
verses.transliteration: ayám agne jaritā́ tvé abhūd ápi  sáhasaḥ sūno nahy ànyád ásty ā́pyam  bhadráṃ hí śárma trivárūtham ásti te-  āré híṃsānām ápa didyúm ā́ kr̥dhi

translation.text: WITH thee, O Agni, was this singer of the laud: he hath no other kinship, O thou Son of Strength. Thou givest blessed shelter with a triple guard. Keep the destructive lightning far away from us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒वत्ते॑ अग्ने॒ जनि॑मा पितूय॒तः सा॒चीव॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒ न्यृ॑ञ्जसे प्र सप्त॑यः॒ प्र स॑निषन्त नो॒ धियः॑ पु॒रश्च॑रन्ति पशु॒पा इ॑व॒ त्मना॑
verses.transliteration: pravát te agne jánimā pitūyatáḥ  sācī́va víśvā bhúvanā ny r̥̀ñjase  prá sáptayaḥ prá saniṣanta no dhíyaḥ  puráś caranti paśupā́ iva tmánā

translation.text: Thy birth who seekest food is in the falling flood, Agni: as Comrade thou winnest all living things. Our coursers and our songs shall be victorious: they of themselves advance like one who guards the herd.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त वा उ॒ परि॑ वृणक्षि॒ बप्स॑द्ब॒होर॑ग्न॒ उल॑पस्य स्वधावः उ॒त खि॒ल्या उ॒र्वरा॑णां भवन्ति॒ मा ते॑ हे॒तिं तवि॑षीं चुक्रुधाम
verses.transliteration: utá vā́ u pári vr̥ṇakṣi bápsad  bahór agna úlapasya svadhāvaḥ  utá khilyā́ urvárāṇām bhavanti  mā́ te hetíṃ táviṣīṃ cukrudhāma

translation.text: And thou, O Agni, thou of Godlike nature, sparest the stones, while caring up the brushwood. Then are thy tracks like deserts in the corn-lands. Let us not stir to wrath thy mighty arrow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदु॒द्वतो॑ नि॒वतो॒ यासि॒ बप्स॒त्पृथ॑गेषि प्रग॒र्धिनी॑व॒ सेना॑ य॒दा ते॒ वातो॑ अनु॒वाति॑ शो॒चिर्वप्ते॑व॒ श्मश्रु॑ वपसि॒ प्र भूम॑
verses.transliteration: yád udváto niváto yā́si bápsat  pŕ̥thag eṣi pragardhínīva sénā  yadā́ te vā́to anuvā́ti śocír  vápteva śmáśru vapasi prá bhū́ma

translation.text: O'er hills through vales devouring as thou goest, thou partest like an army fain for booty As when a barber shaves a beard, thou shavest earth when the wind blows on thy flame and fans it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्य॑स्य॒ श्रेण॑यो ददृश्र॒ एकं॑ नि॒यानं॑ ब॒हवो॒ रथा॑सः बा॒हू यद॑ग्ने अनु॒मर्मृ॑जानो॒ न्य॑ङ्ङुत्ता॒नाम॒न्वेषि॒ भूमि॑म्
verses.transliteration: práty asya śréṇayo dadr̥śre-  ékaṃ niyā́nam bahávo ráthāsaḥ  bāhū́ yád agne anumármr̥jāno  nyàṅṅ uttānā́m anvéṣi bhū́mim

translation.text: Apparent are his lines as he approaches the course is single, but the cars are many, When, Agni, thou, making thine arms resplendent, advancest o'er the land spread out beneath thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ते॒ शुष्मा॑ जिहता॒मुत्ते॑ अ॒र्चिरुत्ते॑ अग्ने शशमा॒नस्य॒ वाजाः॑ उच्छ्व॑ञ्चस्व॒ नि न॑म॒ वर्ध॑मान॒ आ त्वा॒द्य विश्वे॒ वस॑वः सदन्तु
verses.transliteration: út te śúṣmā jihatām út te arcír  út te agne śaśamānásya vā́jāḥ  úc chvañcasva ní nama várdhamānaḥ-  ā́ tvādyá víśve vásavaḥ sadantu

translation.text: Now let thy strength, thy burning flames fly upward, thine energies, O Agni, as thou toilest. Gape widely, bend thee, waxing in thy vigour: let all the Vasus sit this day beside thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पामि॒दं न्यय॑नं समु॒द्रस्य॑ नि॒वेश॑नम् अ॒न्यं कृ॑णुष्वे॒तः पन्थां॒ तेन॑ याहि॒ वशाँ॒ अनु॑
verses.transliteration: apā́m idáṃ nyáyanaṃ  samudrásya nivéśanam  anyáṃ kr̥ṇuṣvetáḥ pánthāṃ  téna yāhi váśām̐ ánu

translation.text: This is the waters' reservoir, the great abode of gathered streams. Take thou another path than this, and as thou listest walk thereon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आय॑ने ते प॒राय॑णे॒ दूर्वा॑ रोहन्तु पु॒ष्पिणीः॑ ह्र॒दाश्च॑ पु॒ण्डरी॑काणि समु॒द्रस्य॑ गृ॒हा इ॒मे
verses.transliteration: ā́yane te parā́yaṇe  dū́rvā rohantu puṣpíṇīḥ  hradā́ś ca puṇḍárīkāṇi  samudrásya gr̥hā́ imé

translation.text: On thy way hitherward and hence let flowery Dûrva grass spring up Let there be lakes with lotus blooms. These are the mansions of the flood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्यं चि॒दत्रि॑मृत॒जुर॒मर्थ॒मश्वं॒ न यात॑वे क॒क्षीव॑न्तं॒ यदी॒ पुना॒ रथं॒ न कृ॑णु॒थो नव॑म्
verses.transliteration: tyáṃ cid átrim r̥tajúram  ártham áśvaṃ ná yā́tave  kakṣī́vantaṃ yádī púnar-  ráthaṃ ná kr̥ṇuthó návam

translation.text: YE made that Atri, worn with eld, free as a horse to win the goal. When ye restored to youth and strength Kakshîvân like a car renewed,

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्यं चि॒दश्वं॒ न वा॒जिन॑मरे॒णवो॒ यमत्न॑त दृ॒ळ्हं ग्र॒न्थिं न वि ष्य॑त॒मत्रिं॒ यवि॑ष्ठ॒मा रजः॑
verses.transliteration: tyáṃ cid áśvaṃ ná vājínam  areṇávo yám átnata  dr̥ḷháṃ granthíṃ ná ví ṣyatam  átriṃ yáviṣṭham ā́ rájaḥ

translation.text: Ye freed that Atri like a horse, and brought him newly-born to earth. Ye loosed him like a firm-tied knot which Gods unsoiled by dust had bound.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नरा॒ दंसि॑ष्ठा॒वत्र॑ये॒ शुभ्रा॒ सिषा॑सतं॒ धियः॑ अथा॒ हि वां॑ दि॒वो न॑रा॒ पुनः॒ स्तोमो॒ न वि॒शसे॑
verses.transliteration: nárā dáṃsiṣṭhav átraye  śúbhrā síṣāsataṃ dhíyaḥ  áthā hí vāṃ divó narā  púna stómo ná viśáse

translation.text: Heroes who showed most wondrous power to Atri, strive to win fair songs; For then, O Heroes of the sky, your hymn of praise shall cease no more.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चि॒ते तद्वां॑ सुराधसा रा॒तिः सु॑म॒तिर॑श्विना आ यन्नः॒ सद॑ने पृ॒थौ सम॑ने॒ पर्ष॑थो नरा
verses.transliteration: cité tád vāṃ surādhasā  rātíḥ sumatír aśvinā  ā́ yán naḥ sádane pr̥thaú  sámane párṣatho narā

translation.text: This claims your notice, Bounteous Gods! – oblation, Aṣvins! and our love, That ye, O Heroes, in the fight may bring us safe to ample room.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं भु॒ज्युं स॑मु॒द्र आ रज॑सः पा॒र ई॑ङ्खि॒तम् या॒तमच्छा॑ पत॒त्रिभि॒र्नास॑त्या सा॒तये॑ कृतम्
verses.transliteration: yuvám bhujyúṃ samudrá~ā́  rájasaḥ pārá īṅkhitám  yātám áchā patatríbhir  nā́satyā sātáye kr̥tam

translation.text: Ye Twain to Bhujyu tossed about in ocean at the region's end, Nâsatyas, with your winged sterds came nigh, and gave him strength to win.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॑ सु॒म्नैः शं॒यू इ॑व॒ मंहि॑ष्ठा॒ विश्व॑वेदसा सम॒स्मे भू॑षतं न॒रोत्सं॒ न पि॒प्युषी॒रिषः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ sumnaíḥ śamyū́ iva  máṃhiṣṭhā víśvavedasā  sám asmé bhūṣataṃ narā-  -útsaṃ ná pipyúṣīr íṣaḥ

translation.text: Come with your joys, most liberal Gods, Lords of all treasures, bringing weal. Like fresh full waters to a well, so, Heroes come and be with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं हि ते॒ अम॑र्त्य॒ इन्दु॒रत्यो॒ न पत्य॑ते दक्षो॑ वि॒श्वायु॑र्वे॒धसे॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ hí te ámartyaḥ-  índur átyo ná pátyate  dákṣo viśvā́yur vedháse

translation.text: THIS deathless Indu, like a steed, strong and of full vitality, Belongs to thee, the Orderer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यम॒स्मासु॒ काव्य॑ ऋ॒भुर्वज्रो॒ दास्व॑ते अ॒यं बि॑भर्त्यू॒र्ध्वकृ॑शनं॒ मद॑मृ॒भुर्न कृत्व्यं॒ मद॑म्
verses.transliteration: ayám asmā́su kā́vyaḥ-  r̥bhúr vájro dā́svate  ayám bibharty ūrdhvákr̥śanam mádam  r̥bhúr ná kŕ̥tvyam mádam

translation.text: Here, by us, for the worshipper, is the wise bolt that works with skill. It brings the bubbling beverage as a dexterous man brings the effectual strong drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृषुः॑ श्ये॒नाय॒ कृत्व॑न आ॒सु स्वासु॒ वंस॑गः अव॑ दीधेदही॒शुवः॑
verses.transliteration: ghŕ̥ṣuḥ śyenā́ya kŕ̥tvane-  āsú svā́su váṃsagaḥ  áva dīdhed ahīśúvaḥ

translation.text: Impetuous Ahîṣuva, a bull among cows of his, looked down upon the restless Hawk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं सु॑प॒र्णः प॑रा॒वतः॑ श्ये॒नस्य॑ पु॒त्र आभ॑रत् श॒तच॑क्रं॒ यो॒३॒॑ऽह्यो॑ वर्त॒निः
verses.transliteration: yáṃ suparṇáḥ parāvátaḥ  śyenásya putrá ā́bharat  śatácakraṃ yò 'hyò vartaníḥ

translation.text: That the strong-pinioned Bird hath brought, Child of the Falcon, from afar, What moves upon a hundred wheels along the female Dragon's path.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं ते॑ श्ये॒नश्चारु॑मवृ॒कं प॒दाभ॑रदरु॒णं मा॒नमन्ध॑सः ए॒ना वयो॒ वि ता॒र्यायु॑र्जी॒वस॑ ए॒ना जा॑गार ब॒न्धुता॑
verses.transliteration: yáṃ te śyenáś cā́rum avr̥kám padā́bharad  aruṇám mānám ándhasaḥ  enā́ váyo ví tāry ā́yur jīváse-  enā́ jāgāra bandhútā

translation.text: Which, fair, unrobbed, the Falcon brought thee in his foot, the red-hued dwelling of the juice; Through this came vital power which lengthens out our days, and kinship through its help awoke.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा तदिन्द्र॒ इन्दु॑ना दे॒वेषु॑ चिद्धारयाते॒ महि॒ त्यजः॑ क्रत्वा॒ वयो॒ वि ता॒र्यायुः॑ सुक्रतो॒ क्रत्वा॒यम॒स्मदा सु॒तः
verses.transliteration: evā́ tád índra índunā  devéṣu cid dhārayāte máhi tyájaḥ  krátvā váyo ví tāry ā́yuḥ sukrato  krátvāyám asmád ā́ sutáḥ

translation.text: So Indra is by lndu's power; e'en among Gods will it repel great treachery. Wisdom, Most Sapient One, brings force that lengthens life. May wisdom bring the juice to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां ख॑ना॒म्योष॑धिं वी॒रुधं॒ बल॑वत्तमाम् यया॑ स॒पत्नीं॒ बाध॑ते॒ यया॑ संवि॒न्दते॒ पति॑म्
verses.transliteration: imā́ṃ khanāmy óṣadhiṃ  vīrúdham bálavattamām  yáyā sapátnīm bā́dhate  yáyā saṃvindáte pátim

translation.text: FROM out the earth I dig this plant, a herb of most effectual power, Wherewith one quells the rival wife and gains the husband for oneself.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ता॑नपर्णे॒ सुभ॑गे॒ देव॑जूते॒ सह॑स्वति स॒पत्नीं॑ मे॒ परा॑ धम॒ पतिं॑ मे॒ केव॑लं कुरु
verses.transliteration: úttānaparṇe súbhage  dévajūte sáhasvati  sapátnīm me párā dhama  pátim me kévalaṃ kuru

translation.text: Auspicious, with expanded leaves, sent by the Gods, victorious plant, Blow thou the rival wife away, and make my husband only mine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्त॑रा॒हमु॑त्तर॒ उत्त॒रेदुत्त॑राभ्यः अथा॑ स॒पत्नी॒ या ममाध॑रा॒ साध॑राभ्यः
verses.transliteration: úttarāhám uttare-  úttaréd úttarābhyaḥ  áthā sapátnī yā́ máma-  -ádharā sā́dharābhyaḥ

translation.text: Stronger am I, O Stronger One, yea, mightier than the mightier; And she who is my rival wife is lower than the lowest dames.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒ह्य॑स्या॒ नाम॑ गृ॒भ्णामि॒ नो अ॒स्मिन्र॑मते॒ जने॑ परा॑मे॒व प॑रा॒वतं॑ स॒पत्नीं॑ गमयामसि
verses.transliteration: nahy àsyā nā́ma gr̥bhṇā́mi  nó asmín ramate jáne  párām evá parāvátaṃ  sapátnīṃ gamayāmasi

translation.text: Her very name I utter not: she takes no pleasure in this man. Far into distance most remote drive we the rival wife away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हम॑स्मि॒ सह॑मा॒नाथ॒ त्वम॑सि सास॒हिः उ॒भे सह॑स्वती भू॒त्वी स॒पत्नीं॑ मे सहावहै
verses.transliteration: ahám asmi sáhamānā-  -átha tvám asi sāsahíḥ  ubhé sáhasvatī bhūtvī́  sapátnīm me sahāvahai

translation.text: I am the conqueror, and thou, thou also act victorious: As victory attends us both we will subdue my fellow-wife.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ तेऽधां॒ सह॑मानाम॒भि त्वा॑धां॒ सही॑यसा मामनु॒ प्र ते॒ मनो॑ व॒त्सं गौरि॑व धावतु प॒था वारि॑व धावतु
verses.transliteration: úpa te 'dhāṃ sáhamānām  abhí tvādhāṃ sáhīyasā  mā́m ánu prá te máno  vatsáṃ gaúr iva dhāvatu  pathā́ vā́r iva dhāvatu

translation.text: I have gained thee for vanquisher, have grasped thee with a stronger spell. As a cow hastens to her calf, so let thy spirit speed te me, hasten like water on its way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर॑ण्या॒न्यर॑ण्यान्य॒सौ या प्रेव॒ नश्य॑सि क॒था ग्रामं॒ न पृ॑च्छसि॒ न त्वा॒ भीरि॑व विन्दती३ँ
verses.transliteration: áraṇyāny áraṇyāni-  asaú yā́ préva náśyasi  kathā́ grā́maṃ ná pr̥chasi  ná tvā bhī́r iva vindatī3m̐

translation.text: GODDESS of wild and forest who seemest to vanish from the sight. How is it that thou seekest not the village? Art thou not afraid?

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒षा॒र॒वाय॒ वद॑ते॒ यदु॒पाव॑ति चिच्चि॒कः आ॒घा॒टिभि॑रिव धा॒वय॑न्नरण्या॒निर्म॑हीयते
verses.transliteration: vr̥ṣāravā́ya vádate  yád upā́vati ciccikáḥ  āghāṭíbhir iva dhāváyann  araṇyānír mahīyate

translation.text: What time the grasshopper replies and swells the shrill cicala's voice, Seeming to sound with tinkling bells, the Lady of the Wood exults.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त गाव॑ इवादन्त्यु॒त वेश्मे॑व दृश्यते उ॒तो अ॑रण्या॒निः सा॒यं श॑क॒टीरि॑व सर्जति
verses.transliteration: utá gā́va ivādanti-  utá véśmeva dr̥śyate  utó araṇyāníḥ sāyáṃ  śakaṭī́r iva sarjati

translation.text: And, yonder, cattle seem to graze, what seems a dwelling-place appears: Or else at eve the Lady of the Forest seems to free the wains.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गाम॒ङ्गैष आ ह्व॑यति॒ दार्व॒ङ्गैषो अपा॑वधीत् वस॑न्नरण्या॒न्यां सा॒यमक्रु॑क्ष॒दिति॑ मन्यते
verses.transliteration: gā́m aṅgaíṣá ā́ hvayati  dā́rv aṅgaíṣó ápāvadhīt  vásann araṇyānyā́ṃ sāyám  ákrukṣad íti manyate

translation.text: Here one is calling to his cow, another there hath felled a tree: At eve the dweller in the wood fancies that somebody hath screamed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वा अ॑रण्या॒निर्ह॑न्त्य॒न्यश्चेन्नाभि॒गच्छ॑ति स्वा॒दोः फल॑स्य ज॒ग्ध्वाय॑ यथा॒कामं॒ नि प॑द्यते
verses.transliteration: ná vā́ araṇyānír hanti-  anyáś cén nā́bhigáchati  svādóḥ phálasya jagdhvā́ya  yathākā́maṃ ní padyate

translation.text: The Goddess never slays, unless some murderous enemy approach. Man eats of savoury fruit and then takes, even as he wills, his rest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आञ्ज॑नगन्धिं सुर॒भिं ब॑ह्व॒न्नामकृ॑षीवलाम् प्राहं मृ॒गाणां॑ मा॒तर॑मरण्या॒निम॑शंसिषम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ñjanagandhiṃ surabhím  bahvannā́m ákr̥ṣīvalām  prā́hám mr̥gā́ṇām mātáram  araṇyāním aśaṃsiṣam

translation.text: Now have I praised the Forest Queen, sweet-scented, redolent of balm, The Mother of all sylvan things, who tills not but hath stores of food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रत्ते॑ दधामि प्रथ॒माय॑ म॒न्यवेऽह॒न्यद्वृ॒त्रं नर्यं॑ वि॒वेर॒पः उ॒भे यत्त्वा॒ भव॑तो॒ रोद॑सी॒ अनु॒ रेज॑ते॒ शुष्मा॑त्पृथि॒वी चि॑दद्रिवः
verses.transliteration: śrát te dadhāmi prathamā́ya manyáve-  -áhan yád vr̥tráṃ náryaṃ vivér apáḥ  ubhé yát tvā bhávato ródasī ánu  réjate śúṣmāt pr̥thivī́ cid adrivaḥ

translation.text: I TRUST in thy first wrathful deed, O Indra, when thou slewest Vr̥itra and didst work to profit man; What time the two world-halves fell short of thee in might, and the earth trembled at thy force, O Thunder-anned.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं मा॒याभि॑रनवद्य मा॒यिनं॑ श्रवस्य॒ता मन॑सा वृ॒त्रम॑र्दयः त्वामिन्नरो॑ वृणते॒ गवि॑ष्टिषु॒ त्वां विश्वा॑सु॒ हव्या॒स्विष्टि॑षु
verses.transliteration: tvám māyā́bhir anavadya māyínaṃ  śravasyatā́ mánasā vr̥trám ardayaḥ  tvā́m ín náro vr̥ṇate gáviṣṭiṣu  tvā́ṃ víśvāsu hávyāsv íṣṭiṣu

translation.text: Thou with thy magic powers didst rend the conjurer Vr̥itra, O Blameless One, with heart that longed for fame. Heroes elect thee when they battle for the prey, thee in all sacrifices worthy of renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऐषु॑ चाकन्धि पुरुहूत सू॒रिषु॑ वृ॒धासो॒ ये म॑घवन्नान॒शुर्म॒घम् अर्च॑न्ति तो॒के तन॑ये॒ परि॑ष्टिषु मे॒धसा॑ता वा॒जिन॒मह्र॑ये॒ धने॑
verses.transliteration: aíṣu cākandhi puruhūta sūríṣu  vr̥dhā́so yé maghavann ānaśúr maghám  árcanti toké tánaye páriṣṭiṣu  medhásātā vājínam áhraye dháne

translation.text: God Much-invoked, take pleasure in these princes here, who, thine exalters, Maghavan, have come to wealth. In synods, when the rite succeeds, they hymn the Strong for sons and progeny and riches undisturbed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इन्नु रा॒यः सुभृ॑तस्य चाकन॒न्मदं॒ यो अ॑स्य॒ रंह्यं॒ चिके॑तति त्वावृ॑धो मघवन्दा॒श्व॑ध्वरो म॒क्षू स वाजं॑ भरते॒ धना॒ नृभिः॑
verses.transliteration: sá ín nú rāyáḥ súbhr̥tasya cākanat-  mádaṃ yó asya ráṃhyaṃ cíketati  tvā́vr̥dho maghavan dāśvàdhvaro  makṣū́ sá vā́jam bharate dhánā nŕ̥bhiḥ

translation.text: That man shall find delight in well-protected wealth whose care provides for him the quick-sought joyous draught. Bringing oblations, strengthened Maghavan, by thee, he swiftly wins the spoil with heroes in the fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं शर्धा॑य महि॒ना गृ॑णा॒न उ॒रु कृ॑धि मघवञ्छ॒ग्धि रा॒यः त्वं नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो॒ न मा॒यी पि॒त्वो न द॑स्म दयसे विभ॒क्ता
verses.transliteration: tváṃ śárdhāya mahinā́ gr̥ṇānáḥ-  urú kr̥dhi maghavañ chagdhí rāyáḥ  tváṃ no mitró váruṇo ná māyī́  pitvó ná dasma dayase vibhaktā́

translation.text: Now for our band, O Maghavan, when lauded, make ample room with might, and grant us riches. Magician thou, our Varuṇa and Mitra, deal food to us, O Wondrous, as Dispenser.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒ष्वा॒णास॑ इन्द्र स्तु॒मसि॑ त्वा सस॒वांस॑श्च तुविनृम्ण॒ वाज॑म् आ नो॑ भर सुवि॒तं यस्य॑ चा॒कन्त्मना॒ तना॑ सनुयाम॒ त्वोताः॑
verses.transliteration: suṣvāṇā́sa indra stumási tvā  sasavā́ṃsaś ca tuvinr̥mṇa vā́jam  ā́ no bhara suvitáṃ yásya cākán  tmánā tánā sanuyāma tvótāḥ

translation.text: WHEN we have pressed the juice we laud thee, Indra, and when, Most Valorous we have won the booty. Bring us prosperity, as each desires it under thine own protection may we conquer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒ष्वस्त्वमि॑न्द्र शूर जा॒तो दासी॒र्विशः॒ सूर्ये॑ण सह्याः गुहा॑ हि॒तं गुह्यं॑ गू॒ळ्हम॒प्सु बि॑भृ॒मसि॑ प्र॒स्रव॑णे॒ न सोम॑म्
verses.transliteration: r̥ṣvás tvám indra śūra jātó  dā́sīr víśaḥ sū́ryeṇa sahyāḥ  gúhā hitáṃ gúhyaṃ gūḷhám apsú-  bibhr̥mási prasrávaṇe ná sómam

translation.text: Sublime from birth, mayst thou O Indra, Hero, with Sûrya overcome the Dâsa races. As by a fountain's side, we bring the Soma that lay concealed, close-hidden in the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्यो वा॒ गिरो॑ अ॒भ्य॑र्च वि॒द्वानृषी॑णां॒ विप्रः॑ सुम॒तिं च॑का॒नः ते स्या॑म॒ ये र॒णय॑न्त॒ सोमै॑रे॒नोत तुभ्यं॑ रथोळ्ह भ॒क्षैः
verses.transliteration: aryó vā gíro abhy àrca vidvā́n  ŕ̥ṣīṇāṃ vípraḥ sumatíṃ cakānáḥ  té syāma yé raṇáyanta sómair  enótá túbhyaṃ rathoḷha bhakṣaíḥ

translation.text: Answer the votary's hymns, for these thou knowest, craving the R̥ishis' prayer, thyself a Singer May we be they who take delight in Somas: these with sweet food for thee, O Chariot-rider.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा ब्रह्मे॑न्द्र॒ तुभ्यं॑ शंसि॒ दा नृभ्यो॑ नृ॒णां शू॑र॒ शवः॑ तेभि॑र्भव॒ सक्र॑तु॒र्येषु॑ चा॒कन्नु॒त त्रा॑यस्व गृण॒त उ॒त स्तीन्
verses.transliteration: imā́ bráhmendra túbhyaṃ śaṃsi  dā́ nŕ̥bhyo nr̥ṇā́ṃ śūra śávaḥ  tébhir bhava sákratur yéṣu cākánn  utá trāyasva gr̥ṇatá utá stī́n

translation.text: These holy prayers, O Indra, have I sung thee: grant to the men the strength of men, thou Hero. Be of one mind with those in whom thou joyest: keep thou the singers safe and their companions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒धी हव॑मिन्द्र शूर॒ पृथ्या॑ उ॒त स्त॑वसे वे॒न्यस्या॒र्कैः आ यस्ते॒ योनिं॑ घृ॒तव॑न्त॒मस्वा॑रू॒र्मिर्न निम्नैर्द्र॑वयन्त॒ वक्वाः॑
verses.transliteration: śrudhī́ hávam indra śūra pŕ̥thyāḥ-  utá stavase venyásyārkaíḥ  ā́ yás te yóniṃ ghr̥távantam ásvār  ūrmír ná nímnaír dravayanta vákvāḥ

translation.text: Listen to Pr̥ithî's call, heroic Indra, and be thou lauded by the hymns of Venya, Him who hath sung thee to thine oil-rich dwelling, whose rolling songs have sped thee like a torrent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒वि॒ता य॒न्त्रैः पृ॑थि॒वीम॑रम्णादस्कम्भ॒ने स॑वि॒ता द्याम॑दृंहत् अश्व॑मिवाधुक्ष॒द्धुनि॑म॒न्तरि॑क्षम॒तूर्ते॑ ब॒द्धं स॑वि॒ता स॑मु॒द्रम्
verses.transliteration: savitā́ yantraíḥ pr̥thivī́m aramṇād  askambhané savitā́ dyā́m adr̥ṃhat  áśvam ivādhukṣad dhúnim antárikṣam  atū́rte baddháṃ savitā́ samudrám

translation.text: SAVITAR fixed the earth with bands to bind it, and made heaven stedfast where no prop supported. Savitar milked, as 'twere a restless courser, air, sea bound fast to what no foot had trodden.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्रा॑ समु॒द्रः स्क॑भि॒तो व्यौन॒दपां॑ नपात्सवि॒ता तस्य॑ वेद अतो॒ भूरत॑ आ॒ उत्थि॑तं॒ रजोऽतो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॑प्रथेताम्
verses.transliteration: yátrā samudrá skabhitó vy aúnad  ápāṃ napāt savitā́ tásya veda  áto bhū́r áta ā útthitaṃ rájaḥ-  -áto dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ aprathetām

translation.text: Well knoweth Savitar, O Child of Waters, where ocean, firmly fixt, o'erflowed its limit. Thence sprang the world, from that uprose the region: thence heaven spread out and the wide earth expanded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒श्चेदम॒न्यद॑भव॒द्यज॑त्र॒मम॑र्त्यस्य॒ भुव॑नस्य भू॒ना सु॒प॒र्णो अ॒ङ्ग स॑वि॒तुर्ग॒रुत्मा॒न्पूर्वो॑ जा॒तः स उ॑ अ॒स्यानु॒ धर्म॑
verses.transliteration: paścédám anyád abhavad yájatram  ámartyasya bhúvanasya bhūnā́  suparṇó aṅgá savitúr garútmān  pū́rvo jātáḥ sá u asyā́nu dhárma

translation.text: Then, with a full crowd of Immortal Beings, this other realm came later, high and holy. First, verily, Savitar's strong-pinioned Eagle was born: and he obeys his law for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गाव॑ इव॒ ग्रामं॒ यूयु॑धिरि॒वाश्वा॑न्वा॒श्रेव॑ व॒त्सं सु॒मना॒ दुहा॑ना पति॑रिव जा॒याम॒भि नो॒ न्ये॑तु ध॒र्ता दि॒वः स॑वि॒ता वि॒श्ववा॑रः
verses.transliteration: gā́va iva grā́maṃ yū́yudhir ivā́śvān  vāśréva vatsáṃ sumánā dúhānā  pátir iva jāyā́m abhí no ny ètu  dhartā́ diváḥ savitā́ viśvávāraḥ

translation.text: As warriors to their steeds, kine to their village, as fond milk giving cows approach their youngling, As man to wife, let Savitar come downward to us, heaven's bearer, Lord of every blessing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यस्तूपः सवित॒र्यथा॑ त्वाङ्गिर॒सो जु॒ह्वे वाजे॑ अ॒स्मिन् ए॒वा त्वार्च॒न्नव॑से॒ वन्द॑मानः॒ सोम॑स्येवां॒शुं प्रति॑ जागरा॒हम्
verses.transliteration: híraṇyastūpaḥ savitar yáthā tvā-  -āṅgirasó juhvé vā́je asmín  evā́ tvā́rcann ávase vándamānaḥ  sómasyevāṃśúm práti jāgarāhám

translation.text: Like the Ângirasa Hiraṇyastûpa, I call thee, Savitar, to this achievement: So worshipping and lauding thee for favour I watch for thee as for the stalk of Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑द्धश्चि॒त्समि॑ध्यसे दे॒वेभ्यो॑ हव्यवाहन आ॒दि॒त्यै रु॒द्रैर्वसु॑भिर्न॒ आ ग॑हि मृळी॒काय॑ न॒ आ ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: sámiddhaś cit sám idhyase  devébhyo havyavāhana  ādityaí rudraír vásubhir na ā́ gahi  mr̥ḷīkā́ya na ā́ gahi

translation.text: THOU, bearer of oblations, though kindled, art kindled for the Gods. With the Âdityas, Rudras, Vasus, come to us: to show us favour come to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं य॒ज्ञमि॒दं वचो॑ जुजुषा॒ण उ॒पाग॑हि मर्ता॑सस्त्वा समिधान हवामहे मृळी॒काय॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: imáṃ yajñám idáṃ vácaḥ  jujuṣāṇá upā́gahi  mártāsas tvā samidhāna havāmahe  mr̥ḷīkā́ya havāmahe

translation.text: Come hither and accept with joy this sacrifice and hymn of ours. O kindled God, we mortals are invoking thee, calling on thee to show us grace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामु॑ जा॒तवे॑दसं वि॒श्ववा॑रं गृणे धि॒या अग्ने॑ दे॒वाँ आ व॑ह नः प्रि॒यव्र॑तान्मृळी॒काय॑ प्रि॒यव्र॑तान्
verses.transliteration: tvā́m u jātávedasaṃ  viśvávāraṃ gr̥ṇe dhiyā́  ágne devā́m̐ ā́ vaha naḥ priyávratān  mr̥ḷīkā́ya priyávratān

translation.text: I laud thee Jâtavedas, thee Lord of all blessings, with my song. Agni, bring hitherward the Gods whose Laws we love, whose laws we love, to show us grace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्दे॒वो दे॒वाना॑मभवत्पु॒रोहि॑तो॒ऽग्निं म॑नु॒ष्या॒३॒॑ ऋष॑यः॒ समी॑धिरे अ॒ग्निं म॒हो धन॑साताव॒हं हु॑वे मृळी॒कं धन॑सातये
verses.transliteration: agnír devó devā́nām abhavat puróhito  -agním manuṣyā̀ ŕ̥ṣayaḥ sám īdhire  agním mahó dhánasātāv aháṃ huve  mr̥ḷīkáṃ dhánasātaye

translation.text: Agni the God was made the great High-Priest of Gods, R̥ishis have kindled Agni, men of mortal mould. Agni I invocate for winning ample wealth. kindly disposed for winning wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निरत्रिं॑ भ॒रद्वा॑जं॒ गवि॑ष्ठिरं॒ प्राव॑न्नः॒ कण्वं॑ त्र॒सद॑स्युमाह॒वे अ॒ग्निं वसि॑ष्ठो हवते पु॒रोहि॑तो मृळी॒काय॑ पु॒रोहि॑तः
verses.transliteration: agnír átrim bharádvājaṃ gáviṣṭhiram  prā́van naḥ káṇvaṃ trasádasyum āhavé  agníṃ vásiṣṭho havate puróhito  mr̥ḷīkā́ya puróhitaḥ

translation.text: Atri and Bharadvâja and Gavishṭhira, Kaṇva and Trasadasyu, in our fight he helped. On Agni calls Vasishṭha, even the household priest, the household priest to win his grace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्र॒द्धया॒ग्निः समि॑ध्यते श्र॒द्धया॑ हूयते ह॒विः श्र॒द्धां भग॑स्य मू॒र्धनि॒ वच॒सा वे॑दयामसि
verses.transliteration: śraddháyāgníḥ sám idhyate  śraddháyā hūyate havíḥ  śraddhā́m bhágasya mūrdháni  vácasā́ vedayāmasi

translation.text: By Faith is Agni kindled, through Faith is oblation offered up. We celebrate with praises Faith upon the height of happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रि॒यं श्र॑द्धे॒ दद॑तः प्रि॒यं श्र॑द्धे॒ दिदा॑सतः प्रि॒यं भो॒जेषु॒ यज्व॑स्वि॒दं म॑ उदि॒तं कृ॑धि
verses.transliteration: priyáṃ śraddhe dádataḥ  priyáṃ śraddhe dídāsataḥ  priyám bhojéṣu yájvasu-  idám ma uditáṃ kr̥dhi

translation.text: Bless thou the man who gives, O Faith; Faith, bless the man who fain would give. Bless thou the liberal worshippers: bless thou the word that I have said.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ दे॒वा असु॑रेषु श्र॒द्धामु॒ग्रेषु॑ चक्रि॒रे ए॒वं भो॒जेषु॒ यज्व॑स्व॒स्माक॑मुदि॒तं कृ॑धि
verses.transliteration: yáthā devā́ ásureṣu  śraddhā́m ugréṣu cakriré  evám bhojéṣu yájvasu-  asmā́kam uditáṃ kr̥dhi

translation.text: Even as the Deities maintained Faith in the mighty Asuras, So make this uttered wish of mine true for the liberal worshippers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्र॒द्धां दे॒वा यज॑माना वा॒युगो॑पा॒ उपा॑सते श्र॒द्धां हृ॑द॒य्य१॒॑याकू॑त्या श्र॒द्धया॑ विन्दते॒ वसु॑
verses.transliteration: śraddhā́ṃ devā́ yájamānāḥ-  vāyúgopā úpāsate  śraddhā́ṃ hr̥dayyàyā́kūtyā  śraddháyā vindate vásu

translation.text: Guarded by Vâyu, Gods and men who sacrifice draw near to Faith. Man winneth Faith by yearnings of the heart, and opulence by Faith.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्र॒द्धां प्रा॒तर्ह॑वामहे श्र॒द्धां म॒ध्यंदि॑नं॒ परि॑ श्र॒द्धां सूर्य॑स्य नि॒म्रुचि॒ श्रद्धे॒ श्रद्धा॑पये॒ह नः॑
verses.transliteration: śraddhā́m prātár havāmahe  śraddhā́m madhyáṃdinam pári  śraddhā́ṃ sū́ryasya nimrúci  śráddhe śrád dhāpayehá naḥ

translation.text: Faith in the early morning, Faith at noonday will we invocate, Faith at the setting of the Sun. O Faith, endow us with belief.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शा॒स इ॒त्था म॒हाँ अ॑स्यमित्रखा॒दो अद्भु॑तः न यस्य॑ ह॒न्यते॒ सखा॒ न जीय॑ते॒ कदा॑ च॒न
verses.transliteration: śāsá itthā́ mahā́m̐ asi-  amitrakhādó ádbhutaḥ  ná yásya hanyáte sákhā  ná jī́yate kádā caná

translation.text: A MIGHTY Governor art thou, Wondrous, Destroyer of the foe, Whose friend is never done to death, and never, never overcome.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्ति॒दा वि॒शस्पति॑र्वृत्र॒हा वि॑मृ॒धो व॒शी वृषेन्द्रः॑ पु॒र ए॑तु नः सोम॒पा अ॑भयंक॒रः
verses.transliteration: svastidā́ viśás pátir  vr̥trahā́ vimr̥dhó vaśī́  vŕ̥ṣéndraḥ purá etu naḥ  somapā́ abhayaṃkaráḥ

translation.text: Lord of the clan, who brings us bliss, Strong, Warrior, Slayer of the fiend, May India, Soma-drinker, go before us, Bull who gives us peace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि रक्षो॒ वि मृधो॑ जहि॒ वि वृ॒त्रस्य॒ हनू॑ रुज वि म॒न्युमि॑न्द्र वृत्रहन्न॒मित्र॑स्याभि॒दास॑तः
verses.transliteration: ví rákṣo ví mŕ̥dho jahi  ví vr̥trásya hánū ruja  ví manyúm indra vr̥trahann  amítrasyābhidā́sataḥ

translation.text: Drive Raksasas and foes away, break thou in pieces Vr̥itra'sjaws: O Vr̥itra-slaying Indra, quell the foeman's wrath who threatens us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि न॑ इन्द्र॒ मृधो॑ जहि नी॒चा य॑च्छ पृतन्य॒तः यो अ॒स्माँ अ॑भि॒दास॒त्यध॑रं गमया॒ तमः॑
verses.transliteration: ví na indra mŕ̥dho jahi  nīcā́ yacha pr̥tanyatáḥ  yó asmā́m̐ abhidā́sati  ádharaṃ gamayā támaḥ

translation.text: O Indra, beat our foes away, humble the men who challenge us: Send down to nether darkness him who seeks to do us injury.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपे॑न्द्र द्विष॒तो मनोऽप॒ जिज्या॑सतो व॒धम् वि म॒न्योः शर्म॑ यच्छ॒ वरी॑यो यवया व॒धम्
verses.transliteration: ápendra dviṣató mánaḥ-  -ápa jíjyāsato vadhám  ví manyóḥ śárma yacha  várīyo yavayā vadhám

translation.text: Baffle the foeman's plan, ward off his weapon who would conquer us. Give shelter from his furious wrath, and keep his murdering dart afar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒ङ्खय॑न्तीरप॒स्युव॒ इन्द्रं॑ जा॒तमुपा॑सते भे॒जा॒नासः॑ सु॒वीर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: īṅkháyantīr apasyúvaḥ-  índraṃ jātám úpāsate  bhejānā́saḥ suvī́ryam

translation.text: SWAYING about, the Active Ones came nigh to Indra at his birth, And shared his great heroic might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ बला॒दधि॒ सह॑सो जा॒त ओज॑सः त्वं वृ॑ष॒न्वृषेद॑सि
verses.transliteration: tvám indra bálād ádhi  sáhaso jātá ójasaḥ  tváṃ vr̥ṣan vŕ̥ṣéd asi

translation.text: Based upon strength and victory and power, O Indra is thy birth: Thou, Mighty One, art strong indeed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमि॑न्द्रासि वृत्र॒हा व्य१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षमतिरः उद्द्याम॑स्तभ्ना॒ ओज॑सा
verses.transliteration: tvám indrāsi vr̥trahā́  vy àntárikṣam atiraḥ  úd dyā́m astabhnā ójasā

translation.text: Thou art the Vr̥itra-slayer, thou, Indra, hast spread the firmament: Thou hast with might upheld the heavens.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमि॑न्द्र स॒जोष॑सम॒र्कं बि॑भर्षि बा॒ह्वोः वज्रं॒ शिशा॑न॒ ओज॑सा
verses.transliteration: tvám indra sajóṣasam  arkám bibharṣi bāhvóḥ  vájraṃ śíśāna ójasā

translation.text: Thou, Indra, bearest in thine arms the lightning that accords with thee, Whetting thy thunderbolt with might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमि॑न्द्राभि॒भूर॑सि॒ विश्वा॑ जा॒तान्योज॑सा स विश्वा॒ भुव॒ आभ॑वः
verses.transliteration: tvám indrābhibhū́r asi  víśvā jātā́ny ójasā  sá víśvā bhúva ā́bhavaḥ

translation.text: Thou, Indra, art preeminent over all creatures in thy might: Thou hast pervaded every place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॒ एके॑भ्यः पवते घृ॒तमेक॒ उपा॑सते येभ्यो॒ मधु॑ प्र॒धाव॑ति॒ ताँश्चि॑दे॒वापि॑ गच्छतात्
verses.transliteration: sóma ékebhyaḥ pavate  ghr̥tám éka úpāsate  yébhyo mádhu pradhā́vati  tā́ṃś cid evā́pi gachatāt

translation.text: FOR some is Soma purified, some sit by sacrificial oil: To those for whom the meath flows forth, even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तप॑सा॒ ये अ॑नाधृ॒ष्यास्तप॑सा॒ ये स्व॑र्य॒युः तपो॒ ये च॑क्रि॒रे मह॒स्ताँश्चि॑दे॒वापि॑ गच्छतात्
verses.transliteration: tápasā yé anādhr̥ṣyā́s  tápasā yé svàr yayúḥ  tápo yé cakriré máhas  tā́ṃś cid evā́pi gachatāt

translation.text: Invincible through Fervour, those whom Fervour hath advanced to heaven, Who showed great Fervour in their lives, -even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये युध्य॑न्ते प्र॒धने॑षु॒ शूरा॑सो॒ ये त॑नू॒त्यजः॑ ये वा॑ स॒हस्र॑दक्षिणा॒स्ताँश्चि॑दे॒वापि॑ गच्छतात्
verses.transliteration: yé yúdhyante pradháneṣu  śū́rāso yé tanūtyájaḥ  yé vā sahásradakṣiṇās  tā́ṃś cid evā́pi gachatāt

translation.text: The heroes who contend in war and boldly cast their lives away, Or who give guerdon thousandfold, -even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये चि॒त्पूर्व॑ ऋत॒साप॑ ऋ॒तावा॑न ऋता॒वृधः॑ पि॒तॄन्तप॑स्वतो यम॒ ताँश्चि॑दे॒वापि॑ गच्छतात्
verses.transliteration: yé cit pū́rva r̥tasā́paḥ-  r̥tā́vāna r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ  pitr̥̄́n tápasvato yama  tā́ṃś cid evā́pi gachatāt

translation.text: Yea, the first followers of Law, Law's pure and holy strengtheners, The Fathers, Yama! Fervour-moved,even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्र॑णीथाः क॒वयो॒ ये गो॑पा॒यन्ति॒ सूर्य॑म् ऋषी॒न्तप॑स्वतो यम तपो॒जाँ अपि॑ गच्छतात्
verses.transliteration: sahásraṇīthāḥ kaváyo  yé gopāyánti sū́ryam  ŕ̥ṣīn tápasvato yama  tapojā́m̐ ápi gachatāt

translation.text: Skilled in a thousand ways and means, the sages who protect the Sun, The R̥ishis, Yama! Fervour-moved,– even to those let him depart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरा॑यि॒ काणे॒ विक॑टे गि॒रिं ग॑च्छ सदान्वे शि॒रिम्बि॑ठस्य॒ सत्व॑भि॒स्तेभि॑ष्ट्वा चातयामसि
verses.transliteration: árāyi kā́ṇe víkaṭe  giríṃ gacha sadānve  śirímbiṭhasya sátvabhis  tébhiṣ ṭvā cātayāmasi

translation.text: ARAYI, one-eyed limping hag, fly, ever-screeching, to the hill. We frighten thee away with these, the heroes of Ṣirimbiṭha.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒त्तो इ॒तश्च॒त्तामुतः॒ सर्वा॑ भ्रू॒णान्या॒रुषी॑ अ॒रा॒य्यं॑ ब्रह्मणस्पते॒ तीक्ष्ण॑शृण्गोदृ॒षन्नि॑हि
verses.transliteration: cattó itáś cattā́mútaḥ  sárvā bhrūṇā́ny ārúṣī  arāyyàm brahmaṇas pate  tī́kṣṇaśr̥ṇgodr̥ṣánn ihi

translation.text: Scared from this place and that is she, destroyer of each germ unborn. Go, sharp-horned Brahmanaspti and drive Arayi far away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒दो यद्दारु॒ प्लव॑ते॒ सिन्धोः॑ पा॒रे अ॑पूरु॒षम् तदा र॑भस्व दुर्हणो॒ तेन॑ गच्छ परस्त॒रम्
verses.transliteration: adó yád dā́ru plávate  síndhoḥ pāré apūruṣám  tád ā́ rabhasva durhaṇo  téna gacha parastarám

translation.text: Yon log that floats without a man to guide it on the river's edge,– Seize it, thou thing with hideous jaws, and go thou far away thereon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्ध॒ प्राची॒रज॑ग॒न्तोरो॑ मण्डूरधाणिकीः ह॒ता इन्द्र॑स्य॒ शत्र॑वः॒ सर्वे॑ बुद्बु॒दया॑शवः
verses.transliteration: yád dha prā́cīr ájaganta-  -úro maṇḍūradhāṇikīḥ  hatā́ índrasya śátravaḥ  sárve budbudáyāśavaḥ

translation.text: When, foul with secret stain and spot, ye hastened onward to the breast, All Indra's enemies were slain and passed away like froth and foam.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परी॒मे गाम॑नेषत॒ पर्य॒ग्निम॑हृषत दे॒वेष्व॑क्रत॒ श्रवः॒ क इ॒माँ आ द॑धर्षति
verses.transliteration: párīmé gā́m aneṣata  páry agním ahr̥ṣata  devéṣv akrata śrávaḥ  ká imā́m̐ ā́ dadharṣati

translation.text: These men have led about the cow, have duly carried Agni round, And raised their glory tg the Gods. Who will attack them with success?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं हि॑न्वन्तु नो॒ धियः॒ सप्ति॑मा॒शुमि॑वा॒जिषु॑ तेन॑ जेष्म॒ धनं॑धनम्
verses.transliteration: agníṃ hinvantu no dhíyaḥ  sáptim āśúm ivājíṣu  téna jeṣma dhánaṃ-dhanam

translation.text: LET songs of ours speed Agni forth like a fleet courser in the race, And we will win each prize through him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यया॒ गा आ॒करा॑महे॒ सेन॑याग्ने॒ तवो॒त्या तां नो॑ हिन्व म॒घत्त॑ये
verses.transliteration: yáyā gā́ ākárāmahe  sénayāgne távotyā́  tā́ṃ no hinva magháttaye

translation.text: Agni the dart whereby we gain kine for ourselves with help from thee,– That send us for the gain of wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आग्ने॑ स्थू॒रं र॒यिं भ॑र पृ॒थुं गोम॑न्तम॒श्विन॑म् अ॒ङ्धि खं व॒र्तया॑ प॒णिम्
verses.transliteration: ā́gne sthūráṃ rayím bhara  pr̥thúṃ gómantam aśvínam  aṅdhí kháṃ vartáyā paṇím

translation.text: O Agni, bring us wealth secure, vast wealth in horses and in kine: Oil thou the socket, turn the wheel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ नक्ष॑त्रम॒जर॒मा सूर्यं॑ रोहयो दि॒वि दध॒ज्ज्योति॒र्जने॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: ágne nákṣatram ajáram  ā́ sū́ryaṃ rohayo diví  dádhaj jyótir jánebhyaḥ

translation.text: O Agni, thou hast made the Sun, Eternal Star, to mount the sky, Bestowing light on living men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ के॒तुर्वि॒शाम॑सि॒ प्रेष्ठः॒ श्रेष्ठ॑ उपस्थ॒सत् बोधा॑ स्तो॒त्रे वयो॒ दध॑त्
verses.transliteration: ágne ketúr viśā́m asi  préṣṭhaḥ śréṣṭha upasthasát  bódhā stotré váyo dádhat

translation.text: Thou, Agni, art the people's light, best, dearest, seated in thy shrine: Watch for the singer, give him life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा नु कं॒ भुव॑ना सीषधा॒मेन्द्र॑श्च॒ विश्वे॑ च दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: imā́ nú kam bhúvanā sīṣadhāma-  -índraś ca víśve ca devā́ḥ

translation.text: WE will, with Indra and all Gods to aid us, bring these existing worlds into subjection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञं च॑ नस्त॒न्वं॑ च प्र॒जां चा॑दि॒त्यैरिन्द्रः॑ स॒ह ची॑कॢपाति
verses.transliteration: yajñáṃ ca nas tanvàṃ ca prajā́ṃ ca-  -ādityaír índraḥ sahá cīkl̥pāti

translation.text: Our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspr. let Indra form together with Âdityas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दि॒त्यैरिन्द्रः॒ सग॑णो म॒रुद्भि॑र॒स्माकं॑ भूत्ववि॒ता त॒नूना॑म्
verses.transliteration: ādityaír índraḥ ságaṇo marúdbhir  asmā́kam bhūtv avitā́ tanū́nām

translation.text: With the Âdityas, with the band of Maruts, may Indra be Protector of our bodies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह॒त्वाय॑ दे॒वा असु॑रा॒न्यदाय॑न्दे॒वा दे॑व॒त्वम॑भि॒रक्ष॑माणाः
verses.transliteration: hatvā́ya devā́ ásurān yád ā́yan  devā́ devatvám abhirákṣamāṇāḥ

translation.text: As when the Gods came, after they had slaughtered the Asuras, keeping safe their Godlike nature,

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒त्यञ्च॑म॒र्कम॑नय॒ञ्छची॑भि॒रादित्स्व॒धामि॑षि॒रां पर्य॑पश्यन्
verses.transliteration: pratyáñcam arkám anayañ chácībhir  ā́d ít svadhā́m iṣirā́m páry apaśyan

translation.text: Brought the Sun hitherward with mighty powers, and looked about them on their vigorous Godhead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सूर्यो॑ नो दि॒वस्पा॑तु॒ वातो॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षात् अ॒ग्निर्नः॒ पार्थि॑वेभ्यः
verses.transliteration: sū́ryo no divás pātu  vā́to antárikṣāt  agnír naḥ pā́rthivebhyaḥ

translation.text: MAY Sûrya guard us out of heaven, and Vâta from the firmament, And Agni from terrestrial spots.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जोषा॑ सवित॒र्यस्य॑ ते॒ हरः॑ श॒तं स॒वाँ अर्ह॑ति पा॒हि नो॑ दि॒द्युतः॒ पत॑न्त्याः
verses.transliteration: jóṣā savitar yásya te  háraḥ śatáṃ savā́m̐ árhati  pāhí no didyútaḥ pátantyāḥ

translation.text: Thou Savitar whose flame deserves hundred libations, be thou pleased: From failing lightning keep us safe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चक्षु॑र्नो दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता चक्षु॑र्न उ॒त पर्व॑तः चक्षु॑र्धा॒ता द॑धातु नः
verses.transliteration: cákṣur no deváḥ savitā́  cákṣur na utá párvataḥ  cákṣur dhātā́ dadhātu naḥ

translation.text: May Savitar the God, and may Parvata also give us sight; May the Creator give us sight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चक्षु॑र्नो धेहि॒ चक्षु॑षे॒ चक्षु॑र्वि॒ख्यै त॒नूभ्यः॑ सं चे॒दं वि च॑ पश्येम
verses.transliteration: cákṣur no dhehi cákṣuṣe  cákṣur vikhyaí tanū́bhyaḥ  sáṃ cedáṃ ví ca paśyema

translation.text: Give sight unto our eye, give thou our bodies sight that they may see: May we survey, discern this world.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒सं॒दृशं॑ त्वा व॒यं प्रति॑ पश्येम सूर्य वि प॑श्येम नृ॒चक्ष॑सः
verses.transliteration: susaṃdŕ̥śaṃ tvā vayám  práti paśyema sūrya  ví paśyema nr̥cákṣasaḥ

translation.text: Thus, Sûrya, may we look on thee, on thee most lovely to behold, See clearly with the eyes of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॒सौ सूर्यो॑ अगा॒दुद॒यं मा॑म॒को भगः॑ अ॒हं तद्वि॑द्व॒ला पति॑म॒भ्य॑साक्षि विषास॒हिः
verses.transliteration: úd asaú sū́ryo agād  úd ayám māmakó bhágaḥ  aháṃ tád vidvalā́ pátim  abhy àsākṣi viṣāsahíḥ

translation.text: YON Sun hath mounted up, and this my happy fate hate mounted high. I knowing this, as conqueror have won my husband for mine own.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं के॒तुर॒हं मू॒र्धाहमु॒ग्रा वि॒वाच॑नी ममेदनु॒ क्रतुं॒ पतिः॑ सेहा॒नाया॑ उ॒पाच॑रेत्
verses.transliteration: aháṃ ketúr ahám mūrdhā́-  -ahám ugrā́ vivā́canī  máméd ánu krátum pátiḥ  sehānā́yā upā́caret

translation.text: I am the banner and the head, a mighty arbitress am I: I am victorious, and my Lord shall be submissive to my will.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मम॑ पु॒त्राः श॑त्रु॒हणोऽथो॑ मे दुहि॒ता वि॒राट् उ॒ताहम॑स्मि संज॒या पत्यौ॑ मे॒ श्लोक॑ उत्त॒मः
verses.transliteration: máma putrā́ḥ śatruháṇaḥ-  -átho me duhitā́ virā́ṭ  utā́hám asmi saṃjayā́  pátyau me ślóka uttamáḥ

translation.text: My Sons are slayers of the foe, my Daughter is a ruling Queen: I am victorious: o'er my Lord my song of triumph is supreme.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येनेन्द्रो॑ ह॒विषा॑ कृ॒त्व्यभ॑वद्द्यु॒म्न्यु॑त्त॒मः इ॒दं तद॑क्रि देवा असप॒त्ना किला॑भुवम्
verses.transliteration: yénéndro havíṣā kr̥tvī́-  ábhavad dyumny ùttamáḥ  idáṃ tád akri devāḥ-  asapatnā́ kílābhuvam

translation.text: Oblation, that which Indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high,– This have I offered, O ye Gods, and rid me of each rival wife.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स॒प॒त्ना स॑पत्न॒घ्नी जय॑न्त्यभि॒भूव॑री आवृ॑क्षम॒न्यासां॒ वर्चो॒ राधो॒ अस्थे॑यसामिव
verses.transliteration: asapatnā́ sapatnaghnī́  jáyanty abhibhū́varī  ā́vr̥kṣam anyā́sāṃ várco  rā́dho ástheyasām iva

translation.text: Destroyer of the rival wife, Sole Spouse, victorious, conqueror, The others' glory have I seized as 'twere the wealth of weaker Dames.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॑जैषमि॒मा अ॒हं स॒पत्नी॑रभि॒भूव॑री यथा॒हम॒स्य वी॒रस्य॑ वि॒राजा॑नि॒ जन॑स्य च
verses.transliteration: sám ajaiṣam imā́ aháṃ  sapátnīr abhibhū́varī  yáthāhám asyá vīrásya  virā́jāni jánasya ca

translation.text: I have subdued as conqueror these rivals, these my fellow-wives, That I may hold imperial sway over this Hero and the folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ती॒व्रस्या॒भिव॑यसो अ॒स्य पा॑हि सर्वर॒था वि हरी॑ इ॒ह मु॑ञ्च इन्द्र॒ मा त्वा॒ यज॑मानासो अ॒न्ये नि री॑रम॒न्तुभ्य॑मि॒मे सु॒तासः॑
verses.transliteration: tīvrásyābhívayaso asyá pāhi  sarvarathā́ ví hárī ihá muñca  índra mā́ tvā yájamānāso anyé  ní rīraman túbhyam imé sutā́saḥ

translation.text: TASTE this strong draught enriched with offered viands: with all thy chariot here unyoke thy Coursers. Let not those other sacrificers stay thee, Indra: these juices shed for thee are ready.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्यं॑ सु॒तास्तुभ्य॑मु॒ सोत्वा॑स॒स्त्वां गिरः॒ श्वात्र्या॒ आ ह्व॑यन्ति इन्द्रे॒दम॒द्य सव॑नं जुषा॒णो विश्व॑स्य वि॒द्वाँ इ॒ह पा॑हि॒ सोम॑म्
verses.transliteration: túbhyaṃ sutā́s túbhyam u sótvāsas  tvā́ṃ gíraḥ śvā́tryā ā́ hvayanti  índredám adyá sávanaṃ juṣāṇó  víśvasya vidvā́m̐ ihá pāhi sómam

translation.text: Thine is the juice effused, thine are the juices yet to be pressed: our resonant songs invite thee. O Indra, pleased to-day with this libation, come, thou who knowest all and drink the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य उ॑श॒ता मन॑सा॒ सोम॑मस्मै सर्वहृ॒दा दे॒वका॑मः सु॒नोति॑ न गा इन्द्र॒स्तस्य॒ परा॑ ददाति प्रश॒स्तमिच्चारु॑मस्मै कृणोति
verses.transliteration: yá uśatā́ mánasā sómam asmai  sarvahr̥dā́ devákāmaḥ sunóti  ná gā́ índras tásya párā dadāti  praśastám íc cā́rum asmai kr̥ṇoti

translation.text: Whoso, devoted to the God, effuses Soma for him with yearning heart and spirit,– Never doth Indra give away his cattle: for him he makes the lovely Soma famous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑स्पष्टो भवत्ये॒षो अ॑स्य॒ यो अ॑स्मै रे॒वान्न सु॒नोति॒ सोम॑म् निर॑र॒त्नौ म॒घवा॒ तं द॑धाति ब्रह्म॒द्विषो॑ ह॒न्त्यना॑नुदिष्टः
verses.transliteration: ánuspaṣṭo bhavaty eṣó asya  yó asmai revā́n ná sunóti sómam  nír aratnaú maghávā táṃ dadhāti  brahmadvíṣo hanty ánānudiṣṭaḥ

translation.text: He looks with Ioving favour on the mortal who, like a rich man, pours for him the Soma. Maghavan in his bended arm supports him: he slays, unasked, the men who hate devotion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒श्वा॒यन्तो॑ ग॒व्यन्तो॑ वा॒जय॑न्तो॒ हवा॑महे॒ त्वोप॑गन्त॒वा उ॑ आ॒भूष॑न्तस्ते सुम॒तौ नवा॑यां व॒यमि॑न्द्र त्वा शु॒नं हु॑वेम
verses.transliteration: aśvāyánto gavyánto vājáyanto  hávāmahe tvópagantavā́ u  ābhū́ṣantas te sumataú návāyāṃ  vayám indra tvā śunáṃ huvema

translation.text: We call on thee to come to us, desirous of goods and spoil, of cattle, and of horses. For thy new love and favour are we present: let us invoke thee, Indra, as our welfare.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मु॒ञ्चामि॑ त्वा ह॒विषा॒ जीव॑नाय॒ कम॑ज्ञातय॒क्ष्मादु॒त रा॑जय॒क्ष्मात् ग्राहि॑र्ज॒ग्राह॒ यदि॑ वै॒तदे॑नं॒ तस्या॑ इन्द्राग्नी॒ प्र मु॑मुक्तमेनम्
verses.transliteration: muñcā́mi tvā havíṣā jī́vanāya kám  ajñātayakṣmā́d utá rājayakṣmā́t  grā́hir jagrā́ha yádi vaitád enaṃ  tásyā indrāgnī prá mumuktam enam

translation.text: FOR life I set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and from Consumption; Or, if the grasping demon have possessed him, free him from her, O Indra, thou and Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑ क्षि॒तायु॒र्यदि॑ वा॒ परे॑तो॒ यदि॑ मृ॒त्योर॑न्ति॒कं नी॑त ए॒व तमा ह॑रामि॒ निर्ऋ॑तेरु॒पस्था॒दस्पा॑र्षमेनं श॒तशा॑रदाय
verses.transliteration: yádi kṣitā́yur yádi vā páreto  yádi mr̥tyór antikáṃ nī̀ta evá  tám ā́ harāmi nírr̥ter upásthād  áspārṣam enaṃ śatáśāradāya

translation.text: Be his days ended, be he now departed, be he brought very near to death already, Out of Destruction's lap again I bring him, save him for life to last a hundred autumns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒ह॒स्रा॒क्षेण॑ श॒तशा॑रदेन श॒तायु॑षा ह॒विषाहा॑र्षमेनम् श॒तं यथे॒मं श॒रदो॒ नया॒तीन्द्रो॒ विश्व॑स्य दुरि॒तस्य॑ पा॒रम्
verses.transliteration: sahasrākṣéṇa śatáśāradena  śatā́yuṣā havíṣā́hārṣam enam  śatáṃ yáthemáṃ śarádo náyāti-  -índro víśvasya duritásya pārám

translation.text: With hundred-eyed oblation, hundred-autumned, bringing a hundred lives, have I restored him, That Indra for a hundred years may lead him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं जी॑व श॒रदो॒ वर्ध॑मानः श॒तं हे॑म॒न्ताञ्छ॒तमु॑ वस॒न्तान् श॒तमि॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी स॑वि॒ता बृह॒स्पतिः॑ श॒तायु॑षा ह॒विषे॒मं पुन॑र्दुः
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ jīva śarádo várdhamānaḥ  śatáṃ hemantā́ñ chatám u vasantā́n  śatám indrāgnī́ savitā́ bŕ̥haspátiḥ  śatā́yuṣā havíṣemám púnar duḥ

translation.text: Live, waxing in thy strength, a hundred autumns, live through a hundred springs, a hundred winters. Through hundred-lived oblation Indra, Agni, Br̥ihaspati, Savitar yield him for a hundred!

verses.sanskrit_deva: आहा॑र्षं॒ त्वावि॑दं त्वा॒ पुन॒रागाः॑ पुनर्नव सर्वा॑ङ्ग॒ सर्वं॑ ते॒ चक्षुः॒ सर्व॒मायु॑श्च तेऽविदम्
verses.transliteration: ā́hārṣaṃ tvā́vidaṃ tvā  púnar ā́gāḥ punarnava  sárvāṅga sárvaṃ te cákṣuḥ  sárvam ā́yuś ca te 'vidam

translation.text: So have I found and rescued thee thou hast returned with youth renewed. Whole in thy members! I have found thy sight and all thy life for thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्म॑णा॒ग्निः सं॑विदा॒नो र॑क्षो॒हा बा॑धतामि॒तः अमी॑वा॒ यस्ते॒ गर्भं॑ दु॒र्णामा॒ योनि॑मा॒शये॑
verses.transliteration: bráhmaṇāgníḥ saṃvidānó  rakṣohā́ bādhatām itáḥ  ámīvā yás te gárbhaṃ  durṇā́mā yónim āśáye

translation.text: MAY Agni, yielding to our prayer, the Raksas-slayer, drive away The malady of evil name that hath beset thy labouring womb.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॒ गर्भ॒ममी॑वा दु॒र्णामा॒ योनि॑मा॒शये॑ अ॒ग्निष्टं ब्रह्म॑णा स॒ह निष्क्र॒व्याद॑मनीनशत्
verses.transliteration: yás te gárbham ámīvā  durṇā́mā yónim āśáye  agníṣ ṭám bráhmaṇā sahá  níṣ kravyā́dam anīnaśat

translation.text: Agni, concurring in the prayer, drive off the eater of the flesh, The malady of evil name that hath attacked thy babe and womb.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॒ हन्ति॑ प॒तय॑न्तं निष॒त्स्नुं यः स॑रीसृ॒पम् जा॒तं यस्ते॒ जिघां॑सति॒ तमि॒तो ना॑शयामसि
verses.transliteration: yás te hánti patáyantaṃ  niṣatsnúṃ yáḥ sarīsr̥pám  jātáṃ yás te jíghāṃsati  tám itó nāśayāmasi

translation.text: That which destroys the sinking germ, the settled, moving embryo, That which will kill the babe at birth,even this will we drive far away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त॑ ऊ॒रू वि॒हर॑त्यन्त॒रा दम्प॑ती॒ शये॑ योनिं॒ यो अ॒न्तरा॒रेळ्हि॒ तमि॒तो ना॑शयामसि
verses.transliteration: yás ta ūrū́ vihárati-  antarā́ dámpatī śáye  yóniṃ yó antár āréḷhi  tám itó nāśayāmasi

translation.text: That which divides thy legs that it may lie between the married pair, That penetrates and licks thy side,– even this will we exterminate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त्वा॒ भ्राता॒ पति॑र्भू॒त्वा जा॒रो भू॒त्वा नि॒पद्य॑ते प्र॒जां यस्ते॒ जिघां॑सति॒ तमि॒तो ना॑शयामसि
verses.transliteration: yás tvā bhrā́tā pátir bhūtvā́  jāró bhūtvā́ nipádyate  prajā́ṃ yás te jíghāṃsati  tám itó nāśayāmasi

translation.text: What rests by thee in borrowed form of brother, lover, or of lord, And would destroy thy Progeny,– even this will we exterminate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त्वा॒ स्वप्ने॑न॒ तम॑सा मोहयि॒त्वा नि॒पद्य॑ते प्र॒जां यस्ते॒ जिघां॑सति॒ तमि॒तो ना॑शयामसि
verses.transliteration: yás tvā svápnena támasā  mohayitvā́ nipádyate  prajā́ṃ yás te jíghāṃsati  tám itó nāśayāmasi

translation.text: That which through sleep or darkness hath deceived thee and lies down by thee, And will destroy thy progeny,– -even this will we exterminate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒क्षीभ्यां॑ ते॒ नासि॑काभ्यां॒ कर्णा॑भ्यां॒ छुबु॑का॒दधि॑ यक्ष्मं॑ शीर्ष॒ण्यं॑ म॒स्तिष्का॑ज्जि॒ह्वाया॒ वि वृ॑हामि ते
verses.transliteration: akṣī́bhyāṃ te nā́sikābhyāṃ  kárṇābhyāṃ chúbukād ádhi  yákṣmaṃ śīrṣaṇyàm mastíṣkāj  jihvā́yā ví vr̥hāmi te

translation.text: FROM both thy nostrils, from thine eyes, from both thine ears and from thy chin, Forth from thy head and brain and tongue I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्री॒वाभ्य॑स्त उ॒ष्णिहा॑भ्यः॒ कीक॑साभ्यो अनू॒क्या॑त् यक्ष्मं॑ दोष॒ण्य१॒॑मंसा॑भ्यां बा॒हुभ्यां॒ वि वृ॑हामि ते
verses.transliteration: grīvā́bhyas ta uṣṇíhābhyaḥ  kī́kasābhyo anūkyā̀t  yákṣmaṃ doṣaṇyàm áṃsābhyām  bāhúbhyāṃ ví vr̥hāmi te

translation.text: From the neck-tendons and the neck, from the breast-bones and from the spine, From shoulders, upper, lower arms, I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒न्त्रेभ्य॑स्ते॒ गुदा॑भ्यो वनि॒ष्ठोर्हृद॑या॒दधि॑ यक्ष्मं॒ मत॑स्नाभ्यां य॒क्नः प्ला॒शिभ्यो॒ वि वृ॑हामि ते
verses.transliteration: āntrébhyas te gúdābhyo  vaniṣṭhór hŕ̥dayād ádhi  yákṣmam mátasnābhyāṃ yaknáḥ  plāśíbhyo ví vr̥hāmi te

translation.text: From viscera and all within, forth from the rectum, from the heart, From kidneys, liver, and from spleen, I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒रुभ्यां॑ ते अष्ठी॒वद्भ्यां॒ पार्ष्णि॑भ्यां॒ प्रप॑दाभ्याम् यक्ष्मं॒ श्रोणि॑भ्यां॒ भास॑दा॒द्भंस॑सो॒ वि वृ॑हामि ते
verses.transliteration: ūrúbhyāṃ te aṣṭhīvádbhyām  pā́rṣṇibhyām prápadābhyām  yákṣmaṃ śróṇibhyām bhā́sadād  bháṃsaso ví vr̥hāmi te

translation.text: From thighs, from knee-caps, and from heels, and from the forepart of the feet, From hips from stomach, and from groin I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मेह॑नाद्वनं॒कर॑णा॒ल्लोम॑भ्यस्ते न॒खेभ्यः॑ यक्ष्मं॒ सर्व॑स्मादा॒त्मन॒स्तमि॒दं वि वृ॑हामि ते
verses.transliteration: méhanād vanaṃkáraṇāt-  lómabhyas te nakhébhyaḥ  yákṣmaṃ sárvasmād ātmánas  tám idáṃ ví vr̥hāmi te

translation.text: From what is voided from within, and from thy hair, and from they nails, From all thyself from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अङ्गा॑दङ्गा॒ल्लोम्नो॑लोम्नो जा॒तं पर्व॑णिपर्वणि यक्ष्मं॒ सर्व॑स्मादा॒त्मन॒स्तमि॒दं वि वृ॑हामि ते
verses.transliteration: áṅgād-aṅgāl lómno-lomno  jātám párvaṇi-parvaṇi  yákṣmaṃ sárvasmād ātmánas  tám idáṃ ví vr̥hāmi te

translation.text: From every member, every hair, disease that comes in every joint, From all thyself, from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपे॑हि मनसस्प॒तेऽप॑ क्राम प॒रश्च॑र प॒रो निर्ऋ॑त्या॒ आ च॑क्ष्व बहु॒धा जीव॑तो॒ मनः॑
verses.transliteration: ápehi manasas pate-  -ápa krāma paráś cara  paró nírr̥tyā ā́ cakṣva  bahudhā́ jī́vato mánaḥ

translation.text: AVAUNT, thou Master of the mind Depart, and vanish far away. Look on Destruction far from hence. The live man's mind is manifold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रं वै वरं॑ वृणते भ॒द्रं यु॑ञ्जन्ति॒ दक्षि॑णम् भ॒द्रं वै॑वस्व॒ते चक्षु॑र्बहु॒त्रा जीव॑तो॒ मनः॑
verses.transliteration: bhadráṃ vaí váraṃ vr̥ṇate  bhadráṃ yuñjanti dákṣiṇam  bhadráṃ vaivasvaté cákṣur  bahutrā́ jī́vato mánaḥ

translation.text: A happy boon do men elect, a mighty blessing they obtain. Bliss with Vaivasvata they see. The live man's mind seeks many a place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदा॒शसा॑ निः॒शसा॑भि॒शसो॑पारि॒म जाग्र॑तो॒ यत्स्व॒पन्तः॑ अ॒ग्निर्विश्वा॒न्यप॑ दुष्कृ॒तान्यजु॑ष्टान्या॒रे अ॒स्मद्द॑धातु
verses.transliteration: yád āśásā niḥśásābhiśásā-  -upārimá jā́grato yát svapántaḥ  agnír víśvāny ápa duṣkr̥tā́ni-  ájuṣṭāny āré asmád dadhātu

translation.text: If by address, by blame, by imprecation we have committed sin, awake or sleeping, All hateful acts of ours, all evil doings may Agni bear away to distant places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्र ब्रह्मणस्पतेऽभिद्रो॒हं चरा॑मसि प्रचे॑ता न आङ्गिर॒सो द्वि॑ष॒तां पा॒त्वंह॑सः
verses.transliteration: yád indra brahmaṇas pate  -abhidroháṃ cárāmasi  prácetā na āṅgirasó  dviṣatā́m pātv áṃhasaḥ

translation.text: When, Indra, Brahmaṇaspati, our deeds are wrongful and unjust, May provident Ângirasa prevent our foes from troubling, us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अजै॑ष्मा॒द्यास॑नाम॒ चाभू॒माना॑गसो व॒यम् जा॒ग्र॒त्स्व॒प्नः सं॑क॒ल्पः पा॒पो यं द्वि॒ष्मस्तं स ऋ॑च्छतु॒ यो नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तमृ॑च्छतु
verses.transliteration: ájaiṣmādyā́sanāma ca-  -ábhūmā́nāgaso vayám  jāgratsvapnáḥ saṃkalpáḥ pāpó  yáṃ dviṣmás táṃ sá r̥chatu  yó no dvéṣṭi tám r̥chatu

translation.text: We have prevailed this day and won: we are made free from sin and guilt. Ill thoughts, that visit us awake or sleeping, seize the man we hate, yea, seize the man who hateth us.

suktas.deity: Against the Bird of Ill Omen

verses.sanskrit_deva: देवाः॑ क॒पोत॑ इषि॒तो यदि॒च्छन्दू॒तो निर्ऋ॑त्या इ॒दमा॑ज॒गाम॑ तस्मा॑ अर्चाम कृ॒णवा॑म॒ निष्कृ॑तिं॒ शं नो॑ अस्तु द्वि॒पदे॒ शं चतु॑ष्पदे
verses.transliteration: dévāḥ kapóta iṣitó yád ichán  dūtó nírr̥tyā idám ājagā́ma  tásmā arcāma kr̥ṇávāma níṣkr̥tiṃ  śáṃ no astu dvipáde śáṃ cátuṣpade

translation.text: GODS, whatsoe'er the Dove came hither seeking, sent to us as the envoy of Destruction, For that let us sing hymns and make atonement. Well be it with our quadrupeds and bipeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शि॒वः क॒पोत॑ इषि॒तो नो॑ अस्त्वना॒गा दे॑वाः शकु॒नो गृ॒हेषु॑ अ॒ग्निर्हि विप्रो॑ जु॒षतां॑ ह॒विर्नः॒ परि॑ हे॒तिः प॒क्षिणी॑ नो वृणक्तु
verses.transliteration: śiváḥ kapóta iṣitó no astu-  anāgā́ devāḥ śakunó gr̥héṣu  agnír hí vípro juṣátāṃ havír naḥ  pári hetíḥ pakṣíṇī no vr̥ṇaktu

translation.text: Auspicious be the Dove that hath been sent us, a harmless bird, ye Gods, within our dwelling. May Agni, Sage, be pleased with our oblation, and may the Missile borne on wings avoid us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हे॒तिः प॒क्षिणी॒ न द॑भात्य॒स्माना॒ष्ट्र्यां प॒दं कृ॑णुते अग्नि॒धाने॑ शं नो॒ गोभ्य॑श्च॒ पुरु॑षेभ्यश्चास्तु॒ मा नो॑ हिंसीदि॒ह दे॑वाः क॒पोतः॑
verses.transliteration: hetíḥ pakṣíṇī ná dabhāty asmā́n  āṣṭryā́m padáṃ kr̥ṇute agnidhā́ne  śáṃ no góbhyaś ca púruṣebhyaś cāstu  mā́ no hiṃsīd ihá devāḥ kapótaḥ

translation.text: Let not the Arrow that hath wings distract us: beside the fire-place, on the hearth it settles. May, it bring welfare to our men and cattle: here let the Dove, ye Gods, forbear to harm us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदुलू॑को॒ वद॑ति मो॒घमे॒तद्यत्क॒पोतः॑ प॒दम॒ग्नौ कृ॒णोति॑ यस्य॑ दू॒तः प्रहि॑त ए॒ष ए॒तत्तस्मै॑ य॒माय॒ नमो॑ अस्तु मृ॒त्यवे॑
verses.transliteration: yád úlūko vádati moghám etád  yát kapótaḥ padám agnaú kr̥ṇóti  yásya dūtáḥ práhita eṣá etát  tásmai yamā́ya námo astu mr̥tyáve

translation.text: The screeching of the owl is ineffective and when beside the fire the Dove hath settled, To him who sent it hithcr as an envoy, to him be reverence paid, to Death, to Yama.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒चा क॒पोतं॑ नुदत प्र॒णोद॒मिषं॒ मद॑न्तः॒ परि॒ गां न॑यध्वम् सं॒यो॒पय॑न्तो दुरि॒तानि॒ विश्वा॑ हि॒त्वा न॒ ऊर्जं॒ प्र प॑ता॒त्पति॑ष्ठः
verses.transliteration: r̥cā́ kapótaṃ nudata praṇódam  íṣam mádantaḥ pári gā́ṃ nayadhvam  saṃyopáyanto duritā́ni víśvā  hitvā́ na ū́rjam prá patāt pátiṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: Drive forth the Dove, chase it with holy verses: rejoicing, bring ye hither food and cattle, Barring the way against all grief and trouble. Let the swift bird fly forth and leave us vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒ष॒भं मा॑ समा॒नानां॑ स॒पत्ना॑नां विषास॒हिम् ह॒न्तारं॒ शत्रू॑णां कृधि वि॒राजं॒ गोप॑तिं॒ गवा॑म्
verses.transliteration: r̥ṣabhám mā samānā́nāṃ  sapátnānāṃ viṣāsahím  hantā́raṃ śátrūṇāṃ kr̥dhi  virā́jaṃ gópatiṃ gávām

translation.text: MAKE me a bull among my peers, make me my rivals, conqueror: Make me the slayer of my foes, a sovran ruler, lord of kine

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हम॑स्मि सपत्न॒हेन्द्र॑ इ॒वारि॑ष्टो॒ अक्ष॑तः अ॒धः स॒पत्ना॑ मे प॒दोरि॒मे सर्वे॑ अ॒भिष्ठि॑ताः
verses.transliteration: ahám asmi sapatnahā́-  -índra ivā́riṣṭo ákṣataḥ  adháḥ sapátnā me padór  imé sárve abhíṣṭhitāḥ

translation.text: I am my rivals' slayer, like Indra unwounded and unhurt, And all these enemies of mine are vanquished and beneath my feet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्रै॒व वोऽपि॑ नह्याम्यु॒भे आर्त्नी॑ इव॒ ज्यया॑ वाच॑स्पते॒ नि षे॑धे॒मान्यथा॒ मदध॑रं॒ वदा॑न्
verses.transliteration: átraivá vó 'pi nahyāmi-  ubhé ā́rtnī iva jyáyā  vā́cas pate ní ṣedhemā́n  yáthā mád ádharaṃ vádān

translation.text: Here, verily, I bind you fast, as the two bow-ends with the string. Press down these men, O Lord of Speech, that they may humbly speak to me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि॒भूर॒हमाग॑मं वि॒श्वक॑र्मेण॒ धाम्ना॑ आ व॑श्चि॒त्तमा वो॑ व्र॒तमा वो॒ऽहं समि॑तिं ददे
verses.transliteration: abhibhū́r ahám ā́gamaṃ  viśvákarmeṇa dhā́mnā  ā́ vaś cittám ā́ vo vratám  ā́ vo 'háṃ sámitiṃ dade

translation.text: Hither I came as conqueror with mighty all-effecting power, And I have mastered all your thought, your synod, and your holy work.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो॒ग॒क्षे॒मं व॑ आ॒दाया॒हं भू॑यासमुत्त॒म आ वो॑ मू॒र्धान॑मक्रमीम् अ॒ध॒स्प॒दान्म॒ उद्व॑दत म॒ण्डूका॑ इवोद॒कान्म॒ण्डूका॑ उद॒कादि॑व
verses.transliteration: yogakṣemáṃ va ādā́ya-  -ahám bhūyāsam uttamáḥ-  ā́ vo mūrdhā́nam akramīm  adhaspadā́n ma úd vadata  maṇḍū́kā ivodakā́t-  maṇḍū́kā udakā́d iva

translation.text: May I be highest, having gained your strength in war, your skill in peace my feet have trodden on your heads. Speak to me from beneath my feet, as frogs from out the water croak, as frogs from out the water croak.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्ये॒दमि॑न्द्र॒ परि॑ षिच्यते॒ मधु॒ त्वं सु॒तस्य॑ क॒लश॑स्य राजसि त्वं र॒यिं पु॑रु॒वीरा॑मु नस्कृधि॒ त्वं तपः॑ परि॒तप्या॑जयः॒ स्वः॑
verses.transliteration: túbhyedám indra pári ṣicyate mádhu  tváṃ sutásya kaláśasya rājasi  tváṃ rayím puruvī́rām u nas kr̥dhi  tváṃ tápaḥ paritápyājayaḥ svàḥ

translation.text: THIS pleasant meath, O Indra, is effused for thee: thou art the ruling Lord of beaker and of juice. Bestow upon us wealth with many hero sons: thou, having glowed with Fervour, wortnest heavenly light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒र्जितं॒ महि॑ मन्दा॒नमन्ध॑सो॒ हवा॑महे॒ परि॑ श॒क्रं सु॒ताँ उप॑ इ॒मं नो॑ य॒ज्ञमि॒ह बो॒ध्या ग॑हि॒ स्पृधो॒ जय॑न्तं म॒घवा॑नमीमहे
verses.transliteration: svarjítam máhi mandānám ándhaso  hávāmahe pári śakráṃ sutā́m̐ úpa  imáṃ no yajñám ihá bodhy ā́ gahi  spŕ̥dho jáyantam maghávānam īmahe

translation.text: Let us call Ṣakra to libations here effused, winner of light who joyeth in the potent juice. Mark well this sacrifice of ours and come to us: we pray to Maghavan the Vanquisher of hosts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॑स्य॒ राज्ञो॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धर्म॑णि॒ बृह॒स्पते॒रनु॑मत्या उ॒ शर्म॑णि तवा॒हम॒द्य म॑घव॒न्नुप॑स्तुतौ॒ धात॒र्विधा॑तः क॒लशाँ॑ अभक्षयम्
verses.transliteration: sómasya rā́jño váruṇasya dhármaṇi  bŕ̥haspáter ánumatyā u śármaṇi  távāhám adyá maghavann úpastutau  dhā́tar vídhātaḥ kaláśām̐ abhakṣayam

translation.text: By royal Soma's and by Varuṇa's decree, under Br̥ihaspati's and Anumati's guard, This day by thine authority, O Maghavan, Maker, Disposer thou! have I enjoyed the jars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रसू॑तो भ॒क्षम॑करं च॒रावपि॒ स्तोमं॑ चे॒मं प्र॑थ॒मः सू॒रिरुन्मृ॑जे सु॒ते सा॒तेन॒ यद्याग॑मं वां॒ प्रति॑ विश्वामित्रजमदग्नी॒ दमे॑
verses.transliteration: prásūto bhakṣám akaraṃ carā́v ápi  stómaṃ cemám prathamáḥ sūrír ún mr̥je  suté sāténa yády ā́gamaṃ vām  práti viśvāmitrajamadagnī dáme

translation.text: I, too, urged on, have had my portion, in the bowl, and as first Prince I drew forth this my hymn of praise, When with the prize I came unto the flowing juice, O Viṣvâmitra, Jamadagni, to your home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वात॑स्य॒ नु म॑हि॒मानं॒ रथ॑स्य रु॒जन्ने॑ति स्त॒नय॑न्नस्य॒ घोषः॑ दि॒वि॒स्पृग्या॑त्यरु॒णानि॑ कृ॒ण्वन्नु॒तो ए॑ति पृथि॒व्या रे॒णुमस्य॑न्
