verses.transliteration: vā́tasya nú mahimā́naṃ ráthasya  rujánn eti stanáyann asya ghóṣaḥ  divispŕ̥g yāty aruṇā́ni kr̥ṇvánn  utó eti pr̥thivyā́ reṇúm ásyan

translation.text: O THE Wind's chariot, O its power and glory! Crashing it goes and hath a voice of thunder. It makes the regions red and touches heaven, and as it moves the dust of earth is scattered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं प्रेर॑ते॒ अनु॒ वात॑स्य वि॒ष्ठा ऐनं॑ गच्छन्ति॒ सम॑नं॒ न योषाः॑ ताभिः॑ स॒युक्स॒रथं॑ दे॒व ई॑यते॒ऽस्य विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॑
verses.transliteration: sám prérate ánu vā́tasya viṣṭhā́ḥ-  aínaṃ gachanti sámanaṃ ná yóṣāḥ  tā́bhiḥ sayúk saráthaṃ devá īyate  -asyá víśvasya bhúvanasya rā́jā

translation.text: Along the traces of the Wind they hurry, they come to him as dames to an assembly. Borne on his car with these for his attendants, the God speeds forth, the universe's Monarch.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे प॒थिभि॒रीय॑मानो॒ न नि वि॑शते कत॒मच्च॒नाहः॑ अ॒पां सखा॑ प्रथम॒जा ऋ॒तावा॒ क्व॑ स्विज्जा॒तः कुत॒ आ ब॑भूव
verses.transliteration: antárikṣe pathíbhir ī́yamāno  ná ní viśate katamác canā́haḥ  apā́ṃ sákhā prathamajā́ r̥tā́vā  kvà svij jātáḥ kúta ā́ babhūva

translation.text: Travelling on the paths of air's midregion, no single day doth he take rest or slumber. Holy and earliest-born, Friend of fhe waters, where did he spring and from what region came he?

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒त्मा दे॒वानां॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ गर्भो॑ यथाव॒शं च॑रति दे॒व ए॒षः घोषा॒ इद॑स्य शृण्विरे॒ न रू॒पं तस्मै॒ वाता॑य ह॒विषा॑ विधेम
verses.transliteration: ātmā́ devā́nām bhúvanasya gárbho  yathāvaśáṃ carati devá eṣáḥ  ghóṣā íd asya śr̥ṇvire ná rūpáṃ  tásmai vā́tāya havíṣā vidhema

translation.text: Germ of the world, the Deities' vital spirit, this God moves ever as his will inclines him. His voice is heard, his shape is ever viewless. Let us adore this Wind with our oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒यो॒भूर्वातो॑ अ॒भि वा॑तू॒स्रा ऊर्ज॑स्वती॒रोष॑धी॒रा रि॑शन्ताम् पीव॑स्वतीर्जी॒वध॑न्याः पिबन्त्वव॒साय॑ प॒द्वते॑ रुद्र मृळ
verses.transliteration: mayobhū́r vā́to abhí vātūsrā́ḥ-  ū́rjasvatīr óṣadhīr ā́ riśantām  pī́vasvatīr jīvádhanyāḥ pibantu-  avasā́ya padváte rudra mr̥ḷa

translation.text: MAY the wind blow upon our Cows with healing: may they eat herbage full of vigorous juices. May they drink waters rich in life and fatness: to food that moves on feet be gracious, Rudra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याः सरू॑पा॒ विरू॑पा॒ एक॑रूपा॒ यासा॑म॒ग्निरिष्ट्या॒ नामा॑नि॒ वेद॑ या अङ्गि॑रस॒स्तप॑से॒ह च॒क्रुस्ताभ्यः॑ पर्जन्य॒ महि॒ शर्म॑ यच्छ
verses.transliteration: yā́ḥ sárūpā vírūpā ékarūpāḥ-  yā́sām agnír íṣṭyā nā́māni véda  yā́ áṅgirasas tápasehá cakrús  tā́bhyaḥ parjanya máhi śárma yacha

translation.text: Like-coloured, various-hued, or single-coloured, whose names through sacrifice are known to Agni, Whom the Angirases produced by Fervour,vouchsafe to these, Parjanya, great protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या दे॒वेषु॑ त॒न्व१॒॑मैर॑यन्त॒ यासां॒ सोमो॒ विश्वा॑ रू॒पाणि॒ वेद॑ ता अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ पय॑सा॒ पिन्व॑मानाः प्र॒जाव॑तीरिन्द्र गो॒ष्ठे रि॑रीहि
verses.transliteration: yā́ devéṣu tanvàm aírayanta  yā́sāṃ sómo víśvā rūpā́ṇi véda  tā́ asmábhyam páyasā pínvamānāḥ  prajā́vatīr indra goṣṭhé rirīhi

translation.text: Those who have offered to the Gods their bodies, whose varied forms are all well known to Soma,– Those grant us in our cattle-pen, O Indra, with their full streams of milk and plenteous offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒जाप॑ति॒र्मह्य॑मे॒ता ररा॑णो॒ विश्वै॑र्दे॒वैः पि॒तृभिः॑ संविदा॒नः शि॒वाः स॒तीरुप॑ नो गो॒ष्ठमाक॒स्तासां॑ व॒यं प्र॒जया॒ सं स॑देम
verses.transliteration: prajā́patir máhyam etā́ rárāṇo  víśvair devaíḥ pitŕ̥bhiḥ saṃvidānáḥ  śivā́ḥ satī́r úpa no goṣṭhám ā́kas  tā́sāṃ vayám prajáyā sáṃ sadema

translation.text: Prajâpati, bestowing these upon me, one-minded with all Gods and with the Fathers, Hath to our cow-pen brought auspicious cattle: so may we own the offspring they will bear us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒भ्राड्बृ॒हत्पि॑बतु सो॒म्यं मध्वायु॒र्दध॑द्य॒ज्ञप॑ता॒ववि॑ह्रुतम् वात॑जूतो॒ यो अ॑भि॒रक्ष॑ति॒ त्मना॑ प्र॒जाः पु॑पोष पुरु॒धा वि रा॑जति
verses.transliteration: vibhrā́ḍ br̥hát pibatu somyám mádhu-  ā́yur dádhad yajñápatāv ávihrutam  vā́tajūto yó abhirákṣati tmánā  prajā́ḥ pupoṣa purudhā́ ví rājati

translation.text: MAY the Bright God drink glorious Soma-mingled meath, giving the sacrifice's lord uninjured life; He who, wind-urged, in person guards our offspring well, hath nourished them with food and shines o'er many a land.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒भ्राड्बृ॒हत्सुभृ॑तं वाज॒सात॑मं॒ धर्म॑न्दि॒वो ध॒रुणे॑ स॒त्यमर्पि॑तम् अ॒मि॒त्र॒हा वृ॑त्र॒हा द॑स्यु॒हंत॑मं॒ ज्योति॑र्जज्ञे असुर॒हा स॑पत्न॒हा
verses.transliteration: vibhrā́ḍ br̥hát súbhr̥taṃ vājasā́tamaṃ  dhárman divó dharúṇe satyám árpitam  amitrahā́ vr̥trahā́ dasyuhántamaṃ  jyótir jajñe asurahā́ sapatnahā́

translation.text: Radiant, as high Truth, cherished, best at winning strength, Truth based upon the statute that supports the heavens, He rose, a light, that kills Vr̥itras and enemies, best slayer of the Dasyus, Asuras, and foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं श्रेष्ठं॒ ज्योति॑षां॒ ज्योति॑रुत्त॒मं वि॑श्व॒जिद्ध॑न॒जिदु॑च्यते बृ॒हत् वि॒श्व॒भ्राड्भ्रा॒जो महि॒ सूर्यो॑ दृ॒श उ॒रु प॑प्रथे॒ सह॒ ओजो॒ अच्यु॑तम्
verses.transliteration: idáṃ śréṣṭhaṃ jyótiṣāṃ jyótir uttamáṃ  viśvajíd dhanajíd ucyate br̥hát  viśvabhrā́ḍ bhrājó máhi sū́ryo dr̥śé-  urú paprathe sáha ójo ácyutam

translation.text: This light, the best of lights, supreme, all-conquering, winner of riches, is exalted with high laud. All-lighting, radiant, mighty as the Sun to see, he spreadeth wide unfailing victory and strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒भ्राज॒ञ्ज्योति॑षा॒ स्व१॒॑रग॑च्छो रोच॒नं दि॒वः येने॒मा विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒न्याभृ॑ता वि॒श्वक॑र्मणा वि॒श्वदे॑व्यावता
verses.transliteration: vibhrā́jañ jyótiṣā svàr  ágacho rocanáṃ diváḥ  yénemā́ víśvā bhúvanāny ā́bhr̥tā  viśvákarmaṇā viśvádevyāvatā

translation.text: Beaming forth splendour with thy light, thou hast attained heaven's lustrous realm. By thee were brought together all existing things, possessor of all Godhead, All-effecting God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं त्यमि॒टतो॒ रथ॒मिन्द्र॒ प्रावः॑ सु॒ताव॑तः अशृ॑णोः सो॒मिनो॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tyám iṭáto rátham  índra prā́vaḥ sutā́vataḥ  áśr̥ṇoḥ somíno hávam

translation.text: FOR Iṭa's sake who pressed the juice, thou, Indra, didst protect his car, And hear the Soma-giver's call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं म॒खस्य॒ दोध॑तः॒ शिरोऽव॑ त्व॒चो भ॑रः अग॑च्छः सो॒मिनो॑ गृ॒हम्
verses.transliteration: tvám makhásya dódhataḥ  śíró 'va tvacó bharaḥ  ágachaḥ somíno gr̥hám

translation.text: Thou from his skin hast borne the head of the swift-moving combatant, And sought the Soma-pourer's home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं त्यमि॑न्द्र॒ मर्त्य॑मास्त्रबु॒ध्नाय॑ वे॒न्यम् मुहुः॑ श्रथ्ना मन॒स्यवे॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tyám indra mártyam  āstrabudhnā́ya venyám  múhuḥ śrathnā manasyáve

translation.text: Venya, that mortal man, hast thou, for Âstrabudhna the devout, O Indra, many a time set free.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं त्यमि॑न्द्र॒ सूर्यं॑ प॒श्चा सन्तं॑ पु॒रस्कृ॑धि दे॒वानां॑ चित्ति॒रो वश॑म्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tyám indra sū́ryam  paścā́ sántam purás kr̥dhi  devā́nāṃ cit tiró váśam

translation.text: Bring, Indra, to the east again that Sun who now is in the west, Even against the will of Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑हि॒ वन॑सा स॒ह गावः॑ सचन्त वर्त॒निं यदूध॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhi vánasā sahá  gā́vaḥ sacanta vartaníṃ  yád ū́dhabhiḥ

translation.text: WITH all thy beauty come: the kine approaching with full udders follow on thy path.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑हि॒ वस्व्या॑ धि॒या मंहि॑ष्ठो जार॒यन्म॑खः सु॒दानु॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhi vásvyā dhiyā́  máṃhiṣṭho jārayánmakhaḥ  sudā́nubhiḥ

translation.text: Come with kind thoughts, most liberal, rousing the warrior's hymn of praise, with bounteous ones,

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒तु॒भृतो॒ न तन्तु॒मित्सु॒दान॑वः॒ प्रति॑ दध्मो॒ यजा॑मसि
verses.transliteration: pitubhŕ̥to ná tántum ít  sudā́navaḥ  práti dadhmo yájāmasi

translation.text: As nourishers we tie the thread, and, liberal with our bounty, offer sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒षा अप॒ स्वसु॒स्तमः॒ सं व॑र्तयति वर्त॒निं सु॑जा॒तता॑
verses.transliteration: uṣā́ ápa svásus támaḥ  sáṃ vartayati vartaníṃ  sujātátā

translation.text: Dawn drives away her Sister's gloom, and, through her excellence, makes her retrace her path.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॑हार्षम॒न्तरे॑धि ध्रु॒वस्ति॒ष्ठावि॑चाचलिः विश॑स्त्वा॒ सर्वा॑ वाञ्छन्तु॒ मा त्वद्रा॒ष्ट्रमधि॑ भ्रशत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvāhārṣam antár edhi  dhruvás tiṣṭhā́vicācaliḥ  víśas tvā sárvā vāñchantu  mā́ tvád rāṣṭrám ádhi bhraśat

translation.text: BE with us; I have chosen thee: stand stedfast and immovable. Let all the people wish for thee let not thy kingship fall away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒हैवैधि॒ माप॑ च्योष्ठाः॒ पर्व॑त इ॒वावि॑चाचलिः इन्द्र॑ इवे॒ह ध्रु॒वस्ति॑ष्ठे॒ह रा॒ष्ट्रमु॑ धारय
verses.transliteration: ihaívaídhi mā́pa cyoṣṭhāḥ  párvata ivā́vicācaliḥ  índra ivehá dhruvás tiṣṭha-  -ihá rāṣṭrám u dhāraya

translation.text: Be even here; fall not away be like a mountain unremoved. Stand stedfast here like Indra's self, and hold the kingship in the grasp.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ममिन्द्रो॑ अदीधरद्ध्रु॒वं ध्रु॒वेण॑ ह॒विषा॑ तस्मै॒ सोमो॒ अधि॑ ब्रव॒त्तस्मा॑ उ॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॑
verses.transliteration: imám índro adīdharad  dhruváṃ dhruvéṇa havíṣā  tásmai sómo ádhi bravat  tásmā u bráhmaṇas pátiḥ

translation.text: This man hath Indra stablished, made secure by strong oblation's power. May Soma speak a benison, and Brahmaṇaspati, on him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ध्रु॒वा द्यौर्ध्रु॒वा पृ॑थि॒वी ध्रु॒वासः॒ पर्व॑ता इ॒मे ध्रु॒वं विश्व॑मि॒दं जग॑द्ध्रु॒वो राजा॑ वि॒शाम॒यम्
verses.transliteration: dhruvā́ dyaúr dhruvā́ pr̥thivī́  dhruvā́saḥ párvatā imé  dhruváṃ víśvam idáṃ jágad  dhruvó rā́jā viśā́m ayám

translation.text: Firm is the sky and firm the earth, and stedfast also are these hills. Stedfast is all this living world, and stedfast is this King of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ध्रु॒वं ते॒ राजा॒ वरु॑णो ध्रु॒वं दे॒वो बृह॒स्पतिः॑ ध्रु॒वं त॒ इन्द्र॑श्चा॒ग्निश्च॑ रा॒ष्ट्रं धा॑रयतां ध्रु॒वम्
verses.transliteration: dhruváṃ te rā́jā váruṇo  dhruváṃ devó bŕ̥haspátiḥ  dhruváṃ ta índraś cāgníś ca  rāṣṭráṃ dhārayatāṃ dhruvám

translation.text: Stedfast, may Varuṇa the King, stedfast, the God Br̥ihaspati, Stedfast, may Indra, stedfast too, may Agni keep thy stedfast reign.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ध्रु॒वं ध्रु॒वेण॑ ह॒विषा॒भि सोमं॑ मृशामसि अथो॑ त॒ इन्द्रः॒ केव॑ली॒र्विशो॑ बलि॒हृत॑स्करत्
verses.transliteration: dhruváṃ dhruvéṇa havíṣā  -abhí sómam mr̥śāmasi  átho ta índraḥ kévalīr  víśo balihŕ̥tas karat

translation.text: On constant Soma let us think with constant sacrificial gift And then may Indra make the clans bring tribute unto thee alone.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी॒व॒र्तेन॑ ह॒विषा॒ येनेन्द्रो॑ अभिवावृ॒ते तेना॒स्मान्ब्र॑ह्मणस्पते॒ऽभि रा॒ष्ट्राय॑ वर्तय
verses.transliteration: abhīvarténa havíṣā  yénéndro abhivāvr̥té  ténāsmā́n brahmaṇas pate  -abhí rāṣṭrā́ya vartaya

translation.text: WITH offering for success in fight whence Indra was victorious. With this, O Brahmaṇaspati, let us attain to royal sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि॒वृत्य॑ स॒पत्ना॑न॒भि या नो॒ अरा॑तयः अ॒भि पृ॑त॒न्यन्तं॑ तिष्ठा॒भि यो न॑ इर॒स्यति॑
verses.transliteration: abhivŕ̥tya sapátnān  abhí yā́ no árātayaḥ  abhí pr̥tanyántaṃ tiṣṭha-  -abhí yó na irasyáti

translation.text: Subduing those who rival us, subduing all malignities, Withstand the man who menaces, withstand the man who angers us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्वा॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ताभि सोमो॑ अवीवृतत् अ॒भि त्वा॒ विश्वा॑ भू॒तान्य॑भीव॒र्तो यथास॑सि
verses.transliteration: abhí tvā deváḥ savitā́-  -abhí sómo avīvr̥tat  abhí tvā víśvā bhūtā́ni-  abhīvartó yáthā́sasi

translation.text: Soma and Savitar the God have made thee a victorious King All elements have aided thee, to make thee general conqueror.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येनेन्द्रो॑ ह॒विषा॑ कृ॒त्व्यभ॑वद्द्यु॒म्न्यु॑त्त॒मः इ॒दं तद॑क्रि देवा असप॒त्नः किला॑भुवम्
verses.transliteration: yénéndro havíṣā kr̥tvī́-  ábhavad dyumny ùttamáḥ  idáṃ tád akri devāḥ-  asapatnáḥ kílābhuvam

translation.text: Oblation, that which Indra. gave and thus grew glorious and most high,– This have I offered, Gods! and hence now, verily, am rivalless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स॒प॒त्नः स॑पत्न॒हाभिरा॑ष्ट्रो विषास॒हिः यथा॒हमे॑षां भू॒तानां॑ वि॒राजा॑नि॒ जन॑स्य च
verses.transliteration: asapatnáḥ sapatnahā́-  -abhírāṣṭro viṣāsahíḥ  yáthāhám eṣām bhūtā́nāṃ  virā́jāni jánasya ca

translation.text: Slayer of rivals, rivalless, victorious, with royal sway, Over these beings may I rule, may I be Sovran of the folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ ग्रावाणः सवि॒ता दे॒वः सु॑वतु॒ धर्म॑णा धू॒र्षु यु॑ज्यध्वं सुनु॒त
verses.transliteration: prá vo grāvāṇaḥ savitā́  deváḥ suvatu dhármaṇā  dhūrṣú yujyadhvaṃ sunutá

translation.text: MAY Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you according to the Law: Be harnessed to the shafts, and press.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्रावा॑णो॒ अप॑ दु॒च्छुना॒मप॑ सेधत दुर्म॒तिम् उ॒स्राः क॑र्तन भेष॒जम्
verses.transliteration: grā́vāṇo ápa duchúnām  ápa sedhata durmatím  usrā́ḥ kartana bheṣajám

translation.text: Stones, drive calamity away, drive ye away malevolence: Make ye the Cows our medicine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्रावा॑ण॒ उप॑रे॒ष्वा म॑ही॒यन्ते॑ स॒जोष॑सः वृष्णे॒ दध॑तो॒ वृष्ण्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: grā́vāṇa úpareṣv~ā́  mahīyánte sajóṣasaḥ  vŕ̥ṣṇe dádhato vŕ̥ṣṇyam

translation.text: Of one accord the upper Stones, giving the Bull his bull-like strength, Look down with pride on those below.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्रावा॑णः सवि॒ता नु वो॑ दे॒वः सु॑वतु॒ धर्म॑णा यज॑मानाय सुन्व॒ते
verses.transliteration: grā́vāṇaḥ savitā́ nú vo  deváḥ suvatu dhármaṇā  yájamānāya sunvaté-

translation.text: May Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you as Law commands for him Who sacrifices, pouring juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सू॒नव॑ ऋभू॒णां बृ॒हन्न॑वन्त वृ॒जना॑ क्षामा॒ ये वि॒श्वधा॑य॒सोऽश्न॑न्धे॒नुं न मा॒तर॑म्
verses.transliteration: prá sūnáva r̥bhūṇā́m  br̥hán navanta vr̥jánā  kṣā́mā yé viśvádhāyasaḥ-  -áśnan dhenúṃ ná mātáram

translation.text: WITH hymns of praise their sons have told aloud the R̥ibhus' mighty deeds. Who, all-supporting, have enjoyed the earth as, twere a mother cow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र दे॒वं दे॒व्या धि॒या भर॑ता जा॒तवे॑दसम् ह॒व्या नो॑ वक्षदानु॒षक्
verses.transliteration: prá deváṃ devyā́ dhiyā́  bháratā jātávedasam  havyā́ no vakṣad ānuṣák

translation.text: Bring forth the God with song divine, being Jâtavedas hitherward, To bear our gifts at once to heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमु॒ ष्य प्र दे॑व॒युर्होता॑ य॒ज्ञाय॑ नीयते रथो॒ न योर॒भीवृ॑तो॒ घृणी॑वाञ्चेतति॒ त्मना॑
verses.transliteration: ayám u ṣyá prá devayúr  hótā yajñā́ya nīyate  rátho ná yór abhī́vr̥to  ghŕ̥ṇīvāñ cetati tmánā

translation.text: He here, a God-devoted Priest, led forward comes to sacrifice. Like a car covered for the road, he, glowing, knows, himself, the way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यम॒ग्निरु॑रुष्यत्य॒मृता॑दिव॒ जन्म॑नः सह॑सश्चि॒त्सही॑यान्दे॒वो जी॒वात॑वे कृ॒तः
verses.transliteration: ayám agnír uruṣyati-  amŕ̥tād iva jánmanaḥ  sáhasaś cid sáhīyān  devó jīvā́tave kr̥táḥ

translation.text: This Agni rescues from distress, as 'twere from the Immortal Race, A God yet mightier than strength, a God who hath been made for life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒तं॒गम॒क्तमसु॑रस्य मा॒यया॑ हृ॒दा प॑श्यन्ति॒ मन॑सा विप॒श्चितः॑ स॒मु॒द्रे अ॒न्तः क॒वयो॒ वि च॑क्षते॒ मरी॑चीनां प॒दमि॑च्छन्ति वे॒धसः॑
verses.transliteration: pataṃgám aktám ásurasya māyáyā  hr̥dā́ paśyanti mánasā vipaścítaḥ  samudré antáḥ kaváyo ví cakṣate  márīcīnām padám ichanti vedhásaḥ

translation.text: THE sapient with their spirit and their mind behold the Bird adorned with all an Asura's magic might. Sages observe him in the ocean's inmost depth: the wise disposers seek the station of his rays.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒तं॒गो वाचं॒ मन॑सा बिभर्ति॒ तां ग॑न्ध॒र्वो॑ऽवद॒द्गर्भे॑ अ॒न्तः तां द्योत॑मानां स्व॒र्यं॑ मनी॒षामृ॒तस्य॑ प॒दे क॒वयो॒ नि पा॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: pataṃgó vā́cam mánasā bibharti  tā́ṃ gandharvò 'vadad gárbhe antáḥ  tā́ṃ dyótamānāṃ svaryàm manīṣā́m  r̥tásya padé kaváyo ní pānti

translation.text: The flying Bird bears Speech within his spirit: erst the Gandharva in the womb pronounced it: And at the seat of sacrifice the sages cherish this radiant, heavenly-bright invention.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॑श्यं गो॒पामनि॑पद्यमान॒मा च॒ परा॑ च प॒थिभि॒श्चर॑न्तम् स स॒ध्रीचीः॒ स विषू॑ची॒र्वसा॑न॒ आ व॑रीवर्ति॒ भुव॑नेष्व॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: ápaśyaṃ gopā́m ánipadyamānam  ā́ ca párā ca pathíbhiś cárantam  sá sadhrī́cīḥ sá víṣūcīr vásānaḥ-  ā́ varīvarti bhúvaneṣv antáḥ

translation.text: I saw the Herdsman, him who never resteth, approaching and departing on his pathways. He, clothed in gathered and diffusive splendour, within the worlds continually travels.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्यमू॒ षु वा॒जिनं॑ दे॒वजू॑तं स॒हावा॑नं तरु॒तारं॒ रथा॑नाम् अरि॑ष्टनेमिं पृत॒नाज॑मा॒शुं स्व॒स्तये॒ तार्क्ष्य॑मि॒हा हु॑वेम
verses.transliteration: tyám ū ṣú vājínaṃ devájūtaṃ  sahā́vānaṃ tarutā́raṃ ráthānām  áriṣṭanemim pr̥tanā́jam āśúṃ  svastáye tā́rkṣyam ihā́ huvema

translation.text: THIS very mighty one whom Gods commission, the Conqueror of cars, ever triumphant, Swift, fleet to battle, with uninjured fellies, even Târkshya for our weal will we call hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्येव रा॒तिमा॒जोहु॑वानाः स्व॒स्तये॒ नाव॑मि॒वा रु॑हेम उर्वी॒ न पृथ्वी॒ बहु॑ले॒ गभी॑रे॒ मा वा॒मेतौ॒ मा परे॑तौ रिषाम
verses.transliteration: índrasyeva rātím ājóhuvānāḥ  svastáye nā́vam ivā́ ruhema  úrvī ná pŕ̥thvī báhule gábhīre  mā́ vām étau mā́ páretau riṣāma

translation.text: As though we offered up our gifts to Indra, may we ascend. him as a ship. for safety. Like the two wide worlds, broad, deep far-extended, may we be safe both when he comes and leaves you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒द्यश्चि॒द्यः शव॑सा॒ पञ्च॑ कृ॒ष्टीः सूर्य॑ इव॒ ज्योति॑षा॒पस्त॒तान॑ स॒ह॒स्र॒साः श॑त॒सा अ॑स्य॒ रंहि॒र्न स्मा॑ वरन्ते युव॒तिं न शर्या॑म्
verses.transliteration: sadyáś cid yáḥ śávasā páñca kr̥ṣṭī́ḥ  sū́rya iva jyótiṣāpás tatā́na  sahasrasā́ḥ śatasā́ asya ráṃhir  ná smā varante yuvatíṃ ná śáryām

translation.text: He who with might the Five Lands hath pervaded, like Sûrya with his lustre, and the waters- His strength wins hundreds, thousands none avert it, as- the young maid repelleth not her lover.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ति॑ष्ठ॒ताव॑ पश्य॒तेन्द्र॑स्य भा॒गमृ॒त्विय॑म् यदि॑ श्रा॒तो जु॒होत॑न॒ यद्यश्रा॑तो मम॒त्तन॑
verses.transliteration: út tiṣṭhatā́va paśyata-  -índrasya bhāgám r̥tvíyam  yádi śrātó juhótana  yády áśrāto mamattána

translation.text: Now lift ye up yourselves and look on Indra's seasonable share. If it be ready, offer it; unready, ye have been remise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रा॒तं ह॒विरो ष्वि॑न्द्र॒ प्र या॑हि ज॒गाम॒ सूरो॒ अध्व॑नो॒ विम॑ध्यम् परि॑ त्वासते नि॒धिभिः॒ सखा॑यः कुल॒पा न व्रा॒जप॑तिं॒ चर॑न्तम्
verses.transliteration: śrātáṃ havír ó ṣv ìndra prá yāhi  jagā́ma sū́ro ádhvano vímadhyam  pári tvāsate nidhíbhiḥ sákhāyaḥ  kulapā́ ná vrājápatiṃ cárantam

translation.text: Oblation is prepared: come to us, Indra; the Sun hath travelled over half his journey. Friends with their stores are sitting round thee waiting like lords of clans for the tribe's wandering chieftain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रा॒तं म॑न्य॒ ऊध॑नि श्रा॒तम॒ग्नौ सुश्रा॑तं मन्ये॒ तदृ॒तं नवी॑यः माध्यं॑दिनस्य॒ सव॑नस्य द॒ध्नः पिबे॑न्द्र वज्रिन्पुरुकृज्जुषा॒णः
verses.transliteration: śrātám manya ū́dhani śrātám agnaú  súśrātam manye tád r̥táṃ návīyaḥ  mā́dhyaṃdinasya sávanasya dadhnáḥ  píbendra vajrin purukr̥j juṣāṇáḥ

translation.text: Dressed in the udder and on fire, I fancy; well-dressed, I fancy, is this recent present. Drink, Indra, of the curd of noon's libation with favour, Thunderer, thou whose deeds are mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र स॑साहिषे पुरुहूत॒ शत्रू॒ञ्ज्येष्ठ॑स्ते॒ शुष्म॑ इ॒ह रा॒तिर॑स्तु इन्द्रा भ॑र॒ दक्षि॑णेना॒ वसू॑नि॒ पतिः॒ सिन्धू॑नामसि रे॒वती॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: prá sasāhiṣe puruhūta śátrūñ  jyéṣṭhas te śúṣma ihá rātír astu  índrā́ bhara dákṣiṇenā vásūni  pátiḥ síndhūnām asi revátīnām

translation.text: O MUCH-INVOKED, thou hast subdued thy foemen: thy might is loftiest; here display thy bounty. In thy right hand, O Indra, bring us treasures: thou art the Lord of rivers filled with riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मृ॒गो न भी॒मः कु॑च॒रो गि॑रि॒ष्ठाः प॑रा॒वत॒ आ ज॑गन्था॒ पर॑स्याः सृ॒कं सं॒शाय॑ प॒विमि॑न्द्र ति॒ग्मं वि शत्रू॑न्ताळ्हि॒ वि मृधो॑ नुदस्व
verses.transliteration: mr̥gó ná bhīmáḥ kucaró giriṣṭhā́ḥ  parāváta ā́ jaganthā párasyāḥ  sr̥káṃ saṃśā́ya pavím indra tigmáṃ  ví śátrūn tāḷhi ví mŕ̥dho nudasva

translation.text: Like a dread wild beast roaming on the mountain thou hast approached us from the farthest distance. Whetting thy bold and thy sharp blade, O Indra, crush thou the foe and scatter those who hate us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ क्ष॒त्रम॒भि वा॒ममोजोऽजा॑यथा वृषभ चर्षणी॒नाम् अपा॑नुदो॒ जन॑ममित्र॒यन्त॑मु॒रुं दे॒वेभ्यो॑ अकृणोरु लो॒कम्
verses.transliteration: índra kṣatrám abhí vāmám ójaḥ-  -ájāyathā vr̥ṣabha carṣaṇīnā́m  ápānudo jánam amitrayántam  urúṃ devébhyo akr̥ṇor ulokám

translation.text: Thou, mighty Indra, sprangest into being as strength for lovely lordship o'er the people. Thou drovest off the folk who were unfriendly, and to the Gods thou gavest room and freedom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रथ॑श्च॒ यस्य॑ स॒प्रथ॑श्च॒ नामानु॑ष्टुभस्य ह॒विषो॑ ह॒विर्यत् धा॒तुर्द्युता॑नात्सवि॒तुश्च॒ विष्णो॑ रथंत॒रमा ज॑भारा॒ वसि॑ष्ठः
verses.transliteration: práthaś ca yásya sapráthaś ca nā́ma-  -ā́nuṣṭubhasya havíṣo havír yát  dhātúr dyútānāt savitúś ca víṣṇoḥ-  rathaṃtarám ā́ jabhārā vásiṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: Vasishṭha mastered the Rathantara, took it from radiant Dhatar, Savitar, and Vishṇu, Oblation, portion of fourfold oblation, known by the names of Saprathas and Prathas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवि॑न्द॒न्ते अति॑हितं॒ यदासी॑द्य॒ज्ञस्य॒ धाम॑ पर॒मं गुहा॒ यत् धा॒तुर्द्युता॑नात्सवि॒तुश्च॒ विष्णो॑र्भ॒रद्वा॑जो बृ॒हदा च॑क्रे अ॒ग्नेः
verses.transliteration: ávindan té átihitaṃ yád ā́sīd  yajñásya dhā́ma paramáṃ gúhā yát  dhātúr dyútānāt savitúś ca víṣṇoḥ-  bharádvājo br̥hád ā́ cakre agnéḥ

translation.text: These sages found what lay remote and hidden, the sacrifice's loftiest secret essence. From radiant Dhatar, Savitar, and Vishṇu, from Agni, Bharadvâja brought the Br̥ihat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते॑ऽविन्द॒न्मन॑सा॒ दीध्या॑ना॒ यजुः॑ ष्क॒न्नं प्र॑थ॒मं दे॑व॒यान॑म् धा॒तुर्द्युता॑नात्सवि॒तुश्च॒ विष्णो॒रा सूर्या॑दभरन्घ॒र्ममे॒ते
verses.transliteration: tè 'vindan mánasā dī́dhyānāḥ-  yáju ṣkannám prathamáṃ devayā́nam  dhātúr dyútānāt savitúś ca víṣṇoḥ-  ā́ sū́ryād abharan gharmám eté

translation.text: They found with mental eyes the earliest Yajus, a pathway to the Gods, that had descended. From radiant Dhitar, Savitar, and Vishṇu, from Sûrya did these sages bring the Gharma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॒स्पति॑र्नयतु दु॒र्गहा॑ ति॒रः पुन॑र्नेषद॒घशं॑साय॒ मन्म॑ क्षि॒पदश॑स्ति॒मप॑ दुर्म॒तिं ह॒न्नथा॑ कर॒द्यज॑मानाय॒ शं योः
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspátir nayatu durgáhā tiráḥ  púnar neṣad agháśaṃsāya mánma  kṣipád áśastim ápa durmatíṃ hann  áthā karad yájamānāya śáṃ yóḥ

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati lead us safely over troubless and turn his evil thought against the sinner; Repel the curse, and drive away ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and cornfort!

verses.sanskrit_deva: नरा॒शंसो॑ नोऽवतु प्रया॒जे शं नो॑ अस्त्वनुया॒जो हवे॑षु क्षि॒पदश॑स्ति॒मप॑ दुर्म॒तिं ह॒न्नथा॑ कर॒द्यज॑मानाय॒ शं योः
verses.transliteration: nárāśáṃso no 'vatu prayājé  śáṃ no astv anuyājó háveṣu  kṣipád áśastim ápa durmatíṃ hann  áthā karad yájamānāya śáṃ yóḥ

translation.text: May Narâṣansa aid us at Prayâja: blest be our Anuyâja at invokings. May he repel the curse, and chase ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तपु॑र्मूर्धा तपतु र॒क्षसो॒ ये ब्र॑ह्म॒द्विषः॒ शर॑वे॒ हन्त॒वा उ॑ क्षि॒पदश॑स्ति॒मप॑ दुर्म॒तिं ह॒न्नथा॑ कर॒द्यज॑मानाय॒ शं योः
verses.transliteration: tápurmūrdhā tapatu rakṣáso yé  brahmadvíṣaḥ śárave hántavā́ u  kṣipád áśastim ápa durmatíṃ hann  áthā karad yájamānāya śáṃ yóḥ

translation.text: May he whose head is flaming burn the demons, haters of prayer, so that the arrow slay them. May he repel the curse and chase ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.

suktas.deity: For the Birth of a Son

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॑श्यं त्वा॒ मन॑सा॒ चेकि॑तानं॒ तप॑सो जा॒तं तप॑सो॒ विभू॑तम् इ॒ह प्र॒जामि॒ह र॒यिं ररा॑णः॒ प्र जा॑यस्व प्र॒जया॑ पुत्रकाम
verses.transliteration: ápaśyaṃ tvā mánasā cékitānaṃ  tápaso jātáṃ tápaso víbhūtam  ihá prajā́m ihá rayíṃ rárāṇaḥ  prá jāyasva prajáyā putrakāma

translation.text: I SAW thee meditating in thy spirit what sprang from Fervour and hath thence developed. Bestowing offspring here, bestowing riches, spread in thine offspring, thou who cravest children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॑श्यं त्वा॒ मन॑सा॒ दीध्या॑नां॒ स्वायां॑ त॒नू ऋत्व्ये॒ नाध॑मानाम् उप॒ मामु॒च्चा यु॑व॒तिर्ब॑भूयाः॒ प्र जा॑यस्व प्र॒जया॑ पुत्रकामे
verses.transliteration: ápaśyaṃ tvā mánasā dī́dhyānāṃ  svā́yāṃ tanū́ ŕ̥tvye nā́dhamānām  úpa mā́m uccā́ yuvatír babhūyāḥ  prá jāyasva prajáyā putrakāme

translation.text: I saw thee pondering in thine heart, and praying that in due time thy body might be fruitful. Come as a youthful woman, rise to meet me: spread in thine offspring, thou who cravest children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं गर्भ॑मदधा॒मोष॑धीष्व॒हं विश्वे॑षु॒ भुव॑नेष्व॒न्तः अ॒हं प्र॒जा अ॑जनयं पृथि॒व्याम॒हं जनि॑भ्यो अप॒रीषु॑ पु॒त्रान्
verses.transliteration: aháṃ gárbham adadhām óṣadhīṣu-  aháṃ víśveṣu bhúvaneṣv antáḥ  ahám prajā́ ajanayam pr̥thivyā́m  aháṃ jánibhyo aparī́ṣu putrā́n

translation.text: In plants and herbs, in all existent beings I have deposited the germ of increase. All progeny on earth have I engendered, and sons in women who will be hereafter.

suktas.deity: Prayer for Good Conception and Birth

verses.sanskrit_deva: विष्णु॒र्योनिं॑ कल्पयतु॒ त्वष्टा॑ रू॒पाणि॑ पिंशतु आ सि॑ञ्चतु प्र॒जाप॑तिर्धा॒ता गर्भं॑ दधातु ते
verses.transliteration: víṣṇur yóniṃ kalpayatu  tváṣṭā rūpā́ṇi piṃśatu  ā́ siñcatu prajā́patir  dhātā́ gárbhaṃ dadhātu te

translation.text: MAY Vishṇu form and mould the womb, may Tvashṭar duly shape the forms, Prajâpati infuse the stream, and Dhatar lay the germ for thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गर्भं॑ धेहि सिनीवालि॒ गर्भं॑ धेहि सरस्वति गर्भं॑ ते अ॒श्विनौ॑ दे॒वावा ध॑त्तां॒ पुष्क॑रस्रजा
verses.transliteration: gárbhaṃ dhehi sinīvāli  gárbhaṃ dhehi sarasvati  gárbhaṃ te aśvínau devā́v  ā́ dhattām púṣkarasrajā

translation.text: O Sinîvâlî, set the germ, set thou the germ, Sarasvatî: May the Twain Gods bestow the germ, the Aṣvins crowned with lotuses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒र॒ण्ययी॑ अ॒रणी॒ यं नि॒र्मन्थ॑तो अ॒श्विना॑ तं ते॒ गर्भं॑ हवामहे दश॒मे मा॒सि सूत॑वे
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyáyī aráṇī  yáṃ nirmánthato aśvínā  táṃ te gárbhaṃ havāmahe  daśamé māsí sū́tave

translation.text: That which the Aṣvins Twain rub forth with the attrition-sticks of gold,– That germ of thine we invocate, that in the tenth month thou mayst bear.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॑ त्री॒णामवो॑ऽस्तु द्यु॒क्षं मि॒त्रस्या॑र्य॒म्णः दु॒रा॒धर्षं॒ वरु॑णस्य
verses.transliteration: máhi trīṇā́m ávo 'stu  dyukṣám mitrásyāryamṇáḥ  durādhárṣaṃ váruṇasya

translation.text: GREAT, unassailable must he the heavenly favour of' Three Gods, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि तेषा॑म॒मा च॒न नाध्व॑सु वार॒णेषु॑ ईशे॑ रि॒पुर॒घशं॑सः
verses.transliteration: nahí téṣām amā́ caná  nā́dhvasu vāraṇéṣu  ī́śe ripúr agháśaṃsaḥ

translation.text: O'er these, neither at home nor yet abroad or pathways that are Strange, The evil-minded foe hath power

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मै॑ पु॒त्रासो॒ अदि॑तेः॒ प्र जी॒वसे॒ मर्त्या॑य ज्योति॒र्यच्छ॒न्त्यज॑स्रम्
verses.transliteration: yásmai putrā́so áditeḥ  prá jīváse mártyāya  jyótir yáchanty ájasram

translation.text: Nor over him,. the man on whom the Sons of Aditi bestow Eternal light that he may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वात॒ आ वा॑तु भेष॒जं श॒म्भु म॑यो॒भु नो॑ हृ॒दे प्र ण॒ आयूं॑षि तारिषत्
verses.transliteration: vā́ta ā́ vātu bheṣajáṃ  śambhú mayobhú no hr̥dé  prá ṇa ā́yūṃṣi tāriṣat

translation.text: FILLING our hearts with health and joy, may Vâta breathe his balm on us May he prolong our days of life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त वा॑त पि॒तासि॑ न उ॒त भ्रातो॒त नः॒ सखा॑ स नो॑ जी॒वात॑वे कृधि
verses.transliteration: utá vāta pitā́si naḥ-  utá bhrā́totá naḥ sákhā  sá no jīvā́tave kr̥dhi

translation.text: Thou art our Father, Vâta, yea, thou art a Brother and a friend, So give us strength that we may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒दो वा॑त ते गृ॒हे॒३॒॑ऽमृत॑स्य नि॒धिर्हि॒तः ततो॑ नो देहि जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: yád adó vāta te gr̥hé-  -amŕ̥tasya nidhír hitáḥ  táto no dehi jīváse

translation.text: The store of Amrit laid away yonder, O Vâta, in thine home,– Give us thereof that we may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्राग्नये॒ वाच॑मीरय वृष॒भाय॑ क्षिती॒नाम् स नः॑ पर्ष॒दति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: prā́gnáye vā́cam īraya  vr̥ṣabhā́ya kṣitīnā́m  sá naḥ parṣad áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: To Agni send I forth my song, to him the Bull of all the folk: So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः पर॑स्याः परा॒वत॑स्ति॒रो धन्वा॑ति॒रोच॑ते स नः॑ पर्ष॒दति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ párasyāḥ parāvátas  tiró dhánvātirócate  sá naḥ parṣad áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: Who from the distance far away shines brilliantly across the wastes: So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो रक्षां॑सि नि॒जूर्व॑ति॒ वृषा॑ शु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषा॑ स नः॑ पर्ष॒दति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: yó rákṣāṃsi nijū́rvati  vŕ̥ṣā śukréṇa śocíṣā  sá naḥ parṣad áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: The Bull with brightly-gleaming flame who utterly consumes the fiends So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो विश्वा॒भि वि॒पश्य॑ति॒ भुव॑ना॒ सं च॒ पश्य॑ति स नः॑ पर्ष॒दति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: yó víśvābhí vipáśyati  bhúvanā sáṃ ca páśyati  sá naḥ parṣad áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: Who looks on all existing things and comprehends them with his view: So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॒स्य पा॒रे रज॑सः शु॒क्रो अ॒ग्निरजा॑यत स नः॑ पर्ष॒दति॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: yó asyá pāré rájasaḥ  śukró agnír ájāyata  sá naḥ parṣad áti dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: Resplendent Agni, who was born in farthest region of the air: So may he bear us past our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नू॒नं जा॒तवे॑दस॒मश्वं॑ हिनोत वा॒जिन॑म् इ॒दं नो॑ ब॒र्हिरा॒सदे॑
verses.transliteration: prá nūnáṃ jātávedasam  áśvaṃ hinota vājínam  idáṃ no barhír āsáde

translation.text: Now send ye Jâtavedas forth, send hitherward the vigorous Steed To seat him on our sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य प्र जा॒तवे॑दसो॒ विप्र॑वीरस्य मी॒ळ्हुषः॑ म॒हीमि॑यर्मि सुष्टु॒तिम्
verses.transliteration: asyá prá jātávedaso  vípravīrasya mīḷhúṣaḥ  mahī́m iyarmi suṣṭutím

translation.text: I raise the lofty eulogy of Jâtavedas, raining boons, With sages for his hero band.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या रुचो॑ जा॒तवे॑दसो देव॒त्रा ह॑व्य॒वाह॑नीः ताभि॑र्नो य॒ज्ञमि॑न्वतु
verses.transliteration: yā́ rúco jātávedaso  devatrā́ havyavā́hanīḥ  tā́bhir no yajñám invatu

translation.text: With flames of Jâtavedas which carry oblation to the Gods, May he promote our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आयं गौः पृश्नि॑रक्रमी॒दस॑दन्मा॒तरं॑ पु॒रः पि॒तरं॑ च प्र॒यन्त्स्वः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́yáṃ gaúḥ pŕ̥śnir akramīd  ásadan mātáram puráḥ  pitáraṃ ca prayán svàḥ

translation.text: THIS spotted Bull hath come, and sat before the Mother in the east, Advancing to his Father heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्तश्च॑रति रोच॒नास्य प्रा॒णाद॑पान॒ती व्य॑ख्यन्महि॒षो दिव॑म्
verses.transliteration: antáś carati rocanā́-  -asyá prāṇā́d apānatī́  vy àkhyan mahiṣó dívam

translation.text: Expiring when he draws his breath, she moves along the lucid spheres: The Bull shines out through all the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिं॒शद्धाम॒ वि रा॑जति॒ वाक्प॑तं॒गाय॑ धीयते प्रति॒ वस्तो॒रह॒ द्युभिः॑
verses.transliteration: triṃśád dhā́ma ví rājati  vā́k pataṃgā́ya dhīyate  práti vástor áha dyúbhiḥ

translation.text: Song is bestowed upon the Bird: it rules supreme through thirty realms Throughout the days at break of morn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तं च॑ स॒त्यं चा॒भी॑द्धा॒त्तप॒सोऽध्य॑जायत ततो॒ रात्र्य॑जायत॒ ततः॑ समु॒द्रो अ॑र्ण॒वः
verses.transliteration: r̥táṃ ca satyáṃ cābhī̀ddhāt  tápasó 'dhy ajāyata  táto rā́try ajāyata  tátaḥ samudró arṇaváḥ

translation.text: FROM Fervour kindled to its height Eternal Law and Truth were born: Thence was the Night produced, and thence the billowy flood of sea arose.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मु॒द्राद॑र्ण॒वादधि॑ संवत्स॒रो अ॑जायत अ॒हो॒रा॒त्राणि॑ वि॒दध॒द्विश्व॑स्य मिष॒तो व॒शी
verses.transliteration: samudrā́d arṇavā́d ádhi  saṃvatsaró ajāyata  ahorātrā́ṇi vidádhad  víśvasya miṣató vaśī́

translation.text: From that same billowy flood of sea the Year was afterwards produced, Ordainer of the days nights, Lord over all who close the eye.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सू॒र्या॒च॒न्द्र॒मसौ॑ धा॒ता य॑थापू॒र्वम॑कल्पयत् दिवं॑ च पृथि॒वीं चा॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒मथो॒ स्वः॑
verses.transliteration: sūryācandramásau dhātā́  yathāpūrvám akalpayat  dívaṃ ca pr̥thivī́ṃ ca-  -antárikṣam átho svàḥ

translation.text: Dhatar, the great Creator, then formed in due order Sun and Moon. He formed in order Heaven and Earth, the regions of the air, and light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: संस॒मिद्यु॑वसे वृष॒न्नग्ने॒ विश्वा॑न्य॒र्य आ इ॒ळस्प॒दे समि॑ध्यसे॒ स नो॒ वसू॒न्या भ॑र
verses.transliteration: sáṃ-sam íd yuvase vr̥ṣann  ágne víśvāny aryá ā́  iḷás padé sám idhyase  sá no vásūny ā́ bhara

translation.text: THOU, mighty Agni, gatherest up all that is precious for thy friend. Bring us all treasures as thou art enkindled in libation's place

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं ग॑च्छध्वं॒ सं व॑दध्वं॒ सं वो॒ मनां॑सि जानताम् दे॒वा भा॒गं यथा॒ पूर्वे॑ संजाना॒ना उ॒पास॑ते
verses.transliteration: sáṃ gachadhvaṃ sáṃ vadadhvaṃ  sáṃ vo mánāṃsi jānatām  devā́ bhāgáṃ yáthā pū́rve  saṃjānānā́ upā́sate

translation.text: Assemble, speak together: let your minds be all of one accord, As ancient Gods unanimous sit down to their appointed share.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नो मन्त्रः॒ समि॑तिः समा॒नी स॑मा॒नं मनः॑ स॒ह चि॒त्तमे॑षाम् स॒मा॒नं मन्त्र॑म॒भि म॑न्त्रये वः समा॒नेन॑ वो ह॒विषा॑ जुहोमि
verses.transliteration: samānó mántraḥ sámitiḥ samānī́  samānám mánaḥ sahá cittám eṣām  samānám mántram abhí mantraye vaḥ  samānéna vo havíṣā juhomi

translation.text: The place is common, common the assembly, common the mind, so be their thought united. A common purpose do I lay before you, and worship with your general oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नी व॒ आकू॑तिः समा॒ना हृद॑यानि वः स॒मा॒नम॑स्तु वो॒ मनो॒ यथा॑ वः॒ सुस॒हास॑ति
verses.transliteration: samānī́ va ā́kūtiḥ  samānā́ hŕ̥dayāni vaḥ  samānám astu vo máno  yáthā vaḥ súsahā́sati

translation.text: One and the same be your resolve, and be your minds of one accord. United be the thoughts of all that all may happily agree.
